fQeGt83Mmn7FM6_bGWYtqA.text: Excellent customer service, excellent food, I love this place. will revisit when I am back in vegas.

vQEpLRDEn7nyUYfRHp3wyg.text: Buddy designed a restaurant that made you feel like you were having a meal in his family kitchen.  Service was incredible and the meal didn't disappoint.  Chicken parm, meatballs, and meat/cheese board were all awesome! Atmosphere and attention to decorative detail was impressive.  Will be back!

CvuWIQVrJWe9P44lSWdQFg.text: Ate at this restaurant with a group 9 last Wednesday night. I had heard great things about this restaurant & being a foodie I was excited! First problem was they pushed 2 tables together resulting in them being uneven with each other = disaster when putting wine glasses down. Unacceptable .. Not even an apology or offer to correct the problem.   Service was extremely slow and the restaurant was NOT full. We got our wine & beverages &'appetizers approx. 10 min before our meal came!! We couldn't even get a waiters attention to bring us wine!   The food was average. Nothing I couldn't cook as well in my own kitchen. The dessert was a treat.. I will say the Cake Boss knows his desserts. That was about it. Sad to say I won't be returning to Busdy V's

xydU9ukbL-DRAk6j2M_Gjg.text: Seriously really delicious food. Must orders: Calamari - one of the best we've ever had Lasagna- the best we've ever had Meatballs- better than mine and the best we've ever had  We also had  Parmesan chicken- moist and yummy probably the best one we've had as it has a tendency to be dry but this one wasn't.  Linguine and clams- very good Cheese pizza - kids liked it  I will definitely come back!!  Tried the bakery earlier and discovered this gem.    Don't forget to ask for Rosemary fresh bread and dip into oil with Parmesan....

w10WYJCxB55nAQ_9vd8VwQ.text: Short wait for lunch. Service was good and the drinks are strong. The salmon was excellent and had a balsamic reduction which gave it a nice sweet crust. Overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon

KAfuJ2smV2hnon9-Yqu4LA.text: Brunch Boss  Parking:  Located at the Grand Canal Shoppe closer to the Palazzo side so it is nice stroll from the Venetian Parking structure. Where parking can sometimes be a pain but usually plentiful.  Establishment:  Service was okay it was a tad bit slow but not annoyingly so. *3 stars*  Food (Brunch):  To begin there is an all you can drink for about $15 which is probably worth it if you plan on having more than 1 drink. Bringing your total to about $50 a person.   The concept of quality over quantity definitely applies here there is probably about 10 dishes of breakfast items and some Italian dishes some of their Italian dishes were just okay though but nothing I regretted trying.  What shines here though is their dessert. They have a glorious display of desserts that will be sure to satisfy your sweet tooth. *4 stars*  Overall:  First brunch in Vegas so nothing to compare to but for the price I thought it was very enjoyable especially after 3 sangrias.

_SDmM3YvjqakQl1XWW1sSA.text: Went a few weeks ago.  Just had an appetizer:  the Mac and cheese.  Made with fontina cheese, it was very rich and delicious.  Enjoyed it better than Yardhouse Mac & cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese

UiZaUCcZAIhOGcWLRLYHng.text: Service...slow Meatballs are excellent! (That is the only reason why I would give this place a 4 star) Our table had lasagna, chicken parm and vodka rigatoni.  The lasagna received raves from my niece. The rest of the food was sub par at best. I definitely would not get the rigatoni again...ever!   Loud, yet fun atmosphere. Friendly staff. The management was helpful.

aXaiDcIzvnZ6eLhyt-2zqA.text: Ambience was good  Ordered fried calamari and lasagna.   Fried calamari:  Portion was okay for 2 to share.  Could have been more deep fried.  Came out a tad bit soggy  The breaking fell off for the most of the pieces.  Too salty  Size of calamari was food   Lasagna-  Good portion for two to share Taste is home made- which is what they are going for.

ghRDOszos5AMc7vPPDtwXg.text: This review is for the bar only  While my loving, wonderful husband waited in line at Carlo's Bakery, I thought I'd pop over to Buddy V's across the way and try a libation.  Since I had no clue what I wanted, I asked the bartender to "make something up with amarone", and she did.  I like surprises!    Open space with a nice view - and it's right across from the bakery.  Check! Check!

971Hz7jwZDsSU4pj1QXnvA.text: Went for Sunday brunch last week and I would go again if I was in the mood for a treat.  Very friendly waitstaff and managers.  Pretty much a nonstop flow of people refilling our drinks, taking our plates, checking in on us and making conversation.  There was kind of a weird moment at first when our group first came in and went up to the hostess podium and two young guys up at the front literally just turned and walked off without saying anything, but later on made up for it.    Most of the food was delicious (a few hot items were cold already due to there being too much AC in here, as other reviewers have mentioned, but it's not under their control).  They have mini cronuts!  And really excellent french toast.  Our whole group was very satisfied - there was something for everyone - seafood, veggie items, fancy meats, lots of sweet stuff.

Ths1mpgv8hZu6f-Y5hT0Fg.text: I had very bad experience here. The price is a little bit high,but it tastes good. The most worst things that I want to say is the poor serice. The serious woman waiter wrote the final total payment for me and asked me to sign my name. She wrote 25% tips for me and she did not even smile to me. Maybe I look like Asian and she think that I would never come here twice. After she asked me to sign my name for paying,she just left and did not give me a chance to ask her the question. Maybe I look young and Asian. I am studying in America and I just finished my final. I want to have great time in Las vegas,but this experience really made me upset. I just want to share my True experience here. I would never come here again. Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eMH6olJUWKRlDymgBxXn7A.text: My husband and I had brunch on Sunday and it was one of the best brunches we have ever been to in Vegas.  The brunch price was fair $32.95 and then for $14.95 you could have unlimited mix and match drinks from a good selection of adult beverages.  The brunch had quite a few items from the menu and everything was exceptional.  Also the wait staff were really fantastic.  Everyone was friendly and ready  to help in any way.  Dirty plates were removed quickly.  We live in Henderson so we don't usually go to the strip but we will be going back to brunch in the near future.

MoNgFKhfQ3RmOKN6YXwriA.text: This restaurant is exemplary. The waiter told me that the Philly Cheesesteak was voted one of the best outside of Philadelphia. He was exactly right. I also had the Nutella cake and it was divine. The service was fast, attentive, and friendly. I would return here in the future.

TpwVCbISct3Mak0uSbcW4w.text: Nice looking place, nice staff, but the food.....the food was tasteless. Meatball sub had no seasoning and the fries were just....fries. my wife had the pizza and it was just bland and subpar. I asked for a Coke and the waiter brought me a cherry coke. I asked him for a Coke again  and he brought me what tasted like a mix between Dr Pepper and cherry coke. My went on to try the canoles, and they tasted like chalk.  We were really disappointed. We were rooting for the "cake boss", but he just didn't deliver.

QDiWX_OTFY2xu2JozwNsrQ.text: Stopped for a few drinks and appetizers.   Service was good. We ordered 2 specialty drinks to try something new and they were great. Mine was the sweet tea vodka drink. Yum!  I wish I had the names.   We had the garlic bread and meatballs and they hit the spot.  The meatballs were perfect. Very tasty and not dried out.   Would go again.

fZPgVnKC8h2Mz9YFWH107A.text: We went to Buddy B's for their Sunday Brunch to celebrate my  birthday. It was fun and delicious! $35 for the buffet that had an antipasto station, carving station, dessert station, breakfast and lunch station and a kids station. Then there we bottomless mimosas, bellinis, sangria and beer for $15! And bottomless bloody mary's with a do it yourself bar for $16! Non-alcoholic beverages were included. Everything was delicious! My favorite was the pasta carbonara. We will definitely be coming back!

SysMqZpr36DEKIDyGZXSUg.text: My favorite Italian restaurant on the strip so far-the orecchiette pasta with Italian sausage was great

fEUMPO1h86SZmWFPr5M5Zw.text: My husband and I had the chicken parm and lasagna, he said it was one of the best if not the best chicken parm he'd ever had, and I absolutely loved the lasagna. And we both agree the Nutella cake and salted caramel ice cream is up there with one of the top desserts we've ever had. And our waiter Giorgio was wonderful he took care of us with a great friendly smile and personality.

cEZDAtYr-35dxVV9paljhQ.text: A small group of us went to try this place out for dinner and overall we loved it! The food was good and so were the cocktails. I liked that the menu was kind of small because as it was I couldn't even decide what I wanted to eat, lol. I finally decided on the chicken Marsala and the sauce was yummy.. The noodles that were served with it were a little salty for my taste but I still liked the dish. We also had the pizza and spaghetti and meatballs, which they said it was good too... I recommend the calamari for a starter.

tdtK_1uhLfuwqQkCl5KauQ.text: We can't wait to come back to this location! The tomato basil soup and the Caesar salad was absolutely scrumptious. The croutons used in the Caesar salad was one of the best things I've ever tasted. The wait staff was courteous and friendly. Everything was up to par!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FgklAN1rjkgQf8NLQGs4CA.text: Awesome restaurant. Everything was delicious. The busser was awesome and made sure the drinks were never empty. He is definitely a hard worker and I appreciated it. The waiter was great also. Affordable prices with decent portions. I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vedFiK5kgG_JRvz2mP0Fyg.text: I was actually stupid-impressed by this place. I didn't have much in terms of expectations, but things went incredibly well here from the food perspective. Our waiter was also incredibly cool, and we definitely enjoyed the overall experience. The food was American-Italian as all get out, and among some of the best for that style you can expect to get.   However; the things that drop the rating down are more about the overall experience. The starters were okay (meatballs), and the whole place/atmosphere overall was a bit iffy. The chairs are your standard fare for restaurants like this, and seemed really flimsy and were uncomfortable. The drink list felt a little lacking, and I feel like the suggested drinks were more a marketing speech more than a genuine recommendation.   Negatives aside; dat veal parm was just fantastic. Hardly can think of another that I like more, it definitely stands there near the top of some of the best I've had of that particular dish. Want more....

pyd5DeMrWu0eiuT3ioewKQ.text: We had Chicken Parm and Shrimp scampi. Both were delicious. Most amazing is of course Tiramisu. Made my birthday very special. Finding Tiramisu made right is hard and definitely this place has one of the best I had after a long time

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eHTe6od7xhiC5ZFUtp_K7A.text: Omg where do I start ! This place is amazing !!! I would make a reservation if u could so u don't wait and ask for the beautiful view, even if u don't it's worth the 45 min wait . It's honestly the most delicious Italian restaurant I've ever been too, the staff was soo friendly and the atmosphere was relaxing ! So happy I went

2akGNBQqcjSt9aFvYGBd1g.text: The chicken parmigiana, meatball sub and garlic bread were so good!!! We also had the Italian birthday cake, which I wasn't quite sure I'd like because of the liqueur, but it was sooo delicious!!! Definitely a new "go-to" place!!

xuq6NEV4tVwBih87iUqJXg.text: Solid choice at the Venician.  A little hard to find, but the food quality is outstanding, service is top notch, and pricing is fair.  Had a great meal Christmas Eve for a party of six.  All were pleased with their meals.  I'll be back!

g3CcTGal3_34xauFFmw2_g.text: If you want great Italian food with great service, come here! You don't have to get that fancy and the price is just right. The portion size of these dishes is remarkable. I ordered their Chicken Picatta and was blown away. I think I've probably had Chicken Picatta three times in my life. This was the best I've ever had. The lemon and garlic sauce was buttery, but not too thick and the pasta was cooked perfectly; as well as the chicken. I also enjoyed their bread that's cooked fresh. Everyone else was also very pleased with their meal. Two thumbs up!

srk5w_JYiG8FXFOGFr9eLQ.text: I used to live in Italy and I know how real Italian food should taste. This restaurant is amazing, food quality is great. Everything was very tasty and costumer service is high end.

rwap5eP0MI6Q7_ovDZEN7Q.text: This review is for Buddy V's brunch. It's $34.95 with soda, ice tea, or coffee from 10:30am to 2:30pm (I think) on Saturday and Sunday. In short, it's awesome. It's probably our favorite brunch on The Strip due to the selection, quality, value, and service.   The selection is huge and there's a menu online but for a brief recap there's a carving station (ham, bacon, 2 kinds of sausages), shrimp cocktail, eggs/frittata, charcuterie station, a couple kinds of pasta, meatballs, chicken parmesan, salad, french toast, crespelle, pastries, like 5 kinds of cookies, like 4 kinds of cakes, cannolis, and fruit. A nice touch is that there's two sets of meatballs/chicken parmesan so if one is empty you can get some from the other station. They were great about refilling the dishes and every trip I went up, everything was available.  It's a buffet so don't expect things to be the same as ordering from Buddy V's off the menu. That being said, it was all still very good. Even the fruit was good (because it was sweet), and they had more exotic options like dragon fruit and rambutan as well.   Service was friendly and they were very good about refilling drinks and clearing plates. All that said, I think what you get is very good for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KXFypCd56Jnqb0Us33cAcw.text: The way the lasagna looked on the pictures convinced us to try this place out. We ordered the nonnas lasagna al forno and was exactly as tasty as it looks. We shared it between two with a side of garlic bread. It was plenty of food. Had left overs to take. Total $40.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nonnas lasagna al forno. It&#39;s one order split in half. With garlic bread on the side. Delicious!

Wc0mDhpWHNISSlkRYdmhBg.text: The servers are all business, the food is real good, the ladies/girls that staff the reception desk are terrible! I waited so long on hold that I chose to walk to the restaurant while on hold. Exactly 15:05 I arrived at the greeting desk, where 3 young ladies were standing helping nobody because their were no customers in line. Literally they were simply standing chatting. They asked If they could help me as I approached their station. I asked them why they don't pick up the call on hold? They told that they can't tell a call is waiting and that happens all of the time. Knuckleheads! Tell the owner. Tell the Mgr. Tell someone. A TERRIBLE start.

-hl-Os2bmy3v85sKwVcvWQ.text: Happy hour 4.30-6.30pm 7 days/week offers $5 small plates and $4 prosecco/wine/sangria.   Recommend:  - granny meatballs flavorful, smooth, hearty - calamari crispy yet juicy - ricotta cheese light, goes well with grilled bread  Ok:  - sausage pepper sliders

sVNHY6OgvhWv5ZDxbHnjiQ.text: Pretty good place to eat if you don't want to go far. We got scallop and shrimp. Fresh and yummy. Linguine with clam was good too. Octopus was yummy and tender.  Overall long wait, good food but pricey.  $120 with tips without any drinks for 2 ppl

Hmvgru3SrpNnW6PGeA1dFg.text: I made reservations through open table and was seated immediately upon arrival. Our waiter was excellent, always checking in on us and he had a great attitude. You get fresh bread with olive oil & vinegar once you order. We all ordered the $40 price fix dinner menu. Caesar salad to start (this comes with polenta croutons, it was an unexpected surprise!), chicken parm and the cannoli for dessert. All were delicious! The entree is large enough to split.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm from the $40 3-course menu. Delicious! And massive....

xEEHeqYrl-fdjlrA7ZjK2A.text: Delicious dinner. I ordered the Chicken Marsala. It has a wonderful flavor with three very tender chicken breasts. Served with a side of pasta. The table shared the calamari fritti and the meatball appetizers. The calamari was delicious. I found the meatballs to be overloaded with spices. I would definitely recommend this place.

GJ6s-5C7eRnR2_Ub7UTOUA.text: Food was good. Service was just OK. Our server didn't seem like she wanted to be there, serving us on the patio on a Friday night. My expectation was higher for their Italian food.

VQ0AFqDzf4zgDONyxsv72g.text: Went twice during my stay in Vegas and I must say, Buddy V's has great service.   It also has an awesome happy hour with their yummy calamari with fried green peppers coming in at $5. Such a steal especially for a place like this. The meatball sliders were yummy and I enjoyed the sauce of the mac n cheese but it was definitely more sauce than pasta.  Sangria was also delicious and affordable.  Next time I know not to come for dinner though. The pastas were just okay and I've definitely had better.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala

V06QO_BxBXl1OEZWOZ7aEQ.text: Best happy hour on the strip! My friends and I were staying at the venetian so we decided to try this place as it was right in the hotel. Luckily, we made it in time for happy hour - drinks were $4 and food was $5! The regular dinner menu itself is a little pricey so the happy hour is definitely a steal.   We all got a round of sangria - perfect amount to get you a little tipsy at dinner! For $4, the drinks are the best deal because you can't get a $4 cocktail anywhere in Vegas. We ordered some of the $5 appetizers from the happy hour menu for dinner. We all got an order of the meatball sliders which is their famous Grandma's meatballs in small burger buns. I would highly recommend ordering these! The flavor was delicious and it was a good size. We also ordered calamari to share, and tried the mac and cheese carbonara. The calamari was nice and crispy, and came with fried jalepenos. The mac and cheese was okay...super creamy and the noodles were a bit overcooked.   Service was a little slow as there was only one waitress for the outside happy hour patio. But would highly recommend coming here for happy hour for some drinks and snacks especially before going out!

oXM3_CiCj-5HqxYRUTEOAw.text: Not bad considering the expectations - mine were a little on the lower side based on Buddy's Cake Boss background. Pretty fast and friendly service -bussers were always making sure you don't go thirsty. Portion sizes are on the larger side, but leftover pasta is always great. The sunday gravy special is pretty solid, perfect for a meat lover - spicy sausage, pork, meatballs. Rigatoni and the sauce were pretty good. Orrechiete sausage pasta had good texture and flavor as well. For dessert the warm nutella cake was their most popular- it was great. Cannoli was unfortunately not as tasty and had a strong cinnamon flavor that somehow reminded us of Fireball whiskey - not that pleasant. Overall not bad, not great.  3.75/5.

ub_0y_kAkOLJFKcOP0Zleg.text: The Italian food is exactly as generic as you're thinking it may be. It's a noisy environment just like you're expecting it may be. Yes it's a tourist trap type of restaurant. Yes, your teen age daughter will love it.

Os9t2547xSegWriEYotUlA.text: The food was okay, nothing super special.  The service was very slow.  It wasn't packed, so I am not sure why it was so slow.  Another problem was that there wasn't a bathroom in the actual restaurant.  It was very frustrating to have to leave the restaurant to take a kid to the bathroom.  We only came because of Cake Boss and probably wouldn't return.

wxyv1QC4G04Yx3s74Kxo6Q.text: Went for lunch as part of a romance package. Had the most incredible Chicken Parm. My wife's Carbonara was real good as well. Although I could have made a meal just of their fresh focaccia bread. As if great food wasn't enough, the service was phenomenal

-v9pB9FrZFqRR1uWPjCRVA.text: Ariss!!!! He was the best!! We came down for brunch, we are locals, he was so attentive and we had the best time! The food is phenomenal! This is one of our favorite brunch spots!

vmW9XWvUU5cvbNNGtEIiaA.text: Just checked in at the Palazzo. Walked to the grand canal shoppes and found Buddy Vs.   It was weekend brunch. Delicious. Everything was fabulous. The shrimp and cocktail sauce was the best I've had. The ham had a black crust on it but was moist and perfection inside.   Even the coffee was excellent. Awesome.

YS12zDzgzXX8S5GDQSImiQ.text: the best spaghetti and meatballs I ever had in my life this Chef knows good tasting food I can't wait to try everything on the menu. I tried meatballs in a lot of restaurants and I always return them I was expecting to return the food I ordered and it was delicious

GrkBaqnBcFeFeAs60givvg.text: AMAZING GRILLED SALMON! Amazing service! The restaurant was awsome! And very pleasing to eat here! 100% recommended

Os_c2e6FSn4o6l4TB6Cv4Q.text: Linguini w/ clams was our favorite dish. Good portions and decently priced considering it was delicious. The focaccia bread was also fresh out of the oven. I'd definitely come back.

VMO5dtYJBr7gIIYKHds6cw.text: The Nutella chocolate cake and the salted caramel ice cream were to die for! Everything was amazing and we'll definitely be back again

MWLXasqDA6wOO7pkeRSDlg.text: We had a good dinner at Buddy V's. Other than having a reservation and having to wait nearly 30 minutes for our table even though there was no one sitting at it and it was ready to go. We had to ask a manager for bread because we were told it was just coming out of the oven for 15 minutes. It came out a minute before our entrees. The food was very good, but the service just was not. We were a table of 8. I understand that's a lot of people, but our waitress came over maybe twice to check on us for the two hours we were there.

fAPTNvl_awQY93AxYQqhhA.text: a tad hard to find if you're walking over from the palazzo - it's easiest if you exit through the palazzo entrance and then swing a left and walk down the sidewalk. there's a side entrance that brings you right to the front door of buddy v's.  it's a cute italian restaurant and seems very family friendly. portions are huge and easy to share. i had chicken piccata, which is one of my favorite italian dishes of all time. they do an excellent rendition with linguine!

PbwtgOzgLMUHDMMpz_DzzQ.text: It was pretty good. Being from an Italian family that makes really good pasta, Buddy's is on par but not exceptional for Italian cuisine. The fried calamari was tender and yet over fried. The spaghetti was good. The meatballs were too soft bust flavorful I would give it 3.5 star

OPteaGklPW4O5xWKImwyZw.text: I had a awesome time at this restaurant  I really loved the food , great taste , great drinks . Beautiful interior design and really friendly staff. I really recomend it

VPN32k_3-cIvU3pADNuTbQ.text: Went to this restaurant for my Wife's Birthday. It was "FANTASTIC" the service was awesome and the dishes that we ordered were delicious. It was impressive!!!  The only thing missing was not being able to meet Buddy in person and having the staff sing happy birthday.. I love his TV show Cake Boss and I'm a big fan.  Hopefully next time we can meet him.

9mhsi0fEIPy-9ZXj43cv1g.text: All I can say is wow! Phenomenal service: our waitress was sweet and attentive. She was very helpful with allergies and avoiding dairy for me.   Great food: the pasta sauce is the best I've ever had! Food comes with bread and oil and vinegar which was very filling! I recommend the pomodoro. Appetizers were also amazing, though definitely ask about serving sizes because some are much larger than others!   Overall I had a great experience!

07yWcQQD_L1_zJp2at_Zjw.text: We went to Buddy V's the first time cause I won a gift certificate from a radio station. I am picky about Italian food because I am used to my families, but they were very good. I did watch people go from table to table with breads, but no one ever came to ours. That was fine cause it left me with room for dessert across the way at the bakery!

_Rq9BtrUpyarF9mhtdqpbg.text: I love Italian food in general, but this place is NEXT LEVEL AMAZING!!!! Everything is delicious. Plenty of sauce on the pasta, homemade croutons on the salads that were still hot (!), and mouth wateringly rich desserts.   You will not be disappointed with your meal, no way.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The restaurant week menu

HpfS8iIxT1Y_tZw-QaP57w.text: Came here on a Friday night with reservations. The service is excellent. The servers and employees are very welcoming and check in on you. As for the food, my wife and I both had the prix fixe menu for $40/person which include an appetizer, entree, and desert. I had mama's meatballs and the chicken Parmesan, along with the tiramisu. All of the food was out of this world. My wife had the Caesar salad, chicken Parmesan, and Canoli. She really enjoyed the food. Also, I should mention that the restaurant overlooks the strip and has an awesome view. Come here. It is reasonably priced with great service and awesome Italian food.

nn81td1LLypFrDuMhd9pZw.text: Came for my mother's birthday. Let me tell you about my mother: - She was born in Calabria, Italy - Loves Italian food (given), but almost never goes out for Italian food since we have it with family often and her standards are high. - She does not like to spend money, everything is compared to a cheaper alternative and rarely thinks money is well spent at restaurants.   Our waiter hyped up the family style dining experience, which we usually do on our own. The fact they had a program to do so was great to hear, and it did not disappoint.  The food was amazing. Exceeded all of our expectations. We had a great spread that really covered all the bases from the menu. One dish was better than the next.  The waiter, Georgio, was the best in the business. I've eaten at great restaurants around the world and had great service but he was truly world class and made the night. He was funny and entertaining but did not overdue it. Sometimes you get a funny or personable waiter who you like but they are too busy chatting they forget a request or get distracted, but not Georgio. He even sang happy birthday to my mother in Italian which really was the icing on the cake.   It was a night to remember, thank you to Buddy V's for making it special!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Georgio!

nl80Azb58ECVK1PnA9i4mA.text: I took my mom here for a Mother's Day lunch and we were not disappointed! I almost didn't give this place a shot because we did not like Carlo's bakery very much, but this place turned out to be so great! We were seated within 10 minutes and got a great table next to a window with a view of the strip and right next to the live music. Our waiter provided great service and my mom even got a flower for Mother's Day. We ordered the Salmon, Chicken Parm and Garlic Bread. All of it was so delicious! The salmon was cooked perfectly and the chicken was tender and juicy. The spaghetti had great flavor, I definitely recommend getting the extra Parmesan on top and adding some crushed red pepper! I also love that they offer unsweetened tea and come around to provide refills regularly. There are so many restaurants to choose from in Vegas, but I would probably go back here next time and try some other items off the menu. (The spaghetti in my picture looked prettier when it came out,  I messed it up)

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eVRiBV_m8qJY5ldJEr5zKA.text: Hearing so much about Buddy V's cake boss, I was eager to try out his restaurant as well and it was so perfectly placed right across from the cake boss.  It was perfect timingly as there was absolutely no wait time when we went and we were seated right away.  So my husband and I both decided to try his pasta, but we first started off with his meatballs as an appetizer.  They were decently sized but to our disappointment, there was not much flavor to it.  We were expecting a burst of flavor but there wasn't much to it except for ground meat.  Not much seasoning to it at all and it was honestly, something that I make better at home.  For the main course, I ordered the chicken regatoni "alla vodka," which I always have to try at all italien restaurants.  It was pretty good except a bit on the salty side.  My husband ordered the "my dad's bucatini carbonara" which he thought was just ok.  Our waiter was very helpful and did suggest the meatballs for us to try.  Everything else about the restaurant was great.

5q5Kk0S-36vRHD0T9tY02Q.text: After wanting to try this restaurant, we finally had lunch there recently. So glad we did!! Our party of four started with calamari fritte and cheesy garlic bread. So good!! The most tender calamari we had ever had!! The bread was hot and cheesy with the perfect blend of herbs and garlic.  The smashed meatball sandwich with Tuscan fries were delicious!! The most tender flavorful meatballs I've ever had!! The applewood bacon turkey club was also delicious!! Perfect amount of everything with good balance of flavors. The Caesar salad served with the turkey club was just okay. The dressing was mediocre. Overall, great experience!! We'll be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon turkey club sandwich - delicious!! Caesar salad okay.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smashed meatball sandwich with Tuscan fries - wow!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari and cheesy garlic bread - yummy!!

e3tOwfIq1CM3lZqjce-HKw.text: Best meal we have had in Vegas! Everything was amazing! The meatballs were incredible and oh that sauce. We loved the manager Stuart! He really made sure we were taken care of the whole evening. I would highly recommend! Great food and even better service. Thanks Stuart for making us feel like family!

a4MgV5yjX-Z272rA8VcQtw.text: My family owned an Italian deli/bakery for 26 years (9 of which I worked) so I know what homemade sauce, meatballs, sausage, etc tastes like.   With that being said, my girlfriend and I were very happy with our meals and exceptional service. Walked in around 5PM on a Tuesday night. We were quickly seated. We each ordered a sangria which shockingly were only $4 each since it was happy hour. They were delicious. Lots of good fruit in them. They were not cheapened because of HR.   We each ordered the same dinner, the rigatoni with lamb, pork, meatballs. and sausage. At a $26 price tag, I was very happy. Most Strip Italian places will charge $18+ just a plate of spaghetti alone. We meats were tender and delicious as was the sauce. The pasta, cook perfectly. Freshly baked bread was served before dinner as well. Again, delicious.   I look forward to returning. The service was as stellar as the food.

SbNbpKLyByDFBQ3yzaQVVA.text: What a treat!  I made reservations for two the day before we decided to go.  We walked up and were seated quickly.  Our server greeted us shortly thereafter.  The menu has such a great variety of classic  Italian staples. It was hard to decide what we were going to eat.  For the appetizer, we ordered Mozzarella en Carozza ("mozzarella in a carriage").  Hands down, this was the most delicious appetizer we've had in such a long time.  The crust was nice and crispy.  But the gravy (sauce) just took it over the top.  It was so full of flavor.  It was a nice balance of tomatoes and basil.   For the main course, my hubby ordered the Sunday Gravy.  I loved the presentation.  They served the meat in a separate metal pot.  Plenty of sausage, lamb necks, pork and meatballs.  It's served with rigatoni.  This entree was so tasty that we immediately started looking for the recipe on the internet.  I ordered the Linguini with Clams.  It came with plenty of clams.  The portion sizes were perfect.  We were pretty stuffed by the time we were done with our meals.  However, we wanted to try a dessert while we were there.  I loved the dessert menu. It looks like a family photo album with pictures of Buddy and his family.  We selected the Italian Wedding Cake.  I didn't think I had any room for dessert.  But this little cake was so good that we knew we had to finish it all. Luckily we had a long walk ahead of us. The restaurant was at the far end of the shops in the Venetian.  We will definitely make this a must the next time we're in Las Vegas.   You should too.  We plan to try the chicken parm.  The atmosphere was what were looking for.  It was like a huge Italian farmhouse kitchen.  And you could see into the kitchen.  Loved the whole experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Wedding Cake
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella en Carruzo. Our favorite and a must try.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desert menu = family phot album

SH7YJ3pH7eiZRvBJdRzivQ.text: Not gonna lie the cake boss annoys the crap out of me but we decided to try this restaurant for a few reasons: proximity to our hotel, cuisine, and price point. Well, everything was delicious and service was outstanding! Highly recommend for Italian comfort food (red sauce menu) that won't cost a fortune. Bartender was so nice and attentive, we decided to eat at the bar instead of wait for our table. Enjoyed this meal much more than the $$$$ dinner we had the night before.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got to watch Sunday night football, sit at the lovely bar, and enjoy comfort Italian dishes.

Ab8djfWIHT2ZrDxzFuji-w.text: Just went tonight with my husband for our anniversary. We were both nervous trying such a new restaurant but we were impressed. We had a great server, Daniel, who was very knowledgable about the wine and food. We bought a bottle of wine that turned out being amazing. My husband had the chicken Parmesan and I had the chicken rigatoni with vodka sauce. Everything was so good and the only thing we could say is it didn't taste like restaurant food, it tasted homemade. We also had to order the lobster tail. Even after a bottle of wine and our dinner it was so light and airy. Amazing. When Daniel found out it was our anniversary he brought out a plate of Italian cookies and bottle of sparkling dessert champagne. It was such a great experience all around and next time we come to Vegas we will be coming back to Buddy V's!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu that looks like a photo album
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our anniversary cookies

s3CgBMu4Gh_nYXbtRHBXRw.text: Had the $22 three-course prix fixe, "express lunch." Started with the panzanella, and it was amazing. This place probably has the best croutons in the world. Next time I go, I might just ask for a side of croutons with my salad because WOW. Because I split our main courses with someone else, I got to try both the Bucatini Carbonara and the Spaghetti Bolognese. I personally preferred the Carbonara, because I thought the sauce had struck the perfect balance and the noodles were great, but the other person slightly preferred the Bolognese. Moral of the story: both were excellent. We finished with cannoli and tiramisu. Both were, as you could have guessed, fantastic. Moreover, the servers were very friendly and we felt that they paced the meal perfectly. I can't wait to go back.  However, before you do, make sure to call and ask if the prixe fixe is on the menu that day because, when we first arrived, even though it was a Thursday at noon, the waiter said that he had to check.  UPDATE: I came back, and learned that we are not limited to their packaged breadsticks for lunch. Instead, they have (free) focaccia bread. All you have to do is ask for it, and then someone will come around with a big pan of focaccia bread. Make sure to ask for the olive oil and vinegar too!!

BQWSsVwtPdV9mbHtIWlUgw.text: The food was amazing! Staff was friendly and helpful! Only reason they didn't get 5 stars is the weird menu and times. There are too many different times and menus. It got pretty confusing. We went during brunch and didn't realize it was actually a buffet until we sat down. We ended up eating off the A La Carte menu. Chicken Parm was the best I've had. While chicken fingers were included in the brunch buffet, you couldn't order them off kids menu. Ended up getting plain & dry chicken parm & son ate it up. Food is great, just be sure to look at menu & times ahead of time so you aren't disappointed.

OiPf8W-vFz3iHAu1QpxKgA.text: Came on a Monday night. They weren't too busy Got seated right away, server was so nice and accommodating (as we were in a hurry) and everything looked very nice and Italian.   The food is kind of expensive. ($15-30)  We ordered 2 appetizers (garlic bread and meatballs) BOTH taste yummy! We got six pieces of each. There were four of us and we finished everything. We also split the shrimp scampi and it was good too. (Nothing unique but it definitely hits the spot and is satisfying.) we left very happy.

kJtzdKWtNcyzUkpIpV1jlw.text: The clams and linguine, AMAZING.  The where cooked perfect.    The bread that was brought to the table was very fresh and really liked the olive oil and balsamic vinegar.   Service was excellent.

3HqexQPNy1-ijG5h9zeh3Q.text: Wow! What a gorgeous, cozy restaurant with beautiful views of the Las Vegas Strip! I absolutely ADORED the decor, from the lighting fixtures to the brick walls displaying real photos of Buddy Valasco's family, to the STUNNING open-air kitchen!! I just felt HAPPY being in engulfed in the ambiance of this restaurant!   The staff was so friendly and the food was classic, comfort and delicious. (don't miss that salumi/cheese board! YUMMMMMM)  This will be the next place that I plan a big get-together because it is PERFECT for large parties. Can't say it enough... I LOVE it!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy V&#39;s family
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lovely open-air kitchen
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful entrance to the restaurant!

qiws7p4Fa_Hz_er3_DGu-w.text: The bread! The pasta! The desserts!! I don't know where to start, but I do know that Italian food is one of my favorite genre of food (other than Thai or sushi) and I can be a picky one when it comes to taste. I must say the service at this restaurant was impeccable, and the food was all sorts of delicious. Their wine selection was pretty impressive so that is another plus. I recommend the Calamari for an appetizer or the mozzarella en Carozza, which is basically fried mozzarella. I have only been here once so the dish I had was the lasagna. I make lasagna from scratch at home so I know good lasagna, and it was delicious.

_faWhFwF6tphWA_UOpgrtw.text: Great Place to eat! My husband and I were staying at the Venetian and stopped in Buddy V's for lunch.  I would highly recommend this place, reasonable prices and amazing food! The server and hostess were so sweet I asked their names and it was Joy and Emily. So friendly and made great suggestions.  Next time we are in Vegas this is a must for us! You will not be disappointed or feel ripped off with the prices!

mWDQXFY4-aaN2PzFtqD4rA.text: Had a Chicken Parm that was off the charts amazing!  A friend that was eating with us ordered the Veal parm, I had never seen a piece of veal that big, I thought they had brought out a small breaded pizza.  The veal was also amazing.   The atmosphere was casual but the view of the strip was incredible.   We had a great waitress that not only had great recommendations and fast service but also gave us directions on the quickest way to get a cab for our next adventure of the night.

fv7E-hkuU0fuXO7YeJExYg.text: Words cannot express how AMAZING our meal tasted! Dreams came True this day as we tasted Buddy's very own recipe. The ambiance was that of classy comfort, gorgeous staff, attentive service and PHENOMENAL food!!! I can't wait to go back to try more!

e2cShJaq2c89lfavWsFZjg.text: Average food. Overpriced. Loud atmosphere. Service wasn't all that. Spend your money elsewhere even if you are a cake boss fan

IWnExh-Y5UbTBabdC_Nmkg.text: Amazing food!! Some of the best Italian that I have ever had. Went there for a birthday dinner and was very happy and full when I left.

NMrTfkDKnHZaSR-Uhj8KyQ.text: Ate there for lunch and it was perfect. Had the mozzarella bread for starters and the chicken parm for the meal. We added some meatballs to it and it was out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm with added meatballs!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella bread. Awesome!

h532sLxmvKMKznCiJEZhVA.text: Awesome atmosphere, awesome food, awesome location. Staff was friendly but not attentive (most into gossiping with each other).   We ordered the calamari appetiser, chicken pasta and chicken parma. Everything was delusions and the calamari is a must have, however the chicken in the pasta was quite tough as it was reheated and not freshly cooked. Pasta on the other hand was al dente.   For dessert we got the XL Lobster tail (if you have not tried this, you are missing out on a whole new world). And the trio of donuts (good but not something I would order again).

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of donuts
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. XL Lobster tail
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken pasta

eH1BPWbB8WlfDgFK_4L5aQ.text: Went for Mother's Day my husband made a reservation. We got there and still had to wait for a table to be cleared!!! Also my lobster was horrible and dry! Don't think I'll b going back again!

WT7u7kJN0yPFpAG4xnChWA.text: I have to say it was so much better than I was expecting! We found the restaurant pretty easily by following the maps around the shops but I can see how it can be difficult to find. The red and white checkered tablecloths on the tables in front of the restaurant made it obvious we had arrived.   Buddy's is very spacious inside. I loved the decor of lights made with whisks from large mixers. Also, the rolling pins hanging and bundt pans were so creative. It felt very cozy and welcoming.   On to the food! There were breadsticks waiting on the table. We were pleasantly surprised when they brought out olive oil and balsamic with warm focaccia bread...melted in your mouth. The bread was so soft, yet crunchy at the same time! We ordered the meatball sub with Tuscan fries, the Margherita pizza and kids spaghetti with tomato sauce. The Margherita pizza wasn't exactly as thin as most that I've had but very good! The crust was soft and a little thicker with chunks of tomatoes and fresh basil. My daughter ate so much spaghetti she couldn't believe how good it was.   On to dessert! I loved how the dessert menu had pictures of Buddy's family, so sweet! We opted for the warm Nutella chocolate melting cake with salted Carmel ice cream. Words cannot even describe...we fought over it with our forks...it almost got ugly. There was not a crumb left.   The service was great. I wanna come back for dinner now!  Con: the only thing negative which was quickly fixed, my daughter ordered a Shirley temple. It had no taste, tasted like colored water. No idea what the problem was but they brought another out and it was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids spaghetti with tomato sauce
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids menu

T7XXmyCozGE2YFP8g5irqA.text: First of all you have to find the restaurant.  I think we went round about when it was easier to just come in off Las Vegas Strip.  It's very nice, with a full seating bar on one side with a big screen TV and then the dining room on the other side.  We opted to sit at a table in the bar so we could watch our home town Seahawks play Monday night football.  Very nice menu with lots of choices.  Pretty typical price wise of most restaurants in this caliber.  I opted for pasta and clam sauce.  Was ok, not wonderful although our server raved about it.  Hubs ordered lasagne which I tasted and it was really good but the portion was big enough for three people which is just wasteful.  We had split a Caesar salad and believe me, don't try to eat an entire salad.  They are typical Las Vegas size.  Best part of the salad were the polenta croutons.  Really good.  The salad had way too much dressing.  Also get a side of bread and olive oil as a starter.  Bread wasn't warm and felt stale to the touch.  Biggest turn off, the two young ladies acting as hostess for the restaurant were at a podium right in front of us while we were eating.  They spent the entire time playing with each other's hair.  Not very appetizing.

MhsDepRtItUaijcKbV6J6Q.text: What a pleasant surprise dining at this awesome place.  Special shoutout to Charles , the server. He was very interactive and attentive to my dining experience.  I'll definitely go back next time I visit , he even offered us souvenir cups.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guava, pineapple juice with Red Bull
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic cheese Pizza
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Rigatoni Alla Vodka

kWEr8dogJ9_KzMnx15ZEMw.text: You only want to read one line?, "So good, at least gotta try it"...  Got there around 9:50pm (they close at 10pm) and the service was great, our server was super nice and really willing to help us make decision and stuff. On a side note: her recommendations were upstanding. We were not planning to have a full meal there, just desserts and coffee (at least I wanted coffee, 10pm? Yes, but it's Vegas).   Everything was amazing! The coffee, the Nutella Volcano (or something like that), the tiramisu and the cocktails, the bella regazza wow, tbh we had 2 and it was not for the ladies at the table.  The place is "hard to find" have to really look for it inside the Venetian but I'll be worth it. I don't feel that there's the need to say this but, the place is kinda pricey (obviously).

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XnKINb6Mlxw84wU2-yk-kQ.text: We were just recently at buddy V's. Celebrating my wife's 50th birthday. She wanted to do something special so we came here. Had no clue on how much enjoyment we were going to get into. Our waiter suggested the chef special family style dinner. There was four of us in our party. Needless to say by the time we were done we had eaten 90% of our complete meal. Also add a special my daughter contacted the restaurant. And ordered a special dessert platter for my wife. For her birthday. Management was very accommodating. Our server was beyond belief outstanding and phenomenal along with his  Assistant. The food was fantastic and fabulous. My wife quote said" yes  These are the best meatballs I have ever eaten. Since my grandfather meatballs. " The beef tenderloin and the Seabass were cooked to perfection. The pasta was cooked to perfection according to my wife and friends. I highly Recommend this restaurant to anybody visiting Las Vegas. Expect to pay a little more

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The main course. Seabass, chicken pasta ,Lobster your pasta,
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer. Salad, meatballs, cheese pizza, Italian sandwich cheese and meat plate.

_iYR8ZYAP3mreHHoCxcVUQ.text: While in Vegas I'm always tempted to go out to a buffet for dinner, but since my friends wanted something less gluttonous, we decided to come here. I have absolutely no regrets and would recommend anyone to come here for an easy dinner. My one point off is for service. Although everyone was very attentive, it seemed disorganized as different people came to serve us water/drinks and we ended up having 8 cups of water on our table instead of 4.  FOOD:  Rigatoni ala vodka $24 - This was very tasty and hit my cravings for a creamy tomato sauce. The pasta was cooked right, chicken was tender, and overall finished all the pasta with a very full belly.  Cabonara $24 - Pretty tasty and a little peppery. I really love creamy pastas so this was definitely worth a try. The noodles were al dente and pretty tasty. However I still think that the Rigatoni ala vodka was better.  Pro tip: If you are looking to be seated at a normal dining table, be sure to make a reservation in advance. We did not know this and were seated at the bar area which did not bother us. However, if you want a more 'date night' atmosphere, a reservation and specifying to sit at a normal dining table may be the way to go here.

cYjrqcCfIsi9MbCGACjwwQ.text: Ordered the lasagna and it wasn't what I expected...however the meatballs and the bread were delicious!

mgilkvnGZ-A8JGCtaUobUg.text: Buddy V's was a great surprise! We had originally planned to walk the strip, check out the Bellagio Fountains and then go to Peppermill, but we needed up staying longer on the strip and got hungry;) So, while walking around The Venetian I started to Yelp the closest restaurants and saw Buddy V's. We made it for happy hour, and took advantage of some $5 sangria and Grandma's meatballs! The starter bread was awesome and the sauces were perfectly seasoned. I got the lasagna and it was awesome. My wife got the shrimp scampi and she loved it! We sat on the patio, but next time I will make a reservation for a view of the strip inside. We were too full for dessert, but we will be back to try some cheesecake or a cannoli!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gThQ_ykbW5qDUJOARBIoAA.text: Found this place based on Yelp review because we were craving Italian food. It's across from Carlo's bakery. Different menus  are offered throughout the day. Ours was 'Sunset', from 3-5pm and it was perfect. Only a few tables were taken. When you walked in, it was a typical family upscale-but-casual Italian restaurant. The staff were efficient but a little robotic. Some staff dropped off the hot coffee which we didn't order and they didn't notice till we pointed out. We ordered chicken Parmesan, linguine white wine sauce and clams and Hoboken iced tea. The staff brought out the warm focaccia bread not long before the meal. The pasta were delicious and I loved my linguine with clams. Very simple ingredients and they did a great job. I wish that I could get this where I live. Salud, see you next time!

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lisa V &#39;s Linguine &amp; White Clam Sauce

X3uqegz2mRFaeGE3S_zpYg.text: Amazing! It was sooooo yummy! My husband ordered the Beal Chop Parmesan. He said it was the best he ever had! Knocks all of the Italian & steakhouses out the park in Chicago! My toddler devoured his spaghetti and chicken parm! I enjoyed the Momma Shrimp Scampi! We will be visiting every time we are in Vegas!

e1Fgs47r1oiG1NAl7msvGA.text: This place was amazing!!! Everything from the appetizers to the entree were so good. Courtney our server gave us really good recommendations. For appetizer octopus, garlic bread and caprese salad. By recommendation of our server we split lasagna and carbonara pasta and was the best decision ever. This is a must if you're in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nonna &#39;s Lasagna Al Forno
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy &#39;s Caprese Salad Cheesy Garlic Bread and Sicilian Charred Octopus
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta My Dad &#39;s Bucatini Carbonara

zkkRVVinrJDsfEtJhNtecQ.text: My wife and I love this restaurant. Always good food and beautiful ambience. We always ask for a special table in the lounge. You should go there when Nicholas Cole and his band are playing. They do a beautiful job entertaining everyone. We go there every year and he makes our special occasions (40th anniversary, 45th anniversary, wife's birthday) memorable. Thanks also to our waitress Herschie for her fantastic service

pI_RG7SZodpqbMUxH9OhNA.text: Made a reservation for Saturday March 9th for me and my husband we checked in and they took us back in a few minutes. Our server Georgio was absolutely wonderful, he was very friendly, and even with many tables he still managed to check in on our table. I ordered the chicken piccata and my husband order the chicken Marsala. The chicken piccata was the best I've had in a long time. And the chicken Marsala was very good. Overall the experience was great, the service was great, the food was amazing! I've found a new favorite in Vegas, I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Picatta

E8tg3iv2dCRg53p2ZiSzwg.text: The food here was amazing. Literally everything we ordered was delicious. I only wish I took pictures of each dish...only managed three pictures because I was dying to eat! Ha. As far as Vegas restaurants go, it's not too high priced either so that's a nice thing. My slight complaint, and reason for the missing extra star, is for the long wait to get our food. It's not a huge deal, but if you have a show to get too, allow yourself plenty of time.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parm appetizer. Nice and crispy on the outside and easily a favorite of the table.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The carbonara. Everything I hoped for! So creamy and rich.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer meatballs...so good! Great flavor and not at all dense.

r40dhqTQZahHW2yWAWiSrQ.text: Sweet Jesus. Ok, I love Carbone. I do. Great ambiance and all. Love the freebies they give out (oh my lord; enough to go there just for that), but a funny thing happened to me, friends... while being stranded at the cesspool of a hotel called Mirage (conference; avoid at all costs). I walked across the street, yesterday... and decided to finally check out this "Cake Boss" place. I was expecting mediocre food. Big portions. I mean... he makes cakes for f*ck's sake. Cakes. What the hell does he know about Italian food (aside from being Italian)?  Well, now... I have been converted. First, they have a live band most nights (Nicholas and his brother; jazzy, very talented). I sat at the bar and privately swooned over the charming and achingly pretty bartender,  "Christian." She has the most beautiful eyes. The most, um.... What? Hey. This is my review. I'll write what I want. Get out of my head.  Ok ok... the food. Had the spaghetti carbonara last night. Best I've had. Ordered the spaghetti bolognese tonight. Best I've had. See the pattern? So, what I'm saying is... Buddy V's is legit. This is the Italian restaurant you want. Is for me now.

rSqt9qUEa4dtwWuAb9K5kg.text: One of my top favorites in Las Vegas, especially since it is in the hotel we stay at the most. I recommend making a reservation for dinner because the place is usually pretty busy even in the middle of the week. The decor is nice and upscale and the space itself is large. I love that they had live music during dinner.  Everything I have tried here is absolutely excellent. We usually start off with the garlic bread, although you are given fresh bread with olive oil and vinegar. The fried calamari is also excellent. A lot of people order the meatballs but I have yet to try them!  For entrees, we usually stick with the delicious pastas. My go to is Chicken Rigatoni "Alla" Vodka. Very filling! If you have a lot of room for food or are very hungry then I recommend getting the lasagna because it could literally last you 2-3 meals. The portions are huge!  Overall, this place is excellent for authentic Italian food!

OysnXYmSydsi39aKbwqfrA.text: This is one of those places that already has so many reviews and popularity, there is really no point in making yet another. But that's why my nickname is Ol' Pointless Kevin.   I got the 3 course meal and chose a panzanella salad, chicken parm, and and a cannoli.    I haven't had a panzanella salad before to compare it too, but research shows the main points of it are tomato and croutons, which this did seem to be based on. But I have a feeling it is not traditional recipe, as it had a grip load of delicious fresh cheese, several types of greens, and other veggies. Or maybe it's one of those things that varies region by region in Italy. At any rate, I think this elevated it into something more interesting than a basic panzanella salad. Very good.  Next came the chicken parm. Huge portion of chicken, plenty of cheese, and very tasty pasta on the side with clearly scratch made sauce. However, the pasta portion was a portion for ants. I saw pictures of this on other reviews and the portions appeared to be double normally. Maybe they ran out of noods and that's all they had left, though I mean that seems strange for an Italian place. Maybe it's just sort of a random portion each time and the pasta Gods were not on my side this time. On a sidenote, I can't eat chicken parm anymore without my mind going straight to the Impractical Jokers sketch where Q is just naming absurd parms like "donkey parm, gorilla parm. . ."  The cannoli was easily the best I ever had. Gigantor size. One side had choco chips and the other pistachios. Only a soulless monster could complain about this. Obviously the Cake Boss is going to make excellent desserts. I need to try their bakery across the hall next time.   So yeah, overall did a good job of hitting that Italian food fix.

sQKam6K-lnr82PRbomxbGg.text: Went here for my wedding. Had a great time. Service was amazing and made it a lil more special by giving us a congrats desert plate with our names on it. Love it very much!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SgsRhlNOr7C3cS5GqMNnOg.text: Very good food, and the service is amazing, the server is always on top of refilling our drinks. They are quick with the food, Excellent service. Highly recommended. Love it.

YqQnIsDL_PvzVAXJKTAZcA.text: MY NEW FAVORITE RESTAURANT  I am a Vegas local and like to try new spots when my hubby and I go on date nights. We LOVED the fact that it's extremely family friendly, the live music kept our 1 year old dancing in her high chair (the band they have is spectacular and extremely friendly.. they even dedicated a song to my little one)  The service was the best I've had in a LONG time. GEORGIO went above and beyond to give us spectacular service.. he even gifted out little one with a stuffed animal, which she loved. ( its service like this that will make a Vegas local come back again and again)  The entire staff is amazing and we will deff be back !  Lisa the host was also super sweet and accommodating. Thank you buddy v!! See ya soon for Sunday brunch

GRExhvAABD5gDpNTL7z-iA.text: Georgio is the best server we have had in ages! He gave us 5star service and the food was amazing too. We also really enjoyed the Rat Pack style music. We highly recommend the chicken Parm, Toscano salad and the Caprese. We will return again. A+++

VCo3xOe3vhB3GP3cljSxxw.text: Came here back in January with the girlfriend. One of my favorite brunch buffets in Vegas if you know what to expect.   There are many choices, but not a ton like "normal" buffets which I liked because I didn't feel pressured to try everything and get too full on things I disliked. It's also very nice that the cooks create the items in small batches. I felt like everything was fresh and delicious because of this.   My favorite items were the ham, eggs, and crepes which you can top to your liking.   I also found my way to the desserts to have myself a Buddy style dessert and even grabbed a handful of candy that was out in jars.   This restaurant was very accommodating and pleasant to be in. My girlfriend and I were seated right near a window looking out at the strip and away from the large groups. It felt private and is the reason we are going back this upcoming weekend.   Excellent job.

vpchdkpM4k9SgEbvc561Ig.text: Loved this place. We had 11 people for dinner and it did not disappoint. Everyone our group thoroughly enjoyed their meals! Big beers and great foods! We would absolutely go back. The restaurant was also very accommodating for our group size too. Thanks Tammy!

Mj7_f33HLLClFB6bISIQlA.text: The original restaurant we were planning on having was closed for a private dinner, and so we ended up at Buddy V's... and I just want to say it was amazing!  It had great service, amazing Focaccia bread - that's made there to boot in their in house(in restaurant?) oven -, fantastic setting and vibe, and most of all sumptuous food.  We ordered several appetizers, and they were all good, but the octopus was amazing.  It was the most tender melt in my mouth morsel of octopus I've ever had, and if you're familiar with octopus that is hard to accomplish.  After the appetizers, we were blessed with some amazingly delicious chicken parmigiana.  Overall would dine again, it was an amazing dinner with fantastic service!

yxFrL9_hl_AdzzZ1HIF-Bw.text: Gotta say, pretty delicious food. I was a little skeptical since it's a celebrity chef restaurant on the strip but I was hooked from the complimentary focaccia. The meatball appetizer is delicious with super garlicky cheesy garlic bread to sop the sauce. I got the penne vodka and it was the best vodka sauce I've had in a while. I added some red pepper to spice it up some. My husband got lasagna and loved it. The orichetta is a lighter option with nice sausage in it. The chocolate cake is a decadent rich finish to a great meal.

pyLbUhyrURdmxi0AHaX1Qw.text: Classic Italian restaurant!  Service was best we experienced while we were in Vegas for the week. Spaghetti and meatballs with extra Italian sausage was very good!  My family and I loved this restaurant!

pR3E55sc3vU0EZHlIalmrA.text: The food taste okay and nothing special but our server was super nice lady. We went there after we read so many yelp reviews since we were staying at the Palazzo. we had the chicken Picata and shrimp scampi with caesar salad.

0_2RinMGY1_pidwJYDTcxA.text: Delicious!  Meatballs were great. Loved the chicken parmigiana.  Can't wait to try meatball sandwich next time. Super nice staff.

La73OmUN7RMhK1T58JqC6Q.text: This restaurant is AMAZING! Where do I begin, the staff was so pleasant. Our server was the best. He helped us decide on our entrees. He really knew his food. He mentioned to us how he is Italian & grew up with his mothers authentic cooking. The moscato & cucumber mule we ordered were delicious. I ordered "My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara" & I can honestly say, it's the best Italian dish I have ever tasted. The food & desserts tasted very fresh. It's a little on the spendy side, but worth every penny.

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h8ZiIP-I9NqrREUBzroc8g.text: I have nothing bad to say about this place at all. I looked them up on yelp about what to order before we showed up so I knew we had the most popular dishes they offered. We went for my birthday & shared the chicken Parmesan, lasagna & caprese salad and all was amazing. My sister got the cake boss martini and it was heaven. Check out his bakery across the way. It all looked and tasted great!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kFo87AcVeOinhDVLuN6W8A.text: Exceptional service, food, and atmosphere. We were seated and our waitress promptly came and took our drink order. The food was not only nicely presented, but tasted amazing! We both loved our entrees. The cannoli was very authentic and my favorite, dessert. We also got the cheesecake, but nothing special in my opinion. Definitely recommend this restaurant while in Vegas!

vZlp8lYK0k76Cd6LlcECzw.text: Charles is one of the best servers out there! Had a great experience and can't wait to come back. Portions were huge and service was exceptional. Props to Buddy V's for bringing their A game

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3WZs8QsIGx06lVVTL7o2lA.text: We happened upon this place while strolling around the Venetian at lunchtime. SO happy we did! I had Dad's bucattini carbonara and my husband ordered the Hoboken Philly cheese steak. I had already eaten half of my pasta when I took the picture and My husband barely made a dent in his huge sandwich and mountain of parmesan fries (which were the best fries we've ever had!). I didn't order any extra protein on my pasta, but that didn't take away from its amazing flavor and heartiness. We aren't used to paying $23 for pasta, but this was worth it! We ate to our hearts' content and still have food left over. Staff was extremely friendly and attentive! Our server moved us to a table near a window, looking out over the strip- extra tip for him! The atmosphere was very pleasant and had a nice feel. I'd come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5jmgHq2eBQjvzGLYyaU_tw.text: This place has everything from great food, amazing ambience, incredible service, and live music as the icing on cake.  I came in for brunch for a friends birthday and was blown away.  They have 3 different buffet stations as well as a Bloody Mary station to build your ultimate Bloody Mary which I did.  I am stuffed and can't wait to come back.  Ariss is an incredible server.  He is the reason to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great manager! Thanks for everything Milly!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday David!  Haha

naXNsibV0pv1_YWt8J7T7A.text: Buddy's was delicious. It was clean, cozy and service was great! Everything from the cheesy garlic bread (a must) to the lasagna to the sangria was delicious! You can tell love was definitely put into the food! I would've loved to try the dessert but I had already eaten too much! I highly recommend!

bmOBG9A4EgTF2mc-dNlCWA.text: This is absolutely the best Italian restaurant I have ever been to. The Caesar salad was amazing, dipping the bread in the olive oil and balsamic vinegar was a spiritual experience! My wife had the Buddy's special pizza. It was delicious, crispy, cheesy, tasty. I had Nanna's lasagna, it was simply the thickest, tastiest, richest lasagna I have ever had. We paid our check and at the last minute decided to have cannoli to go for dessert. Our server took care of that in 2 minutes, great service! Eddie our servers helper took some great pictures of us at our table. What a wonderful dining experience!

wrSF5BgkHJ4KBF1ZnvRciw.text: I was pleasantly surprised to how wonderful my dinner was.  I had the Chicken Piccata, which was quite tasteful w/a lot of flavor.  The pasta that came with piccata was the best tasting pasta, yet...it had so much flavor...I can still taste it, yum.  The Eggplant Parmesan and Calamari was just as tasty.  I truly was pleased w/how flavorful each meal was.  I definitely will go back and oh...we did go to Cake Boss's bakery...wow!  I had the strawberry tower, will not disappoint you, I promise.  Loved it! Bought their carrot cupcakes, sugar cookies and  walnut cookies...will be baaaack!

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Zio2ZV5L_PY8hNOeEKwOEw.text: This is one is the best places in Las Vegas. Fantastic pasta! OMG eggplant parm! And don't skip dessert!

s9pqix1jd8PIDmTsSNvXNg.text: The service was GREAT right from the start.  The host immediately had the authority after walking us to our table to honor a request to sit at table adjacent that was bring swept as this was a window view table.  No hesitation, she asked for a minute to have table swept and immediately prepared.   The waiter and the support staff immediately started service even with a full house.  Great team work for service.    Fresh bread and olive oil was nice.  The meatballs are worth it just to dip the bread.  Kid's spaghetti was high quality and nice with the meatballs to start.  Pasta perfectly cooked.  Caesar was large enough to share with 3 and a real Caesar dressing.  It was really good with unique croutons.    The Brocalini was great.  But the lasagna was best and perfect.  The wines are appropriate and match nice.  Prices are very reasonable considering location and level of service. The service team was great and a joy.  They treated my daughter with respect and wasn't condescending despite her age, 6 years.   I'm very dissappointed at myself for bypassing this place all my previous trips to Vegas.  This is now my go to place for Italian on the strip.  Very homey and tasty.  Really high quality and straight forward.  Nothing complex needed.
