3yQ5mLltYA8Y3IaFL5L_AA.text: The service was FANTASTIC!  We were a table of five and shared our entrees to have a variety of tastes.  Some of us loved the calamari, the other half thought it was too tough.  The eggplant parm was actually hard, so I'm glad it was a shared appetizer instead of a meal. I had read great things about the lasagna...but I must say, I was slightly disappointed.  The portions were huge but if nothing about the dish makes you want to  eat more then who cares?  The chicken parm was GREAT!  But the pasta it came with was OVERLY salty!!!  The Osso Bucco and Polenta were OUTSTANDING as was the Veal in bone parm....although another party at the table complained there was too much cheese on that.  The XL Lobster Tail for dessert is to die for :) ...and I really loved the cannoli.  The ambiance was great....and like I said, the service was stellar!  The portions were great, ... I just have a few complaints....and a few disappointments.  Would still give it another try to taste a few more things before discounting it.

2yEOCeH_qwf6RIrLQzJ14A.text: Wow!  What a fabulous meal we had last week. My husband and I are major foodies and have eaten at some of the best Italian places in the USA. We loved the best of course in Boston little Italy and Buddy Vs is as close as it gets.  I had the Osso Buco and my husband had the ravioli,  and both were amazing. We had to keep sharing with everybody at our table.  The only trouble we had was finding it.  It is on the second floor, but we kept asking for directions from everybody in the Venetian  and nobody could tell us.  Finally a drink server put her full tray of drinks down and went to a wall phone and got directions for us. You would think they would have training on directions in the hotel on how to get what you are looking for.  But it was definitely worth the navigating.  We will be coming back again!

zQUOZGaF69t0pYG67uPYXA.text: We had Thanksgiving dinner for four at Buddy V's Ristorante.  According to our internet search for top Las Vegas restaurants for Thanksgiving dinner 2015, Buddy V's was showing a delicious menu including a squash soup to start and a main plate, all for $28/person.  When we arrived, it was $10 for soup and $29 for the main plate.  They explained that somehow, it was the 2014 menu and pricing showing online.  The soup arrived and it was way too sweet.  It should have been served as dessert, not an appetizer.  I barely had three spoonfuls and when  they took it away, they didn't even ask if it was ok.  The main course arrived and it was tasty, but cold.  We sent it back and asked for it to be hot.  When the second plate arrived 10 minutes or so later, it was still cold.  We hoped that the third time would be a charm, but it wasn't.  Half the plate was hot, half was cold.  I'm sure they must have microwaved it.  The really scary thing was that half the turkey and sausage was gone, so I'm still wondering if they served me my plate or someone else's plate.  We spent over $250 for four with a $40 bottle of wine, before tip, and were tremendously disappointed with the service, and the fact that they're incapable of serving hot food, despite several attempts.  The flavor was good, but that is not sufficient to give them our business a second time.

VixvGvm8i-QfRkue2fHriA.text: We stopped by Buddy's this week to get cannoll's to go.  We were told to go to the bar.  After being ignored for at least ten minutes the rude female bartender finally got our order.  She does not need to work in the service industry!  The cannoli made up for it though!  Excellent.  Went back the next day for more.  Again Buddy would be appalled at how rude the waitstaff in his bar area is - even if you are busy you tell someone you will be with them in a minute.  But once again the cannoli was fantastic!

E8RLU4ZIGSKOz5TzrScVeA.text: Great meal here last night. Salads were top notch, bacon Mac n Cheese excellent, and each of our three entrees was superb (the lasagna was exceptional). Not a ton of cutting edge dishes here; just classic Italian fare done right! The dessert menu is inventive and excellent- the hot Nutella cake is a winner!

tmE8vUzOPw2ZoW37H-Salw.text: Wow what can I say about this place. Let me start by saying we had high hopes for this place. However, the reality is that this place was mediocre at best. I will start with the good. The service was good, the meatball appetizer was good, and the fresh bread was great. This is where it stops, the spaghetti was somewhat chef boyardee tasting and the chicken parmigiana lacked flavor. Consequently the only flavor from that dish was from the cheese, which was all cheese no chicken. At this point the wife and I chalk it up to a loss and believing the hype and figures hey the desert has to be good, after all it's the cake boss right. WRONG!!!! This was probably the most disappointing part of the meal we got the cannoli and tiramisu. The cannoli was bland and lacked any depth and the tiramisu was also boring lacked any real flavor and to boot was but in a small Masson jar. Oh let's not forget the cookies that were served with the cannoli they were as hard as a biscotti. Now I can chalk up the good as a loss but the desert really?! That should have been second to none. The bottom line, if you want good Italian food and dessert go anywhere else but this overrated excuse of an Italian restaurant!!!!

GWALfUbiP4uSUuWy21O_6Q.text: Would have given this place five stars because my husband and I really enjoyed our dinner when we dined there on our vacation last week. But we felt our waiter although very nice was not totally truthful and sneaky. We had ordered a salad and the fried mozzarella for an appetizer, both were delicious! But our waiter casually asked if we wanted cheesy garlic bread and the way he asked it came across that it was complementary...it wasn't $9.00 :/ the other thing was that my husband and I had both ordered beers, and when I had ordered mine he pulled out the menu and pointed to two choices and asked which one I wanted...I just pointed to the smaller of the two choices. When we got our bill it turned out he had added on a souvenir glass (an extra $5.00) without informing me that was what he was doing. So we felt we got a little bit scammed into adding on all these extras. So ask questions before you just say "sure!" to something.

Q1vLM-ojcO4Jpqcj0MA9hQ.text: Service was great...went there twice during our stay :) Caesar salad was average and the macaroni carbonara was average but everything else was amazing!  Looking forward to next time!

hhb3TKJbmIlRD5ajHYYgIg.text: HORRIBLE...I went there yesterday to celebrate my birthday.  I'm a Cake Boss fan.  I'm 100% Sicilian and thought it would be fun to try.  VERY DISAPPOINTED.. OK tell me what Italian Restaurant doesn't serve bread... you have to order garlic bread full of grease flavor garlic not even real butter flavor and smothered in melting cheese... how about some nice Italian bread you can dip in olive oil ...the Caesar salad didn't have any anchovies on it,,,, HELLO Italian eat anchovies,,, the portions were very small and just NOT GOOD.... the Lobster Claw said it was filled with Canoli filling and cream... sorry it was just straight whipped cream with baileys in it.... very disappointing.  I'm a NYer and I know what a real lobster claw is supposed to be..., I will never go there again and OMG the prices were very expensive.... 2 for lunch came to $100.00 and it wasn't good at all... Sorry Buddy... you need to get those people trained right... and get some good bread in there...

rQxdGph3pMorUpKfDVqzLA.text: great service, great food, great experience, great ambiance, even general manger stopped by to say hello and check on us.

PMP4WAIxmvpHBoZz5Uggmg.text: My boyfriend had some pasta that had chicken and a vodka sauce.  I desperately wished I had ordered that instead of the scallops.  The scallops I had were seared pretty nicely and had capers around them for some saltiness, but I kinda wished I had salt or something besides mashed potatos with them.  Mashed potatos and scallops kinda don't go together in my head.  Anyways, his food was so good I kept eating off his plate and he kept letting me because I'm his girlfriend so he has to...  The calamari was also okay.  Compared to Nora's it wasn't that great but if you aren't a spoiled brat then yeah, the calamari is Ok.  I also had the nutella cake with icecream and that was Ok too.  The icecream was raved about by my server last night, and he told me that it is the same icecream as Honeysalt.  I thought I had had it before!!!  I didn't care for the cake so much and just picked out the Nutella.  I don't know why I got that because I can have Nutella at home.  I should have gotten some different dessert.  I will know now for next time to get the pasta and get a different dessert.  That dang vodka sauce and pasta was SO good.

BzdsgZw2TwlviPgJmGVBLg.text: So sad!  We had such high hopes for this place.  We eat out a lot (in fact we are trying a new restaurant every day this winter break!)  This restaurant cannot compete with anything else nearby.  Maggiano's -fabulous, Brio - lovely, Buddy V's -meh.  We had the meatball sand and the vodka sauce pasta.  Both were bland, small and overpriced ($23 for a very small plate of pasta.). No hot bread and butter, no attentive wait staff, no one asked how are meals were, we were invisible.  Then we come to the real reason we went - the lobster tail pastry.  At $15 we were sure it would be crazy good.  It wasn't. The cream inside was luscious and the presentation was beautiful, but the pastry itself was so hard and overcooked we couldn't cut it and that made sharing difficult.  Worst of all, I left my commemorative photo of my little girl and I from  the National Geographic exhibit on the table.  When we realized this 2 hours later we rushed back to the restaurant.  They had thrown it out!  Who doesn't keep people's forgotten things for at least the rest of the day?!  A very bad $64 lunch and a sad tale to tell.

kXjFbhM674-nNEpv4OP_Tg.text: Yum yum yum!  Great food and great dessert! You must try the carbonara pasta!  and their molten cake and Italian bday cake dessert are to die for, I swear!

ewsN6tvyl7IObUd0M653FA.text: Way good!  The chicken parm was fantastic.   Very tasty and much better than Otto down the street.  I couldn't be more pleasantly surprised by this meal.  The chicken was cooked through but not over cooked.  The breading was NOT soggy, was firm and crunchy.  Just a well executed dish.  The pasta was good too.  Services was attentive and nice!  I never had an empty glass and before I could ask for something like extra cheese, they were asking me.  Awesome!  Just awesome!

viN6WIc1zaEg3xbYP9C5aw.text: It was our last night in Vegas and my husband wanted Italian. Being from New York (and having an Italian husband!) my expectations were high. The restaurant had a nice, homey atmosphere with an open kitchen. It was fun to see the meals being prepped and watching them come out. We started with the caprese salad and fried calamari. The burrata was delicious. The calamari was crisp and light and very tender. For our main diss, we shared the Valestro family gravy. What a hit! We both loved the "gravy" ! Very authentic, homemade sauce..Italian husband said one of the best he's ever tasted. Portions were nicely sized. Sever was on point but not very attentive. One HUGE complaint..a bread basket was not provided!! A great Italian restaurant with no bread so sop up all of that saucy goodness??! Come on Buddy! Breadsticks in a bag! You can do a lot better than that! Lost a star on the bread issue...We will return on our next visit..with our own loaf of Italian bread!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b5Wwp2IabyDnVz5LypPbQA.text: I was excited to try this place, especially bc the owner is the star of TLC's reality show 'Cake Boss.' I had high expectations, but unfortunately, they were not met.   I took the safe route and ordered Chicken Parmesan. This dish is pretty difficult to mess up since it's so common and every Italian restaurant has it. But to my surprise, it was just....Bleh. Nothing spectacular about it. Tasted better everywhere else.   I was with 7 other girls, who ordered a variety of dishes. All didn't seem wow'ed at all, too. Two girls ordered the same thing (forgot what they ordered), but one girl's dish was way more salty than the other. We all had a taste of both girls' dish and agreed.   Service was also just.... Bleh. Whenever we asked our waiter for something, he had a lame excuse why it couldn't be done or if it can be done, he would take forever to do so. One thing I don't like is how they can't split up checks. Even very small restaurants don't have problems with splitting checks now a days. I also don't like paying a lot for food that's less than mediocre.   I must add though that their dessert menu looked amazing. Too bad none of us were in a mood to try anything. I MIGHT be back to try out a dessert or two when I make it out here again to L.V.

ia58AFqLejoT6wSZJ6EivA.text: The food was on point....Tiffany was rude while setting up the reservation.... It's hard to get it all right. The food was really good though.

kKAmF0AZOUh8a6haJVZxJA.text: 2nd visit to Vegas and again we go to Buddy V's and have an awesome meal and reasonably priced for Vegas. The cannolis are the best ever. This is a definite keeper on our next visit.

mZbE2ULmePsS_OS7TmqKaw.text: We had dinner reservations and arrived 30 minutes early. We requested a window table and were immediately seated. The table had a great view overlooking Las Vegas Blvd.  Service was prompt and friendly.  The meal started with a basket of bread along with Olive Oil and Balsamic.  In support of Restaurant Week we ordered off the special menu.  The Caprese Salad was perfect. Nice variety of heirloom tomatoes, silky burrata, and the green beans was an interesting addition  The entree of Spaghetti Bolognese was just the right size. The meat was very tasty and the sauce flavorful.  Dessert was Zeppole coated with spiced sugar and served with a raspberry dipping sauce. A great finish  Thanks Buddy V for your support of Restaurant Week.

nrHbl2DawTPDp_PXRcJndg.text: Food: A Service: A Ambiance: B Price: A- Layout: B+ Location: A  Sat in the bar lounge area. Host welcomed us in even with PBR tallboys in hand. Felt at home. Ordered a pizza and calamari app. Great calamari, excellent service. Can't wait to try the other items on the menu. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari was great! Don&#39;t forget to enjoy with beer!

pp5PFMp8IqNGvdkgnQe5HQ.text: I was so excited to see this restaurant listed in RESTAURANT WEEK!! I've been wanting to come here anyway & this was the perfect opportunity. A 3 course dinner for only $30.14!! I had Grandma's Meatballs for my app & Chicken Parm as my entree. Restaurant week's portion came with 4 meatballs. 2 pieces of chicken & a small but good size spaghetti. Both were just amazing. So much flavor in the meatballs & you can see the herbs when you cut into it. The breading on the chicken parm was perfect. Not too thick so it's not filling. The spaghetti sauce was simple & delicious. Mini donuts as the dessert with a chocolate & raspberry I think it was sauce to dip. 5 small pieces I believe. Spiced sugar coating the outside of the donut.   The specialty cocktail list was awesome! Everything looked good! I ordered the DRAGO ROSSO-absolut ruby red, pomegranate, jalapeno & mango. A spicy treat! I've always wanted to try a spicy cocktail & this one was amazing. I had to take small sips cause my throat burned a little! The jalapeno seeds were floating at the top too. I think I should have asked the bartender to not make it that spicy. But it was good! Priced at $14.   The restaurant is beautiful! It's huge. The kitchen was open so you can watch them cook (love that). Brick walls & floor to ceiling windows with great views of the Strip. There are old pictures everywhere & cool decor. Unique chandeliers & a great wine shelf! We had a great table next to the window :)   Service was great! Everyone was so nice. I even got a birthday dessert from them with a sparkler attached! I will be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant week size dessert. Zeppole?
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Restaurant week size Chicken Parm.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best garlic bread ever!

aOQy_KL1eftuUUvthDBbUQ.text: We were super excited to go to Buddy's and were definitely not disappointed! Portion sizes were great and everything was presented beautifully. Our server, Georgio, claimed to be Buddy's godson and produced a picture of Buddy holding him as a baby, but I'm a natural born skeptic and wonder if it's True :) Nonetheless, Georgio was very attentive and knowledgable about the entire menu. He even told my friend that what she was planning to order was too boring and she would probably prefer something else! He made a recommendation and she ended up loving it! My dish was nothing short of fantastic and next time I'm in Vegas will definitely be going back! The bread before dinner was served warm with traditional oil and tasted soooooo good.   My only suggestion is definitely talk to them ahead of time about how the checks are going to work. We felt bad making him split it a couple ways because it took a while in the system.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and rigatoni alla vodka. YUMMMM
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu!

S09zYiDUEh1SBwak29KC9A.text: 1) The linguini & clams was too salty.  2) Manager took it back and told me yes chef agreed it was too salty.     3) they replaced the plain pasta without the clams. 4) the second time complained it was not my order the linguini without clams and the manager attitudes changed so unpleasant and took the dish back to replace the 3rd. 5). The final bill, buddy v's charged me two orders on linguini & clams.     6).  I will not go back and wont recommend on the services either.

AMbZStk7iue-cv5rvHWMPg.text: This place is awesome! Great food, great prices. The chicken parm, will fill you up! Love the garlic bread!

Vue9nuwd8eavpLEertQU8w.text: The service was bad and slow and the food was mediocre. They were trying to have a home cooking vibe and it was a fail. I wouldn't go again

ph29qZbzyw3JJLfOgm3nQQ.text: Excellent! Service was great, very friendly and entertaining. Good wine list, reasonably prices- menu with good variety of classic Italian meals- we had the octopus with fingerling potatoes- very good, tender with orange, rather than the usual lemon   Also had the caprese salad with small tomatoes and fresh mozzarella-very good    Chicken Marsala was excellent, with side if pasta, lasagna was incredible, a veritable brick if meats and cheeses! Plop, you will jot leave hungry   Ended the meal with lobster tail, split ingest 4 people- very good with its flakey crust and creamy goodness  Overall, great meal, reasonably priced - would definitely return

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus and fingerling potatoes
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese!

lcNbn46eBOm53HiggcddIw.text: The cheese ravioli is wonderful! The spaghetti was also great. But the desserts!!! OMG! The cannoli was delicious , and the cheesecake too! Wait staff could not have been nicer or any better. Would definitely recommend!

UuHlPmwk2Ddn3Zi5112fEQ.text: While back in vegas I could not miss Sunday brunch at Buddy V's. Again very Impressed with everything first of all when I arrived I received a welcoming greeting by by Tiffany who does an awesome job! The food is always consistant and the QUALITY of the food amazing. The staff, EVERYONE is so HOSPITABLE and hard working. This time the GM came by to say hi and chat while I was taking photo of food.

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fQQqch6UUVrBQhgTofy2fg.text: Delicious food and superb service. Our waiter Peter provided us with excellent and impressive service.  We ordered the grilled salmon, shrimp scampi, clams with linguini, and the cheese ravioli. Would definitely recommend!!!! One of best restaurants in Vegas!!!!

TLUL5PF9StDj3eDP1G7A6w.text: Came here after watching a show expecting something wonderful considering the prices. Came on a Wednesday night expecting a wonderful experience considering this is Buddy's rest. Who we have loved for many years on TV. The service was slow and not up to what we usually get at a good resturant. As far as the food. It was good not great. SORRY BUDDY. But we won't be coming back to your resturant.

ues_-rJOdK9ZNPVyePM_aw.text: Amazing!  Loved everything! The Sunday Gravy is the best....Service Amazing and our Hostess Marissa was beautiful and classy!

yUL6AtyY3NC-xZUd1MYmtg.text: So happy I stopped by for lunch! The chicken Parmesan is AMAZING! Came in after a client told me how good the food was, hands down will be back. Probably after we found that client her dream house!

ckwIXrRx_eofWmiuq_enhg.text: Saturday brunch was fantastic! Be sure to try sunday style eggs, veggie fritatta, and meatballs.

m4Nxk8LuqkLqglwqMX8cWA.text: Came in for the happy hour specials and a drink or two... Loved the grandma'a meatballs!!! And would go back just for that.. We got Mac & cheese, ricotta cheese, and the calamari.. Also a cannoli... The food was great and the service was awesome..

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2_VnhSalJekFt5nnA744Sg.text: Very good food! Some of the best bolognese I've found. Chicken rigatoni with vodka sauce was lovely. Good ceasar salad. No room for dessert, unfortunately. Eat here and you won't be disappointed!

_pIRzaQmrvfeKWDJa6LOow.text: Stopped in for some dessert and an after dinner drink with a large group. I liked what I had but take issue with the fact that he has an Italian spot in Vegas. I mean, come on, you are known for a crappy TV show that has an emphasis on desserts and you "film" in Hoboken. I dont care if your grandmother cooked Italian...mine did too.  This place features fo-talian food with a of Carabbas feel. Hmmmm, I wonder where you got the idea?   In their defence though, their lobster tail pastry was delicious. Everything else was underwhelming.   Will I be back? NO. Im tired of all these wannabe TV culinarians.

_lyxIrQXMFi4_OMYopvYHQ.text: I had the linguini with clams, my husband had the parm and my son had the spaghetti with meatballs.  It was all delicious!! The service was great and very family friendly not like some restaurants in Las Vegas that could be intimidating.  We also had the hazel nut dessert with the salted Carmel ice cream and it was just the best!  Love this place.

zc8nzq5qp5Za9cgRjKRgWQ.text: Huge fan of Buddy and his family and this restaurant did not disappoint. The bread they bring you is delicious. Our waiter (wish I got his name) was extremely kind and made small conversation with us which I loved. I got the cheese ravioli and it was amazing. My mother got the meat lasagna which was absolutely amazing. Definitely recommend that. My brother got the scallops and fell in love with it. The portions weren't huge (the turkey lasagna was a pretty good portion but the ravioli and scallops weren't huge), but were very filling! We had Canolis and lobster tails for dessert which were amazing. We had a great experience and it was 100 % worth it. So good in fact we are going back tomorrow for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch Salmon. It&#39;s actually bigger but I had already eaten some when I took this photo :-) It was so good

FbMlXgaUxlVt98ah0SkCWA.text: I normally don't order spaghetti and meatballs, but it was included in the Prix Fix meal, and I wanted a salad.  So,  I reluctantly ordered it.   Man oh man, am I ever glad  I did.  It was just like my aunts, if not better.  The most succulent meatballs ever!! The sauce was so good too.  I almost ate the whole bowl.  I left  a few bites because I was so stuffed.  I thought about it he next day, that's how I know it was good!!!

1qLA28UxqWMfDYr7_NBtHw.text: Ordered grilled octopus(spicy), chicken parm, food is really salty, just ok level. However, the tiramisu and Italian birthday cake are awesome. I think the ads guy was in Cake Boss show? Desert is worth the visit. Should have made reservation otherwise line is long.

dQkgt1owb2IxKWe7Zk2ETg.text: The portions are large enough to share...which allows you to share and try more. The service was just fine. It wasn't the best meal I've ever had but fed not the worse... If your in the area stop by but I wouldn't make my way over here just for Buddy Vs

F_JyetKrMg2g8Un9XBJv5Q.text: So I can't say I love the fact that Buddy's feels very much like its part of a mall. I think it's due to the fact that the entranceway is huge. The open floor plan just makes the restaurants main Dining area feel like it's right in the middle of the mall. However despite this minor flaw the food here is authentic. Our waiter was from Naples and had a True passion for the food he was serving. Our apps were delicious including the Caesar salad and calamari. The meatballs were top notch. For dinner I ordered the mixed meats with pasta. The dish had a name but I can't remember for the life of me what it was called. The lamb was fatty though which is why I can't go to five stars. Plus the dish was missing a component in my opinion. Like maybe some cheese or vegetables. My friends dishes all looked good. No one seemed   blown away but we were definitely satisfied and impressed by the cleanliness and authentic Italian cuisine we were served.

SIN1dKcUJ-NcRnCrwkTrxA.text: My wife and I were dying to go to Buddy's new place in Vegas. So I made reservations ahead of time and couldn't wait. We went earlier in the day just so we could know where in the mall it was located. I'm glad we did since it was off a corridor from the main forum shops. We liked how the place looked. Well set up and inviting. They had a long row of outside tables in front of the restaurant.   So we go to the place and they found our reservation and went to seat us. They brought us into the bar and sat us in the corner with a view of the strip. I didn't mind the view but if I made reservations why was I sitting at the bar? Kinda of set the mode already. It was not to crowded for a Friday night which we were very surprised when most restaurants are hopping. There were bread stick on the table already but they were prepackaged ones and not from Italy, they were made in New Jersey.   We wanted the best from Buddy so my wife ordered his wife's linguine and clam sauce. While I had Buddy's chicken rigatoni "ALLA VODKA". My wife's meal was plain and not worth the $26 that they charged for it. It tasted like my wife made it herself nothing fancy or fantastic taste. Mine had maybe 6 pieces of chicken in it and the pasta was kind of chewy. It was like my wife made it also. Not saying I wouldn't eat it but not real fine dining. We have been to several restaurants in Vegas since we go 4-6 times a year. So I'm no newbie.   Oh I missed the garlic bread we ordered before the meal. Which consisted of three pieces for 9. Nothing special and little over priced again. My wife and I agreed Buddy should of opened a cafe type restaurant and not fine dining. The food is more family food but over priced for Vegas. It would be totally packed everyday if the prices were lower and family orientated.   But not to jam on Buddy over his place. We had the Italian birthday cake and let me tell you it was no disappointment. We loved it and that what Buddy is famous for Cakes. I wish he had a bakery with the restaurant because that would go no stop. Hope this helps you guys out. thanks

ZZroaMwlcb8-NxU6kx8kGA.text: Being a spaghetti lover, I naturally wanted to try Buddy V's. My fiance and I were able to be seated right away without a reservation, but we did go on a Monday evening so that may be why. I wish we were seated at another table because the waitress we had got on our nerves. My fiance and I do not drink, so when asked if we wanted any alcoholic drinks, we declined. Our waitress looked at us like we were from outer space and make little comments the rest of the night about us not having a drink or two. I thought it was very rude of her to do so. The food was tasteful, but slightly expensive for what you get. I've had spaghetti that's been more flavorful before, but the garlic bread was out-of-this-world good. The atmosphere is calm and the decor is very nice. Overall, I would eat at Buddy V's again, but would order something different than spaghetti.

jEI62SCGuvgMZLYJTttgSA.text: The service at Buddy V's was some of the best I've had in Las Vegas. Everything about the restaurant is very warm and welcoming. The staff are friendly and attentive without being overbearing they where knowledgeable of the Menu and made useful suggestions.  I had the Sunday gravy it was a nice assortment of meats sausage, lamb, and pork in marinara sauce. My girlfriend had the sea bass and gave it high marks. I don't eat fish so I can't vouch for it personally. We finished with the Italian birthday cake. It was very moist and flavorful without being too sweet. The price was a little high, but this is a celebrity chef with a restaurant on the vegas strip what would you expect. In the end we left satisfied and happier than when we went in.

iOy3KUz5fk6yDnQE8PJygw.text: The restaurant had great atmosphere.   I and my new bride had the meatball sub along with the Italian sangria.  Within an hour, I was sick to my stomach and was in the restroom for almost 3 days.  I will never eat there again, due to this.  The tab was over $80 for 2 meatball subs and 2 sangria's... Way overpriced.

3tKHjV6jDa2wZz_ifUmE-w.text: !!!So good I tipped the Chef responsible for my Chicken Parm plate $20!!!  It was the best spaghetti I've had. Not the typical American style spaghetti swimming in sauce. It was True Italian full flavored perfection. Service was very good and attentive as well.

ZBbkE9PUtJ0xfB-RTw57rg.text: Great meal at Buddy V's! The Grilled Octopus app was the most tender I've ever had. The Chicken Marsala was savory, the way it should be. Too many restaurants use sweet Marsala wine and ruin the dish. Buddy V's was right on, and a good portion size too. My wife's Capellini Shrimp Scampi was terrific. Very nice wine selection by the glass. By the way, the Caesar Salad with polenta croutons is a must have as well.

OkMSg3irgAgqf9K69J3tng.text: Delicious food!!! I'm sorry I don't remember my waiters name but he was super nice and made great recommendations. The panzenella salad is a must try. Beautiful restaurant, amazing food and atmosphere. Can't wait to go back.

tOYLjfbVbj-ys7D5SKJCBg.text: The food was amazing. Served in a timely manner and with extremely fresh ingredients. HOWEVER, the staff is extremely unpleasant. The hostess had an intimidating face and seemed like she didn't like her job. The waiter was polite but not friendly. I would not come here unless I was dying for the food.

JFWPPr1WzD9FaRRu1cPJog.text: I will say this, it is nice to see service return to Veags in a big way. From the minute we walked in we felt like family. Awesome, awesome, awesome friendly folks and they really care. Food is fabulous.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Sea Scallops look Devine.  Broccoli is awesome.

NCR2hxnR16jKJ0n033PZow.text: Great food! Excellent service! The chicken parm was wonderful! The cannolis were awesome as always!

IbRzAXMmEhI9MyNzVSxGSQ.text: Only place in The Venetian that disappointed . Felt like the Olive Garden.  Bread had no taste. Very stingy with the pasta. The waiters were nice and desserts were good. Loud and overpriced.  Even the $12 bloody Mary was bland.

GEPsiiAmzQsvz8GUMIuWcQ.text: The lasagna is very good, and you must try the Italian birthday cake.  It is expensive, but service was good.

pjY4cev4bbM3ZrbeaLyM_A.text: Amazing food, the ravioli's were to die for!  Excellent service, very professional and friendly.  Crazy good deserts, but that is to be expected!  Wonderful atmosphere with a great price point!

88gTEqlhvdq0TtZb6d7Y7g.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere special to celebrate our anniversary. We spent a good hour narrowing down Italian food restaurants based on reviews and the menu, and we were very disappointed with our experience at Buddy V's. When you walk in the atmosphere is very welcoming, dimly lit, guy playing the piano, and nice decor. That's where the nice experience ends. Once we sat down, our waiter tried to hard sell us on this wine that was clearly the wine the restaurant wanted the waiters to sell that night. We had to tell him "not interested" at least 3 times. I don't expect to get hassled and given the "hard sell" by our server at a really nice restaurant. The food we received tasted like it had been frozen and reheated. Definitely did not taste fresh. We started out with the Meatball appetizer. The meatballs had no "crispiness" to the outside. The sauce was thin and had no flavor.  My boyfriend got the Lasagna (which was supposed to be their signature dish), and I got the Pasta alla Vodka (normally very yummy if done right). The sauce with the Lasagna was runny and had no flavor. He even commented that the Lasagna I made at home tasted better than what he got at Buddy V's. As for my Pasta alla Vodka, the sauce was runny and had no flavor, the chicken was tough, and the pasta wasn't cooked enough. I went to an Italian food restaurant in Shenzhen China that had better Pasta alla Vodka. To top it off, the menu prices were $25+, which is kind of what you expect from Vegas, but I expect top quality food at that price, and especially from a celebrity chef. Do not eat here.

245Dq2sDXanq4QBmJ8JBjQ.text: This review is based truly on the service and not the food.  My husband and I ate here on 3/9/14 during Restaurant Week while visiting Las Vegas.  I would like to start off and say that we are lenient when it comes to services.  It is a very hard job and not everyone is cut out for the job and unfortunately Perry M. at Buddy V's is one of them.   Our evening started out with us walking up to the hostess station around 5:15 that Sunday evening.  We asked the two ladies if we could have a window table.  They stated it was going to be about 20 to 30 minutes.  We stated no problem that we will go to the bar and have a drink to please come over and get us when the table was ready.  They stated that was fine.  We ordered two drinks at the bar and about 20 minutes later we saw two tables being cleaned at the window area.  So my husband was paying close attention and before we knew it the hostess was taking up a couple that had just arrived.  Luckily a table was being cleared up behind them so my husband had to go grab the hostess to remind her of our table.  She then remembered we were waiting and sat us down.  Point being, if my husband wasn't keeping an eye out we would have lost those window seats we were waiting on.   Now on to our next adventure, we meet our waiter Perry M., he asked if we wanted water and we stated we did.  The assistant waiter came through and gave us bread and I stated thank you to him, but got no response back.  Perry then came back and got our food order.  The food came out as scheduled and was delivered by a young gentleman from the kitchen.  Our assistant waiter came by and gave us more bread and again I said Thank You with no response.  I come from the south and when someone says thank you, your response should be Your Welcome or My Pleasure.  To me this is plain rude.  Again, we are just holding our tongues in the whole situation.  My husband wanted another beer.  Ever since Perry ordered our food we never saw him again at the table to ask how everything was.  I told my husband to put the empty glass on the edge of the table maybe he will notice it and walla' he did.  My husband asked for another beer and he went on his way.  At this time our water glasses are now empty.  Well after 10 minutes still no beer has arrived at the table.  By this time the dessert has arrived and my husband and I are sharing a glass of water since we have not been refilled or asked if we wanted any.  Again, we are not saying anything.  We don't ask for much.  We know it is hectic sometimes doing this job.  We were going to let go not getting the beer, but we do like for our water to be filled up WITHOUT having to ask.  So we just asked for the bill and were just going to chalk it up to bad experience and not return.  Until our bill came, the first two charges are for the restaurant week special at 30.14 per person (which is correct).  Then two additional entrees where added and the kicker was he added the beer that never arrived.  Our total check should be in the range of 60+ change, but the total was 122.00.  So that is the point my husband lost it and grabbed the manager.   The manager that night was Sean Fiori whom assisted us.  We explained everything to him expect the experience with the hostess earlier.  We explained our experience with Perry M and his assistant.  We showed him the bill and he immediately apologized and said he will fix the bill and gave us an after dinner drink to make up for not getting the beer.  We are not people to complain.  We put up with a lot from waiters/waitress, but this was awful.  We are simple people and want to be acknowledged and respected and just fill up our drinks every now and then.  Literally he orders our food and gave us the messed up bill.  That was all and wants us to tip you on this service.  Don't get me wrong.  We had no problems with the food, but the service made this experience awful.  Hopefully he gets continued training or he needs to find another profession.

Bi4yxalOTFgE5XzS3BR7pQ.text: Great appetizers the calamari was exceptional with a good lemon flavor.....chicken parm was on point

H8bumfmijhnLructyFXT0g.text: I didn't have my phone with me last night. Forgot to check-in. Bf & I wanted to go to Trattoria but it was closed because they were expanding. So we ended coming here. And it turns out that it was Buddy's place! Cake boss!!! Awesome!! Wait time was an hour, we put our name down and went shopping around to kill time. We got sitted in front of the kitchen. It was awesome to see the cooks say "yes chef!" Decoration had whisk, bundt pans, and rolling pins hanging off the ceilings. Cool! Yelpers said the portions are big so bf and I decided to share. No splitting fee. We got the calamari and chicken Parm. The focaccia bread was warm, soft, and perfect. The dipping was olive oil & balsamic vinegar. It was well balanced. Our order was taking soo long. Then our waiter came back with the wrong order for our appetizer. He was so confused. We were confused. He goes back to the kitchen and we hear the head chef get angry and started to yell at the waiter. The manager comes to our table apologize and pays for our appetizer. Great service!! Finally our appetizer arrived! Our calamari was perfect. Lightly battered, soft, and the sauce was great! It wasn't chewy! I hate chewy calamari! Our entree chicken parm was perfect as well. Well seasoned, lightly battered, juicy, thin, and huge!! No room for dessert this time.Next time we will come back and try the dessert too!

W4OO3zQo_CYEoGSO5r23rA.text: The restaurant's web site shows that it opens at 11:00 a.m. That is incorrect. We arrived a bit after 11, and that, in and of itself, was a trial. Then, we waited...and waited. Finally, a bit after 11:30, the gate was rolled back. Second in line, we asked for a table by the windows (remember: empty restaurant). The er, um, "hostest" told us that THOSE seats were only for groups of 6 or more. By the time we left, 3 of those tables were occupied (out of about 10), all with parties of 4 or less.  Our waitstaff was attentive, as was the person who filled the water glasses and actually brought out the food. Both orders had been left under a heat lamp too long, and the one order, a pizza, was less than warm. The other order had much to be improved. We will not be returning, nor will we suggest it to out of town guests.

TWThb_hqHRUwA2m42YnnhA.text: We went to Buddy V's for a late lunch around 2:30. The restaurant was less than half full, plenty of seating, no wait. There were 4 of us, with two more on the way. The not so pleasant manager said they do not sit incomplete parties...are you joking, there were so many open tables!! We said we'd like to be seated to order drinks, they refused. So we waited a few minutes, went back up to the host stand asked if they really couldn't seat us with all the open tables, it seemed a little ridiculous.  Still a very rude no. We left went to another Venetian Italian restaurant, got seated right away.  Will never go back, horrible service. I understand if your busy, but they weren't, just very rude and unaccomadating.

W2YK-p3h_SXxf_bPdk8Bjw.text: Very disappointed!!!! We came here for my sister-in-laws birthday dinner and with all the great reviews we thought it would be a great experience but boy was I wrong. We got seated pretty quickly without a reservation so it did start off good. We placed our drink order and thats when it all went wrong. We got our drinks but after that did not see our server for 20 min even after asking other workers for him and that we were ready to order. He finally came back and we placed our order. Our appetizers came first and after finishing they cleared the table completely taking all napkins and utensils. The food finally arrived to the table and we all were starving but couldn't start eating because we did not have any utensils to eat with. After asking for our waiter and waiting another 15 minutes and having our food get cold we finally got our waiter and he grabbed the utensils. Finally we told them it was my sister-in-laws birthday so they brought out a cake which was not that good and we sang to her. We then received the check and they charged us $10 for the cake we didn't even eat. Definitely will not be going again.

yOIYMvFhD_PucthsNyx6Zw.text: Looking back at this experience, I'm actually angry. Maybe it deserves a 2, but this is the worst experience I've had on strip, I expected much better. I feel used, dirty. We had a party of 8, 4 couples. I brought 2 bottles of wine (tempranillo and a cab/syrah) intending to pay the corkage fee, which turned out to be $35 (highest I've ever encountered). The waiter said that since we were Seahawks fans and he was too (night before the super bowl) he would waive one of the fees if we tipped him more, more or less, even though he'd rather see us enjoy an Italian wine with dinner.  After examining the wine list we opted for the ones I brought. The waiter also informed us that since we were a big party we should take advantage of an "appetizer platter" for us all to share, meats, cheeses and salad, sold to us as a family style Italian sharing experience. We talked it over and all agreed it sounded good. Then we ordered our entrees, 1 couple opted to split the ravioli, my boyfriend ordered the lasagna and I planned on ordering the small margherita pizza so we could share. When I tried to order my margherita the waiter told me it was really small, just an appetizer, I told him I wanted small because I wasn't terribly hungry and didn't want leftovers, he insisted I should get the chicken alla vodka because they had just won an award for it, I asked if it was small, he said "oh yes, very small" and gestured with his hands. I caved, and ordered it, after all, I do love pasta and vodka sauce.  Appetizers came shortly after, 2 different salads, 2 meat/cheese/bread platters, calamari, and the meatballs (6). It was all ok, nothing spectacular, but one of the salads was pretty good (it had arugula, yum), and the meatballs were pretty good (nothing compared to Casa di Amore's off-strip though). The entrees came and my pasta was huge (bigger than he implied at least, average dish size for most restaurants though). My noodles were undercooked and the chicken was incredibly dry, sauce was decent, but not enough to make the chicken palatable.  I gave away most of my dish to the couple who split the ravioli, as they were pretty underwhelmed with theirs too, and thought mine was a slight improvement. I took one ravioli in exchange and nibbled my boyfriend's lasagna which was actually pretty amazing (in comparison), meanwhile kicking myself that I didn't just stick with the pizza.  The check came, north of $400, turns out the appetizers were all billed separately, so we should have just ordered what we wanted to begin with.  Looking back I'm convinced that the waiter only wanted me to have the more expensive entree, not the one I'd be happy with, and it angers me that he wouldn't just take my order as I intended. I suppose I've learned my lesson, stay away from gimmicky strip restaurants, stick to your guns, and recognize the upselling. What a swindle, this waiter put used car salesmen to shame, I've never felt more used after a dining experience, and the food was mediocre at best. I'm pretty sure he wasn't really a Seahawks fan either. Buyer beware. We'll stick with Casa in the future.

dkZRS5KLYWvYBLxBJiXcoA.text: Absolutely awful customer service by the manager here. He treated me very poorly when I spoke with him about our server (who was wonderful). He accused me of taking a bribe from the server to give him a compliment. I'm highly disappointed.

TgU1-GCzBTEDEy5yEYTVIQ.text: We went with the family of seven and wanted to pay separate bills. For some reason we were told we could not do this and had to put everything all on one bill. Imagine The fun at the end of the night of trying to divide everybody's dinner and then pay separately. But then being told that you can either pay on the all-cash or only on a credit card. thank God we had an accountant with us who could figure out each individual bill and tip. Dinner was very good, my meat was overcooked which they took back and then replaced. I did think they would have discounted my dinner a little bit since I did not get to eat with everybody, however they did not; but I guess it was OK because the food was good. We had two people that had birthdays, which we told them when they asked if it was a special occasion? At the end of the night they brought out two birthday desserts to share. The unfortunate part about this was that they charged us for these desserts which we thought were free since no one asked for anything! All in all the food was good, but the crazy bill rules and being charged for what we thought was a complimentary dessert on top of having my dinner late made it so that I probably wouldn't go back.

kA8cVv406spFlyFthA27jw.text: We came in for a early dinner around 4 pm. Excellent service today from our server Brittney.  She knew the menu and gave us good recommendations. All our orders were excellent. We had the Lisa warm Nutella cake for desert that was awesome!!

JrjscGMhXoo8C1mtI2UYTg.text: I have many food allergies and our waiter took great care in taking note of them. Then the manager came over and informed us that the chef would be making all of my food himself and fresh. They did an amazing job keeping me healthy and made me feel like a queen. They treated my 3 children like little kings and queens. Such a great experience!

WK6Vbl6NDcDYQ2UnfeHEuQ.text: Great atmosphere!! The waitress, Deanna was awesome. She was very helpful, gave a great recommendation for what we were hungry for and kept our glasses full.  The piano and band were very good in the background adding to the ambiance. We definitely recommend this place to anyone. Prices were fantastic compared to other places we ate at. We will be back for sure!  Thanks Deanna for making it a successful dinner!!!

TKFB8_6QrbflOUjtc4-vdg.text: We had our holiday luncheon there this past week. It was a hit with all of us. Bryan Forgionne,the executive chef, is incredible. My boss has not stopped talking about the good food and service.  I highly recommend checking it out.

jqQ1sqJ_HHLqo_MMsxd1Vw.text: Second time going to Buddy's this year. Both times the food and service were great. Went for lunch and the menu isn't huge but the meals were great. Had their meatball sub (meatballs were great!) and their chicken sandwich and we really liked both. Finished it off with a cannoli - lets just say you can tell why he's famous for his cannolis.

qv659KXFOCeV7oYB5aPkAQ.text: We had dinner here last night. The food was excellent and the service was out of this world. Our server was prompt, courteous, and funny. Our drinks, appetizers and entrees were out quick and piping hot. Lots of attention to detail. Overall a great experience!

IdhfVQDRwe7Jp-EKPGX0Bw.text: Wow, we loved everything we ate here! The lasagna was the perfect balance of cheeses, sausage, pork, and tomato sauce. The chopped vegetable salad was loaded with veggies and garbanzos and perfectly dressed. Don't even let me get started on the heavenly meatballs. I just kept eating even after I was full because I rarely get food this good. Thank you, Buddy!

8CtLxDQ2g7TfpW7Wmd3Q8w.text: Great Italian food with an awesome view! It is super cool even going into the restaurant, the ambience is like no other and the decor is perfect. Fun, loud environment, but still good for a date. Made a reservation last minute and they had no problem taking us early when we arrived. Good service, good food. Will be back!

aQJhJxv1pZTcaebBjD0pcQ.text: Surprisingly fantastic.  I was skeptical since Buddy is not only a TV chef, but one known for cakes and pastries.  I'm glad I gave this place a try though.  It was fantastic.  The food was well above average, and greatly helped by more than reasonable pricing.  Generous portions too.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  I'm hard-pressed to think of a better meal on the strip that's in at-all the same price range (dinner for two came to under $100)

MHIYhbwFMQ161wzvqN0X2g.text: I had a cesar salad and chicken marsala, and it was so delicious. The sald was fresh and the croutons were homemade. The chicken marsala was the best I have ever tried. It was so flavorful and perfect!

t12yDeieZC78I_dy6tM0dQ.text: Casual family friendly restaurant in the Venetian. My husband is a huge fan of Cake Boss, so we had to stop here and Carlos's bakery when in town.  No reservations were needed for lunch and there are many tables. Casual Italian fare of sandwiches, pastas, and some meat dishes. We shared the eggplant starter and each had one of the sandwiches for lunch. The eggplant was okay - presentation was on the sloppy side though. My BLT was nicely presented with grill marks on the bread. Service seemed a bit forced and over cheerful. Food was a little slow to arrive given that it wasn't particularly busy when we arrived.  Overall a-ok but there are much better spots in town for mid-range pricing. The main plus is that it's family friendly if you have kids in tow.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sandwiches, side Caesar salad and fries
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parmigiana starter

2zITs99v823CRHl5j5JgjA.text: There should be a six star option for this place. Buddy V's knocks it out of the park every time we come here. We are locals and have eaten our way in and out of Vegas. This is our favorite Italian place.(Carmines is a close second) I know how subjective peoples tastes are, but this restaurant is an absolute treat for me and the cost to quantity to quality to service ratio is fantastic. I think that means lots of great food that is reasonably priced with friendly and efficient service. But be warned. If you order the veal chop parm and eat the whole thing, you'll need a wheelchair to get around.

IdM0vakveLwOGQ0SsBTx7A.text: The Mac and cheese appetizer and the free focaccia bread was the only good part of our meal. Service was awful from the moment we checked in for our reservation. The front desk staff were not friendly and it took forever to get our food, so much so our waiter caught us staring down the kitchen and she finally checked for us. The carbonara pasta was not flavorful, and there was no pancetta as advertised. It had no flavor. The worst feeling is leaving a place where you spent $50+ per person and felt like you could make it better yourself at home. Very disappointing, Buddy.

oWBPhoCPYtOLGa8jb_X6UQ.text: Went here for the Nutella cake. Common with the cake boss reviews you have to try it.  The cake was amazing with a nice hot interior and fresh taste.  This is a cake that kills every dessert that I have had.    Wonderful melt in your mouth sugar high.  Is this heaven ?

8vusY-FrPthgj_K4rZA3pw.text: It was good. I saw this place on the hotel eats channel and ever since then, I've wanted to go.  The decor was cool. They're trying to make you feel like you're in your Italian grandma's house on a day where the kitchen is pumping out homemade lasagna. They definitely succeeded in this respect.  I only gave it four stars because the food is just good, not great. Very good ambience and service, but very average Italian food.

XCzBhRnWCmvR4f5YW5OWgA.text: We paid more and less in Vegas, but Buddy's was the best.  The "Parm" was a cheesy dream, The grilled salmon was cooked perfectly.  I guess it is the simple combination of the best ingredients with the presentation skills and technical excellence of a master baker that makes it so good.  This was the only restaurant we visited on or near the strip that didn't seem to be charging a location premium.  It was not inexpensive, but it was reasonable.  Oh-ya, save room for desert OMG!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uzBU-V2sbMQFgT6dXnX2Fg.text: Disappointed. Went in for Happy Hour. Sat down and waited. No one approached for almost 10 minutes and then only to tell us us the table we were at wasn't for Happy Hour. We moved to the bar and sat for another ten minutes. Bartender was not around when he did come into view, He never looked our way ignoring us completely. We finally gave up and left. It wasn't that busy to not even be acknowledged! Too bad!

J4ShYn0YjXyJRxO1AV8EGQ.text: Came here on a Saturday evening and was able to get a table pretty quick by sitting in the bar area. Eggplant parm and spaghetti and meatballs were both excellent, lots of seasoning, tons of flavor. Service was great, very polite and friendly wait staff. Will absolutely go again next time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parm appetizer, perfect combo of crunchy breading, melty cheese, and eggplant. Very yummy.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs, spaghetti cooked perfectly, great flavor in the sauce and meatballs.

jh_mH8WAYZNr2aFPzyH_ow.text: We had a really great experience at this restaurant. The food was great. Service was great and fast. Love the polenta croutons for the salad. Hope to eat here again.

RPXFulfGkI4hC_yxCqq4eA.text: By far the best spaghetti I've ever had.  I'm from a place where we don't have many options regarding Italian food SO I have not gotten away from large franchise Italian restaurants much, but this is the best.

UN7sZquiYP4dm9ru0UkaQg.text: This is such a great restaurant and I highly recommend this restaurant. I had a lot of food and the stomach pain from so much food was totally worth it. This restaurant has great service and the breadsticks were the bomb. Furthermore, the meatballs were fat juicy spheres of goodness. . Also their cannolis give me life. I hope you enjoyed this review as much as you will enjoy this restaurant assuming you really liked this review.   #foodislifesoyeeeet

gFmzCQ4Hb1ft7hsVfVw_8g.text: Definitely not worth the hype. We got calamari for an appetizer which was really good. But as for our main dishes the food was okay nothing special. Definitely needs to have more flavor and spices. We got the cannoli for desert and it was awful. The service was attentive and friendly. Wouldn't come back though.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

viQPegu1U2lA-awdaRqL6g.text: I'm a NY Italian living in Las Vegas. Most of the time I find it difficult to find great tasting Italian food like I've been accustomed to eating. My husband and I decided to try Buddy's for Easter dinner today. We started with the calamari which was perfectly fried. I usually prefer red sauce with mine, however, the sauce that came with it was really good. The slices of fried peppers were also a nice touch. For dinner I order the lasagna. It was so delicious and had a lot of great meats in it. I ended up bringing more than half of it home. My husband ordered the chicken parm which came with two large chicken breasts. We each had an iced tea and our bill was $80 and change. We skipped dessert and went across the way to Carlo's

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nonna &#39;s Lasagna Al Forno
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari after we had already started eating
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan

e4gb3ywTGMZElGggJXC_nQ.text: The cheese ravioli was good. Service wasn't great. Our server Peter J seemed pretty put out by us being there. Never got the Pepsi I ordered. He catered to the other tables and made us feel very unwelcome.

jQ9jtzP1AJnh2kBWQmqt6A.text: My wife and I wanted to see if Buddy V's cooking lived up to its hype, so instead of taking a trip to Jersey, we decided to stop in to his Vegas location. We went on a Sunday morning (the morning of the Route 91) massacre.    We ordered the brunch buffet (about $35 per person, all you can eat, including pastries), which gave us a large variety of meats, salads, veggies, appetizers, pastas, soups, and of course, pastries. I can't say that this was the best Italian food I've ever had, nor can I say the pastries were phenomenal, but everything was authentic and tasted good. The meatballs definitely lived up to the hyped up reviews. I even enjoyed the "peel your own" shrimp.   Price was decent, considering it was owned by the world famous Buddy V. There was also a live band that played in the bar area, creating a really nice atmosphere.

d-d9r8SZvz10rx80N3B_9g.text: Bad experience for a celebrity restaurant.  My wife loved the cake boss show and she wanted to try buddies restaurant.    There was HAIR in my food (gross) and the manager gave me some stupid excuse about the company that services the napkins "whatever".  Waiter was nice, manager was not pleasant in-fact dismissive about hair in my food.    Buddy V "Cake Boss" well-known household name, good reputation in the food/restaurant industry and positioned  as high profile fine dining restaurant at The Venetian in Las Vegas. The experience was all but excellent: HAIR discovered in my food (GROSS!) and poor presentation of product (plates were extremely worn).

U0hK8_bM7E0Jcow-Plzp_Q.text: Sitting at the bar eating right now. Chris is fantastic. I wasn't really hungry but needed to eat. She recommended a half serving of pasta and side salad - neither if which I saw on the menu. It was PERFECT! Exactly what I wanted. Salad had warm polenta croutons. Delish. I had the bucatini and added chicken. The chicken was cooked fresh and did not feel like an add on. I'm thrilled I decided to eat here. Thank you Chris for the great recommendations!

EgDxQb-xRBNvGwp1q795_Q.text: Our service was excellent! Nice, friendly, and attentive server and busser. The drinks were also great. I enjoyed the carbonara mac and cheese and caprese very much. The buddy pizza was just okay.

0FuMZ9Ar35zOLvdUvCWeTQ.text: Sunday Gravy was AMAZING!!!!.  I have had many excellent dishes at this restuarant but this was by far the best thing I have ever eaten.  Being Italian I don't understand the review that said if you want authentic Italian don't go here.....that person does not know Italian food at its best.  The Cannoli is amazing and I don't know what he is talking about.

nhCcBa1ZcW0q88qllXqfCg.text: Great place to go. Had some awesome hh specials food is great and the bar staff was super friendly. Not too expensive. Second visit and both times it was great

tnRuT-wsaS0qxbT3oM8L1g.text: We made reservations for 9pm we ran a bit late but ended up nabbing a great booth facing the main street. The servers are prompt and polite, we had very delish bloody mary's (mine was virgin) really flavourful. My date had the chicken parm, he described it as cooked perfectly. I had mama's chicken holy smokes! Juicy and bursting with a medley of flavours. Loved the restaurant, a definite highlight. I look forward to the next trip.

fMe7jGnAhLhleLUbx9tWTg.text: Had a fabulous evening at Buddy V's last night. Sat in the bar with my husband and enjoyed the meatballs, caprese salad, shrimp scampi pasta and lasagna. We got all the food at once so we could have a little bit of everything at once.  Everything was cooked to perfection and OMG the mozzarella was amazing.  Definitely worth a visit if you like Italian cooking!

BLYuom6xwKf-pOmvZKeL8w.text: If you are in Vegas you HAVE to come here. The food here can not be beat. The best meatballs in the world as an appetizer!! The chicken Marsala is to die for, and the Nutella chocolate cake made me speechless. The prices are reasonable as well.

1yZf1QhVuec53rT8z0KVqA.text: We went back this morning for Sunday brunch and it was good. Not great but good. It was lacking in variety. The Mac and Cheese was yummy, as was the hot pasta salad. There was a small selection of cut meats and cheeses and some tasty meatballs and my husband was thrilled with the carving area. But the crepes weren't very good (no matter how much Nutella I loaded on) and the blueberry muffins and chocolate croissant were dry and tasteless.

f8gjeomDn5gDxQtdlzn1pQ.text: Classic Italian dishes. The benefit of this Italian restaurant is that in Vegas everything is expensive and this spot is reasonably prices.  They do not serve oversized portions so when you order do not prepare to get a giant plate that you can split.  Each person will need their own dish, but you won't really take leftovers with you unless you are staying at the Venetian anyways so it is perfect.  Priced and portioned well.

AkfTBPI4GnvlbiC-6toIww.text: Was there with family last night, the food was even better than the 1st time we were there.  I booked a reservation on open table & requested a view for my visiting cousins; they gave us a beautiful booth with an amazing view of the Spring Mtn corner. I can't speak highly enough of the server & buser...so on the ball that we never had to ask for ANYTHING!  My cousins LOVED the experience; not just the food...it was a great night:)

3sxqtfhxMe3XfmIUWVGBzw.text: The wife and the children enjoyed this place. The ambience is chill with an open kitchen. Right across from it is Buddy V's bakery but didn't get a chance to try their pastries. The food was good. We ordered the calamari which is a very generous portion. It was fresh and tasty. The kids enjoyed their pizza and we ate the spaghetti bolognese. The sauce was to die for. For desert the Nutella cake with caramel salted ice cream was the finisher and we were in heaven. We went twice in 4 days. That should say something considering the options in Vegas.

gZLp2w2fp6VTmQoId6r3mA.text: We are Cake Boss fans, so we enjoyed this restaurant. We had a half hour wait on a Thursday night, not too bad. Good kids menu & a pretty good selection of Carlo's Bakery desserts.  Probably the best meal we had in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato basil soup was excellent.

sx3TYtzgHZgUJdTkYTdMzQ.text: I've been here twice now, but didn't review the first time 2 years ago.  Now 2 years on taking another family trip (2 adults, 2 kids) we wanted to try this place again as we had such a great experience the first time.  Thought this place would be a big disappointment and all hype due to him being a TV personality. But food is amazing and even better, the price is right!  Highly recommend if you want good Italian on the Strip.

qLkW4KZls000RonKG3Q-6A.text: 4 stars for food  I had the Chicken Parm/Garlic Bread/Caesar salad  2 stars for service  20 minute wait so we sat at the bar...big mistake, I think they forgot about us or didn't have enough staff  Needless to say, worth stopping in!

xRFNfnT8lzHDYwFGQDJkEg.text: Brunch Review: fresh, delicious, attentive staff.. Even the strawberry lemonade was freshly made by the bar and taste amazing, not too sweet -added perk it comes in a keepsake glass.. HIGHLIGHT OF THE DAY!! Buddy Valastro walks in mid brunch and says hello to everyone, and takes pictures with us.. Very sweet and humble!

ja4FCjZ2paCmtkAdRayJJA.text: Amazing service and even better food.  Went there with a large wedding party.  If you like Italian, and even if you don't, this is the best restaurant in town.

aOqVrUy7pxsB1zZzhDPS5g.text: The dessert was delicious! My chicken rigatoni was raw. The chicken was chewy so I cut all the pieces and sure enough it was pink! Super disappointed. The pasta wasn't bad at all...a little salty for my taste. The chicken Piccata was cooked nicely. The cannoli was very good. The cheesecake was amazing!!! The manager took care of us...free dessert. We will go back for dessert and a no-chicken dish :)

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese with Spiced Pumpkin cake! Delicious!!!!!!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli

GDKhDk6f2UnuEC27Eo9cZQ.text: Buddy Vs is actually right outside the Palazzo parking garage. If you park in the Venetian parking garage you have a LONG way to walk.  Excellent service and the food is just amazing--best Caesar Salad ever--however the noise level is off the charts---is extremely loud in the restaurant - we were there at 9pm and wasn't even full but seated across from someone you had to yell to be heard.  Overall great restaurant.

diw6IBslwWIJBaJ-3CLq0A.text: By far the worst sevice i have ever had in a restaurant.  We had a party of 6 sit down for dinner and a birthday celebration.   No bread no  water for 20 minutes oue appetizers were ordered and another 30 minutes for those.  Do even get me started on how long for the entrees to arrive.   Horrible, horrible sevice.  Another couple got up and left after similar poor service.  Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to eat in Vegas!

NEtegOZghQxF4bajZHYeeg.text: Took the family for lunch as a Christmas treat. Service was good, especially friendly even with three small children including accommodating special requests. We tried the calamari, meatballs, Hoboken chopped salad, carbonara, kids Mac and Cheese and pizza. For dessert we had cannoli, nutella chocolate cake and Cheese & Cake. First, the Nutella Cake is insanely amazing! Everything else was very good as well. Honestly their kids Mac and Cheese was one of all our favorites! It should be available for adults. The meatballs were prefect. Loved the flavor combination of the chopped salad but my 19 year old daughter who likes things simple, thought it was too much. The cheese & Cake, a take on cheesecake was good not super sweet but definitely not the top choice of the three we got.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara, meatballs, pizza and calamari
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts - cannoli, nutella and cheesecake

5ldjoNBSnEvd_o7_XejIiw.text: The wait staff service was great. Hostesses were unfriendly. Food was very bland. The caesar salad was good, but the croutons were terribly weird sponges. Between my husband and I, we had a Caesar salad, a meatball sandwich, and pasta bolognese...the meat sauce was bland, making both the pasta and the sandwich a bore. Another downfall, no fresh bread was served, but instead there were packaged crunchy "bread" sticks sitting on the table. Although the location is conveniently located in the middle of everything and the decor cute, the actual food was a disappointment and the cost even more so (+$50 for our 3 item meal!) We will not return.

M-JH981gFcZwCrt5J4PKgQ.text: The bone in veal Parmesan chop gave me my ENTIRE life! I'm salivating just thinking about how delicious it was. And, the garlic cheese bread - yummy! We also ordered the lasagna. We were hold they won an award for Best lasagna in Vegas. I'm not a big lasagna person, but I'll take their word on it.  The service was absolutely top notch from checkin with the hostess and our server, all the way to the two managers that stopped by our table. We were lucky to be seated at a table with the most spectacular view of the strip.   The entire vibe of Buddy V's is just perfection. It's Italian themed with modern contemporary flair. The open bar area with views of the strip impressed me, as did Buddy's music playlist. I found myself using Shazam on many selections. Soulful sounds from Izzy Bizu and Alice Russell to Hiatus Kiayote and Conya Doss permeated throughout the restaurant. This really added to the already wonderful Expedia we were having.  This place definitely deserves five solid stars. I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy Garlic Bread:)
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table

ypqyNehSVQjD0CUzm0J_6A.text: Our second visit to Buddy V's this trip to Vegas. Had a small Caesar salad which was very tasty. They do half portions of their salads. The wife had veal marsala and I had the chicken Parmesan. The chicken Parmesan was excellent my wife thoroughly enjoyed her veal marsala. We were seated near the kitchen with the plates banging, people taking and overhead music it got loud. There were two portions of the chicken Parmesan one was stacked on top of the other. Along with the spaghetti that accompanied the chicken I walked away full.   On the first is it to Buddy V's I had the New York strip and my wife had a salad. The New York strip with seasoned really well I thoroughly enjoyed it. I couldn't wait to bite into it I forgot to take a photo of it but it was it was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. There are actually two portions of chicken piled on each other.

sAuxPcTz_xfJLRBFHHbtWQ.text: I love the "outdoor" tables with the traditionally Italian red and white checkered tablecloths!  The plate portions were good, the food delicious, especially the Chicken Piccata, and the Calamari appetizer.   Knocked 1 star off for the sangria carafe: it barely filled 4 half cups.  Don't bother with it. The service was also on point.  I really enjoyed my meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Piccata
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uchx-dgqX7uZnHBNZqbpTg.text: Buddy V's is conveniently located across from Carlo's Bakery in the Venetian Shops.  Buddy's takes reservations and they seat you pretty quickly.  The restaurant is nice although it's a little on the dark side at night and a little loud.    I've had the Eggplant Parmigiana and the Chicken Marsala a few times.  The Eggplant Parm is served as an appetizer but it's enough for a meal.  It's good.  I love the Chicken Marsala here.  It's flavorful and tender.  A lot of places don't get Chicken Marsala right but Buddy's does.  My husband gets his usual, Chicken Parmigiana and he likes it.  Service is friendly and really awesome.  Next time, I'd like to try their Happy Hour.    Overall, a great place to get an Italian meal in Vegas.

vzJAXVfmdRJaefqewqr53Q.text: LOVED this restaurant so much that we're going back for a second time on this extended trip to Vegas! I can't wait because their Bucatini Carbonara is now something I'll be dreaming about forever and attempting to replicate at home.   My husband ordered from the Prix Fixe menu which is $40 per person. He chose the Grandma's Meatballs (which were just okay, sorry Grandma!), the Orecchiette & Italian Sausage (amazing!!!), and since he didn't like any of the dessert choices (either cannoli or tiramisu), our waitress asked the manager if he could substitute in another dessert, and she said yes, for an additional $4. So he ordered the bread pudding for after dinner (pretty good, but extremely filling, so it's more of a shareable dish and I mean for more than 2 people lol). All in all, it could be a pretty good deal, because it shaves a few $'s off of a dessert, if you were planning to get one. We personally wouldn't order from this menu next time, because we simply don't need the dessert after such a satisfying dinner.   For weeks, I had been planning on coming to this restaurant, so I already knew that I would get the Carbonara and it certainly did not disappoint! Based off of a recommendation, I added crumbled Italian sausage and it was all spectacular.    We came in for dinner on a Friday night and made a reservation for 7:15 just in case it was super busy. We arrived early so we sat at the bar and our bartender, Chris, was super friendly and cool. She even went to check on our table for us and told us that it was ready whenever we were! This was easily my favorite restaurant to try over this almost 2-week stay in the Vegas area.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orecchiette &amp; Italian Sausage
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Dad&#39;s Bucatini Carbonara with crumbled Italian sausage

o5Ulnf0riY0zrATLWf9FEQ.text: We were at the Venetian and decided to stop by for some good Italian food. We figured, since this restaurant was in the Venetian it would be awesome. First off, we were seated by an awesome guy who was very polite. He took our drink order right away and even went over the menu with us. That's where the awesomeness stopped. It took FOREVER for our waitress Valerie to come take our order. When she finally got there, it seemed like she had better things to do. She took the entire order at once down to the desert.  By the time our Ceasar salads came out, we still had not gotten our appetizer. At this time, another couple was seated next to us. There order was taken promptly and there appetizers and entrees came out before ours did. Valerie did not check on our table once. The guy that seated us came back to refill our drinks and give us our appetizer. By this time, the couple next to us had gotten there entrees and were eating already. After about 10 more minutes, we recieved ours.  Now to the food. I ordered the chicken parmigiana. The chicken was over done and dry. The spaghetti was the best part of the entree, but had a strong marinara taste and lack of seasoning. It tasted like a pizza sauce. When we finished, Valarie came back to get our desert order even though we had already given it to her when she decided to get our entire order up front. The tiramisu was good, and the best part of the meal.  We finished our desert and waited another 20 minutes for our check. We decided to pay cash so we wouldnt have to wait for our inattentive waitress any longer. Overall, the people who were seated after us came, ate, and left before we were able to get out of there. A mediocre dinner took about an hour and forty five minutes and was ridiculous. The innatentiveness and lack of service is the reason for the two star review. We probably will go somewhere else next time we are in the mood for Italian.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm

o2tRET8FYWw34quC1O76HA.text: First off, you've got to dine here! This place knocked me off my feet. I was not expecting the quality of food, service, and ambiance here. I felt very taken care of from the moment we checked-in for our reservation til the moment we left.   This is amazing Italian food that reminds me of family dinners. It feels like it's made with love and care. I got the pre fix dinner. The meatballs were to die for! Everyone was right about these! I shared a Caesar salad and those polenta coupons are some of the tastiest bites I've had of polenta. For my entree I did the chicken parm. The portions are huge and every bite got better and better. Vibrant flavors and fresh ingredients. The presentation was also lovely! I finished off my three course meal with a coffee and a cannoli. Oh wow was I surprised at that cannoli! If you're a coffee drinker I highly suggest pairing it with your dessert.   If you get there early enough in the week, the happy hour looked amazing! Happy hour is only in the bar area though. So make sure you know the hours and ask for happy hour seating.   Our server Andre was excellent in helping us out and was very attentive. The server who helped with waters was always on point and we never went without. So so wonderful!   I'll be back when I'm in town again!
