rms2LT4HXKUOQeuheSa5Jg.text: Slow service, terrible attitude by several of the staff. Our group of 10 arrived on time for our reservation & stated we needed to be out within a reasonable time to attend another booking. Well the opposite happened. Drinks, bread, salads, food all came out as slow as molasses! I mean HOURS! We had to practically BEG the kitchen to get our meal. The worst part was when we complained we were met with extreme condemnation by one of the managers. The saving grace was another the manager who took $ off bill & apologized. We missed our show. My advice skip this restaurant there are so many others to choose from. Seriously SKIP this place!!!!

-YwwRTGeyg5qFj58ocfcgQ.text: Wow - I went to this place 3 months ago and I'm still thinking about it.  A group of friends went for a birthday celebration and ordered the special - meatballs, a drink, and dessert.  The meatballs were incredible.  The cannoli was the best I've ever had,  I can't wait to go back.

vTWtUaKtv1IZ5L6Pw9AKCA.text: Georgio made our night! My daughter & I came in for dinner after a very long day of travel and then touring around Vegas. There's no way he could have known the trauma we had been through in the few days leading up to eating here (my older daughter passed out and suffered facial trauma the day before she was to leave for camp. Instead of her traveling on the charter bus from Texas, my younger daughter & I flew her in and drove her the 4.5 hours one way to camp). From the moment we sat down (to a spectacular view), Georgio treated us as if we were family. The food was more than spectacular & so was the service. We left the restaurant on cloud nine. We will definitely be making a special trip back to Vegas just to eat here & see Georgio again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Pasta (most tender lobster ever)

Hki1JXJPqK0msXlA_hisMA.text: Went to dinner with friends here last night. My second time dining here. I had the chicken Marsala. Best I've ever had. My boyfriend got the sea bass. Both were very tasty. Very attentive server. I didn't catch his name. Food arrived in a timely manner. Shared the butterscotch creme brulee for dessert. I don't dine here often because it's pricey. However I highly recommend dining here. Will fine here again!Everything is A+

jJbx313DD5Btvu-69XOcIA.text: I came to Buddy V's for dinner during my girlfriends bachelorette. It started off a little rough. Mostly bc my best friend is very picky and wants what she wants. When she didn't get the table she wanted she was pretty dramatic about it. But, it was her bachelorette weekend. The manager took over and was absolutely amazing. Not only gave her the table she wanted, but was just overall awesome. The food was also great and reasonably priced, especially for Vegas. And when we left we felt like we had a family at Buddy V's . Great deceive and great food.

txLtGOKkOkHKDPCAfao0cA.text: I like spaghetti and all but italian food isn't my go-to meal. We were at the Venetian to ride the gandolas so we decided to stay for dinner. The wait was a bit long but there's lots to look at in the area so we walked around for a bit and came back when our table was ready.  The restaurant is located right across of Carlo's bakery which is convenient.  Once seated, I noticed there were some plastic packages in a container on the table. I assumed it was a hand towel but it was actually a package of long thin breadsticks. I munched on this while waiting for our food. I had the spaghetti with shrimp. It was good, but not incredible. But again, I'm not the biggest italian food fanatic. I really loved the garlic bread we ordered though! The pieces were huge and delicious.  Side note: I have seen buddy's show so it was cool to be at his restaurant. We also went to his bakery earlier that day. The restaurant's hostess stand displays buddy's family photo album which I thought was a cute touch.

9shguE2S1w2iQPLqE1_f-A.text: Simply awesome. Best Italian food I have ever had so far. Must try. To top that off, servers were very pleasant and nice, even though they were really really busy.

wSaQdLSSkmmY-W82lGnMfQ.text: Great overall evening from the seating and service to the food itself. My wife and I each did the $40 meal that included choice of app, entree and desert. We eat a lot of Italian and I have to say this ranks as one of the best dinners I've ever had. Highly recommend for a great dining experience!

dD1hS6KCmIkH-l7tKdtyNQ.text: Despite all the fancy interiors, the food was not even close to what was reviewed by others. It's like the chef punched out early, and one of the waiters/waitress did the job. We ordered Caesar salad to begin with, it was the most salty Caesar salad I ever had in my life..then our pasta can, we were hoping the pasta can make it up. It just got worse, the pasta wasn't even fully cooked , some of them are still hard to chew, the chicken was so try that it's hard to finish, and the saucy, sorry, the white salty water in side of my pasta.... this makes me wonder how did they even get this man good reviews.. and the service was okay, just one of the receptionist didn't want to be there at all. I understand you might had long day, but you can't force me to compromise. At end of the day, I'm here for a service and food.

gmFYmwVnLq38LnN6LK-3xA.text: The service was very good. We had a reservation and showed up 10 min early and people were overstaying their time at their tables but the staff made it a priority to get us seated.   We ordered the garlic parmesan cheese bread and calamari for the appetizer. The bread had very little taste of garlic and was mostly just a cheese bread. The calamari was delicious and was nice and crispy, and I always go for the deep fried jalapeno pieces. For my main dish I ordered the salmon which was cooked perfectly and was light enough for me to leave room for the Italian birthday cake for dessert. The cake was nice and moist but it was very hard to eat for how it was served.

CuZChU5Rf_NnerGw980U4Q.text: We were visiting from Oklahoma City and were craving Italian food. The chicken piccata and chicken Parmesan were both excellent dishes and the service from our waitress was excellent. We moved to the bar as the restaurant was closing to watch the OKC thunder vs Golden state game as the restaurant was closing. The bartenders were pleased to serve us and did not rush us out and even provided complimentary water bottles to take with us for later in the night. I can't say enough great things about this place. You guys really set the time for our whole trip to be amazing!!! Hope we can come back

yrqGcjO-xH73AbdHBPNw2A.text: Super hungry from our long flight we stopped into Buddy's before checking into our hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed the smashed meatball hero and burger with Tuscan fries that hubby and I shared. The fries were quite amazing- crispy not oily with Parmesan cheese. They also serve fresh brewed iced tea which was very refreshing after our long trip!

0UkkgfDQmA7yB45dGEfY_w.text: Located in the Venetian, Buddy V's is one of our favorite restaurants in Vegas.  Aside from the fantastic cuisine, the live music is an absolute delight. (Great job, as always, Nicholas Cole!)  The Sunday brunch has a wonderful line up of Italian style dishes, complemented by bottomless Bloody Mary's.  Don't miss the salads and charcuterie area, and save room for their hand crafted desserts. (Buddy V is not the Cake Boss for nothing...) ;)

yiawvoCvhp2EZhPyZqrKTw.text: The food was amazing! My boyfriend and I split a Caesar salad and the carbonara dish. It was the perfect amount of food for us. The only downside is that sometimes it felt like our waiter forgot about us. He seemed overworked.

MIbZyXkQRDdy3S1OMeKx0g.text: Took our workers for a nice dinner after a long day at the tradeshow.  Make sure you reserve this place as lines can get long and you may have to wait a while.  Service is attentive from start to finish.  Food is very good for commercial grade restaurant with a celebrity endorsement.  Live music was very entertaining, playing all the oldies with a drummer and a singer/pianist.    Food wise, can't go wrong with anything you order here.  Everything is just fresh and piping hot.  Seafood is immaculate, meatball are succulent, desserts just melt your arteries and bread is bread.  Wine is expensive obviously but what do you expect.  I'd come back again to entertain guests or just grab a good italian food fit for a tradeshow attendee.  Their birthday cake is made out of diabetes so it's really good.

qQ6iQ5tb1Yc37o5WmybdWw.text: Good! Was it great? Was it the best Italian style dinner that I've ever had? Was it worth $100 with tip (no booze) for two? No. No and no.  BUT it was good.  It just mostly  fell very short on the service and overall feel of the place.  We were seated off the bar area,  near a window looking out at Senor Frogs - not really the vibe we were going for.  There seemed to be a cozier dining area and one more suitable for a couple celebrating an anniversary- which was disclosed in the open table app. The bus staff was clumsy and inattentive. Our sever lacked even forced sincerity.  Whoever brought our food was hurried and had no idea who ordered what. That's just not okay service at this price point.  It's just not.    So yes, service was insincere and inexperienced. We would have liked to ask for more bread, but our bread plates and oil were whisked away before we could even think that we might want more than a small square of the delicious bread!  Appetizers came out very fast - the caprese salad was fresh and delicious! It was beautifully season with gorgeous cracked pepper.  That grilled bread was a touch too charred for me, but absolutely edible and tasty.  The meatballs - generous portion and good! The best ever - no! We enjoyed them though.   My husband went with the scampi and it was very good, nice complex, yet subtle in flavor - the winner of our entrees.  I went with the orecchiette and sausage - the description reminded me of a favorite dish of mine - and while it was good - it wasn't anything extraordinary.  I adore a simple, comfort dishes and sure, it was good, but it missed the mark by being a touch too dry.  The roasted tomatoes were absolutely a definite star of the dish.  It just needed a little something to pull it together. I had to work hard to make a perfect bite each time I stuck my fork in the dish.  I don't want to have to work that hard for a $20+ dish of pasta.  I want the last bite to be as delicious as the first.    For the price point of everything - Vegas considered - I expected there to be a much larger degree of wow here.  It was all good, fresh, well portioned - but it was nothing over the top extraordinary and service and seating and overall feel of the place - at least where we were seated -left so much to be desired.  I know next to nothing on the celebrity chef here - it was the Yelp reviews that drew us in and I'm feeling a bit misled.    Note to restaurant- treat every table like it's the first time a couple has been able to celebrate a kid-free anniversary getaway in seven years.

ida0pCdCrJeN_89OGVQFAQ.text: Was brought by my wife as a surprise while in Vegas.  It was great dinner date night setting.  Its got a classic casual Italian and high end experience all wrapped up in one place.  Overall the place seemed to accommodate a good mix of family friendly atmosphere while still being nice enough for a one on one date night.  The menu is a mix of dishes all with a family vibe.  We started with Aunt Nina's Mozzarella En Carozza which was good.  The breading was a little flaky made it slightly less easy to handle, but was overall good.  Would have probably tried something else in retrospect, but it wasn't bad by any means.  I had My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara which is one of my go to Italian dishes.  Immediately jumped off the menu at me as was as fantastic as I can recall as I've had anywhere else.  The ingredients tasted freshly prepared and the pasta was delicious.  I would have this any day and be completely satisfied.  At the end they brought out a Cannoli as a nice birthday surprise which we didn't ask for, but was welcomed and eaten down to the last bite.  If you like desserts and Cannoli's then this is a must for you.  My only slight downgrade is for a Vegas vibe.  It feels a bit like a mall/casino setting from the outside, but that's what you're going to get in Vegas so you should really expect that instead of a small time / local place you may get in other cities.   If you placed this restaurant anywhere outside of the Vegas strip and I may be inclined for a 5 star experience, but it was nothing to significantly detract from the overall experience.

cFqXeAbSwDlC46_PKjx_fw.text: The food is good and the waitress was very friendly.  The clam pasta was really good. I couldn't finish the whole pasta because of the portion. It's a little bit hard to find in the Venetian because Venetian is huge and they are a little bit away from the rest of the restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y9GhIzjfR88SIuHPQTwl1A.text: Hands down, one of the best meals we've had in Vegas! Our waiter, Giorgio, from Sicily, was fabulous. He recommended "family style " for the 4 of us and we were not disappointed! Giorgio and his team of servers were very attentive and fun besides! Food was amazing! Calamari, meatballs, and a salad to die for..... followed by 4 different entrees. Sea bass, steak, chicken, shrimp! To top it off a plate full of desserts to share! Giorgio even bought us a bottle of wine! ( after we finished our 2) Fantastic! Don't miss this great restaurant!

-3CilRQmOymjWnkckRpwAw.text: Came here on a Monday for my birthday for dinner... we had reservations but wasn't necessary since it wasn't that busy, which was nice!  We sat in the bar area for happy hour! Can't beat the $6 appetizer prices, we ordered calamari - bomb!!! Sausage and pepper sliders- delicious  Meatballs- yummmm Gnocchi- so good!  They also give you focaccia bread with balsamic and vinegar so good!!   We didn't try any big pasta dishes since we were eating our way through Vegas and wanted to save some room, but i would def come back here!! All the food was delicious and smelled great. We had a good server & the vibe was nice in the bar area, love the lounge type couches they had! I also got a birthday cannoli with pistachio and choc chips...  perfect dessert

oFwQSfT_poS7pkGLMXXbww.text: The party I was with of 7 dined here on Labor Day weekend on Friday evening.  Some in the party were in no shape to dine, while I was ready to feast.  As usual, another benefit of Yelp is doing a quick search and relying upon fellow Yelper's to point me in the right direction!  I had one of the best plates of lasagna in recent memory and the photo I took and am attaching with this review attest.   Perfect sauce, heat and layers of fresh and flavorful awesomeness.   So good that those who follow Anthony Bourdain and those who are with Guy Fieri would appreciate it.  The bread to start was perfect warm crunchiness and the cheese plate was incredible-really tasty pecorino and a solid gorgonzola.  My wife's rigatoni with vodka sauce was tasty.  Attentive service in a relaxed atmosphere with a great view facing the strip at night.

QNIiILTbwQ1EVeGj7I4hIQ.text: The ambiance was very nice.The restaurant seemed kind of dead for a Saturday night.I ordered the Lasagna and a glass of Moscato.The lasagna was very delicious and they gave a pretty nice portion.The bread they served with the food was ok but not great.But overall it was a pretty good eatting experience.

ZjwU5dIqvH2Ci0xgwN_nkg.text: This is my second time around at Buddy V's...... Very good food, going-rate prices for the strip, and the ladies working the tables and hostesses are as stunning as they are efficient.

ARAteokF0e0Fkeh61ztixA.text: My last meal before heading back to oc was here during summer. It's so hard to leave Vegas when you are having fun and with family. I celebrated my mom's bday early here and service was beyond exceptional. We 5 of us were seated in a booth, dinner was about to begin, it was a Sunday but eating here made it feel like we were really away on vacation. The calamari was well seasoned, not too much battered, and crispy. We had Moretti's and it went well with our meals. I love Italian food and the pasta was cooked perfectly and not too al dente.  For us cali drivers, a heavy meal is not the way to go before heading home. Plus the 100 degree weather doesn't help so much. We were stuffed and with to go boxes. They gave us a little cute cookie plate for dessert. I want to come back here for a romantic dinner next trip. Thank you Buddy V's!!

We ordered fried calamari (It Was Good), Gnocchi  (Good), & Mac & Cheese Carbonara  (GREAT...smoked mozzarella & fontina set it off)...  Definitely a great choice!

wQqfuEknQ5t2J9iKWyEjGw.text: Our first visit to Buddy V's will not be our last!! We stopped in for Happy Hour in the bar and stayed through dinner!! The atmosphere was fun but not so loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation. The food was reasonably priced, delicious and the staff was friendly and accommodating. We also loved live music. Nicolas Cole on vocals and keyboard with a drummer played and sang some of our favorite old songs. We even danced when he played a song we requested. Great fun!

VfuVQAXhLtWnB4T0a7lgGg.text: This was our first time at Buddy's and we were drawn to the restaurant with its live music. The band that was playing live was amazing. Nicholas Cole is phenomenal and he played tunes that made the dinner experience more exhilarating. It was truly incredible for Nicholas to do a warm introduction with every table and because of which we were able to put down some song requests which he performed with such grace and passion. We love food and music and Nicholas along with his band paired with the delicious food made this night thoroughly enjoyable. Loved this place period !!!!

Yb7rp0DJbxrR4RAhzgMABw.text: Usually we find with celebrity places that the impression outweighs the quality of what we anticipate we are going to have.  Such is not the case with Buddy V. The food was amazing from grands meatballs to egg frittata and red velvet cake. We went for brunch and between both of us tasted all we could with no complaints at all. The service was great and everything tasted homemade from family recipes. We didn't eat again the rest of the day and there was something for everyone (except fish) since its Italian. I do have a suggestion though: If you are eating at Buddy's how about providing a menu for the pastry shop across the way and having those to go orders ready and waiting. Having to wait in line shouldn't be something you have to do if you have already splurged on the meal. Pricey but worth it. Reservations recommended'

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interior
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HiVZyk61lFAwauuxptthPg.text: We enjoyed the Caprese appetizer, sea bass, and lasagna entrees!  Our waiter recommended the caprese and we wondered if we should have ordered so much food until it arrived and we tasted it to determine that it was the best we've ever had!  The flavors were interesting with what looked like white grape tomatoes, heirloom tomatoes and sooo delicious and creamy buratta cheese. The sea bass was cooked to perfection with crispy and buttery edges. The arugula salad was divine with the fish. My mouth waters thinking of it as I write this! Our waiter recommended the Pino Grigio which was perfect. My husband had lasagne and an Italian dark beer that our waiter recommended. Once again spot on recommendation. The lasagne was a bit spicy with just the right amount of sauce. Focaccia was light and hot and perfect! We asked for bread to go with the leftover lasagne we brought back and they gave us 4 generous pieces. No dessert, although I'm sure it would have been wonderful, especially the cake with canolli filling. We will return!  Just a couple of notes: Dinner for 2 with tip was $120.  Definitely worth the cost!! There is not a convention in town and I don't recall a time in the last 40 years when I've been in Vegas and it's been so quiet. We walked in to sit at a window seat that we requested.

lGWRLNYv9tXpUWpBKD2K0g.text: Yum! I wanted a buffet on Sunday for brunch but didn't want to wait in a lengthy line.  Buddy V.'s satisfied the craving.  I would definitely return. The food is fresh and refilled frequently.  I really enjoyed the meatballs, thick bacon, chicken parmesan, mac and cheese carbonara, and cannolis. No wait to sit or get food. Great value for the offerings.

keW9yiurQjo1K8VE4m1lpw.text: My husband and I come to Vegas often and have been wanting to try this restaurant. Walking towards this place you could smell the aroma of garlic!  We were seated within minutes and had a great waiter. Wish I could remember his name. He was very friendly and accommodating. He recommended great dishes. We ordered a variety of different foods which were all delicious.  We sat in a comfortable booth overlooking the whole restaurant and enjoyed watching the chefs cook while we ate. Overall, a great place to eat. Great service, great food. We'll definitely be back!

0VUKtrvP7Vmy6uXNqbdPJg.text: Awesome experience. The spaghetti was great. Best garlic bread I've ever had! The Nutella cake dessert is an awesome choice. Our waiter was super friendly. He was Buddy's cousin and he was a lot of fun (taking pictures and joking with my 9 year old daughter). Food was stellar and he made it very memorable.

QV1zysuCfbfNlcoEuwV2Cw.text: Fantastic food, amazing atmosphere! This one was really Italian for a very good price! The only cherry  missing on the cake, was having a sgroppino afterwards..

ryZBP7sIgdz6kC2TAsE-Cw.text: Nothing special - it's like Maggiano's or Carmine's but not as good  Best parts are the service and the desserts

DL5g786SturZaaBf5DFQcA.text: Not a bad experience, but definitely didn't meet my expectations. I'm a Cake Boss fanatic and have stood in line for hours to get in to Carlos Bakery in Hoboken when it was the only location, so Buddy V's was a no brainer.   A long line outside the bakery across the hallway, but no wait for the restaurant, possibly just because it was FILLED with exhaust/smoke. They assured us it was not normally that way and let us pick our table in the least-smoky area of the restaurant, which overall got better as we went. Not sure what the issue was.  The octopus salad was super small, so I was glad I wasn't that hungry. More so, the octopus smelled like tuna in a can. I've never had octopus that smelled bad, and almost didn't eat it, but took a chance. The special Cake Boss dessert cocktail was strong, gross, and the red velvet crumbs on top weren't even red.   There are two cakes on the dessert menu, and we got both. The chocolate cake was underwhelming, but the Italian Birthday Cake.... oh my gosh amazing. Is this really what Italian Birthday Cake is like? We have been DOING. IT. WRONG. Chocolate ganache filling AND cannoli filling, covered with mounds of fresh whipped cream, sliced almonds. Definitely Top 5-10 desserts of my life.  Our waiter Charlie was very nice, but he was overbooked it seemed as it took 12 minutes for someone to take our drink order, and we often waited and waited just to have someone walk by so we could grab their attention. I also asked him 3 separate times to bring the check before he did.   It all felt extremely, extremely overpriced, too. $100 for 2 entrees, a cocktail, and 2 desserts, that mostly were not very good? Meh.   Pro-tip to you people standing in line at the bakery: if the dessert you're planning on ordering there is on the Buddy V's restaurant dessert menu... why are you waiting? Order it here. (But skip the food.)

TeEo37WRRuieePlhQkIpZw.text: Service was terrible!!!!!! I am in the restaurant business and I saw the busser more than my server. Caleb H checked on us probably about two times during my dinning experience. I ordered the chicken parm and was not even offered extra parm or fresh ground pepper. If you come to this location make sure you don't get served by Caleb H!!!!!! I am a server and I know what to expect for quality service. I felt like I was under served just because I was of the younger age group. Definitely not worth it!!!!

LPV2pwijjJsd5Id1VAmKvg.text: Best dining experience you can get in Vegas for great taste, generous portion, and chic ambience. Outstanding service

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti bolognese. Rich favor
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parm chicken

xxOxCSksqs2u__wlIDV78g.text: This has become one of our favorite places to eat when we are in Vegas,, service is great and the food has always been amazing. Highly highly recommend.

QFIz52uSRWBI4uv5T5uGKA.text: This place was awesome. We went about 4pm and had the sunset menu which had enough choices for us. Has the fried mozzarella appetizer which was different from normal mozzarella this had so many flavors going on. It was really good. Kids portions were big but also 12.00 a piece. Husband had chicken parm said it was good and had lots of flavors going on as well. Chicken was not dry. Had the Caesar salad was saving room for dessert. Salad was good and just the right amount. Desserts are awesome. Must have is the tiramisu the lady fingers are on the side and you dip them in the mason jar of stuff. My daughter had the apple pie it was ok not too sweet came with vanilla ice cream. Would have liked a little warmer. If your in the area would definitely try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple pie crust was really good and not to sweet
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The awesome tiramisu

ZXjSpJXqjC7TV6z_U_w-dw.text: Amazing!! The food and the service were fantastic. The Italian Birthday cake was to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0AHEE6HKtoS12bvFsJWy6A.text: Go here, Vegas must! BEST Italian food I have tried by far! I had their chicken parmesan which was absolutely perfect! My sister had "Buddy's Favorite Pizza" and it was also delicious. Their cannolis are also to die for, so yummy! Also, SUPER friendly staff! No complaints here.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannolis with Chocolate Sauce

vPpgT21IfQWUTkoHG_taFw.text: This Place Is SHADY!!! Our server was the biggest swindler of them all. We ordered a Stella and he said "medium or large" we go with the smallest being the medium. When the bill comes the Stella Beer was $16. I inquired on why so much and they said because you keep the glass. I said we wanted the beer with no glass and they said that's the only option. The bus boy came around to clear off the table and he said they do have a smaller 12oz version without the stupid souvenir glass for which we weren't given the option.  Then for dinner my daughter asked for a white pasta instead of the kids spaghetti. Waiter said he could do a kids Alfredo. Come the bill was a charge for a $20 Alfredo when the other kids entrees were $12. We had to ask the manager which quickly took care of the problem.  I personally ordered a Caesar salad and as the waiter walked away he said he would being enough to share. Bill comes and were being billed for a huge family portion for which 2 people ate and more than half was left.  The cocktail we ordered was too sweet and liquor. We could have got a better value and experience and mastros for the cost paid. We dine out 3-4 times a week and know the routine of value, quality, service and overall customer appreciation. This place provided NONE!   The overall experience sucked, service sucked and we were left feeling like we were takin advantage of.  Steer clear of this over priced and over rated restaurant.

_KIwLWT709JUNUt9tfeo0Q.text: Special thanks to Bethany our fantastic waitress for recommending the Beef Tenderloin with sauteed spinach, mashed potatoes, chianti sauce! It was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My wife received this Holy Cannoli for her birthday!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Beef Tenderloin was so good I didn&#39;t want to share it with the birthday girl!

xoMPyRrKaGaYh6Dwfrrhbw.text: Buddy has done it again! Not only is his bakery next door amazing, but his restaurant is great too. I've been here both during lunch and dinner, but at night it has a more dark tone with warm lights, great for a romantic night but good too for families. No matter what table you are seated in, you will have a view of the kitchen and the chefs.   Our server Brittany was really nice and bubbly. I was having trouble deciding between the scallops and the chicken parm, she recommended the chicken parm and assured me that in case I didn't like it that I could order something else.   But she was right! The chicken parm was delicious! I personally don't like chicken, but this was juicy and crunchy, covered with hot marinara sauce and cheese covering it all.  It also came with spaghetti marinara on the side.   My friend was jealous and wish she had gotten mine. She ordered the seabass, which was flaky and good  too, but I still liked mine better.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Draggo Rosso
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Marsala
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita Vennezia

2FXG35GuL84iEVbFC7-g4A.text: I'll describe Buddy V's in 1 word...perfect. From the Caesar salad, the broccoli rabe / sausage rigatoni, the Bronzino to the Tiramisu, everything was bursting in flavor, perfectly cooked and beautifully presented. A most enjoyable experience.  I rarely give a restaurant 5 stars on Yelp, but Buddy V's is well deserving. Don't hesitate making reservations. Incredible!

2dks6mOl521mRnOCUn1mAg.text: Food and service were on point. Servers worked as a team. Someone was checking in every 10-15 minutes, to make sure I was ok.  I had the tomato soup which was very rich and a nice start, their lasagna was filling but could not stop me from their Nutella dessert and salted caramel ice cream. Delicious!

TrvDizTuQULmZXo-FfsOXQ.text: In Vegas last week for a convention made reservations when we arrived we still had to wait around 10 minutes. Once we were seated took forever for our waitress to get to our table so the Manger took our drink order. And then again for another 10 minutes we waited to place our order. She finally takes our order. The food was good not great. Wanted to place a desert order but when no one comes back to take your order how can you.!!Finally waved down the Manger to pay out. Pricey place for such Terrible Service.!

u730VFxzg8OyDJd7lQpe-Q.text: We are back!!! Express lunch was delish as usual. We shared meatballs and caesar salad (love polenta croutons!) Carbonara hands down....they kill it here! Just wish they served bread or soft breadsticks instead if crunchy packaged sticks...Buddy V is a "baker" after all. Need to wipe the sauce off the plate. A tiramasu and canoli to hold us over until next time. CIAO!

6pKqbDUBEqWSofkY53-MzQ.text: Went here a couple times already. Perfect date spot. Great customer service! The food is just like my friends mother's cooking back in Jersey! The pasta was cooked perfectly. I wasn't surprised with the dessert but his bakery across the restaurant is a must try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gNF_U3m7Z3foRUtFNJZz9g.text: We were excited to see that Buddy Valastro had a restaurant in Las Vegas & had to try it out. Definitely were not disappointed!   Both of our servers were excellent. Went with the recommendation for the Caesar salad as it included polenta croutons that were out of this world good! Salad was crisp, bright & fresh. Hubby greatly enjoyed the mac & cheese, while my eggplant parm was fantastic! Will definitely come back on our next trip West!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side Caesar salad with polenta croutons &amp; a glass of Prosecco

1IbWemPjhsvLL_A76ZGmFw.text: While waiting in the super long line at Carlos bakery across the way I noticed this restaurant. (Found out later that they are connected) My friends and I had already decided on Mexican food for dinner but I wandered over to look at the menu and inquire about the wait time. As soon as I walked in I was in heaven! It smelled amazing! The prices weren't bad and the hostess sad she could seat our party of 4 right now so I went ahead and followed her to a table (with an incredible view of the strip!) I never went back to my friends... I just texted them and told them we had a change of plans and would now be eating Italian at Buddy V's! We told our server, Casey, we had reservations and were kind of in a rush. She was fantastic and told us which dishes to avoid because of a longer cook time and made a few recommendations on dinner and wine. We ordered Salmon, spaghetti bolognese, chicken piccata and ravioli and all four of us loved our dishes. As promised, Casey had us out of there in under an hour and we made it to the show with time to spare! Great food, great service, great views & I can't wait to go back! Next time I'm ordering dessert because they looked delicious as well!

L5gpgUgYuwrHSqpfWHiAQA.text: Great food! This might sound funny but, the croutons on the Caesar salad are to die for. I had the sea bass and it was perfectly not a bone in the fish. My husband had the lasagna and it was a very generous portion and delicious.

3XscPn_IPYAhE_7yG0jp_Q.text: Met a group of peeps for lunch.  Our first discussion at the table was where is the best place to park. Well, it wasn't the Venetian, where I was lucky enough to park and walk from. Grrrr!  After getting the waiter to confirm, use the Palazzo Valet, but it's still a little trek.   The waiter was super friendly and nice, even when I returned my soda, because it had a funny smell. I promise it wasn't me...I made half the table confirm it smelled bad.   I asked the waiter what was good and he said many things. I mentioned the chicken parm, because so many people on yelp ordered it, and he said that was a good option. So I went for it.  Buyers remorse!!  It was decent, don't get me wrong, but the guy across from me got a burger that looked amazing!!!  Who would have thunk it...a burger at an Italin joint?!  Next time!  The parm was ok, and most would probably love it, but I am super picky about my sauce, being raised in an Italian pasta sauce making family. It did have two big pieces of chicken, fried well, and not dry with ample cheese on top. I wouldn't throw it away, but it wasn't OMG, I am ordering this again.  I already know I will be ordering the burger next time. :P  I also wish I had room for the lobster tail dessert, but I just don't. :(  I would come back again, because I think this place could make me happy.  Just not a good start with the strange soda this time.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm...it was ok. Next time I&#39;m ordering the burger!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of seating
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice place!

emWVEkIzVBmijAXxaQhC5Q.text: Truly the best Sunday Gravy I've had in awhile!  Would highly recommend their food to anyone.  They even beat out that 3 star Michelin chef Gordon Ramsey!

d7MtLIMv0a75QKz6C_apag.text: Food = 5 stars Overall = 3 stars  We had a very uneven experience at Buddy V's. The room was nice, but you really want a booth, as the tables had very uncomfortable-looking, unpadded chairs. Service was scattered and disorganized. Our server, Kacie, while very nice, seemed to be kinda all over the place, we had just sat down when she asked us if we were ready to order (??) and the bread service didn't arrive til after the entrees were served -- disappointing, as the restaurant had been open for long enough to smooth out those kinds of issues.  On the bright side, the food was excellent, we started with the meatballs, which were surprisingly light and tasty, with a nicely seasoned red sauce. I had the whole wheat penne pasta with pesto and veggies, delicious with a lot of flavor but still light. Hubby had the shrimp scampi with perfectly cooked shrimp and angel hair pasta and a light and flavorful sauce.   The prices were pretty good for Vegas so we felt we had a good value, but it was really too bad that the overall experience didn't match the quality of the food. With so many options in Vegas, I doubt we would be back.

_c-8sdT36e39DklkAkYYrw.text: The service are terrible, I ask a bigger table because I wanna more space and the restaurant are almost empty at Monday 15:40 P.M and the attendant say no because it's for big families. The margherita pizza it's the opposite of the real one, the waiter dropped water on the table, water I don't ask for. They bring the tap before I ask a desert, totally rude, bad bad service.

-n9VUK-_vflxgG1WQ5ypfg.text: Delicious! To start, the garlic bread and fried mozzarella really set you up for a great meal. Then for the main course, we had the lasagna (not pictured) and the eggplant Parmesan with a side of spaghetti. Amazing!! And what's a trip to Buddy's without the famous lobster tail?? This has got to be one of my favorite Italian restaurants I've been to. Thanks buddy!

XQfpRLFzT1NuDTCrvFUatw.text: Much better than I expected.  Went on a Sunday morning so it was a brunch buffet that I did not partake in, so I only ordered Tomato Basil soup.  The soup was good, though serving size was small for the price and it didn't come with bread.  My wife got the buffet and really liked it and she snuck me some bread for my soup and that bread was also good.    All in all, for a place founded based on a TV show, it's really pretty decent.  However, it's overpriced.  As a bonus, the Carlo's Bakery is across the hall.

GCdvjuNaBKOJy44KLPVchQ.text: Nice food and service. I like the place with enjoying out sight view and food. I'm very picky. Some of the order was not mine taste  as other might have their favourate

0PHEHNk_IFd97LLFSc3Dag.text: Great food and amazing service from Kristi and Alex!  The Gravy is amazing with tons of flavors. And the chicken parm is the best I've ever had. Get a booth that over looks the strip and it's perfect to watch. Don't forget the calamari!

CyKVUZX-J9JvOJ-Cr-xjew.text: Sorry...not a fan. We opted to do Sunday brunch and the food was just not good. The hot offerings had 2 types of eggs, chicken parm, frittata, and pastas. It was cold and gummy. Mac and cheese was saturated with oil. Carving station had your choice of apple sausage, Italian sausage, and Ham. They were so stingy with the meats only giving you one piece of meat. Nothing special about that. Peel and eat shrimp was good and the panzanella salad. The salad was very light and refreshing. Desserts pretty to look at but sadly, disappointing, even the famed cannolli's not enjoyable. Waitress was too busy flirting with guys instead of serving us. Not acceptable nor enjoyable for brunch.

sf2eZ1VfSYEUI_49PZy2Ag.text: Great service, great food!  Chicken parm, spaghetti with meatballs, chicken marsala, and Caesar salad all very good!  You will probably need a reservation as this place typically has a long wait.  Request a table by the windows overlooking the strip!

5Fy5egKuJYSLclw7Lhs6NA.text: Beautiful Mediterranean sea bass, crispy, moist and great service! Had the "lobster" desert oh myyyyyy.

_2V_yrQvcrQsU1pQznVfUg.text: We had our wedding reception at Buddy V's and everyone left full and happy! The food and service was amazing. The staff was helpful. I did not have to worry about a thing. The lasagna was so tasty and satisfying, the croutons in the Caesar salad were a delicious surprise, and the cake we got from Carlo's bakery was so amazing and pretty. Thank you again Buddy V's!

zs7kSkde2cddA1mqeMvZ0w.text: Authentic Italian done family style. Love this place food is always great. Must try the calamari and mamas meatballs

Service : 5/5 Food : 5/5  Only regret I have is I didn't try the dessert , will have to come back for that :)

MReZFy74LPzXBs_MdfsHDQ.text: Food was very good. Waiter was outstanding! Although a little pricey, its Vegas, you get what you pay for. The service was excellent and the food was very good. It was a little noisy, but all in all, I would visit again.

hsCjI__YIVqfW8lVLXXtlw.text: The calamari was truly the best I've ever had!  Hot and Tender as butter with a  wonderful dipping sauce!  The lasagna was huge, 7 layers, cheesy deliciousness   The grilled salmon was divine and the scallops were tasty.  Great view, service and ambiance, however it was a little loud.  Do Not Miss the butterscotch creme brulee!!

4RAOZNA85iRwOw8giACFQA.text: The service was outstanding !  My wife was given a complimentary glass of wine for what they called a delay. There was really no delay they were just on top of Service so much that they apologized up-and-down for the delay!  The veal chop was hot and tasty and the lobster tail was out of this world. My wife's veal Picata was outstanding as well will definitely be back.

VQDnSTdbfhZ_XL3dSi0T2g.text: First off the menu is not very impressive, kind of reminds me of Quick stop Italian joint, not a sit down restaurant. Your better of going to the polazzo and eating at carnivore.   We started off with the mozzarella sandwich in marinara sauce which was pretty good. Very hearty and pleasantly seasoned. Then my wife ordered the chicken parm which she enjoyed. I ordered the meatball sub, I know what your thinking "meatball sub how can you judge off of that" well the waitress told me it was a signature and it sounded good for lunch. Well my take on the sub was the bread was great, a little butter action with the melted mozzarella, but the meatballs were not so good. The texture was not there for me, it was like the microwaveable meatballs, honestly if you blind folded me and but a subway sub in comparison I would probably pick the subway sub.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lackluster $15 not much better than a subway sandwich sub
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

vujJMSGU2OPgyIbN3_-kAQ.text: I guess I missed the part of the show where Buddy went to Vegas to start a restaurant??  I'm a huge fan who occasionally watches episodes of Cake Boss and dreams about going to Hoboken to taste his food.  So when I heard about Buddy V's Ristorante during this recent birthday trip, my heart skipped a beat and I told my husband we HAD TO go!  From the outside, the charming decor mimicked that of a quaint cafe nestled in the corner of somewhere in Italy (or so I'd think, since I've never been).  It drew me in!  I love how it felt homey yet upscale inside.  We had a reservation and were seated promptly.  Our food took a while to arrive but the taste more than made up for it!  I ordered Nonna's Lasagna.  Oh my!  It was as if I've never had lasagna before!  There were so many layers with meat and cheese that just melt on your tongue.  That good!  I wished my stomach were bigger just so I could have more of that lasagne.  It was a very generously portioned dish.  My husband ordered Mama's Style Chicken.  He loved his dish too!    Oh and don't get me started on the dessert!  Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake was perfect for my birthday treat - chocolate cake drizzled in chocolate sauce with caramel ice cream.  Scrumptious, to say the least!  They decorated with "happy birthday" and our server sang to me in Italian.  It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.  The customer service was amazing.  Our server was funny and accommodating.  We had our baby with us and enjoyed a memorable dinner out.  What more could you ask for in Vegas?!  Definitely one for the books!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mama&#39;s Chicken
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simply the best!

j1yTBKDlfWeDFjufMRx9jw.text: last minute decision to meet up friends in vegas and to celebrate my birthday. stayed at the palazzos and had dinner at buddy v's. we tried their popular lasagna dish, pastas, calamaris, cesar salad and a steak entree. everything tasted delicious and authentic, especially the lasagna. the pastas were done al dente with the right amount of sauce and flavor. it reminded us of italy. this is an upscale place preparing solid classic italian dishes. las vegas + great dinner experience = feeling like a winner.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. look at all the yummy food.

F-qO_Yvmx3P108cTpj0Y3Q.text: One of the best Italian experience I have had and their lasagna was phenomenal! Great service and decor.

U_PoFHMI4SCJmH6u1-HkSA.text: Food, Drinks, and service were all great. Would definitely come back! We came for dinner and it ended up still being happy hour which was a plus. Everything seemed reasonable in price and we had large portions!

X73tmoyNKv1dRjFzh1DwXw.text: I fell in love with this place! I am a huge Buddy fan so coming here was a must. It definitely was all that I expected and more. The service was great and quick. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and gave great suggestions. Our food exceeded our expectations. It was full of flavor and the the portions were great. We got a cannoli for dessert and it was AMAZING!!! I cannot wait to come back and try some more dishes, wines, and dessert.

-ZoGfIxgPdtjNfK6JoJk9g.text: What a great happy hour menu! $4 drinks and $5 apps every night from 4:30-6:30. Really great service from friendly bartender named Tawny and cool live music playing Sinatra, Bennett, etc.  Can be comfortable in jeans or more dressy.    You won't be disappointed. Check it out!

GpV1YsHXuocmnADxkR3b1w.text: Awesome! We had the Brunch Buffet. My wife and I were pleasantly surprised when we came upon Buddy V's on accident. We just so happened to come during a time they were offering the buffet. I did not find a single thing offered that wasn't excellent! The service was prompt and helpful and the selections were tended to regularly so everything was fresh. Make your way here if you find yourself in the area, you will not be disappointed!

y2PCd8qPq1lTAqtm9fLa1Q.text: Don't waste your time and money going to Buddy V's for Happy Hour.  We were seated outside the restaurant in the walkway and the seats had wood slates that were uncomfortable. We tried 6 dishes that were basically fast junk food with little flavor.  Our waitress was hap hazard with her service forgetting twice to fetch a glass for a bottled drink and only bringing 5 of the 6 appetizers with the 6th one arriving about 15 minutes later.  Afterwards we walked across to Carlos bakery and there was not one item that looked spectacular.  Food was grossly overpriced even in comparison to other Strip bakeries by 30%.

wbttbF1CANAN4O6_sfensg.text: Great experience start to finish. Georgio was a fabulous server. His recommendations were appreciated and well received. We totally enjoyed the food.

5pdRsJZxZlqdvMruTxpNZw.text: Really surprised how good it was.  Ordered the linguine with shrimp and clams. Wasn't on the menu, but added the clams for a small up charge.  Server was really nice as well. Will be back.

S6oyGaxowyOrjluRBhQn0w.text: After losing a small fortune in a matter of minutes I didn't think I could be so happy so quickly. Buddy V's was literally on of the best restaurant I have been to in Vegas. To start the lobster tail (dessert) could make a grown man cry of joy, I literally would have been happy to stick a straw in it and suck out all the cream out instead of actually ordering a meal (Which is what I did the following day, pretty sure i gained about 10lbs just off of lobster tail filling)  Enough about the dessert (I'll be talking more about it more when I write my Carlos Bakery review, yes it was that good!) The entrees are not something to overlook either. Let me start out by saying I am a somewhat food snob when it comes to classier restaurant. While I have left some places questioning the quality based on what I paid this is certainly not one of those times. As far as Italian food goes it doesn't get much better, the quality is spectacular and there is nothing that I would have changed. To top it off the portions were HUGE! Being a guy in his early 20's of course I forced myself to eat every bite. However most people would have probably took half of it to go.  If you are ever in Las Vegas do yourself a favor and stop by Buddy V's for dinner.

Yyo4OvKC_iyjUY1RpPgvqA.text: One word. AMAZINGGGG!!!! Definitely a 5 star restaurant. I came here because I love Cake Boss. I knew it wouldn't be a disappointment at all. My friends and I ordered: chicken parm, mother in law shrimp scampi, salmon, orecchiette & Italian sausage and a margarita pizza. All were on point! I'm def coming here again

eoMHdCjEAUkFcpCqb88C8g.text: Great food and the staff is always helpful in feeding to your tastes. Can't wait to come back.

EMIzLU4nLF7dDvBk5ZwTrg.text: Who's not a fan of Buddy V? I drool over the eye candy on Cake Boss (the food eye candy!).  When I realized that Buddy brought Jersey to Vegas, I couldn't wait to try it. It's difficult to find a restaurant on the strip that has character, good food, and great service. Buddy V's has all three. We made reservations on a weekday evening and the restaurant was about 3/4 full. The ambiance was casual with an upscale Italian vibe; translation: fine dining without leaving a hole in your pocket. Win Win. There were two people taking care of our table, so we got double the attention and service. Both our waiter and waitress were friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We ordered "My Wife's Eggplant Parm" as an appetizer and chicken rigatoni alla vodka and Nonna's lasagna al forno as our mains.   My Wife's Eggplant Parm- clever! I like how Buddy gives cred to those who deserve it. The eggplant parm was pretty much a tower of crispy goodness. Eggplant, melted mozzarella, tomato parm, eggplant, melted mozzarella, tomato, parm...you get the picture. The eggplant was had a nice crunch and the melty cheese and tart tomato sauce were a delicious combo. I'm using to a more traditional baked eggplant parm as opposed to the deep fried dish that was served. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but I was missing the deep flavors of the eggplant that was fried away.   Chicken rigatoni alla vodka- rigatoni, pancetta, grilled chicken swimming in a decadent tomato cream sauce was heaven. I really enjoyed the creaminess of this dish. The sauce was a perfect combination of flavors (it's all about the sauce). This pancetta was a nice touch of smokiness. Super filling, you will have leftovers!   Nonna's lasagna al forno- YES. CHEESY, MEATY, traditional lasagna with a ton of flavor. This hefty lasagna had Italian sausage, beef and pork, ricotta cheese, mozzarella, provolone and parmesan baked to perfection. Four types of cheeses people. It was cheesy. If you are looking for a classic and delicious lasagna, look no further. The only thing I was missing was a bit of sweetness in the tomato sauce. Otherwise, I would absolutely order this item again. Totally big enough to split.   I truly enjoy traditional Italian food. Big portions, big flavors and lots of sauce. Warning, you will be in a food coma after you finish your meal. Come with an empty belly and be prepared to eat. We had a ton of leftovers which is what should happen when you go out for Italian food. I enjoyed the decor of the restaurant, the ambiance, as well as the service. We let our waitress know that we were on a time crunch, and she got us in and out of the restaurant in no time with full bellies and smiles on our faces. This restaurant was closer to Palazzo then Venetian and somewhat of a mission to find, but we found it and we were glad we did. A very solid option of casual Italian food in the heart of LV.

B4Ln9TilPSybVrEJtONDlg.text: Was visiting Vegas & leaving on Sunday so I knew I couldn't do the brunch but I checked the facebook & saw they were doing the "Sunday Brunch" on Saturday now & was so excited! We had the best experience, from the amazing food to the wonderful service. The cannoli I see on TV were so worth it & the red velvet cake, wow! We are definitely making this a Vegas tradition!

t_3kQMr1sV9jnTYCt1-xyg.text: Mouard was our server and was excellent in attitude and service throughout our dinner. My brother is a huge fan of the show Cake Boss and was start struck to eat there, but the manager Kristina Poole really tipped the cake off with a signed Buddy V Carlo's bakery flier, a coffee cup and water bottle. Thank you for making his experience that much better and definitely deserve a rare review from me here. Keep up the great service!

_4ynVNlq8z8E1GcLBujP7A.text: We have been to Buddy V's many times and the food is delicious!  My favorite is the eggplant parmesan...delicious and tender!! Their bread is always served warm and fresh and you just want more.  My only complaint is that I never have enough room in my stomach to have dessert!

EtsFoEKul6xeFTWe6d1G2g.text: We came for dessert after drooling over Buddy V's cakes. I haven't had this terrible of desserts since...I don't know. They served frozen desserts from some chain supplier like Cisco. Had cannoli, Italian wedding cake, and three scoops gelato of different flavors. Cannoli was in a greasy shell that tasted like Mexican fried ice cream shell and cheese was more like whipped cream, not even mascarpone. Wedding cake was cold and also similar cheap greasy flavor. Gelato had not enough flavor for "gelato". Top that off with Vegas pricing and slowest service in Vegas, plus people smoking freely where we were sitting, so will not be back.

RGBUxHbn-HPyKyRq4F5crQ.text: If you want a italian neighborhood resturant feel in the middle of the strip this is the spot. You cant miss with this choice. Sunday Gravy is to die for, pizza was also very good. Calamari was some of the better that I have had. Service was top notch as well. Next door is the to-go bakery and I got a cannoli that qas the best I have ever had, cakes were also very good.

Wr6kU1j7ZTGpdFEi6dyleQ.text: Buddy V's Ristorante has a variety of great tasting Italian food.   I loved the atmosphere, it was welcoming and personal. While waiting to get a table, I hung out in the bar area which was very spacious and had great waitresses. I had a Moscow mule, it was pretty decent.   They got us a table in 35 minutes, which was exactly what they estimated. I got a Caesar side salad, which was decent. I wasn't super fond of the croutons. We also got garlic cheese bread, which was very tasty.   My main dish was eggplant parmesan, with a side of spaghetti. I really enjoyed the eggplant, it was presented very nice as well. I also liked the spaghetti sauce. Since it was my birthday, they brought me a delicious birthday dessert. I must say, it was probably one of the best desserts I have ever had!

bvzQfbsFYKYXxvXhpf_AXA.text: 4.9 of 5. The service was exceptional. Ate a late lunch in the bar. Had Grandmas Meatballs, a Caesar salad and an amazing slice of cheesy bread. BDWcF0RnLsm0DDm0IBuFQQ.text: Freaking love this place, was the first meal we at when we landed, and the last one before we left, both times were consistent, but not only the food was great, the service was awesome. Our waiter, was uncle georgio, ask for him, he was funny and awesome, gonna miss it.

rqLyfqxiFWvOAUsM-yG8Eg.text: I am a huge Italian food lover!! We stayed at the Venetian and we ate dinner here and OMG! I was blown away by the big portions, flavorful foods, and amazing atmosphere! The sangria was one of a kind and was made fresh. Everything was so so good! We live in California and plan to go back just to eat here again! I cannot day enough good things about this ristorante! Staff was so helpful and really treated us like family. I crave the food and cannot wait to come back!

zmQKFhjGYLhqhzfSJmQhzQ.text: Server was horrible. Overall experience was irritating trying to flag a server down for everything. Server forgot to put in our order. We sat and waited while people who came after us get served their appetizers and entrees while we waited over an hour just to get our salad appetizers. We didn't know it takes more than an hour to make a lettuce tomatoes salad. Done. NOT ever coming back. Save your money. There are much more nicer restaurants in Las Vegas Nv.

OEh0qDRnMJ2uq2sjq5U-2w.text: Amazing food. Our party of 6 had different meals. We all were so impressed and full. The only complaint would be the cracker sticks served instead of bread. The waitress was good, but was rushed. However, Eddie who helped serve was amazing. He was personable and professional. A True asset to the restaurant. I definitely would and will go back next time I visit Vegas.

81WdMkpmB86TStLQbgj07g.text: Made a last minute reservation for 6 and they were able to accommodate it. The food was good and the prices weren't to outrageously high. I got the pizza with truffle oil and it was great. It has a somewhat limited menu. Everybody at my table ordered different things and they enjoyed their dish. Only negative was the sun was setting and the sunshade didnt block very well so the sun was right in my face.

pmBjhRIeuGuDhbshXtq9NQ.text: Went in at 5:30pm on a Wednesday evening. Place was pretty empty. There was two of us. We went to the hostess and she told us there would be a one hour wait. I had to double check with her and ask her if she was sure. She assured me it would be an hour. I told her the place was almost empty. She rolled her eyes at me. Went somewhere else. I prefer to spend my money with companies that want it.

1qzuU8bLZ-nHHjzh1qiGPw.text: Hi, I brought my wife and mother of three in for a mothers day dessert treat and a drink.  Cheesecake was excellent, limoncello was great, but the server Valerie really took it as an imposition to HAVE to serve us.  "You JUST want dessert?"  9pm, no line outside, sorry we had to to ruin the servers night.

yczrqoY8wNHNe6zHLun7Qw.text: Great view of the strip. Fantastic food! Our waitress, Kacey, was the best! Highly recommend.

gCgWer-E2dueti_AKC7Dgw.text: We like the Cake Boss and had to try his Italian ristorante! We came @5pm with reservations and just right before the dinner crowd started trickling in. First impression are the female hosts who check you in and take you to your table. They were all very nice, but they all really looked like they were from New Jersey (have you watched Cake Boss or Real Housewives of New Jersey?!) Sorry, I digress.  We ordered the antipasto Grandma's meatballs (the waiter said you'd get 5, our group got 6-no complaints there!); the Lisa V's linguine & white clam sauce (I still purr from the wine and virgin olive oil-tasted like butter); the chicken rigatoni alla vodka (the plate was licked up); and the orecchiette and italian sausage (this one-not so good). While we waited we received a small piece of focaccia bread each (why couldn't we have more slices??) with olive oil and balsamic vinegar (ya-ummm, but why couldn't we have more slices?? And I would've preferred more vinegar...) One of us requested a side caesar salad (not on the menu, but provided) and instead of croutons it was cubes of polenta (yummy). I suggest you should ask "what is the meal favorite here?", so you won't be disappointed.  We opted for dessert across the way at Carlos' Bakery, which is slightly (read my review for the bakery thus my use of the word "slightly") a mistake because I really wanted to try the butterscotch creme brulee.

J3wNBN82YcIlSt0aA_VBmA.text: This place was really good! Living in NJ, i'm spoiled with access to the best Italian food in the county (in NYC), so I'm a tough judge. But our food was delicious and the service was A++++. We had the mozzarella en carozza which was tasty with a chunky tomato sauce and pesto; delicious, but more like a glorified grilled cheese than the carozza I'm used to on the east coast. The complimentary homemade bread was great though. We also had the veal marsala and chicken penne alla vodka and both were GREAT. I was also pleased with the portion of everything; they weren't gluttonous but large enough for a small leftovers meal. I'd suggest it to anyone going to Vegas, but with SO MANY restaurants on the strip, I don't think it's a "must visit" if you're only there for a short time. Staying 4+ days? Add it to the list.

Q12MbRzwHct186Y_qlweTQ.text: I was excited to try this place because i am a big fan of cake boss. We were quickly seated and greeted by our waitress. We ordered the grilled cheesy bread for an app. It was so good! I ordered chicken parm and my husband got the chicken rigatoni. They were both really good. Save room for dessert if you come here!!!! We got the NJ style cheesecake. It was probably the beat I've ever had! So creamy with just the right amount of sweet. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the food complimented it well.

oVQbyqd9yVBaLwopyS9Ehg.text: We couldn't believe the "Let's eat cake" guy has a restaurant so we had to check it out. We went in not having high expectation but left feeling very satisfied. We ordered charred octopus and roasted sea bass. The octopus was in a soupy broth. It was different but loved the broth. The sea bass was likely seasoned so we can taste the fresh fish that paired well with a nice salad. We also tried the bread. It came after we ate but paired well with the brothy octopus. The dessert menu was limited but his bakery was right across.

cd_Bvolelkd0zrQ40Usvfw.text: What a fun filled delicious experience! We had the privilege of being served by the VERY personable Giorgio, Buddy V's cousin. Funny, helpful and friendly; it doesn't get any better than that! We started with the Tomato & Basil Soup with gran padano and focaccia croutons as well as the Grilled Octopus with pepperonata, lemon, caper, arugula & citrus salad. We LOVED the octopus! For dinner we had My Wife's Eggplant Parm, a beautiful stack of crispy & crunchy eggplant, tomato, mozzarella and parmesan, a Classic Cheese Pizza with mozzarella & provolone, and a FANTASTIC Osso Bucco, with mashed potatoes instead of the parmesan polenta, natural jus and gremolata. As a generous show of hospitality and a thank you to us for reaching out ahead of time, Giorgio bought us a creme filled "Lobster Tail" pastry and a butterscotch Creme Brulee. All in all, a wonderful evening with great friends, old & new! Come Wine & Dine along with us, @travelwinefoodie

Probably the best Caesar salad I've ever had..... with fried Polenta croutons!  My husband had the Lasagna --- this man is hard to please--- and even he raves about it!  I had the Spaghetti Bolognese, it was delicious!  Would have loved to have dessert, but too stuffed!  We will not hesitate to visit Buddy Vs again!  2 thumbs up!

rCTq93htFYHX7ZqsZtb7_w.text: So lazy. That's part of my Vegas living. I don't want to go too far for food. Luckily this was a short walk away from where I was staying at the Venetian  What I ate:  - Cheese and charcuterie plate: I love cheese, I love charcuterie. Why wouldn't you enjoy this? Great to share. My friends didn't like the blue cheese, but I gobbled it all up! - Chicken rigatoni alla vodka: Plenty of large chicken pieces, flavorful sauce. This was just a tad on the salty side. The rigatoni were perfectly al dente! - Buddy's special pizza: Dough was fresh and flavorful, the toppings were delicious. I was glad I stole a slice from my friend and tried it  Pros: - Easy access from the strip, located in the venetian shops - Ten min walk from venetian hotel - Great food - Service was nice - Plenty of room for large or small parties. I watched staff bring together tables for groups of 10, and quickly break it down for smaller parties - loved the open kitchen - you can definitely get some of their famous desserts without having to wait in like across the hall at their bakery - Lots of bright light and space  Cons: - can be confusing to find if you've never been there - Lots of bright light. If you're nursing a hangover, this may not be the place for you. Order the pasta/pizza to go and eat it in the dark cave of your hotel room  Would I come again? Sure

oyp4VpcEbyswgyti-_ZciQ.text: A friend and I stopped in at the bar at Buddy V's before a show. We were able to take advantage of the happy hour specials. It's a limited food menu, but it's still good food. It was a perfect pre-show meal.

o2GJbq9sVlqMcKqlY0jDOg.text: Buddy V's a fantastic place for some huge Italian dishes.  We have visited Buddy's 4 times now, and each experience has been the same great service and consistent quality of food.  Located in the Palazzo/Venetian Canal Shops, it has a strip side view, and big windows to make a nice bright and open restaurant.  The entree portions are very large and typically can be served in a family style, so everyone has a chance to sample a number of dishes.  The fresh baked bread is a nice start to the meals, and the dinner starter Caesar salad is fairly small in comparison to the entrees.  One go-to dish is definitely  Nonna's Lasagna, which is a wonderful mixture of meats and lots of cheese.  The Veal Milanese, which is a lighter version of Veal Parmesan, using a mix greens/tomatoes as the topping was very good.  Hints for you visit: Make reservations, as prime times fill quickly!  Request a table by the window for a strip side view, or you can sit on the "patio" for people watching inside the Canal walkways.  And, plan on large portions for the entrees, if you have a desire for dessert.

6eZBD5L2-IiLb58XICqRWg.text: This was my second visit to Buddy V's! My first visit was absolutely unparalleled. I literally dreamed about my entree and the day we'd meet again. So of course on my recent trip to Vegas, I had to come back! As expected, the service was great! Once again, I ordered their Fettucini Alfredo pasta dish with added shrimp. The flavors were all there, however, it kind of dry (lack of sauce) and the noodles were more al dente than previously. I would give 5 stars, but due to the meal not meeting the expectations of the first I'll, unfortunately, have to drop my rating to a 4. However, I will be back on my next visit and hopefully, I'll be able to give them a 5 star.

A bit pricey but you know where the extra went right into amazing food and attentive staff and service.   We go for the Sunday brunch and sample everything.

AR24qD0Y5HmryhvTFHCRZA.text: Amazing place to eat ! Took the garlic bread and spaghetti was fantastic.  A bit expansive but worth the price!

EnwiK-UCXi3yGfJEzRbbGA.text: This restaurant was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. We made a reservation for a big party and they took care of all of our needs.  First thing that I loved about this place was that they continuously topped off our water. I don't think I ever remember my water being low at lol.   Second, the food itself was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. I got the Bolognese spaghetti and it was THE BEST THING I HAVE EVER TASTED. I couldn't believe how good it was.    The servers were so nice and funny! They had us laughing the whole time and constantly checked up on us.   If I could give this a 100 star rating I would, but I guess a 5/5 star will do.

FlcL41TWdCUIZc5AKb-h3g.text: I recently had lunch at Buddy V's in the Venetian and walked away with a favorable impression.   Though it was busy, service was speedy and friendly.   I loved everything we tried except the strawberry lemonade which tasted like Hi-C.   The lasagna was great, but the superstar dish is the My Mother-In-Laws Linguine Shrimp Pasta.   HOLY FREAKIN' COW!  Damn delicious! I had intended on splitting it with my partner who ordered the lasagna but ended up eating it entirely on my own. It was too good to share!  The pasta tasted fresh and the fresh lemony sauce was to die for. Oh, and the prawns! HUGE!  Please do yourself a favor and try this one.   (I would've taken a picture but it looked so delicious I just jumped right in.)  Overall, I had a fantastic lunch at Buddy V's and will happily dine there again next time I'm in Vegas.

hjJ2OIDokgkx5UzQwPb7Qw.text: Really great place for a solid, not break-the-bank dinner in Vegas! The atmosphere of the restaurant is very fun while also still classy.  The menu has something for everyone! I had the lasagna, which was really heavy, but definitely really good. My mom had a salad and loved it! Definitely a must for anyone wanting to visit the Venetian and have good Italian food.

R-fsyOO6M6nCNWEanpSVdQ.text: Looking forward to checking out Buddy V's. Love the show Cake Boss and looking  forward to a late lunch at his restaurant. Food was Great. The best Garlic bread I ever had and my meatball sandwich was delish. My wigs margarita pizza was average. The problem I had was Happy hour is from 3-6pm, we were unaware of that and nobody told us. We had reservations at 3pm. After ordering and eating our apps, we noticed another table with some good looking slider (I love sliders) that were not on our menu. Turns out there is a Happy Hour menu. The prices are awesome and have different food from the regular menu. Our bill was $70+ if we ordered from the happy hour menu it would have been half of that. The manager came over and offered nothing but a "I'm sorry". Moral of the story, ask for the happy hour menu when you come here between 3 & 6pm.

uwSyLLSplA13rr6ZwcOPsQ.text: Great restaurant! Fun atmosphere with lots of pictures and an amazing view of Treasure Island. My mom and I ordered the garlic bread and decided to split the chicken parm. Everything came out quickly and all the servers and waiters were nice people. The garlic bread was AMAZING. The chicken parm was even better! We'd told our waiter that we were going to split it and they brought it out on two plates. My mom and I each got perfect portions! Fun, quick meal with great service and great food!

We came for brunch and I completely Italian girl-ed out, ordering three meals and devouring every single bite of every one of them.  I got the orrechiette, the linguine with clams and the margherita flatbread. They were all just so perfect.   They have a Cake Boss cocktail too (of course), and it tasted like actual liquefied cake.   No Buddy V to be seen, but I hiiiighly recommend. Another review I'm getting hungry writing.
