Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Cake Boss

2xFAjdbMtkfNpQzrS0sbKg.text: Great food, the grilled octopus delicious, the spaghetti bolognese divine!! And the complementary dessert for my Birthday was perfect.. We ate at the bar and the service from Christy and Courtney was great.. I highly recommend it..

X236oM5Hi3wQnsYWCgsAuA.text: Went here over the weekend and it was great! Definitely one of the best Italian places I've tried. It's located inside the Venetian grand canal shops.   Service was on point and super friendly. Food was delicious and generous portions, i could barely finish my food. The garlic bread was also yummy and each piece of bread served is big enough to split between two people to share. Cheesey and garlicky - it was an amazing combo. I got the carbonara but tried the friends Bolognese spaghetti and both were really delicious. If I come here next time I'm in Vegas I would probably order the spaghetti bc it's the best I've ever had while eating out. The cocktails are meh which is why I gave 4 stars, I tried 2-3 and I didn't really think they were anything special or worth paying for. But otherwise everything else was on point! I'm definitely gonna try to come back when I can if I'm in the area

cmM-tstkAKEWuXD2XEwW9A.text: I came here for lunch on a weekday. After receiving the regular lunch menu, I asked for the Express menu. For $22 I got the meatballs, chicken parmigiana, and cannoli. The chicken parmigiana is the best I've had. The complimentary bread is addictive. The meatballs and cannoli were both good and well above average. The service was very attentive without being overbearing.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandma&#39;s Meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiana, so delish

-denK5_Qe7ehGXNY4WWjtA.text: I came for an early meal as I had to catch a flight later. I was expecting the happy hour as I arrived at 5.50pm but they just changed it to 5.30pm instead of 6.30pm, what a bummer! We decided to eat here either way as we drove over just for this place. Glad we did as we got seated at one of the little Italian style tables "outside" and had Valerie as our server. She knew the menu by heart and made some excellent recommendations and answered all our questions. We decided to order the cucumber mule, the "my wife's eggplant parm" and the "grandma's meatballs". The drink was ok but that's not we were here for, the food was excellent! I am normally not a fan of eggplant Parmesan but I went with Valerie our server's recommendation and this did not disappoint at all! I absolutely loved the presentation but more so how good it tasted! The crunchiness was excellent. The meatballs were delicious too. I was so full after just these! I walked out with a good belly thank you to the father of it, Buddy V:) absolutely loved the food and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

zBro1KznbE7hs01tgdMmkw.text: First time there.  We had a certificate, it was an anniversary and we love Italian food, so it was opportunity to check out Buddy's place.  We started with Buddy's Caprese, which is made with Burrata cheese.  Creamy inside, firm outside, delicious all the way.   We then as Cheese Ravioli and The Lasagna.  Great sauces flavors, and the herbs used in the sauces added a nice herby touch.  The meats used in the lasagna included a spicy Italian sausage.  That was it.  The other flavors fell in line.  The Italian Wedding Cake we had for dessert was Wow!  The cannoli filling was a great touch.  For service, it was good as it gets.  We were greeted promptly and seated promptly.  Our server was right on top of us being seated.  From offering to take an order for drinks and appetizers, to being there to answer menu questions, to taking the order, he was right there.  He came back to ask us about or order, how it tastes, and tell us little things about what we ordered, he was attentive, but not smothering.  They definitely train their staff very well.  We observed other servers acting the same way.  From greeting to returning our paid bill, our server was polite, funny, informative and top notch.  Our server experience alone was worth the visit.  We'll be back since there are many more items to explore.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy V&#39;s Italian Wedding Cake Dessert
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy V&#39;s Caprese

Luhk0iiP2cvRA3Cl0HeeMw.text: Best Italian meal I've had in a long time!! The service was AMAZING, the food was just perfect. Highly recommend if you're in the area. I would definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy Garlic Bread
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

6BJy8NLg4KONuuezWUvy1g.text: I was so excited to try here because I'm a huge fan of Cake Boss.  Let me tell you- it was SO good.  Enrique - our waiter's wingman - was so attentive.  The rigatoni was incredible. The pizza was good but not amazing. Told the Chicken parm was delicious. Told the linguine was very tasty.  COME HERE.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni, Cheese pizza, Linguine, Chicken Parm

-XYskTlbBawY-kCJCmvT0Q.text: I have to say this place is a must visit in Vegas. In the past 6 months I've tried a lot of the hot spots but Buddy V's I'm going to visit again! The portion sizes are amazing for the price, the food is delicious (who doesn't love perfectly cooked Italian cuisine), the ambience is cute and the service is excellent. I sat at the bar where Jason was bartending. He knows his cocktails and you can tell he enjoys his job. He found a way to build a connection with everyone sitting at the busy bar. Highly recommend this restaurant!

leqtvIUQF7xH8o321YIB_Q.text: So good. Sat at the bar because the wait was up to an hour for main dining room. Lovely atmosphere here, friendly and professional wait staff. Food was excellent-had the prix fixed menu offering. Have to say the orecchiette with sausage, pesto, tomatoes was memorable. Lots of Strong flavors. Tiramisu was deconstructed and not my favorite way to have it-also a very small dessert. Still, tasted very good. I was most impressed with the management who kept walking the restaurant asking how diners" meals were.

TqmgNtJ__ZY-MFV2V6j_OQ.text: I was soooo satisfied with my experience here! My mom and I were wandering around The Palazzo not knowing where to go for dinner. We both were craving some good Italian food, and decided to come by Buddy V's for dinner. The menu had so many options, and the prices were so reasonable, so why not? Fancy restaurants on the strip are usually SO OVER PRICED, with sucky food. So we were a bit nervous. But this was not like any other place there!!   I ordered the Chicken Parmesan which was so freaking delicious. I can't even explain it. The chicken melted in your mouth, it was perfection. We also ordered the cheese ravioli- amazing!! The portion size was so big, we easily could have shared one dish. But we ended up eating everything.   They also serve complimentary bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar before your entrees arrive. It was a great experience, ambiance was great, and we got a beautiful window seat to enjoy the view outside. I would definitely recommend!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm in bottom, and top is cheese ravioli
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Window seat view :)

S1FtHOiiG69hYHMTs96BnQ.text: Meatballs great flavor. Nice texture  Ceasar salad v nice. Can taste the anchovy and served w fried polenta instead of croutons.  Tomato soup, too salty but otherwise good. Very rich.  Carbonera excellent and also rich. Nice contrast of texture with some crunch too. Excellent service with effective waitress and water was always filled.  Nutella dessert puts most molten lava desserts to shame. Must get it. Too loud.

sVzRXpdRr9u42zTt2HVKAA.text: If you like the Olive Garden and Buca Di Peppo then you'll love this place.  if your idea if a good Italian meal is something you'd get in a large northeastern city, you'll find this place very average

b7zpW8UfMC3NEWvgpo6E6g.text: Excellent dining experience! We reserved a table through Open Table and we didn't have to wait at all. We had a nice booth near the open kitchen. The wait staff was attentive and nice. Both of our dishes, chicken piccata and chicken Marsala were both amazing, film of flavor and perfect portions. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Picata

HxkUwAFFtUuGi5LXvCd7Qg.text: Was in Vegas for a fun weekend and then a conference, so I got to try Buddy V's twice. The first time was for a late Sunday brunch, but we just got there too late for the buffet brunch, which looked really good. Gonna definitely have to come back for that some time.  Me and my date tried the salumi plate, which was pretty good, especially since it came with crispy grilled baguette slices. Schmeared some of the blue cheese on a slice and then layered the salumi and prosciutto for a nice little open face mini-sammy. Yum! I ordered the chicken parm, which came with a side of spaghetti marinara and my date ordered the caesar salad and we split them both between us, which was more than enough food since the caesar was pretty good size and the chicken parm came with two equal sized filets covered with cheese and sauce. The caesar came with polenta croutons, which were amazing and would have been a great appetizer on their own with a side of red sauce! Crispy on the outside and warm and fuzzy in the middle. Almost took away from how good the caesar was. My date thought there was too much dressing, but I like it that way. The chicken parm was awesome! Probably the best I've ever had anywhere. Good thick tender piece of chicken, nice breading, and great cheese to chicken ration with a nice marinara on top. But the coup de grace was the unassuming side of pasta on the dish. I don't know what it was, but it was just spaghetti marinara but the size and texture of the pasta was just amazing. It was like the unknown actor stealing the spotlight from all the big name actors in a movie!   I went back for lunch later in the week and got the Express lunch for $22 which included a 3 course selection. I got the caesar, spaghetti bolognese, and lemon sorbet. All were awesome, expecially for the price. But the spaghetti again was amazing. And the bolognese sauce was nice and thick and held to the pasta like glue. Easily the best spaghetti dish I've ever had. Again, I don't know what it was about the pasta (size? texture? taste? perfectly al dente?) but it was like crack in pasta form. I can't wait to go back! And this is from a guy who try's not to eat pasta much because it's a carb bomb. And I don't think I've ever had a more perfectly balanced sorbet. Not too sweet, not too tart (lemon sorbet). And 2 big scoops! What a great way to finish the meal and cleanse the pallet!  Well done, Buddy V! Well done!

g3DzTDk9F5iwCF_KZ50wUQ.text: I'm a huge fan of Buddy, Cake Boss so we tried his restaurant. Food was amazing! Portions are very small for their price. We ordered pasta, thought the serving was too small for $28.   But you can never go wrong with their desserts. Really the best!!! Cannolis and lobster tails are scrumptious! Tried them in Vegas and New York.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w6ZYVnomxJ5BDlnMp1cQAQ.text: Excellent location with great service. The food was delicious and I enjoyed every bit of it. The tomato & basil soup was really great way to start off things and make sure you end it with their popular canoli. No complaints and honestly one of the better friendly services.

fAoL_XPFmBEuvqbZxcBQKQ.text: The food here is delicious and the service is 5 star. Very friendly and enjoyable atmosphere. Christian was the best server. We will be back on our next trip to Vegas.  Great location across from Carlo's Bakery.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A-qo6QwKOGzue2U9vD68BA.text: We've been here twice. Once for happy hour and the other for Sunday Brunch. Both times the food and service were amazing!! Definitely would recommend!

D8TtWk9p-GbCWRphMDid8w.text: Was really looking forward to have dinner here. My partners Spaghetti was nice but we both agreed that my Lasagna wasn't. I didn't even eat half of it and when I told the waitress that I didn't like it that much she didn't even reply. It was okay, but severely overpriced, felt like a let down overall.

zvDUzvGqLNB4o063zmXLfA.text: An unexpectedly good place to eat, we didn't really have a look online on where to eat, just went to the casino and picked a restaurant. We didn't realise it belonged to that 'Buddy' from the TLC cake boss until we sat down. There was virtually no wait at all and we got a table within minutes. The service was wonderful and the staff seemed well organised and knew what they were doing. We were given fresh bread to start off with, just like an authentic Italian resturant. Then we ordered the Sunday gravy and the mac and cheese. Both dishes were full of flavour and was delicious! It was a perfect amount of food for 2 people, however it was such a shame we couldn't squeeze dessert in.

8EJOL8K7dJQcJoQBhylkHw.text: This place is amazing!! I asked for best tasting dessert and they delivered. Mouthwatering!!

9eZuJSChaDAgqneN96Y3Xg.text: One of the best places for a lasagne on the strip! This place was honestly not the first place we had picked to go for dinner that day, but some how we ended up there and we were not disappointed! The service to begin with is AMAZING. Our server told us that one lasagne would be good for the 3 of us, but we were being naive and didn't want to believe it. So we got 3 lasagnes, because of the high praise from the other staff as well. Our server was not joking, that lasagne is one plate you might never finish in one sitting. All three of us finished only about a quarter of our lasagnes before we were stuffed to our eye balls. We literally couldn't move. But it was so delicious, form the sauce to the meat and the cheese! They also make fantastic drinks and offer great insight on the various dishes. The restaurant offers great views, and even though we didn't get to try it, we heard the high praise of their cheese cake!  TLDR: Get one lasagne for 3 people, you will all be stuffed!

QrZ5drkebVt7b07L6EIfHg.text: The food was amazing. The service was amazing. The Assistant GM Adam Margolies was the perfect host of the evening. Speaking of amazing food: Mozz Carozza, meat and cheese board, meatballs, calamari, egg plant, tenderloin, scallops, italian greens, and great wine; and last but not least, the dessert; Lobster tail, cannoli and Nutella cake; It was a few slices of Heaven in Sin City.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BEST Italian dinner we&#39;ve had in a long time. This definitely made up for the lost time. The Iacovoni family- TWO THUMBS UP!

QE3Vy6SzGkZYlt17wjSgvQ.text: My friend and I went here because our flight landed earlier, and we wanted to find a decent restaurant to eat in. We got there at around 4 and ordered a meatball sub and caprese salad.   I didn't like how they didn't give us bread but instead some type of cracker. We were hungry, so we munched on until we saw our entrees.  The meatball sub was decent looking with seasoned fries. The fries were tasty, but the meatball sub wasn't worth the money. It was tiny and tasted like it had been heated in the microwave. It was still passable if it was about $10.  The caprese salad was not worth the $16 we paid. From left to right were a whole tomato, a small blob of caprese, about 12 cherry tomato halves drenched in dressing, and a spinach leaf. It was the tiniest salad I've ever eaten. Wasn't that good and definitely not worth the money.  If you're hungry and don't want to spend over $30 for two people, try somewhere else!

XH8ZM2kIwfsexVi0Cu7rgQ.text: Food was so awesome we didn't have room to try any dessert! Get the panzanella...seriously so good. We also split lasagna and vodka rigatoni.   Wonderful and well priced for vegas!

5CSciS2f9DBiIITDYjMpkQ.text: Had tomato basil soup, chicken Parmesan and cake. Everything was ok but comparable to Buca de Peppo or Eastside Marios. Actually the later two I would consider going to before buddy vs. I love his Sunday gravy recipe so I thought this would be an excellent place. Spaghetti was a little underdone. Server was nice. Beer selection was ok. Probably wouldn't recommend or go back.

dBKTL0X8cLTCpR8O53zBqA.text: It's a pretty good Italian place.  Good atmosphere, reasonable prices for Vegas and super great waitstaff. I'm a pretty snotty Italian reviewer so for most people this may be a 4 star. It has a fairly mainstream flavor. Do try the garlic bread and buddy's Sunday gravy.  Both really good.

f1erB54C1arIhnRg_2uHRg.text: Best meal in Las Vegas in recent memory. Great service - thank you, Georgio. Amazing lasagna and linguini with clams. The croutons in the Caesars salad were warm and made of polenta. And the desert! the cannoli is what dreams are made of.

tIhajua58xzhdKi3rkh7_A.text: Food and service were great.  We reserved ahead of time, we were accommodated quickly upon arrival and given a nice view of the strip.  Fresh baked focaccia was great.  Grilled octopus was a little spicy but good.  Best dish of the night for us was the Orecchiette & Italian Sausage.

fpKSMgE-6acg_-wx_AGmHg.text: Wow. I was wondering if Buddy Valastro was going to be a sell out by lending his name to restaurants and bakeries across the US. I can definitely say no. I judge Italian restaurants by their sauce and their meatballs. I know both being from the Philly/NJ/NY area. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I was served a very generous, steaming portion. The presentation was lovely. It was very fresh. The meatballs were outstanding. Firm, flavorful and delicious. The spaghetti was perfectly al dente, and the sauce was as if it came from an Italian grandmother's kitchen. The service was very very good. Friendly, knowledgable and attentive to any need. Bravo Buddy Valastro!

1tuX6QbiqSJVf-WgEHCK3w.text: Always great to come back here. Cheese board is always great. Very fun atmosphere and servers are always great. I recommend coming here for the authentic Italian.

KRZLS5xnrlDu_EectswM6A.text: This will remain one of my always go to places when I'm in Vegas. I've been to Vegas twice now for special occasions and Buddy V's is always where we enjoy dinner. We were there on 7/7 celebrating my daughters 21st birthday. Everything was just perfect. Our server, which I don't remember his name and upset that I can't give him some recognition was just awesome. Attentive with personality. Made our dining experience fun, but still classy. Our food was delicious. My hubby and I shared the chicken Marsala. So much flavor and cooked to perfection. Drinks from the bar were made perfectly. Just an overall wonderful night. Oh and by the way we were a party of 8 with separate checks. No problems at all. Thank you Buddy V's for making our birthday celebration just absolutely PERFECT!

5INyQMzm3_4OgiBP305O_g.text: Nice Italian restaurant with many homage's to Buddy's family. I love his show, so I wanted to try his food- got the prix fixe meal with the Cesar salad, chicken parm, and cannolli. The ceasar salad was super good and had polenta croutons. Our attendant (not the waiter) was AWESOME! He kept our waters full, and came by with more bread. Our waiter, was just okay. He was super chatty with other tables, and he tried to up-sell everything. Kind of felt a little pushy at times. Overall, we had a great time. Just had a horrible view of the Trump tower when we went but a cool view of the Strip. Ain't nobody wants to look at that tower while they're dining. But that's just my opinion.

itHmyzZNo-gut1zJOSZBjg.text: Yes, yes, yes! This guy does more than cakes, and he does it well! We came here for Sunday Brunch and we were not disappointed! Everything was outstanding, and well prepared. My wife raved about the tomato soup, and she was right -- it was awesome! Oh, and the waitstaff was amazing! Dirty plates didn't linger on our table, and our beverages were never empty. Great job! Spend the money and indulge in this great experience!

1DD_5QEToSuI5Dz19HGNLg.text: Very good place! Some of the best gravy you will find outside grandmas kitchen. You can bank on that.  Also the best Mac n Cheese I've ever had. If only it had Lobster as an option!   The meatballs are excellent. The Lasagana was excellent. The Caprese was excellent. The calamari was very good.  We will definitely be back.  Oh and the bartender was super hot. We didn't catch her name but we both appreciated her mucho.

9zaurE_NztL-Po-VXzwB9Q.text: Made dinner reservations before going to see the Fortunate Son in Concert.  The cheese bread is good, and I am not a big fan of cheese.  I ordered the linguini  and clam sauce and my wife got the spaghetti with meat balls. We topped it off with the Apple pie ala mode.

rne_PFNPl4anjgg3ax2o7A.text: Well to begin with the restaurant was almost empty at lunchtime so not only was there no wait time but also we got a table with a view.  My husband and I decided to share an antipasto and a pasta. We started with Grandma's Meatballs. I typically don't like red sauce or meatballs but this was soo soo good.  Then came Nona's Lasagna Al Forgo. They gave it to us in 2 separate dishes which made it a lot easier to share. The portion size was extremely generous especially for lunch. But we felt that it was very similar in taste to Grandma's Meatballs. Maybe ordering similar sauce dishes wasn't the right decision.

d3Zb6y-EGr3Rzn67taBwwA.text: We went for lunch without a reservation and sat at the bar. The chicken Parmesan was outstanding. Very fresh ingredients and fantastic iced tea. We really enjoyed it and had a view out to the strip.

-1mqnP3wwSxhjNzW9klQ4A.text: Our family had a great meal here last night. The only problem we had was the waiter pushing everything but what we were ordering, pushing us towards the more expensive items on the menu. Making us feel guilty for not ordering dessert.   The food was amazing and filling,
