iCj4_iG3fCO92WoF_u8lhQ.text: This is probably my favorite Italian restaurants so far. We waited for 30 minutes my son and I. The staff is very friendly and attentive. The wine list reasonable. I ordered piccante chicken it had amazing flavors the pasta taste great. My son order the cheese pizza and ate every bite of it. We didn't have room for dessert. After looking at their menu for the desserts it looks very appealing I just wished we had room in our stomach for us to order. I do recommend this place. This is a kid friendly atmosphere with fine dining all mix together. I will go back again.

4gX46fo_MEfFw_GehYpYyg.text: I am definitely a fan of this place.  The whole restaurant reminds me of classy establishment that will not scare you away from wearing jeans and a tshirt.  The food is Great and the service is excellent.  Our waitress yesterday was I believe Graciela and she did an excellent 5 star job !  Nuggs had the classic cheese pizza.. of course.. and although the presentation was nice the sauce tasted like it was straight from the can (in my opinion).  It did not compliment the pizza at all and I could only compare it to what would seem like Hunts canned tomato sauce accompanied with good pizza dough and cheese.  My friend had the Chicken Parm , and I had the Bucatini Carbonara which I hoped I spelled correctly.  Definitely NO complaints on those two dishes!  I would definitely try those if you are not sure what to get.  Cheesy Goodness accompanied with the subtle flavor of bacon and texture of what seemed to be bread crumbs in the Bucatini are going to have me coming back in July for a double order!  Super deliciousness! My only sadness is that for 23.00 nugget stole most of it from me and there wasn't enough for me.  It's a portion size designed for an average person I would imagine but being that I'm on the bit larger side of the spectrum I could have eaten two plates easily.  Chicken Parm with spaghetti was demolished by my friend so I would imagine that should tell you how good it was.  The Cheese board is also a good add to your list of things to get while you are here.  Great selection of meats and cheeses but the bread was not enough for the amount on the board. Desserts I might have to say are phenomenal !  I would have to say a best choice would be the Nutella cake and ice cream.  I say this only because after our meal the nugget had finished most of her pizza and half of my pasta so when I asked her if she wanted a dessert she replied NO.  I received my nutella cake and after having one bite I asked her again .. Are you sure?  It's nutella cake.. and the result about dessert is in my picture for this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nuggets response to &#34;would you like to try my dessert?&#34; This is after she said she was too full and didn&#39;t want anything.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball sandwich with really good fries!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with chicken parm

U-92FOhBb7yB6RYaigjoRQ.text: Just incredible and a must stop in Las Vegas!!!   Order the birthday cake for dessert

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wu8pCrD40im7sR-CAz0FoQ.text: I would like to say thank you to buddy v'S  FOR everything they did to accomidate us for our wedding reception. Our waitress was great. Thank you Beth. Tammy thank you for helping with preparation. The food was great and Beth was verry atentive with all our guess the service was amazing thank you Buddy V's for making our day so much better. I highly recomend this resturant for any event.

rToQHFwGyHjoulyiB86Hng.text: Ordered pasta, italian birthday cake and meatballs. Bartended was attentive. Price is ok with the food and its in Vegas so a lil bit pricey.

0NNio1PPw9GPSolgPoSziQ.text: Such a great experience - food was phenomenal. Atmosphere and service was on point. I'd recommend to anyone.

SvxJmS69ZKntfuX12c7PzA.text: Underwhelming brunch. Limited selection of dishes and desserts. Best part is the appetizer bar with very fresh green olives and thinly sliced cold meat. Small fresh carrots/veggie bar at the kids section were also quite refreshing. Friendly service but won't come back.

qGQuUIc4kYrwkfnRITjsRg.text: Had chicken parmesan with garlic cheese toast. Both we good with generous portions. It's a good family Italian meal, at a 5 star price.  Great Italian restaurants that for the price maybe better choices.

6EJxkmh-WTJt-5-jscschw.text: Snap! I go to Vegas frequently and I ALLWAYS hit Buddy V's at least once! Everything is fabulous but the Cheese Ravioli is A-mazing!!! Save room for the famous deserts (the lobster tail is the best IMO)

PeJFbQVqH59deilHwzPP4w.text: During lunch they have a buffet. It's not spectacular by any means. I was expecting more from the dessert section. The rest of the food was early average. I enjoyed the live music though.

ujOxBxtbT12Emh8pOTeEoQ.text: This was a wonderful brunch. The food is fresh and authentic. If you love Italian food this is the place. We opted for the all-you-can-drink Bloody Mary's, Bellini's, mimosas. The service was awesome and they were on top of the drinks and the refills. Although we didn't have children with us, there was a specific section for children's Foods like chicken fingers, Etc and desserts. This is our second time humor and we will be back.

DQhnwi98EJdGD8_CvvbwUw.text: This was hands down one of the top places I've ever eaten. Amazing food, beautiful cozy and inviting atmosphere and the service was phoenomial to say the least! I believe our servers name was Georgio? Not positive on the name but he was spectacular! SUPER friendly, helped us find great drink and food choices based on what we were looking for. Answered  every question we had thoroughly, he was quick and effiecient, even made us laugh and took a picture for us before we left! Of course knowing this is the 'Cake Boss' restaurant, needless to say the dessert was on point. The drinks...they were certainly not messing around with a lack of alcohol but it wasn't so much to ruin the flavor of the drink! With their current special, depending on what drink you get, you can take the glass home. Overall lovely experience and I wish we had on in Kansas City!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing tasting fun drink, with just enough alcohol! You get to keep the glass too

Ma6dZvVqAEiKXI0siCGtIA.text: Amazing food!!! I ordered off the kids menu, Alfredo and mushrooms with chicken parm. OMG I didn't even eat half, SO RICH.

UR0EtOC0_6LPCoE3KqIrdA.text: I didn't know Cake Boss had a restaurant here and I actually found it through Instagram. My friend and I came on Saturday and we sat at the bar since it was happy hour. We ordered the sausage and pepper sliders, mac n cheese and Italian birthday cake. And we were very pleased with our order. The sliders tasted like what you would expect typical sausage and peppers, but tasty. Mac n cheese had chicken and veggies, which is more like a entree versus what most Americans think of it being a side dish.  Service was standard and considering we sat at the bar I've never had a bartender treat me poorly, but I must admit she was kind of awkward towards us. Lastly, the Italian birthday cake was really moist, but not dippy. I can't wait to come here again and try the Chicken Parmigiana, a customer next to us ordered this and it looked delicious. I highly recommend Buddy V's to anyone especially if you're at Venetian already.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian birthday cake
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and pepper sliders
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

zMQitHKcFrQ3H9PGWUcvJA.text: Went to Buddy V's today. First let me start off by saying the hostess  tall thin looks like asian descent with ponytail who sat us was not very friendly. We asked to sit at a booth after finding the chairs too slippery and uncomfortable. When we asked to sit at booth it was like we bothered her.   Once we got to sit down we were promptly served by a great busboy. Our waiter was Rocco.  He did a great job. We were talking and were not quite ready to make our order just yet but the rude hostess came over took all menus but one and said we could share? Does this place not have enough menus?   The food was ok. I got the angus burger on brioche and others got pasta items off the menu also said it was ok but not for price. Fries were not savory. It was just ok and overpriced.   In the past I have tried the zappolis and wedding cake and they were phenomenal!!! But on this trip  I was just here for food. I wanted to give this place a better score but I was not happy with the limited selection, prices and the taste.   Maybe just a bakery there would of been great.

kbhj9E0qPKvF-nFVRfMn-g.text: Such a great restaurant! Great vibe, great food and even better people! The food was fresh and incredible! Especially the croutons! The wine selection is great. Service is great. And to top it off, we got to meet the Cake Boss himself.

wqxHFLLtOhnt_yiYHzIUYQ.text: Absolutely amazing food, ate here two nights in a row because it was THAT good!  Sunday Gravy is incredible, sorry to say but better than my mom and grandmas...and I'm Italian! Garlic Bread is killer!  Excellent place to get authentic Italian, service is great and vibe is not stuffy like most Vegas celebrity restaurants.   Lobster tail for desert!!

94ck5XbWFpH06r5JwAsNgw.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome.  That is how I would describe every aspect of this restaurant.  My wife is a huge cake boss fan, and we were told Buddy opened a restaurant.  Of course, she thought we should try it and I was glad she forced the issue.   We started with grandmas meatballs, and they were tender and delicious.  Followed this up with the Lasagne and I will say that I am a bit of a Lasagne snob and am very picky.  Up to this visit, I openly stated that my home made lasagne was the best I have ever had, and I now have to admit that Buddy's was a bit better.  A very healthy portion that I could not finish, and the mix of cheeses, meats, pasta, spices and sauce was a True delight.  The waiter we had was great and was extremely helpful with the menu and wine choices.  I would suggest to anyone to go here for a good hearty, filling meal.  Great job Buddy!

yNNJMRd5wztN7LOJ2SmAvA.text: Excellent food!  I had the chicken parm.  The chicken was good but the spaghetti side that came with it was fantastic!  The pasta was perfect and the sauce was the perfect amount and a great taste.  I look forward to returning.  Great environment too.  Yum!!!!

npmZP4A8zEDKM9Io5EJ3fA.text: Peter is amazing! The service was great and Peter, our server, was so accommodating and sweet! He made a recommendation for the linguini with clams which was delicious! We had a blast and Peter even gave us canolis to go! Thank you Peter for making our first visit to Buddy V's so great! We'll be back!

LJiDYgpwi8MCDdpfQeQShA.text: My husband and I ate here in late June 2017 in between lunch/dinner crowd. We were seated and our waiter was spot on (not hovering but available whenever needed). I had seen Eggplant Parm on the lunch menu but noted it was not on the "Sunset" menu (3-5pm) and our waiter responded he thought they could manage that but said he couldn't promise...but he delivered. OMG...it was DIVINE!!! It was the perfect balance of crispy eggplant on the outside and not too squishy on the inside. My husband got the Spaghetti Pomodoro - it was delicious. But, honestly, it was the Caesar Salad that was even more memorable. My husband took a bite of the "crouton" and told me I had to try it. Well, it was polenta squares that were deep-fried. WOW! It transformed the salad to something we had never experienced. Their Acai Mojito was great, too. Impressive and memorable!

cfg0Cte_QSrI4WRbBkzEFg.text: Enjoyed the lasagna and the chicken parm. I'm not a fan of canollis, but these were especially good. Also enjoyed the Italian bday cake dessert.

eGFLjbeQNFoHrXFnWBF0Lw.text: Best Happy hour food, service & ambiance we've had in Vegas. Definitely would recommend!

myZLqmai9gLbv2TpeKyWJQ.text: Food was really good. Pasta, salads, appetizers and bread  all yummy!!! Service was so so. Bakery had a small line. But worth the wait for all the goodies.

VOLmvlgyGdQDV9ZLlruw6w.text: We enjoyed everything about this place!  We sat in there "outdoor" seating. It was freezing out when we were there so it was nice to pretend to be outside. While we were sitting their was a cute little skit/show. The bread and olive oil that came out was exceptional. The olive oil had a deep yellow-green color, there was no salt and pepper on our table. I would have liked to add a little for dipping.  Chris ordered the pasta of the day, lasagna. SOOOO GOOD! The bechamel was layered thin with a great nutty flavor the sauce was light but flavorful and the cheese was gooie with small charred bubbles that still had their crunch when it got to our table.  I ordered the charred octopus salad OH MY GOODNESS so so so so SO SO SO SO SO GOOD! I was a little iffy about the potato but I should have never doubted whoever made this salad lol. It was excellent.

F-FdOqZLOSpx9TtYvXM82A.text: 5 stars for service. Team work, communication, a sense of urgency, and very polite. Our food was SALTY (chicken piccata and pasta with vodka sauce)!!!!!  My boyfriend and I have worked in hospitality for years and understand that mishaps.....happen. We don't rush to complain but the food was not made for consumption. HOWEVER, the service and quick replacement of meals made all the difference. Server and manager were fantastic in having us leave there very satisfied. I ended up getting a new chicken piccata with less salty sauce on the side and my boyfriend opted for lasagna which was awesome (light and airy and full of flavor). Octopus appetizer was very good and not too salty!  We shall be back Buddy! By the way, great team you have.

IqQbt1v9Zm6GITnaz6qp2w.text: The express lunch menu was a great value for the quality and quantity of food. Choice of appetizer/salad, entree and dessert.  Chicken Parmesan and spaghetti with Bolognese sauce was excellent. Service was fantastic. Beautiful and yummy deserts.

YyLYkOMXaO4F7KhZ1_cTqg.text: We went to Buddy V's on opening night. Our server was a little nervous but did a good job. Buddy and his family were in the restaurant and were very friendly. I had Caesar salad which featured freshly made croutons that were crunchy on the outside and creamy inside. For a main course I had the chicken parm it was nicely breaded still crunchy just enough sauce and small side of spaghetti. For dessert 3 of us shared the lobster tail and Nutella cake. The lobster tail pastry was a little tough but the filling was great the Nutella cake was amazing. The decor was very welcoming like grandmas house and whimsical with bakery influenced designs.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whisk lighting fixture

XMdJiIryaByYbTie_a7gag.text: Gr8 restaurant hidden away in the Venetian. Went for lunch and service was fast and friendly. Ordered the chicken parm and it was awesome!! Not the biggest portion of pasta but more than enough chicken. Didn't make it to the pastry side but it was very busy over there. Def will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

jhV-nQwPLDYqQHXMSFyh9A.text: Went to happy hour and sat in the bar. The staff was nice but there was confusion about getting the happy hour menu. Ordered drinks and watched them sitting on the bar until I got up to get them.   Finally spoke to the assistant general manager, Adam who listened to our concerns & he was kind enough to buy us a second round of cocktails. Service suddenly approved dramatically. The meatball sliders were fabulous & the drinks generous.   No place is perfect, but I respect a place that goes out of its way to make things right. I'll definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The BEST olives I have ever tasted!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fabulous turkey slider
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular menu cover

DWKnlXuFXU5ZYut0JoYD2w.text: When arriving we had a huge joyful greeting from the hosts. We had reservations but I want a widow seat for my party.  They quickly when into action to make my request happen. They said it would be 20min but was only 10. Wow the appetizers are very flavorful we had mom's meat balls and eggplant, I recommend both. Very diverse wine and drink list. Main dish was cooked to perfection, the steak and the veal was our choices both very well prepared and delightful. Server has very good and attentive too. 2 piece music group in bar area was outstanding. This is a great pic for a good meal. Peace out!!

-CfpTmilSnuzzm5lzoKDkQ.text: Excellent food and service!  We were seated quickly, ordered promptly, food came out quickly, and the wait staff was attentive throughout our experience!  The chicken parm is excellent and the tiramisu is second to none!

wRUj567czr0ziRZEt7guxg.text: After a lengthy research online we picked Buddy V's at the Venetian for our Easter Brunch. The selection was not huge but all the items were fresh and had amazing flavor. The salad and bread selection even featured a traditional hot cross buns. Carved meat station had slab bacon along with an incredibly tender leg of lamb. The pastas and meatballs were an excellent nod to the Italian side and made me want to go back for dinner. My kids favorite item was the French toast. The cake boss did not disappoint for the dessert. Individual tiramisu was perhaps the best I ever had and the mini cannoli's had very flavorful filling but we're probably made a bit too early and the shells were already a bit soggy. Unfortunately the only downside to our meal was the grumpy servers and unfriendly host staff. It is a family atmosphere place and they all acted annoyed to be serving children. A pleasant attitude and a smile goes a long way to make you feel welcome. Overall we are glad we picked Buddy V's to celebrate Easter at. As locals we will most likely be back.

JtiP8Xlh8Q7OlaB-XKDQNQ.text: Buddy V's is mall food at best.  Not bad but not great either.  We were a group of 12 and our waiter was in overdrive pushing the bill up.  We asked about ordering family style, he had us each order an individual dish and we left a ton of food behind.  He recommended the veal to each one of us (the most expensive item) and when I ordered chicken picatta he asked if he could bring veal picatta instead.  Same for wines.

JoCiITRcC4dN0HjSM-cBng.text: The pasta is fresh and  I love that.  The meatballs are flavorful and really do taste homemade, like mom used to make.  The cannoli for dessert, which my husband loves, tasted good to me too, even though I just had one bite.  I do not like cannoli but I sure liked theirs!  The service was horrible.  Absolutely positively horrible.  Nice people, don't get me wrong, but horrible service.  The "bread guy" needed to be told what to do in his job but why couldn't he remember on his own you fill up the water glasses and you keep offering the focaccia?  The waiter was sure to tell me that it was his helper's 19th birthday, but who cares?  Do your job and party later.  The floor manager with the dark black hair and who I believe was dressed too casually for this type of price point restaurant wasn't doing much of anything.  He barely looked up from his texting while showing a waitress what he was texting and laughing about to mumble "Good night.".  Help your waiters out man!  Be a team! I believe the waiters have too many tables to be able to give you the service you deserve for paying those "on the strip" prices.  My hubby did state his linguini with white clam sauce was not flavorful at all.  He ended up asking for a lot of cheese on top, which you have to wait for also since it is not on the table.  Don't be cheap Buddy, put the cheese on the table!

efHo8-VKTt8tvFAAIUbt4w.text: I give it a three only because they took forever to bring our food. It did not feel like how Buddy describes it. Very slow service. Did not exceed my expectations for the first time visit.

utjqVzKss_7n-l_yEP-KYw.text: Buddy V's has absolutely become the Italian restaurant gold standard on the strip. Not only is it an affordable meal but the food is exquisite. It's "real" Italian food that tastes homemade but is served in a Strip-type location and atmosphere. I especially love the ravioli. We've tried the Sunday gravy, the lasagna, the spaghetti, the Veal parmesan, the kale (which is amazing) and my favorite the parmesan polenta (delicious). Really I have never had anything that wasn't good at Buddy V's. The tiramisu is excellent (although I admit I was very disappointed when they went away from the traditional large portion down to the small mason jar). They used to have an amazing portion tiramisu  with surprisingly moist chocolate cake at the bottom. I have eaten a LOT of tiramisu all over the country and this is hands down the best. Even better than the great restaurants I enjoyed in NYC. If you'er a local or are in Vegas for a vacation, go to Buddy V's.

FnYPhUdR5zzFLcWjca6YnA.text: This used to be one of my favorites in LAS.  Went there tonight with a friend all the while telling him how great the food and service was going to be.  Boy was I wrong.  While the food was adequate, the service was non-existent.  To get anything, we had to constantly flag down staff members.  While some may accuse me of being too picky, I think the fact that the restaurant did not have fresh grated parm cheese available (they claim their wheel broke) is a major blunder for an Italian themed restaurant.  I mentioned how poor the service was to one of the floor managers on our way out, and all she could say was "Please don't let that stop you from coming back."  Really?  That's it?  Spend a couple of hundred dollars on dinner only to be told that?  I think it will be long time before I head back that way.  Which is too bad because the bone-in veal parm, with our without parm cheese, is really a wonderful dish. Ironically, shortly after we were seated, a table of 10 or 11 was seated next to us.  The wait staff fawned all over those folks and the chef even came out to meet the leader of their pack.  I guess we weren't high enough rollers to get the attention that we expected.

ZBa4V7KDlvep6KghvJ5-JA.text: Well we didn't get to actually eat here because the hostess wouldn't seat us. I had promised my kids a treat from Carlos' Bakery but the line was huge, so we decided to get a table here instead & have dessert & drinks. It was around 3:30 & as it was between lunch & dinner the restaurant was mostly empty. The hostess informed us that since we weren't actually eating a meal she couldn't seat us at a table reserved for people who were eating a meal.  Hmmm, in a mostly empty restaurant. We would have had a few cocktails each as well as desserts, & we always tip well because regardless of how much or little we eat, the staff still has to do their job. So I guess my one star rating is for the hostess. Maybe we'll be back some day...

lZSJyShbV5eQkkVCX5V2ew.text: Just returned from dinner at Buddy V's.  We had no prior knowledge, but the place looked interesting.  Suffice it to say everything was first rate, truly outstanding.  Georgio was our waiter. We took all of his suggestions and couldn't be more pleased.  He really took excellent care of us.  The food and drinks were all top notch.  I highly recommend Buddy V's!

7PwAcmeEIOwOlcMu9V1hmA.text: Absolutely loved this place! It reminds me of family from the moment you walk in! Te atmosphere is remarkable. The decor blends perfectly with what Buddy stands for and who he is. The most memorable aspect would have to be the chandeliers. They had whisks handing from them as well. That shows creativity and passion. The food was amazing! The flavor profile was on point and we got to try the canolis.   Overall  service was great,  the place was clean, the dishes were affordable, and the environment felt like home. Thanks Buddy for a great experience in Vegas!

6aG-CFO0xB0EjeCnCyj4fQ.text: I'm not a big Italian foodie but everything for dinner that I tasted was amazing. I ended up having the beef tenderloin and I ate every bite. 2 days later I'm still craving it. Wasn't too impressed with the desserts but did like the creme brulee a lot.

aPosbAMIfTn3yo5RG4STRQ.text: Absolutely LOVED everything here! We asked for a table by the window and had a nice view. The drinks are all really great. Highly recommend the chicken parm. We ended the night with a cannoli which was PERFECT!!

Yp5o5XVsI-yKzNqxjabbpg.text: Very casual place. The food was delicious, we had Caesar salad, eggplant parmigan and chicken parmessan. The food took awhile to come out, but the wait staff were very attentive and friendly.

w-Z5QQyYvOBMDzgpiPUZnQ.text: I am a Las Vegas local who is originally from New Jersey and boy was I impressed. I did not even care for any of the pastries at Carlo's Bakery back in Hoboken, but we wanted to try a little taste of Jersey in Sin City.   The Sunday Gravy (have no fear, you can get this every day) reminded me of those many Sunday dinners back in NY/NJ that started at 2 and ended around midnight. It almost brought a tear to my eye eating that food because it tasted so much like what my grandparents would make for us. Those grand meals are unfortunately a thing of the past, but Buddy V's brought it back to life. The meats in the Sunday Gravy were perfect, the pork was so tender, and you can taste the flavor in every bite of the sausage and meatballs. It was quite a feast and a pretty good value considering that you are right on the Strip. My wife had the lasagne and it was massive. The service was excellent, attentive, but not overly.   Buddy, your pastry shop may not be great, but your Italian restaurant is. Great job! Thank you for bringing a taste of New Jersey to Nevada. The location is tricky, it is on the side of the Venetian between the Palazzo, but once you make it there, you will be back.

zlT8G12R8-1jtBh8x1Wrmg.text: WOW My husband and I have been here 5 times already, Our server Rocco has been the best of the best, the food is delish and the desserts are to die for, a must is the Lobster Tail Pastry with fresh fruit, the cannoli's come in second best but all are good Every visit we ordered something different to try and we have not been disappointed one of my fav's is the margarita pizza, last night we had the sunday gravy pot, meatballs, pork, lamb, sausage with a bowl of rigatoni, so yummy, we had friends from NJ visit last month and this was the first place we took them, they can not wait to return matter of fact I can't wait for our next visit, so until then I will have to patience but it won't be long,  thanks Buddy for opening on the strip see you soon

cDk-s8iM0OIIOK3l0hHWGw.text: The food was wonderful, but the service was terrible.This restaurant would have had five stars if it were not for the poor service. It took 20 minutes for a waiter to come to our table, Then the waiter asked us if we wanted bread, because they brought bread to everyone's table, but our's was different it was a garlic cheese bread that we did not order and he charged us for it.  So the food was great, service terrible!

klN72c63FT1XQZ32jExPsA.text: Located in the Palazzo Hotel, it's not the best Italian food on the Strip, plus the service was poor. We spotted this restaurant, after seeing the huge line for Carlos' Bakery. That's the bakery from the TV show Cake Boss. Honestly, who would wait 30 minutes for a pastry, when Sprinkles Cupcakes is down the street and pure perfection. Anyway, we saw Buddy V's and read the menu at the front door. The prices seemed reasonable for a Strip restaurant, so we made reservations for 7:00 p.m. We arrived on time, only to wait 30 minutes while they took walk-ins before us. Once seated, the greeting was non-existent. I actually had to stop our waiter, and ask what his name was. It was Chas. After bringing our beverages, he quickly recited the one special, and he asked what we wanted. Totally rushed. I stopped him right there, and began asking questions about the restaurant. "Chas, who is Carlos?" "If Carlos and Buddy V are famous for their cakes, why did they open an Italian restaurant?" As he became increasingly annoyed with my questions, he explained that the restaurant is based on Buddy V's grandmother's recipes, not Buddy's recipes. Naturally, I commented that Buddy V shouldn't have his name on the restaurant if they're not his recipes. Oh well, just a logically conclusion. The veal Marsala came with a side of pasta. The pasta was good, but the veal Marsala was tough and the sauce was tasteless. Really salty and bland. Our dining experience lasted a quick 35 minutes...even with my insistent questions. Don't waste your money or 35 minutes eating here. There's lots better Italian restaurants on The Strip.

o9_WS9P5xi9NWzwsCWNYBw.text: I didn't know until just this moment that we were there only the second week they were open.  We had no idea this was there, but were at the Venetian and followed our noses.  Service was excellent, attentive, but not invasive.  We weren't that hungry, but proceeded to order the octopus appetizer which was great.  The octopus was cooked perfectly.    My husband ordered the (I think it was called the Sunday gravy or something).  It was a pot with red sauce, sausage, veal, and meatballs.  He said it was very good.  I ordered the eggplant parmesan appetizer and the creamy polenta side.  I was too full to finish it, but it was delicious.  The eggplant had a wonderfully crisp coating and was not mushy at all.  The polenta was creamy and wonderful.  I also had a frozen Bellini that was yummy.  We are talking about going back to Vegas just to eat there again!

QmTvtjIiju-l3rkUejKx3w.text: My mom and I went in here tonight around 7. The hostess was very polite and seated us right away. We sat ignored at our table for over 20 minutes, we were never even offered water. We finally left and found another place to eat. Very disappointing, we were excited to eat there and the food looked delicious.

j9ApJAFRR-S5OB-WuJ_9Qg.text: I wanted to start out by saying Buddy V's Ristorante was highly recommended to me by my son from the night before on Mother's Day. My boyfriend suggested we dine there for my birthday the next night. Being raised in an old fashion Italian family that cooked a lot, I usually do not like to eat out at Italian restaurants because the food usually taste too Americanize and falls short of True Italian cuisine.  Well, I must say I give Buddy V's a big 5 stars. Their food, Charred Octopus, Orecchiette & Italian Sausage (pasta), Roasted Branzio (seasonal fish), Italian Greens (Tuscan kale, garlic oil, plum tomatoes) was the best ever!! My whole crazy Italian family would approve! Be warned the tropical drinks are very delicious but very strong. I got cockeyed 1/4 of the way drinking from my glass. I ended the evening with a cannoli which I give a 4 star because I still think my Mom's cannoli were a bit better. I was a little disappointed they did not offer a SMALL comp birthday dessert however they did write happy birthday on my Cannoli plate with chocolate. Coffee was great tasting and the serves rocks! Everyone is friendly and attentive.  I love this place, I may have to come back for brunch!

9voV0-fKcWYvvgKLWsLy4g.text: I would have given 5 stars as the food was great and service was outstanding but while eating my linguini and clams I bit into sand in my clams. Clams need to be cleaned better. The garlic toast was awesome. Caprese salad is a must. Overall great place to eat.

KtSqEcNezW0pnmrcCwkywQ.text: WHO: I know all of you are TLC Cake Boss fans like I am, who wouldn't be?! So, for everyone in the world who LOVES Buddy V as much as I do, be a NERD and come eat here (Don't forget the pictures, lol!) WHERE: Located inside of the Grand Canal Shoppes of the Venetian and or Palazzo. WHEN: Monday through Sunday from 11:30am-10pm; Friday & Saturday from 11:30am-11pm. & most importantly, Happy Hour from 4:30-6:30pm! =D WHY: BECAUSE EVERYONE'S DOING IT! Lol, just kidding. Wouldn't you like to take part in a sit-down lunch or dinner with your friends and or family in Buddy V's first restaurant in Las Vegas?! & also because Carlo's Bakery is going to open in a few weeks to months just right across the restaurant! SO PERFECT! WHAT: The first time I came here, my family and I did dinner. As I walked into the restaurant and to the table, I noticed the perfectly dim ambiance that filled the entire room. I love ROMANTICKLE restaurant settings! It makes me HAPPY! Random Tangent: Sometimes I make words up so don't dictionary.com them because it most likely won't be in there. Haha So as my family and I were seated, we were handed the menus and ordered. I love dinner with family because we purposely order something different so that we can try each other's food! Too good! FOOD: Chicken Parm- I personally got the chicken parm, and it was excellent! I wish there could have been a tad bit more spaghetti with it, but overall Yummy! Margherita pizza- My younger cousin chose this pizza, and I'm glad he did because there were slices for every single one of us! SHARING IS CARING! Nonna's Lasagna al Forno- My older cousin ordered the lasagna. From the bite I took, I remember wishing I ordered it! It was definitely a hearty meal because there were leftovers! Thumbs up! DESSERT: Buddy's XL Lobster Tail- As I was scanning the dessert menu, my eyes suddenly zoomed into this dessert! I absolutely love the flaky pastry shell that enclosed the yummy, creamy, and PERFECT custard cream! (Everytime I go to NY, I search for Lobster Tails!!) Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake- My cousin is addicted to chocolate, as this made his eyes light up! I loved the hazelnut praline crunch, good touch to the chocolatey goodness! I still want to try the rest of what's on the dessert menu!!! GIMME GIMME GIMME! HAPPY HOUR: My cousin and I just made it in time for HH the other day, and we went HAM! Grandma's Meatballs- The perfect tasty, softy GOODNESS! I love these meatballs! Macaroni & Cheese Carbonara- I am a mac&cheese fiend! This mac was pretty good. I've never had it with peas, but it actually gave it a sweet taste, GOOD COMBO! Calamari Fritti- Loved the grilled lemon pinwheels, banana peppers, and the tomato aioli! AIOLI!! Meatball sliders- We couldn't get enough of the meatballs, so we had to order it in bread! Lastly, try the "CAKE BOSS" chocolate martini! If you love chocolate & alcohol, it was a really good mix! Tasted exactly like a chocolate cupcake... the only difference is it is in LIQUID FORM, and you may not be able to walk straight after! Lol Before I continue typing, I am going to STOP and leave you with one thing... ENJOY!! & LET ME KNOW WHEN CARLO'S BAKERY OPENS! HOLLER! =D

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank Buddy V for happy hour!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Cakeboss&#34;. Delicious!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $5 calamari for HH.

MvBQxv-gUFbvqr7qKd1I8w.text: We had an early dinner. Stopped in around 4:30 p.m. The restaurant is really nice, open and clean. There are great views. The portions are pretty big. I didn't care for the drinks. But other than that the menu is pretty simple and easy to follow. The prices aren't that bad for being a restaurant in Vegas. Definitely good for either a big family dinner or casual dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli! $9 and it comes with 2. Very Good.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smashed Meatball Sub
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy French Bread-Grilled

LAfeenN1p_lQjJZCo2ZO6Q.text: I'm sorry,  a restaurant of this calibre and it ran out of honey to serve with tea....  Unacceptable.  Oh yes,  I forgot to mention that no milk was served with coffee... It had to be asked for after trying to hunt down the server..   Although this may seem like a small thing the attitude of the server goes a far way to contribute to the star rating given.   The whole experience was marred with slow service,  inefficiency and smacked of a back street joint rather than the upmarket restaurant it is supposed to be.   Guys it is the small things that that matter,  big name but small on performance....  Won't be back!

AiPlunpj-XQ8wPbHpAh8pQ.text: My sister label this as a glorified Olive Garden and she was completely wrong. She doesn't appreciate authentic Italian food, carbs and all. Food was outstanding, we had chicken parm, spaghetti and the lasagna at our table and we all tried bite of each meal and all were very delicious and tasteful. Service was a little slow to getting our order and then getting the check but he was a great server none the less, very entertaining. I love the family atmosphere they had as well as the touches of family in the menus. We also had a bottle of the moscato which was amazing with our meals. Highly recommend this place for some good cabs before a night out on the strip!

vMTncp15oEvSC17TJLuFwA.text: Lisa's warm nutella cake is exceptional and so are the people who work here. Emily was super sweet and made my day.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lisa&#39;s warm nutella cake is exceptional.

tmWN7x8V-1JvJePGDCeNPA.text: The food is phenomenal ! One of only 2 restaurant that I would recommend in Vegas. I ordered off the lunch express menu which gives you a 3 course meal for $22. I had the meatballs for an app. You get 3 in a small boat of gravy (pasta sauce ) And they were spot on east coast Italian meatballs. They use the holy trinity of meat which is hard to find on the west coast and the sauce can't be beat . This is the kind of sauce that makes me want to step up my game because it Puts my gravy to shame !! For the meal I ordered the bucatini carbonara - again it knocks your socks off. The pasta is cooked perfectly , pancetta is crispy and the sauce light and creamy.. Simple and elegant . For dessert I ordered the tiramisu which came in a 2 oz canning jar and 3 lady fingers .. What a divine way to end a perfect meal. As a side note my husband ordered the 3 course meal as well. He ate it before I could get a pic , and I didn't get to try anything he ordered except his dessert . So we will have to take his word for it when he says the tomato basil soup was fantastic , and his chicken Parmesan  was the best he's ever had . He stated that the chicken had a light breadcrumb coating (he hates when it's thick like some sort of chicken bird sweater )  and his side of spaghetti was cooked perfect and served with the same type of sauce as my meatballs . For his dessert he ordered the cannoli.. Oh holy cannoli was that amazing!! I ended up eating it for him as he is lactose intolerant .. A good wife would have explained that cannoli are stuffed with marscapone cheese ! But.... Here we are ..

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball appetizer
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta carbonara
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Holy cannoli this is amazing

T6RyX0JZiuSHaJBg4ax0RQ.text: I was in need of a sweet fix since Carlo's Bakery right across the way was such a let down. Buddy V had a happy hour, so we decided to take a seat in the bar area where the live band was setting up. I tried a red sangria. It was so bad, I could only take one sip. I also ordered Lisa's warm nutella cake. The nutella was missing and the cake was dry until you reach the middle where the chocolate sauce oozed out. The combination of the cake, ice cream, and the praline crunch paired well together, but the ice cream was the best out of the three, although not amazing. The dessert wasn't as bad as his cupcakes. I just expected more from the Buddy brand. Our waitress and the ambiance were great, however.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ql0voPK_HGtpZFBGb7jejw.text: We just got back from Las Vegas and I am still thinking of the meal I had at this restaurant.  We went for a birthday celebration so we made reservations.  I was skeptical because I am very critical of Italian food because I am married to an Italian.  I ordered the Sunday gravy with meatballs pork lamb and sausage.   The dish was fantastic.  Gravy was just as good as homemade sauces I have had.  I will definitely order again.  I probably will share with hubby because entrees are Hugh.  The waitress was accommodating and even allowed us to split the check.  I hope one opens up in Houston soon.

y5xPtGyOYAna8eC1VvcewQ.text: I make sure to come here whenever I am in Vegas. Not really that expensive given it is in a strip casino. I really enjoy their chicken parm.

tNS4jRbqlU2ZlsMyOASqkw.text: Came in valentines day weekend for a 7:30 reservation. I was worried that they'd be slammed and food would take a while. Pleased to say that was NOT the case at all. Our server and bus boy were very attentive, made great recommendations and took good care of us.  We are Las Vegas locals that braced the traffic and tourists to come check this place out because we are big cake boss fans. It was well worth it!  I think their Mac n cheese was my favorite. It's hard to tell. It was so good we couldn't help ourselves, SO FULL!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella cake with salted caramel ice cream
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac n cheese

964lUaU74mOS7ksidBRTvA.text: We had Sunday Brunch here and it was a wonderful experience.  The food was all excellent and our waiter was fantastic.  The Sunday Eggs were our favorite, and my wife isn't much of a fan of scrambled eggs.  The frittata had a lot of huge chunks of vegetables, especially asparagus.  The meatballs, chicken apple sausage, freshly smoked bacon, chicken parmesan, and mac-n-cheese were all excellent.  Of course, there were croissants, fresh breads, pastries, cannolis, tiramisu, zonuts, and other desserts.  The food was all delicious and far exceeded our expectations.  We also had all you can drink alcohol.  My wife had bellinis, sangrias, and mimosas.  I had a few beers which, unfortunately, was cheap domestics, but whatever.  I definitely recommend Buddy V's, which is right across the hall from Carlo's Bakery, and the next time we're in Vegas, we'll definitely be back.

PWKtwmk2A89NVDlNWLf4QA.text: Been here for dinner before and loved it, so when I read about the Sunday brunch, I just had to come back and indulge. I'm here to share with everyone that this brunch for under 35 dollars is a steal! Fantastic fresh foods to meet everyone's needs. Charcuterie, cheeses, garlic breads, 5 carving station meats, panetone French toast, eggs, pastas, chicken parm, meatballs, killer tiramisu and other desserts. It's kid friendly too with a kids station even an adult would enjoy. The staff is on top of things and Asst. GM Adam Margolies is visible and easy to talk to. Sean was great to us last time for dinner, so from top to bottom, Buddy's has it all!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu.... Wow, fantastic!!!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finish off your meal with tasty desserts
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No awful aluminum trays here, the food is set in pots, pans and Dutch ovens

LDGfXhiOZAbG_c4wJeGtOA.text: AMAZING. The Lasagna was freaking amazing. Service was great. They serve Coca Cola, even bigger ++++.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna.TRY IT. You will not be disappointed!!!

YqKxW8WyN6wLJ6mi9yIEcQ.text: We arrived around 11 to get some desserts at the bakery next door. The line was LONG so we decided on lunch here instead. You can get a Lobster Tail (for $15) and a few other things that you can only get at the restaurant. Prices are decent for a strip meal. The place was pretty empty so we were seated quick. They had a lunch deal which included a salad, entree and dessert for $22. They had enough options to choose from and everything was pretty tasty. I got the salad panzanella, margherita pizza and cannoli. Everything was great. I would have liked more fresh mozzarella on the salad because it was so good. The pizza could have used more sauce but those are my likes when I make that salad and pizza. I would go again for sure and maybe next time get the $15 Lobster Tail.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu just the right amount to make you feel like you had dessert but didn&#39;t stuff your face.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super yummy not to sweet Cannoli!

t3CzfSEMaxnHtGoYlQOhJg.text: out of the world Italian food servers were extremely nice and made you feel very comfortable complimentary freshly baked focaccia bread with olive oil and vinegarette for dipping (you may ask for more, they don't bite)  the lasagna was very cheesey (good thing) and you get a bit of everything in each and every bite  kid's meals were a good deal also especially their chicken parm  pizza was good but not my taste   nice and dim atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh focaccia bread appetizer
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam linguini
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids meal chicken parm

cRWtK2vhQlET7twTWFQX4A.text: Best tomato basil soup I have ever had! I also had the margarita pizza, it was not the best pizza I was disappointed. My wife had the Chicken Parmesan it was fabulous.

p07S28JqQmJC7pCfiM-KnQ.text: Cake Boss Restraunt? Really?!? Yes. Bunt cake tins and rolling pins decoration. Not bad. They even got a good Dogfish IPA on tap!! Yay!!!!  Pasta aldente. Look. I'm not Italian but I consider this home cooking by any standard.  I had the veal. Good stuff.  Pricey but you are in the canal shops (whatever). Service great! I'll come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal. Mmmmmm

uLKLR2hvctrQDo1S2JiO2A.text: Good all-around experience. Came here with a group of 7 business colleagues. We decided to go with their special "family style". This was a great call as we got many, many plates of appetizers, mains, and desserts. Very good value for money when you have many folks sharing!  The ambiance was an enjoyable one. A touch loud on the music, but hey it's Vegas, that's petty much the norm. Good for families and business groups alike. Good options for wine and cocktails as well!

6cc57HaoJ620g_BIWQf-5A.text: Enjoyed Buddy's with my friend while in Vegas! Service and food were excellent!!!!! Thanks for the fun experience! Don't forget to go next door to the bakery :)

zpYd8CM0wb9OwOqEFmonEQ.text: Went to the Venetian to have dinner we were headed to Yardbird but when we got there it was closed for private party only as were several of the other restaurants. So we wondered around and found Buddy V's so we gave it a try my husband loves Italian food. We got a table on the indoor patio, interesting as it faces the bathrooms and lots of people going by. First we were never given focaccia bread and oil. We ordered large ceaser salad and chicken parm to split. We also ordered garlic bread as we know nothing about the focaccia. The chicken parm was good but I took one bite of the pasta and had to ask if it was fresh made the waitress assured us that it was, it did not taste like fresh pasta and on top of that it was gummy. The waitress was very nice about it and offered a dessert we declined. Ceaser salad nothing great very dry no oil cheese anchovie flavor to it, like you would expect at a Italian restaurant more food court except for the croutons they are very different my husband did not like them and I thought they were ok because they were unusual.

hQJTaxRHOIYHmUxnGh0seQ.text: This is my first time at Buddy's Restaurant in Vegas for me and my husband we were in for a surprise..we ordered the chicken parmigiana and tomato & basil soap..it was so delicious and especially his perfect soft moist garlic bread was perfect with our dinner,all I could say me and my husband enjoyed it so much we will comeback again..Buddys food was worth it ..I would definitely recommend friends and family come here..

iwlL1IEWdFMTjEYLZmyZow.text: Absolutely love this place! Came here on a Sunday with a girlfriend and we both loved the food.  We were running a bit late so we called the restaurant and they were so nice and had no issues pushing our reservation back by about 15 minutes.  Once seated we ordered some wine and sparkling water. I know this is something very minor but I loved that the sparkling water was nice and cold -- you'd be surprised how many restaurants give it at room temperature. We immediately ordered entrees and I ordered the Chicken Rigatoni Alla Vodka and my friend ordered the Bucatini Carbonara. Both of them were so so good. My Rigatoni had just the right amount of sauce and it was incredibly flavorful and they gave Parmesan cheese and red chili flakes on top and that just added the perfect touch. I had a few bites of my friends Bucatini and it was so delicious -- usually restaurants use spaghetti to make Carbonara but using Bucatini was such a great touch. I love that the egg was mixed perfectly in without scrambling it. My only regret is that I wish we had been more hungry to eat more!  I've tried A LOT of restaurants in Vegas but this is one where I will definitely return!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Rigatoni Alla Vodka -- super yummy!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini Carbonara -- so good!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. complimentary focaccia

Wguc8jJBETHHPI6Z-qRGcg.text: My family and I were in Las Vegas to celebrate my grandma's 80th birthday and my grandparents 60th anniversary. This was the perfect place to celebrate and was not terribly overpriced like some of the other Vegas restaurants.   Everybody seemed to enjoy their entrees. I started with a caesar salad, which was a bit on the salty side. The carbonara with shrimp was super yummy and was realistically large enough to share. Others had ordered the shrimp scampi, lasagna, Sunday gravy and sea scallops...all of which looked great!   This is a great place for a special occasion meal!

kaZ7hfZt8dGOHNGIbRg3Ng.text: Best italian restaurants on the strip for your money! We had excellent service with Joseph R! He was the best waiter we had during our Vegas trip. Homemade sangria with the souvenir carafe is a great value, chicken rigatoni "alla vodka" tasted great!

aYPtnOmWfsv7IqYK0G2pUg.text: We were at a party in the bar.  There were many foods laid out and an open bar.  The bartenders were up beat and helpful.  They never seemed stressed or impatient even though they were going full steam with many customers.  They took the time needed with each customer to serve them professionally with kindness.   The bar area is open with easy access from the inside shopping area of the casinos.  There is adequate seating.  It is clean and the food is good. Everyone at the party seemed to be pleased.

5u9hQ4fLl0tl2rYwelohrg.text: Seeing as my awesome bf let me drag him into all of the restaurants I wanted to go while we were in Vegas when he said he wanted Italian food for brunch on Sunday I gladly obliged.  They had a buffet set up and for $34.95 we got to choose from an array of antipasto, pasta, meats, soups and desserts. We also took the option for all you can drink for only $16.95 additional which included peach Bellini, mimosas, sangria, domestic beer and wine.   I took full advantage of the cheese board/antipasto area and filled my plate with prosciutto, salami, Gorgonzola, pecorino and focaccia bread. The marinated olive mix with peppers was delicious! Must try this. Also grabbed some iced peel and eat shrimp that had a nice spice to them that I wasn't expecting, but enjoyed.   Chicken parm was a bit soggy from sitting in the hot tray unfortunately. Orecchiette and sausage pasta was simple, but great and probably my favorite thing.   Loved the Italian sausage, did not really like the chicken apple sausage.   Tiramisu was awesome. Cannolis were just ok in my book.   Great place for families to dine and well worth the price tag for the brunch buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

Z1_klp98Z-OFTxrl7-sNjg.text: This place is so freaking good, pastas that have spices and cheesy goodness for days.   Even the fish is amazing, which isn't something you would guess from a pasta place.   Great views over the Venetian canals and LV Blvd make this a fun spot to people watch while you nom.   On the way out, make sure to stop off at the Cake Boss' Bakery and grab some wedding cake and other sweets. Just a heads up though, it's amazing, sweet and expensive! We spent 60 bucks on sweets that were "snacks".   Worth the stop and a great special meal place if you're a visiting tourist.

HXU2vyBw7wIQp58IoVxTSg.text: This had to be the best customer and food service I ever had! All the servers were so friendly, my water cup was always filled and I didn't even have to wait to ask. Love that lol. The food was amazing! We had Grandmas Meatballs and omg I had to savor each bite it was so good. My boyfriend had the Hoboken Philly Cheese steak and he said it had to be the best he's ever had. Thank you for Buddy's Ristorante!

kROj_kZ9AlSSqMHWVElk_g.text: We ate dinner last night before the George Strait concert, the restaurant is very well decorated and has a nice ambience.    The service was outstanding, my wife had the ravioli and she did the marinara was very good.  I had the carbonara and it was excellent.    I would definitely recommend this place for anyone wanting a great dinner for a decent price.

0-u76SDmc0siWmV8E-bpYg.text: Holy cow. If you're not down to read this long review, the gist of it is: best buffet in Vegas hands down.  I came here for a comp'd Sunday Brunch buffet, which is normally priced at about $35 per person-- already pretty reasonable for the strip. But you're getting SUCH BETTER FOOD than you're finding at the standard all you can eat buffets in hotels. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The food is constantly being swapped out for fresh batches, and everything just TASTES homemade. The meats were the biggest surprise-- I don't think I've had meat that tasted that good and UNprocessed since visiting Europe... I'm not joking. The pastries were also fluffy and clearly created by an expert.   There was a lot of variety though I did feel that the brunch leaned more lunch than breakfast... so know that coming in. The breakfast food was limited to regular scrambled eggs, "Sunday Style" eggs (with cheese and veggies mixed in), bacon and sausage options. Other food available was cheeses, meats, shrimp, pastas and a SLEW of desserts.  I tried getting a small taste of everything and there wasn't one thing I didn't like. I often have trouble with buffets where I grab a bunch of stuff on my plate but it doesn't necessarily taste great TOGETHER-- but that didn't happen here. Everything was very cohesive and worked well together no matter what you piled on your plate.  I highly recommend the Orichette pasta, the Carbonara Mac & Cheese, the sausages, and the croissants. You won't go wrong with any of the desserts-- but be sure you grab one of their famous cannolis!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the desserts-- look at that tiramisu!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orichette pasta -- a fave
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fritatta -- another good breakfast option

BdwFfC0juoVNnVJtMIyWxA.text: Sangria is delicious! From the salads to the entrees and the great service from Charlie, our (handsome) server, this was a great find in Vegas! Chicken Parm, smashed meatball sandwich, what penne, all superb! Will be back when in Vegas!
