Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zy60nW31nTWqqxnRnVMIDA.text: Had an excellent lunch yesterday which included the best Caprese salad ever with Burrata Cheese! Broke my heart, delish!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy V&#39;s  Caprese Salad

K7BylrJGoWo1rFJckpRwFQ.text: Our experience at Buddy V's from start to finish was easy breezy. Buddy V was able to accommodate a part of 15 girls for a Bachelorette Dinner. Prior to our dine in, the manager provided us with different menu options that would best fit our party. We eventually went with a pre-fixed course that included these options for about $64pp (including 8.25% tax and 21% service fees):  Under Starters- select 1 Appetizers-select 1 Mains-select 2 Desserts-select 2.  We selected the items below: Starter: Margherita -  Appetizers: Grandma's Meatballs Mains: Chicken Rigatoni and Spaghetti Bolognese Desserts: Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake and Cannoli   Overall, all the dishes were delicious, a bit on the saltier side FYI. And of course we left with shameful amounts of leftovers (because that's what happens with girls in Vegas, we tryna look good in our night swim bikins, don't hate). The winner goes to Lisa's Warn Nutella Cake... this is a MUST order. As soon as the soft chocolate molten cake with warm gooey nutella inside hits your tongue, it will make you......mmhmm. Yes. Exactly THAT thought :)

HXXj-mRtD-eyGMQ-MjJRag.text: We went to Buddy V's during our recent trip to Las Vegas. We wanted a sit down dinner that wasn't too expensive. We ordered the garlic bread, grandma's meatballs, and split the chicken parm. It was so much food so we were glad that we decided to split the entree. They bring warm bread to the table with olive oil and balsamic for dipping. I'm not normally a big bread person but it was really good. The meatballs were so tender and delicious, I highly recommend. The garlic bread was cheesy and had just the right amount of garlic. I was honestly a little disappointed with the chicken parm. It needed some more sauce and was a thicker cut than normal. I don't regret ordering it, just wasn't impressed. Maybe it's because we're from NJ and are used to getting really good parm. The spaghetti was perfect al dente and the sauce was great. If you want an inexpensive meal with a good environment, I'd recommend you check Buddy V's out.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EgJxUmBtocQV9nSgaw_yhw.text: Everything was delicious-from the warm focaccia bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar to the wonderful service. The helpings were generous !  If you are looking for good Italian food-you won't be disappointed !

3z9QJOHdHttMzXl05llXuA.text: Loved this place. I got the pasta. We had amazing service. I wanted Diet Coke and they only had Pepsi. Our amazing waiter somehow got me the Diet Coke. Everything was delicious. I can't wait to go back.

lX_jKBpTpuk_DaooOiR7Ow.text: We had a great experience here. The ambiance is nice. The food was excellent and they serve heavy portions at a fair price. We all took a box home. Unfortunately our server was hit and miss. Big plus was that they let us carry in our 25oz bud lights and daiquiri from Fat Tuesday's. 'Merica!

HHNRiLUgSBN4vekMVDk8YQ.text: A more casual spot with a fun atmosphere that had some pretty good Italian food. I ordered the linguine with clams and sort of wished I would have gone with the shrimp scampi after I did it. My pasta was good, but the sauce was really brothy and most of it sat at the bottom of my dish, leaving less flavor to the pasta than I would have liked. The wait staff here is nice and attentive and the prices are reasonable, given the location.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine with clams

l5YMgmuQeXQYWKZ4P4tBeg.text: Barely 3 stars. Staff was rude. You need reservations or you'll wait one hour to sit in the walkway near bathrooms. Drinks are $16 and are small. Portions were also small. I left the recommended 22% tip and the waiter was not thankful. Not going here again due to "I don't care about you" attitude from staff.

mTyo4B0UY-ZAbwhzpYILGw.text: My boyfriend took me here this past weekend in Vegas, we sat in the bar area. Good food, good service, cute restaurant and ambiance.

otFRBF7CvCew0hJT6lh_ZA.text: Delicious and promising authentic Italian food.  Expensive though.   Make this a one trip dining during your stay in Vegas.  Food reminds you of Grandmas.

Guo6cO3cmFxeHGiZnt3eAw.text: Soooooo pleasantly suprised by this place. Went to the famous Cake Boss bakery since there are only 2 stores world wide! After standing in line at the bakery we found ourselves starving and impatient so we decided to just go into this sister restaurant right across the hall. Went in with no expectations and having read nothing about the place and was totally blown away!   I had the chicken ceasar salad cause after spending 3 days in vegas all I wanted were vegetables and water. The romaine was crisp, the dressing was yummy, and the crutons were the star of the dish... parmesan polenta crutons!? That's a thing? You're damn right that's a thing and it's amazing! Would give it a full 5 but they were a bit skimpy on the chicken. 4.5/5  The man ordered the Philly Cheese Sandwich which was also delicious. Crisp and soft bread, ooy-gooy cheese, juicey thin slices of perfectly seasoned meat. It's not a traditional Philly in any sense but it's Truely one of the best I've ever had. 5/5  Might I add they offer the dessert we were standing in line for at the bakery. Kind of wish we had just dined here and ordered a pastry for dessert!  Would definitely dine here again give it a shot for sure!

4IRfyNVxzaICvJXRqfWxYA.text: AFFORDABLE DELICIOUS BUFFET! We did the Sunday brunch Buffet the weekend after Thanksgiving (2015). This was one of the cheaper buffets in Vegas. Cheap in price ($34.95 per perosn), but not in quality that is. The food was delicious and there was such a good variety of Italian food, breakfast food, seafood, desserts & fruit. Not to mention, it wasn't your typically fruit you find in your local market. The garlic cheese bread was Heaven! The pasta dishes were great as well. The seafood was fresh and great quality. Honestly, I'm not a big fan on buffet's but this was a great way to try out several of the dishes at this restaurant. ALSO...The pianist really added to the ambiance of the place. We will definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Brunch Buffet $34.95
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Brunch Buffet $34.95
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Brunch Buffet $34.95

TadYc7AKYYnYFu9ei4zlaQ.text: I loved this place. It reminded me of the old Villa Penza and other old school joints where the cook or the owner mingles and sits with you for a while and makes you feel at home even though they know you are leaving.  These are the special touches that made the old school joints what they were with tile floors and checkered tablecloths and the food was nectar of the gods and 'ambience' was for people who didnt know anything about food.  These elements gave us the confidence to break some rules like 'never order spaghetti and clam sauce outside of the metropolitan area'.  The simplicity of this dish was a revelation.  The DeCecco macaroni was cooked to perfection, It was the perfect platform for the teeny tiny baby clams that are mandatory for this dish and no substitutions.  The fragrance of the baby clams, the garlic, the textures, it was just magnificent and like no other commercially prepared dish we have had in years.  Kudos!  I dont like sitting on top of the kitchen.  Its too loud and too hot.  This was neither.  It was very entertaining.  They were loving the food they were preparing and it made you that much more excited about how good it was going to be to see this.  The veal marsala was fantastic.  It was good quality veal and the marsala was not cloying and sickeningly sweet as the cheap marsalas are.  This was proper marsala.  The osso buco was great, cooked to perfection, falling off the bone resting on a pool of creamy polenta.  I highly recommend the 'birthday cake' for dessert.  Its an experience.  While many of these authentic homestyle dishes are stylized for presentation, this is the way we really eat in  NJ.  Great meatballs.    This visit was AFTER Gordon Ramsay Steak and in no way was it a letdown, it was right up there with GR.    Kudos to Adam Margolies and his exceptional staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. zeppole, &#39;birthday cake&#39;
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. veal marsala
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. osso bucco, gremolata, polenta

lxVYNRggEkKZgqw7J-ldyw.text: We had reservations for dinner at Buddy V's on our second evening in Vegas. However, after indulging in a tall, alcoholic slushy sold on the Strip, we were not up for dinner and canceled our reservation. Throughout our stay, we dined at several high end establishments, but none were as good as we found Buddy V's to be when we popped in for lunch on our last day!  The staff greeted us warmly, suggested we take a window seat with a great view of the strip and were responsive and attentive during our meal.  My husband and I ordered the three course express lunch, which was an incredible value at $22 by Vegas standards. I had the panzanella salad and found it to be superb. My husband had the Caesar salad served with polenta croutons, which was pure deliciousness. For our entrees, we both had the chicken Parmesan, again delicious . The lunch portion was so generous, that we could have easy shared one order. We looked forward to the dessert, as that is what Buddy V is known for. We were not disappointed: the cannoli was heavenly on its own, but the dark chocolate sauce put it over the top. Hubby had the salted caramel gelato served with biscotti. Good, but no competition with the cannoli. We were so glad we were able to finally dine at Buddy V's! It was the best meal, value and service of our vacation.

QhNM0Dp-4vZy0H10Rg5hnQ.text: Wow... Had mozzarella and meatballs for appetizers that was good had a bottle of pinot noir. Main meal: chicken parmigiano. ..ok Scallops. ..boooo...this was terrible. ..fish taste like on verg of going bad, bacon tasted like old grease, the sauce don't even know what that was supposed to be, and for 32 bucks...booooooo.  Lasagna was good.. Service was good  I make better itialian at home

ZniwNIghQYms7LUQdDA4iA.text: If you come here, ask for Peter!  He was an AMAZING server!!  And hands down, eat the linguine and clams!  Warning: There was a lot of garlic!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine and clams

CLk-zkiUKyVhVAimDJ1IxQ.text: Restaurant is huge, doesn't give you the warm feeling that an Italian restaurant should have in my opinion.  Food and drinks took forever, server was very polite but could make up the fact that everything took a very long time to get to the table.  We had the caprese and the panzanela salad, both were ok, nothing out of the ordinary.  For an entree I had the veal Marsala, comes with a side of linguine which was flavorless. Veal itself was decent but nothing that would impress.  Desserts was the only salvageable items that we had, cannoli and lobster tail made me give them 2 stars.  Would not return to this place, there's other Italian places that are much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert menu

1T9gUT8RgbdYQeUYJlTU9g.text: We had a the tomato soup which was absolutely delicious, and Aunt something's bread and cheese thing. The bread and cheese thing was good but not great. The drink were very good as well. One of us had a steak, which was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious. The other, got a Margherita pizza which honestly kind of spoiled the whole meal. The dough was meh, and the toppings were almost non existent. Only about 20% of the pizza had cheese on it, there were 3-4 tomato slices and basil leaves spread across the 8 slices. The worst thing however was the sauce, my first impression when I tasted it was that they had used sewer water and canned tomatoes to make. The whole thing was soggy with this sauce, which was simply gross. It's a shame, because the rest of the meal was great :/

7vtMIR9xplN9ku0S7o8Rbw.text: Amazing Italian Ristorante!! The food was delicious, the service was great & the portions were large. We were so happy we decided to give Buddy V's a try. We will definitely come back next time we are in Vegas.

K9xd3zcCR6bGbnr8d_ebyg.text: Very good Italian food. Comfy interiors and friendly servers. We had a good bottle of wine that our server recommended, and even though it wasn't one we originally wanted, it was fabulous! We shared a salad and pizza, along with a dessert, and we were full.

ope_g3ZOZarkEusiu_6nUA.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Venetian. Service is good food is even better!! If you watch the show or are a fan of Italian food you need to try it!

A8eZ2UIyJDvXjEQ6Bbt6lA.text: Delicious food and drinks! We had the meatballs and the eggplant Parmesan. The staff members were all friendly and efficient. We hope to go back before we leave Vegas.

NrRbfQzwT5q1t-PkgY76BA.text: Overall a great experience and wonderful food! We were early for our reservation, so we started with drinks in the bar. Sangria was good, it's a blend of white and red wine which was different. Only complaint was service was slow.  When we moved into the restaurant area, our experience just got better from there. Service was fabulous! All of the wait staff were very attentive. We ordered grandma's meatballs, lasagna and the chicken parm. The meatballs were absolutely delicious! Best restaurant meatballs I've ever had. My husband raved about the lasagna and talked about it the rest of the night. We would definitely go back just to have that. Chicken parm was good, but not the best in LV. The sauce on all the food had great flavor and consistency. Being Italian and growing up in NY, this restaurant exceeded my expectations. We will definitely be back!

b-ejW2ZdBTtbYXCDgPYIxw.text: Long review: First off let me start by saying this review is not about the food. The food is amazing. I've been coming here for 3 years in a row for my birthday and once for our anniversary and the food has not disappointed once.  This is about their service. Like I stated I, with my family, having been here 3 years in a row and have received excellent service and food, until this last time in August. I originally called to reserve a table for 8 guests and a baby. I was later informed that one more person was to be added, so I called to see if I can get a bigger table. I was told I couldn't because it was a busy night for them, that maybe we could squeeze another chair, that was fine since it was for a kid. When we sat down there was so space for a car seat sling, my cousin's baby was on the floor behind her chair. The manager did not want to move us to a bigger table, which there were plenty of! The whole time we sat and ate and left there were bigger tables all around us! How is having a baby sitting in a car seat on the floor behind the chairs next to another table safe? We asked if this was a hazard or safe or a fire hazard and she kept saying no. We felt uncomfortable leaving him there (he was 2 months at the time) so my cousin had to hold him the whole time we dined. Then came time to pay. We could not do split. He la according to the waiter, the "computer" wouldn't let him. So we all wrote down our amounts and the card number on the back of the receipt. He then came back to say we were short. He was talking about the SUGGESTED gratuity. When then explained we would add gratuity when we signed the receipt. He said again that the "computer" would not let him because the total of the bill was the amount with the SUGGESTED gratuity includes. How is this even possible? My cousin tried arguing with him other wise but the waiter would not budge! He was determined to get his suggested gratuity. My cousin was getting rather upset so we budged and paid the total and walked away. Happy 30th to me! Sad to say that even though I LOVE the food here, this will no longer be my annual birthday dinner spot.

HwsgCjOx474arj4Kr9PnDQ.text: Delicious! Highly recommend the salmon and Cesar salad! The bread is so soft and warm, freshly made. Quality of food is great and portions are more than enough! Price is $$$$ of 5 plan to spend $100 per couple, but I definitely think it's an experience one must try if your in Vegas!  Cons: No restrooms, restrooms are outside the restaurant not far but an inconvenience. Lasagna had a little too much Rosemary and same with the Cesar salad to many herbs. Other than that great serve and super friendly staff!

dw4gJWCrIP8sWDUFLaMFnA.text: If you know what authentic Italian food is... Don't go to Buddy V's. For $22 each, (lunch special) you can get an appetizer, main, and desert. While the portions are appropriate, the food itself was not. My meatballs ("grandma's meatballs" appetizer) were great, they tasted homemade! The "Spaghetti Bolognese" was incredibly basic, the sauce tasted like it came from a can, and the spaghetti noodles were simply basic. The biggest disappointment was the cannoli. Obviously I had high expectations not only because of the price, but because of the insane hype that surrounds this restaurant, because of the fact that it is owned by Buddy Valastro and family, from the show Cake Boss, which regularly features and highlights their cannolis as a staple item. It was so incredibly stale on the outside, I had to literally smack it with my knife to knock a chunk off of it to eat, which would have been okay if it wasn't just a greasy, dried up piece of crust. The filling was sub-par as well, I'd have rather had some cool whip inside there, at least it would be somewhat pleasant. Overall, the food was poor.  Our service was phenomenal, both of our waiters/ servers were very kind, fun, and knowledgeable.   If you're looking for good food, go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The strip view from our table was very nice. Unfortunately the food was not.

LJGeIJjoZh328Vm__95Sgw.text: This place surprised us with how good it was. We just shared a ton of appetizers between 4 of us-salumi & cheese board,  mozzarella carozza and meatballs. The sauce was out of this world and the mozzarella carozza was all around amazing, to the point that even as full as we were I couldn't let any be left over. I hear they have a great happy hour which unfortunately timing wise we missed. This was definitely a winner and would be interested to try some of the actual entrees and pizza/pasta.

8wi-gkKS_8PAxNqUCczAGw.text: Good Italian food with a fun, casual atmosphere.  When we are in town we love to go to Buddy V's.

eLb0lqL5JvkkOHsrp5Ksiw.text: The first time we came to this place me and my kids were excited!  I mean it's Buddy's place!!  Food was amazing and service even better..   Not sure what happened from 2 years ago to now. The prices were raised for the Sunday brunch which makes it not so worth it considering the Buccanel Buffett is 20 more with way more variety and fresh everything.  We called ahead to make sure of the hours it ends and was told 230pm.. We arrived at 1130 and they tried to turn us down. I got a little direct and let her know we called and she said fine and sat us.  Our waiter was ok.. Brought our drinks and was pretty friendly.  Crepes - had a hair.. I was discreet and told a staff member as I seen another in the pan.  The Mac n Cheese Carbonara... used to be the best Italian dish there.. not so much.. the sauce was drowning the noodles and it just seemed to have a not so fresh taste..  they took a long time to refill it when it was empty As well as if they were trying not to serve much of it.  The French toast triangles were hard and dry. The cheese counter is always a great spot.  The kids section is crap. The bread pudding was great especially topped with a couple apples From the apple crumb desert. The variety of food VS. the now $39.99 cost is not Worth it at all.. I was super bummed and won't be returning next month on my planned trip.

T9wSe5hPkP7mKzoCBgjnkw.text: I came in with a party of 11 and despite the reservation it took some time to get seated (about an extra 15 minutes). Great apps to start off as we went with the cheesy bread. They offered a $40 3-course meal special, and an extra $10 if you get the NY Strip Steak as an entree. I decided to splurge and I ordered the steak as my entree, the tomato soup as my app and the cannoli as my dessert. I would definitely recommend the soup, but I was not much of a fan of the steak nor the cannoli. I tried my friend's chicken parmesan and while it was good, I feel like it is not that hard to make a good chicken parmesan.   In summation, while it is not one of the best restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip it definitely is a good choice if you are visiting The Venetian.

UM_ET_8HhLMcvKziToZZIA.text: Nice bottle of white and the prixe fix.  Salad to start then some orecchiette and salmon.  Had complimentary tomato basil soup while we waited for our entrees.  Great cannoli and tiramisu desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wv7lzeLyo3wEN_oV_O_akw.text: The Bottom Line: A bustling restaurant with dim lightning, large plates, and good service make this a great place to bring friends.  Try: Spaghetti Pomodoro Chicken Rigatoni Alla Vodka  Pro: While the restaurant is usually quite lively, they separate the tables out in a way that makes conversation possible, which is usually an afterthought nowadays. The service was quick and practically invisible, which can be good or bad, depending on your preference.  The food itself was simple, solid Italian. You won't be disappointed, nor will you be blown away. It's a safe choice for a good evening out.  Con: If you have a large party, you'll have to be split up amongst several tables.

WCkSEi6E5dfSYZBTSfDeqQ.text: We enjoyed the brunch on a Sunday morning. And we enjoyed it until they packed up the food and had to give us to go cups for our drinks.  Our server (wish I could remember his name) was amazing and attentive. Our glasses were never empty.  The food tasted amazing. However, it felt a little pricey for what it was. I wish there was a few additional options. But what can I expect, it's on the Strip

xa5Kw0Ma_OxdvvMdgzyCvw.text: Some great, some average, overall would definitely recommend Buddy V if you're craving Italian.  The good: Our server was very sweet and funny and speaks five languages fluently, he definitely made our experience more memorable. the Lasagna and Sunday Gravy are freakin delicious. Lasagna has just the right meat/cheese/carb ratio (Read: a lot of cheese. Can you blame me though?), served hot, and melt in your mouth. Sunday Gravy is a luscious, generously-portioned plate of stewed meat and meat balls soaked in marinara sauce that will blow any carnivore's mind away. Buddy's favorite pizza is also tasty with well-seasoned sausage. For dessert, don't miss the warm Nutella cake. Just, don't, miss, it. For drinks, old fashioned was worth a try.   The meh: chicken parm was dry, chicken rigatoni was unmemorable. Tiramisu was good but was paled in the presence of the Nutella cake. Cheesecake was pretty average (Read: not sweet, worth ordering if you're going for cheesecake). My drink (sugar and spice) was too sweet for my liking.  Recommend going family style and get multiple things to try. Portions are big so don't go crazy.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm Nutella cake, cheesecake, tiramisu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nonna &#39;s Lasagna Al Forno, Valastro Sunday Gravy, chicken Chicken Rigatoni Alla Vodka, chicken Chicken Parm

GBuIdH9SdYUCtPkCOuwKXw.text: We went to Buddy V's to celebrate my 25th birthday. The cakes and pastries displayed in front of their open kitchen, rustic finishes on the light fixtures, beautiful views of the strip and old school live music playing in the background are the makings of a very memorable experience!  We truly enjoyed the drinks, food and service and will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bowl of Rigatoni
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Valastro Sunday Gravy
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WiEP8le4zrDa7I1RcWFENQ.text: Good food and good service. Everything in Vegas is expensive and so was Buddy's. We split an individual pizza due to the prices.

C39hqE1zueUOl0AC4xlnAw.text: Classic Italian dishes done right. My fiance and I were looking for an Italian restaurant in Vegas after hiking all week in Utah and this hit the spot. Large portions for a reasonable price. I got the veal marsala which was recommended by our waitress and it did not disappoint. Two large tender pieces of meat with plenty of mushrooms in their thin marsala sauce. Only critique I had was that I thought the sauce was over salted. The linguine in garlic sauce was perfect. My fiance enjoyed the shrimp scampi linguine in a white sauce. Had a hint of lemon and was fresh. Five jumbo shrimp cooked perfectly. We each had a side salad and shared grandmas meatballs (lamb, pork, and beef) with their complementary garlic bread. Meatballs tasted like home cooking. Skipped dessert and went to his bakery across the way, but could easily get one of his infamous desserts with dinner. I'd return to try other menu items!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panzanella Salad
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandmas Meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

QXkDnC6mwcMYbFrppwwTvw.text: Make reservations!  I ate there for bunch and it was GREAT!  This trip we ate here for dinner and it was sooooo good. The portions are very generous. We all ordered something different so we could share. Everything was outstanding. We all left stuffed and took doggie bags. It made a great next day lunch!

Cy1ua7XGfCmGoxVQrhTZxw.text: Four of us arrived at about 5 PM.  We were promptly seated in the bar area as we wanted to take advantage of the happy hour selections.    The bread that was brought to our table had a herb/Rosemary flavor and went well with the vinegar and olive oil.   The macaroni and cheese was hardy,rich, and flavorful.   The calamari was great, neither greasy nor over battered, and came with a delicious dipping sauce.  The sliced grilled lemon was delicious too.   The meatballs were firm, not crumbly and came with a great tasting marinara sauce.   The meatball sliders,came on a fluffy tasty bun.   Both the bloody Mary's and the bloody Caesar's were as good as any that are made in the area. The sangria was good and came plenty of fresh fruit (in the glass).  The happy hour Chardonnay is nothing to brag about though.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. view from our bar table
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. meatball sliders
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sausage sliders

FAzAYHrRvY5XPNGBQX1yMg.text: I was torn between 3 and 4*, simply because I've been to Italy many times and this is ok, but not as good as it should be. My husband loves lasagna and he gets mine (though not as often as he would like), so he is pretty spoiled and was unfortunately not at all impressed with his dish. The whole thing lacked seasoning and was pretty bland. I had the pasta scampi and liked mine, the shrimp were nice and big, pasta was al-dente and it was nicely seasoned. We were sooo looking forward to Buddy's famous lobster tails, but they were sold out at 5:30pm already. We did get the canolli and they were amazing as well... so back to 4*. Service was also friendly and attentive, but prices are pretty high for simple pasta dishes?

5eZegE_JOCmgTxU2bVbLtA.text: I'm almost tempted to say that the Express Lunch is one of the best deal on the entire strip for lunch. $22 gets you 3 delicious courses. I went with the Grandma's meatballs, chicken parm and a cannoli for dessert. Large portions, attentive service and you got a winner winner chicken parm dinner. Def go here and taste some very solid red sauce Italian grub on a budget. They don't skimp. Keep in mind, you have to ask for the Express menu.

l9z-0r3tcQfO92kmUMiM4g.text: If you wanted the best Italian food look no further... If you want the best staff and service look no further... 5 stars is not enough... that good.. make a reservation place is crowded for a reason... that good.. in Vegas for 4 days and eat here twice and wish I eat here every night.. Scrimp scampi best I EVER HAD - never mind Vegas- anywhere including little Italy in NY which I often frequent.  My son.. my wife... all gave 5 stars... these people get it ... they treat you like a king and queen... My waiter Giorgio... the best... they have live music tonight... guy singing sounds just like Harry Conick Jr... incredible....normally I hate music when I'm eating but this place gets it... soft music that you still can have a conversation at your table but if your lucky he will be here when your eating... he was so good I honestly thought it was a LP / tape playing... son is 15 and has appetite of a horse and both times failed to eat more than half of his Sunday s Gravy dish with pasta ... meatballs... sausage.... and pork... again one of the best dinners I ever had never mind best dinner on my vacation and my waiter Giorgio was 10 stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iY0jSa0wLH8UUW8oaA5YUw.text: Nothing but a five star worthy review here! The service, atmosphere, and food were all phenomenal! I made reservations for four for my wife's birthday, and the strip is swamped this week with the National broadcasters association conference in town. No problem seating us, and serving us in a timely fashion. Everything from the side Caesar salad to the calamari fritti, to the salmon, bucatini, and veal Marsala were all very tasty. Don't believe the dollar sign reviews though, this place is expensive, should be a three dollar sign rate, but it's worth a once a year splurge.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry iced tea
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids chicken parm
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon

WRijKPhfcFv_nz5vwkwzPg.text: I am not going to lie, But this was by far the best experience that I have ever had at a resturant. We made a reservation in advance because we knew that it was a popular high demand place to eat. When we came to to the resturant we waited about 5 minutes so that while they got our table ready.  Once we were seated, we were instanlty greeted and served with drinks. Our Waiter was extremley nice! We informed them that we have people with food allergys and they took note to them.  Our waiter asked us what they were and took note (peaches, peanuts, onion, shell fish, and nuts where the allergains.) When it came time to order our food, he helped those with food allergeys first. Insuring that they order somthing that they can eat. He even made sure to check with the chef if it can make something without it in the dish.   Everytime someone came out with food they asked who the people were with the allergey and told them wheather or not it is safe for them to eat it. One of the managers informed us that it would take a while for the food to come out since there are so many allergeys. All in all it took 50 minutes for our main entrees to come out and 30 minutes for the appitizers. The food not only looked amazing, but it tastes delicious.  We also had some cocktails, which were not only very strong (for those who like to drink with their meals :)) but they were very refreshing.   Towards the end, we had informed our waiter that we have two people celebrating their birthday and he went to the back and brought them both out a canoli with a candle.   This was by far the best experience that any of us could have asked for. I highly reccomend if you are looking for great italian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Cannoli
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Cannoli
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Surf and turf

GcBbIooHsYL5oH74h2B_qA.text: Had a bad experience but the server Matt did the best he could do.  We arrived in the restaurant slightly before 4pm and were immediately seated. We ordered our food by 4:10pm and no one came to check on us until I had a chance to wave down the server. This was at 4:37pm. He said he will go check on the food. The female manager came by within a few minutes of our complaint and only apologized and offered us free bread. Which we did not accept bc we were saving our stomached for the food we ordered. The food came out at 4:48.   Overall we felt like we were not taken care of and the food was subpar. The chicken parm was good but the other pasta dishes had no flavor. If you are craving pasta especially seafood pasta make sure you bypass this place and head into the square and dine at Mercato del Pescheria which blows this place out of the water! Would definitely not recommend this place!

bDBu0Hp2A7Ef35QC_DvCNA.text: The staff was welcoming and polite, recommended things on the menu. We ordered the chicken parmigiana, eggplant parmigiana, and buddy's favorite pizza and all were delicious. Definitely recommend this place if your passing through or staying here.

oEepsVHpuZa6AeHypcJ7Pw.text: First timers here at Buddy's and will definitely be returning to try other items on the menu! We were in town for a family Birthday weekend and this visit to Buddy's just added to the already perfect weekend. The only thing I would change would be leave the bread on the table, the waiters walk around with trays of bread asking if you want a slice.  Featured in the photo is Spaghetti and Meatballs, very good...taste is spot on perfect Italian. Portion was just enough to leave you with room for dessert which was Canoli from Carlos Bakery of course. Prices are very reasonable for a fancy Las Vegas restaurant and service was impeccable. Thank You for a wonderful meal and dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti Central with Meatballs

4MpaOAopOz83P0VbXTOeSQ.text: Amazing restaurant inside the Venetian hotel (2nd level). I was expecting a extremely busy restaurant on Saturday at 4pm but there was no wait for a table. Server was quick and friendly. Pepsi is your soda options and there's a ton of wine options. The food menu is one page but great options. We ordered a Caesar salad with grilled chicken, garlic toast with cheese and chicken parmigiana. All tasted fresh and delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ef8LLpzXsIraICJQjctzLw.text: Another outstanding meal at Buddy V's.  The cheesey garlic bread is to die for.  I have never had garlic bread with that much flavour.  I had the free range chicken breast with fingerling potatoes and spinach.  Juicy chicken with outstanding flavour and an amazing presentation.  This restaurant hits it out of the park every time we eat here.  We hope to be back in Vegas in 2018 and will definitely be back.  Thanks for making our Vegas experience that much better.

3PIoQAKrPlZ36W4V-VE1yQ.text: Decided to come to Buddy's on the spur of the moment because of the novelty of being on tv and didn't expect the food to be great but, man were we wrong! We weren't looking for anything too heavy because this was a late lunch and dinner was scheduled for 8pm.  There wasn't a wait and we arrived during happy hour (4:30pm-6:30pm seven days a week). My wife had the Sangria and I had the Bloody Mary & Caesar. Tasty!  We ordered the calamari, mac &a cheese carbonara, smashed meatball sliders, & sausage & peppers sliders. All of it was perfect.  Service was attentive and prompt. Definitely on the list to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders, mac &amp; cheese carbonara, and calamari

V6YeKzS8UYsn9aUmyzAQ8w.text: My husband and I are really picky about our spaghetti sauce and Buddy V's nailed it! It was like eating at your Italian grandmother's house. The meatballs tasted homemade along with the bolognese sauce. Calamari batter was crispy and light, not to mention the delicious pizza (I recommend Buddy's Favorite). Don't forget the famous Carlo's Bakery cannolis. Everything was so amazing including the service. I highly recommend!

Exlh5WN71ESVkQTUyGOhng.text: Had the BEST meal there! The waitress was the sweetest & knows her stuff!! The pasta is homemade & it doesnt get better than that!  We had a cozy corner table in the lounge that had the view of the strip. We enjoyed fresh bread & amazing cocktails before our soup tomato basil soup arrived..and OMG it was to DiE for with the cheese-bread we dunked into the soup. We had eggplant parm..another OMG moment. Daughter had chicken rigatoni with tomato based cream  sauce that was heavenly! A small side ofside of Cesar salad which was also very fresh and flavorful. Our friend had angel hair pasta with huge shrimp! Looked amazing!! Finished off with a set of huge canolies.  The service was AMAZING!! The atmosphere a big plus!  Loved every moment of it. Counting the days til we go back.

80p6F1lJ-4lGfg51vTe8IA.text: Really good Italian food and even better customer service!  I got Velastro's Sunday Gravy, Buddy's Family Recipe mix. Wow! Amazing! Excellent mix of meats (sausage, lamb, meatball, pork) and tomato sauce, served separately from a bed of rigatoni pasta. Yummy!  Our waiter Giorgio was kind enough to quickly walk me through how best to eat it!  Diminish / Replenish!  Will make the trip back here when in Vegas again.

Pn289a2ftuS7VexvF7vafg.text: Holy moly! This is the BEST food I have had in Vegas and we've been coming here at least 3x a year for the past 6 years. Shrimp scampi and chicken Parmesan along with caprese salad will keep us coming back for sure. Love the atmosphere and windows to the strip. Waiter was great and tiramisu delicious!

4gIjXFsNnbkoK4W3g1cU7w.text: Great restaurant! Overlooks the strip! Big portions! Big prices. Everything we ordered was delicious. We've been here 3 times and the service and food is always the same! Must try!

Ig3mfVUyIzfq8OjFsrCFFA.text: Place is my go to when I'm out in Vegas. Their bottomless mimosas, bellinis, &  sangria are so delicious food is good. I wish they'd keep it hot. The food is like room temp to cool. But other then that I'd definitely recommend it to people

DhRP5r-WSCinZhyujPY1dg.text: Enjoyed Buddy V's Brunch Buffet. Food was Incredible. Atmosphere was relaxing. Live music helped to set the ambiance of the room. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Well worth the price. Looking forward to my next visit.

71r7WHCMW_69cMgZ0M3p7g.text: Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Been here many times and every time it's excellent. I've had a real link weenie and clams and the lasagna in there Mediterranean sea bass. All very good

9--roRcHhSybb0FGnZtZsQ.text: Attempted to come here once and couldn't get a reservation.  Second time around was able to get one.   Place  is very nice and clean. Menu is pretty extensive and you can find most something for everyone, however is a little pricey. I had the eggplant appetizer (for an entree) and was very pleased. The bread they bring your table is addictive it's so good! Service was great.   Deserts were kind of a let down. I tried the Nutella cake and was kind of let down for the $10 you pay for it. Seemed kind of small and didnt really taste much like Nutella. I was disappointed as buddy is known for his amazing over the top deserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella cake with salted caramel ice cream
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bX7sS-i_W1d-VlDILAmfcw.text: Pleasant surprise!! Food was really good. Service was fast too but didn't feel rushed. I had the penne with chicken and the sauce had a nice little zip to it. Portion size was not too big which. I like. Only drawback was like everything else in the Venetian it was hard to find, tucked away in a corner hallway, you're almost better off locating from outside the hotel. Definitely recommend trying it out.

hqCJcwFcx-6a-hkxvZ-A_g.text: Awesome brunch buffet on Sunday. Great food and well worth the price. Came hungry and left full and happy. I would recommend it to anyone staying at The Venetian or Palazzo hotels.

ygGcdVjZGlzPFQAIqAaDnA.text: Was greeted by two smiling faces.. I was seated in the patio outside.  The gentleman  that served us water and some bread, I believe his name is Carlos was amazing, very attentive and awesome guy..the two stars are because of him. Now let's talk about the elephant in the room, her name is valerie, I wish you dont get her as your server because she does not have the patience to listen to the full order nor to give any suggestion. . My order finally arrives and my pasta was undercooked. Asked her if the kitchen could just cook the pasta a little bit longer. She says sure, doesn't bother apologizing, whatever. This other lady comes out and says, did you not want the pasta anymore? I dont know how much clearer I should have been. All is all. Decent food. Amazing service from Carlos but Valerie really needs to work on that rather then delivering the food to our table and chit chatting with people all the way on the other side of the room or may be they need to get more servers because she cnt handle it!!!

eqCQfu8kD0RXWSts1yWyyQ.text: Great Italian restaurant and food is reasonably priced. Food comes out quick and staff is friendly. Good place for casual dining.

OMhBiXUgYYG9saXfZ1_2DA.text: We had a wonderful experience here. The atmosphere is fabulous and the staff are simply brilliant. We had coffee and a cannoli (hope that is the correct spelling) one afternoon and then came back for dinner. We ate the best lasagne ever with a gorgeous ceaser salad. The view was lovely. I loved it and will go back next time I visit Vegas.  Thanks for a great experience.

Z9ddFMTp2mjgA2XDQXarvA.text: Buddy V's wins for best happy hour on the Strip! The bartender was super helpful and fast. The portions for HH aren't that large but allow for a taste of a variety of options. We had the meatballs, calamari, ricotta and polenta-all delicious! The sangria was AMAZING! If I was eating on just the HH it would have received five stars!  After HH we sat down and had dinner. The majority of the courses were excellent. I didn't like how the waiter pushed more food than was necessary. I also had the veal piccata and it wasn't that good. Eating starved baby cows only happens once a year for me and it wasn't worth it on that meal. The cheesy garlic bread was very delicious. I would definitely return for the HH but probably wouldn't eat in the main restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal piccata. Not that good but the pasta that came with was delicious!

nPPoH4y0N16-tv7U-QC1HQ.text: My husband and I went around 9 on a Sunday night and they got us right in with no wait! They also gave us a table with the BEST view! Our waitress was very nice and attentive. She explained all menu options that we were confused about and recommended nice dishes. We split the Caesar salad, garlic bread and lasagna. Restaurants usually charge when we split but they didn't charge extra AND they brought them on two separate plates. Believe me- you want to split unless you have a HUGE appetite. We were both starving and couldn't finish the food. It was so good and we didn't have room for dessert- but we will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm (split half) and garlic bread
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from our table

Sug3qF4JoAffikw5AuA8dA.text: Great service and great food!!  The caprese salad was fresh, light and the burrata cheese was delicious.   The meatball sub had a great creamy cheese on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

t5yBawgTeZOgEad2x7327g.text: Not as pleased as I thought I would be!  Came here for a birthday celebration while in Vegas and was let down.  Got here on a Saturday evening ready to feast and was seated promptly after waiting for the rest of my party to arrive. The hostess lead my group to a table by the window and we were seated and given menus.  The items on the menu seemed really good. I knew I wanted something with sausage while the rest of group went with the steaks and spaghetti. The first issue came when everyone had decided on what they wanted and they server took 20 minutes to come back to the table to take our order. That was somewhat odd especially since when the drink was taken he overlooked my order, seriously!!!! I had to ask another waiter who was helping another table to grab my drink, that's not good.  Next, when the waiter did eventually come over to take our orders he insisted on orders rather than giving recommendations, hmmmm, not smooth! The issue with the orders was that everyone's order was taken except for one but that member of my party could not order because the waiter has walked away after getting the 5th order. Why would you do that when there is another person at the table!!! Once again, we had to get another waiter to add another steak to our order because our waiter was unable to do that the first time!!  As for the food, my meal was great. Everyone that ordered a steak loved their food. However, the spaghetti, I was informed, was a bit sour! I did not try it but I told by another member of my dinner party.   Once finished with our food. We had to wait another 20 minutes before we could get the check. Getting the check went like this. In finally getting the attention of the waiter I got two words out asking for the check and then he interrupted and didn't let me finish to offer dessert. Seriously, usually there is a back and forth in communication but this guy had to speak over me, confusing to me! Again, he was insistent about getting a dessert rather than suggesting or recommending.   Once I finally got the check everyone was ready to go because this waiter was just no helpful in explaining anything or being attentive to our party. Not a memorable birthday dinner for the birthday girl after talking with her about her dinner. She liked the food but the service a bit aggressive. I guess working here causes the workers to be impatient and overbearing. I don't think so because the other waiters that I talked to were very gracious about assisting my table. I think the gentleman that helped us that evening was just trying way to hard and no making a good impression.   The food was fine but the service was below what I expected based the reviewed I have heard about Buddy V's. I wanted to 5 star this place but the service killed that potential rating. I hope this situation does not happen to anyone else. But, kudos to the chefs in the kitchen who worked hard to prepare the food.  #buddyvhelpmeout

upEDJcma3PU-eSybHUCszA.text: I'm giving them 3 stars because the main plate and service were ok. We decided to dine here because of their famous cakes but honestly, they are not that great!! I recommend you to share the desserts and to ask for more water because they're very sweet. The price for the food is fine, but the desserts are kind of expensive for what you get.

We4AIB5s2q8GzqPflfTs_g.text: Made a reservation here for a bachelorette dinner. The host was nice enough to see if we can have our happy hour bites at our dinner table and luckily we were able to. The one thing that dampened everyone's meal was the server. She was haste and not very amicable. I feel like I saw her at most 3 times during our entire meal.   Nonetheless, the meal itself was pretty delicious. We order a variety of the happy hour bites such as the meatballs, sliders and Mac and cheese to share. I ordered the chicken and pasta which I actually felt like it was large enough to share. I would also recommend taking advantage of the happy hour drinks to go along with your meal. Overall experience was a little more than average but definitely could have been better. Hoping to make another visit to give this place another try.

njLutz5ijimqRmFtFyPhqg.text: waited for more than an hour and the front desk girls were still ignoring us.. talking to themselves looking at us. It wasn't a pleasant experience.. since my friend was 8month pregnant and wanted have Italian food .. we waited for that long..  Food is superb no doubt about it..

3bWhxw0fnCpKFBRUjzZNVg.text: Classic Italian food with a cozy, yet contemporary atmosphere ~  I have to admit that I wasn't a fan of TLC's "Cake Boss" and didn't follow it but I knew of the show and appreciated that it was a family affair. When the restaurant opened in Vegas I didn't really have any desire to try it out until my man had a business lunch there and told me I had to try it.   We've been here twice now and I'm happy to say that the food is just delicious! My favorite dish is Buddy's mother in law's capellini shrimp scampi. Packed with flavor I can't stop eating it and it never comes home with me for a late night snack. There's tons of garlic, roasted tomatoes, spinach and white wine! My man has enjoyed everything he's tried from the meatball sandwich, chicken parmigiana  and his favorite dish which happens to be the super cheesy lasagna.   The warm, complimentary focaccia bread is always a hit and we've had the calamari and caesar salad which were great.  Don't forget to tell them if you're celebrating anything special as they'll bring out a mini cannoli on the house.   Located across from the restaurant is Buddy's bakery which serves the best chocolate dipped strawberries in case you want something for later!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar

lqmMt58KgqDbOi7QWQSCJA.text: This was our second trip to buddy's vacationing from Florida.  We sat for an early dinner at around 3:30. We were seated promptly. After our orders were taken they brought out oil and balsamic for dipping but never brought out the bread.  We asked and were told 5 minutes but it never came.  They threw some sliced bread on the grill with butter, but I've had better toast at Perkins.  Eventually entries came but imagine my surprise to see the kids chicken parm had more chicken than the the adult size chicken vodka.  Manager was responsive and brought out additional chicken to add to my entree when I pointed it out.  I did not ask to be comped for the chicken vodka but it was taken off the bill.  Waitress was excellent and atmosphere inviting... but the bread never came

z4kutuasKrDX2mviecW2Ng.text: We had lunch here and all really enjoyed it.  Our waiter was great and helped guide us through the menu. We started out with appetizers of the meatballs, calamari, and the antipasto board. Everything was very good. We didn't leave a bite. For lunch we had the family style serving. We had lasagna, salmon, chicken parmigiana, and vodka pasta. The salmon was very good along with the lasagna. The chicken parmigiana was also very good. Chicken was fried smothered in cheese. Even though everyone was satisfied with the meal our waiter talked us into dessert. We had a tray of canolli's, molten chocolate cake, gelato, and other desserts. Great lunch experience.

JmVDkpbVZId8QTVh7dqSfw.text: In Las Vegas for several days and headed to the strip looking for a dining establishment...just because we were in Las Vegas.  Now here is the problem for one that does not know Las Vegas...it can be very overwhelming by the selection of dining establishments and trying to walk to / find another option than those in the casio/hotel complex you are in, can be challenging given the distances involved.  We were in the Venetian and enjoyed walking along the Grand Canal.  And we ended up at Buddy V's and very glad we did.  Unfortunately it was a Friday night and there was a 90 minute wait for a table.  There was seating in the bar / lounge area and it shares the same dinner menu, so off we went.    Ordered the $40 price fix menu which included an appy, entree, and dessert.  I selected the caesar salad, chicken parmesan and for dessert, the cannoli.  I will start with the good.  The chicken parmesan is good, really good...nicely breaded and covered with a nice tangy tomato sauce then melted cheese.  The cannoli was okay...very rich and a nice end to a dinner.  The portion size of both were quite large and one will not leave hungry.  Unfortunately there was no taste to the caesar salad dressing and the polenta croutons were simply awful...really terrible.  I had higher expectations for their caesar salad.  Our server was pleasant and attentive and the food was brought out fairly promptly after each course.  All in all, it was a positive food experience and happy to recommend Buddy V's...just not their caesar salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent chicken parmesan
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bland caesar salad
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli

5fxsDrKWojDHXErx9O39Kw.text: Delicious meatballs!  The garlic cheese bread and delicious home made marinara sauce are the bomb. The bar seats have a nice view of the strip.

4E6GwSva9wlbB4uvIhpK4Q.text: Amazing Dining Experience!!! Came to Las Vegas for our 30th Anniversary.  Used Yelp to pick a good restaurant near a concert venue in the Venetian.   The waiter, Giorgio, was incredible.  Recommended the couples special that consisted of two appetizers, two/ three main courses and a dessert tray.   Apps- meatballs and a meat and cheese sampling was a meal onto itself.   Main Courses- Beef tenderloin in a red wine reduction, over mashed potatoes. Wow! Grilled Sea Bass and Rigatoni. Unbelievable!!! Finally, a tray of pure delight!! Cookie Dough Gelato, Molten Chocolate Cake, Canoli and Tiramisu!!  This place is so good!! Do yourself a favor and ask for Giorgio, he makes the experience complete!!

6BRBrbVyiR_5lgVbQ4mCog.text: Their pasta dishes were delicious, and all the staffs looked working super hard and they were also very friendly.

WgslzDapMOwG2NKJgravZQ.text: Going against my diet was so worth it! Lol. I went here with coworkers with the idea that I would eat healthy but saw the menu and that all went out the window. I couldn't visit an Italian restaurant and not have pasta!   I shared some calamari for my appetizer and skipped a salad to save room for the main dish. I ordered the chicken rigatoni with a tomato based cream sauce. Omg it was delicious. I tried not to eat it all and failed miserably. The sauce really makes the dish. You probably won't have room for dessert but try to chicken rigatoni and you will leave happy!

ZB0MnQTcng6EOvrTvq5ltQ.text: Great service, customer service was excellent, the manager on duty was amazing she went above and beyond for our party of 10.   We did wait over 20 mins but the manager and the server sure did make up it.

LYwEHY9rg450qpE4UWZEcQ.text: My husband and I just had one of the best meals I have EVER had in a restaurant! I cook a lot and am a good cook so it is not often that we enjoy meals out enough to say it is better than home cooking. I had the Sunday Gravy and he had the Lasagna and they were both beyond excellent...moaning kind of good Our waiter was also fantastic. Don't remember his name but he is Italian, a chef, a Certified Sommelier and he recommended an excellent bottle of wine to compliment our meal. This was our last experience in Las Vegas before going home tomorrow and I'm so glad we didn't miss it. This is a MUST DO every time we come to Vegas!!!

Is47rdaD3OEGdXtdqplHOQ.text: We loved this place. Ask for the express lunch menu. Get the sangria carafe. It's very light on alcohol but you get to keep the carafe. Big portions. It's at the entrance  by Taos up the escalator. From main entrance  of Venetian walk over to pallosso side from the outside. It faces the strip.

aO4RXnoeFpfJ427HHv9ehQ.text: Stopped in for lunch, ordered the Salumi & Cheese board as an appetizer and  Nona's Lasagna and Chicken Rigatoni ala Vodka as main dishes.  The cheese board was the highlight of the meal. Lasagna and Rigatoni were so-so. Wanted it to be better. Also a little pricey, but it is Vegas..

BRvDsWSNq4Iy5sH_jpPPCA.text: Was here for work and wanted a casual pasta night for one. Great customer service and amazing food ! I will be back.

qt6y2wsI699n4B8dIgvjPQ.text: I would honestly give this 10 stars if I could.  I was craving lemon chicken and saw on the menu they had chicken paccata, which is close enough if I modify it. So my husband and I walked from our hotel over to Buddy Vs without having a reservation. When I first saw the place, and how large it was, I kind of thought this might be just a so-so place, maybe closer to fast food than I had hoped. But it absolutely was not fast food. It was lovely.  Upon being seated, our waiter (Peter) immediately came over to inquire about drinks. When I went to order, my picky self literally needed to modify everything (sorry, chef). Instead of a salad, I asked if I could have just tomatoes and cucumbers with a little lemon. For the chicken piccata, I asked for it without the capers and without any garnish. Sweet Peter says, "oh, so you basically want lemon chicken?"  Be still my beating heart. Yes. My cucumbers and tomatoes (at least 3 different varieties) came out quickly and were fresh and delicious. My lemon chicken came out exactly as I wanted it.  From the person filling the water, to the person bringing bread to the table, to the person delivering the food, and - of course - Peter, the service was way beyond our expectations. Not once was I made to feel that my modifying the food was a problem, which is huge to a picky eater like myself. Everyone was genuinely nice, enough so that we went out of our way to find the manager before we left to let them know how happy we were.  If I am in Las Vegas again, I will definitely visit this restaurant and will specifically ask to sit in Peter's section. I hope he knows he can never, ever quit.  :)

hoQLEA2szwgqfDfmixL0zg.text: My husband asked what's the waiting time, the hostess she said it's 30 Minutes or maybe less.  we go ahead waited anyway because the kids were hungry. After 30 minutes we still waiting on our table. My husband thinks they forgot about us. After they got us a table and took the orders, there were another 30 to 40 minutes waiting for  our food. Shrimp scampi was okay, but the kids really liked the spaghetti. That's the only reason I gave them 2 stars.

i_IKYubc9tJgL0stAV1M-w.text: Had reservations for 4:30 and didn't realize that they had a sunset menu, with limited choices, that was from 3pm to 5pm. With some finagling, our waiter, Michel, got us dinner entrees. We had the calamari appetizer (very good) and the garlic bread with mozzarella (very good). The fresh focaccia with olive oil and balsamic vinegar was excellent. Our entrees were rigatoni ala vodka with chicken (excellent), chicken parmigiana (excellent), and chicken marsala (excellent).  The portions were perfect. We didn't get dessert because we'd eaten at Carlo's bakery earlier in the day. Dessert menu did look good.   I'd rate Buddy's 4.5 stars, but because of our waiter Michel, I went up to 5 stars rather than go down to 4.

Hlxxmnaq-_dukJSjm3vyCQ.text: Made a reservation through Open Table for my birthday. We arrived right on time and were immediately seated at our table. We were immediately given ice water which was much needed in Vegas!   My husband ordered the Sunday Gravy and I had the Agnolotti which was a ravioli filled with a mixture of beef, pork and veal covered in a sage brown butter sauce. We also shares the garlic bread which we didn't really need because they bring you this delicious focattia bread fresh from the oven. During our meal the manager came by and chatted with us for quite a while about restaurants in Chicago he and my husband has both visited. He let us know that what I ordered was the best dish on the menu.   We could have easily shares the Sunday Gravy between the 2 of us because we were so stuffed we had to order dessert to go! Bit the cannoli was delicious in our hotel room a few hours later!  As with most great places in Vegas it helps to make a reservation so you don't have to wait. And I will absolutely bring my family next time we are in town!

ft6eQVubGcXNCbGxfxIGXw.text: Best food I've ever eaten in my life.  We tried beef medallion, carbonara, Mac and cheese, shrimp linguini, Italian birthday cake, warm Nutella cake, creme brulee, homemade lemonade. Wow wow wow, best food and drink I've ever had. Even the coffee was good. Everything was authentic. Staff were friendly and good looking. I absolutely love this place. Kudos to the chef. Thank you to our servers Caleb and Angelo for a wonderful night at your restaurant.

p6XG0r8l3R5ZGDiWsKu-cw.text: Had a blast with two others I was with. The server, Danielle was great. Very knowledgable and attentive. The food was very good, pizza and pasta. The two I was with enjoyed the deserts also.

HMwYDZ_vZniL8G7csiQcsA.text: A bit overpriced, but hey- it's Vegas. The food was definitely good- HUGE and too filling GOR us to get to try the desert, but it hit the spot.

Ast1JAwNXOSdva5S1mGtxg.text: Very good... So much food we had a lot of leftovers. And the next day it was still awesome. I had lasagna and my husband had the chicken Parmesan (both our meals were so good). Nice place. Sucks cause we were too full to eat or have room for desserts. Happy note is Carlos bakery is right across the way. This place is at the Venetian.

gE11tXYiRzjiN3PbLItV6g.text: One of my favorite restaurant. I ate the shrimp scampi and it was amazing. The portions are very big so make sure you're hungry. For dessert the nutella cake is super delicious the cake super moist and soft.

cunvmdGZp-XNENfRk--zwQ.text: Had a delicious dinner with my husband. The Venetian Hotel is a sight to see and the food at Buddy Vs was incredible- possibly the best I've ever had. I had the Bronzino and my husband had the chicken parm- Wow. My martini was incredibly good. No dessert- we were super satisfied from our dinner.

KIs0rxmyLyxR5_UX_zSRrQ.text: The last two times in Vegas I've eaten at Buddy V's. Both times I've had the smashed meatball sandwich. Big thumbs up! Meatball subs are, in my opinion, generally too dry, but the two I've had at Buddy's have been pretty moist. The parmesan fries are hot and crispy, they were very good. Sevice has been good, no problems in that area. My one complaint was the first time I went I got breadsticks, second time none. I am not a fan of Cake Boss so I was really just there for the food, next time I might try something different like chicken parm. Both times I was there it was a weekday afternoon right when they opened so it was not crowded. There was a lot of people at Buddy's bakery across the hall though.

V0GxCg4JFzWaaLRuPE-JxQ.text: This could be the first time I have ever said that a dinner on the strip was a bargain. Not only was it a bargain it was excellent. We had a family dinner with 6 people and did family style dinning. It was wonderful. Tons of food and a wonderful selection of tastes. If you go and have a chance to do the family dinning you would be crazy not too.  The only negative I can say is that it was a bit loud making conversation a tad difficult.

gP8ICpmxMMoICOHRTJZQew.text: It was good, but $24 for spaghetti and meat balls should have been closer to $17/18. The Caprese salad was also pretty unique and comes with a large tomato you slice yourself as well as cherry tomatoes.
