qL2IQXl0OXD-mff3dX65AQ.text: Impeccable service.  Great ambience!  Fantastic view of the strip.  BEST. FOOD. EVER.   EVER!  If I could, I would eat the chicken parm here every night for the rest of my life.

16nlS0E-G4BPRZteXSUtaA.text: Great environment and great service. There was live music and our serve was nice enough to walk us through the menu. We got the salad and the lasagna, which was both amazing. The salad was too salty for my taste, but I guess I should have asked for light dressing. Otherwise, everything was great!

tPpWY2w9qTf8OLUsQfWhAw.text: I came to visit for the first time for Restaurant Week for my sister's birthday. I'm pretty impressed Buddy. I have to admit that so far, your dishes taste just as good as your cakes (well...the cakes look good so maybe as good as your cakes look?) I booked reservations for seating on Open Table for my sister's birthday. Told them the occasion and requested a nice little "surprise". They did more than that. They gave us the best seat (take note here because this seat is the seat you want) in the house. You walk past kitchen, past the bar, and the main floor. You'll see these big windows that help open up the room with natural sunlight. In front of that window lies a simple yet perfect table for four. You can look right out and see the strip from above, and if I'm correct the pirate show at TI also! My sister and I ordered the garlic bread, caprese salad, meatballs, and Chicken Parmesan. The MEATBALLS are definitely one I recommend, but beware! These come as appetizer and can be very filling! So if you intend to make it to dessert, I'd be careful with this one. One order would be good to share with your party. It's so full of flavor, juicy, and tender. Major noms. I think it's because of the veal. The GARLIC BREAD. Oh the garlic bread is also a major 5! Extra cheesy, extra buttery, and extra extra garlicy. An extra 5 points if I could because it tastes just as good as a leftover. It came with 4 HUGE pieces and one is a good size to split in half with another (that is if you're a light to medium eater). CAPRESE SALAD is also a great recommendation if you're looking for a nice salad to eat. Full of color and flavor. They have like 3-4 different types of tomatoes in it. There was cherry tomatoes and some tomato that is red, purple, and green (it's good I swear!). It was topped with a perfect ration to cheese and drizzled around with a light olive oil and balsamic vinegar. **CHICKEN PARMESAN two extra stars because Buddy V's chicken parmy will probably become that GO-TO-MUST-HAVE dish. I mean it's just chicken parmy right? I know...but it was perfect. The sauce wasn't too much nor thick or overpowering. The breading on the chicken had that perfect crunch to their tender chicken. It had that nice bed of creamy melted cheese topped with a wonderful POW of garlic flavor and herbs and spices. I'm a variety seeker so I always go to different place and try different things, but once I find THAT DISH it's hard to steer me away from it. That dish is THIS PARMY. **DRAGO ROSSO-It hasabsolut ruby red, pomegranate, jalapeno & mango. It's divine! I love spice. This has a whole lot of spice. If you're into bloody mary's or the mexican drinks with the clamato juice. You have to try it. WARNING though. It is really spicy so if you only like a lighter taste of spice for your palette I recommend you pass. BUT! Service was great, the ambiance was amazing. Casual, but upscale? More for business meetings, lunch, and special occasions. Lastly, it was cute after my request they surprised my sister with bakery made cookies with a light up sparkler. See Jojo S. review for photos: yelp.com/biz/buddy-vs-ri...

UVu-_CEtZ_j82mnl5Fkrrg.text: Place is actually better than I expected.  Classic Italian food with huge portions and prices. Carbonara like spaghetti was awesome.  Squid was excellent also.  Desert here was good. Had some kind of chocolate hazel nut cake with coffee ice cream. So creamy and fulfillling.  Then We Walk Over To Carlos bakery.  :)

dUAMW0k3933gnrrwlxUdXQ.text: Delicious Sunday Brunch! Be sure to try the meatballs and Italian Sausage. Decor is simple, but well done and the food is home style, simple, but perfectly executed. ONLY because it has the CAKE BOSS name attached to it - dessert could have been a wider selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k1pAJcN00XkXQMzBNm2ZFg.text: Food is so good, and the prices are reasonable...same prices as Italian chains. Service was excellent. My husband had the chicken parm and it pretty much melted in my mouth. The only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars is because I wish there were more options on the menu, and options for gluten free individuals (besides salad).

12LPhiGoo4Ni008gBLeVuQ.text: One of the newer restaurant that opened here at The Palazzo, it is located on the second level of The Grand Canal Shoppes, next to Barney's New York.  Came here on a date and yes, I do agree with a fellow Yelper that it IS a big spacious restaurant so it doe not give you the intimate, romantic/family style a Italian restaurant should be. But hey...it's located in a 5 diamond hotel right ON THE STRIP...what else can you expect?  To sum it up, everything we ordered was delicious. The service was great, our waiter was attentive the entire time keeping our drinks filled, napkins/utensils were delivered quick.  We got an order of their famous meatballs as an appetizer. I believe it came with six. Perfect to start off with. The meatballs were very flavorful and they weren't puny little meatballs either. For our entrees, I ordered chicken Parmesan and my date ordered a pasta dish. Let me tell you, like most restaurants here on the strip, portions were pretty big. I definitely had leftovers for the next day. My chicken Parmesan wasn't dried and they put the perfect amount of melted cheese on top.  We also ordered dessert. Not a big fan of sweets to begin with and I was already full from dinner. But my date suggested we share something soooo....sure, why not? We ordered the canoli and it was wayyy toooo sweet for my liking. The cream filling....bleh....over powering. I much prefer a gelato or something if I ever get a chance to come back here.  Overall, this is a really good restaurant and I can see it thriving here at The Palazzo. Prices aren't as expensive as say, Dal Toro or Bouchon. If you're in the mood for Italian and kind of on a budget.....I definitely recommend Buddy V's.  (P.S.) Heard Buddy V is going to open up a bakery shop at the Venetian sometime in March 2014. Stay tuned!

jB__9vlx5JaZm-hLd0gLyQ.text: Food was good but overpriced. There are other restaurants in town just as tasty for almost half the price.   I had high expectations for the Lobster Tail XL and was extremely disappointed. The size, first, and then the shell of the pastry wrapping the custard. It was so hard I could barely chew it, much less finish it. The custard itself was good though.   The bake shop outside of the restaurant is all I'd ever go back for.  Their cinnamon cannoli's are much more worth the price for their quality.

sKIyXi6Pfdi4CpqPTYvSlg.text: Ordered their cannoli dessert since on Buddy's "Cake Boss" T.V. show, it's the best thing ever. Tried it, but it was very stale. I'll give it another try next time to taste their main dish to see if they're any good but the real reason why I'll be returning is their phenomenal service.

xrPEKihC1QumrMMvN5DnJw.text: Made lunch reservations while in Vegas! I was super excited to try Buddy's restaurant! The place was casual, not very busy and our table wasn't ready. Ok fine. We were seated and it took us 15 minutes before anyone came to us. Mind you it wasn't very busy. Finally, waitress came over and filled our glasses with water and took our order. We got our appetizer which was like breaded mozzarella, still no beverages. :/ we had to ask the bus boy for our drinks. I ordered lemon piccata, dh ordered chicken Parmesan. It was all decent, but the terribly slow service really ruined the whole experience. With so many better options I won't be returning.

Klqd3S_fFVggnak23TaV0A.text: Love the chicken and the veal parm. The apps are great. I had quick service and they actually have a pretty good view especially if you go sit in the bar.  The only downside it you can tell they don't have a homemade pasta but whatever they do serve still tastes great.

3MXjmFzDSWjbKZ5ILY-YeA.text: Just had a brunch buffet at this place.  Live music and great foods.  It's one the best in Vegas!

SV7uLlf7uwZmiRHPW41dgA.text: Sunday brunch is overpriced at $34.95 per person.  Food that was provided was good quality as was the service.  Would be improved by including a drink, smoked salmon, omelette station. Recommended gratuity is calculated including sales tax which is inappropriate.

5so39bQWadq9n5qFjadhzg.text: Outstanding from start to finish. Caprese salad was great. The gravy dish was loaded with veal, meatballs and sausage. And the best part, the desserts!

bbzDKi12Dd3z_yBnwUPQFQ.text: Wasn't sure where to eat with my husband and two young teen daughters buy took a chance.  This food reminded me of my great grand mother's table.  Meatballs were authentic and loved the veal Marsala.  My girls had the kids chicken parm with was perfect.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  We finished with cupcakes from the Carlos' Bakery for the girls.

9inaxcsSoyeVktbijSFMCw.text: Came here for the great happy hour menu. $4 sangria was excellent! Ordered the cheese and charcuterie board (not on the happy hour menu), and it came with a good portion of three different meats and cheeses, olives, and delicious grilled bread slices. We devoured the bread, and they immediately brought us more! There was live music, and they took requests, which provided a great atmosphere. We already had dinner plans elsewhere, but we had to try their desserts. We shared the lobster tail pastry and the warm Nutella cake with salted caramel ice cream. The lobster tail was amazing, with perfectly flaky layers and a sweet creamy filling, served with berries on the side. The Nutella cake didn't have as much Nutella flavor as we were hoping, but delicious nonetheless. The real star was the salted caramel ice cream! Would love to come back again and stay for dinner, as everything looked delicious.

Pzo0qFoKydxwT_xnq8nvEg.text: We went to Buddy's on our first night in Vegas.  The atmosphere was great and I really liked the decor.  Our waiter looked just like Buddy's cousin and had a great personality.  I started with a Caesar salad that had more dressing than lettuce.  the best part was the soft croutons on top.  A bowl of those would have been awesome.  Salad, not very good. I then just wanted meatballs and the waiter talked me into pasta and meatballs.  The balls were small and not very flavorful.  My wife had chicken marsala.  there were 4 full breasts in the order.  it was a huge portion.  She liked it. We passed on dessert in order to gamble sooner.  Overall, the food was ok but the price for what we got was too expensive.   The next night we went to Lavo in Palazzo and spent $20 more per person and had a way better eating experience.  Do yourself a favor, and stick to Buddy's Bakery across the hallway and skip the restaurant. Too many better options in and around the Venetian.

iytjxE9V8IBRfSzYWj1WKA.text: Poor service, over-priced and mediocre food at best. They were not accommodating to special requests such as a different pasta sauce or adding cracked red pepper to a dish. People come here for the name but leave thinking Buddy V should stick to cake instead of restaurants.

uy-PtcwzcGmCrXouVRLk6w.text: Went for a birthday celebration and they made it nice with Happy Birthday written in chocolate on the dessert that my daughter selected. Food was fantastic--cheesy garlic bread to die for, meatballs yummy, eggplant parm and dad's bucatini great. Flatbread pizza wonderful too. Portions are very generous. Several people had chicken piccata or chicken marsala and said there was too much chicken but that's a good thing! Had cannoli and warm nutella cake for dessert--great!  Now my concerns---service left a lot to be desired starting with the bar. We arrived early and had drinks then were ready to move to dinner but the bar made a huge thing of needing to close out our tab there first (3 drinks, one of which was a happy hour drink, so not a big tab!). Okay that's fine but then it took forever to get the waitress to come so we could close out. Not good.... and then at our table the waiter was very nice (Rocko) but not very efficient nor was his helper. We had to ask for olive oil and vinegar for the bread and they brought one for the table of 6 so we asked for another and never got it. Later in the evening we asked for two decaff coffees and those never came.   We were not in a hurry so it was fine but they need to look into these issues. Would definitely go back for the great food!

ZqTLqHVfeexKvR7N1h0_FQ.text: Best service ever. They treat you like family. And the food is to die for. It's amazing all the way from the antipastos to the main entree. So so delicious.

LG6HZFVBagxXQfWg3a28ug.text: We spent NYE at Buddy Vs at the Palazzo. What a great experience!  The food was great, fresh and tasty and not too much, but enough to share tastes with everyone at the table. I had the linguini and white clam sauce, it was delish. I also appreciated that most dishes were slightly under salted. The flavors really came out. But, if you go for no other reason, go for Giorgio!  Even though the place was crazy busy he took the time to give us special service. I've been in family-run trattorias in Italy and that's how Giorgio made us feel, just as if we were in his family's kitchen. It's Buddy's, don't skip dessert!  We had the Italian birthday cake and, Giorgio you were right. It made me forget about run-of-the-mill tiramisu!

EG3UAajAzIMmxeUD_Cl36g.text: I don't even know how to explain how horrible service was. After being seated, we waited about 15 minutes for our server to take drink orders! He was hardly apologetic and to make matters worse, he was so rude while I asked him a few questions about the appetizers.   After 45 minutes of ordering, we finally received our food. It was okay. Not worth the bad service.   I have been to many restaurants and I have never felt so uncomfortable or treated so rudely from a server, ever.

3je0iSUp5ghpuR4PzQE5HA.text: Decided on Buddy V's after looking into all the great restaurants on the Strip. Prices are reasonable for a "famous person's'" restaurant. Sat at a table with a view of the open kitchen.  Thin breadsticks individually wrapped at each table.  Great calamari fritters appetizer. Crispy and nice marinara sauce on the side. Ordered Clams and linguini.  They were ok.. chewy clams, very light on garlic, but substantial portion. Friend ordered vodka sauce rigatoni with chicken.  Good sauce, chicken breast a little tough but all around not bad. We opted not to have dessert with our meal since we were full and instead went 'across the street' to Carlo's Bake Shop. I've never been to the original one in New York, but I'm guessing they serve many of the same items in Vegas. It was just as crowded as the restaurant if not more.  There is a large window to view the pastry chefs/bakers decorating the cakes - a great way to pass the time while you are waiting to get your desserts.

C5O_gFkrF25WePdx9O3SeQ.text: I had a reservation for 930 and the hostess was just crawling each time she took somebody to a table she was gone for at least 5 minutes.. I don't entirely blame her I would probably have a bad attitude if I was all by myself on a Friday night . The part that really mad me mad was that there were 2 managers just standing around doing nothing. When I asked one of the managers if he could help he said we had to wait for the the hostess and he couldn't help us. When we finally did get seated we were sat in the bar. That would of been fine but in the bar they had one waiter to take care of the entire bar area while the two managers sat and ate at the bar. The food took for ever and they even showed up with the wrong food for my mother and that took 15 minutes to get her food while we starred at are food till she got hers .the food was just alright and way over priced. I was disappointed

8jIovVUmolSb88SFaxPudw.text: Delicious. Casual restaurant that's great for family or date night. Quick service with a friendly smile and small talk. Had the lasagna it was huge and delicious. The shrimp scampi has large fresh shrimp. Sauce was just right and not too heavy. Also tried the scallops they were delicious except they were small. But the dish was overall filling.

kwK-TDeVWHrZd67ks1iPfw.text: Bad experience.  They put a single diner in a corner table. No server ever showed up.  The place wasn't busy but they just kept walking past the table.  No one cared until I left.  The bakery is busy but the restaurant needs some work.

huUweJ1QNWDdit7FZTWlYQ.text: I love a home style Italian meal. The food at buddy v's is simply perfection in this catagory. We had a special birthday lunch here. What can I say, service was oecable. Our waiter t.j. Was highly versed on the options we had a couple if starters the fried mozzarella left us speachlesd, and the calimari was a great compliment. The best part was their adaption if chop salad for a lunch salad it was huge! Save room for dessert, we had the famous lobster roll and the most Devine Italian rum cake served in a miniature cake stand complete with candles for the birthday girl! We can hardly wait for the bakery to open trust we will be the first in line! Yes this will be someplace to come again and again - oh I almost forgot auto pilot parking if you love valet pull in hop out and a quick elevator ride and you are there! This is a winner! Hands down.

2LEc12vwFGs_JSVHWx9_Lw.text: BEST ITALIAN IN VEGAS!!!! I had reservations for Friday (11/28/14) night at 6:15. They had a table for me but it was not in the main dining area. I asked to be moved to the main area but was told I would have to wait. The GM Adam came right over and asked if we could wait about 5 minutes and he personally would get find me a table. He found one for us in about 3 minutes.   Adam spent about 5 minutes with us going over the menu with us and telling us the history of the restaurant and Buddy. After we got our drinks, Adam came buy again and was going to take our order but we told him we could wait for our server. Adam was very personable and made sure we were taken care of. Way beyond your typical GM.  Now the food, we both ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. I am Italian and am very picky about my Italian food but it was excellent!!! The best I have had in Vegas in years. We also had the awesome Buddy V's special Lobster Tail (pastry) for dessert.A MUST TRY!!!!

m_nrGD_tSFONqOXAjKNEpg.text: SERVICE  +  Excellent Service. Super friendly staffs.  AMBIANCE  + Fun and loud.   FOOD + Aunt Ninas Mozerella en Carozza $12 // Good + Tomato Bique $9 // Good + Bucatini Carbonara $24 // Okay  + Bone in Veal Parm Chop $42 // Good  DRINK + Drago Rosso $14 // Good + Sicilian Tea $16 // Skip   DESSERT  + Lobster Tail $9 // Okay   NOTE + Cake Boss! + Takes reservation.  + Good price. + Would like to come back for Sunday Brunch Buffie.

_Rp1-Ux1PuKDkntyTQuQcQ.text: Easily the best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Far far better than Giada's. Great service and beautiful ambience.

byCNkCyZVByu4zllObLOXg.text: I loved this place.  We had a very large party and had to split the tables.  No problem.  The waitress was awesome.  She told us about the menu and gave us great tips.  The food was delicious!!!!  I highly recommend.  Make a reservation.

prGynhzBRICFFACQLy2UeQ.text: We decided to come because we heard this place was great for families with kids. That is an understatement! The restaurant is loud (due to awesome music playing) enough to drown out our very vocal toddler.   But let's talk about the food I had the beef tenderloin and the wife had the grilled salmon. Both were close to perfect as can be. Meanwhile our son had the cheese pizza which was so good...I stole a slice. It's enough for two kids so I didn't feel bad.   To cap off the amazing dinner we had the Nutella Cake...which was heavenly and we ate ever last bite.   You got to come check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Cake with vanilla ice cream, normally comes with salted caramel ice cream.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Salmon
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Tenderloin.

YTKeQzYroG-WKzeX2ZLiiw.text: Came here for their brunch buffet. The food is much better when it is ordered off the menu instead of a buffet. It's still good but it's not as good. For example, I love their chicken parm but it's soggy at the buffet. The croutons in their panzanella isn't warm and crispy like they usually are. However, it's a good way to try a lot of the items off their regular menu. Service is still good and $35 for a brunch buffet is super reasonable.

vgSDCMtc3SEDadVMHExdJw.text: Weekend brunch buffet is fantastic. We have had the buffet at Wynn and other locations, this thing blows everybody else away. Grandma's meatballs. Best ham I've ever had in my life. Wait staff is very very good.

mZaN4jYe7dkel35weTITBg.text: Made a reservation and when we get there the hostess said we will be right there and then was joined by 4 other coworkers and just continued to talk and have a private conversation instead of getting us seated ( I thought you were at work but clearly we are on your time)  Happy hour is good but the staffing in the bar area was slow! Poor girl was all by herself in the lounge area and you could tell she needed back up. Food was good though, smaller portions.

POXjPih71dg2mdufYa88yQ.text: The menu had an insert for restaurant week that got you three courses for around $40. I had a salad, the spaghetti bolognese, and the pictured cannoli. My wife had the Cesar salad, the chicken parm, and a Nutella cake. Everything was really great. The service was very attentive.   The restaurant is tucked away at the far end of the Venetian shops, and even though we're staying at this hotel, we'd have never found it. It's a relaxed atmosphere, and right across from it is Buddy V's bakery that had a line out the door. Looked fantastic, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lPnzDLn10giG4tn4NrgCLw.text: First of would like to say the food at this place is amazing. I have never had a Italian mean better then this place unfortunately I can't say the same about there service. First we had reservations for a 10pm; there was 10 of us in our party. Prior to making reservations they told us that the kitchen would close at 11pm but we can order anytime prior. Well the "water boy" was very nice and polite. The server was the complete opposite. Very rude just no personality. He just kept rushing us. We had just sat down and already asking what we would like to drink. We never got a chance to look at the menu. The water boy came asking if we preferred flat or sparkling water (never where we once told or notify that whichever one you choose you would be charge $5.50 per cup) get out of here with that. I don't mind paying that's not the point but really. If I was going to be charge that then I would of asked for something other than water. We also mention to the waiter if we can do separate checks he mention he can do up to 4 transactions. Which we were fine with. We were also celebrating people in our party birthday. I don't know why it took 20min after we eat to bring out the birthday dessert. Are you kidding me! We asked for the check and the waiter brings us 1 whole check. After we said it was ok to separate it in 4 checks. We didn't say anything cause at that point we were all frustrated with the waiter and just wanted to leave. While I and another individual in our party are trying to figure out totals and cash. At that point another person in our party notice that our waiter was laughing at us trying to figure things out. . At that point we just paid and did not leave a tip. The place is beautiful the food is delicious. But i will never eat here again. Unless I can order and take it home but nope. Such an unfortunate place because I love the show and I was so excited to eat here but the service sucked. I really hope that they can trained there waiters to have better costumer service or if you close at 11pm don't do reservations at 10pm. Maybe this person wanted to leave and that's why he was rushing us? But who knows? nobody deserves this service.

doHGDCGBmd3murzeKmp0Lw.text: I visited this restaurant on 1/30/2017 which means Vegas was packed for the New Year festivities. I went to dinner with 11 of my friends who I was visiting Vegas with. The first thing I noticed about this restaurant was that it has a very cozy feel. Great place for family or a romantic night out with your significant other. We had a large group so we were seated toward the back of the restaurant. No complaints there because there was a huge window by our table that overlooked the strip. Our waitress was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. She took the time to help us order... all 12 of us which I thought was great. For the appetizer, they offer a very flavorful bread with baked on cheese. So not really a cheesy bread. The bread was soft and came with a balsamic and olive oil mix. It was so delicious. For the main course, all of the meal come in very large portions. The menu offerings are also kind of pricey. I simply ordered their meatball appetizer because I wasn't very hungry that night of our trip. The meatballs were delicious. The dish came with about 6 meatballs for about $9. I also sampled my friends' meals and everything everyone ordered was delicious. I would absolutely recommend this restaurant if you want a nice, authentic Italian meal. My only regret is not have a big appetite the night I visited this restaurant so that I could have tried a full size meal. Maybe next time!

rVT88WT0Mu_Jepk5O53aAA.text: Wasn't sure what to expect in terms of fanciness or price. My husband and I came here to celebrate our 1 year anniversary and we were very pleased with our service, the food, and the ambience.   We've watched Cake Boss before but we didn't know this was THE Buddy from Cake Boss. The bakery was right across the way but we were so engrossed in our conversation and the yummy food we didn't have time to get any sweets for the way home.   We each orders from the Prix Fixe menu....I got the Tomato/Basil soup, Chicken Parmigiana and the Tiramisu. Everything was perfect!!! I'm always on the hunt for good tomato soup and it was delicious!!!!! My husband ordered the meatballs, carbonara, and canoli and he said everything was yummy as well!   Our server was great and attentive...she was training another server but it was never awkward or intrusive. The manager came over also to check on us and wish us a Happy Anniversary. The restaurant was very busy, even for a Wednesday night, but we never felt neglected....we always had people checking on us. We had a great experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0msETj_74alSYtUP6WuTwg.text: Beautiful restaurant, delicious food...annoying service. Our waiter spent 15 minutes trying to push the family style dinner but wouldn't give us a price...told us it would range between 40-65 per person at the chefs discretion. It was like dealing with a used car sales man. He would not let it go even after we told him we were just ordering off the menu. He then tried to up sell us on everything. Made for a a super uncomfortable experience. Sad because the food is delicious. I'm not sure if this is was just a issue with our waiter...or if this is how the place operates.

t3COcGr6nDp6pevopeXzqQ.text: Came in with my boyfriend for my birthday on January 19th. We had reservations at 7:00 and even though we were about 10 minutes early we were seated right away. I really liked our table as it was right next to the window overlooking the Strip. The restaurant was busy but not overly packed.   This is where it started to go downhill. We sat for almost 15 minutes before my boyfriend had to flag down a busser to ask him to call our server. We hadn't even been poured water or given bread at all. The busser was nice enough to bring us both, telling us that our server would be right with us. 20 minutes goes by before our server even acknowledged our presence. What was really disturbing was that she was the waitress for the table directly next to us and had been walking right past us and using the register right next to us the whole time! I would not expect service like that from this type of establishment. Especially when it wasn't even very busy.   We ordered the mac 'n' cheese carbonara for an appetizer and it did not disappoint. It was very tasty and just the right portion size for the two of us. I decided on the chicken parmesan while my boyfriend got the spaghetti and meatballs. The food came out quickly and was delicious.   The only complaint was of the service and lack of attention from our server. Every time my boyfriend tried to get her attention to let her know it was my birthday she would ignore him. She seemed very preoccupied with a table of older men. I understand she saw a big tip but it kills the restaurant's reputation as there are many different groups of people who come in to dine.   It was good but there are other Italian restaurants in LV that have better food and prices with much better service. I have to say it really bummed me out that this experience wasn't what we had hoped for as it was a special occasion that we had been looking forward to for some time.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and Meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clockwise: Bellini, Moscow Mule, Mac &#39;N&#39; Cheese Carbonara appetizer

_QdrZBLNKvFA0LELqQIKiA.text: Had Lasagna, Shrimp Scampi and Meatballs.. among those 3 Shrimp Scampi is the winner .The rest is just ok.. nothing really special..

Kqf5cnTTmT7lywRrfv6YEA.text: Been here a few times, as we are a fan of the TV show.    Prices have definitely gone up.  Usually a "traditional Italian" (Buddy V's sells tradition throughout his advertising)  restaurant includes fresh bread.  Not this place.  Order the garlic bread, and await your bill $$$ .  The price of the drinks have skyrocketed as well.  The pasta is not fresh.   For the price of Buddy V's pasta, you have to offer some fresh pasta.  The deserts were actually terrible.   Not sure if Buddy V has actually dined at this restaurant for a while.  The quality has defiantly decreased.   We will not be going back here.

jfKCINzgPooKiZ4WJbMJ3w.text: We had dinner here on Mother's Day & the service was excellent!  My guy had the Sea scallops  and they were cooked to perfection. I had the Chicken Parmesan & spaghetti & it was delicious ! We had the meat & cheese board for starters. Everything was just perfect! Nice casual dining experience & delectable Italian dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fbuuPEiCDff4YfnBMbV3uQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! My new favorite restaurant!!! I wish I lived in Vegas so I could eat this often. I ordered shrimp scampi and calamari and Nutella cake. It was amazing. And not only was the food delicious but service was great! We got seated right away and the servers and busboys were on top of everything. Literally my whole experience was impeccable!!! I would highly recommend this place to everyone and anyone!!!!!!

Yb8TtlGbEI-WFx6amPX9Bw.text: Most horrible service ever!! Server was very dry. Didn't even say hello when we got to our table. When we began to order server graciela just kept asking us anything eles anything eles, apart from that took forever to even take our order. never coming back here again.

IvJPBiUtlE-oOoy3F2Fm_w.text: Family was in town and we decided to go here for dinner. I was able to get a last minute reservation which worked out perfect. The restaurant staff were great from the time we checked in for our reservation to the waiter we had as well. We all ordered something different and each item was delicious! We've been twice now and would recommend to anyone interested in eating here.

aGrBzjfAPrGQ1OEMZQjtKA.text: Food was mediocre. Atmosphere is cute, feels like a mom/pop restaurant. With all the great food options in Vegas, I was disappointed. Had the eggplant parm (ok), carbonara (not good).

eYGw_fmFN_Z-UdCxp8PYwg.text: These guys are a solid 3.5.  The service is very good, it is Vegas after all.  It is though a chain-like, more modern casual Olive Garden.  The food is a bit better than Olive Garden with some good items like the Sunday Gravy.  If you're expecting high quality Italian food this might not be the best stop. If you want some comfort food at a decent price, this is a good choice.   Sadly they don't have much from the Carlo's bakery dessert menu though.

atDn1UmWjS_NP8mldUVe_Q.text: I went to Buddy V's with some out of town guests who love Italian.  The location is good, the ambiance nice, the service was decent. The food was just OK; Not great by any means. Maybe I had high expectations, but I was seriously disappointed and so were my guests. I had the carbonara, it was super salty. My husband had the clams. He was not impressed.  The ceasar salad was excellent. For the price, not a great value.

ezFtwdWrNHnR1oX_h86CtA.text: Okay, the hostess took awhile to sit us down.  On the phone but didn't even look at us to smile.  This is they reason why I gave 4 instead of 5 star.  But overall, our waiter was nice and prompt.   The order were fast.  The food is alright.  We heard about the bakery and always see a long line.   We decided to give their dessert a try.  It's not the best we've tried but it's alright.

6zJF5-WMgCFd4ddq873QWw.text: Absolutely enjoyed it. We went with reservations (pardon the pun) expecting the food to rest on the tv show. We were happily surprised. Our waitress found out we were from Virginia as she was too. The personal touch was very nice. Food was great, served at the right time, tasted great, and ample portions. The price was very reasonable as well.

p9CxeVJb7NggAdBwqI6AnQ.text: This is a perfect low key Italian joint.  The best chicken parm I have had, which is saying something.  Also, the pasta was a perfect al dente.    Kid friendly, reasonable prices(for Vegas, anyway), good portion sizes.  Casual, non-spectacle joint, which is needed once in a while when visiting this town.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room

Z1zcJYrtno2drX3ayrkUqQ.text: The food was good. The service was ok. We had a group of 10 people eating for dinner. The waiter argued with us when we didn't order what he thought we should order, Including drinks. At the end of the meal he wouldn't separate our checks. He said that they couldn't do separate checks, but after We had to figure out each persons portion of payment he took everyone's cards. Made no sense. Would not recommend to a big group.

to3ZBBXzzvG7Rk-KkbbPoA.text: A little disappointed as I had expected great food! Do not order grilled cheese pesto sandwich! Awful ! Meatballs were average !  The orange sponge cake on the other hand was awesome! One of the best cake I've e ever had!

IJyeqNLlFLcz6WjXkuUiyg.text: Do not bother...... simple simon way over priced.  All dried pasta, no fetucini alfredo, meat balls had bone chips. It was a tourist trap joke.    There are far better choices at venetian  Note to Buddy, rethink it bro, dried pasta, at least cook it perfect.  It cod not be simpler to make your own pasta.  I Got spaghetti and meat balls 30.00

TCqUwIt9V7at2yZtqZmDOA.text: Food was great.  For the quality you cannot beat the price.  Wait staff was excellent.  Would highly recommend

6pPrVg6q9PLcf64XMBHY_g.text: Yummy food here! We ordered lasagna and chicken parmesan- two great choices! Large orders that we could not finish but definitely took it to go to experience it all over again the next day.

Y09VsxryTUsP3CpsNUScuw.text: Much better than expected...thought it was another gimmick restaurant.  Very happy with all our dishes, we ordered 3 different appetizers and 5 entrees and 2 kids plates.  Would be 5 stars but hostess made me wait in front of her for over a minute before acknowledging me...not cool....just raise your head up and say I'll be with you in a second.

TA_x4wed77qvRZuA4iYcIQ.text: We had a very enjoyable dinner at Buddy V's in the Palazzo Hotel. the prices were very reasonable, the service was good, and the food was delicious.  I had the chicken parmigiana and really enjoyed it. It was a very large portion with two large cutlets. The chicken was so tender, I didn't even need a knife, as I could cut it with a fork.  My wife had linguini with claims, and she also enjoyed her dinner. There were plenty of claims with the pasta.  We will definitely return during our next visit in Vegas.

cE-IMU6q-S5yr7rXBUMaVA.text: The food was delicious. We were there for our anniversary. Best Italian food ever,fast service and very friendly waiters.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking good - steak n lobster &amp; lasagnia

WXQIYL62sG0j_-GYGD2dIQ.text: We went here for brunch last week. Cost was about $50/pp with bottomless cocktails (included Bellinis, mimosas, Bloody Mary bar, and a few other choices I can't remember). I thought there could've been more food choices in the buffet. They had a crepe station but only offered two fillings, they had a decent mix of sweet and savory dishes to choose from though. We went up three times to refill our plates, and I enjoyed everything I ate. We loved the Bloody Mary bar! Such a cool addition! They also had live music which added a nice touch. I would recommend to anyone who loves a good brunch.

G3w0G_AlwVVXVtUcpMUrGw.text: Stayed at the Venetian and decided to eat here. Food was great. Probably some of the best Italian I've ever had. The service was great. Our cups never went empty and when I spilled a scant amount of tomato sauce on my shirt, the waiter came out of nowhere and gave me club soda to help with the stain and it worked! I will definitely be coming back here the next time I visit Vegas.

E_SArbIbynMjns6Hdx66gg.text: The customer service is excellent. Our waiter was very attentive. The food is super good. The experience was so worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A2gr9FeoSfJ5Eqx7XyLeLw.text: AMAZING!     My friend and I both had the Sunday Dinner Gravy and it was incredible.  Service was impeccable and Joy the bartender was great! Loved conversation with her and had a brilliant time.

amwW_01SQP-YLm-HCMnHww.text: We amazing got a order to go chicken piccata and it was amazing. I also went over to Carlos's bakery and took baked items to go and chocolate strawberries they were awesome thank you so much service was great and the bartender was very friendly.

zgtd2edLSTweWZViSxy1UQ.text: The food was simply one of most flavourful dishes I've ever had. I simply could not recommend the veal Marsala more. The service was even better than the meal. Polite, happy and efficient. Made sure we were happy. I'll gladly be going back next trip.

UPQ3WMamqUcDKyBgXXDedA.text: Loved this place.  My choice of pasta taste like it was home made.  I finished every bite!  We had a nice view to the Vegas strip

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FwRVGKMF_KnNf79K0o9btA.text: We had the opportunity to visit the new Buddy V's at the Venetian Las Vegas. We found the outside menu to be very interesting and the offer of happy hour irresistible!  unfortunatly, the man we met at the front desk did not share our excitement.  He acted irritated with our presence, but when asked, directed us to the upper level of the restaurant as the appropriate area for happy hour values.  after selecting a place to sit, we were accosted and told not to sit "there" as "that" isn't happy hour seating, "this" is happy hour seating.  (beware the hi top tables as they angle your drinks to the floor). Our poor waitress (April) seemed very unhappy to see us. She described a few of the beverages when asked, but after ordering "bellinis", she told us the Bellini machine was broken. When asked if the drink could be served on the rocks, she acted shocked and said it was impossible as it was made from a mix. We heard the bartender say the machine wasn't quite ready. When quizzed, the waitress said it wouldn't be ready for "hours!". We settled for the house red, and let me tell you, i do mean settled.  the transparency of the liquid lent itself more to watery cool-aid, with legs and bouquet to match. We did sample a pasta appetizer, which might have lead us to believe the food was worth putting up with the service, but a smart phone app lead us to better Venetian opportunities. Our party was met with a hostile glare as we were fleeing the establishment, and i was forced to resort to mad dogging the man(ager?) to make good our escape.  greeting cold, directions sketchy, service irritated, food potential but unknown, farewell hostile.  1/2 star....

8V1jayXx-9ap08bsK3obtg.text: Stopped in for a small dinner and was blown away by the food and the service. The Eggplant Parmesan was absolutely amazing and the Garlic Bread was just fantastic. The service was wonderful and very attentive, and the live music was a wonderful bonus.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

OINEvPaRDjMAveln9dpccQ.text: So I love the food! Food is fantastic. Service was subpar. Our server Deanna seemed irked by our presence. If this is suppose to be a family friendly restaurant I definitely didn't get that feel. Half our party arrived and sat down and began eating. Then the rest of us joined them about 15 minutes later. We stood there waiting to be seated with our group for about another 10 by that time some of our group had finished eating stood up and left so we could sit. No one came to ask if we needed help as we stood next the table. Like I said food Amazing service Subpar at best.

kh_LTlHjqtPFUgSTTnd0HA.text: Very good meal, timely reservation and service!  My only complaint would have my balsamic salad dressing was below standard although the ingredients of the salad were good quality.  The Lasagna is a mega-meal onto itself.  The Tomato Basil soup was good and my wife loved her Spaghetti Bologanese.  The Raspberry Sorbet was excellent!

-jf3TO4EgTZsJjQEsFXnUA.text: Lasagna was great , caesar salad had these incredible croutons made from polenta. Service staff was really great but our waiter was pushy and a little rude. Kept trying to force us to have the family meal, when we declined dessert he kept telling us full or not we had to have it. When one of the kids asked about a dish he told them when he was young you ate what was put in front of you and explained to us how we care to much what they (children) think. Overall food and atmosphere was great ...maybe we just weren't getting the waiters spence of humor.

hF-PiU1FV_8xIhAzCA9jwA.text: Best kept secret in Vegas. I brought prospective customers here during Shot Show 2015 and it was an overwhelming success. We ate in the bar area during happy hour. $4 American beers (16 oz) and $5 appetizers. The food consisted of the best meatball sliders I have ever tasted, sausage and pepper sliders, calamari and ricotta cheese with garlic toast points. Outstanding food, great staff (especially Mike the bartender from The North End). What else would we expect from the Cake Boss?

Xd6Q_7KrLzIQfcRYkl2WfA.text: This is a good place to go before you catch a show. Not to pricey for a nice meal in Vegas and the food is good. I enjoyed eating here but it wasn't anything spectacular.

GqZJKU-zDZ7t4UK5FPtD0w.text: Very good and wonderful service. I like the decor. I feels like you're in a home and the food is very filling. It is like a home cooked Italian meal. Great experience and good food. I would definitely recommend it.

LlKRTUFniFA8ZQVKP0EAXQ.text: Great food!! Chicken Marsala is a must try. The rest of my group enjoyed their food as well. The spaghetti was also very good. Check this place out.

cxInwdkytOGXdIkiiLAk6A.text: Everything was like eating at mommom sophie's. From the chopped salad to the garlic bread and bowls of fresh made meatballs!  Recommend it to anyone!  And im going across to carlo's bake shop for a cup cake!

taMvmWwq_jpz8O4paT-v2w.text: Ate here twice during our stay because it was so good. Fantastic Italian food and feel-like-family service. So many restaurants disappoint, but this one lives up to the hype. Ordered an appetizer, salad and entree each time and loved 'em all. The spaghetti and meatballs were the best evah!  Also, be sure to order dessert!

O8Wg--DglZDAW5-nPGnPlQ.text: The atmosphere is cool and view of the strip is nice. The bolognese was very good but the meatball sub was so-so at best with bread so hard the stuff in the middle spilled out everywhere. The house salad was nothing more than romain and the lemon vinaigrette was incredibly salty...like bathed in salt. Not sure I'd come back, so many other good options that are in the same general are.

pLeftI_pdCGjOtfYjDh8Xw.text: We love the food, but today the service was terrible! The chicken parm is FANTASTIC! My husband loves the meatballs and the kids swear the pizza is the best. Usually the service is wonderful, but for whatever reason today the server was totally inattentive. Luckily the food is so good, we will come back.

ePRVKEyhKeZDj4MebS_8gw.text: I went here for Valentines Day and it was the best Italian food I've had in Vegas! Great service and pretty fast. A nice view no matter where you sit and pretty atmosphere/good music. I had the Chicken Parm and it was soo good. The Chicken Marsala was so tender too. And the fried mozzarella appetizer was delicious. Highly recommend!

tphjx9btYqMHICiegyW2-A.text: The best chicken parm there is! And their cannolis are so delicious. You must eat here in Vegas!

k3wYaDUmTmDg4GRiCbuYVg.text: I was very impressed. Great food and good service. I ordered the Spaghetti Central, had a great flavor to it. Also the fresh bread was a great addition to the meal.

SDMsFB2TCMVjQYa5VaJGUA.text: The food was great. I had the cheese ravioli with chicken added. It came within 10 minutes and was amazing! Our waiter was also friendly. He made sure we had everything we needed! Great cheese bread with vinegar and oil before the meal!

IFPSZ_hKmmBa6FcTQogLYg.text: Sorry, I couldn't tell you about the food since we didn't get that far....   Buddy might make this food for his family, but not allowing them to sit until the entire party is present is rude!!  I fully understand when it is busy, but there were so many open tables it was almost alarming.    We asked both the hostess and the manager (both rude and short) if we could sit and have a drink and we were told no, but you can go to the bar and get a drink.  Since a few of us worked in the industry, we understand the policy when it is busy, but when it is not I would think a good manager would make the right decision.  We felt like Greg Focker in Meet the Parents when he wanted to board the plane.   That's OK, Canaletto happily sat us (they were slammed btw) and enjoyed taking our $250 lunch tab along with the 2 additional friends who came when we were finished of our referral.

rf-minA302AnHHnnV6xApg.text: I got the cheese ravioli and the Portion was sorta small for the price. Atmosphere is casual and very family friendly. I'll come back an maybe try something else. Servers we're VERY attentive and even gave us appetizers on the house!!

_VV_DZbDcCcI7BLtrVrwJw.text: We ate in the bar area, and thoroughly enjoyed the happy hour food and drinks. The atmosphere was pleasant, while the food and drinks were surprisingly good. Highly recommend the meatballs. The only disappointment was the service from server Miko. He was very chatty with a few tables, while short and dismissive with others. He would take your order, but didn't return to the table to check on you, refill drinks, recommend additional food items to order, take new drink orders, etc. On the other hand, the men and women who cleared the tables, refilled water glasses, brought out new utensils, etc were efficient and pleasant. If management reads these reviews, please pass along praises to your staff who work hard and deserve recognition for a job well done, while taking note of the one employee who seriously missed the mark.

v4uD141-1wdRtzZfgVNTUg.text: Amazing food!  Quite possibly the best pasta I've ever had. We loved the ambiance looking out at the strip with the jazz band playing next to us. Highly recommend a visit to this place if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parmesan, parmesan risotto, and spaghetti and meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and Meatballs

GkIJHg-FDyG5s-rYvv99SQ.text: We came here because of the great reviews and proximity to our hotel. We were seated right at 2pm for lunch on a Sunday and service was prompt and attentive. I ordered the garlic bread and lasagna and it was absolutely divine!! I would surely recommend buddy's again, especially after a full weekend of partying in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread, some of the best I have ever tried.

dHDVNnLkSW8Q8rvbn8sKEg.text: Buddy is more than just the boss of cake...he's the boss of FOOD in general!  I can't even begin to describe how excited I was when my stepdad told us that we were going to have Christmas dinner at Buddy V's in the Venetian.  I was the only one out of our family of four who even knew who BuddyV was!  Can you believe it?!  Okay, so Christmas night we head to the Venetian from the Bellagio expecting more traffic than there actually was.  But it's a good thing we left when we did because maneuvering through the Venetian was a fete in and of itself!  I won't fault the restaurant for this - for all we know, there could have been a short cut that we had no clue about.  Also what we didn't know that CARLO'S BAKERY was right across from the restaurant, complete with viewing glass into the bakery!!  Of course I got pictures ;)  So, walked right up to the hostess at Buddy V and got seated immediately by the window facing The Strip.  It was a beautiful evening with a nice view. EVERYONE we encountered in the restaurant was amazing.  My 3 other party members all ordered Buddy's Christmas Prix Fixe menu (in photos) which consisted of butternut squash soup, crusted prime rib, smoked mashed potatoes, and a chocolate Yule log for dessert.  I opted for steak and lobster  with a side Caesar salad as I am not a fan of butternut squash...or prime rib for that matter.  We were greeted with freshly baked bread topped with a wonderful herb mixture.  The server's assistant brings it out on essentially a cast iron sheet seemingly straight from the oven.  No butter is offered, but they provide an olive oil and red vinegar mixture.  Most of us got full just off the bread!  Oh!  And breadsticks are waiting for you at your table when you're seated - not the Olive Garden kind, but the kind that come pre-packaged in wrappers and are very crunchy.  Our server brought out my salad the same time as the others had their soup.  I did try the soup and it was, surprisingly, very good to my non-butternut squash-loving palate.  There seemed to be a delicious marshmallow cream on top.  The entrees arrive and they are positively beautiful!  I ordered my filet medium well, but after I had finished half my lobster and took a bite of my filet is when I noticed that my steak was far from medium-well...it was literally still bleeding.  My mom apparently did not know that prime rib generally comes with quite a bit of pink to it so she had me flag down our server to ask him to have the kitchen cook our meat a little longer.  The server was very gracious and apologetic but we were quick to let him know it was not his fault.  Before long, the manager made his way to our table to profusely apologize for the mistake in our meat temperatures and offered to bring us more soup or an appetizer to apologize - wish was amazing - but we declined as we knew it would be too much food.  When the server came back out with our corrected order, to my mom's surprise (but I kind of figured this would happen), they actually brought out two fresh dishes!  We were beyond thankful!!  To top it off, our server let us know that his manager put our first round of drinks on the house!!  I mean, this was impeccable service!!!  We couldn't have asked for a better experience.  Buddy V's deserves all the accolades it can get and I absolutely cannot wait to return!  OH!!  How could I forget that I just HAD to order one of Buddy's famous cannolis.  I had never eaten a cannoli before so why not start with the best?  The cannoli's presentation (as well as the entire meal) was wonderful!!  Two different cookie-flavored ends and a scrumptious chocolate caramel sauce that I just wanted to drink!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2018 Christmas Prix Fixe Yule Log
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. World-famous cannoli with chocolate caramel sauce
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2018 Christmas Prix Fixe herb crusted prime rib

OA00p5QqjcWx_XPLcdAa4Q.text: During a search for the perfect birthday cake we were excited to find Carlo's Bakery located in the Venetian. Everybody loves the Cake Boss! Directly across from Carlo's is Buddy V's. They were happy to make our reservation for 7 and even seated us early.   I stepped out of my normal lasagna comfort zone and order the grilled salmon. The presentation was perfect but unfortunately I have a terrible time controlling my facial expressions. The mashed potato portion would have been gone in about 4 bites. I said it was fine, but within a few minutes our waiter returned to the table with another side dish of potatoes and I must admit a tear of joy was shed. The food wasn't as expensive as we expected so we also ordered a bottle of wine.   Can't forget the cake! The birthday girls fittingly got the Italian Birthday Cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Birthday Cake
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Salmon

CmPjUXzdn2xWTgCHhXPE_w.text: I would recommend Buddy V's to anyone! The only reasons I'm giving my review a 4 star instead of a 5 star is because the drinks cost more than I thought was necessary and the constant attempt to up sell me at every encounter. Our server was not rude about it but it was more or less annoying. This is my first time to Vegas so I knew things would be costly but it shocked me.   I ordered the lasagna and after my first bite, I quickly knew that it was the best lasagna that I've ever had! My husband had the chicken parmigiana and it came with two chicken breasts! Come hungry or prepare to share a meal because we both left with enough food to feed us two or three times over!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna

CoGBzlrpONCkuz19RfzD5w.text: 3.5 stars.  Got the Prix fix menu. For 2  Caesar salad - 2.5stars generic salad+ 1 stars for the polenta croutons which made it more outstanding. Needed more dressing.   Panzanella salad:4 stars (but u need to ask for more dressing-which is like a balsamic shallot mayo-yummy!). Salad was spring mix, but crouton, soft cheese, and tomatoes made up for by having multiple textures.   Steak pizzaiola: 5 stars. Sirloin steak that taste prime quality grill to well done perfection as ordered with minimal charring. Over a bed of cheesy polenta and topped with roasted tomatoes that helps give it just enough saltiness for the steak.   Salmon: 2.5 stars. Well cooked and beautiful presentation but lacked flavor. The acidity in the veggie malange under the salmon would have balanced the flavors well, but the salmon had no taste.   Tiramisu: 3 stars. Hubby liked it. Didn't care for it too much.   Canoli: don't know if it's just me but only 2 stars. Tasted heavy and not much flavors.   Maybe next time we will pick something else instead of the prix fix.   Oh the cake boss cocktail:5 stars. Sweet cocktail for those who have a sweet tooth. Chocolate liquor with creamy Bailey depth and cake crumbs.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panzanella salad: delicious but have to ask for more dressing.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon: beautiful presentation but lacked flavors.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak pizziola: must order.

uRafPZLlcvPf-_y8FvC_GA.text: A pretty good deal for  prime real estate strip prices that are no stranger to culinary inflation. And for lower prices come here during non-prime time hours like 2-5 or something like that.  Free complimentary bread and breadsticks and main courses that are less than 25$ . Good deal.  And shoutouts to the servers/manager/busser for being able to handle my rowdy friend. The manager was very kind enough and astute when she realized the forfeited expense of the extra side pasta was most certainly not worth battling his brash behavior.   Ordered the popular chicken Parmesan. Chef was able to bake it exactly how it should be: moist and cheesy with a lighter breaded exterior.  Side rustic pasta was fresh, nicely seasoned and even better with extra fresh Parmesan cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baked chicken Parmesan. Very good. Enjoy it!

GRArE61bmKQ37Co0cKPgvg.text: Amazing Italian and ambiance in Vegas! We were with a large group celebrating multiple birthday and we had no issue getting a same day reservation for 14 people. After our delicious dinner they brought out a TRAY of desserts to celebrate the multiple birthdays! Will definitely visit again!

0gmN4C4ElBLjMktHPyzMNg.text: I have eaten here several times and everything I have shoved in my mouff has always been on point. Try to get a seat by window, the view is amazing with the windows stretching from the ceiling to the floor. I always get the Caesar salad, it's enough for four people, and they have polenta croutons! Linguine & clams are delish, my friend had the smashed meatball sub and she loved it. I don't like soggy bread so I didn't get to indulge. My Mother in Law's Linguine Shrimp Scampi was perfect! Madeline's Roasted Vegetable Linguine rocked my mouff! Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno is a must! Cheese Ravioli was awesome..I could go on and on but you get it...it's a must if you come to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Madeline&#39;s Roasted Vegetable Linguine  Confit of zucchini, eggplant &amp; tomatoes, spinach, kale, garlic, basil, pecorino
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love cute little details like this. A tiny milk can they use for creamer for your coffee
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. it was just a cardboard cut out, but he was real to us..LOL!

6njHiau6D0tNyUU9GC_7Yw.text: Never disappoints , the eggplant parmesan outstanding as is the veal piccata and veal Marcella . The garlic linguine outstanding!. The only neg is the loud singer entertainment.

fG5J_NORYwOP7dtKtjTpeQ.text: I had the "My Mother in Law's Linguine Shrimp Scampi" and it was ah-mazing. It was really tasty and the actual shrimp portion was really big. Also, I'm from Long Island, New York. I've had pretty amazing cannolis, and Buddy Valastro makes the best cannolis (considering it's a chain) hands down.   Will definitely be back in the future to try the other classics. Highly recommend!

88ZB5SVsPVZmFmLB58YWKg.text: OMG, the orecchiette!    The two man band playing classic Vegas tunes at the bar was also excellent. The singer's voice was so good, it was like I had attended a Vegas show for free with dinner!

dnOke-wOqYNlLMu7a41h2g.text: First off let me say, best chicken parm ever. Def pricey, but you're on the vegas strip.... what do you expect? Slightly negative remarks-the tables are dainty, and with it being family style, things can get crammed real quickly and the restaraunt music was a little too loud for my taste. Also, the lady who answered the phone when I called to check the wait literally just said "hello" no thank you for calling blah blah. Really unprofessional. Other than that, everything else was awesome. Our waitress was attentive and kind. The food came out in an orderly fashion. We received complimentary bread for the table and ordered garlic bread in addition, though the garlic bread was good, it was unnecessary. The caesar salad was good, croutons were weird. The croutons were soft, cheesy with a hint of lemon. I've never had anything like it but wasnt a fan of that part of the salad. Now.... for the star of the night, the chicken parm! The chicken was so thick and juicy, with a nice even layer of cheese and marinara on top. The spaghetti that accompanied was prob the best red sauce I've ever had. Now.... I love me some good maggianos, but this beat their chicken parm! The noodles were perfectly al dente, perfect amount of sauce and such good flavor. We ordered the tiramisu-good, not great. And the cannoli! The cannoli was really yummy. We will be back because it was so stinking good.

g_Xa3yivpGYgzFDLU4gTDA.text: Wonderful Dining experience. r9XQakFuyZ_iFv7dXN5fSw.text: Got a fantastic table at the window.  Focaccia bread was brought to the table.  Never saw the guy again.  I guess it's one and done.  Calamari was mostly the tentacles which is not so great. Toscano salad was just ok.  Entree's came out before we were done with salads which is bad business.  Entrees dropped off without any follow up.  No parm or spoon for my linguini with clams.  It finally arrived when I was half way done with my meal.  My friend had orchiette with sausage and he it was good not fantastic.  Spoke to manager who offered free desert. I appreciated his concern.  With so many choices for in Vegas, this will not be a future option for me.

ZyVlQMGnKW1JVxWMoOhpwA.text: I was so in love with this spot. The meatballs to start were so yummy they melted in my mouth. The melon cocktail was so refreshing and delicious. The service was spot on. They were quick, kind, helpful, and articulate. I suggest coming here if you're ever in Vegas. The noodles and sauce were so delicious and my boyfriends meal was full of different meats that were all to die for. Great place!

v-MWT4dbtiU6124_W4YBmA.text: Best dishes & pointers. We went here in May & just went again tonight. Best dish we've had is the lasagna. Salmon & Chicken Marsala are ok, Chicken Parm is much better than anywhere else. Great service. There's live music from the bar, really enjoyable, and they take requests. Great place for any size group & celebrations!

SFBHhib40cWwV5PvF8USKg.text: Great ambiance, nice waitstaff. I went here last year and had the veal marsala, was great. Went today and had the clam linguine, taste was ok, but the clams were a bit overcooked and rubbery, and I thought it needed some citrus-- I asked for some lemons and the waitstaff gave me some, which made it taste better (to me. Maybe other people don't put citrus in their seafood pasta.) The pasta itself was cooked right, and the sauce was good too. I'm docking a star for the overdone clams which are what I look forward to in a clam linguine. For $24, it was eh...I think that pasta dish was more $17-18 quality. The other stuff on the menu might be better though; my veal was good, and hopefully the clam linguine was an outlier.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bJ67dkQOkCDHb3lfCPKbqA.text: If you are looking for Italian food on the strip, you should definitely check out Buddy V's! I came here for lunch with the SO and was seated right away. The restaurant is very open and spacious which I really liked!   To start, we were provided warm foccacia bread which was oh so yum! We ordered the lasagna and the linguini and clams. Both entrees were so good and super filling. The food is also very affordable which I liked. Next time I'm in town, I'll definitely be back to try other dishes on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini and Clams

uDNsvOwNdWqJgp-1FwsVjg.text: My sister and I made reservations at Buddy V's after the Las Vegas Half Marathon in November. We wobbled our way over to the Venetian after we had our showers back at our hotel (Flamingo).   For those that don't know, the Las Vegas Half and Full Marathon are at night, so we were eating dinner probably at like 10pm. I was actually surprised at the modern, upscale interior of Buddy's. I was expecting a layout similar to an Olive Garden or Buca di Beppo, but this place is definitely higher end.   We were seated near a window, which we really enjoyed because we got to people watch down below and see people finishing the marathon.  Although we were worn out, we needed to refuel. As much as I normally would have loved a glass of wine at this kinda place, I stuck with water since I felt dehydrated. I ordered a side Caesar salad for starter and the spaghetti for my main meal.   The Caesar was okay. The dressing wasn't as flavorful and the croutons are really weird. They are not your normal croutons. They are soft and essentially taste like funnel cake. I didn't love that but what do you expect from a pastry chef? I only finished maybe half the salad.  The spaghetti was good. I enjoyed the sauce and the overall flavor was good. Although, it was nothing to write home about. Pretty baseline spaghetti.  All in all, this place is a pretty standard Italian restaurant with an upscale, modern feel. Their price points are very reasonable and it's seated at a great location, so if you're looking for a non-chain place in Las Vegas, this might be a good option for you.

O4c-h4--wJ5eTo1tCkS2Zg.text: I came here for a Sunday brunch and holy cow this place was amazing! They serve shrimp cocktail early in the morning at 10:30AM (YES!)  First of all, the hostess and waitresses are very kind and attentitive. They were also informative as well since they knew it was our first time here at Buddy V's. I ordered bottomless mimosas, but you could also change your drinks to a sangria or a Bellini! I thought that deal was one I had to take! Their food was delicious! I loved their tomato soup and the ham that they served. I also loved the scrambled eggs and the mini crepes they had. Their "Grandma meatballs" were also very flavorful and satisfying  I've been to the brunch buffet in Paris but I've got to say this Sunday brunch buffet tops Paris!   I can definitely see myself coming back here again, my only complaint would be that the area is too cold. I think if they raised their tempurature it would have been more comfortable for me but everyone in my party was so cold, which was the only reason why we wanted to get out of there.

UiFgqDD6jT1RE4C2S5B4Vw.text: What a nice place to eat! Not too fancy. Not too cheap. Great for families! It wasn't the best in flavor since most everything was on the bland side but it was still good.   Chicken parmigiana- a bit bland chicken. Needs a bit more spices. Still good to eat though! Spaghetti was yummy! Some Italian places make this dish too salty so I preferred it more bland and adding a bit of salt.   Prime rib- yes, at an Italian restaurant. Not the best to order but it was a prix fixe meal so we tried it. Prime rib was also a bit bland, but again, better than salty, which I've gotten too.   Lou's gravy- meat lovers would love this one! All kinds of meats- sausage, meatballs, lamb, I forgot the others. Husband loved it! He said it was actually too much meat. That's not often heard of.   Clam spaghetti- seasoned on the bland side again but clams were juicy and not chewy.   Garlic cheese bread- now that was delicious!! I could have more of that!! We're ordering more of that next time.   Customer service- 5 star rating!! The young gentleman was very accommodating. He was so patient with my son too. When asked why there was no star on the Xmas tree, he said he wasn't sure but he would look into getting one next year. He then took my son to see a bigger tree at the back of the restaurant to check for a star. He said he'd tell the manager that that tree needed one too after confirming with my son. The extra help in getting out dishes and filling our cups were so "johnny on the spot" too!!! Loved every bit of the wait staff!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

svm3UXwjoG5_QCmF5jwvkw.text: We had a great experience for being our first time. The Host was A Little Rude And Not Welcoming. As soon as Georgio Attended Our Table He Made Our Experience Well Worth The Time. Thank You Georgio For The Desert And The Photo. We will definitely Go Back On A Trip Back To Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qpbis2gjJIg5cgvRK6I9aw.text: Had such a great meal here! We went during lunch time so we sat in the bar and got the express menu which was $22 for 3 courses! Such a great deal and the food was amazing. The carbonara was a hit!

tqRsy0m-_yL3gBWTN15IqQ.text: OMG! One of the best Italian restaurant we have ever been at. We are from LA, and came to Las Vegas for the Thanksgiving weekend. On Saturday night my son chose that restaurant for his B-day, and - it was perfect! The location, the ambiance, the food , and the service. Everything was just PERFECT!  The restaurant is big and beautiful, with an awesome view. Everything we ordered from the menu (and i mean everything) was delicious!! We even ordered few dishes twice. The service was quick and amazing. The servers were all polite, kind and friendly. What an awesome experience.  We will not miss that restaurant in any trip to Las Vegas, for sure.   If you like Italian food, don't look any farther. This is definitely the best.

KFv3EXkPxI17iZDmPM5NoA.text: Cocktails are good, though the bartender definitely seemed overworked.  Meatballs were amazing.  Mac & cheese carbonara was so bland and underwhelming (even after adding salt) that I left a good amount because why waste the calories.  Clearly a bad choice on ordering that.  Overall though Buddy V's seems like a pretty good place and everyone around me seemed to be enjoying their meals.  I would definitely return, for the meatballs if nothing else.

iGdsoJA6Q_blrJSUKSdzeg.text: I am a foodie. I live in Los Angeles and I try all restaurants. I know the difference between bad and good food. This was definitely good food at its best! The staff was beyond amazing from when you checked in at the hostess stand  to the waiters assistant even the manager came by to see how we were doing, this was just one of the best evenings we had in Vegas. If you love good Italian food don't miss out. You will not be disappointed.... Go for the chicken Parmesan or the scallops

zujDL8VRMaJp6v1aI2EBSw.text: This place was amazing! the food (I tired several plates becauze my friends and I all shared) was all amazing! I personally ordered the chicken rigatoni, and it was fabulous. Our server was hilarious and an excellent waiter. Even the bus boy was extremely polite and helpful.

qSe1afOBz6IAM5Ql0O4P1g.text: I had the dish called My Mother/in-law's Scappellini Linguine with shrimp.  It was one  of the best dishes I've had in a long time.  Great flavor, nice sized shrimped and perfect serving size.  Our server was wonderful. Only down side was a not so friendly or welcoming hostess.  Don't let her stop you!   Bon Appetit!

f-pqjmmIGaft0BShaYEv6Q.text: I can't say anything bad about the delicious restaurant. You smell the del ious home cooking as soon as you get close to this restaurant . My husband ordered a ceasar salad and the croutons were crisp but baked soft on the inside. I swear those croutons changed his life! I had to try one for myself and it was different and delicious. I ordered the lasagna and grammas meatballs. The meatballs and tomato basil soup was so good. I could barely get started on my lasagna but the few bites I did take were Devine. I had to get a go go bowl. X since I didn't have a microwave to eat it later, I put it in my room fridge until it was time for me to go then I carefully wrapped and packed it and brought it home to Houston. I enjoyed it at home.

I6Pdfm0KK2EKMMK5SYSaZw.text: Went here cause of my love for Cake Boss and came away floored at how amazing the food at the service was at Buddy's.  The lasagna is to die for, and ask ask ask for the focaccia bread ... it is amazing!! Our waiter was a True Italian and was amazing at getting us all that we needed!! I can not recommend Buddy V's enough!!!!

d-pwbd8DftX54Q6x-M1XaQ.text: Everything was sooooo good . I would recommend this place so much . Portions were very good . I can't wait to go again.

VI3tr_cEB6Hepm_CK0csJg.text: Soooo I was mostly disappointed with my dinner last night.... I liked the ambiance of the restaurant and the Grilled garlic bread was really good but the salad, pasta, and dessert left something to be desired! My salad was pretty boring but I longed for another salad once I got the completely unseasoned pasta. I had to add wayyyy to much salt and pepper to give it some flavor. My friends pasta was also really really bland. Together our check was like $125 which is a bit expensive for a meal that you left feeling kinda blahhh about! At least in my opinion.

dIKqv5CCWDxyRqvcItEYWA.text: Hands down, the BEST Italian food I have had. I had the chicken rigatoni and the sauce was something I have never experienced....EVER! I loved it here. From the staff service, to the food and decor, it was amazing. And that's not the end of it. We met the cake boss himself ! He was so nice and he went and greeted every table in the restaurant. Carlo's Bakery is located right across from the restuarant. And the cannolis are a must try. My husband and had our anniversary lunch here and we will be coming back every time we are in Vegas. I highly recommend this place.

bco1TqHg6as7Z7GcnwCgKQ.text: Glad we made the decision to check this place out . I would definitely recommend. Good service and even better dishes

rDTSofplnA9E2dMDY-gUEQ.text: This place is incredible. I popped in for a late lunch and sat at the bar (great bartender, btw, very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu). I had something so crazy simple - Spaghetti Pomodoro -  but it was some of the best pasta that I have ever had - no joke (and I have been to Italy multiple times). If you can do something like this so well, I can't wait to go back and try your other items! As Arnold S says, "I'll be BACK!"

zNpJEeMm6ZNp0hQOUde-8g.text: So loud, as in get-a-headache loud, I don't know why they didn't put in any sound absorbing panels as the restaurant was all hard surfaces and at full capacity, the noise was unbearable.  I couldn't really enjoy the food, but it was okay, nothing special from other Italian eateries on the strip.  If you're deaf, you should be fine otherwise I would stay away...would not go back.

iGg87dA8Gto8WkCxkkAUug.text: I was skeptical at first about trying a place based on a TV personality. But I am so happy I did. They have a brunch on the weekends until I want to say 230 and it looked amazing with a large variety. I did not try it due to arriving at the end of the time frame but I would go back just for that. I had the meatball sandwich and a cedar salad. The cedar salad had polenta croutons with like a lemon flavor. I love love love polenta so this was everything. I'd even go back just for this salad and it was a very large portion. Also tried the chicken parmigiana and the creamy pasta carbonara. All good. The theme is also very cute with checkered table clothes and very good service. There is also a view of the strip from the windows that I enjoyed. I would highly recommend this place.

PdUPNnxV2BtR6sZQbdEpsw.text: O. M. G.  The food is so amazing and the service is great. Everything we ordered was served family style. I'm not sure if that's the norm, because I was there with my husband and a company dinner. We had some of everything. Lasagna, calamari, filets, scallops...and several more items. EVERYTHING was good. The lasagna and calamari were my favorite. So flavorful and presented beautifully.   I am in Vegas a few more days and I will definitely be back for round two.

nC7Jf7d-ukJfyZcrkWVKjQ.text: So glad we were able to experience this restaurant! I ordered the carbonara with wheat pasta, and my fiance ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Both were delicious. Spaghetti sauce was very fresh with ripe tomatoes. My dish was flavorful and not too heavy for a cream-based sauce. The complimentary bread was also tasty. We did not try the dessert here, but wish we had because Carlo's Bakery across the way was a disappointment compared to this restaurant. Next time, we will order dessert here and see if it's better than the quick stop place.
