Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara with wheat pasta- so yummy.

ZNQZ29pP1mLJnGyXkxgwaA.text: We walked and walked and walked and walked..... this place is hard to find! After going on a mission to find this spot for something sweet - my two friends said it all looks like supermarket bakery items and didn't order- wtf? We worked too hard to get here! I ordered a hazelnut mini cream puff (about $3 or $4 I don't remember exactly- a little pricey for its size but not crazy). The ordering part sucks ballls! You order with one person then another bags it up, while you wait on yet another line to pay then another to pick up.  There were only 4 people in front of me and this ordeal took 20 minutes! This is where they lost a star.  I finally got my little golden chocolate hazelnut nugget- and OMG!! So good.  Worth all the hassle- I didn't even share with my friends- who judged this pastry by its cover.

DCfF4Ie_wJ56XgT-nK-cNA.text: Our service was excellent and the waiter was very nice. I ordered the calamari and the caprese. The calamari was good but also very salty. The caprese had great flavor and I loved how the bread was so perfectly cooked that it had a nice crunch, combined with the flavor of the cheese etc. it made a perfect flavor leaving you to eat all the others.

ubr_sinoFJPS32WnKpOTlA.text: I came here for lunch with a Group. I ordered a margarita pizza and it was delicious. The pastas also looked amazing but I did not want something too heavy. The pasta sauce is well-made and the ingredients are fresh. The ambience isn't too fancy so if you're looking for a upscale Vegas dinner place this spot might not be it. It was however a great place to get in and out for lunch.

HI3gM2fOCItIfr-c0jBKJQ.text: I was really excited to come here for dinner based on all the reviews but once I left, I wondered why it was so loved. It wasn't terrible, but it also wasn't amazing.  I called in a week ahead and made reservations for a Friday night. They were accommodating and I called the night before to confirm the reservation. The place isn't hard to find, but it can be better described..I was told it was across Barney's, but there are many levels and entrances. Anyhow, we were seated promptly, but without menus. The waitress came by a few min later and described that they do family style or menu if we prefer. We preferred the menu. Since we were pretty hungry, I ordered 2 fries for our table and we all ordered our food- some of us to share the meals.  The fries came, and they were mediocre. Then someone came by with warm bread for the table- I wish they did this sooner so we knew. Or even mentioned it. Anyhow, food arrived and it was fine. I shared the chicken parm and it was decent. No one complained about the food, but no one raved about it either.  It did take some time for the check and then for them to come back to collect it.  Would I go here again? Maybe but it wouldn't be my first choice.

sACWexSVjbuqt_UPkDYq0Q.text: Celebrity chefs have let me down before in Vegas, but I was pleasantly surprised by Buddy V's. For a man known for his cake, he can dream up some good Italian food.  You may be shocked by the prices at first (well probably not it is Vegas), but the dishes are served family style. Yes, you can realistically share a dish with someone else. (My exception to this would be the spaghetti.) The Cesar salad was crisp and coated in dressing and could easily be split between two or three. There are very few options for vegan's or people who don't want dairy, but you can opt for the Spaghetti Pomodoro. Usually, I do not like spaghetti at restaurants because most of the time I can DIY. However, the flavors of the sauce were fantastic. Super tasty my only gripe is that in comparison to everything else the portions were tiny. Luckily you can load up on the deliciously garlicky, buttery, and cheesy bread. This place seems to stay pretty busy, so get there early. In a world of lackluster name driven Chef restaurants don't be affraid to take a chace on Buddy V's Ristorante.

0QcZ8tR6x9U3eZQ3fy2VkA.text: Peter made out night! What a great fun evening. The lasagna was AWESOME and I had 1/3 and shared the rest with the group. Grandma meatballs were way SALTY! My guess is that they sit in a bath of constantly evaporating liquid that just gets more and more salty.  We wanted to try famous desserts but were carb'd out after bowls of tasty pasta. Easy OpenTable reservation and to note is was Valentines day but we ate at 5pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandma&#39;s Salty Meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna enough for 3
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigitoni

j2g9cyboTntMkUGU4VDoOg.text: Wonderful service!!  The food was excellent. My daughter even asked for something not on the menu and hers was amazing. The wine options were excellent. Would liked to see a gnocchi option on the menu. We skipped the dessert because we were too full.

sPBz5HutZeDzJ0JOW-doRA.text: Not a fan of Buddy Valastro as a tv chef personality; however, his restaurant did offer some delicious and memorable appetizers.   Pros  Macaroni & Cheese Carbonara: One of the most decadent and rich mac & cheese I've had. Although the pancetta was lacking, the cheese sauce was pure heaven and the penne pasta was cooked just right.   Aunt Nina's Mozzarella Corozza: It's pretty much a delicious version of the grilled cheese sandwich filled with plenty of mozzarella and pesto that is placed on a chunky bed of ragu. The only dislike I had about this appetizer was that the sandwich was drench in too much olive oil for grilling.   Margherita Pizza: A simple pie that was baked to perfection with a perfect ratio of mozzarella, tomato, and basil.   Overall great dining experience with delicious food to start off the day. I definitely will return and also will be saving room for dessert to try out his popular bakery, Carlo's Bakery that is located across the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aunt Nina&#39;s Mozzarella en Carozza

ckfU4zDJqeyPcjPBzLPTwg.text: We had the surf and turf, finished every bite! Excellent food, it was cooked perfectly. We can't wait to come back.

rYax4TKCkEgo6Xbh-k4Dlg.text: Went to Buddy's for Saturday brunch and it was so delicious! There was such a wide variety of good food and the service was wonderful! Would definitely recommend to anyone heading to Las Vegas

Kf342cmeSBYL5uPgJhhshQ.text: What do the macaroni grill, bucca di beppo and Buddy V have in common? More than you would think.   We had the lasagna and chicken marsala, both were fine, but very ordinary. If you gave me these dishes from any of those 3 restaurants I don't think I could tell the difference. That doesn't mean the food is bad, but Buddy V advertises and charges like it's something more.    On a side note the lasagna was a massive block of melted cheese, it was very heavy. Again not a bad thing if you love cheese.

G5_IjfaLIp9hha9TkL3NEQ.text: We booked our reservation on open table and noted that we were celebrating our honeymoon. The hostesses and our server seemed a bit frazzled. We were fine with some of the delays because they were extremely busy. After our meal was over our waitress returned with our boxed leftovers and what seemed like our check in hand and asked if we wanted dessert. (The couple sitting next to us, had received dessert and the gentleman who had been singing thanked them for celebrating with Buddy V's). Since no one had mentioned anything about what we were celebrating, I mentioned to our waitress that I had noted that we were celebrating our honeymoon when I made the reservation because we had gotten married two days ago. I asked if they do anything for special occasions and she said that they could write congratulations on a dessert. It took about another 10 minutes before our waitress returned to ask what we wanted for dessert. By that time we had decided that we didn't want to wait any longer. Overall, the food was really good, but the disorganization and the lack of attentiveness even when we mentioned celebrating something was a little annoying. The waitress was pleasant enough and the food was good.... but so many things were overlooked and delayed that it kind of ruined the experience.

yxgAptUc_jyx00HV6bg78w.text: Simply fantastic Happy Hour.  We tried a bunch of the small bites and got the Buddy V's pizza as well to truly experience the restaurant.  If you're coming for the Happy Hour you have to sit in the bar area but there's plenty of seats and it's very comfortable.  Great view of the strip can be seen from most seats, as well as TVs for watching the game.    I began with a $4 house red wine and then ordered the sausage and pepper sliders, veggies and olives, calamari, gnocchi, and meatballs.   I would specifically say the calamari has a very nice texture to it and isn't too crispy.  In addition, the meatballs are simply outstanding.  The gnocchi is a bit weird as it's not the typical pasta variety, but instead a cubed pasta variety.  Still tasty, but not what I imagined when ordering.  The sliders were great and come 2 to an order.  And the olives and vegetables were a nice addition to any meal with crispy, tasty bread to add.  The pizza was actually very good as well with sausage and fresh cheese.  I had to get a pinot noir by the glass added to my order off the main menu to compliment the meal.  In total, I got out of a Las Vegas strip restaurant with all of that food and 2 drinks fro $60.  What an incredible deal.  This place is a must for Happy Hour (until 6:30pm) and I imagine their main dishes are just as good.  I had high hopes coming into Buddy V's given their association with the Honey Salt and Andiron team, but this Happy Hour and my experience overall was just phenomenal.

xLMfR8wD6LwmKdJb69ZpIw.text: My wife and I had lunch there to celebrate our 3 year wedding anniversary there while we were in vegas. Albert and Charlie provided great service. The food was amazing. We had the garlic bread and calamari for starters. Fresh and flavorful. My wife had coffee that was yummy from Brazil. She had the lasagna and I had the linguine with clams. Everything tasted fresh and had good flavor. Food was warm when we got it and the portions where perfect. They even gave us a cannoli for desert since they knew we were there for our anniversary. We had an amazing time there.

DrGq6rSjVvqbrvrHk2cohQ.text: Fun environment based off of Cake Boss. Food was very good, and the service was decent. We had a nice seat by the window with a view of the strip which was neat. It seemed a little loud inside and our service seemed slightly rushed. The presentation and flavor of our dishes were wonderful.

6-tzWCXcqj0HkenVH7T65w.text: Great food!  We dined at Buddy V's for our anniversary.  The service was fantastic and the food was amazing.  They serve the best warm focaccia bread with olive oil & balsamic while you wait.    We both had the linguine & clams with sides of polenta and broccolini.  Usually when you order linguine & clams you get very few fresh clams in the shell.  It's typically just enough to add some theatrical value.  But this place piles them on.  We both were given a lot of fresh clams in the shell.  The white wine sauce was excellent and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente.  There was no room for desert so we didn't get to try any of Buddy's famous confections.  Next time.  Only complaint... When you're coming from the valet parking garage the place is sooo hard to find.  The signage in the Venetian isn't very good and every person you ask sends you a different way.  We walked around that enormous hotel for more than 20 minutes looking for this place and almost gave up.  The staff acknowledged that it happens frequently.

HeogTuf8JMf67eq5ECdF2g.text: My second time dining at this restaurant and I must say I'm a fan. I had the Chicken Parmesan and it was amazing. Two generous cuts with a decent portion of spaghetti cooked perfectly al dente. The dessert was wonderful as well, a unique take on Tiramisu inside a small mason jar with four ladyfingers set next them. All in all I would definitely recommend to everyone and I can't wait to go back and try other dishes on menu. Special thanks to the staff which were attentive and worked very well to ensure a pleasant dining experience.

tfwJZBLkpe0XP6Sr5Ac7mA.text: Meatballs are out of this world! My husband split that and the chicken parm and we are always full after. It's amazing food, great staff, and a great atmosphere!

CKuzzTiUZGn6HtQ6fSqGxQ.text: It's one of the best happy hours in town. Prices are great. Only 5 dollars for appetizers and 4 or 5 dollars for drinks. I can tell that they have the best  fried calamari in town. So soft that they are melting in your mouth . I tried my boyfriend's gnocchi and loved them too even though they are totally different from real Italian gnocchi which you try in Italy. Just a different recipe, not a big deal. The environment is very classy and it has outdoors. There is also Carlo's bakery just in front of it where you can get a desert if you like.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour Bloody Mary.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari and gnocchi. Happy hour.

UnprwgW5wv1TBt2JFT5V0g.text: Came here based on the reviews. Stayed for the fantastic service and food. I've traveled far and wide in the world and I have to rank this high on my list of great dining experiences.  My thanks to Chris and Tawny for making me feel right at home.  And to the kitchen for an incredible meal of bone in veal chop!  Absolutely outstanding. Great job Bobby V.  on your hiring and training!!!

nToaNlCPUJZ2h2dDjqXmQw.text: You were so looking forward to a celebration meal at this restaurant. This was our destination restaurant for our special trip. When I made the reservation they asked if we were celebrating a special occasion. I stated we were celebrating a birthday and a graduation. When we arrived they acknowledged the celebration at the hostess stand. That was the last time it was mentioned. Not one of our servers recognized the occasion. It was less than impressive. The food was good. We had meatballs and spaghetti, chicken parmesan, and Mediterranean Sea Bass. My sea bass was tasty and came with a nice side salad. The food was all good but I wouldn't consider it excellent. A huge disappointment was being charged $10 for a glass of tea. The food prices were reasonable and what I would expect but I could have had a glass of wine for that price and it wasn't listed on the menu. Being gouged for iced tea is insulting. Next time I would pick a different restaurant in Las Vegas for a celebration.

w3Y89iaiZYCVrm18JF-Zqg.text: Hey,  ba da bing, ba da boom, I'm at the Cake Boss's joint.  You gotta problem with that?  Cause if you do,  he knows a guy who knows a guy!   That said,  and it needed to be, I rarely eat southern Italian in restaurants because growing up in NY, I had the good fortune to eat the real master chefs cuisine,  my grandmother,  father,  aunts and friends parents. Anyway my point is,  I'm seriously biased.   My goal was to eat something tasty and not heavily laden with sugar,  flour, carbs as I'm in the middle of a book about that stuff which is gross, scary and fascinating all at the same time.  But,  I digress.   I went for lunch and ordered grandma's meatballs and a side of Tuscan Kale with roasted tomatoes.  While I get that we didn't use real San Marzano tomatoes here,  it did come close to replicating an authentic flavor.  I should point out that meatballs to Italians is a very serious and personal matter. My extended family can argue endlessly on the what constitutes the perfect meatball, whether there should be inclusions such as pignola nuts, raisens and tons of other stuff you can't possibly imagine.   The Tuscan Kale wasn't on the menu,  but Star, my server,  not wanting to disappoint,  checked with the kitchen and they said they could do it.  I was very happy.  That's service! Problem was,  it came out very tough, chewy and barely edible.  So I appreciate the extra effort,  not the result, and the results are what matters. Once you commit to me, I'm expecting your A game stuff.   Appropriate classic Italian Frank Sinatra,  Dean Martin, Louis Prima and other legends sang in the background. I'll go back ang give them another try for dinner.

nGq0nayj3cRe9k4Se0_2xw.text: We were given a table to for 3 outside of the restaurant and placed by the public restroom. There was a communication barrier with the pre-server which resulted in a $8.00 bottle of water. The entrees were not aesthetically pleasing to the eye and tasted bland. We ended up wasting 2 hours of our vacation on subpar food. The server was good, that is why I am giving it 2 stars.

as0YIjgh_zEozzV_pxJs0g.text: Told us we had to wait 45 mins for a table for 3 people, when the 45 mins was up they offered us a table in a hallway outside the restaurant and never mentioned that's where the table would be. When we asked how long the wait would be for a table inside the restaurant we were told it would be a 30 Minute wait due to "private events".

LjpYEtwRF-YlzrGBo8D93Q.text: I can see I'm one of many who loved this restaurant!  We arrived about 9 PM on a Thursday night.  The place was packed but fortunately there were two seats at the bar, which we prefer.  Christia was awesome.  She made me a great martini and then proceeded to help us order.  We had meatballs and a caesar salad to start.  Both yum.  The croutons are made from polenta which was a nice surprise.  We ordered Sea Bass and Chicken Parm for entrees.  Once again, yum! Nutella cake for dessert.  After stuffing ourselves silly we walked around the beautiful Venetian Hotel and Grand Canal.

9KgRxwi2UP-ZZ5KG2uA1rA.text: This place has quality Italian cuisine. The salumi and cheese board are high quality ingredients and a must have! This appetizer would feed up to 4 people. The chicken with vodka sauce was delicious. The sauce was perfectly seasoned and the chicken was tender. I did get the famous dessert "Buddy V Lobster Tail". It was a croissant style pastry shaped like a lobster tail filled with cream. It looked really fun, but the pastry was so hard I couldn't cut it with a fork. Other than the dessert everything else was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salumi &amp; Cheese board

phdu83U0A3LNH2yHavrkuA.text: This restaurant is the noisiest place in Las Vegas (the casino is quieter).  There is absolutely NO option for a conversation, the wait staff is so rushed you get your food handed from all different directions and from different staff each time.  There is NO atmosphere only a mad rush of feed and fee then flee.  The food is mediocre to poor and sadly the dessert was the worst plate of all! What a let down.

aFic-KNgFgpxJLt4Aax-ug.text: I had the panzanella salad, and it was delicious!!!! I was looking for something light to eat but with substance since I was going out to drink later that night (vegas, go figure). Perfect amount of veggies to cheese. Yum!!!  For dessert, we ordered the lobster tail! So good. We came for my bachelorette dinner so they even decorated it for me!! Although the "flaky pastry" was a little too crunchy for me, the custard cream and fresh fruits were perfection!!   Definitely get the lobster tail next time you're here!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster tail dessert

X0A-oQJ9RpNJAO2_1nf_HA.text: Solid Italian in the Venetian.  I had the fixed price deal with meatballs, bucatini and a cannoli.  Service was OK, food was quite good.  Setting was nice, noisy, but not too loud.  Prices were better than the average Strip restaurant.  I would go back.

DC6AnwFp5ovoHL1Ow3HYwg.text: Due to the amazing spaghetti and meatballs, we had to come back! Again, the food was amazing! We did try the chicken parm and the caprese this time and were impressed with those as well. Definitely put this place on your list when in Vegas!  The service was great, we were well taken care of and left very happy! Just make sure to get spaghetti and meatballs!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese

Ifk-uH3YnRYZ073uw1nJog.text: Best tasting food and dessert. Fast and excellent service . Try everything you can , don't miss the Nutella cake with salted caramel gelato . All pastas are great .. and the appetizer bread is a special mention

WhYh1pwvdyh1X9gINXR4iA.text: Had a birthday dinner here and the staff was amazing.  The night we went there was a live performer there and he was great! The food, price, portions, and staff were all fantastic!

R0XUB47IGSJAd1c4_avZ2A.text: This was our second stop at Buddy V's while visiting Vegas.  First you can't beat the location if you are a shopper.  The restaurant is located in the Canal Shoppes which is one of our favorite haunts while visiting.  What always blows me away is the line across from the restaurant for his bakery, it usually is formed at least halfway down the corridor.  All I can say is the bakery must be delish....but I digress.  We only had to wait 10 minutes for a table at lunch which you can sit in the bar or wait in the corridor.  We were seated in the bar area.  The best way to describe the vibe here is casual chic.  The restaurant feels very open yet has a Brooklyn restaurant feel to it.  Servers are dressed casually and make you feel very comfortable.  I would have liked the server to be a little more friendly...don't get me wrong she was very efficient...just didn't seem happy to be there.  However she gave us great service and everyone has those days so it did not take away from the experience.  I had the eggplant parmesan  which was HUGE and delicious.  No way I could eat it all or even half of it...but I sure did enjoy trying.  Hubby had the spaghetti and loved it.  The cheese garlic bread is like an entree on its own...perfectly toasted with yummy gooey cheese.We both enjoyed the menu as all of the entrees have special ties to the owner like My Wife's Eggplant Parmesan or Lisa V's Linguine, this just gives you the feeling of being in an Italian grandmas kitchen.  Hubby ordered a Buddy V's lobster tail for dessert and I can tell you they look just like they do on his tv show...big and stuffed full of tasty goodness.  I only had a bite as i was still trying to tackle the eggplant parm but it was magnificent.  This is definitely going to become a lunch tradition when we are in Vegas.  Great food at reasonable prices

pDkzbECTQlAgOfMCgnYDsA.text: Great spot. Fast and very friendly service. Food was delicious. Good variety of options on the menu, and our server Crystal really knew how to get everything right even though we had a complicated order. Would definitely go back.

BBRKcbPSWAOtBHnXwzrnBQ.text: I don't have enough words to describe how much I liked this place ! The restaurant is absolutely beautiful, the food was delicious and the music went really well with the restaurant theme. Perfect for a date !

ykaw5_n1LeKnuBkxQRkbhw.text: I ordered the chicken parm and the bf had lasagna.  We also ordered the fries. Chicken parm was very good. Nice and crispy and the inside was juicy.  My bf said the lasagna was the 2nd best he's had,  his Italian moms is number 1. From hostess to waitress to server everyone was very nice and attentive.  Everyone seemed happy to be there making our visit much more pleasant.

7Vh0oWQwc1b2dFfI0jPv0Q.text: Awesome food, large portions and Stewart is a great manager. Talked with us for some time. Definitely going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XvNH6oDeq57baGQ0nOP7QQ.text: I'm pretty disappointed because I was really looking forward to eating here. Buddy's menu kind of disappointed me because he is an excellent baker however the menu for his dinner is very minimal and boring. I went all the way as far as sitting at a dinner table to have dinner but after opening the menu and reading the items, I closed the menu got up and walked out the restaurant. I give him three stars because his bakery across the way is very good.

UB3DaiTpLsJSwD9HTRiR_w.text: Holy hell. The food here is amazing. If you're here for the weekend, the brunch buffet is the best. As for weekdays, any entree is great although i always go with the steak. Their tomato soup is to die for and it's one of the best Italian restaurants I've been too.

tnmLOEEVi-QVEwJanwkzEA.text: Girls night in Vegas on a Friday night usually a very busy night and hard to get a table but making a reservation made that so easy! Our food was beyond delicious we will definitely be back. From the environment to the service to the awesome view of the strip. They are doing great over here! Our bus boy Christian was so hospitable and got everything we needed so efficiently. Order nonnas lasagna and chicken parmesan it came out so quickly and you cannot beat the fresh out of the over bread! Thank you!!

XHmuue0Kth0ZzM-YgdS-0Q.text: I ate at the bar for happy hour. We really weren't planning on eating there but after going to Carlos bakery right before we thought we might get a snack here. Our bartender was cool at first and then became a bit pushy. The drinks were good. I got the sangria, my friend had a Bellini.  So we each ordered a caprese salad and gnocchi to share. We received our caprese salads. It was a pretty good portion. We both agreed our salad needed some more vinegar and a bit of salt. It just tasted so bland. I love caprese salads so this was a real disappointment. We then receive ricotta cheese and bread. Neither of us touch it since we didn't order it. Then we figure out the gnocchi isn't coming. We eat the ricotta and both think the cheese is bland too! I won't be coming back. But food was a huge disappointment!

0rAtkuTA1S9zR6o3O5QuFg.text: For the good:  The bus staff was the best thing about this place, making sure your drink was filled and bread was on  the table.  The ones to clear as well.  For the bad:  I know there is over 300 different types of pasta, but the waitress should at least learn the names of the ones where they work.  She didn't know the difference in the dishes, when I had a question.  I asked for the dessert menu up front, so I could decide if i wanted salad verse dessert, she never brought it.  (finally got it from the bus staff).  Slow to do service, waited a long time to pay my bill at the table.  I ordered the carbonara, was not happy with the type of pasta, but more important way too much "cracked" pepper on it.    The bread/focaccia was just average.    For the real bad:  About an hour later, made my stomach very ill.

Ra1RK6SVydGqb4iP6CZGpw.text: Was expecting more from this dining experience. Had a charcuterie plate and they went with boring, everyday cheeses. Poor garnishments. Not what you'd expect for $19. My son had the Hoboken Cheesesteak and the meat was excessively greasy. He couldn't finish it without fear of gastrointestinal issues. I had the spaghetti with meatballs. It was good. Not great. Certainly not what I expected from a celebrity chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Charcuterie!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Is that the famous Pappy Faulkner?!?!

ApyOe_ds_FsIDJ_6em7RDQ.text: I'm a huge fan of Cake Boss, so I just had to visit the bakery and try the restaurant. I was impressed with the food. Everyone in my group ordered something different: spaghetti, pizza, and chicken parm. The chicken parm was my favorite. Also, the inside of the restaurant looked really neat. It's a fun place to eat at, and it is definitely a place you need to visit if you're a fan of Cake Boss! Also, I recommend the cannoli's! They are to die for! The cannoli cream was delicious and sweet! In fact, even if you're not hungry for a full meal, I recommend stopping by for a cannoli as a snack or dessert.

iTyFJ4lufJpYvrRH5lpTiw.text: This restaurant was okay. There weren't a ton of people and it took FOREVER to get served. Also,there is no bathroom in the restaurant so you have to schlep out into the hotel which is a pain.  The food was fine, not really memorable. The decor was odd, it was like old home comfort mixed with a modern feel? Either go old home comfort to match your food or go modern? The server was nice and personable.

egpGNuIAUCEFSWrBG1hh4Q.text: Was disappointed with the food and service, all I can say about this place is OK....  I had the chicken parmigiana, it was good, but the sauce was very acidic, way too strong for me, I had asked the server prior to ordering and she said it was very mild. My friend had the carbonara, she said it was average. Our other friend had the scallops and she liked it.

vucR0EHzvK00wnRxAxJRpQ.text: Food is fresh, served quickly and delicious. I had the free range chicken which was good; but that was it. The potatoes, mushrooms and artichokes served with it were very little. My mom had the chicken Parmesan and it had pasta and two huge pieces of chicken. Much better value at a dollar less than the free range.

jRQ_5RfuBQeVguealcSkIg.text: Poor service, mediocre food. With so many options in Vegas, there are many better choices

dxZK90krTvjjqSsSZtChdw.text: Did you know the owner of this place is like a famous chef or baker or something? Yea, I didn't know either....but I was schooled by my boyfriend's 60-something year old mom. Learn something new everyday!  Our party of 8 came here around 10:30pm on a Sunday evening. We got seated quickly, even with our big party. None of us were very hungry, so we ordered all appetizers or small dishes and a couple of drinks.   My boyfriend and I shared a Margherita Pizza (definitely big enough for two -- has about 8 small pieces). Both my boyfriend and I agreed that the pizza was really tasty! We happily ate the whole thing. It was cooked just right and was hot and steamy when it got to our table. Just the way I like it! I also ordered a Salad...I don't remember the name of it, but it was decent sized and tasted fresh. I was so full on pizza, I couldn't eat my whole salad. I definitely could have just done one or the other.   I don't remember what the rest of my party ordered. There was a variety of dishes, but they all must have been good because I don't remember anything left on anyone's plate when we were done. This means the food was delicious! Or else we were all just hungry. Either way, it was good overall.   Service was great. Our server was friendly and personable. I like that when it comes to servers!  My only gripe was that our food took forever to come out. We waited a good 15+ minutes before anything came out. That was a long time considering they weren't that crowded or busy when we were there. They may need to work out some kinks in the kitchen.   On a side note, this restaurant has good views of the strip. I really liked that, and I spent awhile gazing out at the bright lights and the busyness of the strip. Good people watching!  Overall, I enjoyed my time at Buddy V's. I would definitely come back here again on another visit to Vegas!  Cheers!

roMsKFfT-gIiurMT6SvM3w.text: Like I said about the bakery, this place symbolizes overrated businesses glamorized by the media for no justifiable reason:  The spaghetti my sister ordered was extremely sour and the flavor was disgusting. One bite of it and my insides starting screaming. Mid-way through the meal, my sister needed to use the restroom.. for a while.   My margherita pizza? Equivalent to the taste and thickness of a napkin. Zero flavor and toppings spread so thin, they must have evaporated upon baking.  After dinner, I left it to Lisa's Nutella Cake with Salted Caramel ice cream to save Buddy V's reputation. I mean, there's no way someone can mess those flavors up - the title alone is perfect. I was wrong. Overly sweet, dense, rich - one bite was too much (and must have contained at least 75g of sugar). The ice cream had nothing salted or caramel about it. I am a huge lover of desserts - and this made me so so sad.  Summary: +long wait, pricey, not good - Why would you come here?

mMoNbDeWp2Ey8MHh5n1pxQ.text: Wow wow wow, is all I can say! This place is heaven on earth! Ask for the express lunch menu if available, best bang for your buck. For $22, you get a three course meal. For dessert I recommend the cannoli or the tiramisu.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G1bEfRqJRxIEEh04BcaDvw.text: Terrible service! People that work there really unhelpful!! Don't recommend at all!!  We came there to get a desert and they gave us a table at lounge area, after we gave the order they asked for my ID which I didn't have with me and told us that we can't seat in that area, first of all we didn't even ask to seat there and they told us to leave and didn't even give us a different table. Why would they even give us a table make us do an order and then tell us to leave? Terrible !!! Terrible service!!

ZD14IT3UZo2Q3z1T-OBqBg.text: The atmosphere was nice and the decore is beautiful.  I love the way the kitchen is open so you're able to see the food being prepared.  The surf & turf was good the steak was very tender. The olive oil  mashed potatoes were to die for! The staff was super friendly and made sure that our glasses stayed full and all of our needs were met. Excellent experience.

YbklCMztg6wma8GgFKKFrg.text: We love everything in Buddy V's Sunday brunch! Just the right amount of choices for a buffet. Not overwhelming; Nothing goes to waste  Service was great too!  and there was live feel-good music while we enjoy family time and our scrumptious meal  Thank you for the great experience!

uiUjzjFBS8FUs8nQeLBOaQ.text: I have eaten here twice and have been very impressed both times! The service was great! The food is amazing. Best pizza ever. The crust is the perfect combination of soft and crisp. Tomato sauce has just enough spice. My kids, who aren't sausage lovers, thought the sausage was amazing!  I have also had the vegetable salad which has just a little lettuce and TONS of vegetables. The steak - tender, juicy!  I can't wait to return!

UCK-opsjMU7cJaGoa335Qg.text: This place was amazing the food was so good! Sunday gravy was the best Italian dish I've ever had and I'm from Chicago we are known for the best food! I recommend coming here . Grazie

wa8MnhaeUFEUA5qVYcY_Xg.text: Not impressed at all with the food. Everything was extremely salty. It's like they tried to make up for flavor with salt. And the service was absolutely horrible from the hostess that's nipples were showing through her see through dress to the rude waiter. This place is a def SKIP

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool open kitchen

tHWoaR0PwHx9JguIqMSWnQ.text: 3 words: Creekstone Farms Burger. Amazing. Cooked to perfection, flavorful, and delicious. I seek out Creekstone Farms meat because it's open range, organic, and also happens to be Halal. I called and was told quickly that they do indeed serve Creekstone Farms Beef burgers.   Locating the restaurant was a little tricky but a couple directions later we made it. Inside is beautifully laid out, while not overly fancy, it is classy.   We were seated in a clean red booth immediately and drinks brought right away. The burger was $16. I asked to have the meat cooked away from pork and the server kindly let me know that the only pork they cook is in the meatballs in a pot. The grill only cooks shellfish and steak. Super nice.   Burgers came out with Parmesan fries. Asked for pickles and had them right away. Drinks filled automatically. No breadsticks or other food while you wait. There are some really thin straw like bread sticks on the table that are average.   But all in all, a fantastic experience for lunch. Will definitely be returning on my next trip to Vegas.

tqV07GYMQPfH0etGcqAHoQ.text: Another fabulous meal with superior service from Randy! Each dish was delicious....we ate the Pasta E Fagioli, Sea Scallops, Veal Parm Chop, Chicken Parm, & My Mother-in-Law's Capellini Shrimp Scampi. The Italian Birthday Cake was tasty & so cute!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian Birthday Cake

LCYWOV3UFCjYGOGc4CxvCQ.text: My brother claims the garlic cheese bread takes like its made by Jesus... And it does. Most amazing garlic cheese bread ever. Although, fettuccine Alfredo is not on the menu.. You can order Alfredo with other noodles and chicken. My brother rated that a 5. My mom got the chicken Parmesan and said it was a 5 star meal as well. I got the spaghetti with meatballs and I have to go with my mom and brother and say mine was 5 stars as well.

ZuHIE8m35R_04CGAYOboaw.text: Came here with my parents on 10/25/18 while staying at the Venetian. We had Joana C as a server and she was so accommodating. She went out of her way to make us feel comfortable. The food was amazing and I highly recommend the rigatoni vodka!

J2UHsTWlq2gSnvGjUKNjMw.text: This is some quality, authentic Italian food on the Vegas strip. The service was semi snooty when it came to strollers and an extra chair at the table, but overall it was fine. Try to get a seat near the window it's a nice view of the Wynn water show area.

Df1lly6DlqwbKn_uqlDdyw.text: I was here a couple of months ago, dining solo, and had a 5 Star experience.   I brought my family last night and was truly disappointed.  As soon as we got our drink order in, our server was difficult to call.  Our dinners were extremely salty and only 1 out of the 4, did we enjoy our food.  At one point, we had the manager come over to help us.

35j1kludL8eZ549fP1aKVQ.text: I would have given this place a 5, but no vegan options- not even sides on the dinner menu. Anyways, we had just ordered 3 orders (husband, daughter, and I) of spaghetti pomodoro, and our waitress asks if we are vegan, which we reply yes (she also mentioned she was vegan ). She immediately makes a suggestion which was AMAZING! It had veggies, pasta and they switched the pesto sauce with a tomato sauce! For dessert, she reminded us that the only vegan option was the sorbet! What amazing service and the foods was also astounding!  The atmosphere is casual. Not too busy (Thursday afternoon). Perfect to bring your kids!

pgOutNI0tyhd4v7t28MztA.text: Went to buddy v's on another recommendation from my fellow yelpers. Good solid food. Great service.   My sister got the lasagna and said yes it tasted like home and I got the chicken parm which was also delicious. Both were good and I think next time I'm in Vegas I will stop in.  The prices were pretty reasonable as well as we both got wine and I think our bill was only about $80.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our two glasses of wine.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm. Really good
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm

ppvJLh2t1MHBpGMvoopa7A.text: My husband and I went for dinner last night. We ordered the Caesar salad, lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs. It was absolutely the best lasagna I've had and the other plates were delicious as well!  I'm so glad we stopped in and I can't wait until we come back to Vegas to eat here again!  Highly recommend!

0cWtFmBohJQhKl-VrILzKQ.text: What a great experience we had, food was great, staff was attentive and extremely helpful. Kudos to this restaurant, very family friendly and atmosphere was great. I always enjoy going to a restaurant that has a wonderful staff, and makes you feel welcomed.

BvAN1oz41gx1k_gk_A6ZAA.text: One of our favorite restaurants in Vegas. Everything is fresh and cooked just for you...no food waiting under a heat lamp for the next customer. The chicken parmigiana is the best we've ever tasted as was the chicken picatta. Cocktails, wines and beers are plentiful and tasty. Unfortunately, we've never had a dessert because we are so full after the wonderful dinner. But, they look delicious. The service is spot on and not pestering. We can't wait to return.

cAxHTrMopFeJY2PmL_m8Ug.text: Came for all day outside patio happy hour so you sit inside the hotel watching people wait in line to get there sugar rush on at Carlo's.  We ordered the calamari for my 3 year old and server forgot to tell me its fried with hot peppers so he couldn't eat it and this kid loves calamari!  On top of that both appetizer and pizza came out at once.  Obviously she forgot to ring in our calamari.  Rays loaded pizza was dry and hard bread, don't order it.  Bloody Mary's were delicious.  Server was nice but we were forgotten.  Prices for happy hour is worth it, $6 apps and $5 drinks.  I think the food is good but we ordered wrong.

6J0GhgiZK04LUmttDMew-A.text: Great service Carlos the bus person is so sweet he came over all the time asking if we needed anything food was plentiful and good

CAVk_Q8Boop48x-Fnze-nw.text: Had a strip side table- excellent view. Service was very good. Attentive but not annoyingly so. The complimentary focaccia (I think) bread was fresh. We ordered a calzone type bread- filled with pesto, ricotta or mozzarella, with marinara. YUM! The 4 of us throughly enjoyed our entrees. I can only remember my husband and my dishes. Hubby has the spaghetti and meatballs- the meatballs were so tender and flavorful. I ordered the chicken rigatoni with vodka sauce. If I could put that sauce in a cup with a straw to go, I would. It was so delicious. Wish we had room for dessert but I cleaned my plate and was too full for anything else. Would love to come back.

DbDq06EmYfDX3OcARPn-mA.text: Stumbled upon this place by accident and it was absolutely amazing! My boyfriend and I actually went twice when we were in town for the week. The calamari appetizer was tasty to start. The shrimp scampi is awesome and the gravy with rigatoni is delicious! Great service and atmosphere as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Mother in Law &#39;s Capellini Shrimp Scampi and Valastro Sunday Gravy
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread and Calamari Fritti

Ff6hC1yS-_8CuUz1lvNnrg.text: Great Italian food and great value!  I found Buddy's on Yelp and was so happy that I gave the restaurant a try. We got there during happy hour and there was a variety of small plate appetizers for $5 each and a full menu as well.   I ordered the fried calamari happy hour small bite for $5 and the sea bass for $29 as entree. The calamari was crispy and flavorful and for $5, it was a steal.   The sea bass entree came with an arugula salad on the side and the fish came deboned and was crispy outside and perfectly tender inside.   The ambiance is casual and the wait staff was very friendly. The restaurant was right across from Carlos Bakery and it is a great stop after dinner.   Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seabass entree for $29

U4LqcK7aQk0MPIkyvchn8w.text: Sooooo lovely ! Seriously the best pasta I've ever had in my entire life, the staff was sweet and patient with us while we decided what we wanted. Gave us a lot of options !!

mBkOIvu-N5qkqxvWJZkImw.text: Incredible meatballs, eggplant parm and vodka pasta were incredible! Definitely go to have some Italian food with large portions at a decent price vs other places that were very overpriced vs Buddy V.

G4hm_sIhUwRpWVhmoymuig.text: Disappointed. Sunday Gravy should be offered all day as it is typically eaten early in Italian culture. Over priced, poor service. Bread tasted like frozen texas toast-expected more considering the bakery concept.

vWFMzCoT_XRUL3GdrmrYQA.text: Me and my other half had a wonderful experience here with a beautiful dinner. I had the surf and turf (Pictured below) sorry I had a few bites before I took the picture for understandable reasons. My wife had Chicken Parmesan which I tried and it was delicious. All in all everything about my experience here was spectacular and I'd recommend this to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NyuocgYtQAyVuUwOztsCpQ.text: Great Food. Great Decor. Great Service. Started with a glass of Merlot and the eggplant parmesan appetizer. A crispy tower of eggplant with a golden brown exterior coated with piping hot cheese. Definitely a winner. The shrimp scampi was a delicious main course with a healthy amount of shrimp in a nest of linguine, roasted garlic, spinach, tomato and white wine. For dessert we enjoyed the Nutella cake with salted caramel ice cream. I'm not usually one for dessert but how could I pass up salted caramel ice cream!? All things considered it was a great experience and I'd certainly dine there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful interior
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Parmesan!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi

Oqq0IiHWLW0qV7zlgdOXlA.text: For a famous chef, we expected the food to be better than an average Italian chain restaurant. Sorry! We sooooo wanted to love this place. It's the first restaurant we visited when we arrived in Vegas. The Cake Boss is awesome, but he should double-check the menu and service. The place had plenty of empty tables, and now we know why. There are too many amazing restaurants to try in Vegas, but this just isn't up to the hype. Chicken parmigiana and pasta with broccolini and tomatoes were good but no better than average. The appetizers would get four stars. We had the fried mozzarella, which was incredibly plentiful (so share), and the octopus in a flavorful tomato sauce. The grilled octopus was tender, so I would order it again. It's also a unique menu item. The three stars are because of the poor service (with us served food even before we got our drinks, and we asked twice). The waitress also wasn't helpful with the gluten free questions, and there weren't any GF dessert options. Would I return? If this place was at a regular mall, yes. Since it's in Vegas surrounded by other amazing options, no. I should mention, to its credit, the pricing is absolutely reasonable (especially considering it's in Vegas in the Venetian).

W32arsAL0IAsS8HqyL1SzA.text: Amazing!!!! The service was wonderful! Best I've experienced in Vegas yet! We had wine, Caesar salads, chicken parm, surf and turf, cannoli, and a chocolate cake filled with Nutella. Most expensive dinner we had in Vegas but we celebrated our anniversary and last night here. Very impressed, we'd go back (I want to try brunch)!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NmOI8TY4FucUdkjp3O85SA.text: Where to begin??? This was our third trip to Buddy V's and the food will keep us coming back. We love the flavors, rich sauces, perfectly cooked meats, and quick, tasty appetizers, almost everything we have ordered here is amazing.   The Service is good and friendly and realized last night what my biggest issue with this restaurant is. The appetizers come out fast, which is awesome, but the wait time between your apps and your entree is excruciatingly long. We ordered plenty of apps to keep us busy but 45 minutes elapsed between apps and entree. This was way too long. I think I blamed the server on my second trip when the same thing happened but I realized the kitchen is just slow to get out entrees and the servers lose attentiveness when they have nothing to bring you. I hate having to ask for more water or a refill.   That being said, I highly recommend Buddy V's, the food is amazing Italian food, the desserts are delicious and the live music was a nice touch last night.   Food:     5 stars Presentation: 5 stars Taste: 5 stars Desserts: 5 stars Service: 4 stars  Waiting for second course: 2 stars General Manager: 5 stars Thanks for the attention and for listening to our previous concerns.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone in Veal Parm

_K7_o0joLU2P4CLkRsQBfg.text: Party of 8, about a week ago.  Had reservations, waited to be seated.  Nice waiter who was trying way too hard.  Offered us the family style, we declined because we have way too many food issues.  Ordered garlic bread for the table, it was fine. We had a few chicken Parms, vodka rigatoni, some pizza, some fish.... not very impressed.  Had just had dinner the night before at Roas, and was far, far more impressed.  Food was overpriced for being "fine".  Would not go back.  Did not feel compelled to leave my review until last night's loss, but Buddy clearly doesn't deserve my silence.  What a sore loser.  To be clear, I wasn't going back to his restaurant because the food wasn't good enough and the prices were too high (even before he acted like a child).

y33De7sZtooIkRaim1Bfsg.text: Probably the best tasting Italian restaurant I have ever been to! We ordered the Panzenella salad, shrimp scampi and chicken parm, and everything was delicious. The chicken was served with a side of spaghetti which totally redefined how incredibly tasty spaghetti can be. The staff and servers were friendly and professional, the atmosphere was upscale yet casual, and I fully intend to return the next time I visit Las Vegas. One word of advice: Bring coats as they keep the air conditioning at a very uncomfortably cold temperature.

4GFov0CKw0V4DfYdUPjKHQ.text: Food was great! Friendly staff. We didn't have to wait long for a table. Brunch buffet is a must. I recommend to anyone looking for a buffet with great food for a good price.

y1gcuXhYoikJRp2zG2CzoQ.text: When here for my mom's 60th birthday and was pleasantly delighted. The service was fantastic and the food was delicious.   I ordered the lasagna, while pricy, is the best I've had in town and the portion was huge. So, it was well worth it. In fact, I could have and should have saved half as a leftover; however, I couldn't stop eating.

7wkO6_AEwdXy1hrMn_5k1g.text: Buddy V's Ristorante is a lovely place to go for home-style cooked Italian food.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, salads, pasta, chicken, veal and seafood.  Last but not least, the cakes are insanely delicious- not surprising, seeing the restaurant is owned by the Cake Boss himself.  Do whatever you have to do to save room for dessert!  Our server brought us a tray of freshly baked focacia before the meal.  It was so fluffy and warm.  i could have eaten a whole tray myself!  My sister and her boyfriend shared some of their fried calamari appetizer.  It was great!  The cocktails were wonderful.  I tried my sister's martini called the Cake Boss- red velvet cake, chocolate liqueur and Bailey's.  The restaurant sadly did not offer any Alfredo entrees, which are typically my favorite, but my Chicken Piccata (breaded chicken cutlet in a white wine & butter sauce) was excellent!  The side of pasta was also very good.  I tried my mom's Eggplant Parmesan and was very impressed!  The food truly tasted like we were eating a homemade dinner at a family member's dining room table.  Even though we loved our meals, the best course of the meal was dessert.  I had trouble deciding what to order.  The Cannoli, Butterscotch Creme Brulee and Nutella Cake all sounded so good.  Our server recommended that I try the Italian Birthday Cake- Rum soaked sponge cake with cannoli filling, chocolate pastry cream and toasted almonds.  It was heavenly!  The restaurant's ambience is perfect for a nice family dinner.  It is beautifully decorated with a combination of vibrantly colorful kitchen items and upscale decor.  The restaurant has an energetic and happy atmosphere,  They commonly have upbeat live music playing, but at a reasonable level so you can hear the people at your table talking to you.  The service is also amazing.  The employees make you feel like old friends of theirs- definitely the ideal Italian kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Focaccia

SUOR_-v30uegfZTbl7rviA.text: Food is great, atmosphere is comfy but it is pretty loud and if you're at a big table conversation is very difficult.  Service is very quick and friendly.

cotdO8gVKN7CwiO9cTyPeA.text: Decided to have Italian on a Friday night and made reservations.  It was painless and pleasant.    We were seated promptly at the reservation time and greeted for drinks and water immediately.  I also noticed some plastic packages on the table that resembled chopstick containers and discovered they were mini breadsticks.  Yum.     We ordered salads and the calamari appetizer and they also brought out complimentary bread and olive oil.  Everything was perfect as was the Pino Noir and Cabernet we were drinking.    For the meals everyone tried different dishes which were almost all shared by the time the dinner was over.  We had eggplant parmigiana, chicken parmigiana, spaghetti and meatballs and cheese ravioli.  Everything was spot on and delicious.   I finished my meal off with an espresso and two others shared a butterscotch creme brulee.  As expected everything was perfect.    As you may see from my reviews, I eat out often and across the globe.  This meal, service, ambiance and decor were as good as it gets.  Me and my 3 other guests all had a memorable time and will be back again.  If I can complain about anything, it would be that they should have linen table cloths on the tables instead of the rustic looking wood surface.    Enjoy!

j1LnM2H-6VlQn32Kdn_cvw.text: I am really surprised to read about poor service here. Our experience was completely opposite of that. This was quite possibly THE BEST service we've had in LV in the 4 days we've been here. Our waiter, Mourad, was beyond awesome!  Super attentive and responsive. We never had to ask for refills on drinks - plates were cleared magically-staff was friendly.    The food: meatballs. Best I've had - even better than Mom's... shhh don't tell.   Salmon: I'm from the PNW where the fish is amazing....this place rivals great seafood restaurants near Seattle.   Chicken Parm:  Fork tender, sauce was perfect, pasta was fresh and cooked perfectly   Cannolis:  fan-dam-tastic.   If you like your meal, check out the bakery across the corridor!

gSoz_ChhqwD-qCP7S1V9DA.text: This is a MUST if you love Italian food. It never disappoints. Everything is so flavorful and service is wonderful!

E5tu3kVfwaMF0evtvbNFTQ.text: So, I'm not crazy about the whole celebrity chef thing. I have seen Cake Boss, but I didn't know they had branched out into regular Italian food. But my friend wanted Italian for dinner so we went to Buddy V's. She was excited about it.   My absolute favorite, I order it wherever I go, Italian dish is eggplant parmesan. Somehow at Buddy's it is an appetizer, not an entree. Luckily I asked the server and she was able to make it an entree and add a side of pasta. I was nervous, not knowing what appetizer eggplant my look like, but it was delicious. It was layered slices of perfectly fried eggplant with a chunky tomato sauce and cheese. Honestly, I was half starving from walking all day, but I would say this is one of the best eggplant dishes I've ever had. I cleaned my plate.   So, food was fantastic. Our server was pretty mediocre, but I was so happy with the eggplant I don't even care. They get 5 stars from me. I may have to give this celebrity chef more credit.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant appetizer as an entree with pasta
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmigian

faxsjACcNXdfCzumRHKiNg.text: Best Italian restaurant Ive ever been to. Beautiful environment, outstanding service, and best tasting food I have had in a while. Definitely a must to eat while in Vegas!

aoizVOAgPY5_aF5FNzVx1w.text: Service, professionalism, and very rarely you find personality. Every staff and manager is the absolute  best and somehow even more.   It all started off with an awkward menu situation, but was cleared up professionally and cheerfully by the staff and the manager going so far as to make sure we were indeed part of their family and home.   They have effectively made our Christmas and much more. Will definitely always come back!

rwxJ0XUfox44hRhq7fLl-A.text: Been here few times Good food and service every time Mediterranean Sea Bass was worth it like everything else

GGx_tAEEt4cKPzpQwZ7DxQ.text: This place was great! Food was amazing and so was the atmosphere! Fun place yet would be a great place for a date night as well. Prices were reasonable for the awesome service and food. Had a 40 dollar prefixed menu, my cousin got the steak option for an extra 10 bucks but it was a 14 oz steak . It was huge and delish! Hubby had the veal and he loved it. I had the chicken parm, yum! And both had enough to take home! Celebrated our anniversary there and it was nice they gave us a desert that was too die for! Great for small groups and big ones as well, a wedding party sat down as we were eating of about 20! They accommodated them so well. Caleb our waiter was also amazing and very knowledgeable! Coming back for sure! Next time we go hope we see Buddy!

fS-7NxD-gFAzzOnrpGXsVg.text: Came to Buddy V's with my wife for dinner to celebrate passing a licensing exam. My favorite dish was by far the Bone-In Veal Parmesan, but don't forget to start with the Salumi and Cheese board! Both were recommended by our fantastic server Giorgio, and he paired dinner with an excellent wine choice. Portion sizes are huge so come hungry. Don't leave without trying the Cannolis, or go next door to Buddy V's bakery and expand your choices!

ZahEOP4Y1b4D2ty3YfyOaA.text: So you are on the strip and don't know what to eat? Come here. This place has nice views of the strip and the restaurant is very well designed.  I ordered the cheese stake and it was amazing, the most addicting part of the fries. The menu offer variety of foods with a mix of Italian and American. You can't go wrong, oh and they specialize in desserts! I loved the tiramisu, must get with coffee. This is my second time here and I'm a local. Oh, and free parking at the palazo/Venetian!

GpSvou7TlCIG54jZHsDPag.text: Overall the food was pretty good. I had the carbonara and it was extremely rich. My husbands lasagna was also good. Everything was good but I do have to say I've had better.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JgnUTV34OjQdnimbovUPNw.text: Me and my husband were treated like royalty during our visit! All dishes were delicious and recommended by our awesome server, Giorgio! The wine, cheese, bread, parm, etc were all amazing! We were so full after, but it was worth it! I highly recommend a visit here and ask for Giorgio! He was very entertaining.

A3srq-0q0Q5_4OWSIqfDoQ.text: I recently ate here when I was in town for my birthday, and I'm glad I did. From the start to the end, service was great.  The food was delicious. I remember before arriving looking at all the pictures and how cheesy everything was, which our plates did not disappoint with the amount of cheese. The garlic bread we orders came with three large slices, more than enough to share. I ordered the shrimp scampi. The shrimp were large and juicy, yum! My fiance ordered the chicken Parmesan and he really enjoyed it.  Atmosphere and food were great, the price was fair for the amount of food you get.

oXNQl488BqgVHS5-kSgc2g.text: Outstanding food in great desserts sat at the bar two times when I was here this week Tawny Was a great bartender great server and a pleasure to talk with, comingback again which I do at least a few times a year.

n-vc_7YHIue7k1QDq0w5aA.text: I was seated at the bar during happy hour and i enjoyed it. Happy hour is from 430-630 and it includes beers, wine, sangria, and appetizers. I had some beer with calamari and riccotta cheese. They were excellent. Best calamari I've had in vegas. I also liked their cocktail hour music which was a plus. Would come back for sure.

rxT1VheZOMiHyBPIIvcoKQ.text: I was so looking forward to trying this place bc I love watching cake boss when I saw that he had a restaurant here in Vegas I had to try it. The hostess was nice and sat us down quick but overall look of this place I wasn't impressed at all, waitress was slow and took forever and when our food came out I wasn't falling in my chair in love with it. Taste like every other Italian restaurant every where, nothing special or wow factor about it. It was really disappointing to come here and think that the food would be over the top to die for yummy and turns out it was nothing to recommend to friends. Probably my first and last time here, also it is pretty price for the quality of food.

ZJfYBRKcYTtXlRCRKlwD7A.text: Very good Italian food in Las Vegas. We were in a party of 8, so they offer a "family style" dinner (bringing out multiple courses for the table to share). All courses were delicious!

I6n_2gVWSw6MGq7GRN_eXg.text: Fantastic! First time here and it was for a friend's birthday. We had an amazing view overlooking the strip. First, the decor was super fun with bundt cake pans decorating the walls, rolling pin room dividers and light fixtures that looked like giant whisks. Like entertainment too. Although we couldn't see him, his piano and voice could be heard throughout. And a nice variety of music too! Everything from Frank Sinatra to Maroon 5. Now for the food... For appetizers we got some amazing Jersey mozzarella dish as well as a grilled cheese garlic bread. Both were amazing but now looking back perhaps we shouldn't have ordered two cheese appetizers. Cue in the awkward silence... Just kidding! No such thing as too much cheese! For entrees I highly recommend the lasagna, Sunday gravy and orecchiette with Italian sausage and broccoli I. For desert we had some amazing lemon raspberry cheesecake and the Italian birthday cake. Both were excellent! Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rolling pin room divider and giant whisk light fixtures
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon raspberry cheesecake
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian birthday cake yumminess!

NeApiVAh2tnouMedoi2z-w.text: Just average.  We had reservations, but still waited for 20 minutes.  Once seated it took 20 minutes for our waitress to show up.  Meatballs were average.  Veal was tender and pretty good.  Won't come back:

eb84-sjuyS40LJy9Y36Tog.text: Me and my Family had an early dinner in the restaurant this Sunday. We had a really bad experience as for your customer service. We arrived with a 1,5 year old toddler and my pregnant wife, they let us wait on the side - even we arrived before the peak time. We needed to ask for a highchair multiple times. Our server (Caleb H, if I can believe the name, what is on the check) was super pushy. He didn't event care about we are with a small child. No plastic cup was offered, not even straw for a child. As soon as we told him nicely we don't want any appetizer, he became even more pushy and extremely rude.   We just wanted to have a nice dinner, and enjoy our first night in Las Vegas, in a special restaurant. Especially because it was the first experience for my mother in law from overseas - who loves Buddy btw, she even went to see his Hoboken cake shop!   After we had our meal, Caleb never came to offer Parmesan cheese to our dish and hardy did any check back on us. It was super obvious, that we received "different" service, comparing to the table next to us. We felt really unwelcome.   The food was really delicious and the busser/or server assistant was super nice and caring. He took care of us better, than our server. Unfortunately we don't know his name. He was the only reason we left tip for the server. We hope at least the server treated him better that night, than the paying costumers.   The restaurant was really busy, so we had no chance to speak to a manager. So we couldn't leave any feedback personally.

ciMC4kZ9UZ0BzO23pgMk8g.text: I have been wanting to try this place and finally glad we did! Their happy hour from 4:30-6:30pm everyday is by far my favorite in Las Vegas right now. They have $4 drink specials including sangria and bloody Mary's that were delicious. They're appetizers were $5 plates and everything we have was amazing. What made my mouth drool was the meatball sliders with ricotta cheese. I don't usually like ricotta cheese but it totally made these sliders out of this world. The calamari was also a favorite with having deep fried banana peppers mixed in as well. If you are looking for a good happy hour, this is your place to go!

am1-CCPYqK41Xe97Gd0kPg.text: the best food amazing service and the best wait staff I have ever had the pleasure of having   I highly recommend buddy vs to anyone

AoQ9Ey0tGq0JLXq-fNSsqg.text: What a pleasant surprise! We went on Christmas Eve because it was one of the few with reservation still available that had good reviews. We loved it!! Service was on point, we got our meals fast, food tasted delicious. The pizza sauce is great!

Cwk5rWM5YTwC4FsqUcbicg.text: Service was excellent!! The meatball appetizer a must!! It was just like my aunt made. The orecchiette pasta with sausage was delicious. The lemon drop martini was very good. I wouldn't order the brocollini appetizer again. The focaccia bread was delicious.

3PbYx4f7VLr47ufhdHF-eA.text: The staff is very good at up selling a rather mediocre menu at best. The restaurant counts on the fame of Buddy and really not geared to a True foodie.

VecHpkmbnMOmhwIP_rzPyg.text: We sat at the Bar and the 2 men Group   Nick and Howie play awesome music.  Kathy the bartender has a great attitude and a full time smile. We had tapas at the bar great calamari.      Nice ambiance. Ra ra ra

_EfpVIOcQdtuvAQc6RyQIA.text: I am not an Italian food snob or claim to know how, "good Italian food should taste."  The not so good - Calimari. It was very chewy and may have been a little undercooked. The sipping sauce was pretty good, had a bit of chipotle/spicey flavor to it.  The good - my wife and I split a plate of Chicken Rigatone A La Vodka. This meal was very flavorful. The noodles were large and had chunks of chicken mixed in with it. The vodka cream sauce was very tasty, I would order this again.  They are a little cheap with the bread but it is great and quite frankly I dont need to eat it anyway.  The service - friendly but a little slow.  I would go back!

wr4edtplhHf7SlNyCYdgAg.text: Average food, decent service. Nice setting but the grandma meatballs, chicken parmasean,  garlic bread were disappointing.

4UzJvt6xKJM0sNhSDKcM3A.text: Loved this place. Delicious food, nice ambience and very good customer service. We didn't have reservation and the restaurant was busy. So we only got the table with super tall chairs. That was the only uncomfortable thing (am short). Would love to come again when visiting Vegas.

hxIdSlPGKChyo8HLd5fxmQ.text: The meatball sliders and sausage sliders were very tasty. The bread on the sliders  melted in your mouth... The Nutella Cake was great, especially with the ice cream it came with. The manager Shawn, was so nice and  professional and made sure we had good service. He gave us a complimentary dessert because they were short staffed.

jSL-p3v7dlUx53SJGQ-d1Q.text: Pizza was not good at all. Service had to be reminded to bring drinks and spoons returned because they were dirty. Recommend you skip and find another place to eat.   Highlight was the spaghetti.

KZkERpMAsAj7lruhGnCesQ.text: Been here about 5 times. Food is either always really good or just a little off -- like too salty -- but still decent.  The desserts are always ridiculously good, creme brulee and lobster tail are delicious, the desserts are definitely the best part of the meal. Customer service, not so good. Servers disappear or really rush around to where you only see them 10% of your entire visit when it should be more like 40%. Drinks go unrefilled and putting in orders or requests can take a while.  Good food, a little pricey. Just wish the servers would slow down and be more attentative to their tables needs. Wouldn't normally say anything but been here 5 times and noticed this every time.

RDREup-PX4Wqw-WeICusHQ.text: Amazing!! Everything is delicious! We had the salmon, cheese ravioli, shrimp scampi, chicken piccata and Caesar salad. The sauce is perfect. Service was quick and friendly. We only had to wait 30ish minutes. All in all a great experience.

6BR0cgjixS-PHv43xGdBJQ.text: Good food and good service! Pretty traditional Italian fare. The layout is a little wonky. But the focaccia bread was so good !!! A wonderful dinner out!

AXoQsHQj760jP2qCb-TXIg.text: I am a fan of Cake Boss, so when we visited Las Vegas, I have to eat at Buddy's restaurant.  The location is nice. Price is on the higher range. The serving size is good for one person, definitely not for sharing especially if you are hungry.  The pasta which we ordered Linguini with clams and lasagna are on the salty side. Actually it is salty. My son who ordered chicken blt like it a lot.  For desert, we ordered creme brulee and canoli. Of course, the canoli is to die for!!! Love it!!! But the creme brulee, i wanted it to be more like a flan but their version is more cream version.

L_k9abFlO2lx5RAgcg2WTg.text: True Italian breadsticks: thin, crunchy, and dry just like I remember from NY and New Jersey. Calamari: crispy but not chewy, came with some thin sliced grilled lemon, green pepper; an interesting combo.  The fried mozzarella could have been an entree: more like a massive stuffed grilled cheese sandwich with a light marinara sauce. Caesar salads came with fried Parmesan cheese polenta cubes.  What a flavor accent! Carbonara (oh to die for): just enough bits of ham, a good dose of cream and tons of cheese with al dente pasta that tasted homemade. A large enough portion that I got a dogie bag and enjoyed it again the next day. The lobster roll: a flaky layered pastry with a cream filling and surrounded by berries.  Who could not like it? We came as part of a romantic promotion through our timeshare. Both hubby and I agreed, it was a shame we waited until our last day to eat there. Or we would have returned to try other dishes.  The wait team kept us filled with ice tea and water without apparent effort; we never sat with used dishes on the table (one of my pet peeves). All in all, I felt like I was back in the hood, eating Nona's good food with familia.

UO45otC8n8rFcLRzzj3uyg.text: Sunday brunch was fabulous! The macaroni and cheese and meatballs were great! I personally didn't care for the cannoli, but the brownies were to die for and the cookies were delicious. The food choices were adequate, but I was surprised that there wasn't any spaghetti. Definitely not disappointed!  Great place to dine.
