Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E5Z23DALKxy74RofDaiufw.text: My wife and I stopped in for some lunch after seei by Buddy's place on the map. The bread is great, my salad was so-so. We shared a combination plate that had lasagna and chicken parm. The meal was great.

uHx3v8R85CHU-kpXcBebaQ.text: My Family and I went to Buddy V's on Sunday .... it's actually not bad of a price. same as if you were going to a buffet at a major casino. I liked a few things: 1) they sat us by the window facing the strip my 2 year old had a great time looking outside and helped me out by keeping her in one place. 2) its brunch so it's all self serve.which is nice because i wanted to try a little bit of everything and no big portions 3) they had the good stuff that i can't get even on a monthly basis...as in meats and seafood. they have a lot of pasta with cheese which is great unless you are watching your dairy. 4) my favorite the pastries!! so delicious... was everything i expected and more! also got the opportunity to meet the pastry chef..she was so nice and welcoming. music playing nice classic songs. best part was it was kid friendly. i saw a lot of children so i wasn't embarrassed when my kids would have she moments. lol   definitely going back

qht5Njr6GCGUFPlUxM9mTw.text: Loved the food at Buddy V's. Great Gluten free options as well!  Very accommodating of our larger group.

SaRtDXriN7xb9c2X8ox51Q.text: Experience was good. Food was good. Food took a little longer than expected to come out?   Service was stellar and our server was funny and informative. They always made sure we had what we needed.

D25oumicNZoSYNXAB3VuJA.text: Wanted a good, affordable meal while in Las Vegas and Buddy V's filled the bill. It's a bit cramped and, of course, touristy (you should see the line for the bake shop across the way), but all in all was an enjoyable, casual Italian meal.  I had the clams with linguine and hubby had the lasagna. We started with mozzarella en carozza. All really tasty and fresh. I took cannolis to go - MY GOODNESS those were awesome!!!

wytlzvWuvi4wDSuzhjVFfw.text: Food is great... Nice atmosphere great view from upstairs windows ... Service was great until dessert time then our bar/waiter got busy and forgot about us for 20 minutes and he wasn't very accommodating for being so slow to take dessert order ... Just said sorry I got busy at bar otherwise this place is great .

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great meatball sub

OLsbHIuwPX1Wy_2fDIEF0g.text: Spaghetti and meatballs are amazing, reminds me of my grandfathers cooking. The fresh warm bread melts in your mouth. Definitely a must try while in Las Vegas

tnk8BZLxKBCKlmvkDw8eFg.text: Ate dinner this evening at about 5:30, gave 1 star cuz I had to put something down. Went to the Mariah Carey concert and lost all of my dinner. Very sick to my stomach. Ate the meatballs and then the sausage item off the $40 dollar dinner. Also had the Cannoli. Stopped by about 10:30 this evening to tell them. The gal at the front was putting away menus and didn't seem concerned at all, in fact stated "I'll tell the manager"continued to put the menus.  I asked her if I was going to get to speak to the manager n she said yes n walked away. He came over after a few minutes. I explained what had happened to me earlier.  His reply was "what do you want from me"?  I told him I spent $110.00 plus tip. He said he would take my name and investigate. Not sure what he has to "investigate"?!?!?  His name is William Raspberry according to the card that he gave me, after I asked for a card. I would not recommend this place to anyone!!! March 9, have not heard a word from anyone. Such terrible service!!!!

KzHSxw08QI6KVIwH2myZDQ.text: Delicious! We did Happy hour! Pam, bill, Dan an Lynn sat out side on there terrace enjoyed small plates an wine! Really good an service with a smile! Thank You

4lMlilpK-I0eOM6nXjdT5w.text: Wow. This place is always great. The service is great , food is great. We met the Cake Boss himself, Buddy V was in the restaurant and was super nice.  Nice to have this place around the corner from where we live.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V2jf0mCgL6yoPsOxDqGvAA.text: Staying at the Venetian and craved Italian without breaking the bank. Found Buddy V's thanks to yelp! Never watched Cake Boss, so didn't know anything about the celebrity status of the chef. We didn't have reservations and tried to get a table around 6:45pm on a Saturday for 2 people. Apparently there was a private event so they couldn't seat us til after 9pm, but luckily there was a table at the bar, so we took that. The bar is a bit noisier than the restaurant, but totally worth it to not wait. Before 7pm, they have a 3 course menu  for $38 which includes an appetizer, entree, and dessert.   Loved the moist and soft Grandma's Meatball appetizer. You only get 3 and they are half dollar sized. For my entree, I got the bolognese. Absolutely delicious and extreme chunky sauce. I also loved the fact that they were very generous w/the sauce so that I actually had plenty of sauce for my pasta! Even had some sauce left over to dip a piece of bread! Got the nutella dessert and thought that it was a tad sweet. Very decadent, but just a tad sweet.

7Xp2789VKDCjfvch_M_qgQ.text: Was just here in April 2017, and had the best time! Wait staff was timely and friendly. Knew what they were doing!  Our table of 4 had: MY MOTHER IN LAW'S CAPELLINI SHRIMP SCAMPI - huge portion, even larger shrimp; NONNA'S LASAGNA AL FORNO - there's no such thing as too much cheese Wonderful!; BUDDY'S CAPRESE SALAD - so many heirloom tomatoes, it's almost a full meal; CAESAR SALAD - with croutons dripping with garlic butter; ORECCHIETTE & ITALIAN SAUSAGE - large, large portion; GRILLED SALMON - wonderful, moist, flaky; and TIRAMISU for dessert - nice way to end any meal.  Enjoyed the visit - no, it wasn't cheap, but nothing is in Las Vegas, and you're paying for the ambiance and experience as well, and we weren't disappointed.

LLp7e2jUXt2Us1mG2WbLMw.text: Great Italian food. Relaxed, kid friendly atmosphere. Set up very similar to Olive Garden or Maggianos. Tons of servers and busers keep things moving quickly. Water refilled fast. Courses come out timely. They offer a fixed price menu - $40 for 3 courses. All the food was delicious. Portions are huge.

SjxMWFCuQgQXzYtujKUaxw.text: The meal was okay.  I had chicken parm and while it was good, it wasn't anything to write home about.

fg2Y23aYsPkbaB9mbY_uxg.text: Restaurant week provided the perfect excuse to try Buddy V's. We dined with a group of nine. Service was a bit sluggish at times, but otherwise attentive. They started us with delicious herbed focaccia which paired well with oil and vinegar. I only wish they left the bottles on the table so we could help ourselves. We didn't know upon ordering, but draft beers in the 20 oz and Liter sizes come in a souvenir glass with $9 refills (the cost of a pint). So, that was a nice surprise when ordering a second round.   The restaurant week menu is $40.15 and it came with choice of appetizer, entree and dessert. The majority of the table ordered Grandma's Meatballs, made with beef, veal and pork. They were tender and juicy, the marinara sauce was nicely balanced and flavorful. I was quite pleased. Likely, the second best meatball in town. Those that had the Panzanella Salad seemed satisfied, the mozzarella was very fresh.   The table tried each available entree: Pasta Bolognese, Sea Bass, Carbonara, and Chicken Parmesan. Each were beautifully prepared and damn tasty. My Sea Bass was perfectly seasoned and brightened with a spritz of lemon, the side salad was fresh and light, which was welcomed since I was already pretty full. The chicken parm came with a nice helping of pasta and two lightly breaded baked cutlets topped with mozzarella and provolone cheeses. The pasta across the board was the ideal al dente.   And for dessert we had a choice of tiramisu or cannoli. Both were well executed and scrumptious. I loved dipping the lady fingers into the layers of the creamy tiramisu. The cannoli was filled end to end with sweet ricotta; no hollow center.   I was a little skeptical, but dinner was delicious. Many celebrity chef restaurants fail to deliver, but that's not the case here. It has good eats and casual charm. If you have the opportunity, there's still time to check out the restaurant week menu which is an absolute steal. It's well worth navigating the labyrinth that is the Venetian. Don't park at Venetian like we did, I believe Palazzo self parking would provide better access.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seabass
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tiramisu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. meatballs

oKzoc7icFruM6fON3YX2rA.text: Solid Italian dining option at the Venetian. The staff is all top notch and the food was pretty good. We had sangria to drink which was good and then a really fresh and delicious salad for an appetizer. My entree was the chicken rigatoni alla vodka - I thought this was ok although I have had better vodka pasta elsewhere. My two friends rated their entrees highly. Overall, a solid option that probably won't dissapoint but it did not blow me away.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken rigatoni alla vodka

Us1JRBqGsUWnF5GrxuRytQ.text: Delicious food! I had the chicken rigatoni and it blew me away! The canoli shells were incredibly flaky and rivaled my grandma's.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely delicious! Crystal was amazing!

yM-_bfYTrUVWocJy2_YPqg.text: Brunch was great! My friend and I did the bottomless drinks & buffet brunch. You can mix and match from a few choices of drinks for $14.99. There was a variety of food offerings and it was all pretty good! I will definitely be back! Service was great. Our server was awesome and informative. The manager Emily at the time was great too! She saw us waiting at the meat station and immediately went to help us and another server went to cut up meat and serve us. Great service great food! The entire staff was helpful and friendly. Came here just because I loved watching Cake Boss but my expectations were surpassed!  Try the mac & cheese and chicken parm... don't pass on the Canola! Thanks to our server Freddy...he was the best!

xweBln6AUBpfxoAeh2gaoQ.text: service was good, food was spectacular, but couldn't help but notice that all four of us who ate there just so happened to come down with really bad food poisoning a few hours after dinner which was the only meal we ate together. be careful.

F8IEwSz9FhHyzpm0pVqkiw.text: Phenomenal Italian food, which is what you might expect from a unique restaurant owned by an Italian family. The staff was wonderful as well, from the hosts at the front all the way to the manager who greeted us and had a minute or two conversation with us.   The menu suits itself to family style dining. My wife and I each had drinks, split garlic bread with oil and vinegar, and the pollo rigatoni alla vodka, which is one of the best dishes I've ever eaten. The polenta croutons on the Caesar salad must be tried to be believed. The salad looks so simple that you might be disappointed when it comes to the table vs. my wife's house salad with beautiful heirloom tomatoes, but both were exceptional.  Contrary to many of the reviews I read, they do bring some small bread. Thinking that we didn't, we ordered the garlic bread, which could easily be split between 4-6 people. It was a little much, and if I did it over, I'd leave off the garlic bread and order dessert. We were simply too full!   I'd you're looking for phenomenal food that's not terribly expensive (with drinks and all we were under $80), don't even give it a second thought, and come here. You may want to reserve your table through open table or something similar to get in quickly. Our reservation was delivered exactly on time.

8msZq5YjbhzlISPWkKjCCQ.text: Great food . Friendly staff.  Second time here. Great desert... Yummy. Thank you Buddy V

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice cold one

H5LKg-whxhXCd7NkOPrWaw.text: Absolutely amazing! Great food (steak tenderloin) and great service. Freddy was the best server, very attentive.  Highly recommend.

MZjjs-4l1IT75p6jY_imCA.text: Incredible food. Amazing sauce. Our server was Mourad, and he was so knowledgeable about the restaurant and it's history.  We will be back!

8wUWq9DIRZzw-bjJ0JpJeA.text: Was here a couple years ago. It was great then and still great today. That kind of consistency is rare in Vegas. Highly recommended.

P2SCG1osN6I9S58vFAKPSw.text: We made an OpenTable reservation.  We arrived five minutes early and we were seated right away.  Our waiter, Charlie, was able to answer our questions about the menu with ease.  He provided the right amount of attention to us without being intrusive.  We were a party of 3.  I had the orecchiette and Italian sausage.  It was rich and flavorful, with only a hint of spice, which was exactly what I wanted.  My husband Tim and my friend Gina both ordered the linguini with clams.  They liked it a lot.  I've been friends with Gina for 25 years, and this was probably the only time I've seen her finish an entree at a restaurant!  If you're concerned, don't be; the portion size was generous.  I also had the Italian greens.  They were good and the portion size is large enough for two if you want to share.  We finished with cannoli and apple pie.  Both are worth trying and can easily be shared.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli with pistachios and chocolate chips
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple pie with oatmeal raisin crumble and vanilla ice cream
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orecchiette pasta with mild Italian sausage, tomatoes, cheese, and broccolini

XJMMk-HJW9u-zCENzVXx4Q.text: Amazing!  Very nice ambiance with lots of decorations to look at and a semi open kitchen.  High ceilings so it doesn't feel cramped or dark.  Comfortable seating.  Excellent food.  My girlfriend and I shared the Caesar and it was a very nice portion with polenta instead of croutons.  So good!  She loved her shrimp scampi and I loved my veal Marsala as both were recommended by our server.  Everything tasted fresh and real.  Service was attentive and genuine.  I loved that there a nice view of the strip as well.  Will definitely be going back

Wdv5EdbfH97OsalRojDPgA.text: I was all excited to eat at Cake Boss Buddy V's and it was a treat.. The staff is very very friendly and made me at home!! This is a very relaxing place with tables that gives you a killer view of the strip.. I always wanted to try the Grandma's Meatballs that Buddy V is popular for and man they were soooooooo good !! Full of flavour and moist .. Simply an awesome brunch for me!!   Next is to head to his Shop right in front the Carlo's Bake Shop for the famous Cannolis !!! I am soooo full :) ....

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatball sub!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QoBL6mbwEJJ26n6PnDJ-sw.text: This place is legit. Great space with tons of seating and a nice lounge area where you can wait for a table. The service is impeccable and the food is absolutely amazing. Fine dining is what it's about here. They have tons of tables with a great strip view. If you're in town and need a place to have a wonderful dinner, Buddy V's is where it's at!

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala

XkmjAM-BqzF-9T3-XdInGw.text: Went for the Brunch Buffet, I chose the unlimited beverage add-on. Food fresh and delicious (Mac-n-cheese carbonara & cannolis were my faves) mimosas were great & Thanks to the attentiveness of Graciela, well replenished!! She made the experience just so awesome along with the natural daylight beaming in & the cool wisk chandeliers & rolling pin decor! She was very friendly & inviting considering they were kind of busy..! She should be recognized!!

ImSIo6KcRz_ovx4enXxkSw.text: I must admit I was a bit reluctant to try this place. After all, this guy is a baker not a restaurant chef and every celebrity food person has a place in Vegas and most aren't anything to write home about.  This place is outstanding. Their Cesar salad is a must. They serve it with warm polenta croutons. Talk about a bowl of heaven. Crispy on the outside and full of warm polenta goodness. Yes, I wrote 3 sentences about croutons. They are that good. After that I moved onto the scallops. Sweet, briney with the perfect sear on the outside. Delicious. This has become our must eat at place every time we pass through town. Great wine list, fair prices, excellent service. Worth a visit.  We made a stop for lunch and found the treat of a 3 course meal for $22. I got the Cesar salad, chicken parm with salted caramel gelato. The chicken itself was okay but the pasta was delicious. The gelato was worth a stop in itself.

7KsLfbnANZnGGaUiqZsGHQ.text: This place is amazing. You feel like home when you eat here. The plates are huge and filling. Our servers were amazing and super nice. The food tastes homemade and treated us like we were important. The lasagna is huge so if you're not that full, they can split it and it's still a big portion.

tzrv0dLOxpzjmMbbPCtzPQ.text: Revision -  oops, Buddy V not Bobby V!    My sister's nephew said they serve great burgers here for lunch.  So we came for lunch and three of the five of us had the burger.  Angus beef burger served on a brioche bun.  Cooked to order.  Good but I'm not sure I'd come back just for a burger.  Attentive service at lunch.  You can access the restaurant which faces the Strip.  You don't even have to step into the casino.  Directly across the restaurant is the Cake Boss shop.

TcI-FIKp0VFafMaB9qdyiA.text: Make reservations if you want to sit at a real table. We had to sit in the lounge at a high top - not ideal for dinner due to the lack of space. I had the Mac n Cheese Carbonara - delicious, creamy, smoky flavor. Despite sitting in the lounge, they served the full menu and the food was out almost instantly. Great prices for Vegas. Fun eclectic modern decor. Try to get there from 4:30-6:30 for happy hour on appetizers and drinks! I enjoyed a $4 Sangria.

ESCHAHmgTyAtMRILYSC_fg.text: Wow! What a great dining experience all the way around! Eatery is very inviting like a friendly Italian kitchen. Staff was neat, dressed impeccably and very friendly. Our waiter was fantastic and offered us an option that made our dinner even more special. We had an excellent calamari appetizer, a wonderful salad which the waiter recommended (he said he would split our entree because it was huge and add the salad which saved us money and we got to enjoy an amazing salad as well!) The food was delicious, the ambiance was lovely, the staff fantastic! Definitely going back!

ZaF-SJyVURwgCtkZd8JkGQ.text: Buddy V's is actually quite an interesting place to dine. This joint is not one of the high end Italian joints that you're used to seeing in Vegas, it's more of a casual dining experience in which you can wear shorts and a t shirt and fit right in. The ambiance is actually pretty nice and the location has some decent views of the strip. The food taste was just average, IMHO... Essentially nothing to write home about, the lasagna was just ok and rather small in portion while the Caesar salad was below average but did have croutons that were awesome (warm and soft). Overall, this may be a good spot to go the next day after a long night out, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.   Pros- Location Service Decor Menu  Cons- Average taste  Pricey

ToEw8eNyz3_1Izk7C-Gffg.text: I got spaghetti with meatballs, and my friend got Lisa V pasta. Dayummmm portions are small but after finishing my dish, I'm perfectly full. Flavor is just right, noodles are not soft but a bit chewy. I can seriously eat another one in a few minutes. It's that good!! My hot server was on top of her game, checking on us every 5-8 minutes to make sure we're okay. Food and service was perfect!

VMoiSTuWn5xKZnA49HwPqg.text: 5 stars for service... We got immediately seated. Initially we had intended to go to Carlos Bakery but the line wrapped around the corner, it had 3 different lines! So we decided to check out Buddy's restaurant instead and it was the best decision as we got to sit down. The restaurant is clean, large and well designed - it has elements of a modern Italian restaurant and they have pics of Buddy and his family on the dessert menu. We ordered the cannoli, tiramisu and large lobster tail. Since we ate lunch, we weren't hungry and thus didn't try the entrees. But the lobster tail dessert was worth 15$ and it can easily feed 4 people. The tiramisu was not good and the cannoli was sub par.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli!

r2P7oXw0F7db-W0oMVnEjg.text: Our server was very attentive and explained the menu in detail. We ordered eggplant parm and grilled octopus. The octopus was tender and flavorful. The eggplant was just bland. Atmosphere was nice and we enjoyed our dinner there.

H0nza0F3_BgvgxSLQwSTDg.text: We visited the  restaurant during brunch buffet. This was s great way to sample what a variety of the menu without ordering everything at once. It's fair to say the food was good but the desserts were amazing. I ate 3 cannolis.  After getting extremely full we walked across the way to the bakery called Carlos Bakery. This is just the retail bakery side of the Buddy V. I am not sure what the deal is but there is always a line down the hallway with stantions. The wait was 45 minutes. You get up to the pastries and wait another 15 minutes to get your name called to pay. It a bit insane to have only 2 cashiers that can ring you up and keep this line control thing going. The people who put the pastries into a box and out your name on it then stand around to get rung up is inefficient.

ESs6B6G4PzoMmWZKekKdxw.text: Awesome....came here for Sunday brunch and could NOT have been more satisfied!!  From the doctor your own Bloody Mary bar to the many stations of different foods to try, my husband and I left extremely full and happy!!! A great way to recover from a Vegas Saturday night!

eXUamADTJSHYw58sT2TVQA.text: let me first state the food was good to very good, the service was lame. our server "Kristi F." left us waiting to the point we had to ask a person who cleared tables to have her come by and take our order. She rarely came by never checked on us. We had ordered several fixed menu items, that included desert, yet after the table was cleared from the dinner course she spread out desert menus saying, this and that were good.. We told her we had ordered the fixed menu that was inclusive of such and it seemed rather a  surprise to her, as she collected those desert menus Luckily the two young girls with us were entertained during the obscenely long 2.5 hour meal fest. I am not impressed.  Do not misunderstand me the food was good, the service was quite poor. I did not see a manager walking around, critiquing the troops on their performance and yet obviously it was needed.  The restaurant did NOT appear full, several tables were unoccupied. This adds to my confusion of tonight's performance. Perhaps we caught a bad night for our server and her customer skillset?   We had a table of 7, 5 adults 2 children and 2.5 hours is well too long for a restaurant dinner, that is NOT a  dining experience.  It was lame.    2 stars for food 0 for service..

RghBwvobgY2WCcFUFA1Aew.text: We got the ravioli with the white sauce and the chicken parmigiana. The food was fabulous and the staff were tremendous. We spent about the same or less than in our hometown. This place is very much worth the visit!

rGyMXYJtfL_IExifOewKKQ.text: Absolutely amazing. Some of the best Italian food I've ever had !! from start to finish service was amazing and the food was worth every part of the 5 stars. I would definitely come back here again and recommend it to friends

q28b219LGPAc5ukKHyD9_w.text: Peter was the best server! So attentive, knowledgeable of wine and menu... and awesome service! He knew I was a teacher and comped us a free dessert for Teacher Appreciation month! So thoughtful! Food was delicious as well! Can't wait to come back!

svZN5dLCzgcqnCqlE4XMSQ.text: The Restaurant Is Nice. Food Is Ok Lasagna and Grilled Cheese Bread Were Stars Of Show But I Was Disappointed With Chicken Parmigiana. So Many Positive Comments But It Was Honestly Bland Besides The Cheese Being A Good Quality.

JhuB5cjmV1JawZnW3XEVsQ.text: The garlic bread appetizer is the best garlic bread ever, hands down. I had the rigatoni alla vodka and my fiance had the lasagna. Both very good. We also shared the Nutella chocolate cake which was every bite as amazing as it sounds.  The service was wonderful. As silly as this sounds, my glass was never empty. It drives me nuts when I have to ask for a refill so to have someone always on top of it was wonderful. The waitress did a few weird things like take the drink menu away as soon as we order the first round but otherwise she was wonderful.

z53AGsFCEVoDxOr3ve7g_Q.text: The food here is so good! The service is great and so is the ambiance I will be dreaming about the food for months, it's that good

b2RCFrA-TCHYO9jDfR-tZw.text: This is the first time I didn't bite into a tiny pice of rock in my clam linguine  The service was excellent. I would tell my friends who like to eat to come here.  Buddy's bakery is right across from the restaurant. Yum yum. .

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great clam linguine.

Bbn-Izko-kLwC9ys_YeVcg.text: If you want a fast food setting and to be in and out as quickly as possible...go to Buddy V's.    Incredibly disappointing in that we hoped for a casual dining experience. Instead, we hadn't finished our salads and our entrees showed up!  As well, the server pulled my salad away and when I explained I wasn't done they acted "surprised" when I told them to leave it!  A person who may have been a manager, ( who knows....she didn't introduce herself)...apologized but instead of comping us anything ( like the salad I didn't enjoy anymore) she proceeded to ask if we wanted Parmesan cheese on my entree.    AND as soon as we sat back from our incomplete entree, our check arrived!  Imagine the servers surprise when I told her I wanted another glass of wine.  She was put out because they would mean running our check again.  I don't think this is how The Cake Boss envisioned this.   Save your money if you want a nice, un-hurried dining experience. We especially wanted this to be nice because it was the last night of our honeymoon.  Epic fail.

kPXz4a9txkBuiA7v-j7oQA.text: brought my family for the Sunday brunch which we have enjoyed many times before. The food...still outstanding...the service...mediocre at best. the host actually made us choose at the hostess stand if my family wanted brunch or A La Carte before we sat. when i suggested we choose at the table.."No..I do it this way". Then the pay me no mind severs refilling all our drinks wrong takes away from the overall experience. Still, the best "East Coast"  Italian food in Vegas.

1DjXGQ0FxZFgk2j3xnRocw.text: Had another outstanding dinner here; I stop every trip to Vegas. (Twice a year).   The lasagna was so big and filling, and tonight the spaghetti bolognese was great.    Don't forget the Sunday gravy as a tasty option.   Alexis, our waitress, was delightful and made dinner perfect.   Thank you!!

Mdipu-P6ZR72BugMWtUZZw.text: This is the place to go for Italian! I made a reservation online so we didn't have to wait for a table.  I would advise doing that if possible as it is a very busy place!   The wait staff is incredible! There is the main waiter and then they have another waiter working for the main waiter.  Setting tables, refilling drinks, bringing bread, etc.  It was a very unique concept that I had never seen before.  It made things run so smoothly.   They start you off with some amazing complementary focaccia bread. It is seasoned with some Italian seasonings and cheese. It was piping hot when delivered to us in a very cute basket.  I ordered Nonna's lasagna AL forno. The waiter asked if I was ready for the most incredible lasagna I've ever eaten?! To be honest I was kind of thinking "ya right."  well...  He was right! It really was the best lasagna I've ever had! The presentation was great as well.  It came in a cute little cast iron skillet. We also ordered the garlic cheese bread.  It was good but I honestly liked the focaccia bread better!   You will not be disappointed coming here. The relaxed family atmosphere was very nice! There were pictures of buddy's family on the walls which made it feel like home.  Can not wait to come back here!

J5R7yACReRZeX3eKf4RR6g.text: My boyfriend and I went to this restaurant for our 6 year anniversary on Friday 9-11-15, he had made a reservation with a special request for desert as a surprise to me! I have been wanting to come to this place for some time as I'm a huge fan of Buddy!!   We show up and get seated very quickly it was about 8:45-9:00pm we are sitting for five minutes when a biased comes to the table and asks us if we would like some water...sure he brings us water...we've never been here before so we are taking our time with the menu and decide to order mozzarella as an appetizer when our server finally arrived at our table we had already drank our glass of water it was a good 15 minutes after we sat down...unacceptable if you ask me! I don't know his name cause he talked so fast and was trying really hard with what seemed like a fake accent to be "cool" and laughed at himself....we told him we've never been here and that we would like to order the mozzarella...he then said are you ready to put on your Order for dinner...I said could I have a few minutes he then proceeded to say that I wanted the Veil Parmesan without giving me time to look uhh ok I guess I'll have that since you are in such a rush for me to order when you haven't even put in my appetizer...my boyfriend ordered lasagna... I never saw my server again...well not willingly anyways...I had to flag him down for more water...the buss men were passing out cheese bread and vinegar and oil to every table that was there...except us not once were we offered anything nor where my drinks refilled without having to ask!! I wanted to order a soda and nope didn't even get to do that!!! Our appetizer came was different and so yummy!!! Server never came to see how we where....our food came no server nothing...what if I didn't like my food...oh but I had to flag a biased down again for more water even though they have walked by my table 100 times and I know they seen my water empty!!! So on with it...I had to yell for my server who had been ignoring us after I've asked for him 3 times by a bus man he came I said may I please have a box...10 min later my box arrived...he asked if we wanted desert I said may I see a menu!!(been wanting Buddy's lobster take for years almost went to New Jersey just to try one!!) then my boyfriend asks for a manager cause the special request he set up was to have a lobster tail desert show up to the table as a surprise with writing on the plate saying happy anniversary....my boyfriend was so upset that they ruined the surprised when he talked to the manager he kind of still felt like it was no big deal!! A new server delivered our desert and the comped it(didn't asked them to nor did we want them to)   At the end of everything the SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE! I have been in customer service my whole life never would I treat someone the way we were treated!! We felt abandoned when the people around us where being well taken care of!!!  I give a HUGE SHOUT OUT TO THE KITCHEN THOUGH!! FOOD WAS AMAZING!!! I don't eat leftovers never have my whole life but I did eat the left overs for dinner Saturday!! That says something!!  Just disappointing about the service kind of heartbroken cause j was so excited to finally be going to BUDDY V's

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LOBSTER TAIL DESSERT!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veil Parmesan and lasagna

ucDdsAM8WCUWywCpW5V2vg.text: We got to experience this place randomly for happy our and are so lucky! This is a great happy hour stop! The sangria is to die for, great flavor and punch! We enjoyed their meatball HH app, delicious! Definitely put this place on your list of things to do!

gso2ApuhPGy680OzRs1Qjw.text: We ordered the veal marsala for 24 bucks, not sure if we got veal or pork, it was way tough than any other veal I have had. Sauce was over powered by wine sauce and that's pretty much all I tasted. Probably won't come back here again

FrpHP0uXVdIB2tfMnMC8yw.text: AMAZING. Been watching cake boss and drooling over their food for years looking at it on the show, and tonight we finally got to go! Everything was fantastic! Had 2 three course dinners (Mama's meatballs, salmon, and a cannoli and then the chicken parmesan, and nutella cake) and at 38 bucks each, you can't beat that for huge portions at a relaxed atmosphere on the strip. The staff was super accommodating and made us feel welcome and relaxed as well. If I could give more stars, I would! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZE55sHlZ1rgNqNujwfgZww.text: Average food, terrible staff.  Las Vegas caters to numerous business travelers, yet the staff at Buddy V's couldn't figure out how to provide me with an itemized receipt and seemed bothered by the fact that I even asked for one. They also screwed up a simple request to help me celebrate a team member's birthday.  Whoever manages that restaurant should find something else to do. Because he or she isn't very good at managing restaurants.

AzcvSR0QZHUscy_gJ3SL_w.text: Amazing brunch! Everything you can think of is there- plus it is spread out throughout the restaurant, making it unlike other '' buffets" I've been to. I also greatly enjoyed the bottomless mimosas, bellinis and sangrias. Our waiter even sent us girls with a to go glass so we could keep up our day drinking at the Vatican. So much fun!

BK4GEBSnchxWRjzgRf3WHg.text: The food here was delicious! There were 5 of us and we all loved our dishes... the only reason I am knocking it down a star is because our actual server did nothing for us - the bus boy did everything! And then the server took his own tip. Instead of giving us our change, he kept was was left ...so unfortunately for him that's all he got!   We will probably be back before our trip ends!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KqF_k49zHcBnwrxWHuQ-hg.text: Nice restaurant convieniently located within Grand Canal Shoppes.  Food: Chicken Parm comes with two big pieces of chicken smothered in cheese and a side of spaghetti, which is perfect for sharing.  Buddy's favourite pizza was good too but could have more toppings. Chocolate nutella cake with ice-cream was delicious and only $9.  Place: nice ambience, liked the Cake Boss display of cakes at the front of the restaurant and the his family themed decor and menue was a nice touch.  Get a booth seat or seat by the window.  Service: very good, friendly, and prompt  Overall would recommend for a moderately priced Italian meal.  Also try a treat at his pastry shop across the aisle.

HRuhQqily5KjIk-YcVq1Tw.text: Amazing customer service and the food was incredible! I loved that there was a live band playing, it really made the dining experience on a Wednesday night special. There was great views of the strip and you have to walk through the hotel to get to the restaurant so it makes it a fun experience walking throughout! Overall, I had a great time and I will definitely be coming back.

KZWWMCgTpBItsdOGKwC8ag.text: We were sat down at a table that had a view of the strip.  We did not even ask for it.  Very nice.  The waitress was phenomenal and treated us like family.  Food was outstanding and atmosphere was family friendly.  We had our kids and the loved the food.   We could be loud and act like a family out to dinner.  A great surprise, the experience was overwhelming.   A need to go.

BqjlgZwa0ITyVAELgpj28w.text: If you like Italian food then don't leave Las Vegas without trying Buddy's restaurant! The food was amazing!! And right across from the restaurant is his bakery which is also very good :)

HFF7lABOS9jbgNVPumeB0A.text: This is a great location and setting. It was crowded for lunch. The hostess took our seating request, but failed to let us know how long to wait would be. After long wait we sat at the bar. The service was average. We got the garlic bread and Buddy's pizza. The bread was great and done to perfection. The pizza on the other hand had tough crust which was burnt on a third of it. This was the end we were to eat last. We wish we had discovered it first with all the gastric issues we experienced. We informed the waiter whom offered no resolution. She just stated it must been a bad oven. Why would a cook let such food go out. Why would the wait shaft not try to make a patron happy. This is not a place I'll risk returning to with so many problems with the staff.

2S2c1Jy_Lom7p1smhATV-w.text: I was at the Venetian/Palazzo Shops when I saw a sign that said "Carlos Cupcakes" and "Buddy V's Ristorante". We went to Carlos and had an amazing eclair and I saw that across the way there was this restaurant which I found out was owned by the same person who owns Carlos. Anyways let me tell you why this place is amazing.  Service:  It was lunch, so we got in really quickly. We asked to be seated at a window and they did just that! The servers were all really nice and were happy to be doing their job. One plus is that I was really thirsty at the time and they were on top of refilling my water. (5 out of 5 stars)  Ambiance:  It's really beautiful in here. When you sit inside it feels nothing like the craziness of Vegas. It's so nicely decorated in here, and it's huge so you get seated quickly as well as you don't feel crammed or packed! (5 out of 5 stars)  Food:  So we were sinners and had dessert before lunch (to be fair we didn't have breakfast). I said to my family, "if the eclair is this amazing, then I'd love to see what the restaurant is like." My dad wanted to go elsewhere, but I made him come here and all of us were drawn by the selection on the menu. We all ended up ordering Philly Cheesesteaks. Let me tell you, that was probably one of the best Philly Cheesesteaks I've ever had in my life! So flavorful! There were other things on the menu too, like chicken parmesan, pastas, and lasagnas that I saw people eating nearby which all looked amazing! (5 out of 5 stars)  I am for sure coming back! This is our new favorite place. It blew away all our expectations and I am dying to have more of that Philly Cheesesteak!

HBIxniSwLlXlrGL26s8PTg.text: This is my favorite chicken parm in Vegas!  I think celebrity chefs restaurants get a bad rap on occasion just because a lot of Yelpers don't want to appear "trendy". Buddy V's, IMHO, could be named BLANK and have the crowds it does based on their food alone. As my Uncle used to say when he called us to the table at one of his BBQ's, "It's real good and there's lots of it!". Great service and views along with great Italian food gets 5 stars from me.  WHEN YOU GO- Reservations at night are a must! I recommend lunch and a window seat!

oGConH1s4Zg1xTRZDHJwMA.text: Awesome choice for brunch. For buffet brunch and unlimited drinks (beer, mimosa, sangria, bellinis, wine) $50. Doesn't get much better than that. Went for a bachelorette brunch and our service was incredible. Our drinks never got less than half full and he started leaving pitchers on the table for us--truly bottomless. Our server even made us to go cups of our drink of choice!! The brunch itself was excellent, the Mac and cheese was to die for and so was the dessert table. I'll be including Buddy V's for brunch on all my Vegas trips from now on!

cOF_FfImZto6gs0l4IL9iA.text: Went for a late afternoon meal and cake for hubby's birthday. Great octopus very tender and salad dressing was superb. Also got charcuterie plate, very well done toasted bread cheese olives and 3 cured meats. BUT THE HIT OF THE EVENING WAS THE BIRTHDAY CAKE A CYLINDER OF HEAVEN the stuff dreams are made of. WILL GO BACK ON NEXT VISIT

xMAHDL4KcP0ewoxUDTFgOw.text: Best meal Ive had in Vegas, I'm sorry I waited till my last day before stopping in. The food was well worth the price and didn't break the bank. Well done Buddy you should be proud of this location and staff.

J4sC_gq3sD9khNWLX1Vv0g.text: We made it to Buddy V's at the Venetian!  Tip: Park at Palazzo Valet, walk down to strip and up escalator next to Walgreens for a shorter walk!  We came during Happy Hour, 4:30-6:30 pm 7 days a week. We were here Memorial Day weekend, and it wasn't too full on a Sunday afternoon. The seating in the bar was really comfy with stuffed chairs and couches, high top bar tables with padded seats and bar seating with padded seats with backs.   We tried one of everything on the Small Bites for $5 Happy Hour menu!!!  We also had the Butterscotch Creme Brulee for dessert for $9. So creamy and great butterscotch flavor! It's a good sized bowl, but only about 1/2 inch thick, so not as many calories!  Ricotta cheese was smooth and creamy. It came with grilled buttered bread, and was a great accompaniment to the Olives and Pickled Vegetables, which was served with the same bread. There was enough cheese to also put some on the amazing and Must have Grandma's Meatballs. 3 large beef, veal and pork meatballs with about 1/2 of tomato sauce, sprinkled with a good amount of parmesan cheese. Our other favorites: the Calamari had some big tender pieces that I loved, there were crispy big pieces that that the little tentacles that our friend loved and some fried banana peppers that the spicy food lover liked. My wife's favorite was definitely the Mac and Cheese Carbonara, with smoked mozzarella, fontina, egg, pancetta and peas with a creamy sauce and golden bread crumbs. We got Roma style Gnocchi, which are little fried cubes of polenta with a little metal tub of marinara mixed with pesto dipping sauce-delicious. Crunchy on outside  and smooth inside, great sauce. The smashed meatball sliders was a fun little 2 bite sandwich with peppers on top. Same for Sausage and pepper sliders, which are a bit spicy.   Loved the little to go novelty light up cup for the soda with unlimited refills for $7.   Krystal waited on us, and was very happy and attentive. Manager Kristina Poole visited the table and sat and visited us for a nice chat. We got an update on the restaurant, it's sister restaurant in Bethlehem, PA and Buddy's moms health when we asked. The Assistant General Manager, Sean Fiori, came and whisked her away after a quick picture and check to make sure we were happy.   Very nice evening, could be quick, but this time we stayed and enjoyed ourselves and they were not pushing us out after we paid the bill.  We are here again on 12/18/16 and it's all the same-menu, Krystal the waitress, me and my wife and Flower. She's having the Sangria. No hot chocolate for Tutu, they need to add it to the menu during cold weather.  She got some across the way at Carlos Bakery. Along with Cannoli and a strawberry cheesecake.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Christmas menu 2016
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Price for three people at happy hour $69 with tip!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour menu

K54HQo36WlT3k_Xn9sIcbA.text: The food is worth 4 stars but the service is worth 1. We went for lunch on a Friday at 2:00 and there was no one in here and we barley put out food in at 2:45. Our server, Ricardo, never checked in on us and it took 25 min for him to come see our table after being seating. We had to tell the bus boy we were ready to order. It also took another 30 min to get the bill of us sitting around not having food, empty water glasses in front of us. Other than that I would recommend the cheese bread! It was delicious.

xWsWl7rv-AI7F-oB2Jzt7w.text: I come to Vegas monthly for business and every time I do I make sure to stop by Buddy V's. My wife's Eggplant Parm and Meatball sandwich are my favs.  I came in 9/12 and got especially awesome service by Mathew and his assistant. The food came up fast, and was delicious as always. Neither gentleman batted an eye when I requested a wine glass filled with ice and a lime for my large Pellegrino, and every time near my table they refreshed my drink. They had me feeling fancy!  BTW- Sat. & Sun., they have THE BEST BRUNCH! Everything is delicious, its worth every penny! Buddy, your people are taking care of you down here! :)

sKNM6aUFaUNFDxWNATHT4g.text: Spaghetti was way too salty. Angus burger meat was dry and bland. The buns were burnt and we had to have them replaced. The new buns were dry and too fluffy. Didn't go well with the patty. Tomato soup was too sour. Everything was just a little off in some way.

W0DQgoUP9wEtwRfjT7z8Ew.text: Our experience at Buddy V's is always fantastic.  I had brunch there this past weekend and had such a great time.  The buffet style brunch has everything from eggs to chicken parmesan and it is all delicious.  They also have a bottomless drink package that includes beer, wine, mimosas, bellinis, sangria, and bloody marys for $16 which is such a steal.    Our server was Charlie and we couldn't have asked for a better person.  He was funny, attentive, knowledgeable, and helpful.  In the few times that I have been to Buddy V's I have not had better service than I did with Charlie.  We will definitely be asking to sit in his section next time we come back.

ie2hm6VNKl7JGDWJWy9TlQ.text: Such a great place to go and eat... large quantity but the quality is there feels like your in buddy Vs kitchen... go hungry

BACD2aWYT5ur6yYOZfxZPQ.text: We were seated quickly. The staff are great. Friendly, professional and attentive but not overbearing.   The food is outstanding. My daughter is a very picky pasta enthusiast and she said it was the best pasta she has ever had.

-RUQ8MsF715QUdQkmIxaMQ.text: Came here for my wife's birthday and the kiddos everything was superb from beginning to end. we had shrimp scampi, lasagna , kids has chicken parm, spaghetti, meatball, and pizza,, the desserts are ridicules good . Our server was awesome but I can't remember he's name thanks

__d16JsxZ8xcOXHQX9HwcQ.text: I was a bit sceptical booking here, I thought it was a gimicky restaurant, just for the name. I was pleasantly surprised, the food is amazing. Portion size very reasonable. Service was very good. Food came out quick. Beautiful strip view if your lucky enough to get a window seat like us. A must try if you want Italian food in Vegas.

qSDWdm_jGtrCxQcuaOwysw.text: This was  very unexpectedly good! Good service and good food! Spaghetti and meatball was great and good amount. I always went to Allegro at Encore but I found a new love now! Great place to try especially with familyz

cJklJwW1Ch-HRob99aCeSA.text: This was probably some of the best authentic Italian I've ever had. The Chicken Rigatoni Ala Vodka pasta was phenomenal. I've been dreaming about it since I left Vegas! It's going to be a place we definitely visit again next time we come back! I love the fresh baked bread we got once we ordered and the Moscato de asi we ordered with ate dinner was also wonderful. Love this place! We had great service and a wonderful environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0IvgmdkkdshwqAUJFMcXCw.text: Wonderful food. Fun atmosphere. The Lasagna WAS amazing! We were here New Year's Eve and it was fully booked but we managed to get a table in the bar that overlooked the strip and it was as glamorous as most other restaurants for a fraction of the price and the food is non pretentious and delicious.

5q7AiK3RbxhfKU0sqLdDWw.text: Great food, great service. Enjoyed the bread & oil.  Strong drink menu.  Portions are good. White tablecloth place - though priced medium for the Vegas strip.  Hits that sweet spot, where a couple *can* dine for $60 + tax/ tip.    Based upon strong portions, I highly recommend splitting with your dining companion (easier to do on romantic getaway than conference with "the work guys!")  On our visit in Dec., 2016, we split: calamari (good flavor), meatballs (yessir!) and chicken piccata.  This latter option had the most absolutely delicious pasta i have EVER HAD.  So much so, that despite the $7 addition, I asked the waiter for an extra side.  Huge mistake: by the time the kitchen made it, my tummy was starting to bloat.  But this is Vegas baby, so we still visited the bakery counter across the way!  One observation: they are really strict/ serious about the Happy Hour ONLY in the bar. As i recall, they were equally adamant that we would have to "move tables" to the main dining area (4 feet away) to order off the regular menu.  We didn't fuss with it.  You've been warned : - )  Would return !

gSTI69gorNnAaiJc6dwliQ.text: After reading the positive reviews and liking the proximity to our room at the Venetian, I made a dinner reservation here.  We were a little late because we kept getting lost in the maze of the canal shops, but they accommodated us without any problems.  We were seated by the window in the bar area.  Nice view of the strip below, but it was so loud.  Music was already playing at a loud volume, and then it seemed as if they turned it up even more.  So no dinner conversation for us.  We only like to yell at each other when we're angry.    Lots of choices on the menu, and I almost got meatballs, but I decided to try something else.  The menu had a prix fixed dinner that included a starter, an entree, and a dessert.  So we went with that.  Our starters were the Panzanella salad, and we were served a warm piece of focaccia style bread.  The salad was different than we expected--it contained a lot of greens--but it was still very delicious with fresh buffalo mozzarella and excellent croutons.  My entree was the orecchiette with sausage.  It also contained broccolini and roasted tomatoes.  It was tasty and super satisfying.  My husband's entree was the steak pizzaiolo and it was served with a side of polenta.  It looked good, but my husband was not happy with it.  Difficult to get a steak cooked to his liking outside a steak house.  For dessert, we both chose cannoli.  Very pretty and extremely sweet.  Served with warm chocolate sauce--this part was pretty amazing!  I really enjoyed my food, but it's way too loud inside.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak pizzaiolo with polenta
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orecchiette with sausage

PL6zdg13I0DD5CdnsRC0VA.text: Not bad for on the Strip, but far from the best Italian you can get within the Strip, let alone the Venetian/Palazzo - where Buddy V's can be found.    It's in a great spot on the Strip with some killer views of Las Vegas Blvd.  At night though prepare to be blinded by video screens that are within close proximity of the restaurant.  As far as food goes...We went fairly straightforward with our dining choices.   Grilled Garlic Bread - We did this because you are not served complimentary bread,   Bucatini Carbonara - Probably the best thing we had to eat out of our 3 dishes.  Pretty good flavor and the pasta was al dente.   Chicken Marsala - This was just very meh.  Not much flavor going on, but at least they give you a decent sized portion.    Buddy V's fits a 3 star rating perfectly.  It's not the cheapest place, but it's also not the most expensive.  It's not the best, but it's not the worst.  As long as you know this going in, you will have a pleasant dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bucatini Carbonara
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Bread

eJZwONK2HVfM90tvkFRF5g.text: This might not only be my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas but just my favorite restaurant period. I have been here multiple times and have never been disappointed. We first came for dinner with a couple friends. We loved it so much we returned the next day for their Sunday brunch. It been a Vegas go to ever since. They also have a great happy hour! I suggest the lasagna or the mac n cheese carbonara. The Sunday brunch is a great spread and different from other brunches. Of coarse Carlos Bake Shop is just across the hall so definite plus for after meal sweets.

RgjMQP1vRL8r2z0iGEdK5Q.text: We loved our visit. Delicious food, decent prices and good service. Happy hour was great as well. The meatballs are to die for.

ILran46pIxqbuGCz-GUANA.text: Sat at the bar. The restaurant looks nice but I'm from Los Angeles and that doesn't really impress me. At the bar, the staff allowed a group of four men to be super loud at 4pm in spite of  everyone in the vicinity obviously enjoying a quiet early dinner late lunch.  The bartender working, my receipt says Matt v., burped during his introduction to me and my mother and did not say excuse me or acknowledge how disgusting it was. I wanted to order the mule but really just decided to not to minimize interacting with him. He seemed to be drinking on the job. His burp was not a small one it was one u would expect from a larger set Middle Aged white man and I think it's unacceptable.   He knew the loud group, they're all cis white straight men and when my mother and I sat down, two women of color,  the conversation became about trump and Obama thinking Kenya is a state and worst when they left he seemed to know them, personally.  It was just really distracting and took away from the experience, I know buddy v is loud and expressive but I think being loud and political is excessive and distracting especially while visiting during the holidays to relax. Unacceptable honestly. The calamari smelled fishy as well when it came out. More than we expected. I didn't try it but my mother expected it to be crispier. I still like buddy v and the show cake boss and I think this could be a great addition to the strip if staff realizes they're at work.

p7UbqiY8WcyTnbBA5g1HUg.text: This is a great Italian food place with great views from Palazzo that look onto the strip. Good place to take your date and score of points! Lol

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a great place for Italian food with great views from the Palazzo and Vegas strip. Desserts are worth the try.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VScyNkC6v4v0TGAJB_Mr2Q.text: This was the best of the best!!!! food was great, service was good, decent prices, it sucks because the itis kicked in and made me take a long nap after but it was worth it!

hPSbCWO1W_e1HOZMj8NV6g.text: Went for lunch the  Panzenella salad was a disappointment.  Not much flavour to the dressing and the bread was just a couple croutons.  On a positive note the Pizza crust was very tasty.  The cannoli was horrid would never order them again.

uGarLYq72q8268Q3KSWSjA.text: This one star review is not about the food, Its about the hostess attitude. When asked its been 20 min already she replied no barely 19min and turned. Instead of apologizing otherwise the food is great and our waiter was great. Its my third time here.

iXHLccBBnL6e9ne4D_LKow.text: Great food  All the food was fantasic and the employees were all outstanding.  Definaly check this place out.

EWY_VuSH-MAzoOhTcKpXCA.text: Was a little reluctant to go in for dinner since his specialty is cakes. I was pleasantly surprised. The scallops were amazing and so was the pasta. Topping off the great dinner and wine was the great service from our server

pMubtADSlB9kKO8zt8t9ew.text: This place is great for happy hour! Affordable food and drink prices.  The macaroni had a crispy bread crumb topping that was not my preference, but the macaroni itself was good.  The fried calamari was a pretty decent size and also cooked well.  We also ordered the octopus appetizer off the regular menu.  It was tender, but sitting in a little bit of a bland sauce and the octopus was a bit burnt on the outsides which made it difficult to eat.  The fresh foccacia bread which they make is yummy.  Very reasonable prices for what you get. Service wasn't the quickest, but they were also pretty busy.  We'll be back!

JDcnclU4sR734yJaa4PAAw.text: Excellent food. The carbonara is to die for. It almost taste like a rich macaroni and cheese. Ask for a side of the red sauce to thin down the rich crime sauce and then it becomes like a vodka sauce. So yummy!  Also the NY steak was even tasty even though my wife got it well done. Sit in the patio and people watch and then stare at the Carlo's bake shop so you don't over eat because of the anticipation of amazing deserts after dinner.

HgelBy3CsNjETmrqrsuEhg.text: Yum!!! It's insane how many restaurants there are in Vegas but my friends and I decided on this one because the menu looked good and it was in our hotel. The service was really good. Our waiter took the time to suggest us some appetizers and gave us his opinions on his favorite entrees and pastas. For appetizers, we got the fried calamari and a margherita pizza. The pizza was good and the calamari was really great. The calamari also had fried green peppers which was a little strange and I would have preferred those peppers to just have been more calamari but whatever. It also had really thin lemon slices that were somehow cooked to the point that they were crunchy and they tasted so good with the calamari.  For my meal I decided on the chicken and rigatoni a la vodka because I love pasta with vodka sauce and I don't have the chance to get it a lot. It did not disappoint at all. I loved the pieces of pancetta in it and the pasta was cooked perfectly. Sure it wasn't the healthiest dish (I definitely felt like I needed some vegetables after my meal) but it was delicious so I have no regrets. A couple of my friends got the sea bass and both loved it. Others got the chicken parm and carbonara and everyone enjoyed their dishes.  On to price, is it worth the price? Yes, the food was good, but $24 still is a lot for a pasta dish with sauce and chicken. If it wasn't on the Strip, I would say the prices were ridiculous. However, I think this is one of the more reasonably priced restaurants considering some of the other restaurants nearby. Its good for groups of friends or for families, and I'd definitely recommend it.

KPMwzCoL_PwiLlYSnEp01A.text: Can't for the life in me figure out how this place has eeked out 4 stars. I give it 1.   Ate here for lunch. Very limited menu at lunch. We ordered the carbonara bucatini for $23 a plate. Next to no sauce and only a few chunks of pancetta. Had to flag down the waiter and order more sauce. "Garlic" bread appetizer came as 3 slices of dried out cheese bread with I swear not an ounce of garlic taste to it. The next table to us ordered garlic bread also and got 4 slices; not that I WANTED more but really.....  Place looks nice and clean however.

wI7KnsMqOi4v-SGJr9v-UQ.text: Excellent service!  Food was incredible.  Location is super convenient. I had spaghetti & meatballs & hubby had meatball sandwich w parmesan fries. Everything was superb.  Highly recommend if you are in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball sandwich w parmesan french fries
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tlnu16vKvj_yplcqgeyr5g.text: Let me start off by saying that the food was amazing! And the portion sizes are crazy.  I went here with a group for a friends birthday and she absolutely loved the place. We were all pleasantly suprised with the food. The reason I gave this place only four stars is because of the service. The staff there were really nice but at times were too attentive (refilling the water after a simple sip...wait till my cup is at least half gone). All in all though I loved the place and so did all of my friends. We will definately be going back there next time we are in Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lasagna!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Pasta!

8SEzd8gnKSAt4vmLopNBqw.text: Excellent service!!! Came here for lunch on Labor Day. There was no wait to be seated which was great.  The Food is soooo good !!!!!! We ordered the  Aunt Nina's mozzarella en carozza for an antipasto. Let me tell you that is a definite order again next time we go back. My husband ordered the Lisa  V's linguine & white clam sauce and I ordered the chicken parm. The servings are big that I could not even finish one of the pieces of chicken parm after the app. and of course saving room for the lobster tail for dessert that we shared between the both us because it is huge. It is bigger than the ones you get at the bakery across the from restaurant.   Everything we had was soooo good and can't wait until we go back in the future to try something different on the menu but this time it will be for dinner to have a bigger selection to choose from than the lunch menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail with fresh fruit on the side $15 soooo good!!!!

0YeiGFNbHY6XkBkS289SXQ.text: The staff has their job down to a science and that makes for a very smooth flowing dinner; never had to wait for anything.  Meatball app was good- perhaps too much for two people.  Chick parm was decent- not used to baked chick parm. Substituted spaghetti for rigatoni w/ meat sauce. Good flavor.

KZCFpHn94uNsC1pUaR9aDA.text: My first Buddy V's experience was truly amazing! It was Sunday Brunch so I was expecting the typical all you can eat eggs and bacon. There was nothing typical about the fabulous offerings.   First the all you can drink package included way more variety than what you usually get at a "champagne brunch". The options included certain wine, beer, bloody marys, mimosas, sangria AND bellinis. We ended up trying almost everything and I can't say a bad word about any of it. The fruit was so fresh and delicious in the sangria and the red wine and champagne were top quality.    The service was prompt and the waiters and bussers were extremely attentive. Our glasses were never empty, our table was never dirty. The staff was also helpful in making sure we knew where everything was and offered suggestions on the food and drinks.   Speaking of food... The first thing I noticed was that the food was put out in small batches to keep everything fresh. You could really taste the freshness. The Italian offerings were obviously great and I couldn't believe the antipasto area. Everything was so delicious from the fresh, perfectly cooked shrimp to the very flavorful meatballs. I barely left room for dessert. I was able to take one little bite of most things and well... there are no words!  I can't wait to go back

Xi7OrRVF_ur4kycxZ9zg7g.text: Stopped in for a couple appetizers. Loved his famous meatballs - not to heavy - lots of flavor! We were offered a pitcher of sangria, drank the whole delicious thing! They then offered to clean and box the pitcher as a souvenir! Nice!! Their Birthday cake was a wonderful way to top off a great appetizer snack! Worth every penny! Go - enjoy!

fc0sgUVei-EKnIXSxuc_Cg.text: Went to dinner at Buddy V's last night for a friend's birthday dinner. I had been there before, she had not but i raved about it.   We had a 7:30 reservation and showed up a few minutes early. We were seated right away which is always nice. We had a great table with a view of the open kitchen.   Our server came over to bring our drinks but it seemed to take him a rather long time. This would be indicative of the rest of the meal.  As we watched our server he seemed to have tables all over the restaurant so every thing we asked for took a long time.   Come to find out the server did have a servers assistant but it would have been nice if he introduced this gentleman to us so we knew who to ask for what.   The food was good but I would not go back again any time soon.

KYR84_dr_l-DvZ4Bj8rynw.text: No complaints about this place. Everything we had was quite good. We came here on a weekday afternoon and it was pretty empty. My husband had the Philly cheesesteak and i had the lasagna. The decor was very nice and the waitstaff was helpful. Nothing was overly amazing...simply good food in a very nice place. I'd go again.

8gTRnAh9J8JRLV2-5z1KdA.text: Buddy V's was fantastic!  We had the meatballs, grilled octopus, salami and cheese plate, osso buco, veal parm chop and the "lobster" for dessert.  Great service, no wait with reservations!  Will return!  We live in Vegas and some strip restaurants are over rated.  However I do recommend Buddy's!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;lobster&#34; dessert....amazing!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge Portions!

7ajyBmlpLR6ZALYzGZNoMQ.text: I like the food here. Definitely a go-to spot when guests are visiting and need a family friendly spot for dinner where we can just meet them on the strip. The only thing is that they need new bust boys or more training. My first visit, they just weren't up to par esp on refilling the water. I don't remember too much on the last visit what my complaints were. It just wasn't good.   Although tonight, it was crappy. My son was eating the cracker sticks and we placed the opened packet on top of the plates. The guy comes to pass out the plates but dumps the cracker onto the table. Literally took the plate and dumped it. Hello...my son was eating that and what kind of table manner/service is that.   Then they came around with oil. He left and then a few minutes later came with bread. Our waitress finally asked if we wanted balsamic vinegar with it. I said yes, of course. I never had bread with just the oil! I guess the guys did that to the same table as well.   Our waitress was good it's just the bust boys. They're not what I expect for a restaurant like that.

mDQpU9__hw0p_p9WxR3fRw.text: This is an outstanding brunch , everything was fresh, and appealing. Good coffee.  The best dessert table.  There was also a children's table which was nice.  Worth every dollar we paid. There were 3 of us and we all agreed. We compared it to Bellagio, and Wynn and Buddy V's took first place in our review.

A4Wg1hamubKa0OHRbJuhVw.text: Nothing to write home about. The food was good, but the service was a bit odd. Maybe it was because we were seated in the bar area and it was just a server "free for all" but we had probably three or four different people helping us. You would think "hey, awesome! You must have been really taken care of!" But no, we found ourselves repeating orders or answering the same question to several different people which became annoying. Prices were Vegas high, which is no surprise. So yeah, just a "meh" experience!

8P_gb3_gKQ8vnXGuqgK0OA.text: Came in with group of seven. Said 40 minute wait and was seated around 20 mins (so early).  Took a awhile to order food. And they were out of pizza at 8:30p (so I take it they are frozen)....  So not a good start to the night.

KqysxQ5qs63oPG07t-aQLA.text: Excellent quick service with delicious food! Everything was cooked perfectly from soup to ente We had a wonderful time in a pleasent atmosphere with an attentive waitress!

BW69GuD__ciyAf647s5GbQ.text: I used to watch Cake Boss. While I haven't seen an episode in recent times, I recall not only being amazed by Buddy Valastro's cake designs, but wishing I could try some of those hearty Italian meals that he and his family would cook up as well. I finally had my chance to try both the sweet and savory while my husband and I vacationed in Las Vegas.   Buddy V's restaurant and Carlo's Bakery are right across the way from each other inside The Venetian. The line for the bakery was a mile long, so we opted to have lunch and enjoy one of the desserts in the restaurant instead. I loved the feel of the place. It was cozy and warm with large windows to view the gorgeous strip.   They serve warm focaccia bread with olive oil to start. It was so light and fluffy... We both asked for a second piece even though we promised each other we would save room for that dessert! They offer a prix fix lunch special for $22, which is what my husband ordered. You can choose from a few slightly smaller portions of appetizers or salads, entrees or pastas, and desserts. He went with the meatballs, chicken parmesan, and cannoli. I had the whole wheat penne primavera, which included all sorts of tasty grilled veggies. My husband split his cannoli with me... I really didn't give him a choice. :p It was stuffed with sweet ricotta and dipped in chocolate chips and pistachio. Not to diss my hometown of St. Louis, known for its Italian foods and restaurants, but this was the absolute best cannoli I've ever had in my life!   My husband and I both left Buddy V's completely satisfied and determined that we would definitely return on our next trip. Thankfully, we visit Vegas often, so I shouldn't have to wait too long for another cannoli!

Xxw9I9W3ONC3ZsFd22S15g.text: great meal, and great service.  authentic Italian food. go and enjoy the wonderful dishes, and grab a canoli for dessert

zotb3oMzNPyw7VJnmlThBQ.text: We had a great time at Buddy V's for dinner! The wait on a Saturday night was a little long (45 min when we came at 8:30 pm), but we were able to get a seat by the window which we requested.   We ordered the lasagna and grilled salmon. The lasagna is huge and big enough for 2 to share. The salmon lies on a bed of salad and was light and enjoyable.   We also tried the specialty cocktail with the lemon sorbet and it was delicious!   The view of the strip is a great addition to the food. Service was perfect. Would love to come back to try other menu items!

mGfYJdF4qehzz89Lz4vo7Q.text: Hands down the best Italian food I've ever had! Makes me curious about the bakery now, the lasagna is a must have.

LHJmNypIy6OcOChrYN_Kzw.text: We were SO happy with our meals. There were 8 of us and we all walked away raving. The service is fantastic. The food is amazing. I had a plate of the best spaghetti pomodoro i've ever had--that sauce was unreal. We're from NJ and NY so good italian food is what we are used to but we were really, really impressed here. Its casual too which is great and convenient. No white tablecloth. The portions were perfect. I hate when you get a huge overwhelming plate of pasta and you can't finish it or you overeat. Take my advice and get the warm chocolate cake filled with nutella served with salted caramel ice cream for dessert. It was out of this world!

AZMyY-Q8FN-JBQ45axVMAg.text: Excellent service,  delicious food and live music for dinner (specific evenings)!  The best chicken picatta I've ever had and the desserts are divine.   The creme Brule is unlike any other.   The Nutella cake with the star of the plate. ..salted caramel ice cream.  The mac and cheese is also very unique with crunchy topping and decadent smokey flavor.
