Eaa6SO0tXBeFwnbFWaF0gw.text: Had my second visit to this place this past weekend and I'm glad I made the choice to have dinner here on our last night in Vegas.   The service was amazing. Everyone who came by the table was nice and friendly; there was a lot of personality and charm in the staff which made our time here fun! They were very attentive without being overbearing.   Everyone loved their food. The chicken parm was a crowd favorite and I finished my shrimp scampi even though the button on my pants was about to pop off.   Although I don't come to Vegas often because it's not my thing, I would come back here because I know the food and service will be memorable.

eFqv1IRdFPsZhv57rAFugA.text: We came here for dinner on a Sunday without a reservation; they were busy but we only waited for about 20 mins. Our waiter brought us the drinks and dinner menu and took our orders right away. I ordered the creamy tomato chicken pasta (forgot the exact name), my hubby ordered a meat source pasta and we ordered a Mac and cheese for our toodler. Before the meal, they gave us a piece of freshly baked bread to start with. Our meals came fast and it looked and tasted very good. We finished everything fast. Our waiter was very attentive and the restaurant was nice with live music.   oyster bar at harrah's, this restaurant only charged me 9 dollars for the kid meal with a much better service and food. And you charged us 11 bucks for a plain white rice and a piece of dry chicken breast.

m4F_QZnJD3KIiAXad6QRTQ.text: Dont overlook this as a celebrity chef-outrageous hotel hyped prices. The service was alright but the food is really good, with prices reasonable! I split the orrechiate and the portions were large despite splitting it. The pasta was some of the best Ive had and the side fries were really good too. Overall, I paid $25 for dinner which is not bad at all for Vegas dinner prices.

OzonvYzfzEGoWrpMv5TFIw.text: AMAZING!  Went for Mother's Day brunch.  Every bite of everything was delish!  I even loved the sauce and meatballs and I don't eat those out EVER!  I'm Italian!  The food and desserts were to die for.  Service was excellent.  If you are in Vegas you NEED to go there!

FrgYK7pUCJDNY11Bz5psAA.text: Great if you like pasta and Italian food.   I think this would be a great fine dining experience if you like cheese and carbs.  I would have given this place 5 stars when I was a teenager. So take your kids here and buy them a cupcake at Carlos after.

WLeZWpVLbC9r_YjKufr67Q.text: Dinner was delicious!  Our waiter Peter J was exceptional!  Everything he recommended was fantastic.  From the cocktails to the entrees!  I will definitely come back again the next time we are in Las Vegas!

YfwaMg-_OGq5Ooh3tB4lzA.text: One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas!  Excellent happy hour, large amount of seating, welcoming environment and totally tasty! This joint is delish, the hubs and I have been twice and I highly recommend it. Service is great, cocktails are fabulous and food is fantastic. The price is a little high for my usual, but is on point for a quality spot in this city!  The service is also great, the bartender to the hostess are all friendly and on top of it. Our recent experience even had a fab server (Christine?) who said she constantly checks the yelp reviews to ensure quality experiences! She also recommended the creme brulee, but we were so stuffed from garlic bread and pasta that there was simply no room. But, I might have to give it a try next time!  They also have a fantastic happy hour, and supposedly a great brunch. I say yes!

ml5U3nejl317rya29xVoxQ.text: Service is a little slow but the food is pretty good for the price; Bolognese was our favorite!

JpRvT9me8OdhUhlBmn2fPA.text: Since we were in Las Vegas to celebrate my husband's birthday I was in search for a great Italian restaurant, either on The Strip or not far from it. Most of the Italian restaurants we've picked thus far have been quite good.  Buddy V's received great reviews from various sites so we made reservations there and gave it a try.  It exceeded our expectations!  First timers or those not familiar with the location of restaurants in the Grand Canal Shoppes should allow time to navigate.  Buddy V's can be a bit hard to find but worth the search!  Upon entering the restaurant we found the ambiance handsome and comfortable...neither too elegant or casual.  Views of The Strip were an added bonus.   The staff was courteous and efficient.  Being Italian food aficionados, we look for entrees that'd are a flavor-packed indulgence when dining out. We asked to split the Caesar Salad, which was kindly plated on two plates, and very good.  The fresh warm cubes of polenta in place of regular croutons were a tasty option.   The warm bread that came with our meal was also very good. I ordered "My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara" and my husband ordered "Valastro Sunday Gravy" which includes meatballs, sausage, lamb, pork and a bowl of rigatoni in a delicious red sauce.  Both pasta dishes fulfilled our culinary wishes -- generous portions that were delicious!  (reasonably priced for on the Las Vegas Strip)  One of the reviews I read suggested letting them know if it's your birthday, which we did, and were treated with a delicious dessert with "Happy Birthday" drizzled on the plate.  Our meal was excellent from start to finish!

pF8B5H0XWBvzKmtuhfneug.text: Found this place on Yelp. So we went with all the great reviews. There were 4 of us and we all enjoyed everything we ordered! HUGE portions....no room for dessert at the end :(  !!!!! Oh well, next time start with dessert and then go backwards!  The server was very kind person! The rest of the staff that we dealt with were very friendly! I would recommend this place highly. Remember...share a plate that way you can order dessert!!!

hTAkBiEmK-jFLbHcVqbP8w.text: As I am a big fan of Cake Boss, I was looking forward to dinner at Buddy V's Ristorante. This is a family restaurant in Venetian. So  I gave it a try.  I ordered Margarita pizza, Cesar Salad and Garlic bread. The pizza was not good for me. It was not what I expected from Italian pizza and was expensive for its size. The Cesar Salad was not bad though. It was with warm, chewy croutons, with a hint of fennel in the salad and plenty of freshly grated Parmesan cheese. The garlic bread was not bad either.   Overall, not bad, but there are a lot of better restaurants in the town with this price range.

9KTk5r0Kr090dOtBZvMMwA.text: Popped on in on a Tuesday for lunch while walking the strip. Service was quick, the servers were happy to be there and very friendly. There is a variety of food and drinks to choose from. The calamari was good sized and delicious! I went with a party of 4. The main courses ordered came out timely and hot!  It was slightly on the pricey side though I'll not complain as the experience there was well worth it!

CpBv92cFKxuukD-15kCptw.text: In LV for business and this was my attempt at branching out for dinner. The service was very good and we didn't wait for anything; drinks, bread, appetizers, refills. I ordered the calamari and it was ok. A bit too salty for my taste, but my dinner partner liked it well enough. He ordered the caprese salad and loved it. My other dinner partner ordered the meatballs and was gaga over them. I don't eat meat, so I couldn't taste it.  The wine choices were varied. We all got something we liked. Dinner was phenomenal. I had the shrimp scampi and I was bowled over. Crisp, flavorful, tasty pasta and 5 nice sized shrimps. I had plenty for breakfast the next day.    Two of us ordered dessert. I had tiramisu and he had Nutella cake. I thought he'd lick the plate. I wasn't in love with the tiramisu, but the mason jar presentation was cute.  If you like pasta, give this place a go!  Side note: The live music was wonderful! The waiter kept pushing wine refills on my dinner partner after he says no more, emphatically.

mrGV34-LnnLrybbHReLT0A.text: Holy cow, this was the best experience yet! We always go to Buddy V's for lunch when in Vegas. Delicious food, great ambiance and made to order.   Joy was our server and she's quite an amazing bartender too! Joy's upbeat and positive energy rubbed off as soon as we were seated. She was very attentive, and had excellent customer service skills. She recommended we try her espresso martini to compliment our dessert plate. WOW. BEST MARTINI I've ever had!!! Ask for Joy!  Jose was also kind and attentive. He took photos of us and made sure we were comfortable.   We gave Joy high accolades to one of the managers (Sean?), sadly he didn't seem interested in hearing our feedback and left the table right away. His attitude was less than impressive.   Thank you Joy and Jose! Thank you to the chefs and kitchen staff for a wonderful meal!

T2qbUPDcRfEiQWChhrNwew.text: Place was phenomenal, We even saw Buddy walking around with his wife, such a great experience. We went for the Brunch Buffet, I really cant find anything that I didn't like, all around a great package meal, plus we did the bottomless Drinks, from Mimosas to Bellinis and great beer. Awesome views and the service was excellent. Emily the Bartender/Server was on point, we broke two glasses and no one made a fit or said anything, they only care about your satisfaction. Ill most definitely be back for any meal on my next Vegas visit.

2V940i4THPK0nRl5WSv6IA.text: I've been a fan of the show cake boss four years, so I just had to go to buddy's restaurant  in Vegas! And it did not disappointe, food wss fantastic, great staff and  wonderful at Atmosphere!

QgtpFTlW0FUlwSYMzMJUqA.text: I'm a cake boss fan and I keep it real! I have visit the Hoboken bakery, New York, and now Vegas! In my honest opinion majority of the desserts are very good but price wise they are overpriced! I remember going the first time and spending over $50 on a couple treats! Now let's talk about the brunch! It is totally worth $34.95! ALL YOU CAN EAT for a reasonable price! I rather go eat for brunch than spend that money on a few desserts! Think about it! You can eat as many tiramisu, red velvet cake and so on for one price! Not to mention the delicious grandma meatballs, mac and cheese, chicken, french toast, Italian sausage, and so much more!! The service is a PLUS everyone was awesome and I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas!

iYSKe6dy29yU7VKR4qhnsQ.text: Brought my family in for my birthday dinner this past Sunday night. Great experience from service to food! The hostess was very friendly, our server was very educated on the menu items, the manager (Sean) stopped at our table and asked how everything was. All in all, we felt very well taken care of. My wife is also in the restaurant industry and she could tell that the managers pay very close attention to up keeping the service standards. Highly recommended for special occasions or just a great dinner out with the family!

zWc2RlTqw9SkfFDSyoGeyg.text: Here for a quick lunch and I swear I wish...and I might come back for more. I had the lasagna and it was hands down the best I have ever had.

-b1CWbJKMtZ0gA4Re-NpPQ.text: This review is for their Spring 2014 Restaurant Week Menu.  Can I tell you how much I enjoy this place? I don't watch "Cake Boss," but I'm a fan of Buddy V's Ristorante. Its setting: rustic and contemporary with a homey ambiance that's reflected in its decor. The tall windows open up the space, providing view of Las Vegas Boulevard below. All right, enough of the interior design, on to the food!  Appetizer - Caesar Salad with Polenta Croutons, Parmesan, and Eggless Garlic Dressing: During Restaurant Week, I ate my share of Caesar salads from one restaurant to the next, and this one was the best because of the polenta croutons that were crunchy and soft at the same time. I wish I could eat this salad every day.   Main Course - My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara with Pancetta, Cracked Black Pepper, and Egg: One word: Divine. Ok, maybe a few more descriptive terms like creamy, pleasing to the palate. I would lick the entire bowl if no one was looking.   Dessert - Cannoli: Good, but not the best that I've had. It definitely packs a crunch and isn't too sweet as is, but there's always the option to sweeten it up further by dipping it into the chocolate sauce that it's paired with.   Not on the Restaurant Week Menu.   Appetizer - Garlic Bread: Topped with melted fontina and mozzarella cheeses. Makes a good, tasty starter.   Dessert - Lobster Tail: Filled with buttercream and garnished with fresh berries. Pretty yum, though difficult to cut into.   Service - Staff members were always aware of our table, never missing a beat.  Overall - This has quickly become a new Strip favorite of mine, and I'm already looking forward to my next meal here.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0V11k1UkpPUWH8Gcw0HZVA.text: Went here last week with my girls and was blown away literally! They had a cute lil jazz band which was a unexpected surprise. They played right up until we got our main course so it was perfect timing. We split the caesar salad 3 ways and it was enough since we had the hot delicious focaccia bread with it. This is the best caesar salad I've ever had because of the warm polenta bites instead of croutons! Who knew a caesar salad could be exciting to eat?? I got the chicken rigatoni alla vodka sauce...OMG! sooo much flavor. I was full but kept eating it because it was soo good! Definitely have to come back to try the other dishes. One of the girls got the scallops which looked beautiful but wasn't too filling. The other one got the carbonara which she loved. The ambiance was perfect. Didnt have a long wait. Definitely a 5 star experience!

WqWGeGhdPCP_E_nZUbIPdg.text: Best chicken parm I've ever had! Really good, comforting Italian food! Scallops were amazing, vodka sauce was amazing.  Really good food!

UPsxIZkRCt8Bj-e5alnkmw.text: The best meatballs I have ever had. Food was good and the service was excellent. The portion sizes are great and the prices a very good for being on the strip. I come here every time.

GQJOf5qkA8aXw7Kgd6EK0Q.text: Food and service here is great! Lunch prices are pretty decent and portions are more than enough for one person. Our server recommended some of their best dishes for our group and they were all delicious! The buddy pizza, lazagna, mozzarella appetizer, chicken BLT sandwich, YUM! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer

TUj4DtApQwlwY_WhFCfDMA.text: Solid Italian food.  I had the lasagne which was delicious. My wife the chicken picatta.  She loved the pasta but thought the chicken was just ok.  They only give you one piece of bread at a time, would be nice to have a basket of bread on the table instead of having to ask everytime you ate the one piece they served you.   Ordered the meatballs for an appetizer, they were very good.  Overall a nice meal at a decent price.

U9KjXR1_K6LbU5GQRnHAJw.text: Finally made it to my 200th review!!  I decided to use this special spot for a review on one of the best plates of spaghetti I've ever had, EVER! Hubby and I had been excited to visit Buddy V's since the construction announcement. We are big fans of Buddy's so we were curious to see what his restaurant would have to offer.   This restaurant is located in the Grand Canal Shops. I'll give you a shortcut - if you enter from the side Walgreens is on, just go upstairs and you'll see the signage. Go in through the glass doors for the shops area and you're there. No need to go through the entire casino. His bakery is right across the hall.   Hubby and I decided beforehand that we were going to split the Chicken Parmesan and split a Lobster Tail for dessert. We got a great seat over by the window in the main dining area. The entire restaurant is decorated really cute, and I loved the family photos. Service was attentive but only by our waiter's helper - our waiter took our order then went missing until time for the check. The assistant was great, he deserved all of the tip but I doubt it ended up that way.   Chicken Parmesan was huge, definitely big enough to share. We each got a chicken breast and a large portion of spaghetti so I'm glad we split it. The spaghetti sauce was amazing, I'm still dreaming about it. Noodles were cooked perfectly. Chicken was cooked nicely, no complaints about the meal at all. Our Lobster Tail was a little hard though, like it was either over cooked or a few days old. Not flakey in a good way, more like shards of hard bread. And the pastry cream tasted like whipped cream, not what I was expecting for the price. We'll definitely be back but only for the Chicken Parm. Might try a different dessert next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light fixture in the main dining area.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family photos, love it!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute rolling pin details.

0VxzXxMKEYrwZJfX6Xsw6g.text: This review is only for my pre-shopping Sunday drink experience :) I was just about to order a mimosa and the bartender was pouring what looked like a fresh pink-ish juice of some sort then topping with champagne. I asked what it was and she told me white peach juice. I had her make me a drink with the juice and it was delicious. She was very generous with the champagne and I really appreciated that. I hate paying for a drink of mostly juice. My mom and I had a couple of them and took off to do some shopping.   I'd love to return to eat the brunch buffet because it looked delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White peach mimosas

hYFxAUvGMC7YMJJZlnP7Dw.text: Asked for side salad with dressing on the side. Got a side salad with dressing mixed in.  Ordered a meatball sub, the bread was so stale that I wasn't able to bite through it. I told the waitress she gave me a sad look but didn't respond, didn't offer to replace or partial refund.  Disappointing.  Atmosphere was decent thats why this place gets 2/5 stars.

xpPJvh5Ippr42zfailYuoQ.text: I was a little worried about dining at Buddy's since he's know for his pastries, but my experience was superb.  My friends treated me to Buddy V's for my birthday. We went in on a Sunday around 5pm with no wait.  We ordered from the prix fixe menu which I believe was $39 for three courses, and we also order the highly recommended lasagna. We ordered meatballs and Caesar salad our starters, chicken parm for our main and ended with Lisa's Nutella cake for dessert. We were also given complementary bread.  In one word, go! Everything was unbelievably amazing. Even the croutons on the salad, which are made to order with a crunchy exterior and warm, soft interior. I always seem to go to Italian restaurants for my birthday, and this is by far the best that I've been to. It's a little pricey, but so worth it.

ikjeTsowtBWi8WEvlTK05g.text: Great Italian restaurant in a sea of Italian restaurants at the blue canal shoppes. My wife had the half chicken and she very much enjoyed it. I was craving spaghetti and meatballs and I really enjoyed my meal. I will admit we did get two very basic dishes but I've been to a lot of places where they mess up meatballs and this place did it right. We also got calamari for an appetizer and as a connoisseur of calamari I can tell u that Buddy Vs is top notch they have a very good sauce they serve it with. Now the best part. The bread. Their bread might be the best bread I've ever had at an Italian restaurant. My issue was that they didn't give enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The calamari and bread

3T4UM4QUxckYk7paQgNICQ.text: I had a surprisingly solid lunch here the other day. First of all, the view is a big selling point., overlooking the strip. They have lunch specials and they are relatively reasonable in price for a restaurant on the strip.   I ordered the Italian hero with Caesar salad and my friend ordered the meatball appetizer. The sandwich was really good. Perfectly cooked bread, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The meat was flavorful and had a nice kick. The tomato tapenade added a nice spiciness as well. I tried some of my friend's meatballs and they were great. Moist and well-seasoned. Some of the better meatballs I've tried in town.    We couldn't stop by without trying some dessert, so we gave in and ordered a tiramisu as well as a Nutella cake with salted caramel gelato. The tiramisu was enormous, large enough for four people to share. The Nutella cake was not overly chocolatey and wonderfully paired with the caramel gelato. I'm not typically a fan of Nutella or cake but this was the perfect combination.   They are opening a Carlo's Bakery across from Buddy V's, which will be a great addition to accompany this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella cake
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VXlB9zf7Fp1Fm3R0Mzg-tQ.text: Fabulous brunch served on the weekend. We enjoyed all the morning favorites along with wonderful Italian food and that dessert bar is to die for.

sWFR1j3YosjtvH3HNnoFmw.text: Can we talk about that chicken parm?! Can we talk about it?! G'DAMN!  This was the best chicken parm I've EVER had. Period. I wanna book a flight back to Vegas rynah just to have that dish one more time. They give you two huge chicken breasts covered in sauce and cheese along with perfectly proportioned pasta coated in just the right amount of marinara. I am drooling just reminiscing.   Take me back, please! Someone take me back!  If you're gonna eat anything in Vegas, eat that. Do it for yourself, but more so... for me. Cause I miss that parm, man.

iGDcpZiH7QJD17M93-UnUA.text: I wasn't too impressed. But to be honest, I didn't expect to be either. While I had my moment watching Buddy master cakes on the Cake Boss, to attach his name to a restaurant wasn't as exciting as say, having a bakery with his name on it.  I will say the meal started strong with the meatball appetizer. You get large meatballs in sauce and both were very good. So it set the standard high.  One of my favorite items at Italian restaurants is the pasta vodka. While it was good, it wasn't great by any means. Just okay. I did appreciate the al dente noodles though.   But the most surprising thing was the desserts. I get it, you want to include some family favorites like cannoli's, but still. No cake? What about featuring mini cakes that are decorated? Just something to play off the show. I just expected more than just three plain jane choices of sweets.   I'll admit I sought it out, having the name attached and being new, but I wouldn't urge anyone else to visit this spot while in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Vodka

UssJGU57N33KHCowQ9ERfg.text: our waiter was fine.  very polite and attentive.  that was the best part of the meal!!!   that's sad!  so disappointed in the food here!  absolutely horrible lasagna.  might be the worst i've ever had (maybe chef boyardee is worse - MAYBE!!!)  do not go here to eat.  so many better places in LV!    absolutely bland and boring food.  calamari was just meh.  the meatballs were ok but kind of bland.  DO NOT EAT HERE! cannot stress that enough.  unless you want to overpay for bad food.   VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!

eaTrOJ6GewXmDv2gAZo_wg.text: I came in the restaurant at 3pm on Sunday. Maybe it's because of the odd hour, they are obviously short-staffed. It took them almost 10 minutes before I was greeted by a waiter and served with water. However, service aside, their food was good. I ordered Madeline's whole wheat penne, and their pesto is one of the best I have ever had, but I do think they are a bit over-priced (not by much). In general, I will rate their food 5 star, price 3 star, and service 3 star.

UXFK6RXpNyHGswdk-ZaDvA.text: We stumbled in here on a Saturday and had brunch. It was amazing!! Good selection of food and everything I tasted was outstanding!! It was also an incredible value. We definitely got our money's worth and will totally be back the next time we're in Vegas!! Highly recommend having brunch here!! Also, the service was impeccable!!

loVWVyo1P3n2cK8xGxA9MQ.text: I was craving Italian food and stumbled upon this place when walking around in The Venetian.  This is Buddy Valastro's (celebrity chef from Cake Boss) restaurant, so I figured it has to be good and it did live up to my expectations.  I ordered the Chicken parmesan and spaghetti. It's oven-baked, provolone, and mozzarella.  It was crispy and with the perfect amount of cheese.  The spaghetti was with marinara sauce-$22               My wife ordered Lasagna Al Forno, which apparently is what they're known for.  The lasagna contains italian sausage, beef, pork ricotta and baked cheese on top. My wife was a fan.  It was $22.  The portion was big enough to share, which we should have done, since we had food coma shortly after. The customer service was great and our server was attentive.  I just think the food is pricey for Italian food and it didn't even contain any seafood, but then again anytime you have a celebrity chef attached to the restaurant's name then expect to pay more, so excuse my rant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan and spaghetti
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nona&#39;s lasagna al forno
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area

TGPsZssGAS3Vkcd1lP8K9g.text: UPDATE:   Last night in Las Vegas, for this trip. It was uncertain room service, Table Ten or????? Well I went back to Buddy's. Sat at the bad this time. Again the service (Danny) was stellar, the food was delicious and again, I ate too much and had no room for dessert. Gonna miss this place!   Staying at the Palazzo we saw a show about the owner, his love for desserts. We checked it and thankful that we did. The restaurants pretty spacious but not a whole lot of tables yet we were able to get a reservation for two. Service was top-notch full bar there's enough there to please everybody. We ate so much from bread, salad to entree that it's a shame we didn't save room for desserts. What were we thinking! I feel like we got robbed by our own decision to eat it all because it was so good.   Guess it means we have to go back! Great wine selection too!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti sauce should be bottled and sold - we want more!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold, crisp Caesar salad at its best
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bread ever!

xI5ah_6Q-K73ph77ZPmycw.text: Amazing. My kids loved and they were great with helping my mother in law order something gluten free.

MRTzY5IldGA2RjQv87oQnw.text: Wow, just wow! We went here for brunch. The servers were friendly. The view was amazing. All of the food items were freshly prepared in small batches. I highly recommend them for a fantastic brunch!!!

6J30Zh-iulr7KMuoaohWzw.text: Food is really good! Chicken parm was done deliciously. Server was a tad slow and slightly standoffish. But the service itself was quick! Took 10 mins from ordering to get our food ! Would recommend

VxMAIvve4rLF37MEgdecPw.text: Best service I have ever had. The food was tasty, but the service was out of this world. Our waitress was quick and courteous and the busser, Carlos was out of this world.  Super speedy with the refills pleasant and friendly. Even took a photo with our boys. Everyone should stop for dinner when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zach, Carlos &amp; Drew

fn_xPnvL3sGshqXBOvOCag.text: I love Buddy V. It's authentic, friendly service and the views are very nice. On the weekends they have a brunch for $35 which is highly recommended since it's a buffet style and you are able to sample out many dishes, my faves are chicken parmigiana and the meatballs. The desserts are to die for as well. Great decor and great presentation

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bv0YjM-QOt0C2nncGO6gGQ.text: 20 minutes into dinner and still no bread... it is in the oven, we have been told repeatedly.... food is okay...

-iEQ8-9u0BfsJNtFBLITKQ.text: The food was good and our server Valerie was so helpful and took a good care of us. The only thing is that they haven't updated their happy hour hours on yelp so we were a little bit late for happy hour. But anyways food was tasting very good and we were happy.

6PmNFEqfhC9rWqIKKlpcRw.text: We were in Vegas for a wedding and stopped in here for dinner after the wedding rehearsal. There was 12 of us and we did not make ressies. However they were able to sit two tables of six next to each other which was nice.  We all ordered drinks and food and the time was pretty good. The drinks were a bit slow but that's probs a good thing because it slowed down my dranking pace. There were  two servers helping us, one for each table and they asked that we all order at the same time. We all got our foods which was delicious. I felt that the serving sizes for the prices were a bit off. $12 for a side salad seemed a bit high, even for Vegas. The server at my table did a good job upselling a bunch of items, like shrimp with the scallops and scallops with the steak but she did not mention that there would be a price increase or the amount. Which is fine, we were hungry but a courtesy would have been nice.  They also brought out a birthday cake for the group in honor of the new couple. That was a very nice touch.  Overall this place was pretty good Italian. It is also across from Buddy's Baker which was genius. I got dessert at the restaurant and also at the baker across the street. I regret nothing.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops with shrimp
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champs and miller lite
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champs

Rmlk90T9XoomDsH4GqloVw.text: Definitely a sweeter sauce, pasta was cooked aldente, meatballs were good but standard with oregano flavor and the texture. The eggplant was cooked well and the bread and drinks were kept flowing. Overall a good italian restaurant, especially since you can finish with an amazing cannoli and lavazza coffee at Carlos bakery, then walk around the Venetian. The staff was great and very attentive, the prices were reasonable $24 for spaghetti plus extra for meatballs, $13 for eggplant appetizer. Still two of us split and we were full!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cqxDPQHHKu_XO7jjVgBFrw.text: Went specifically for the creekstone farms burger. It was a decent burger. It didn't amaze me neither did it disappoint. Cooked medium like I requested and it was juicy with some nice greasiness. I appreciated the grilled brioche bun and the nice melty cheese. Their tomato aioli (cough mayo) added very little. The burger could prolly use a stronger compliment to the meat and cheese. The Parmesan dusted fries paired well with the burger. Overall I was pretty happy with it. Also happy with as many restaurants using creekstone farms as possible.

KimjqmxQS4JAtUGi-xJt7A.text: Unfortunately I was not impressed by the food. I was really hoping to enjoy it. We went for lunch and I ordered spaghetti and meatballs. It tasted like it was frozen and then warmed up. With the caliber and recognition of the name behind the establishment, I expected better quality food. We missed the brunch and that sounded great. I'm not opposed to giving it a second try, but for my first experience ...it was just "ok". The service was great and drinks were good as well.

gjePUzI6JQU-m4Or2tHJvA.text: I had high hopes for this place based on other yelp reviews. When all was said and done, my final impression was, eh, ...it was alright. Pros: easy to get reservation, seated on time, courteous staff, good menu selections. Cons: very loud environment, tables so close together you can hear the conversations of everyone next to you, found our waiter to be on the pushy side, food looked better than it tasted. Don't get me wrong, this is a good dinner option, just not a favorite for me. Environment had some to do with it, average tasting food was the rest.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken marsala
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi served on bed of Angel hair pasta

McAy2iGzAYgzhAalrLtqlQ.text: Excellent Italian food! I am very picky about were I eat Italian food as many places are not authentic and I can't stand watery out of the can sauce. This place was one I will absolutely continue to return to each Vegas visit. Food was excellent, portions were big and definitely you get your money's worth. I had linguine and clams, we were a party of 9 and we ordered a variety of food such chicken parm which was very good, lasagna, spaghetti with sausage,shrimp scampi. They have a family style dinner option which seems like it would be a lot of food and good variety. Definitely on the list of great places to eat in Vegas !

uwL1mQl01sYv3DQgaapb5Q.text: Went here with a groupon deal but I can say the chicken parm was amazing. Sauce on the spaghetti seemed a little salty but overall it was delicious. I would come back next time I was in Vegas without the groupon. I went through the week so it was not really packed but I would say reservations help get you in faster.

BsIt1eNMCZrKQz6U-dlT-g.text: The best Italian restaurant that I have ever dined. The most awesome dish was the chicken picatta. Love the desert too.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Picatta

3OMFO3PcTYSP-YF6sk78KA.text: Food is really good. Staff is nice. Not extremely pricey for this area. It's kind of unique to have the bakery next-door. Their cannolis are OK. I like the food way better than the pastries. But then again I am not a sweet person.

z5FuoK3Txsaj35EpVWqbxQ.text: Ok, the food is great.   The services are first rate.  What I really want to tell you is that a group of 8 of us went the celebrate my mom's birthday.   My wife see that they sell things with the restaurant's name on it.   She thought it would be a great idea to have the people there with her to sign an apron as a remembrance gift.   I asked the hostess station if they had a marker to use.  Unfortunately, they don't use them at the station.  I found the manager and decided that if I could get the staff to sign it would be over the top.    Boy, did that manager come through.    He had our server Kala ( sorry if I misspelled it) get the signatures.   He had everybody that was responsible for our meal sign the apron.    There were about a dozen on it.   He presented it to her at the end of our meal.    I can't thank them enough for making that dinner a very special one.   I look forward to my next visit here to Las Vegas.  I'm definitely coming here to eat again!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The apron given (we purchased) to my mom with the staff signatures.    Knocked it outta the park!!!

Gckj1gPGoJqleqYHGE0Wuw.text: My favorite Italian restaurant in Vegas thus far.  Reservations are available, which is nice because it guarantees I will get to enjoy this lovely restaurant when I am in town. My fav dish is the Spaghetti & Meatballs. I always pair it up with their Sangria.   Love their customer service. Love seeing the cooks in an open area preparing the meals because I'm nosy like that. Love that their bakery is across the way. I never leave room for dessert but that doesn't stop me from getting mine to go.   Friendly atmosphere. Good for a romantic dinner for two or a nice night out with friends.   This is a gamble worth taking, eating here always makes me feel like a winner!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D6qA09tJDec22PixCikgCA.text: We visited at 4pm. No reservation needed. Our waitress and the wait staff was attentive to detail. Bread was fresh and flavorful. Great portions. Great flavor on the chicken piccata.Spaghetti perfectly cooked. The tiramisu was out of this world. Delicious..Decadent yet light. Best tiramisu I have ever had. Full bar menu. Kid friendly menu.

U9N9R6stpsDIz5Xr408Shw.text: Great attentive service. We were given a table immediately without reservations in a booth in bar area. Romantic setting and the food was excellent. Better than many of the overpriced restaurants in strip casinos. Loved the fried calamari appetizer and fresh meatballs as well as mixed green salad with mozzarella. Warm rosemary bread was served with olive oil and balsamic. There was live music "Sinatra songs" and the atmosphere was very Italian. The lighting was very dark and it was a challenge to read the menu. we enjoyed a bottle of Prosecco with our meal that was refreshing. Reasonably priced menu. Will come back for more and want to try pasta carbonara next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari

uxGngKPW99U2K80MS_pA-w.text: My family and I had lunch at the restaurant,  food was amazing, being from Honolulu you can't get better than Buddy V's, our busboy Ron was awesome, raspberry  iced tea great . Being a chef from Honolulu it's an eye opening experience. Good job Buddy, open one in Honolulu please . Mahalos  Robert Denis

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KLNHwTXHHIs2iTreCroQzA.text: We had dinner at Buddy Vs with a group of 8 and it was amazing!!!!! We did the Imperial family style tasting... I think that's what it was called. They brought out a tasting of all their specialty items from start to "sweet" finish and it was unbelievable!!!!! Now to the best part which is hard to almost impossible to find in Vegas.. SERVICE!!!!!! Our waiter Giorgio was probably the most incredible waiter I have EVER encountered in all my 40 years of dining 3 to 5 times a week. Astounding and personable, funny stories were shared between him and all my clients and he single handedly made the night... one of my potential clients enjoyed the evening so much he whispered on the way out that anybody that has great taste in dining establishments like Buddy Vs is someone he can see himself in business with.. THANKS GIORGIO!!!!!!!! See you next time in Vegas for sure!! A must visit!

P_MXw3Cf6Ll4NDduLKptqQ.text: great service! - we told our waiter we were running late for the blue man group show and she was able to get our food out very quickly!  the my mother in laws shrimp scampi was great. DEFINITELY get the garlic bread! so delicious. and the meatballs were nice too. these 3 items were plenty for 4 girls. awesome food!

YmuJSwTCcWCXTKGlha3Jdw.text: Ate dinner here last night and let me say..it was perfect!. We did make reservations even on a Tuesday because we had theatre tickets and did not wanna be late. We asked to sit at a booth by the window but was informed that was for guests with a party of 6 but she did seat us at another booth that was smaller. Ok no big.  Our waiter was excellent and very prompt! His name was Chaz according to the ticket. Great service, very knowledgeable about the menu and had great recommendations. He also never let our drinks get very low because he was bringing out a fresh one which I feel is hard for other servers to do anymore. I opted for the Margherita pizza while my mom got the Shrimp Scampi. While waiting they had fresh bread that just came out of the oven and was delicious.  Our food was great and looked good too :) they also start live music at 530 so that was a nice touch. After we were stuffed from dinner we had to look at the dessert menu because let's face it it's Buddys! The dessert menu had pictures of Buddy and his family which was a wonderful touch! We ordered Lisa's nutella cake and holy crap it was heavenly! I highly recommend it.  All in all we had a great experience and would definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita pizza!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lisa nutella cake

ZlLClqaKcfbAQ1EqydKZaQ.text: Honestly all I do is really check in to pecs now a days but decided to write a review because the food and service was so good. Ordered prosseco, lemon chicken piccata (?), and an Italian birthday cake for dessert. I NEVER eat the pasta but it was so good. I'm crying at the workouts I'm going to have to do for this. Everything here is exactly what Buddy V would want it to feel like...family. The food is homey the service people the ambience I will come back!! Highly recommend :)

AY9Fp0yXvTkdCobuvWBDvA.text: I wish I could give this place more than 5 stars!! From start to finish it was the best experience in dining both my husband and I have ever had!! Arrived a bit early for our reservation and were greeted by two extremely friendly and gracious hostesses who said they were happy to seat us early!! The restaurant is beautifully decorated and very clean, looks brand new inside although it's a couple years old! We were seated in a lively bustling dining area. And a young man immediately, upon us sitting down, took our drink order and poured us water. Right after that Caleb (our waiter) arrived, wished us a happy anniversary and asked if we would like to move to a more private table with a special view..we agreed of course and within 2 minutes he had checked with the hostess stand and ushered us to the back of the restaurant where the bustling was at a minimum and sat us at a beautiful table looking out over the palazzo and the strip. Was already amazed at this point and we hadn't even ordered yet! Caleb then spent a few minutes chatting with us and made some recommendations, we ordered the recommended appetizer a crispy mozzarella bread in red sauce..OMG they brought it so fast and it was to die for...could have just eaten that for dinner. I had the 3 course special, chose Caesar salad(amazing), chicken parm(light and Delish..ate the whole thing) and the Nutella chocolate cake with salted caramel ice cream(words can't describe how Devine) hubby ordered the bone in veal parm chop. He was in heaven!! Throughout the meal Caleb gave us just enough attention but was careful to give us space to enjoy our meal, the wait staff had our drinks filled any time they were half empty...never had to ask for a refill and even completely cleared and wiped down our table before bringing desert. I've dined at many 4 and 5 star establishments who could take a lesson in customer service and good food quality from Buddy V's. Thank you Caleb and the staff for a meal and experience 2nd to none, and for making our Anniversary dinner one we will never forget!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful view, Heavenly dessert (Choclate Nutella Cake with salted caramel Ice cream)
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal bone-in Parmesean Chop

-NHVqd38-6kgnwLFzv1QfA.text: This joint was classy and service was great. Located in the Venetian Hotel, this is one of many great Italian restaurants that offer a unique dining experience. My mom and daughter and I were all under the weather with a stomach bug and was disappointed that we couldn't get the upmost experience but we ordered the shrimp scampi, served with pasta. The shrimp was huge fresh and delicious. My daughter and I split the Filet served with mash potatoes...fabulous in both flavor and presentation and they divided it for us at no extra charge. We were so upset that we were not feeling well enough to experience anything on the dessert menu. I hope we can get back soon. I only have two complaints: the music was really loud so it was really hard to have a conversation and there were two, I assume, managers, one man in a suit and the other a lady, who cased the joint like they were one of the Sapranos...I understand they are paid to keep the place running smooth but I felt like if you had checked his pockets, you would find a pair of brass nuckles or something worse #RoadtripUSA

2kUimpmjsCZBNCd9jf2YSA.text: Love this joint! Carlos - why don't you open one of these in NJ? The Sunday sauce is to die for. Also loved  the shrimp scampi & the Nutella cake.  Thank you Peter (our waiter) for making the evening! You are the best!

hhWtRQWK-iW-LoU20OEnJA.text: Way overrated. I think these reviews are based on the happy hour. Just ate there. Food was just ok. Portions aren't huge like people are saying here. SERVICE was horrendous. Waited for ever for a waitress. It was our anniversary even said happy anniversary but didn't even offer a free cannoli. We didn't even want it but she didn't even offer. Her and the water bus boy were too busy cavorting.  The FOOD was just so so. I would never return

_6z7_iaBasnEcouYHCk4gA.text: Excellent top to bottom.  The service at the bar was great.  There were two gentlemen who played music in the bar area and they were talented.  Extensive wine list.  Caesar salad had a nice surprise-and-delight element of warm polenta croutons.  Yum.  Grandma's meatballs...excellent.  I am a tough critic of restaurant meatballs and those balls delivered!  Beef, pork and veal is always the right combination of flavor.  Red sauce great.  And the chicken with rigatoni in vodka sauce with pancetta...delish.  Rich, big flavor.  Huge portions.  The hubs and I split everything so don't be shy about sharing!  Great experience.

u1cDTanb6IRTJCQBOoBZEA.text: Very good food! Service was very attentive! We ordered the smashed meatball sandwich and it was very good.

4OgArhMMnxzDx5uwL0G1LQ.text: First of all, very hard place to find. It's tucked in a lone hallway across from RockBar and of course Carlos Bakery. Went to Carlos to get a couple pastries and decided to poke in and see what this place has to offer.  Went for an early dinner with my wife and was seated by the window in the back next to what im guessing is a party room. View was amazing, service mediocre, food a little high priced (the strip) but overall not bad at all. I had the osso buco my wife had the carbonara and we started with a panzanella salad. Server was pretty absent for the most part, but the view made for good conversation and weren't in any hurry. Overall i wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if i found myself stuck in the Venetian i might wonder back over.

b1Fu7tnWbtQmHzpbENrwDg.text: The food was great and the friendly service even better. Thanks to Caleb, Rasberry, Adam, and chef Bryan Forgione for making our dinner for six a fantastic memory.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kossen girls with Chef Bryan Forgione.

5RxxLG2LVTV3F-AAgH5NwA.text: I will let you know up front I usually do not like celebrity restaurants because they are overhyped and don't seem to deliver value for the price.  There are a few exceptions to this rule and Buddy V's is one of them for the following reasons.  1) As celebrity restaurants go, Buddy V's doesn't try to be trendy, rather it sticks to rustic italian fare and is very successful at it. 2) Pricing is actually more on the reasonable side than ultra expensive.  For $38.00 you can get a fixed price meal of an appetizer, entree and desert.  I had the Grandma's meatballs which were incredible, light fluffy balls of flavor in a red sauce; a pasta dish consisting of Bucatini, a thin tube spaghetti with pancetta black pepper and egg(this was my favorite dish of the night and is worth going back for more), and closed the night with nutella cake which was delicious.  Everyone at the table enjoyed their meals. 3) The service is fantastic. The waiter was very knowledgeable, guiding us with knowledge of all the dishes on the menu and providing prompt drink service and bread service.   All in all a great experience for the simple Italian cooking.

NjIK-QTOARkzKUwtIYx1Sw.text: The food and staff here are fantastic! Some of the best Italian my wife and I have ever ate!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Lasagna!

MJcxQoKI4k499lCLByoD5g.text: From beginning to end, the food and service was amazing. The live band was good as well. The Caesar salad was great! The croutons were hot and soft...and so good. Definitely coming back here in the future.

JJQNutAXK5YRoAd9Dx6UIg.text: A friend who also travels often to Las Vegas asked me to do one thing on this visit...and that was visit Buddy V's and just sit at the bar for minimum one drink.  Everything she said about the bar was accurate: Comfortable, great view of The Strip and really friendly employees.  Honestly, it was not easy to find this place and I know my way around The Venetian as a longtime fan of Grand Lux Cafe and that casino floor where I once played blackjack with 90210 hottie Lindsay Price.  My bartender at Buddy V's was a tremendously nice guy named Mike and he poured me a strong vodka cocktail.  The entire place just smelled too good to not at least look at the menu while sipping so Mike steered me right in a modest order of Grandma's Meatballs with some delicious bread that was exactly the right amount of food.  This simply was not your typical Vegas bar or restaurant experience...and that's why I will be back on my next visit.  Oh, and the place has some nice windows that overlook The Strip and a few tables are right against these windows if you want to just eat, drink and take it all in.  Buddy V's wasn't too loud, wasn't too snobby, wasn't too busy and wasn't too expensive either.  Maybe the fact that it is not easy to find is a good thing for those of us who already know about it.

S-0h4yubFj0EWhOAUlR1Tw.text: So let me just start by saying the food here is amazing.  The drinks are meh, but the pasta was DELISH!  The reason why my review is so low is because our server sucked.  I'm not some snooty restaurant goer either.  I used to work in a restaurant, so I know how it's not hard to be an okay server.  However, that being said, we were there for a Bachelorette dinner, and we had maybe 2 small interactions with our waiter.  He was extremely show, didn't check on us once, but decided to charge us extra for some souvenir cups we didn't ask for and failed to inform us that a smaller bottle of water was $10 each.  We waited for 30 min after we were done eating for him to come by to us and check if we wanted anything else or our bill.  Horrible service and really disapointed about this restaurant as I'm a huge Cake Boss and Buddy fan.  If the service improves by a lot, then I'll be back, but until then, I'd rather be checking out other restaurants on the strip.

HW3uogUSUi1nUXGI5sg3gA.text: Amazing food and atmosphere. The server was great but the manager (1/15/17 @ 9pm) is awful. He was aggressive and in the women servers faces the whole night. This happened multiple times in front of us during our meal in the dining room. The manager is unprofessional and should be removed from his position. He was not physical or rude to any male servers. We checked on our waitress and she stated that he does it all the time and she just brushes it off. She should not have to deal with this type of management. Especially since the food and atmosphere was amazing.

H_WpG1osgUeOxOnqXlbZRw.text: It was well worth the wait. Incredible  food. The wait staff was incredibly friendly the food was homemade Italian like my grandmother used to make I am in heaven especially for here in Sin City

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sAheJnuq-kALl19zhk_IAg.text: We loved it!  We started with water, then ordered the filling to share (2 people):  - Grilled Octopus - Dinner Salad  - Valastro Sunday Gravy  Our server was Valerie. She was very pleasant and helpful.   Our assistant server / busser was Carlos. Wow - this guy had it going on. So pleasant, so prompt - really nice guy too.   Carlos brought our water super promptly.  Our Valerie followed shortly thereafter to take our order.   After we ordered, Carlos was back with oil and vinegar and really yummy focaccia bread.   Grilled Octopus Wow - this was really good. Grilled flavor and very tender. Not at all like calamari. Served with grilled onions and peppers.   Dinner Salad A decent salad of arugula and other mixed greens with small tomato halves and pieces of cucumber with croutons in a light dressing.   Sunday Gravy  Wow - this was great!  First, a maybe, 4 to 6 ounce portion of Rigatoni, then a cast iron skillet of Meat in a rich red gravy. The meat was Meatballs, Sausage, Lamb and Pork.   We liked the first 3 equally and the pork the least.   If you have a salad, an appetizer or both, the Sunday Gravy dish easily feeds two people. A lot of meat!    Dessert We ordered 2 coffees and the Italian Birthday Cake to share.  The cake - OMG the cake!  Not exaggeration here - one of the best cakes I've ever eaten!  We sat just outside the restaurant, sort of in the mall hallway. A bit noisy but good people watching. And this is Valerie and Carlos's station and they really killed it tonight.   Thanks Buddy V's - we really made a great call to eat here tonight and look forward to the next time!

RRMoHeoK2kZcC5-S7NeEtw.text: Let just say this is absolutely the best ever chicken parm I've ever had. I got it with angel hair pasta and everything was cooked perfectly, chicken had a very unique taste and the sauce was sweet but not too sweet. This was a fabulous choice and I'm glad I went. Buddy V is known more for his desserts but his food is absolutely delicious, prices are reasonable and you get way more than you paid for. Customer service was great. I definitely was very pleased with my experience here and can't wait to go back.

-rXiacJkXU_XWxAWFKNNxA.text: Went to Buddy V's for my birthday dinner and it was the best decision I could've made!!! Dinner was amazing and service top notch!  Our waiter was very attentive and made us feel like home.  We tried the garlic bread, chicken Marsala and the lasagna and they exceeded our expectations, big portions and delicious taste!   Also, they have the best tiramisu I've ever tried and I can't wait to go back to have some!!

N2ehM9kyJ8Q57_K-haC5lw.text: Good food, good wine, good service   We had been in Vegas a few hours and were ready for dinner, in the mood for Italian and staying in the Palazzo so decided to try Buddy V's. Seated on the "patio" (inside the hotel, but outside the restaurant), there were 3 of us. They had asked if we had reservations when we arrived (no) and we were still seated right away.   Atmosphere: we enjoyed the "patio" area. We were looking for a place to sit, drink, eat and relax after traveling from the east coast and this was perfect. Waitress was very nice and made recommendations, answered questions and was patient. She continued to check on us through the meal, though she asked if we wanted to see the dessert menu before we had received our dinner. Later she apologized and that's when I realized she had forgotten we hadn't received our entrees yet. SMH. Hubby and Bestie had a bottle of wine suggested by the waitress. They enjoyed it but it was a bit on the expensive side. The waitress kept their glasses full until the bottle was done. She also kept my water glass full.  They also serve this delicious rosemary focaccia. Light and just the slightest hint of rosemary.   Food: Delicious! Portions were very good. We were full but not outrageously.   Appetizers Eggplant Parm: it's a round stack of crispy eggplant, layered with cheese and tomato sauce. It was DELICIOUS!! Two of us shared and it really could've been shared by 4 people as an app.   Meatballs: 6 smallish meatballs in a dish with red sauce. Very light, not too much filler. Hubby and Bestie really enjoyed these.   Main Courses: Chicken Parm - hubbys stand by and it didn't disappoint. Two large pieces of chicken Parm served with spaghetti. Hubby ate all of the chicken and at least half the pasta. He doesn't normally eat too much pasta. He really enjoyed it.   Linguine with Clam Sauce: Bestie ventures out to try something new. It was plated nicely with the clams and smelled good. Bestie ate almost all of it!   Orchiette with Italian Sausage. This also had broccoli rabe and a fresh tomato sauce. When I say fresh, I mean fresh tomatoes sauteed or roasted, but not too long. With garlic oil? The sausage was SO GOOD! I don't normally love sausage but wanted something "lighter" and figured if the sausage was good it could be amazing. I ate EVERY CRUMBLE OF SAUSAGE. I dug through what I wasn't eating to get it all!! I truly enjoyed this meal.   None of us had room for dessert. There want a lot to choose from, which I assume is because Buddy's bakery is right across from the restaurant. It was constantly busy when we went by.   I am guessing in the busier months you might want a reservation. Or if you go to dinner later (we went around 430 bc we were on east coast time). I couldn't figure out the dress code. I don't know if that's why we were on the patio or not.

aO0dqZzdEm9CmZ7fkQEnZw.text: HOLY. ITALIAN. COW.   So much delicious food - the most charming and sassy waiter - and seven of us served faster than we could have gotten a table at any Olive Garden.  I can't even describe the foodgasm thanks to the cheesy garlic bread. Unbelievablly amazing!

RKGnww7olnL3HsGi30Wc0A.text: Our FAVORITE Italian Restaurant in Vegas! We LOVE Nicholas Cole and his awesome music ! We make it a priority every time we are there!!!!!

nNOA2uIzfJXmmXqchKtnjQ.text: We went to the Sunday Brunch. We opted for the added sangria and mimosa option.  We loved the bacon from the meat table and the great Italian food from the kitchen bar.  The salad and cheese was tasty and I especially enjoyed the dessert table

yDsa5r3YbQK4nVszmXCpeA.text: Come here for great, home-cooked style Italian food with classic flavors in an upscale setting at the Venetian! We walked in and were seated promptly at around 8:30 on a Saturday night. Cozy ambience and very prompt service. Wait staff quite attentive and refilled bread and water without being asked. Prices were average to good for a semi-fancy place along the strip, especially for the quality of the food.  Garlic bread - warm, tender and well-seasoned if lacking a bit of salt. Perfect dipped in olive oil and balsamic.  Calamari - standard taste, crisp and fresh. Low quantity but more than enough for us. Battered onion and pepper slices a nice touch!  Buddy's favorite pizza - excellent, flavorful and filling. Olive oil flavor punches through and accentuates the richness of the cheeses. Great value for price!  Cheese pizza - loaded, fresh and baked perfectly.  My Dad's Bucatini carbonara - delicious, decent portion size, al dente. Pancetta flavor excellent. Very eggy sauce without being overpowering. Suggest getting a bit of pepper on it.  Fettuccine Alfredo - my son said it was excellent.  Nonna's Lasagna il Forno - HUGE portion, 11 year old son was only able to eat 1/3 of it. Classic flavors, perfectly put together.   Caesar Salad - Classic taste, fresh. Croutons were one of a kind and delicious!  Check this place out! We chose Buddy V's over Trevi and Carmine's based on reviews.

d5pRGKQe1xgKphuU5QxZ2A.text: This was our first time here - I'm so happy we stopped here for bottomless mimosas! Great food selections and even better drinks!!! What a great way to kick start your Saturday ! Our waitress was so friendly and sweet! I hate that I don't remember her name - it was very pretty!   The down side was you had to exit the restaurant to use the casino bathrooms which had long lines every time!  Over all it was a good experience. The restaurant is a little tricky to find if you have never been to the Canal Shoppes - half of our party was late due to getting lost. They had great seating - good food - friendly staff - and BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS !!

ELdcAwHJ0aXG74bIcsODjA.text: When in Vegas! You guessed it... come here. You won't regret it. The best restaurant in its class in Vegas. Hands down! Best sauce anywhere! The ambience, the hospitality, the food! 5 stars for sure!

Ua2Pfz9kw76vl6Obbim0sA.text: As an Italian from New Jersey, this restaurant was a breath of fresh air. My boyfriend and I watch Cake Boss and decided this was a great idea for our anniversary dinner. I love how everything from the photos on the walls, to the menus, to the recipes were all Buddy's family.  We both had sangria's (my favorite/go to) and they were pretty good. Not the best sangria I've ever had, but good. We started out with the calamari...yummy. I definitely recommend it as a starter. There's a good amount and it's very good.  Our entree's were well portioned and overall great. They had a great menu of so many Italian classics, it was hard to choose! We finished our dinner with two cannoli's (another favorite). I absolutely love the cannoli's here. They do it right, which is hard to find in Vegas!  Overall, this place is a little pricey but a great choice for classic Italian food made the right way.

u6Gop0oipoXa6ZOYBG6roA.text: In the mix of flashy, overpriced Vegas food, I loved Buddy V's for its touch of down-to-earth family-friendly Italian food!  The location is a bit weird -- it's in the Venetian but around a weird entrance in the shopping area that's not super accessible from the Uber/Lyft drop-off. But once you find it, Buddy V's screams classic Italian with red and white checkered tablecloths and a wine list longer than I could read (or afford). The food was all great with pretty big portions, and the carb-loading was exactly what we needed before a night out! They have gluten free pasta, and the fettuccine alfredo was every bit as creamy and delicious as I'd hoped it'd be.  I came with a group of seven, and the service was surprisingly fast and efficient. Our waiter was a little weird, albeit friendly, but nonetheless, I wouldn't hesitate to return next time I'm in Las Vegas and looking for some classic Italian food!

T6S2jOrI3U5G2l_hu3aIhw.text: We were in from Florida and looking for a good place to eat for my 30th birthday, Buddy V's was perfect! We had reservations for a show and told our server our food was out quick and was nothing short but AMAZING!!! My friend and I had Caesar salads, their croutons were warm and fresh! Best salad EVER! We also got chicken and shrimp Alfredo, it was to die for and my fiance got the surf and turf. It was also amazing!!! Highly recommend it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramelized Sea Scallops
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo

O9XiZ3hMhTRN_FM-j9nisg.text: This is a 3 because of the food quality , I had originally seen this while I was staying at the Palazzo on an ad during one of their TV commercials. I figured the authenticity being from Italy and such. I would rate this on the level of a Buco DePippo's food chain. The Caesar salad was average, which could be found at an Olive Garden . The octopus was, grilled, so-so. I had the Seabass which look like a trout. My two employees both had the chicken which look like it was smothered in gravy. We shared a Bolognese pasta which was probably the best because the chef made it perfect very very al dente. The waitress and staff where friendly and professional .   Over all my expectation was a little more authentic and quiet . The live music was nice but it was very loud. Where you could not have a conversation without raising your voice a few octaves.

ChqBoLxJdADKBc7XeiIgjw.text: Located right off the Grand Canal inside the Venetian.  I was craving pasta so my boyfriend and I stopped in for lunch.  I'd researched before our visit and looked over the menu and noticed they had a Prix Fixe lunch menu. When er were seated this wasnt offered to us so I had to ask.   I got the chicken parmesan that came with a caesar salad, generous portion of pasta and chicken, and I got tiramisu for dessert. My boyfriend ordered a margherita pizza.  I really enjoyed my meal. The pasta was delicious and I loved the focaccia bread with oil for dipping. The only thing I didn't enjoy were the croutons on the caesar. They were warm and reminded me of cornbread. Service was a little slow but we quickly learned that is the Vegas norm.

iICN-oX3b04C2Dunfjx9SQ.text: Service was spot on! When you indulge in the bottomless drink menu, it is truly that, you will not see the bottom of your glass with mimosas, wine, a pomegranate Bellini that will pucker you in the right spots, bloody Mary's and of course domestic beer. For $16.95 we enjoyed a multitude of beverages while being serenaded by the live band. The food overly met the expectations we had entering the establishment with a mix between a carving station, pasta station, fresh fruit, deserts and many more. Between the service of TJ and assistance by Shelby we had only ask and it was available. Definitely will return to Buddy V's on a return trip!!!  The Strip DEFINITELY got a little sweeter!!

pu1qSViL83XsH8KqSlCktw.text: I just arrived in LV for a quick meeting.  I normally don't eat lunch, but my business partners picked this place since we are staying at the Palazzo.  I love the ambiance...very casual but cool...  I had the calamari fritti and the bone-in parm chop!  Boy, it was HUGE and so GOOD!  For desert, we walked across the hall and had a canolli at his bakery!  AWESOME FOOD!

3wHeuQq0UqMCd45sM6GTuA.text: this restaurant was amazing! me and my mom came in around 2:45 for lunch, we decided to get the express lunch menu which is $22 a person. you get to pick from an appetizer, main, and a dessert. that's an amazing price for what you get.  i ordered a raspberry iced tea and one of the waiters brought it back asking if i'd like to make it more or less sweet. i thought it was interesting that they actually make the tea themselves instead of buying it premade.  i ordered grandmas meatballs for my appetizer and my mom got the panzanella salad. the meatballs were delicious, the sauce on it was tasty. they weren't huge in size but an appetizer isn't supposed to make you full so it wasn't an issue for me. i didn't try the panzanella but my mom enjoyed it   for entree, i ordered the chicken parm, my mom ordered the margherita pizza. the pizza was HUGE, i was amazed that we were actually getting full sized meals especially for that price. the chicken parm was delicious, and it had a small side of spaghetti as well.   for dessert, we got a cannoli & tiramisu. my mom enjoyed her tiramisu and i loved the cannoli. on one side it had chocolate pieces, and the other side had pistachio shavings. i'm not a fan of pistachio so i scraped that part off. it also came with a side of sauce, i didn't use it but i tasted a bit of it and it tasted like chocolate. the ricotta cheese filling was so amazing i'm still wanting more!   if you are ever in las vegas, i definitely recommend checking out this restaurant. the prices are reasonable and the food is amazing! you won't be disappointed

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. raspberry iced tea &amp; Grandmas Meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita Pizza
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panzanella Salad

SFe219WqOG4CBAcJRg9nIw.text: Couldn't think of a better place to have dinner for my 30th birthday! I am a Buddy fan and I had no idea he had opened a restaurant in Vegas until my friend told me!   Buddy V's is located in the Venetian on the furthest end (passing all the clothing shops). I was dressed  up and hoping the rain wouldn't get us! Ladies, if you suck at wearing heels like me, make sure you keep them in the hotel. This was a long walk for the Uber drop off.  After torturing myself with my cute heels, we finally made it! The restaurant is beautiful. Dim lighting, adorned with cute white and red table cloths and wooden tables. The menu had so much to choose from! I went with the Three Cheese Ravioli. It was honestly one of the best ravioli I've had thus far! The cheese was so creamy, the sauce was cooked with the most amazing herbs, it all tasted fresh! I paired it with a  Melon Blossom, it was a mix of melon and citrus. With Grey Goose Melon, elderflower, orange-cello and cucumber, the drink was super fruity yet floral! It tasted like liquid melon! So so good.   I also tried their Spaghetti Central-Pomodoro. Apparently the sauce on this dish is cooked differently with different time intervals between cooking, and let me tell you the flavor is so amazing! The sauce was nothing like my ravioli, it tasted more sweet and acidic...amazing! And because it was my birthday and it is Buddy's I had to try their Cannoli!   I definitely recommend this place. It was a beautiful restaurant with amazing food, great service and great Italian dishes to select from!

GmywFQBKLbFmFGhtb-17gg.text: Holy amazing! We dropped in for dinner last night before the ZZ Top concert. Man were we impressed! Outstanding service and incredible food. We all had the $40 dinner which comes an appetizer, entree and dessert.  I highly recommend the carbonara!!! Pretty sure it's the BEST I've ever had. Grandma's meatballs are also quite delicious. So much food!!! Come hungry. Excellent adult beverages also. We will absolutely be back. One of the best restaurants in Vegas.

i-5shq4EK7zT_NU3Ws_DkQ.text: Excellent food, great service. Had dinner there with the family while in Vegas. Everyone was very happy with their dishes and drinks. Definitely recommend!!!

SvWedcM9blclhtYtl_ZKuw.text: YUMM!!! I can't say enough about how delicious this place is! I wanted a second stomach so I could eat more. The tomato basil soup is AMAZING, the garlic cheese bread is sooooo good. I went with a group of 6 people and everything was incredibly delicious. Seriously come here hungry. We all ordered different things so we could try different items and they were all so yummy. Then of course went across and ordered some desserts ;)

EEWgV009qEr6KfPvQmJWmQ.text: Buddy V's Ristorante is a lovely place to go for home-style cooked Italian food.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, salads, pasta, chicken, veal and seafood.  Last but not least, the cakes are insanely delicious- not surprising, seeing the restaurant is owned by the Cake Boss himself.  Do whatever you have to do to save room for dessert!

FKPoLTNOi21tmtHUyQ8tjg.text: Great food. Great service. Excellence at its best. The Assistant General Manager Adam Margolies was very professional and made my daughter's 12th birthday a very special occasion. Highly recommended

weSAcc2GYNAMQ7ZmKoaT6g.text: Everything was delicious and service was great. I most enjoyed Mama's Meatballs but not the polenta croutons that came with the caeser salad. Do not get the polenta croutons unless you like polenta.

Z6pOomTFm2FxEMZIBcj7pA.text: They gave me a rotten panzanella salad! They cheese was not fresh at all, and I was afraid to eat it. The rest of the salad was a flavorless bland combo of bread, cherry tomatoes, rotten romas and rotten cucumbers. It was disgusting. I tried to pick around the rotten produce and just eat the cherry tomatoes accidentally getting a rotten one in my mouth before spitting it out , not wanting to cause a scene... the waiter never came by for me to even tell them it was a health hazard!    Also, I didn't even have bread to eat because they give you these tacky bread sticks in a plastic bag. Overall the worst experience at a restaurant I have ever had in Las Vegas, which is rare because there are a lot of amazing restaurants on the strip. I have never been served rotten food before. My husband's dish was bland small, flavorless and overpriced.   Don't waste your money because Buddy is on TV (Cake Boss), his bakery is great, but his restaurant is terrible.

0Y5Cdh2sMqrBFAWvETXI7A.text: Buddy only knows cakes and cannoli's right? Wrong! We had a great time at Buddy V's. The food was excellent and it was a really fun environment!  My wife had the egg plant parmesan for the first time and loved it! I had the Capellini shrimp scampi.  We loved it all. Even hit Carlo's Bakery on the way out. Fun night!

bhKQ82czfxz6C5LPfYAWPg.text: Excellent staff and food. Only gripe would be please put bread on table not the bread sticks. Especially if crowded. We had chicken parm and veal marsala. Both very good. They serve whole wheat pasta which is nice.

9i_5pMQc1rUlNBl7tdNdAg.text: OMG!!!! My wife is a HUGE fan of cake boss we have been to Buddy's cake shop in Hoboken and she has been to a decorating class at Lackawanna, so Buddy V's was next on her list. She made a reservation for a Sunday night lucky as they were really busy. We were seated within 5 mins of arrival at a table beside the kitchen, within 2 mins our waiter came over to offer us a quieter table in the corner near the window and had our drinks within 5 mins. I ordered caesars salad for appetiser my wife had Grandmas meatballs, both meals were amazing you could see the herbs in the meatballs and the flavour was incredible, my Caesars salad was fresh and croutons were not to crunchy but fresh. We ordered off a theatre special menu which was $38 each for a 3 course meal which we thought was pretty cheap ( being from Australia its hard to find an entree for around that price so this was cheap for us). My Entree was chicken parma and my wife had Buddy SNR Bucatini carbonara, dessert was Nutella cake and a cannoli which we took desserts back to hotel room as we were full from our mains. All in all this restaurant was AMAZEBALLS  we will be returning again in the future and to top it off we went to Carlos bakery  right across from the restaurant.  Beware alcohol is pricey....  BONUS our waiter looked like THE ROCK!!!!!

BLOYcSuSsNmmAwi-urvHIQ.text: O M G. If you are looking for homemade, delicious, traditional, NY Italian food- this is where you need to be. The food in this place tasted like home in Brooklyn in my mother in laws kitchen. The restaurant is in a wing of the Venetian and across the way from it, is Carlo's Bakery. (You can easily access the restaurant from outside the Venetain. Its above the Walgreens close to the Deuce stop. Almost like you are leaving the Ventian and walking towards Palazzo). The restaurant was very pretty with gorgeous views. The vibe is very causual, laid back, like you stopped by a friends house. Any clothing goes. No dress code. Not at all stuffy and pretentious like Giadas. (see review). We had a friend with us from Texas who had never had NY Italian food, so we had to take her there and see if it was authentic. Authentic it was. We started out with the mozzerella and Carozz that was amazing. I got the "Sunday Gravy"- which is exactly how we make it here. You get a bowl of pasta, with a seperate skillet of red meat sauce with meatballs (OMG delish), pork shoulder, lamb. My husband had pasta bolongese. Insanely good. My Texas friend had the lasagne. It was huge and she ate it for 3 days. All portions were big. The food was not pricey. The dessert menu comes in what looks like an old photo album, and it contains pics of a young Buddy and family with his dad, and then pics of him with his own kids. The whole place is decorated in family pictiures in frames on the walls. For dessert, we had the Nutella (yes Nutella) Lava cake!! OMG. Melted Nutella runs out of the center of this lava cake served with Salted Caramel ice cream. There are no words. Get yourself there  ASAP. You will not be sorry. It was so good, we went twice during out 10 day stay. Had to go back for lunch and got more meatballs, eggplant parm and 2 amazing salads. My new fav place in Vegas. Buddy needs to franchise these places out across the country. I hear Buddy is there monthly. Sadly he was there as soon as we got home to Nyc. Cant wait to go back.
