uCjkvYhaF6rbZVbfIGJSMQ.text: This was the answer to a several month long search for a simple but ass kicking great tasting Italian meal. It was a busy Tuesday night, so we took a bar seat and enjoyed the great bartending by Mike. We asked him about a wine, he said it was good. When he brought the bottle it was a screw top... I was a bit concerned with the screw top. We had the wine with dinner and enjoyed a great meal. We met some nice peeps next to us and had some great conversation and a most enjoyable evening. Thank you Mike and Buddy V"s for a most enjoyable time and meal. We'll be back. Highly recommend for great tasting authentic style Italian food, with a classy twist.

DSYqsmC7xbS06KhPNhUteA.text: I was hoping that this restaurant was gonna be good... Big fail;( well we went for sunset menu ( 3-5pm) . We started off with the Buddy's Salumi n cheese board($19) as an appetizer...nothing special for the price. Then waiter asked if we wanted garlic bread (FYI not free it was $9 for 3 pieces) bread wasn't even warm, great Italian bread is a precursor to a great meal, not even close.  Menu was limited which isn't bad bc that usually means that the stuff on the menu is usually great...Uhm not the case. The linguine n clams ($25) portion small & there was spaghetti noodles instead of linguine??? Caprese salad($14) there was a whole tomato on the plate which was like boiled n peeled, unimpressed. The angus burger had no flavor n the French fries were overdone n cold, really???  Ok so after being disappointed by the food I was really looking forward to dessert... The XL lobster tail ($15) was so disappointing bc the pastry shell was hard as a rock n hard to eat. As you bite into it all the cream would shoot out bc the shell was so hard. The cannoli shell was hard as well, like a hard cookie ($9). If you had real cannolis you know that they are not supposed to taste like that. To top it off the coffee yes the coffee tasted horrible, like it's been sitting in the pot all day. For 3 people and sunset menu which is cheaper than dinner total $153 and that's with no alcohol..for that total there was not one thing I could say anything nice about. I had leftovers that weren't even worth taking home.  Yes, I should of known better to go to a gimmicky restaurant. But I liked the show and I'm from NYC and was hoping for some good Italiano food n dessert. No love in the food at all. Don't waste your money n time going all the way to the crazy strip for this place.  Buddy .....if your reading this or your PR person lets you know what's going on with your restaurant. This place is giving your familia a bad name. I've had your pastries in NJ. This place is not giving your bakery any justice. People who travel to Las Vegas and who will never go to your bakery in NJ are going to think that your desserts taste like this ( specifically in the restaurant) not good.

W1GPIE5jdjyqMxCckop6Ww.text: Visited Buddy's restaurant 5 nights ago. My friend and I sat at the bar and were taken care of by a wonderful bartender Miko. He was pleasant, funny, and totally on his game as far as drink orders (ask him to make you something - he's got a few awesome drinks up his sleeve!). He definitely steered me in the right direction for dinner - the cheese raviolis are out of this world! We also had a few appetizers that ended up being a meal - grandmas meatballs were heaven, the mozzarella cheese appetizer was not like anything I've had before (in all the right ways), and the antipasti plate was this awesome combo of cheeses and meats and olives that I was swooning over. The only bad part? No room for dessert! Guess I'll just have to go back next time I'm in town!!

nCYlzH11Z8WdteoQwK9_rA.text: First thing first - Standout dishes:  - Buddy's Caprese: I am normally not a fan of Caprese salads, but Buddy really nails this one. High quality ingredients, and finely tuned flavors make this a worthwhile starter.  - Cheese Ravioli: I know what you're thinking. "I can get cheese ravioli anywhere." Yes, you can. The great thing about the ravioli at Buddy V's, however, is that it is a perfect companion to Buddy's outstanding roasted tomato sauce. It's bright, tangy, smooth, and well rounded all at the same time. Definitely memorable fare.  - Cannoli: I am normally not what you would call a "fan" of cannoli, but, once again, Buddy has proved me wrong. Most cannoli, in my experience, are disappointing in their grainy, and under-sweetened filling. Not so with these cannoli. Perfectly sweetened, incredibly smooth filling paired with just the right amount of cinnamon in the pastry make these cannoli worth writing home about. (Added perk: After eating at Buddy V's, you can walk right across the hall, and buy a whole box of cannoli from Carlo's Bakery to eat back at the hotel if you are so inclined.)  Now, to business. There is definitely no shortage of Italian food on the Las Vegas Strip, but Buddy V's is definitely a major standout. Even among all of the other celebrity chef restaurants to be found in Vegas, the Cake Boss is definitely holding his own.  My wife and I stopped by for lunch one afternoon, and had a great time. Our experience was so good, though, that we went back for dinner two days later. For lunch we just stopped by, but for dinner we made reservations through OpenTable. Neither time was the place so busy one would need reservations in order to avoid a wait, however.  Here are some highlights of Buddy V's worth noting:  - The service at Buddy V's is excellent. They are easily on par with restaurants with much higher price points.  - Having worked in food service, I am hyper-sensitive about cleanliness. I had absolutely no complaints here, however. The entire restaurant is very clean, comfortable, and inviting.  - The pricing of most menu items is very reasonable in comparison with many similar Vegas eateries.  - The whiskey/scotch selection at Buddy V's bar is truly impressive. It's not hard to find a bar that serves Johnnie Walker Black anywhere, but one that serves Johnnie Walker Green, Gold, and Blue is tough to find at any price point.  - Unlike most restaurants in the Venetian, Buddy V's is right near an entrance making it an easy place to duck in for a meal without having to stray too far from the strip.  Final pro tip: Be sure to note on your reservation that you are celebrating a birthday, if that is the case. They have some fun, no-loud-obnoxious-singing-involved surprises for birthday-folk. I would imagine the same is True for most other celebrations as well.

3d4DsSdR6oZhAvehGtQfPQ.text: Lunch leaves a lot to be desired. Service was very slow and not friendly.  Lunch menu has nothing really on it. My chicken was cold and salad was drowned in dressing. I couldn't even eat it. I was very disappointed and out seventy five dollars.

G3k9jLJubCLqi1PjPyaXDQ.text: Our waiter, Georgio was amazing, he made our experience soooo memorable and made some incredible Menu recommendations.  Our entrees were great, wines selection was extensive.  Xoxo

l07GlMjx8auRmxtukNrMTQ.text: Overall the food was good, the service was friendly, but a bit bumpy and the wine was disappointing.   For appetizers, we shared the mac & cheese, salumi and mozzarella en carozza.  These were all solid dishes, with the mozzarella probably being my favorite.  Our entrees were brought out before we were even half way through the appetizers, but when I said something they took them away.  I was a little worried that our meals would be sitting under a heat lamp, but kudos to the staff for bringing us fresh dishes when the time came. I thought the wine list was rather lame.  I like wine, but am not an expert, so when I recognize a bunch of the wines as the variety I can find at my local Smith's, I am a bit let down.  I finally ordered a bottle of an Italian variety I liked, but when it came time for the sample taste I was almost tempted to refuse it.  It wasn't spoiled, but sure did taste as though it had been stored at the wrong temperature. For entrees, we tried the lasagne, Dad's Bucatini and spaghetti and meatballs.  Again, all the dishes were good.  I especially loved the Bucatini and would get it again.  Desserts were not quite as good as I expected.  The cannoli were fresh, but the filling was lighter than the ricotta I expected and overall had a strong cinnamon oil taste.  The Nutella cake was your standard lava cake that has been around since the 80s.  The coffee was nice and strong.

G_3vQiCjth1gUlj9tWl7bQ.text: Awesome!  Food was some of the best Italian we've had, Krystal took great care of us, price was unexpectedly reasonable and atmosphere/music was enjoyable. Will come back.

OQLt-ZXMZgoT4a0xTVMvBw.text: The service was outstanding! Our 8 year old girls were cold and the Venetian sets the thermostat so there is nothing they can do about it. The manager brought over two tablecloths for them to wrap up in!  The Sunday Gravy is very good. The cheese board is a bit average. The Italian fish was liked and so were the meatballs.  The lower rating is due to the dessert menu. It is limited and not very good. We ordered the apple turnover, tiramisu, cannollis, ice cream, lemon blueberry cheesecake and the hazelnut chocolate cake. The ice cream is great, but not home made and the only other great dessert was the hazelnut chocolate cake. Everything else was very average. What a surprise!  You have to walk by their bakery across the hall and you see the pastry chefs make these amazing looking desserts through a glass window, but none of them are on the menu! I expected fabulous dessert, but it was pretty disappointing.

KH_WzWr_LTyIuPH_kNjGgw.text: First off... Buddy V's food...  Always amazing!  Service usually amazing as well.  However, this review is for the waiter Kaleb.  Who wasn't even our waiter.  We made a reservation and were seated at one of the two chef's tables.  After giving us the details on the family style meal not on the menu our waiter filled our drinks.  Then we met Kaleb... Nope not our waiter.  He informed us we were being moved because they wanted to use our table for a 12 top.  There were six of us.  He didn't ask he told us we needed to get up and move and leave our drinks on the table.   We asked what was going on.  He just kept saying we had to move.  So as we were being basically pushed to another table at the back of the place he was being a jerk through the process.  Then he tried to switch us from the lunch menu to he dinner menu without explaining what the difference was.  Also telling us he would get a free desert for one of us.  Apparently the menu change is basically a higher price and more items.  Luckily he wasn't going to be our waiter at the new table.  As most should do we called the manager over.  He apologizes and asks us if we want a different table.   Which we didn't care about the table.  He was missing the point Kaleb was being a jerk.  He offered at least free desert to all of us.  We even confirmed it was all of us and not one of us.   Our waitress Kristy... Was amazing!!! So again take note this 1 star rating is not the norm... we generally would give it 5.  Kaleb should get a 0.  Even a few of the staff agreed and confirmed Kaleb was a jerk.  The manager was subpar.  When ordering the apparently free desert we were told it was for 4 of us.   Our waitress went and made sure it was adjusted to what was promised.  Again, We would request Kristy because her service was amazing and she dealt with the situation better than the manager.  When we left 2 hours in... The 12 top never showed up.  We were going to order the family dinner.  So they lost out on probably twice bill and still would have been able to seat the 12 top.  When we told the manager on the way out that that party never showed he said they had to save the reservation and we should be happy because he bought us over $100 worth of desert.  We reminded him that 6 people x $9 doesn't quite equal that.  He says ... "Well I tried." We didn't care about the free desert.  It was how the restaurant handled it.  The point is how this situation was handled.  In our opinion ... It was terrible.

GIzTaUiSiHfG-3h4eFj-7Q.text: The food and service was excellent. Little did we know there would be live music with Nick and Preston. They were great too! Christmas music and Italian brunch, what more could I ask for!

Rxt1thmR97invkUIg_UzBw.text: Great restraunt. Great place, The meals are huge!    I went there for my 33erd Birthday and was stuffed. The Granny meatballs were great. If you love meatballs you gotta try them on your visit. Also the calamari is a great dish as an appetizer very good.   Chicken parm was a good dish too but if I go again I'm getting the lasagna..

mt7v3p3PkaERpIKrpc1A_A.text: Had brunch here on a recent visit to Vegas and was not disappointed.  Their weekend brunches consist of a buffet option with plentiful options of the traditional Italian food options to normal breakfast options.  There is also a massive dessert table consisting of bread puddings to concoctions from Carlos bakery across the hall.  Our server was amazing and made sure our drinks were never more than half empty as we had all partaken in the all you can drink mimosa/sangria option.  He was even kind enough to get our last rounds in to go cups so we wouldn't have to wander the strip drinkless!

BA8OjIyGIPl2UcXYXeSpaQ.text: The wait was a little long, but the bar had open seating so we helped ourselves. They still had the restaurant week promotion going so I took advantage. The service and food was outstanding! Bartenders were super friendly.

R59pkFAMzOrvcT84gwT68w.text: This the second time we eat here with the wife when in Vegas. Glad we came. The wife and I enjoyed the food. We tried the calamari and lasagna. We were pleasantly surprised with the calamari. I hate when the calamari comes out chewy. Luckily this was not the case. The lasagna was also good and recommended.   The portions of big so I recommend sharing and entree. My wife and I did and we still didn't finish the food.   Overall I would it give it a 4.25

Bhf2Qh6qcKsjjSgOTi57sw.text: After speaking with the GM & Owner, learning of their concern for our health and desire to retain us as customers, really showed great customer service us. We appreciate their effort to provide support anyway they could. #GottaLoveGoodCustomerService

_emx8WSKiXPEZlVQqHrcuA.text: The weekend brunch was SPECTACULAR! Some of the most authentic and delicious traditional Italian dishes paired with incredible brunch staples(seafood, charcuterie, etc.)!   The service was superior and definitely measured above board - friendly and attentive but didn't hover. I can not recommend a brunch spot anymore highly than Buddy V's! Whether it's a party of 2 or 20, this places delivers!

yIrYyiyIN0NrH4OMF7H2rw.text: We ate there twice. I thought I was going to explode both times.  Yes, I ate till it hurt because the food was that good.  I wish the Sands location in PA learned from them. The brunch on the weekend is a must try feast.

mB1A6mo1HVVx6j0to7JZdQ.text: Lunch on a Friday had great service in a moderately busy restaurant.  No wait to be seated.  The panzanella salad was the best salad I have had in quite some time.

ji-qZ-rx5NG0VxQAuKzMwQ.text: Ordered calamari (4), lasagna(3), egg plant parm (3), cheese bread (4),cannolis (2), and the bread pudding (5) which was the best thing we ate on our visit! I would definitely recommend coming to this place for that bread pudding but the food itself is just okay, nothing out of this world. Service was great and fast on a Tuesday afternoon (about 1pm) where we did not have to wait to be seated.

guzEBJOCXReQWCDqPXy9oA.text: Good customer service. We had the 3 item combo dinners. Very good! However didn't like the water choices, kind of an up charge. They don't tell that other than tap water there is a charge.

C-sJqJeuK31AgNZStHH3cQ.text: My husband and I got married today at Buddy Vs, on the patio, and had the Sunday brunch for our reception. Tammy helped us plan our wedding as we live out of state. Her attention to detail and execution was perfect and exactly what we had envisioned! The food was amazing as well, everyone said the choices were delicious! We will definitely be celebrating our anniversaries here in the future!

xHwiScdbLIdScN3iy8H2xA.text: We came in for the Marine corps ball.  We've thrown around eating here for a while. Today we decided we would give it a shot, and man it did NOT DISAPPOINT.  The food was fantastic. The service fantastic.  The selection of food was incredible and it has been hot and fresh! We opted for the Sunday brunch buffet and there was such a huge selection of food, not to mention my all you can drink mimosa! Highly recommend !!

5dzFxN5RfJW3y5k8i0R_tQ.text: The BEST italian food and the greatest service. I ordered the chicken parmesan and it's the best I've ever had. We also had meatballs and Caesar salad. The portions are large- it actually fed us for lunch and dinner the same day. We found a new gem on the strip in Vegas!

81G-WA0wxydRsLGa8sWtcA.text: The whole table was impressed expecially even after hell's kitchen we were blown away by the food, service and portions

i2yGFihzU6QBu1HpJ8orqA.text: This was the first time I have been to this restaurant. And I must say it was outstanding.  I had the shrimp scampi and it was so good!!  The picture does not do it justice.  I wish I could get the recipe so I could cook it over and over again for my family!  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a great Italian meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XCrF09PclfY7_FsaaP53SQ.text: I made a reservation for this gem without much background info on it. We were immediately greeted and welcomed into a cutely decorated restaurant.   I had the chicken parm, husband had the cheeseburger and soup, we also got the cheesy garlic bread. My husband enjoyed his burger but was very disappointed because he didn't get he chicken parm. This is the best chicken parm I've ever had.... chicken was so moist and juicy. It melted in my mouth and left me wanting to finish off this large potion. Thankfully, my husband ended up eating some of mine and saved me from devouring the caloric bomb. Everything we had was tasty and we will definitely be returning.   I encourage you to stop in here and give this place a try. It's well worth it!

Wk-tEN9addswTayw56LF1w.text: We went here after checking out of the hotel for their weekend brunch. It was pretty darn good! There was such a variety of food, which all tasted great. I couldn't get enough of the meatballs and french toast. The decor is awesome. It feels like an old school Italian home. They had a live performer in there singing Frank and Dean songs. I thought it was the radio until my wife pointed out it was an actual guy. Awesome way to leave our very memorable trip!

FWzrPyGN7XlLJgkdSy5cRQ.text: A wonderful meal. First time visit for me and would definitely return. The food was amazing. Dessert is fabulous all at a very reasonable price. In Vegas ask to be seated in Georgio's area and you won't be disappointed. He is like having dinner with a family member.

bT3oz5ghs_hPaOV7IHy3MQ.text: I visited Buddy V's not too Iong ago and this is what I thought...  Pros: friendly service, family friendly, big portions, great prices and live band playing while you dine...  Cons: Few items on menu and long wait...  However, Buddy V's is highly recommended and a must go to restaurant when visiting Las Vegas. Buddy V's is located in the Venetian. FYI...I always back up my reviews with pictures...the dishes in the pictures are the surf and turf and lasagna.

MfyLVBTVjeiYGv5-wE-klA.text: Great food...wonderful service.  Had the opportunity to take a picture with Buddy.  Thrilled to hear that he may be opening up in Chicago.  What a nice change from some of the chef owned restaurants...they are very accommodating and strive to please the customer.

mXkoF7WQdKYyKLGcOnLsIQ.text: Went here with my wife during our anniversary trip to Vegas. I have nothing bad to say about this place. It's not necessarily a romantic atmosphere but that's just Vegas in general. Doesn't matter where you go, there's always someone in shorts and a crappy t-shirt and flip-flops. Having said that, we still managed to have enjoy a nice romantic evening. The waiter was great. The chicken parm was great, the corozza was great, the lobster tails and Italian birthday cake were of course great. And just because I needed to try the tiramisu, we came back a few days later. And of course, that was great too. Nice touch with a little bit of chocolate cake in the bottom. I liked that the place wasn't overly crowded and we could go and sit down pretty much whenever. It was certainly one of the highpoints of our trip and I very much look forward to going back. And next time, I'll look forward to stopping into the Carlos Bakery shop opening up just next door. I know some complained about the pricing. I would argue that once again, that's just Vegas. Cocktails cost pretty much $14 wherever you go, unless you're sitting at the slots, and restaurant food is pretty much always $20+ for entrees. That's just the way it is.

zX4wcVfrjYn0Bahbw3Ok0A.text: Some of the best Italian I've had!! Got the lasagna and chicken parm, unbelievable!! Was worried, Italian can be done REALLY wrong, this is old school basic Italian perfected! Will definitely be back!

4JCwC9We3zR17PlWi53Qxg.text: Really fantastic food! We ordered the cutting board, Burrata, Charred Octopus salad, eggplant parm, Nutella cake and washed it all down with a bottle of Far Niente Chard!! What a day!!!

iZiqGNIvCVN6Or8OK1FKtA.text: Had the Philly sandwich for lunch and it was amazing..  Service was great.. Diffently want to come back for lunch again..

g9b3J0V6dLdSYSb5PJI63g.text: Was in Vegas for work and took the family with me. My daughter who is a huge Buddy fan wanted have dinner here. She is 10 and she loved it. The place is charming, very cute. The food was very good as well. Service was friendly and fast. I would definitely come here again if I am ever in Vegas again. If you are looking to have a nice dinner at a place that  is kid friendly, this is a good choice.

AN_A6I-MDaQjGcDQpMEA9g.text: Stopped in here with my family of five as we cruised through the Venetian for a late lunch. We were really headed to Carlos' Bakery but were hungry and went in to Buddy's.  Two kids got meatball sandwiches, one got the margherita pizza, and my wife and I split the salumi and cheese plate with a couple glasses of house red. Happily I got a few bites of the meatball sandwich and it was probably the best I've ever had. The salumi and cheese plate was a great split for a light meal, with excellent meats, cheeses, and I loved the olives. Not normally an olive fan. My daughter really liked the pizza, too.  The bill was about eighty five bucks and the service was good, not great.  Tip: If you want to hit the bakery, grab a number before or during your meal. There was a significant wait for the bakery, although perhaps the novelty will have worn off after a little time has passed.

x1Ja8opTuwhMJTZOc0NfbQ.text: Went at 4:30 with some friends for the happy hour specials.  Service was sincere and friendly. The drink prices were killer for happy hour, and the food was great. I recommend the calamari, not to spicy, and the sauce is great.

ujTRCJQ_KmmYmkSE-w1z4Q.text: Visited this restaurant on a Sunday evening as a party of two. The maitre de was accommodating to our needs and had very good suggestions in accordance with our likings. The service was cordial and quick and not pushy. Personally we tried garlic bread, cheese ravioli with a white sauce ,and a pasta al la vodka. The garlic bread had the perfect portions of additives making it a great addition to our meal. The ravioli with our requested white sauce tasted phenomenal. Great cheese blend with an accommodating white sauce that was buttery but not too heavy. The vodka sauce was a phenomenal mix and just the right portion of red to white. Customer service was great, we look forward to coming here again!

PyOqQfXAIDGpM1S759W0Xg.text: All the food we had was spectacularly....meh. Nothing was horrible, but nothing was even above ordinary from what you'd find at most italian chains. We had the spaghetti bolognese and chicken parm.  Our waiter was beyond terrible though. It wasn't one specific thing, just a lot of little things that added up to a poor experience.  The bus boy/bread deliverer/water guy was great, and that's the only thing I can say positively about the place. At these prices, we definitely won't be back.

Mxz97mPCL4G-RJln0PYnSg.text: I came here the other day for their Sunday buffet brunch special.   My experience was very enjoyable, from the good food to the excellent service.  Since it was a buffet, I ended up trying a lot of the food they had to offer. Some of the food that stood out to being especially good was the Sunday eggs, the chicken parm, panetone French toast, the caesar salad, the chicken apple sausage, and meatballs. There was mac and cheese there as well. This was the first time I had mac and cheese at a buffet or all you can eat setting, and it tasted exceptional. The noodles weren't over cooked, and the cheese sauce was tasty and creamy, there was a bread crumb like topping on it that help bring it all together. There was even some partially peeled shrimp there. Unlike some places, it was properly cleaned and deveined, on top of it not being over cooked and mushy. I wish the cocktail sauce that accompanied it had some more flavor and horseradish in it. The, what I were to assume, mini cannoli were excellent, even though they were already filled, the shell was still crispy and crunchy while the filling wasn't overly sweet.  All of the food I tasted had flavor, and was appealing to the eye, which tends to be a lacking attribute for a lot of buffet places. While you saw the cooks actually make the food, it actually tasted and looked like it was made from scratch, not something that came from a bag, frozen, or reheated from the day before.  The service was top notch. My glass was never less that 1/3 empty, and the busser made sure I always had fresh forks and knives when I came back with more food. The waitress and busser were very attentive, always making sure I was comfortable, enjoying myself, and asking if there was anything they could do for me.  For the price, selection and quality of food, and service, I was very satisfied with my experience at Buddy V's Ristorante. Not only will I most definitely be coming back for the brunch special, I would recommend the place to other people that I know.

u_ms0qSRNaM4fV2aKR5nNA.text: We were so excited about eating here, and the food was excellent.  I can't give it a higher rating because the service was absolutely terrible.  We were seated in about 10 minutes during lunch hour (1240ish).  We were seated at a table overlooking the strip (great) in the bar area (no problem).  The problem was that our waitress was the bartender, and despite only having one or two people at the bar the whole time we were there, it took ages to get anything done, including ordering drinks, our meal, dessert, etc.  It took almost 2 hours to have an app, a split meal, and a dessert.  The hardest working person in there was the busier, who was busting his butt the entire time!  He deserves a raise. :)

HOSfcYndLfr2szZNSX5JzQ.text: The food... Eh, what your paying for is the view and the establishment... Drinks are over priced as well as the food. But it is a place for big groups with $ to spend

QtQXtiwpdqjJ_p-bhy5hyQ.text: Poor service, small portions, and the red sauce they use was wayyy too salty. Prices are in the higher range. The bread  was good. That's about all that was... Basically your just paying for the name. Never going back.

sel7rVVET7eZFDidYILTpg.text: This place was amazing! My father and I went for my 21st birthday and had brunch! We met the assistant manager and he was the most down to earth guy. Remembered us when he saw us the next day in the grand canal shops as well. The food... well it was the absolute best I have ever had. Must go for anyone in vegas!!

hUiylJ0Et5BlqTw1TclRxg.text: The design of the place is awesome and cozy..so many cool details. Service is on point...very friendly and attentive staff. Food isn't anything you haven't had before but simple and good, nonetheless. I wouldn't come here for a special occasion..more of a casual lunch spot in my opinion. Tomato soup is excellent and so was the pasta with vodka sauce..worth a visit. Enjoy!

1DEUrPcY6MjH9FZ6rCGGBw.text: Ate at Buddy V's for lunch yesterday. Ordered the calamari and Garlic bread for appetizer. The bread was crispy and cheesy, it was good. Calamari was big and the jalapenos in it gave it a nice flavor. My husband ordered the meatball sub. The meatballs were lacking a little flavor and I would have liked more cheese, but the sauce had good flavor and the roll it came on was soft. I ordered the chicken piccata. I really liked it. The chicken was pounded thin and the sauce was a little thick and it was the perfect mixture of lemon and capers. I LOVED the Italian birthday cake! It was vanilla cake with a chocolate filling and there was cannoli filling too. It was to die for. It was not overly sweet either and it's definitely big enough to share, but I wouldn't...;)

2SVlIguiZtxlZByFmZ7FTQ.text: Excellent food. Thought I was going to have a mediocre lunch that was "mall food" but i was pleasantly surprised. Definitely a must if you are in the Venetian in las vegas

6lBcB5-TBCwNSIzwOwtpGA.text: 5 Stars for Food. 2 Stars for Service.  The food was absolutely delicious!  From the reviews I expected it to be really good but it was excellent. My husband who isn't a big "food" person, was actually quite giddy. I got a Caesar Salad and Chicken Parmesan. The Chicken Parmesan and the Spaghetti it came with, was the best I have ever had. My husband had the Panzanella Salad and Orecchiette Pasta. He said both were amazing. We also shared the Warm Nutella Cake. It was magical.   I could tell that they took great pride in the way the food was made.  The service was really spotty. Maybe it's because they just opened. But the food was so good it all worked out.

wCF0sy44xgQexaKN6szUNg.text: Good buffet. There wasn't a lot of food but the dishes there were above expectations for a buffet. It is worth the price and especially bottomless drinks, alcohol (almost said alcoholic which is how I'm feeling after 4 days in Vegas lol) is worth the $16.99 price.

cseKoK_yU5MhRDqwirb6rQ.text: Really great atmosphere, great food, service was great, a little over priced, but it is Vegas. I had the shrimp scampi and he had the lasagna, both were excellent! We decided we would definitely come back here again but maybe only once in a great while.

g_P0wuvlrcUa1Jx6IHLK9A.text: From appetizer to desert Buddy V's was a great Italian dinner. The mozzarella en carrozza was delightful, the scallops were seared to perfection and served on the creamiest polenta I've ever had. My wife enjoyed her ravioli and my kids had the pizzas. All delicious.   Desert: we had the lobster tail and Nutella cake. Both were decadent. The lobster tail was smaller than I had anticipated; but it was flaky and the cream filling wasn't heavy.

2Ds7XNMkd1Q4CjQn8CfA1A.text: The best meatballs. We always order it. We also get the garlic cheese bread. We also ordered the Tiramisu~~~amazing !!!!!! We always come here when we come to Vegas.

gzj5jQiFNTJ6gKQWoxnVNg.text: Great dinner tonight. The service was excellent as was the food. Lately, whenever we go for Italian I order chicken piccata and tonight was no exception. It was delicious. My daughter enjoyed her "Mac and cheese" and my hubby loved his sea bass. Our server suggested a wine which was great and the cannoli for dessert was one of the best we've ever had. I would definitely return and recommend!

fHzaA6bZ_ViWYJvyntcfxw.text: Restaurant week lunch menu 2015 review   The Skinny: maybe I just don't get it but the food is okay,  not great... Surprisingly their dessert was the worst course and cannot recommend. (3) service is good and prompt (3) value: it was okay for Restaurant week special but I would skip this place at regular prices.   We came in to try their restaurant week lunch menu which serves a 3 course lunch for $20.15.   I got her Caesar salad,  grilled salmon over a cucumber/chickpea/artichoke salad while the hubs got the tomato basil soup and spaghetti and meatballs.  Both came with a dessert course of cannoli and cookie selection.   The tomato basil soup was a little too bland and needed more basil. The texture was good.  I liked the Caesar salad better albeit it was a little heavy on the dressing and needed more acidity. The hubs thought there was a little too much anchovy in the dressing but I kind of like that. The polenta croutons were a great addition textural and flavorful.   Spaghetti and meatballs was really nothing special and the sauce was too bland -  there really wasn't enough tomato flavour to really make this dish stand out. The meatballs were under seasoned. The spaghetti itself was cooked a bit beyond al dente which in a dish like this,  makes it disappointing.   My salmon dish fared better. The grilled salmon was done perfectly. However the salad of cucumber,  arugula,  chickpea and artichokes was a bit underwhelming and needed more acidity/brightness to bring the flavors together.   The worst course was dessert. It each came with a cannoli and 3 cookies -  oatmeal, chocolate chip and sugar cookie. The cinnamon cannoli was okay albeit rich...there wasn't enough cinnamon in there to really distinguish itself. The cookies were really bad -  they did not have that rich buttery taste to them. The sugar cookie especially tasted more like shortening and artificial flavors. I think they also skimp out and use cheap artificial vanilla extract.  After we finished lunch I was watching the bakers at Carlos bakery. Guess what I saw? A half used package of pre-made manufactured Rice Krispies treats with the shiny blue foil packaging and Kelloggs branded elves (see the pic). Seriously. As a bakery,  you cannot make rice krispie treats yourselves? (Just FYI, all you need is a microwave,  marshmallows,  butter,  rice krispie cereal, a bowl,  a spatula and 10 minutes to make this dessert). To me,  that is just bad form.   At the end of the day, I give the dining experience a 3 star -  it's okay but nothing I would return for. As for Carlos bakery -  just the cookies and the aforementioned shortcut I saw are enough for me to stay far away.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. See the prepackaged rice crispie square in the window of the bakery? WTF?

JtDJ3ouszwYMvBS5S_2jOg.text: My friends and I decided to stop in buddy v's for our last night in Vegas to get some homemade Italian food. 11/4/16. We had made reservations for 8pm for 7 and by the time that came around we still had to wait half an hour for them to clear the table and what not. After being seated we were giving menu and drink menu. Everything sounded really good and look delicious! I order the madiline penne and my friends all ordered something different. The food came out fairly quick, but it seemed like our waiter kept on forgetting what we had. The service was okay, but it was as they were almost rude. The food was also okay it wasn't as expected. I've actually had better! So overall buddy v is just hype because of the TV show. At this point it was an experience and that it's really up to you if you'd like to try it out. Give it a try and see what you think.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J1P6T8h6WM7KvXERQbXLgw.text: Nice Italian restaurant located in the Grand Canal Shoppes. I was craving spaghetti and meatballs and I was very pleased how good it was here.  The pasta was perfect and the sauce complimented so nicely I could have had it without the meatballs. But who am I kidding, those meatballs just took it up a notch! Definitely freshly made, juicy with all the right spices. I was so full that I had one meatball left and yes..I took that fist sized meatball in a doggy bag! No shame here.   My kids enjoyed the oven baked Mac & Cheese gooey on the inside and crispy on the outside & the gourmet burger on freshly baked brioche bread with aioli and side of fries. Happy campers with full bellies!   Of course being so full we had to take our cannoli to go. It looked so darn good that to my surprise tasted even better than I imagined. We ordered the chocolate chip and pistachio nut toppings. The cannoli stayed crispy/flaky even after eating it hours later. The cream and chocolate sauce was sheer perfection.  Definite must!   A casual, hearty establishment for the entire family.  Bundt cake molds for wall decor as well as kitchen utensil inspired lighting and fixtures.  Booth seats overlook the Vegas strip. Since lunch was a hit, I would definitely come back here and check out their dinner menu.

wu4T7DaR45Mvu-TPqypARQ.text: Great service, delicious-- ridiculously good-- food. We ordered the fried mozzarella appetizer, grandma's meatballs, then chicken parm, and pasta a la vodka-- SO good. We were stuffed but took a cannoli and lobster claw to go-- more crazy deliciousness. Pomegranate martini a bit to syrupy, but no big deal since everything else was perfection. Great atmosphere too.

hoiVClV0VXTaGmoJLz3GUw.text: We celebrated our daughter Victoria's  21st Birthday with family last night at Buddy's  and we loved it. We had a great server by the name of Peter who recommended family style dishes ( veal parm, chicken marsala, lasagna  & more that were just  amazing !  In addition , Peter and his team of helpers made sure everything was taken care and everyone was comfortable.  It was an amazing experience and I highly recommend Buddy's for your next special occasion . Ps- I ordered my daughters birthday cake from Carlo's Bakery across the hall from the restaurant and it was so delicious!

UoMaiSUlQq0XZa5ZLwO5EA.text: Updating to add a star. Dinner experience was much better than brunch. Chicken parm was excellent and the cheesy bread as an appetizer was delicious! We had a reservation and was seated immediately. *******  Pretty pricy for what you get. $35 each for brunch. $10 for bottled water at the table. Very little at the carving station. Chicken parm was out, but they did replenish it eventually. It was pretty good. I didn't see much else that I liked. Got some pizza from the kids section to try to fill up. Dessert was the highlight, but it didn't blow me away. Service was very good.

XeyheuhPOnO3hUnakE4niw.text: I came back for the croutons...wait, what? You read that right. Croutons. The little, dried-up bread scraps on salads. I ordered a Caesar salad to start with before my entree, completely unaware of the discovery I was about to make. When my salad arrived, I was immediately intrigued by the croutons - they were unlike any I had ever seen. These croutons were perfect, one-inch square cubes, caramelized to a perfect golden brown on the outside. Biting into one, I discovered a filling of warm polenta - also known as grits in some parts. It was apparent that these croutons had just come out of the oven, and they were HEAVENLY! I wished I could  have ordered a whole plate of them - they were that good. The rest of my experience at Buddy V's was outstanding - the main course, the service, the ambience were all great. It was those croutons, however, that brought me back for dinner the next two nights in a row.  UPDATE: I stopped in for lunch on a Thursday with the family. They had a three-course lunch special. I started off with a Caesar Salad with those heavenly polenta croutons...WOW. My main course was the Chicken Parm, which was delicious. An order of Tiramisu and a cup of coffee was the perfect finish. The service and atmosphere were impeccable. I may have discovered one of the world's best Italian restaurants. I will not miss an opportunity to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nZsJuOD0VrAtPxOS6nJ8ww.text: Perhaps I went during the wrong time. My husband and I visited, unbeknownst to me, during restaurant week. Perhaps they prepared their food ahead of time. All I have to say is that I was disturbed by my meatballs. I was flat out disappointed by my meatballs. Those were not good meatballs.   I had spaghetti and meatballs. My first cause for concern was that our dishes came out insanely fast. Never a good sign in my book. I'm not at Burger King, I do no expect my food to arrive in less than five minutes. The meatballs were small and when I split one with my fork, it did not crumble like a freshly made meatball should. It was hard. And I bet you anything it had been frozen at one point. Sauce was incredibly bland. I was incredibly disappointed.   Main cause for disappointment? This was not my first time here. I've had their meatballs before. They were heavenly, delicious, tasty and FRESH!   Saving grace was their Italian Cake. That was pretty good. But as for the meal, all I can say is how corporate of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Highly recommend the Italian Birthday Cake. At least their desserts are on point.

Q6AVu9n1_Sv-5v9iHdd7Xg.text: A bit hard to find but worth it. Good food and good value for money. I just wish the staff was a but more attentive

qsMOJeoSIJ8nZw-oIkKQFg.text: Decent Italian place. Nice decor. Food was tasty. Had the Margherita pizza, pretty good. Price is good considering it is in Vegas.

oVKpz_gl8okhLlGrVN0iNQ.text: I have nothing bad to say about this place. Service is wonderful!! I came with my family in thanksgiving and everyone treated us like family. Talked to my kids and food was amazing. Just come and eat here!!!

BzYhR4V7ordydABnpnENeg.text: Very good service and food was good! I would not say it is a must go to place in Vegas but it will not disappoint you either.

OPjWunWyyDY4tanC_a3XJg.text: Absolutely the best hamburger I've ever had . Angus beef burger , outstanding . Service was great , a great restaurant

GiY4uvXU-tgbM_bdSfCpEg.text: Servers are pretty hot and intelligent. Pizza was a little bit too salty. Everything else especially the antipasti tastes great. The main dish medium well steak was somehow pricy. I didn't see one single cow on the way from Los Angeles to Las Vegas. This may explain the tag haha.

7zBaxVyUruukL7sR-DSVRA.text: Fantastic, a MUST eat!!! The Caesar salad with melt-in-your-mouth croutons, the grilled cheesy bread appetizer, and the lasagna were absolutely delicious! Wife had the salmon and was thoroughly pleased with her meal as well. This will be my go-to Vegas restaurant for future visits, absolutely loved it. And that doesn't even speak for the service staff, they were absolutely excellent at what they do. Thank you for topping off and already fantastic night with Rascal Flatts!

KcOMo9pROIEbwSnCnc6p4w.text: This place was fabulous !!! Our waiter was Giorgio and he was FABULOUS !! The food was also very amazing to top off the nice service! My friend and I had the bottomless mimosas/bellinis and our amazing waiter made sure our glasses were never empty! The food was amazing, as well as the desserts, my favorite was the cannoli, chicken parm, Mac & cheese and pasta salad ! Would recommend this place for anyone visiting Vegas! This was a great ending to our great vacation!

R0Fj9B_w7l3H2bQmqrTm7Q.text: Went to Buddy V's for the brunch buffet yesterday.  Had a wonderful experience.  Everything was delicious, especially the grandma's meatballs. They were the best I have ever had.  The desserts were amazing with my favorite desserts  cannolis and tiramisu. Wait staff was friendly and very attentive. Will definitely will be returning soon!

WNjXHANE02gdbbRSdd-Bpg.text: This place was a must do for our weekend getaway! This place is so amazing that I had to write this review DURING brunch! The food is phenomenal and the service is impeccable! Cheers to Buddy V's!

Xkuhrh494mwoNFlp0cGJFA.text: Decided to try Buddy V's when I was out with one of my friends since we both had been wanting to go. When we arrived, they told us that they didn't have any tables available. I could see that there were open tables, so I'm not 100% sure this was True. My friend mentioned that he was an employee at the Venetian, so the hostess said she could seat us in about 10 minutes. They put us at a table in the back corner of the restaurant with empty tables all around. I wasn't a fan of being put back in the corner. It took a bit for our server to come to our table, so the experience didn't start out too great.  I thought that the food was okay, but nothing to write home about.  I haven't been back since, and I honestly didn't even think about Buddy V's last time I was thinking about going to an Italian restaurant on the strip.  It's possible I might give it another shot.

K-uim9tJEVIjLwaksv5e8A.text: Good food. Good service. Nice restaurant. Not much to complain about. The service was great. Our server was very nice, kept our waters filled and really seemed like he knew what he was talking about. The restaurant was very nice, good atmosphere. We came for lunch so it wasn't so busy so it was nice and peaceful. The food was good. The tomato sauce tasted a little canned but we only had 1 dish with sauce on it so over all it was good. Dessert was good as well. The tiramisu tasted very authentic. Over all a very nice restaurant.

iTMaJ5Pf1EEzZJlAtwYmqg.text: We didn't expect much from Buddy's. We figured, ah, another TV personality restaurant. Like, whatever. However, we stopped in for a late-night dinner after seeing the Beatles Cirque show at the Mirage, when not much else (even in Vegas) was open at 9:30pm on a Sunday. And Buddy's turned out to be the Boss. As in, very NJ Italian.  Caesar salad usually has hard-as-rock bread croutons. Not here. Buddy's croutons were amazing, soft, warm polenta/cheese cubes. Loved that! The Chicken Piccata was also very tasty, a generous portion with lots of capers and lemon. Very nice. Cute Italian breadsticks-in-wrappers on the table. Surprised and pleased with our meal.   Finally, don't get the weirdly-frosted cupcakes at the Carlo's bakery across from Buddy's (the ones with gobs of over-colored icing on the top). Instead, DO get their authentic Italian/NJ "lobster claw" pastries filled with cream. You could die. They were that good.

lAvkTr-9jRZSlwQitZEVGA.text: Food here was fantastic. We came here last minute without a reservation. The wait was about 30 minutes, but we were able to get seated at the bar right away.   Service was good and the bartender was friendly. The Nutella lava cake was probably one of the best desserts I've ever had.  Minus one star for high prices, and small portions.

wO0EKic5hN_0DePz1S8VMw.text: Great food, TERRIBLE service! Our waiter pretty much ignored us the entire time and had one of the busboys help us with everything. Not once did our waiter check on us or ask if we needed anything.

UhSfBaqrJUznSdBRGbknUg.text: The interior is really nice and the atmosphere is great for just a casual meal or a date.My server was really attentive and always checked to make sure everything was ok. I had the orecchiete and Italian sausage pasta and it was delicious. It was so good that I can't stop thinking about it. Even though the most popular item is the chicken parmesan,I have no regrets getting the pasta. I also ordered a special drink and was given the glass as a souvenir.Next time I'm in Vegas,I will make sure to get the chicken parmesan.

vBvW9le6wB6baIdyG19tCA.text: Traveled to Las Vegas and had dinner at Buddy's! Restaurant was super nice and clean, open kitchen in the center of the restaurant. My wife and I had spaghetti and meatballs, a Caesar salad and garlic bread. Food was great and reasonably priced based on the quantity and quality. Staff was great and the manager on duty was very friendly.

7hEIJDNMgAOBKlWG4LFbgg.text: Average Italian eatery. Laid back atmosphere, do not get dressed up here. There is not much to say - nothing really impressed us but nothing was disappointing either. Not a bad price for the strip. We had calamari, meatballs, and chicken parm. All are average.

Rd0-_EHSJZ61UFDwDV1uJg.text: If I could give no stars I would because the food was awful, cheaply made (frozen veggies?) and just not worth the money. Far better restaurants in Las Vegas. Very disappointed all the way around. Won't go back.

MUmyZ1R2J_sMeR5ttRJ-6g.text: Real NY/NJ Italian. Chicken Parm was one of the best I've ever had. Panzanella was good, a little overdressed and hence soggy. Caprese good but wished there was more tomato. Focaccia (complimentary) was amazing. Margarita pizza was small and just ok. Tiramisu was small and pretty good. Service quick and on point.

fTK_ORKX03R3beM8JQsVDg.text: The shrimp scampi here was amazing. Also,the lasagna was exquisite and the calamari was amazing and the focaccia bread was delicious. Everything that we ordered was on point.

The calamari is delicious here the chicken parm with the side of spaghetti is delicious. The drinks here were amazing shout out to danny our bartender. Im glad i came here. Will be back before we go back home.

GdEcOEShJKH47G40C3vtDA.text: Great food, great atmosphere, great service. However, how do you run out of Pinot Grigio in an Italian restaurant at 6:30 pm on a Tuesday night? Secondly, after switching to a $16 per glass red wine, it was served in  a Libby 's style wine glass !  Time to upgrade the glassware Buddy!!!!

k-r-wjki2L51Sy2kyJvRjw.text: The food was very good. It was traditional heavy Italian American done well. Huge portions, most dishes could be shared. The service was terrible. I made a reservation in advance for a large party. The waiter only spoke to my husband and father in law. There were 11 of us. He had to be asked twice to take a drink order for the other 9 people at the table. When he came back he gave all the drinks to one person to pass around. He tried to upsell us while ignoring the majority of our table. He really pushed the 'family style' but would only explain it to my husband and father in law and seemed annoyed everyone didn't agree. One order was delivered wrong twice. When I asked if it would be removed from the ticket he got defensive and told me no. I had to ask for a  manager. He never offered refills on anybody's drinks but my husband and father in law who shared a bottle of wine. The support staff was great. Our waters were full the whole time, they were prompt with soft drink refills, brought us bread right away. We were there to celebrate the first grand children turning 21. His service ruined the experience for several of us. It was bazaar instead of enjoyable. I would not recommend unless it's just a few of you.

WUJ5wdOAasRel0uHNOoKHA.text: We came for dinner before seeing Human Nature.  I didn't watch the Cake Boss show but I knew about it and wanted to try the restaurant.  We were early and they were still serving lunch so we ordered an appetizer so we could order off the dinner menu.  We got an order of Nina's mozzarella en carozza.  It was like having a toasted cheese sandwich with mozzarella cheese with some tasty marinara.  It was very good.  We shared the order and each had two wedges.  For our mains, my wife ordered  Nonna's lasagna.  It came with beef, pork, sausage, and four kinds of cheese and it was huge.  We could have split this between the two of us had we known how large it would be.  It probably weighed a pound at the very least and it was very good.  We brought 2/3 of it home and have it frozen for a meal for the two of us.  I got the Sunday Gravy.  How could I not go with his signature dish.  It's meatballs, sausage, lamb, and pork simmered in a Sunday gravy and served with a bowl of rigatoni.  The rigatoni was a sensible serving size, but when you added all the meat, this also was a dish that could have been shared.  This dish is worth the praise it gets from reviewers.  The Sunday gravy is excellent and the meat is so tender from the hours of cooking in the gravy!  Saving room for dessert, we opted to have part of this boxed also.  For dessert, we wanted something small and went with our server's recommendation of the Nutella Cake, cake with a warm Nutella center, chocolate sauce, some praline crunch, and served with salted caramel ice cream.  It was delicious and perfect to share at the end of the meal.  Our server, Graciela, was a gem.  She was around often to check on us.  The bus people refilled iced tea glasses quickly,  Service was very good!  The only drawback was the large Palazzo sign along the Boulevard which was at the level of the windows and was extraordinarily bright.  They have a shade which was partially lowered but it should have been lowered more or we should have changed our seating position at the table so our backs were toward the sign.  A very pleasant evening in a really good restaurant!

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meat.

tCGIYqmYIRFCXjD_0IOHdg.text: I couldn't leave Vegas or the Venetian without having some Italian food and I especially wanted to try Buddy V's. We only had time to run by for happy hour but I'm glad we did. I grabbed a glass of house red - not my fav but okay. I ordered the meatball small plate and the Mac n cheese small plate for my husband and I to share. The food was delicious. I really wanted to try the chicken parm but I wanted to stick to a small plate. Hm add a chicken parm slider!!!  So the happy hour menu has $4 drinks and $5 small plates. I will post a photo. The weird thing was that you could only get happy hour pricing if you say in certain spots of the bar. I laughed at the hostess. I have never been to a place that excludes certain bar seating. So if you want happy hour pricing - sit at the bar or the high tops. The low tables and other options are excluded

Afc0pBVTOddKr0_cuTB0Qw.text: The food was really good. I loved the their focaccia style bread they serve warm. The only reason I am giving four stars is, when I went there with my group of 4, the restaurant seating was fairly empty. They told me they didn't have a table available because I didn't have a reservation. She told me the bar area was open for all. Luckily there was a table in the bar that opened as I was having this conversation. As we sat there the restaurant really never filled up, not sure why I was told I couldn't be seated at a regular table.

BtGkkRoWTYRM__sGN2-pfw.text: I was pleasantly surprised tonight!  Everything about our time here truly couldn't have been any better!  We were greeted by the hostess and only waited a few min to be seated for our reservation.  Peter, our server came right over and took our drink order - he was awesome!  He helped me choose my entree, the seared scallops ... which were beyond incredible.  They were served with polenta and shrimp - it was all cooked perfectly.  Polenta was creamy and a fantastic side with the scallops and shrimp.  The sear on the scallop was just right ~ they were tender and very fresh.  For dessert I decided on the butterscotch creme brulee - again, it was beyond perfect!  Holy cow!  Creamy, rich, just enough butterscotch flavor and the caramelized sugar on top with the pecan short bread cookies... I just couldn't stop eating-even after I was full!  The manager stopped by our table - she thanked us for being there and asked if there was anything we needed or had questions about.  Peter was attentive without being intrusive - he was well versed in all aspects of the menu from starters to drinks to desserts.  I am already excited to plan my next trip here.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qYGZHxqiDT23OSyJU_VWKQ.text: Terrific Happy Hour, 7 days a week, 4:30-6:30 pm in the bar and lounge!  This has to be one of the best deals on the strip, and the best part is it's not just a deal for deal's sake, but it's good quality too.   We stopped in after having been at another happy hour nearby where it was quiet and more expensive.  Buddy V's was like a happy hour explosion in comparison, complete with live music!  I had $4 wine, while Husband had $4 beer.  We shared two $5 plates of Mac & Cheese Carbonara and Sausage & Pepper Sliders.  Both were really really good!  Warning though, that is a HOT pepper slice on top of the sliders (looked like a slice of tomato to me).  Really good sausage.  The real star of the show was that Carbonara.  Brilliant to make a mac & cheese version of it.  It was rich and creamy and the peas added a nice pop of freshness.   We would have ordered a lot more if we hadn't just come from another happy hour.  Next time, we'll head straight for this one, or come for a full meal, as we were impressed enough by the quality.  Our Server Gal did a great job, and we enjoyed the free entertainment of the Brothers so much that we tipped them well.

7b1-Ucyz_8KJfER97AhcpA.text: Just happened upon this place while I was walking through the Palazzo and now it's a must have every time I'm in Vegas. I highly recommend the Caesar salad which is unlike any Caesar salad you've ever had because of the homemade and warm croutons. I also recommend the shrimp scampi to pair.

uGYtOqC3q4CacNMPeaMxhw.text: Went for dinner to celebrate 2 birthdays.  They were great seating us on time for the reservation and the waitress immediately said - I know we are celebrating birthdays.  Very casual, nice atmosphere - a touch loud, but to be expected.  We started with the recommended meatballs and Aunt Nina's mozzarella.  Both were good - the mozzarella was a little odd - like a grilled cheese but went well with the meatballs.  I'm not a big meatball fan, so just thought they were good - not sure what it would take for a meatball to be great.  The fresh bread was great.  For dinner we had lasagne, chicken parm and the rigatoni.  Everything was really good - especially liked the lasagne.  The rigatoni was good, but needed more chicken.  For dessert, they brought birthday cannolis, which were good.  There was a huge line at the associated bakery across the hall - didn't have time to check that out.

dkI9h2IHpryjvA3-dcQUYA.text: Walking in this place the atmosphere is very homey. I loved it. Beautifully decorated and a nice ambiance. We came in for happy hour and so we ordered an array of items. We got the meatballs and gnocchi. She ordered the tomato soup as well but that was not on the happy hour menu. The gnocchi wasn't a normal potato Gnocchi but it was made with polenta. It melted in my mouth and had amazing texture. Everything I tried I throughly enjoyed. The bar tender was awesome! She gave us excellent service and made sure we were well taken care of. I will be back!

T8tnc-VgJzdhubgh-NijiQ.text: Bottom line first:  good food, good view, spotty service   I was here for a business lunch. Even though I specified that I wanted a private table, the host smacked me right in the middle of the room. Fortunately, there was one last table for two at the bar area that I was able to switch to before the whole place filled up. The tradeoff was the view, but the business was what was important.    After trying to decide between good reviews on chicken parmigiana and carbonara, I went with the chicken parm.  It was really delicious and was as tender as our server advertised. Maybe a little big portion for lunch, and it was priced as you would expect at the Venetian.   The service was not great. Other than promptly getting our order, it became essentially nonexistent.   I got confused who was actually helping us several times through our less-than-an-hour meal.  The bill was dropped off even before I had a chance to ask for dessert. I guess they wanted us to leave.   Although I had no complaints about the food and view, the service would prevent me from enthusiastically coming back, at least not during the busy lunch hour.

jRs-nrqQExiShlQUMEWbMw.text: Visited Buddy's last week during conference and it continues to serve amazing food at reasonable prices for Vegas!  The service was amazing and I am just sorry I cannot recall our server name but he was better than usual. Visit Buddy's if you are Vegas it is a DO NOT MISS!

edGYOnVi-DUocpRUJlKOpA.text: BEST Drink Ever Thank you Bartender Matthew!!! He also recommended the chicken  picatta amazing !!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Drink Ever !!!! Thank you bartender Matthew!

b02wxOWluvqA1LAPWiZt-g.text: Buddy V's has always been great for us.  The food is very good and the brunch might be my favorite in Vegas.  The carbonara mac n cheese (I think is what it was) will have you battling your Nonna for the last bit in the bottom of the tray.   It's great for the holidays too. We came here for Xmas and thanksgiving and they always do a special spread.  The wait staff is always incredibly friendly and fast, even if they can be a bit quirky.  One of them accidentally gave my girlfriend a backhanded compliment, realized his misstep, and then saved himself.  It was actually kinda funny.  The attitude of the wait staff we've had has been to make sure you have a fun experience along with excellent service.  And we haven't been disappointed.

cNDXjzZ5PmVJc7KWtCLAsg.text: If you come here you have to try grandmas meatballs, can't believe I had to travel toVegas to try the best meatballs.   Happy hour has great deals. $6 appetizers and $5 wines

XPnjD1T-2gNiuYrqBgdlpw.text: Recommendation:  Share an entree!!  I came to Buddy V's craving reasonably priced Italian food on the strip.  On a weekday night I had to wait for a table for 1.  I guess its a good sign that the restaurant is busy.  You might want to consider making reservations for larger parties.    The food and the sangria I ordered were good.  My biggest complaint about Buddy V's is the service and the amount of food thats served.  I normally order an appetizer and entree when I go out.  I asked for recommendations from the server at no point did he try to recommend food or portions that were reasonable.  He had the mindset of upsetting to increase my bill which I understand servers do, but its also helpful for them to be honest.   First I ordered the sangria.  I only saw it advertised by the pitcher, so I asked if I could just get a glass.  The server said that if I wanted more an 1.5 glasses (he pointed to a water glass on my table), then it makes sense to get the pitcher.  So I reluctantly agreed.  It was later that I noticed from another table that the sangria came in a larger glass then what he showed and would have been enough for me.  Not to mention after I poured out the sangria into my glass from the pitcher, the pitcher was full 34 full with ice.  What a rip off!  The calamari appetizer was good, fresh, and well prepared.  The appetizer was average size.  The entree I ordered was the Sunday Gravy.  It was about 2 pounds of cooked meat in red sauce, with a side of pasta.  Clearly enough food for 2 people.  I was upset because I asked the server what he recommended and had a couple dishes in mind.  At no point did he say one was twice the size of the other.  I ended up not touching the pasta and couldn't take it home as my hotel didn't have a fridge.  Everywhere else on my trip I was informed of portion size and asked if I wanted to order less, or the servers made suggestions about getting a different entree due to its size.

qzz69tqlTHusgjdYCctxVw.text: It's 9 : 13 PM and We are still here sitting at the table while I am writing this review . If I could give - 0 Star for this humiliated experience for All of us over a bottle of Fiji water . The Inappropriate Manager asked one of the waiter and told him to pointed who was ordering the bottle of water and that waiter pointed one of my business partner . My business partner came late with me and some of all the team we're there already. Over a bottle of Fiji water She humiliated my business partner . The manager said Oh I was going to split the cost of that Fiji bottle water , REALLY ?? SERIOUSLY ?? My Family frequently comes to this restaurant because we are local here in Las Vegas but with what happened tonight I will never bring my family or anyone to this restaurant ever again . We feel humiliated , disqusted by her behavior .

eCPdU5qso-YsroiJP-ivkw.text: Group of friends and I visited this restaurant for dinner. Our server Georgio gave us excellent service!!! The timing in which every course was brought was perfect. The time taken to explain a little bit about every dish in a comical way was something extra which we loved. Thanks for the awesome service it made our experience in Vegas even more exciting.

i_BNfBE9mF174XC-HbtKyA.text: This restaurant is literally the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to. Every time I looked away and looked back at my water it was filled to the top. The food was amazing and I have never had such amazing service.

etEMnhi9RopLf9jB-EFJWQ.text: 5 out of 5 again! This place is a must. Our server Nichole was amazing, she was so sweet and great recommendations. I had the ravioli, side Cesar, and shared the garlic bread. My boyfriend had the shrimp pasta and he loved it. For dessert we had this amazing chocolate Nutella cake with salted Carmel ice cream on the side. SOOOO GOOD. I love this place and I will always visit while I'm here.

1FwDepBojKDyxaJ3IiVhQQ.text: 3 of us ate here on a Tuesday evening at 7. We had reservations, but I don't think they were needed as it wasn't horribly busy. We ordered the meatballs as a starter and they were delicious. 1 person had lasagna. He didn't finish it and thought it had an odd taste. Another person ordered salmon. He thought it was great. I ordered chicken parmigiana. It was overall really good. The highlight of the meal was the focaccia bread they serve to begin with. Would definitely come back to try other things on the menu.

gCXmyBXf9Tqf5FMbAEW1vQ.text: Delicious food and great service. The wait and the line was a lot longer for the bakery across the way that's owned by the same family.

WxFJ6XaV5YCU9dwqMtm3gw.text: What an EXPERIENCE!  My wife and I were in Vegas for a short trip and as always wanted a dining experience.  We chose Buddy Vs and were not disappointed.  We had a 6:30 reservation on a Thursday.  Had a drink at the bar and enjoyed the live music that was playing in the bar area.  We then went to our table and were greeted by our waiter Giorgio who was born in Italy.  We told him we wanted an experience and with excitement he recommended the Intimate Dinner for Two.  Our only request was no octopus.  Warm bread straight from the pan was brought out.  We got a Black Rooster Chianti and Giorgio picked our second bottle.  We then were brought a plate of meatballs and a charcuterie board that would have made a great Italian hoagie.  Flavor was incredible and courses paced appropriately.  The main course followed with one plate containing a grilled lobster tail, pan fried sea bass pan with no breading, and pasta in a red sauce.  There was a second plate of linguini in a white sauce and a third plate of marinated sliced steak on a bed of mashed potatoes.  It was like having a bit of Venice, Rome and Tuscany at the table.  Throughout the meal Giorgio and the rest of the team would come by to make sure everything was to our satisfaction.  Seriously surpassed expectation.  We ended our meal with espresso and Frangelico, my wife had Amaretto and the dessert which was a plate with molten chocolate cake, toffee ice cream and a cream lobster tail.  Here is the kicker, all of that, remember two bottles of wine, for under $400.  It was truly the experience we were looking for in our meal.  Thanks to Giorgio and Emily the Manager for such a great evening.  If you are planning to go, make a reservation and ask for Giorgio.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert: Lobster tail, Molten chocolate cake and toffee ice cream
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs and meat and cheese board
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great wine

V3QUxvx-6iE0Sw2wdi2fSg.text: Disclaimer: This review is for the experience of TRYING to eat here, NOT for the food! But trying to go to a restaurant--particularly when you are on a vacation or a Staycation--may be almost as important as eating, itself.  Went by Buddy's early in the day (in late morning), to look into dining later that night. I immediately LOVED the decor, and homey, yet elegant look. The awning, wood floors and red checkered table cloths go well together, and it feels like you are in South Street Seaport in New York.  But, the hostess was useless, and had little to tell me that morning.  She was not friendly. She seemed more interested in dancing by herself to the tune that was playing. (They play good music there). So, I just decided to return later that night with my dinner companion.   Well, that was a mess. Now, for the first time that evening (at around 6:15pm), I learn that we needed reservations, and that the wait was 45 minutes to an hour, which we were not willing to do on our schedule.  And again, the hostess was super useless. She did not apologize for the wait, or invite us to sit at the bar (which was empty), nor did she explain why there was such a lengthy wait when we could clearly see that there were at least 4 or 5 apparently empty tables in the foreground. Instead, she made it seem like we were complete fools for not having reservations.  Not a good tactic with your prospective customers.    And I have a pet peeve of restaurant hostesses dressed like they are headed to a trashy nightclub.  Does not fit the family vibe that Buddy's seems to be going for (especially with the quaintly named dishes after family relatives, such as Aunties and Grandma).  The bakery across from the restaurant seems much better run and friendly!   I might return, but it will take a while and maybe some convincing.

CvkKVrvkWF2tO6VqfQRhQA.text: We were looking some good Italian in Vegas close to the Venetian so we decided to give this place a shot.  We had a positive experience, but not sure if we would go again given all the other dining options in the area.  Our waitress took our order and brought our drinks, not very engaging.  She she focused on efficiency and turning the table. A runner brought out the food and he was very engaging, offered to freshen our drinks and asked if everything looked good.  The food was tasty but the portions were not so generous as I would expect in a "family run" Italian place.

Nh68IgH0_j6DVoMIZctoFg.text: Overpriced average food. I ordered a $25 salad with shrimp and it was very average. Little flavor and a laughably small size. The only good thing was the mozzarella.   I don't mind paying more for good food but I don't appreciate overpriced hohum food.

c_QoEuc4px-roE6YzKyaeg.text: This restaurant was absolutely spectacular in every sense and I highly recommend anyone visiting Vegas to pay Buddy a visit! I made a reservation after reading the great reviews on yelp. The restaurant is classy yet casual. The ambiance is welcoming and doesn't make you feel like you are entering a "yuppie" restaurant. We were seated very quickly with my reservation. The kitchen is open so you can see the workers cooking and it is super clean. Smells delicious! I ordered a wine which was good. We had the mozzarella pesto bread as an appetizer. So good!!! Ok let's get to the meal. I had the rigatoni a la vodka. It was to die for! My partner ordered the chicken parm. It was so good too! We ate so much we couldn't get dessert. I'm sure those are delicious as well. Our waitress Kacie was very friendly and fast with service. I highly highly recommend this place. Buddy, great job  Came back 2019, September: if was delicious as expected. Our waitress, Grizella, was outstanding. I described the food as "orgasmic". It is so good. I can't say enough how much I recommend this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now this chicken parm is a CHICKEN PARM!!!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My absolute favorite plate! Dads carbonara. When I say this plate was orgasmic; You will be saying &#34;oohhhhh, ahhhhh, mmmmmm!&#34;
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs. Sounds &#34;typical&#34; but the taste was out of this world!

KW_lkDeQfcBUeayKNe2y1w.text: The first restaurant we dined in during this visit. We went to Vegas for an MS event. Since we were staying at the Venetian, we decided to search for a restaurant within the hotel. We found Buddy V's. I was quite excited since we all know Buddy from Cake Boss is popular. Likewise, I wanted to taste real food from a Baker! But, it will be hard to find the restaurant since its located far out from the main mall area of the Venetian. Heads up!  It was a lunch buffet. So we had a lot of choices to try. They had the salad, appetizer section, a carving section, kiddie section, an array of Italian pastas etc.. and a whole table filled with desserts.   We wanted to try everything but that's not possible. The roast beef on the carving station looked good but it was extremely tough.   My favorites.. the smoked salmon, a pasta that was so delicious just don't know the name , his mama's Italian meatballs, a cold pasta dish and tiramisu. Just check out the photos. Lol.  We enjoyed the restaurant so much that we dined there with the family again prior to leaving Vegas. Our first and last restaurant on this trip. And we celebrated my cousins bday there too..it was convenient to get a birthday cake since Carlos Bakery is right across the restaurant.

-OhBiRoyHQlxEU-NybfILw.text: The Express lunch for $22 is a great deal and the kids meals are actual good food adults would eat also.   Honestly this is the best Italian food I have had in a while. We loved the chicken piccata and the parmesan chicken. I am already planning on being back!
