gE6OI0J_UaCB-DBfm7VnEA.text: Buddy V's is really tasty! We came with a huge party and the food came out fairly quick.   They give you a big piece of warm, fluffy rosemary focaccia bread to start, and it is incredible.  I ordered the Chicken Parmesan and it was cooked to perfection with a good sized (but not overwhelming) portion of pasta and a HUGE serving of chicken. This is more than enough to share. The dish came with two large pieces of Chicken Parmesan and I couldn't even finish one piece on my own. Unless you are absolutely starving or eat meals like The Rock does you will have leftovers (but I was also super hungry and couldn't make a dent, so use your judgement). But seriously check out my picture if you don't believe the size of this thing.  I also got to try a crouton from my friend's Caesar salad and WOW. It's not a crouton but more like a square of polenta, so if you like polenta definitely get the Caesar because it's so unique. If you are only down for boring old croutons then don't order salad or you will be highly disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan

jBFwVVAABEjHYINOoTfcpA.text: My new favorite Italian spot! My GAWD is the food here phenomenal!!   My husband had been itching for a new place to try out, and of you've read my other reviews, we really don't like coming to the strip.   I tried making reservations on Open Table but they didn't have any spots available so I decided to call the restaurant directly ( recommended) I was able to get a reservation for 3 at 6:30.   We arrived a little late ( traffic on the strip) and we were still able to keep the reservation, I did call and let them know ahead of time of the situation. We were sat down and our sever came right over to us and introduced himself as Georgio, a True Italian OG. He made recommendations off and on the menu, which I always love to get!  We started off with the Mac and Cheese and Caesar Salad as an appetizer. It's not your ordinary Mac and Cheese and Salad. The Mac n cheese Carbonara has Smoked mozzarella, fontina, egg, pancetta, sweet peas, it's shareable between 2 people which is exactly what we did. Something that stood out of the salad was the croutons, they aren't just regular hard crunchy croutons, these were soft and had a lime zest to it. Turns out they are made out of polenta cheese and Italian cornmeal. It's really good   Now time for the fun part. I ordered the mother in law shrimp scampi and I instantly got a flavor of heaven!! Picture oven tomato, spinach, roasted garlic, white wine and mixed in with these plump huge shrimp!!! I've never had shrimp like this!!  My husband ordered the Valastro Sunday Gravy, it's  Buddy's family recipe. Meatballs, sausage, lamb, pork, bowl of rigatoni. Our sever wanted my husband to wait when his food came out so that he can show him the Italian way to eat his meal. I had to have a taste of his dish. So we did what any married couple does and picked off each other's plate. I loved his and he loved mine and together we can't wait to come back and try the other dishes that were recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac N &#39; Cheese Carbonara
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad

AUufU-p8x6gzh7haUMtivw.text: Perfect place for happy hour! I tried about four of the happy hour items and all were exquisite!   My gf is a huge fan of buddy so of course we had to stop by buddy's but I'm glad we did! We just ordered a bunch of their apps because we didn't want to be too full for Carlos bakery!   We got the Mac and cheese carbonara, smashed meatball sliders, calamari, and gnocchi. The Mac and cheese was super cheesy and noodles were cooked well. Same with the gnocchi! The calamari was crisp and flavorful. Meatball sliders were my fav, for sure. The sauce was delicious!  Everything was very cheap for the taste and portion. I would definitely come back and recommend this to anyone! Especially those in Vegas on a budget who's looking for some good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mlIM6FDMc9jI__DmneF1Rg.text: Best Italian food in town! They have lots of vegetarian options. Our favorites are cheese Ravioli and substituting the sauce to a vodka sauce, eggplant parm, and mashed potatoes. Their bread is served warm and soft! A must go to place in Vegas for Italian food!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

3V3PwUpFyOCDXB1VnQQtIQ.text: I've written over 2300 reviews and I've only awarded 20 FIVE STAR reviews ever. As crazy as this sounds, Buddy V's is number 20...  I didn't know Buddy V was that crazy reality TV chef from TLC's Cake Boss. I've seen his show a few times, and he does seem to be a more talented baker than that slob Duff over on the Food Network. I actually chose this place based on the pictures and the great reviews. It also helped that it was right across the bridge from Treasure Island.    Why five stars? The service was impeccable. It had been a long time since we've received such great service from start to finish. To put it in perspective, the service here was better than all of the other restaurants we dined at during our trip to Las Vegas and from our home town of San Diego. We didn't expect to be treated like VIPs but that's how we were treated here for dinner.  Our drinks were always full, new silverware was replaced after each dish, and we were checked on often.   The food did not disappoint either.   The complementary focaccia bread with the balsamic vinegar/olive oil was so good. Don't be shy asking for more!   We started with Buddy's Caprese (burrata, roasted vine ripened tomato, tear drop tomatoes, balsamic, extra virgin olive oil). So delicious and perfect for two people to share. Nice zing to those tomatoes.  For our mains we ordered the Parm (oven-baked, provolone, mozzarella, spaghetti marinara) and the Picatta (lemon caper olive oil, linguine, garlic). Both were so tasty and the chicken was incredibly moist. At home we can never seem to cook chicken this tender, so this was absolutely incredible.  I get it, Buddy V's sounds like every other Las Vegas Celebrity restaurant. But the service and the food here make this the best restaurant in Las Vegas as far as I'm concerned. Even better than my favorite celebrity Chef, Gordon Ramsey and his Hell's Kitchen restaurant. I will definitely give Buddy V's my highest recommendation to friends planning on visiting Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Prix-fixe&#34; menu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parm
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Picatta

kuHhwU8GhlDJXIx5vPyfsQ.text: I was worried to try this place... I live in the Bay Area and good Italian food that doesn't taste pre frozen or straight out of a can is hard to come by!   We came here for my sisters bday weekend and wanted to give it a try. By the looks of the pics the food looked pretty authentic and delicious!   They were able to accommodate our party of 9 and gave us a very spacious table right near the kitchen which we liked. Service was great, I don't remember our servers name but he was very efficient and nice! Answered all our questions multiple times and even recommended certain foods and the family meal and ways to share as a bigger party. I didn't realize we were there close to closing time and it was nice not to feel rushed at all! They made it seem like they would stay as long as needed.  I got the chicken parm and my husband got the lasagna and both were delicious! Chicken was so tender I could cut it with my fork! Sauce was delicious and the chicken perm had three types of cheese melted on top. Pricing was a bit High but worth it with the amount of food you got! They brought out warm bread with olive oil and balsamic (my fav!) and the lasagna was so cheesy and well made!   Atmosphere was nice and relaxing and can be a romantic classy dinner or just a casual come as you are place!   My only complaint is they rarely answer the phone! Took me a day and half to get a hold of them for a reservation and then day of about an hour to get through which is ok because they are busy but also might want to have more people answering calls.   Overall very satisfied and can't wait to come back!!!

WLTCr7ZXCJWsx46XyiXGew.text: Huge fan of the show so i came for happy hour -tourist on a budget. Wasn't sure if the food would be good Or bad but i thought it was delicious and unique!  Ordered the Mac and cheese, sliders, calamari, and the gnocchi. Every single item had its own twist. The cheese in the Mac and cheese was a unique taste! Not sure what was in it but it was soooo good! I wasn't a huge fan of the sliders but my boyfriend was. The calamari was a good portion for a happy hour portion! Tasted good and loved the sauce. The gnocchi was a bit weird. It tasted like really healthy vegetables in cake form?! Not the typical gnocchis that's I'm used to.   Customer service was super friendly! Made us feel welcomed and the service was super quick! Will be back for sure !

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum

0YP-qc6-xED95AZ1DJDiEw.text: Best Italian food I have had in a very long time! My server was Angela, she was very friendly and attentive. Very professional! Everyone on staff was very friendly. The food was perfection! I had the chicken Parmesan and spaghetti, it was cooked perfectly. Do yourself a favor and put this on your to do list in Las Vegas! Thank you Buddy Valastro!

EC4-xHZO8e52EmIpwbJClg.text: The Shrimp Scampi was absolutely delicious! Bit of a walk , especially if you don't know exactly where it is... closer to the strip than the parking garage, ladies, If you can wear your comfy heels or flats. They dont take last minute reservations but they do accept walk ins. I will definitely return!

cemOQN_zZEo_hHUQUfeVqA.text: We in Las Vegas....y'all!! Last night we celebrated my girlfriend's birthday and Charles was our server. He was definitely an interesting person, but made it the night laughable and super entertaining.  Our busser was Eddie, he was spot on A+ material and knew how to strike a good conversation and make us laugh. Food was spot and drinks were great. I would of gave this place 5 stars, but they did not have my Acai Mojito, and went along and made my drink without telling me in advance that they were out.  The drink replacement was good, but would of appreciated the heads up.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Birthday Cannoli

6II9sabfrenw0lJBLxwUTw.text: Came here randomly, just for dessert, because we had a gift card. We literally ordered about 4 different ones and out of all of them, the "lobster tail" was my favorite. A light and crispy pastry filled with pastry cream. Can't really go wrong but Buddy blew my expectations out of the water with this one!   The location is nice, right in the Venetian so it's very accessible from the strip. Very pretty restaurant with a great view. Server was super nice and very knowledgeable. Can't say much else because we only got dessert but the desserts are very good!

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian birthday cake

JnfCWwkrSKYs-K7NEc0Ysw.text: My family and I come here often for special occasions and we are never disappointed! The food is phenomenal, the service is top-notch, and we always leave happy and full.   Everything is delicious but they have the most amazing burrata caprese, polenta, the Sunday gravy, the chicken piccata, the four cheese truffle pizza, and cannoli!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WB5GiyjCnuxWJwoEnDf8jg.text: There are some things you can count on to be consistent. Buddy V's is one of them. I was in town this past weekend and stopped in and pick up a favowote dish for takout. Shrimp Scampi.  I am praying that they haven't changed the recipe but instead of Angel Hair - it was Linguine. It was bland. Really bland. It's normally lemony garlicky ans heaven in a bowl. It has some bread crumbs on top - also new. For a nearly $30 dish, I was beyond disappointed. I'd love to hear from Buddy V's to understand what happened. This was always one of my musts when I visit Vegas but I am skeptical now that they've messed with perfection. I pray it was just a new cook and they didn't change the recipe.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carlo&#39;s Bakery directly across the hall for dessert.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Parmigiana stack appetizer - it&#39;s a meal!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi

UoNu0aHWUxj-zyosx8t25w.text: We went here a few years ago and it was always packed and the wait was normally an hour plus. Fast forward to the present time and your wait is much more reasonable. The bakery however is always very busy!  Our next visit was much more reasonable. We were able to get a table within a few minutes around 4pm.  The atmosphere is a more relaxing classic Italian setting, than say Lavo which can get pretty loud.  To start off my wife ordered a Sangria and I got a Moscow Mule. Both were very good and I'd say even keel when it comes to alcohol content.   The Focaicca bread to start off with was warm and very good. We had seconds, it was sooo good!  I ordered the traditional spaghetti and meatballs. Ive always heard the meatballs were good here so I had to try them out. They were made from (lamb, pork, and beef) They were really good, light and tasted homemade, and the cheese tastes like it was freshly grated.  My wife had the Panzanella salad( buffalo mozzarella, tomatoes, cucumbers, focaccia croutons, baby arugula, caramelized onions, balsamic vinaigrette with added chicken. The salad was the size of a football field! She loved it and the chicken was moist and tender.   The Portions were on the larger size, but we were able to finish them, unfortunately we had no room for dessert which was a shame because the cannolies looked really good!  Next we're going to try the chicken parm and Eggplant, the table next to us ordered it and it looked amazing. They said it was really good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs. Really good.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t go wrong with this traditional dish. Spaghetti and meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Focaicca bread.

if4yz107Y5LY-MI6Cdsjww.text: Very good Italian food. We came here for happy hour and ordered from both menus. The staff was very nice. We were first seated in the regular area and asked about happy hour and got moved to the bar. It had a lot of room with a great view. I got the meat ball sandwich with a gnocchi (not made with potatoes) it was a corn bread kind of texture. Very good. The meat ball sliders were very filling. Their bread is very good. We also got shrimp scampi, the best shrimp and just regular spaghetti. All delicious. Their house sangria was very nice a mixture of white and red. Over very good happy hour time with great staff.

3z2yPQ4HToAj1iCUWREH6w.text: This was very good!  It has a nice upscale casual vibe and I love the decor in here! The bundt pans on the walls, rolling pin walls, etc. are fun without being tacky. There are a lot of italian restaurants in Vegas but very few of them are 'approachable' like this one. We aren't fancy and well-versed in upscale italian dishes - we like to be able to read the menu and know what we're getting! This place fit the bill while still being a nice sit down meal. The bread basket was an added bonus.   I had the chicken fettuccine alfredo. It tasted great and the portion was good-sized but it still tasted very light which is unusual for a pasta dish, however it was much appreciated in the Vegas heat!  I also tried the pepperoni pizza. I think the size was fair. It was okay - very fresh tasting, the sauce is especially bright. But I probably wouldn't order this again, I think there are better pizzas in Vegas.  My mom had the lasagna and she was impressed. I am not a lasagna person, personally, but I've been with people who do order it many times and most restaurants can't actually pull it off so I was surprised!  Our waitress was probably the biggest negative thing about this place. She was not very attentive and we couldn't find her when we needed her. On the other hand, the man attending to drinks in our area and boxing up orders and such was friendly and quick to help in her absence. He got a nice tip from us, larger than and separate from the waitress.  I will definitely be coming back and highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates non-fussy italian like we do!

yd-AqLWfopQYz4Nog-B84Q.text: An Italian brunch buffet? By buddy v? YES and YES. This buffet killed every aspect - the tomato soup was incredible, the Caesar salad, chicken parm, mac n cheese carbonara, all of it was delicious! The tomato soup was almost a mix between a creamy tomato broth and Mariana sauce. The Mac n cheese carbonara was such a unique spin on two of my favorites. So cheesy and so creamy, I kept grabbing more. Of course the classic chicken parm is a fan favorite. Each dish had so much flavor and tasted just like a home cooked meal. I couldn't decide which station to keep going back to first. The food just kept being brought out so everything was always fresh and never ran out.   Throw in the desserts, woah. Tiramisu, chocolate mousse, cannolis - you name it. My favorite was the chocolate mousse and it was so rich.   Italian that stands out is sometimes hard to find and when it's produced on such a large scale like for a buffet, it might all just taste ok but not here. Highly recommend this buffet and especially this restaurant. I would love to come back and try a full dish, but a great way to try a little bit of everything!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w__6qNo0Dp8Y2YSx5XBn4A.text: The setting looks like "mama's kitchen", which was adorable w/ rolling pins hanging from the ceiling and bundt cake pans on the wall. Their food spoke for itself from their appetizers, dinner, to dessert. Their cheese board is a MUST and worth the price. The lasagna had a good balance w/ cheese and tomato sauce, but for dessert.... the Butterscotch Creme Brule was sooooo good from the sugary shell and the vanilla mascarpone cream. Their customer service was just the cherry on top SHOUT OUT TO PETER bruhh! I can't wait to try their brunch (.... bottomless mimosa and bellinis!)

syo9itpobDPGJcYExqejgA.text: Was super excited to come here being a huge lover of Italian food and a Cake Boss fan.  We were seated relatively quickly in the "patio" area for their happy hour.  We started off with small bites right away, but our waiter never came back to take our freaking entree order.  We sat there patiently for half an hour after finishing our appetizers.  He specifically knew we were ordering more since we said we'll start off with the appetizers and asked to leave the menu since we were still ordering an entree.  While we were waiting for him to come back, the host grabbed the menu off our table and gave it to the table next to us, without even asking if we were done. We continued waiting and were so annoyed we didn't even order more food. So after 60 minutes of waiting for them to take our order, even though we told someone to grab out waiter so we could order earlier, we just asked for the check, which took another 30 minutes.  It's not like it was busy. Maybe 25% of the restaurant was full, and they had a separate person seating, a separate person taking order, another delivering the food, and another cleaning the tables and refilling water. Not to mention he was one of like 4 waiters, and the place isn't that big.  He charged us $16 for a medium beer, which is totally fine, but other waiter told us it should've only costed us $12, and then they said just kidding.  Seems kind of steep to go from $9-small and $16-medium. I'm a waiter so I'm pretty big on tipping.  Didn't bother to tip as the service was awful. I think our waiter's name was Danny or something. The host sucked too for grabbing our menu without asking, like dude, come on.  They were middle aged people so this was most likely their full time job since we went on a Thursday. You suck at your job guys.

JEQWUI1rg3TsDVH2QhBxcA.text: Did enjoy my food with the exception of the chicken parmigans burnt ends. Luckily portion was a good serving that I didn't feel that I was robbed of my meal will go again likely to try another menu item.

GAJF3-mqWOFargQe1kYJuw.text: My husband & I came here for dinner, they sat us by the window, which had awesome view of the  strip. Our waitress was pretty good, knowledge of the menu. Started with the calamari, which was good & soft. Then I had nonna 's lasagna, so good & cheesy. I would go back again.

aS8kxi-SGCpdXnHIfl3YyQ.text: I'm never entirely happy with my brunch choices in Vegas, possibly because we pay so much and my standards then are equally high. Buddy V's fulfilled my brunch expectations and was trully wonderful. Each bite was amazing! I will absolutely come back on our next visit. Don't leave Vegas without coming here, and specifically Sunday Brunch. Try everything!!

QxoLE7EqTqGbwC72RnXAtA.text: We went at prime time for dinner. The place was so full we had to wait 45 minutes for a table.  Once we were seated though the place was great. Service was good though a bit slow at times, the waiter was really passionate about the food and was able to recommend several options for my parents who don't normally eat Italian.   We ordered the osso buco, the shrimp scampi, and the gravy with rigatoni. All the food came out hot, and parmesan was very quick to be offered.  The food tasted great. Like the waiter said, the osso buco literally fell off the bone, I didn't need the knife at all. It was a bit oily, but otherwise very good. The polenta it was served with was creamy and well seasoned. I felt some vegetables/salad would have gone down nicely, but it was very good overall.  The shrimp scampi tasted very good, but the pasta seemed slightly overcooked (by maybe half a minute) and the sauce a little scarce. Flavour wise it was brilliant.   The gravy was probably the least impressive in my opinion, the sauce just needed something extra in terms of flavour to really make the meat stand out.  Portion sizes were generous, originally we were keen for dessert or a visit to the cake store just opposite, but it was a bit too much.   Overall it was a very good meal and one of the few decent Italian places I've been to in Vegas or anywhere else and it shows in how busy they were, but it seemed slightly let down by some small details.

I6r5Np1_HMwqxJ3Z8KdCvQ.text: We had the Roma Gnocchi, Mac & Cheese, Lasagna, and Cheese Ravioli. All were amazing! We sat in the bar area watching the game. Our server, Christian, was top notch! I'm talking Disney trained top notch. Had the Butterscotch Creme Brulee for desert. It was to die for! So glad we came here to eat.

RTehr-Tx78pEPcOq4lvBVw.text: Sorry Buddy but everything as just Ok for me. Had the meatballs, lasagna, and a antipasti lasagna was the best out of the 3. Also had the red velvet alcoholic bev. Just ok. I was really rooting for it to be good. Good luck and good eats!!!

97wrHD9U26csH56hY0Md6A.text: We stopped in and found out they had a Happy Hour Menu with small bites for $5. Must have is the Mac and Cheese. Very very flavorful, creamy and oh so DELISH!!! The peas were perfect and POPPED in your mouth. The panchetta was a perfect contrast to the silky smooth sauce and the crunchy bread crumb top provided a great texture to the top. The meatballs were fantastic and the bread with ricotta cheese was fantastic. Ask for Olive Oil and Balsamic Vinegar on the side. I ordered a melon martini off the drink menu. It was light, bright and strong! Had a wonderful bit of mint and citrus zest throughout. Lastly we rounded out the dinner with the Nutella Cake!! Oh my GOSH!!! I am not a BIG fan on Nutella and ate around the dollop in the center. The cake was extremely moist! The Salted Carmel ice cream that is made in house at their other restaurant was SUPERB!!! Loved the peanut brittle on the bottom. Try each one seperate and after all together you will NOT be disappointed! We sat in the bar by the window and the view was great. Loved the decor with the rolling pins hanging throughout and HUGE beaters mixed in with the lights. We had a great night! Enjoy!

4D61cShq1mtZNvO_bzZmhQ.text: I have eaten here twice so far this year and can't wait to come back in August. The veal parmesan is the best I have ever had. Appetizers and salad also great. I am always with a group and everyone always raves about the food. Good job guys.

zgnWZmHt2s7oZVqwaOb1GA.text: The food is average, but the desserts...oh oh oh!!! Some of the best I've ever tasted! The Italian birthday cake and Lobster Tail are to die for. Skip Carlo's bakery and order the desserts at Buddy V's!!!!

68V5RWOkFtFItWlP49i0Fg.text: We tried to go there last night and, if the hostesses don't change their poor customer service, this place won't be there for too much longer. Walked up at 5:15 p to make a reservation for 8 at 6 p. The restaurant was very light with guests and, there were plenty of open tables in our sight. One hostess told us the earliest we could be seated was 7:15 p. Then, a 2nd hostess popped up and said it wouldn't be before 7:45. Not a problem, we went to Cannaletto in the Grand Canal Shops. We were accommodated, the food and wine was superb. It was a great dining experience. Buddy, you better go visit soon or, you're going to regret it. Your restaurant management is killing your restaurant and, your reputation.

sNDAQ9yplZzqvJp87nnlRg.text: Positive - Nice view. Nice atmosphere. Polite staff.   Negative - Too pricey for what you get. I felt the food quality was pretty low. The person I went with didn't care for it either and it was his second visit.

T2BFgUOrgVC6yfmutk9jtQ.text: Was really skeptical when my husband told me we were meeting friends here for dinner. So many times famous television chefs have a restaurant and it is not very good...this was not the case with Buddy's! The service was exceptional. She recommended three different meals: Chicken Parm, Lasagna, and Chicken Rigatoni. We had the Chicken Parm, the Chicken Rigatoni, and I went for the Chicken Marsala, as it is one of my favorites. Each meal was delicious! There was not a speck left on our plates!  I will definitely return AND recommend it to all,

LKRWttaEh6MsUvtNzKv4PA.text: Food was a 4 star but the service was a 3 at best. We used open table to book a reservation for 2 at 9pm about 30 min before we arrived on a Friday night but other people were walking in with no problems. Cheese Bread was good, lasagna was excellent, grilled chicken was good and Ceasar Salad was great. Other servers looked more engaged with their tables than out blonde waitress but maybe just luck of the draw. For $120 for 2 people before tip I'd rather go to Buchon.

8mcX0IX6C0lZJOSIUoJZFA.text: The food was pretty good! Their birthday cake was totally awesome. The busboy Victor M was more helpful than our waiter! The hostesses are rude, nasty & lazy! They were so busy talking about what they were going to do that night that they actually got upset with the people in my party for interrupting their plan making! Put these girls in the kitchen to wash dishes where they belong! Get some one better out front please!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6RzhuOyMfSBRhBC6PdRbeQ.text: I teetered between a 3 and 4... the four because the portion size was good (my linguine with calms had clams in the shell AND chopped inside the pasta,) not huge 5 pound plates of pasta; however, spending $26 for a plate of pasta may turn off a lot of customers - but you're in Vegas. A four because my Drago Rosso cocktail was very good, a touch of spice and the mango garnish was delish. Also enjoyed a regular Caesar salad, but the "croutons" were actually yummy, warm, cubes of polenta, right on! Now for the "eh..." Sunday gravy plate - loved meat variety, but couldn't look over salty sauce. Service was okay, couldn't find her half the time, but when she was there she was attentive and kind, without being over the top. Lastly, I made a reservation, confirmed the next day, and when I showed up at five 'till then said they couldn't find it. A 4 because they said they'd sit us anyway, and we did within 5 minutes, but how do you lose my reservation? Doesn't make me feel like my time was worth it to you if you can't even find my name in your records. Will come back, because that was my second visit and I craved to go back last night. But I will be more open to try a new restaurant next time.

VeXNBAxLv1SvlxScCCYEag.text: We weren't quite as impressed as a year ago. First, with a reservation, we were seated in the bar area. It was loud, noisy and the a/c was blowing directly on us. The hostess said nothing else was available. We spotted a booth that just opened up lower down and requested the change of table from the server. Great service in the booth that we were moved to. I ordered from their special menu that was all inclusive. I chose the chicken Parmesan. It was tasty but the sauce was a bit more bland than I prefer. I have to say the cannoli and tiramisu were out of this world. I enjoyed the tomato basil soup as well. This experience was ruined by the hostess seating a reservation at a bar table.

qvrkyfR_LvQDO6AazYUXaQ.text: I made reservations mid afternoon on Wednesday for our group of ten.  We were seated shortly after arriving and got sat next to a noisy group.  Our waiter was able to project his voice to go over some of his favorites on the menu.  We ended up ordering two orders of the salumi and cheese board.  I am allergic to fennel and was assured by the waiter that pasta dish I ordered was in the clear.  Several in the group ordered the  Sunday gravy and were in heaven.  The chicken Parmesan was also a hit (a dish I had on my first visit several months ago). One couple in the group ordered the  waiters favorite grandmas meatballs.  The bread and oil/vinegar was amazing as always.  The group was really impressed with the service we had.  Six of them had never been before.  They were very happy with our pick for dinner our first night in vegas!

CC1V6Eh023CFelq4_8X1xw.text: Let me start off by stating the positive, the service was excellent. Our waiter was very attentive, efficient and friendly. The food was  average, a bit overpriced. I probably won't go back but had to try it.

2yTi7X1pd89Yk1s4lRLXXA.text: I was really surprised. I thought it would rely in its name to generate business. First thing is the service was excellent. Drinks were never empty and servers were friendly and prompt. The food was very good too. My son had Mac and cheese and said it was the best he's ever had. I had an Italian sub and Caesar Salad and both were delicious. We didn't have dessert but from what we saw that was probably a mistake. I'll definitely be back next time in Vegas.

cNVWjYbWmimle_3xDfIwxw.text: Amazing dinner, great atmosphere and exceptional service! We came here for my moms 60th bday. Our server, Peter, was so incredibly friendly and was joking around with us the whole time. He definitely made the experience an unforgettable one! The surf and turf was SO good, my steak was cooked perfectly medium-rare and that lobster! Yum! We order the garlic bread and mozzarella appetizers and they were both just delicious. The creme brulee was INCREDIBLE. As was the lobster tail dessert and the Nutella chocolate lava cake thing. We will definitely be coming back! Thanks, Peter for the great service! Oh, and the prices are so reasonable! Between $30-$50 per plate but it has the atmosphere more like a fine dining setting.

fEenB_hcOowDj1ViA9gobQ.text: Food was ok. Host sat us at the bar when she said that the dinning room was full. After us a bigger party came in and they were sat in the dinning room.

2_yw_DSqE00NV-7G-Cy-sg.text: I was slightly skeptical thinking it would not be good. The apps are average. The pastas...exceptional! Pomodoro was perfect, the lasagna is super huge and delish and the pasta alla vodka was amazing! All of the pasta is perfectly cooked. Oh, and make sure you leave room for dessert. The tiramisu had a chocolate cake surprise at the bottom. I hate the word moist but that's exactly what it was...MOIST. I couldn't stop eating it. Nice views so ask for a table by the window. The restaurant is not easy to find so just ask for directions...don't wander around.

4wtTOUIFQxojZmkgOww13w.text: Carlos bakery was too packed so we decided to go to Buddy V's Ristorante instead to taste some of the desserts. We sat in bar area and our waitress/bar tender was not good. She barely spoke, her hair was in my drink and she really didn't do anything more than what she had to. We witnessed another customer, 2 women waiting to be served. They started at the bar, moved to a table, moved to another table and waited and waited and the waitress/bar tender never helped them so they left. It wasn't busy either. As far as food, I had the Italian cake and I wasn't impressed. I'm not a cream person so maybe that's why I didn't like it.

pHHnKtApfG6nDKbS-CDZlA.text: So disappointed. Not what I was hoping for. This was my very first experience at a celebrity chef restaurant. I had high hopes. The atmosphere was nice, homey touches here and there, nicely decorated, and cute touches like whisks for the light figures. My disappointment was with the food. I ordered the chicken Marsala on the advice of our server.  Unfortunately, my chicken was not properly trimmed, and had a large strip of fat on both pieces. In addition, the chicken was overcooked and chewy. (A patron at the next table had chicken rigatoni, and felt his chicken was overcooked as well). It seemed like the chicken breasts had been cooked earlier in the day and then reheated. The Marsala sauce did not have the sweet flavor you usually taste with Marsala, and tasted more like a simple brown sauce with very little flavor. The side pasta that came with the Marsala was well cooked, well seasoned, and quite tasty. My husband ordered the lasagne, as it was a "specialty" according to the server. The lasagne was fine, although not really any better than other Italian restaurants I have tried. It is heavy on the veal, and heavily seasoned with anise.  If you really like anise, it's definitely the lasagne for you. We ordered the famous lobster tail for dessert.  It was a very small portion for the price ($9 for a piece the size of a very small pear) and did not taste fresh. The cream filling was very good, but the pastry was very chewy and even hard to cut through.  On the plus side, the service was very good, and the focaccia before dinner was also very good.  I was just disappointed that the food was not better quality for the price.

jt6MM7S2sYJwM_MKAoZVCQ.text: Calamari is mediocre, like many other places in Vegas it is overhyped. They are not flexible. Bread is very tasty with oil and vinegar. The main attraction is the desserts. The Caesar salad has delicious cornbread croutons that are soft. Chicken Parmesan is well made not anything special. The chicken piccata is excellent and very flavorful. Tomato Basil soup is well but not anything special. The lasagna is on par with several franchise locations nothing extravagant. The Nutella cake taste like any other chocolate cake I could faintly taste the Nutella. The salted carmel Ice cream and raspberry sherbet is excellent and has a unique flavor. The cannoli is very good as well and is a must to order if you come here I will say the service is excellent. Waiters are very attentive and are aware of their customers desires and level of drinks. The service is very friendly and insightful on the menu.       In conclusion many of the dishes are very normal tasting. The desserts are very good overall. It is overpriced for what you get in respect to food but I say it's good to try once. If you are in for the deserts the bakery across has the same ones but will have a long wait.

zzFv0M8KUIjCODCsv-JP0w.text: Best Eggplant Parmigiana I have ever had. My sisters (shared the steak) also loved their meal. The host was absolutely fabulous - didn't get his name but he is Buddy's cousin. He had an eye on everything and was always dropping in to all the tables to make sure everyone was having a good time and if anything was needed. Always managing to take away a stray glass or refill an empty one as he chatted. I asked for the appy Eggplant Parmigiana as I wasn't too hungry. When he brought it out he said "don't get upset now but I upgraded you to the entree size, no charge, but it is just too delicious to eat just a small bit". He was right - best ever and since my sisters took a fair bit off my plate, it worked out well. For dessert we ordered one cannoli to split. We were so full! Anyway what does he do but come out with 3 (no charge) because it would be "terrible" if we couldn't pick them up with our hands and  eat one each to ourselves. He was right again and they were incredibly delicious! Best host ever! Great dining experience!!!!!!

S8MYJtC0wphF9JBsQfzGAQ.text: Had a really good experience at Buddy V's.  Nice Italian food and truly HUGE portions.  On a Wednesday night, it was kind of like family night with a lot of kids in the room.  Speaking of kids, the kid menu portion were also huge.  As it turns out, 3 of us could have easily gotten a way with a single entree.  These were heavily cheesy meals with pasta to perfection.    What keeps the place from being a 5 is that the actual quality wasn't that special but it's a definitely above average offering and experience

Nc4jVWjPV1DKH5TChvPDIg.text: Best Caesar Salad I have ever had! Polenta croutons are an amazing touch. Dinner portions are small for the price but they still get 5 stars for the salad! Will be back every time I am in Vegas!!

oswQzQ1gsGtAQpOCjZFyhw.text: Service was exceptional. Went there for dinner with friends Ina recommendation from our lunch server. The pasta was amazing and desserts were delicious. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

2wWpnI_MM3f_U8afE45hMg.text: After trying to get a table at other places, we went here. It's not that we didn't think it would be good, but didn't want to go to yet another celebrity-associated restaurant. Enough with the names and prices to go with it. We were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed it.   There was a wait at 8pm on a Sunday night, so reservations help. We were told the wait would be an hour. We made reservations on-line and only waited 25 minuets!   The decor is nice-- the ceiling light fixtures are cool. Big whisk attachments-cool use for them. They have an open kitchen and it smells wonderful. Lots of red and dark wood, feels very comfortable.   We ordered a Caesar salad, garlic bread and panzenella salad to start. The Caesar salad was the best I've had in a long time. Very garlicky, croutons that were warm, soft with a little crunch and a hint of fennel in the salad.  Just the perfect amount of fresh Parmesan cheese. The panzenella was delicious with the same lovely bread, fresh tomatoes and a great dressing. The garlic bread was cheesy, dense and delicious. Just like you imagine good garlic cheese bread should be.   For dinner, we ordered the spaghetti Bolognese ( for the little one), lasagna, and the Sunday Gravy. The little one wanted lasagna instead, so I traded with him. The kids' spaghetti was plenty for an adult ( I left half of it at that) and incredible. Some of the best I've had that I can remember. The lasagna, although expensive for what it is, was equally delicious. Baked in a cast-iron pan, it was warm, gooey and delicious, with a light tomato sauce on top. The Sunday Gravy was good, but he agreed that  the Bolognese and lasagna were infinitely better.   We didn't order dessert, but those around us who ordered got cannoli, which looked fantastic. By the way, Carlo's Bakery is across from Buddy V's if you want something for later.   We would definitely go back and definitely recommend!

Ci1Xr7pnfEIj3JxcJeQeAw.text: Soo excited to go to the Cake Boss restaurant and bakery! The food and atmosphere was great! service was excellent!! The chocolate mousse cake was the most amazing cake I've ever eaten!!

auGlyhUdVM-LVkdgJJSNww.text: Amazing!!! The wait staff was kind and attentive. Even though the place was packed, we were never unattended. I had the scallops and they were easily the best ive ever had. My mom had the turkey lasanga and it was so good. Definetely reccomend those two things.

wqcAwLoSs527CxvdSGSiFw.text: My Fiance and I had dinner here on a weeknight. The service was prompt and attentive...perhaps a bit awkwardly overly attentive, but no complaints here. The food was discouraging though - It was only so-so. Afterward we moved onto dessert and had the birthday cake and it was mind blowingly good. I have never had better. Although a fan of the show, I can now say I've experienced why Buddy is called the Cake Boss. The disappointment came at the check...we split all dished: an appetizer, main dish, and desert with ice cream and had no drinks....$76. I probably won't return to the restaurant, but I sure will hit the bakery when it opens up next door.

HShWyKGP5YmVtVN9Qmadcw.text: Had a great meal, appetizer, chicken Parmesan and dessert were all great at a good price.

jj0YglBzZubTUHLRpExVZA.text: Tomato soup was delicious, caesar salad had lots of chicken.

IHaHnYGvEqskMuxR9HrdTw.text: Can't wait to come back tomorrow!   Michele, Adam and the entire staff are fantastic!

NlKKK8GC0uc0t1nC9QA9Kw.text: We're there sat at 830. No one waiting. The lady ask us to wait for a bit. After 10 mins, the other girl lead us sitting outside of the restaurant. We asked if there is any table inside. She replied. Oh inside, it will be another one and half hr wait. (But clearly there have several tables open inside and it was not a busy night). Then we politely said we will go somewhere else. The lady said. Really, are you sure.       :)  There are lots of choices in Vegas..  We end up with another Italian restaurant.   Thanks but no thanks buddy.

aPa-tc9RtVg7rlzGqCxBfA.text: Had a yummy dinner here with hubby and a friend during a work conference. We started off with an order of fries and a caprese salad. The fries were excellent, and our waitress had the kitchen made a larger caprese salad for us so we could share it. It turned out it was burrata cheese, which was awesome. Hubby had the enormous veal parmesan chop and it was the size of a dinner plate. Our friend had the lasagna, and I had the scallops. All the entrees were excellent. They miss the mark a little on dessert. Although I had a molten nutella cake which was delish, hubby had the Italian birthday cake which was extremely bland and very disappointing. Our friend had the lemon cheesecake, which had a nice bright lemony flavor, but I'm just not a fan of cheesecake, so I can't impartially rate that. Overall, a great dining experience, although the place is extremely loud and I was hoarse by the end of the meal from trying to be heard over the din! Oh, and Buddy was actually there that night making the rounds saying hello to people. That was kind of fun too!

RdzNvFO-41HPgdBC0RG1Uw.text: Very pleasantly surprised.  Granted, my friends and I stopped by just for a light lunch, so we didn't have any entrees.  But the eggplant parm appetizier, garlic bread and panzanella salad were superb!

6duqHSC5vxTHPw19yzfLFw.text: My husband and I come to Vegas frequently so of course when Buddy's opened we had to try it.  We experienced the best service of our lives, and we've eaten at 99% of the restaurants on the strip.  Our server Deanna was very attentive and friendly.  I will definitely request her table during my next visit.  The food was top notch quality food.  The caprese had amazingly fresh mozzarella, and the chicken parm was tender and delicious.  The cannolis are to die for....melt in your mouth amazing.  I can't wait to come back!

WrMNrvVYXqRNzBmKcwnIwg.text: Food was ok nothing to write home about. We sat down and drink order was taken right away. Two min later a different person gave us the drink list and tried to take our drink order. Two min after that a 3rd person did the same thing. Portions were VERY small but taste was good. Service was terrible! They seriously took our plates away as we were still eating--like fork in hand headed toward the mouth and they take the plate away. We went for lunch and the restaurant was very empty so this type of rushed service was unnecessary! Probably will never go back.

L-Xeznl8SXt-tizcfeOkcA.text: My wife and I had dinner at buddy vs this weekend and it was pretty good. Except my chicken Parmesan had VERY salty cheese on it. Calamari was pretty good and they give pretty good portions.

9OcbAYZntVNQtEeMwStUzg.text: One of my Italian Food places ever! First of all, the best dessert I've ever tasted in my life....Italian Birthday Cake is the bomb and a must have! I just wish Buddy would open a place in LA, so us Southern Californian's could partake in the flavors of his families recipes ! His Chicken Parmigiana is outstanding, (order extra sauce!) and the Chicken PIccata is my husband's favorite. We love the feel of the restaurant, the view is beautiful, (although we hate that it's in Sheldon Adelson's place), and we try to make sure we stop there every time we're in Vegas. We even ordered meals to go last time we were there....and the restaurant packaged everything up beautifully for our drive. Order your desserts when you're dining at the restaurant, and you can skip the line across the way at the Bakery.

pYX8UMHY7D5Ofrf4Zx6Btg.text: My friend Katie from Calif. chose dinner at Buddy V's to celebrate her 50th birthday, we are so glad she did! We are obliged to express our amazing experience of the service we received by our server Peter on the evening of November 14, 2015. We have always been pleased with excellent food and service we receive at Buddy V's. However, this time Peter's professionalism and attention to details (serving 5 women, each requesting something different) exceeded our expectations and he made the celebration dinner even more memorable. Such commitment to great customer service is to be commended! We highly recommend Buddy V's as a place to celebrate, and request Peter as your server if you want the 5 star dining experience.

t1or1PGshrDYYrH6-kSrBw.text: So the wife and I went to Buddy V's last night and here are my thoughts.  Overall it was a good dining experience, but not a great one.  I wasn't bowled over by either the service or the food, (except for the desert).  It was just kind of okay and most likely won't go back. First off, the restaurant is tucked away in a spot that has a fantastic view of the Strip, but the internal design was emotionally cold.  I want an Italian-American restaurant to be warm and inviting and this place was trying too hard to be fancy, (which is most likely a result of its being in the Venetian).  We didn't order any appetizers but for entrees my wife had the Veal Marsala and I had the Chicken Parm.  My wife and I both loved the taste of our meals.  They were both well prepared but both were a bit on the small side for the money they are charging. The Chicken Parm had only two cutlets and the side of spaghetti was only about a half a cup's worth.  Same with the wife's dish.  Like I said both tasted real good, but not really any better than any other Italian joint in town. Also, they give you fancy Focaccia bread with dinner.  Sadly they offer no butter or Olive oil to go with it and really, the bread had a distinctive taste to it, which made it non-optimal for dipping.  I'd rather have warm, fresh, and plain Italian bread over the fancy stuff.  For desert we shared a Tiramisu and that was fantastic.  The quality and taste of it was spot on.   As far as the service, the wait staff was very attentive.  Our waiter was professional but a bit stoic.   We probably won't go back because I can get just as good Italian food from a local spot 10 minutes from my house but the desert was great so maybe it's worth it to try lunch there instead of dinner paired with desert.

ti14Coacz93j55fi29bs_A.text: Took my 13 year old daughter there for her birthday dinner. She loves cake boss. We however brought our own cake and they were nice enough to store it in back.  Our server Perry was top notch and went above and beyond to please my entire family including finding candles for me because I forgot them. From beginning to end perfect service that complimented the tasty food.  You will not be disappointed.  Get a seat by the window so you can see the strip.  We will eat here again!

dlTr9n8sh4_u97XY2zis5w.text: The food was excellent and with it being a newly opened I expected some issues. When we first arrived the waiter was not my favorite and was extremely rude, once he realized that we were there during restaurant week. But I spoke to the manager and she switched us to a new server. This guy made our night and I would go back just for him to serve us again. The chicken parm was the best I have ever had and lobster tail dessert was amazing. The only other issue was that we got a child's pizza for my son and it arrived after the rest of us were done with our meals. But the problem was fixed again by same manager and they took it off our bill.

4ACT2ry8IygDTIe80puUAw.text: It was mine and my husbands 14 year anniversary and I was looking for a fantastic restaurant for us to go out to for a romantic evening! I was recommended by a friend to try Buddy Vs because she works as a concierge on the strip and said it has been a pretty popular choice among tourists.... Let me start by saying people must like this place bc of the fact that it's owner has a tv show because I was very unimpressed!  Ok, let me say that it is a beautiful restaurant but not much for a romantic evening... My husband and I were sat at a table barely large enough to hold out plates on, and we were in between 2 other larger parties! We felt completely cramped and not the least bit romantic! However we decided to try to make the best of our night and ordered some of our favorite Italian dishes! When our food arrived I wouldn't put it too far past a fast food Italian taste! There was nothing great about our food and most definitely not worth the price! We are locals who love good Italian food and there are many, and I do mean many, that we have tried off the strip who far exceed Buddy Vs! We will leave this restaurant for the tourists!

gAD5XxeBy9LEvhcHfc8uZA.text: Amazing service & food. We were served by charles and he was the best server ive ever had. He really knows whats hes doing . Buddy should be greatful he has him representing his business!!   Charles gave us advice about vegas attractions, and gave us advice about the menu... boy was he right. Get the bolanase speghitti amazing!!!!

5t_vFhLsd0t_ZU5n2hIewg.text: The food was great and the service amazing! You feel at home and very welcomed as soon you walk in the door.

8rw8ymmDPk9ntEb_C1kmpQ.text: Only thing better than the food was the service. A taste of Italy in Nevada! Made a reservation for a Friday night and got right in with no wait. Hostess staff was warm and welcoming. Started off with a nice Brunello and Caprese with burrata cheese and organic heirloom tomatoes,  accompanied with grilled Italian bread. The manager Kristina was very attentive and brought us their nicest red wine glasses for our Brunello, which we really appreciated. The Caprese was one of the best my husband and I have ever tasted. We have been blessed to spend lots of time in Italy and have had some spectacular Italian meals. Buddy V's was right up there with the best we've had in Florence, Rome and Tuscany. The pasta was perfectly al dente, prepared by Executive Chef Bryan, who we had the pleasure of meeting. We finished our meal with their spectacular cannoli's that were clearly made fresh to order based on their crunchy shell. We can't say enough about our experience at Buddy V's.....from the hostess, busboys, server, managers. This group definitely worked well together just like a big Italian family.

FNaQ0InJ3E60hw7x5LvtUw.text: Everything was perfect except it was extremely loud. And our souvenir glasses.  We ordered the drinks in very nice souvenir glasses. We usually do this at all the tourist places that offer this. We thought our daughters would love them. They love watching the cake boss. Usually they will bring you a new glass wrapped up and you're set.  When we got back from our trip we gave the boxes to our daughters and they opened them and here they were the glasses we drank out of and had beer residue and lemonade residue in it. How embarrassing. The beer one smelled so bad. I thought we were getting new glasses. They could have at least washed them. Good thing we gave them to our kids and not someone else. They were horribly dirty.  Our Server was explaining the appetizers and I heard absolutely nothing he said.  We were sat at a small table for two and I maybe said 5 words the whole time. Because it was too hard to carry on a conversation.  It was our last night in Vegas and I wanted something romantic and memorable.  When I think of Italian food I think romantic and intimate.  It was not. That's the only thing I didn't enjoy.   Food and drinks were amazing.

aPaPQP0UFF5CUi0-f9Fnuw.text: Loved this place!  Peter our waiter was great. The chicken parm was excellent. Would definitely go here again. Portion was just right.  Meals came out quickly. Definitely make a reservation because they had long wait time if you didn't have one

Qvp5_vwP8Oik0w_B9WusRw.text: Overall probably 3 is fair. The space has gorgeous views and is worth the short walk from venetian or palazzo. The food is above average Italian, but not spectacular. The focaccia should've been warm, and why do we need to ask for olive oil? That's not authentic . We had chicken parm and pasta. We said we were sharing but plates were just dumped. Had a very nice bus boy but the waiter was creepy and a little scary. The chicken parm was good, pasta was a little on the creamy side. Overall pretty mediocre for the Boss, hope the cakes are better and they hire some pleasant waiters

1VI3qakgqmsooUqsllr44A.text: This restaurant is a perfect experience for any Cake Boss fan. The food tastes like you stepped into Buddy's home. Very delicious! And the portions are the perfect size. The garlic bread is amazing and fresh. And you have to go for the lobster tail for dessert!

fjja6VtmDgpUJqScCSe4-Q.text: There are too many Italian restaurants on the strip or in the Venetian for that matter to waste your time here. Service was kinda crappy. I was severely underwhelmed by the lunch menu and felt like I was at universal studios at buca di beppo. Tourist trap. 3 stars because it wasnt bad and price was fine. Just not great and certainly not worth trying while in Vegas. Oh and the entrees are splitable despite their up sale attempts. Again think buca's

oa-R68GRkYx-qDRjqpsysA.text: I'm a big fan of his bakeries, so I had high expectations and this place definitely delivered. Nice, swanky look to the place, GREAT view of the strip and even a giant billboard against the backdrop of the Wynn and Encore that was pretty cool to have there. I actually don't really like Italian food, but I thought the food was great. Great service too. The clientele was nice and above-casual. The desserts were amazing. Would definitely come here again. Best part is, when you leave, Buddy's famous Carlo's Bakery is right there!

D8Ry5VxQzNmprpm8Kn492Q.text: The hubs and I RARELY go out for Italian food. Why? Well, because we can make most of the dishes at home with high quality ingredients. Well, when I had some family in town, I suggested all of us going to Buddy V's only because :1. Pit stop at Carlo's Bakery; 2. It's easy for me to get back on the I-15 to head back to suburbia. 3. Italian food is always safe when entertaining guests. Well, my cousins decided to day drink while waiting for me to get off of work, so by dinner time, they were fighting off a massive hangover. And it wasn't even 5 PM. Then they blew us off.  The hubs and I decided to take advantage of our time together with our diva because we both had lobster tails from Carlo's Bakery on our mind. We figured, dinner was going to be a bonus, so I don't have to cook and clean, and we made the trek from suburbia to the Strip.  We checked in for our reservation and was seated within a couple of minutes. When I made the reservation, I requested a table along the windows for the view. I noticed all the tables along the windows were designed for larger parties and I was prepared for them to seat us at a smaller table since our party decreased from 6 to 3. But no, they get a high five for seating our party of 3 at the  primo table that had a view of the Strip as well as a view of Carlo's Bakery so we can keep an eye on our number.  Our server, was personable, just a tad slow. I'll take 'a tad slow' over crappy personality any day. We ordered: Kids Margharita Pizza Grandma's meatballs Caesar salad Chicken Parmesan Agnolotti  I enjoyed  everything that we ordered. I thought the pizza crust was outstanding; thin, crunch AND chewy, perfect amount of sauce and cheese. The meatballs were heavenly. The Caesar salad took us by surprise. When it arrived at the table, we thought the salad looked dry. But when we took our first bite, we understood why it looked like it was dry. It was one of the best Caesar salads I've ever had. It didn't need all that dressing because each bite had the perfect amount of acid, garlic, cheese and saltiness from the anchovies. The croutons were unique; I forgot to ask but I think it was made out of polenta. The croutons were perfect to dip with the meatballs. I had the Chicken Parmesan; it was good not great. MY hub's agnolottis were divine. Hand made, they were filled with veal shank, sausage and pork with a creamy, sage brown butter. The one complaint I had was I thought the agnolotti pastry was a tad thick but the flavors were very good.  All together, we spend $113 with tip for 2 adults and a princess. A tad high for a family dinner, but overall, it was a great experience for us. Too bad my cousins were too drunk. But that's what you do in Vegas.

oTGXM4zq_UMkiFaqmhcoJA.text: BEST DINNER OF THE TRIP!!!!! I got a caesar salad to start, the carbonara, and Lisa's Nutella cake! OUT OF THIS WORLD. The only problem was I was so stuffed by the time dessert cake I couldn't eat the whole thing lol. The ambience was very laid back, with piano music playing as we were overlooking the Las Vegas strip. The musician even came over to the tables to see how we were enjoying ourselves. I eat Italian food very regularly as I am Italian and from Boston, and this was up there with the best Italian dishes I've ever had!!!   The busser was so sweet and attentive we thought he was our server at first! Could not bring us enough bread or help us enough!! However the waitress had no personality, was rude when we asked about the happy hour specials and really did nothing for out experience. Overall I would recommend this to all!!!!!

AIrbQ5-wqdaSFDH1XL1HHQ.text: I just had the best chicken parmesan ever. The service was attentive, every time I looked someone was filling my drinks, asking how I was doing and bringing me food. I ordered off of the lunch express menu. For $22 I received 3 large meatballs, a full sized chicken Parmesan and a cannoli. I highly recommend this place.

b-3OiR59SftrkMDcJExI7w.text: Had a great dinner at Buddy's V's. Food was great staff the same would highly recommend if you are in Las Vegas!!!

7eslMg_nEcjnxk8HcgwrZQ.text: The food was delicious and the service was courteous, fast, and friendly. An even better bonus: Buddy himself was there that day to film for his show! He stopped by every table to greet everyone, ask how the food was, and to take pictures. The sangria was great, as were the panzanella, meatball sub, and canolis. Not saying this because we met Buddy, as I already formed my opinion on the food before we met him. Great experience, and I would definitely recommend if you're on the strip in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_9Y0xD5iuGDfiFTzMXaaIQ.text: This placed is SOOO GOOD!!! This was in our top 3 favorite restaurants on our last Vegas trip. We went for lunch, the atmosphere was pretty casual, for dinner you would need to be more dressed up.   My husband got the meatball sandwich and said it was amazing! I got the Buddies Favorite Pizza, it was the perfect size for lunch.  Everything tasted so fresh! I wish I could eat at Buddy's again.... (well sooner than a year from now)

NdmlNmWZYIahPETu_Uk9ew.text: Place is roomy, food is good. A bit overpriced but it's worth it. Kinda hard to find inside the hotel and casino. If you have someone that can't walk too much I wouldn't recommend it cause it might take a few minutes to find it inside all the Vegas chaos.

JrTNq-vt4DQ_AjOg5UZr1w.text: Always have heard about this place so my husband and i decided to check it out. Service was great...but the back waiter was right on. He pretty much took care of everything. My husband had thr shrimp scampi he said it was ok nothing to brag about. There was not much of a robust flavor to it and the pasta was very starchy as in they didnt rinse it very well. I had the Caprese salad and I have to admit that it was amazing. We also had the meatballs which were tasty. The garlic bread was ok but not fond of the cheese on it. The atmosphere was laid back which was nice. We sat in the bar area because there werent any seats available in the dining area.  So I give this place 3 stars because it wasnt amazing but it always wasnt that bad. Average i would say. Minus that Caprese salad that was amazing.

SCo8H85azrpOLH7YvViAfA.text: Excellent service and the NY strip steak was incredible.  Would highly recommend this place. Everyone was attentive.

Nek6nVC6P7OAbeR76IieWQ.text: The ambience and staff made our dinner memorable. We arrived a bit early for our reservation and they were able to seat us in no time. Since it was obvious that we were going to be seated at the bar section, Kelly reminded me that bars likely do not allow minors in their section since Katharine is only 17 so I informed the hostess. She apologized and asked us to return to the front for reassignment. For the next 10 minutes three other similar sized parties are seated ahead of us. We end up sitting in a table next to the waiters' cashier station. Not much of an issue since we were still towards the front of the restaurant. We open two of the three menus and the entree pages are missing. Kelly walks over to the hostess station to show them this and picks up new menus. This slight hiccup at the beginning of the evening would've been disastrous for most establishment but Buddy V's made up and bent backwards to ensure our satisfaction. GM Christopher and his manager kept checking on us to make sure we were ok. We ordered the Caprese to start and had the Shrimp Scampi, Spaghetti and Meatballs, and Spaghetti Bolognese. All fantastic! We finished with the Apple Pie topped with a scoop of Vanilla Ice Cream. They do a really good job with their food. If you ever get the chance to visit one of their restaurants, it is well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with Meatballs
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple Pie. Yummy!

V_KTFatM3uP4nXLYmPk4Uw.text: Quite possibly the best eggplant Parmesan I have ever had!!!!  Def try it as an app or a small main.

3ienVmLHtOqNxToxyB4ilw.text: Great place to go for casual dining in Vegas. Friendly staff. Recommend the meatballs - they're a must! We also loved the caprese salad. Save room for dessert. His bakery is just across the way.

CS-66uLCxVEpdRX8QUfNSg.text: Not sure if we were unlucky or what but our service was poor most of the evening. Starting with taking others ahead of us at the beginning. Perhaps it was the fact we had kids and they wanted to segregate us. Everyone else got bread immediately but I had to ask because the kids were hungry. Waitress really seemed preoccupied. Food was OK but nothing special. Very overpriced but I expected that on the Strip. Overall not a great experience.

gj4s45HtglHUqbTMIiBp1g.text: If I was on death row and got to choose a meal it would definitely be Buddy V's at the Venetian in Las Vegas. OMG this meal was absolutely AMAZING! No I did not count calories or point. We started at the bar awaiting our table with sangria's and an app of meatball sliders. (We could have stopped there... but no we continued) At the table we chose to go for the cheesy toasted garlic bread and the price fix "before show" meal. Michael chose the meatballs for an app, the  Orecchiette & Italian Sausage as an entree and for dessert the cannoli and I chose the Caesar salad, the chicken Parmesan and for dessert Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake with chocolate sauce and hazelnut praline crunch with salted caramel ice cream and a cappuccino too. We could have been rolled out the door we were soooo stuffed, but we chose to walk up the Las Vegas strip back to our hotel to "burn off some calories". I will definitely need to hit the hotel gym in the AM to work off this dinner. But it was worth every bite and calorie.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If I was on death row and got to choose a meal it would definitely be Buddy V&#39;s at the Venetian in Las Vegas.

8PSgvqBjSl8F5B0lXwOhVQ.text: Food was awesome. The service even better. The cost will put you in the poor house. Welcome to Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake boss merchandise

aR1jwmc6bGA03z2t2xicQw.text: It was my third time in this place last Saturday so this review is long overdue (I have to go every time I'm in vegas) and again  it didn't disappoint the food is great it has this amazing home taste the place is so nice and the service is great any employee you talk too is soooo nice. I had ordered different things every time and every dish is better that the last one. And lets not forget the dessert I've got the Tiramisu every time and its the best dessert ever. I've also tried the chocolate cake and its amazing. So if you decide to go you won't be disappointed

wXF7LEBfL_faWoQgQIK1fg.text: Buddy V's is one of, if not the closest you'll ever get to legitimate New Jersey dining. You get the plaid napkins, Torino breadsticks, a wide variety of Italian entrees and desserts. The desserts are from none other than Carlo's bake shop so you'll be in for a fine treat. I personally ordered the Sunday Gravy entree and it was one of the best Italian dishes I've had in awhile. It's tomato stew served with tender veal, homemade Italian sausage and meatballs served with rigatoni. Think of it as spaghetti with meatballs but more variety of meat for you meat lovers. A great experience overall!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Italian wedding cake courtesy of Buddy V&#39;s

aRbk3z0RtQNI7TqrQSWaJQ.text: The Tiramisu is the best I've ever had in my whole life. I order it every time I am here.   Beware that there is always a line if you come with a big party.  Make reservations in advance or take a chance with the bar area, which can give you a great view of the strip.  When I was previously here, there was live music with people dancing next to the bar area, but they didn't have a band this time. Not sure if this was due to a slow season in December.  Overall a very lovely atmosphere with great food.

LGbn6fdSKuDzOn13nMSIbg.text: Had the margarita pizza, just ok, the frozen one from Vons is better, not flavored enough (bland), crust a little burnt, had the Cesar salad w/grilled shrimp, it was good, but the fresh croutons was not what I was used too, was still warm and a bit undercooked in the middle, it was very soft w some lemon or sour taste, didn't eat those, didn't mixed well with the chilled salad, also had the fresh garlic bread and tomato basil soup, this was the best! Our waiter was a Jerk, our bus guy was better then the waiter I wish I could have tipped him, I tipped the waiter but trust I didn't want too! I'm not going back, I'll stick to the bakery!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh garlic bread and tomato basil soup, this was very delicious!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita Pizza &amp; grilled shrimp on Cesar salad, didn&#39;t care for the croutons.

smEjh332Ef9A3alDox0LAw.text: Did not know much about Buddy V background and his rep on desserts. We went in a couple years ago as guests at Palazzo. Now it's a staple on our liSt based on the food. It's not a huge menu but what they got is goooddd. I always go for the chicken parm. Two big breasts and a side of pasta. It's plenty for two. Other folks in our party had bucatini and it was rich with great fresh pasta. Was not over sauced to allow all flavors. We did the Price Fix menu which for $40 bucks gets you an app, entree and choice of dessert (cannoli or tiramisu). Meatball appetizer was really good though they are a little on the small size compared to Carmine's, Lavo or Matrianos. Chicken parm is a little thicker than other places but keeps the chicken juicy without too much breading. The red sauce on the parm and pasta side is super fresh tomato taste. We had one each of the cannoli and Tiramisu. Cannoli was crunchy with cream and chocolate chunks with a side of chocolate syrup. Wow was it good. Tiramisu was also very good and I liked because not to bitter with coffee taste. It comes in a little jar with a couple of side cookies. Both great for sharing at the table. Atmosphere is really good with view looking over the strip. Nice bar/lounge area with live music some nights. Service was really good and efficient.

_JidZ1Qs3Qj-MPZ058Z4Nw.text: So I never watched the Cake Boss and only ended up at Buddy V's because they had space for our party during a busy Saturday night.  We were seated at the worst possible table in the restaurant right up in the front and the hostess wouldn't budge when I asked to be moved after I saw a lot of tables available since it was 9:30pm (strike 1).  Our waiter was fast talking and nice but he really tried his best to have us order more than we wanted and actually charged us for a salad which he said was going to give us compliments of the house and then forgot all about his promise at the end of the dinner (strike 2).  Those two experiences were the True reason why I brought the score down because the food (except for the salmon) was very fresh and delicious.   Charred Octopus-amazingly good Panzanella Salad-fresh combination of flavors Seared Salmon-overcooked and dry (strike 3). Buddy V's is a very large and pretty modern restaurant with decent prices but the little incidences along the way had me leaving on a sour note.

5nOeT5BSIHsXf6bWwoL9WQ.text: Amazing food! My mom got the eggplant app but as a meal with noodles and it was the best/crispy eggplant she's ever had. I got the chicken riggatoni and it was amazing as well. The chicken was fresh and cooked perfectly. Our server Caleb H. was outstanding and made sure we had everything we needed and never seemed rushed or put out when we needed something. The fresh bread they bring out with oil was to die for a well, but save some room for the main course as it was uh mazing! The whole place is nicely decorated and you can tell everyone really cares. Would go back for sure!

-v1xdDHRYko7nCy3Gv_UfA.text: Its a little pricey but its Vegas after all (everything in Vegas is pricey).  Hubby and I had the Sunday brunch for $35/each. It was decent but I have to tell you, the bread pudding was one of the best I have ever had!   View was awesome. Waiters were friendly.

ZaIkhsO0fwD9W2MRDuA-lg.text: Excellent service with Casey and Georgio! The group of 20! The food was great. No complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great dinner!

n-ZUgt1gZw4KfG2tjYzykQ.text: The best place in san diego. The butter fish was my favorite. I loved the lobster tails as well.

r5J02I-OpMHwlfyUKVdgNQ.text: Wow this place was really good. I had the carbonara and it was one of the best carbonara's I've had which says a lot since it's usually my go to at Italian restaurants. We order Buddy's favorite pizza for the kids to share and it was excellent as well.  Finished with Lisa's chocolate cake and the cake was good but the salted ice cream that came with it was amazing. Service was good too. They got us seated at our reservation time and didn't rush us out which was nice since we were dining with extended family.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm chocolate Nutella cake
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara with chicken

Yoa6qO8LBxsY1oUHT0eRdg.text: Good for lunch and dinner. Large portions reasonable price (on the strip) and best waiters. Definitely be back.

mskNRfLWos1-TeeIaDGFLA.text: The veal with the mushroom sauce was good. The croutons are amazing. The eggplant appetizer was good however they forgot it and brought it almost when the meal was finished. The service was slow they put us at the last table outside and we were kind of forgotten - our party of 9. Our meals didn't come out at the same time.

9qWe48us-THqjGvgBOB6HQ.text: Meh, Buddy V's is a 3.5 stars for me but rounding down because of slow service and complicated bill -_-  I made a reservation at Buddy V's for my birthday. We were a large party of 15 that seated us pretty quickly once our whole party arrived. I know that we were a large party but I just felt like the overall service was very slooow.....The older man (maybe the manager) walked us very s l o w l y....to the table and as we were seated, it just took a long time to get our utensils or menus. It was around 4:45 when we arrived and the restaurant didn't look too crowded at the time.  I am a huuuge fan of moscow mules and I make it a point to try a restaurant's signature mule. Buddy V's has a "Jalapeno Mule" on their cocktail menu and I was instantly intrigued and pleasantly surprised upon tasting it. It was bright and zesty, but the subtle kick of jalapenos would kick in afterwards. It's not a really overwhelming spice, but rather quite refreshing. Highly recommend trying this!  And for my meal, I ordered the linguini and clams and shared with my friend who ordered the sea scallops. Much to my disappointment, the linguini was super salty and extra garlicly. I didn't mind the garlic but the salt was just too much for me and found myself taking gulps of water in between bites. The sea scallops on the other hand were quite enjoyable. The creamy bed of polenta beneath the beautifully seared scallops complemented it well.  The dessert was probably the highlight of the meal. The Italian birthday cake was soo delicious. I'm not a big fan of desserts because I don't have much of a sweet tooth but the sweetness of all the different layers was not very overpowering in this. I loved the chocolate mouse layer. So dreamy....  It was time for the check and here's where things got unnecessarily complicated. Again, service was slow and we seemed to be waiting for forever for the check to come out. Prior to even ordering I had asked if we could split the check into separate bills, by tables, since we were a large party. They had forgotten, but no big deal, I asked them if they could fix it and they said they would. We wanted to split the bill to put it on two separate cards. When they brought back the check and I took a look at it, I was so confused. Our server had literally split everything on the check in half (see my photos), which made it 39247038x more difficult for my party to figure out who we needed to pay back. I clarified with our waiter what I wanted and off he went to fix our check. What could possibly go wrong? So instead of just ringing up another two new bills, he took a looong time trying to move halves from the two checks around. So instead of "linguini and clams" on the bill it said "1/2 linguini and clams" twice. He spent a long time trying to move things around but didn't move everything properly. I think it would've taken equally as long to just create two new bills where each meal was not a half.  So yeah, that was frustrating to deal with. Everyone was getting grumpy because we had been in the restaurant for so long because of the slow service and we were ready to leave after two hours of being there. But our waiter did try...and he was nice...just not efficient. Overall, good food and a nice interior! However, I was expecting a little more from the service since it wasn't too crowded but hey, they tried.
