Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea scallops
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asked the waiter to split the check by table because we had a large group and he literally split all the food...I didn&#39;t understand

tCGeuZ9M5mViCP2fUDbpiw.text: What a wonderful surprise!  I made a reservation for a coworker and I to have dinner here before seeing BAZ last night.  We were warmly welcomed by the hostess as well as our server  - he was so enthusiastic and a pleasure to have help us.  I started with a glass of sauvignon blanc and we shared an absolutely delicious caprese salad - a little different than the norm...in a good way!  I thoroughly enjoyed the chicken rigatoni alla vodka as my entree and could have licked the rest of the sauce out of the bowl...it was that good.  Fun, lively atmosphere...especially after the piano player/singer started.  The restaurant was packed early, so that is always a good sign.

wVg3xS5kz33V0MHpoTSD-A.text: It was mid day and needed a snack from all the walking we've just done. The bar was not too busy as it was 3pm in the afternoon. The bartender was extremely nice along with all the staff that came by to drop off items.   We asked the bartender what he'd recommend and he stated it was the lasagna. By jolly gee was it fantastic. It came out scorching hot in a pan like skillet. Cheese melted and meatiness in every bite. We also had the Nutella cake with a scoop of ice cream if this wasn't a snack I'd say you can finish the lasagna on your own but it was a perfect share.   The price was reasonable and the portions are right sized not too much or too little. If your craving Italian this is the spot.

c1FQjF9IIOD7G-092FQI9w.text: We chose this location on our last night in Vegas, which was a bad decision because we didn't have a chance to go back.  Our waiter was one of the best I've ever had!  The mozzarella appetizer was fantastic!  The lasagna is really the best I've ever had and the butterscotch creek brulee is an event all on its own!  This is a must experience in my opinion!

I1brjp5LsRVf_dkCmO69LA.text: Where do I begin?! I don't know what was my favorite and don't think I'll be picking. It was all so good!   I ordered a couple  cocktails, the Mac and cheese carbonara  and Dad's  Bucatini.   The server was amazing and was very engaging.   I wasn't expecting music and was pleased when we were seated next to the musician.   It was a very amazing  holistic experience for my senses and I will be back!

uZuGUxplfNpCkH-SaQwa2g.text: This was our first time here. We received dinner for two at Buddy's for free. We made reservations because the day before the wait time was an hour. My husband and I had the chicken Parmesan and it was very delicious we had Cesar salad which was also very delicious the bread they gave before the dinner was very good.

1aSJDbGKt6uzm0b5OCx86Q.text: Celebrated my 4oth birthday in this restaurant . My husband told the hostess that it's my birthday. Usually on the nice restaurants I've been they'll do something special for their guest for their birthday or anniversary. I was a little disappointed that they didn't do anything. We did the family style meal since there's 8 of us. The food were great. The service was great but I wanted our waiter Georgio to sing me happy birthday. Spend more than $400 on the meal and we had plenty of leftovers. Since our hotel has no refrigerator, we gave our left over to the homeless people in Las Vegas strip. I should have ask the guy playing the piano to sing happy birthday to me

w0Z622by_RTaWqLv55859w.text: This restaurant was really good! We had never been here before and didn't really know what was on the menu other than knowing it was Italian food. Everyone was really friendly and service was fast. We took our 8 month old and all the waiters and the hostess kept her entertained allowing us to enjoy bout lunch, the hostess even volunteer to rinse my baby's bottle when she dropped it!  Food was excellent and our waitress took time to explain the menu and make recommendations and we love the dishes she recommended. We will be definitely coming back.

Fs2_AUkiAbJ-rdwSvm5WvA.text: Right across from Mirage and in front of Venetian.  Best carbonara ever, it has a flavor special.  Each trip to Vegas this is a must.

Pdx9sAib5CtTCMJh-3f_fg.text: Had dinner here this evening. Nice atmosphere with attentive service. Our meal consisted of a starter of meatballs, orecchiette with Italian sausage and chicken parmesan. Service was very good, but the food was average. Meatballs we're good. The orecchiette had minimal sausage and the chicken parmesan was a bit dry. I subbed mashed potatoes for the spaghetti and they were delicious.

3eroEjhhl6uvN88ch4_weg.text: Truly impressive restaurant with Strip view.  I've been coming to Buddy Vs for a few years now. No weekend trip to Vegas has been complete for me without Sunday brunch here. Their Bruch buffet features high quality breakfast and lunch dishes, fresh premium fruits, cheese, Italian cold cuts and best of all: the desert bar. The service has always been good and the overall value is reasonable for a major resort Strip front restaurant.  Today I came for regular lunch. We ordered the salami and cheese platter, spaghetti Bolognese and tiramisu. As always, the food was outstanding. The three cheeses and three meats were of the finest quality and paired with freshly open-fire grilled garlic butter feloni bread. The Bolognese, while a simple dish, has always been one of our favorites here, as they do it perfectly. Saving the best for last, the tiramisu by itself is worth coming here for (and it's served as part of the Sunday brunch buffet as well !!). I also loved their new coffee from Fonte, which is a perfect pair with the tiramisu.  The weeks before Christmas are always slow, so we were able to get a table by the window with excellent Strip view. Danny did an outstanding job taking care of us and making this a truly enjoyable lunch at one of my favorite restaurants.

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni Vodka
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Parmigiana

TtQIC2Z4giQX3sMWDILVdA.text: Been to buddy V's three or four times always get a great meal and great service there was four of us this trip and we got four different meals all four outstanding

JkjsZqW2oPjXh_Z420VzyA.text: Very good food!!!   I had lasagna and my husband had the chicken parm and both were delicious!!!  We order also the octopus appetizer (don't really know the exact name) it was surprisingly yummi!!!! Like a soup but very tasty!!!!   Huge portions so go very hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm and lasagna

8nu2n4ouxPBAHYIaMRiVzg.text: For a restaurant on the Vegas Strip, we were more than pleasantly surprised.  From soup to nuts Buddy V's delivered for a family vacation with four adults and three children. Everyone was happy with what they ordered which does not usually happen with such a large diverse crowd.  I was a bit disappointed in the pastry shop but the girls in our crew loved the chocolate covered strawberries! We would definitely re-visit when in Vegas again and recommend to friends and family. Service was good too.  Stand outs:   Lasagne Garlic Cheese Toast Linguine with White Clams/Sauce

WbE4XjrI8i_jLeoz6CI9yQ.text: You tawkin' to me? You tawkin' to me? Fahget about it! Buddy Valastro's Italian accent makes my heart skip a beat, and the delicious dishes he's serving up at his self-named restaurant in Vegas will do the very same!  Work trip.  Boooo.  But in Vegas? Hell yeah.  I stayed at the monumental Venetian hotel and had the most luxurious suite of suites.  It was late.  I was tired.  I was hungry, and to make matters worse, I was indecisive of what to eat. (Don't you hate that feeling?)  One of my suppliers suggested grabbing a bite at a place called Buddy V's.  "Oh like Eddie V's brother?" I asked.  "Nooo.  Buddy V's as in Buddy Valastro.  The Cake Boss," she replied. Ahhh.  How did I not know this?    We grabbed a table towards the back, and I acquired the perfect view.  It was about 10PM and I was facing the Las Vegas Strip--the beaming lights shining down on the commotion of pedestrians as they scurried towards the various hotels and casinos.  For my first time in Vegas, this, ladies and gentlemen, was a sight!    I gulped down the most delicious glass of cab, and ordered the spaghetti carbonara and added Italian sausage, per the waiter's suggestion.  It used to frustrate me watching Diners, Drive Ins and Dives because every other episode, Guy Fieri exclaims "this is the best ________ I've ever had!"  When you say that about every dish, what makes one different from the other? Driving my point home, the Spaghetti Carbonara at Buddy V's Ristorante was THE BEST PASTA DISH I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!!! And I'm not Guy Fieri-ing you.  The pasta is obviously made in-house, and that sauce is ridiculously rich and creamy.  The Italian sausage just drove the dish right on home for me.  Buddy V's is... Simply put? OUT OF BOUNDS, and I can't wait to get back to Vegas and eat there again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Washing it all down with an IPA. 32 oz!!!! Buzzed is an understatement!

h9BQbmwOa-1I_zaSrjbISw.text: The food was outstanding....5 stars without question. But our waiter Giorgio deserves 10 stars. From the moment we sat down we felt like we were in his home. Wine and food recommendations (Valastro Sunday Gravy was unreal), sharing stories about our families....and taking the time to learn our daughters names and then ending the night with special deserts for each of them with their names drizzled on the plates in chocolate. Buddy, if you read these reviews, please know that Giorgio is the best waiter we have ever had and absolutely made our night at your restaurant one we will never forget. Great food, great atmosphere and great memories. Thank you Giorgio and Buddy V's!!!

FLCzFyKed5AHrvkL95j7pQ.text: The best lasagna we have ever tasted.   The service was impeccable,  and the margaritas were heavenly!

5LeqE5zYpU-5S7AouE6Lmw.text: Fantastic food, fantastic service. We sat at the bar and had the pomegranate martini, Caesar salad, chicken piccata, and the lobster tail dessert (pastry filled w cream, fresh fruit alongside) and all of it was absolutely delicious. They even split the salad and entree for us. Special shout-out to Courtney at the bar for awesome service!

Um6PDIQYLAILfE_TPbQMZw.text: Having enjoyed dinner shortly after opening with friends in town from Phoenix, the plan to re-visit Buddy V's at a later date somehow getting lost in the constant shuffle of Las Vegas' restaurant landscape, recent rumors from a trusted source suggested that the All You Can Eat Sunday Brunch pairs a good price to food better executed than it needs to be, something each day more difficult to find in the Casino properties of Sin City.  No doubt still a hot-spot amongst tourists, the restaurant itself just under capacity by noon as the line at Carlo's Bake Shop continues to snake out the door at all hours of the day, it was just past 11:15am that one adult and a child checked-in at the hostess podium to be quickly led to a tight two-top adjacent the open kitchen, food displays tempting on all sides as the decor of rolling pins, whisks and ingredients continues to impress without making the environment feel like a 'theme' restaurant in the least.  Half-expecting service to be sub-par, most of the full-time Buffets in town generally better suited to this style of dining than a place converting the dining room into a free-flowing event once a week, it was with greetings from a young man who poured water and occasionally returned to clear plates or refill Coffee that instructions were given to "get started whenever you like," a quick perusal of the options that are mostly laid out on the tableside menu showing a decent variety, though certainly not the same multitude of options as the Hotel's AYCE space.  Obviously focusing on Italian American classics and Buddy's interpretation of the topic by way of long-time Chef Brian Forgione, it was with a plate of Charcuterie, Cheese and Baked Goods that the meal got underway, the 9-year old happy to see Peel n' Eat Shrimp offered, but confused as to why the Salami did not taste like the version offered at Von's, the quality theoretically superior and not nearly as processed but nonetheless lacking in flavor while the Prosciutto, Blue Cheese and Pecorino were all good specimens, though the Focaccia was nearly inedible and hard enough to make one wonder whether it had been baked the previous day.  Modestly impressed by the Croissant as well as two mini-Muffins, a Pain au Chocolat entirely forgettable as a result of too little filling, the decision to investigate the Cake Boss' desserts early was well served by a pot of Tiramisu that would rival any in town, the Red Velvet Cake also quite tasty with a most base and tangy frosting while the Cannoli was much like that across the way, already feeling the sog of being pre-filled and generally underwhelming.  Batting about .500 on Italian Cookies, the Almond Cluster and soft Chocolate far better than the dried Butter rounds topped in Sprinkles or Jam, it was with patience that a fresh pan of pasta was waited on as part of plate three, the Mac n' Cheese Carbonara far too heavily salted to be appreciated for any sort of subtlety while the small Breasts of pounded Chicken Parm and Orecchiette with Italian Sausage were better balanced if not particularly memorable, the surprisingly light Roast Vegetable Frittata offering some evidence of a kitchen that is capable of doing 'high volume' right.  Far more impressed by the Garlic Bread than the Focaccia, crispy and fragrant with just melted Mozzarella or when used to scoop up Grandma's Meatballs and Sauce that takes no short-cuts en route to a fresh Tomato flavor without any added sweetness, choices from the carving station including Spicy Italian Sausage and Smoked Applewood Slab Bacon are well-displayed and prepared properly, the youngster at the table also fond of the Maple-Glazed Ham and sticks of Beef Jerky procured from the Bloody Mary Bar.  Going back to the sweet stuff for plates five and six, the common occurrence of dirty stacked plates and an empty mug at this point almost more amusing than it was an annoyance, fans of Bread Pudding would be well advised to save room for Dessert as the version served hot from a steamer with Caramel Sauce and Whipped Cream is a custard-laden masterpiece that far outperformed Panettone French Toast that is a bit dry along the edges, a better investment for the sweet tooth being the dainty Crespelle served with Nutella, Pureed Raspberries and Whipped Cream...or perhaps a bag of piping hot Italian Donuts offered with the same trio for dipping.  **1/2Charged $36.95 per adult and $10.95 for a child, a price not inclusive of tax or tip, the question of whether Buddy V's Brunch is 'worth it' comes down to whether one prefers quality or quantity as well as an understanding of celebrity Chef branding, the recent Buffet upgrades at Wynn, Cosmopolitan and Caesar's seemingly a better value with superior service, though certain items and the chance to sample several of Buddy V's Signatures without investing in a full lunch or dinner seems worth it for fans or those looking for a family-friendly alternative to Grand Lux Cafe while staying at the Venetian

b1qhGZ9_0HBUqazf_dxnhw.text: Buddy V's bottomless brunch was perfect! I feel like a brunch buffet can tend to disappoint, this one did not. The Mac and cheese carbonara and carving station were my favorite. But the bottomless drinks is where it's AT! Our waiter was the best, he kept the bottomless drinks coming, no need to ask. And the drinks weren't 80% juice either like you can find with a lot of the bottomless drink offers, they were legit good drinks. I'm so happy we made it over here - would absolutely come back, worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bNit8myOvJ-VSKg5MTDFCw.text: Great service, yummy food, reasonably priced! You get a delicious bread with olive oil and vinaigrette dip while waiting for your food. We had calamari for an appetizer and it was amazing. I ate the gouda burger or something like that and it was tasty. Our server went the extra mile and picked up my daughter's bday cake from the Carlo's Bakery and brought it to my daughter with candles singing 'Happy Birthday.' I highly recommend this place.

BDKLzTmwrvebkb0_qLgWDQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here for our 5 year anniversary. We love Italian food so we were naturally excited. I must say, the food is absolutely incredible and the guest service was even better. It was our first time here so we ended up getting lost in the Venetian and arrived 15 mins late to our reservation. The hostess checked us in and actually sat us right away. We had 2 servers - both were wonderful. Our strawberry lemonade drinks were never once empty. It felt like we ordered bottomless lemonade. Our main entre arrived quickly (probably between 10-15 mins). Nonna's lasagna and the Chicken Parm tasted heavenly. After the main entre, the server recommended a variety of desserts. We chose the cheesecake. It was delicious and the portion size was huge. I'm glad my boyfriend and I shared. By the end of the night, our server brought us two glasses with the inscription "Buddy V's Ristorante". He said it was to remember our night at the restaurant. We both had the best experience here and we cannot wait to come back. Probably Valentine's Day :) I wish I was able to remember all of their names for proper acknowledgement but we want to thank the whole staff for making our anniversary dinner so special. We absolutely love this place.

xiAihjOYG3eBN6R7Kb9FqQ.text: I came here for an early dinner one night and I enjoyed a good service.  I wasn't really hungry when we walked in here as I just ate gelato not too long ago. So I just ordered scallop dinner.  It was cooked well but flavor was less, I think I was supposed to eat with bacon served with the dish for flavoring, but I put bacon aside and I think I wasn't supposed to do that to fully enjoy the dish.  They had good drink menu including variety of wine.  While the list wasn't extensive it was easy for me to spot what I liked.  Ambiance is really casual, for being casual restaurant, I thought it was a bit pricy.   Service was great. He was professional with nice smile. The way he presented the desert menu to me, for a moment I thought I was at a fancy restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops dinner

1IJPrEXryHTtnKvjVofVfg.text: I came here for lunch wanting to try Buddy V's chicken blt since it looked pretty good in pictures and seemed to have pretty positive reviews.  Honestly, while it wasn't terrible or anything, it wasn't as great as it looked or as tasty as I thought it would be.  To top it off, service was "meh" and my reservation requests were totally ignored.  I requested a booth by a window but did not get that.  (It was busy for lunch though and almost every table was occupied.)  I also noted that we were celebrating a birthday but not even a simple birthday greeting was given.  Totally disappointing.  I wasn't crazy either about how close the tables were to each other.  One good thing at least was that our water glasses never went empty?  Also, the Caesar salad that came with my sandwich had warm, soft croutons which added a different but interesting taste to it.  Glad I could check this place off my "to try" list, but after that experience there really wasn't anything to make me want to come back here again.

BeO6zGD8BuGgxTKSwViyMw.text: While I still think dinner is a solid three, their Sunday brunch buffet is five stars all the way!   I really don't like traditional breakfast food, and Buddy V's Sunday brunch had two egg dishes and one French toast dish at the buffet. Perfect!   The buffet is divided into five stations: starters (charcuterie, shrimp, antipasto, soup, Caesar salad); carving station (props to the bacon and the spicy Italian sausage); Kids corner (Mac n cheese, pizza, candy); entrees (loved the meatballs, chicken Parmesan, carbonara Mac n cheese) and DESSERTS! Delicious tiramisu in mason jars, cannoli, and zonuts were my favorite.   The buffet is $34.95. I opted for the extra all-you-can-drink mimosa deal for $14.95 and you can choose from mimosa, Bellini, sangria, beer or wine. The Bellini was tasty but that sangria tho! I'm embarrassed to say how many glasses I had.   My fiance got the Bloody Mary deal for $18.95 in which they bring the vodka and you craft your own Bloody Mary from a different station. He had fun doing that (and adding shrimp from the appetizer station) and he also got to choose from all my drinks. He ended up switching to the sangria as well and drank as much as I did. He got to keep his glass as a souvenir.   We got seated right away with no wait (even during March Madness weekend) and I can't wait to come back. Wish it was served every day!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch - Dessert Buffet. Tiramisu, cannoli, zonuts

2ytx5HE29bZ-taLbfYgbOw.text: A revisit here did not quite replicate our earlier 5-star experience.  The restaurant was not as accommodating as before, and did not honor our reservation request for a booth.  Instead we were seated at a table where one-half of my party of four was temporarily blinded by the sun near sundown.  Then we settled in, and things soon improved.  Grandma's Meatballs covered in Red Sauce (Sunday Gravy) were authentic classic Italian meatballs, and Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carozza was a hot and cheesy confection once again.  Calamari Fritti was another nice starter.  And the complimentary Focaccia Bread was great.  A big side of Caesar Salad was good.  And Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno was again one of the best lasagnas I have ever tasted--besides Diane's vaunted cheesy and saucy concoction which won the 2014 Ardiente Lasagna Baking Championship in a blind tasting by judges.  This time I did not even bother to finish the whole rich lasagna dish.  I filled up on half of what was presented to me, and took the other half home.  Alas, Diane failed to persuade the chef to make her Veal Parm Alfredo, and had to settle for a good Veal Marsala instead, which unfortunately arrived late to the table.  For dessert we were served great Cannoli compliments of the chef, to make up for the late arrival of Diane's dinner entree.  Service was excellent except for the ordering miscue, no peppers offered on the side of the Calamari Fritti, and no available Roasted Potatoes this particular evening.  4-1/2 stars overall!

eZv-ZISjviIc3zikHW4Baw.text: We never miss an opportunity to eat here.  Good Drinks, excellent salads, you can't go wrong with their pasta dishes.  Don't forget the amazing deserts!

EfEZVTXqtBI6VH5rPSZ2Kw.text: Must try the meatballs!  Request a seat by the windows for great views of the Strip!!!  Give it a try if you like authentic Italian food!!!

1nFjSro75eZGcB13YHVI3g.text: Wow this place was amazing the prices were good considering it was Vegas and the service was outstanding.  The food was perfect and the portions were really good.  This is a must go place

UQ5dwRTIrsip0wnfWZWaOQ.text: We always have so much fun with Jason and Chris at the bar in Buddy V's, we keep coming back whenever we're in town.  On our five day visit, we visited them three times for food and drinks at the bar.  Jason is a hoot and totally entertaining to hang out with.  The food at Buddy V's is always amazing.  You cannot go wrong with anything on the menu...but be sure to try the Sunday Gravy.

u6ZgbWv67WylgJr9nqW9lw.text: Amazing place! In terms or prices, its on the more affordable side of Italian food in Vegas (but still runs about $20-$30 a plate), and is worth every single penny! Our waiter was the most amazing person, he was very attentive, personable, and charming, and made the experience here the amazing experience it was. The style of the restaurant is very charming and cute as well, and the environment was perfect for a night now while still being relaxing and comfortable. The proportions on the food were well worth the money too, I ordered chicken parmesan, which came with two huge pieces of chicken. The three other people in my party ordered other chicken, and every single one of us had to take home more than half our meal. Would highoy recommend to anyone looking for a good meal, this was the best we had on our Vegas trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was aftr we had finished our meals, we took this to go!

erFTT4ABNbla6aXKPeqWDg.text: What a dining experience. My wife and I ate there last night (not our first time) and from the time we were seated to the time we left everything we great. Generally I'm not one to sit too long. Eat and go is my style but our window seat over looking the Vegas strip, sunset and great food put us in no hurry. Great evening  Thank you

kmHyTfD3n4T39fX6jjqQQg.text: Well, I wasn't feeling very hungry so ordered the Caprese salad and it was absolutely delicious! It came with heirloom tomatoes - some fresh and some were pre-marinated and slightly seasoned, almost as if they were pickled, which enhanced the depth of the flavors. The various ingredients truly came well together. The creaminess of the burrata and the fragrant basil with the tomatoes were simply perfect. I would order this dish again and again. Oh, not to mention the chargrilled garlic bread to boot!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese salad

KyPAeTFyPqm5OLxXZ82A_w.text: Came here with a group of 10, overall consensus was that we expected it to be better but glad that the prices weren't steep.   I had the spaghetti and meatballs, the pasta was perfect consistency but the sauce was a bit runny and the meatballs nothing to write home about.

evVQUAH7gO4LRkLKpbe9LA.text: Loved us some Buddy V's!  So, full disclosure...I've never seen Cake Boss. I ate here because they had great reviews and sounded like the homey kind of Italian restaurant I prefer.  Bestie and I were in a major hurry to catch our flight but had a hankering (and a reservation!) for Italian before we left Vegas.The hostesses were incredibly accommodating and let our server know we had a tight timeline.  As a result, we sat, ordered and ate - including dessert to go - and drinks in a mere 30 minutes! Clearly a dining world record.  Our server Kristin had impeccable recommendations. We started off with the caprese salad and then had lasagna and spaghetti and meatballs for our entrees. The pasta was cooked al dente as it should be. Everything was piping hot, fresh and flavorful. After the complimentary bread and breadsticks, there was no way we could eat all that food. Portions are this side of ginormous.  The manager Adam came by to check on us and chatted about other Vegas restaurants we had been to even offering future menu suggestions for a steakhouse we had been to the night before. He clearly runs a tight ship while making sure guests are well taken care of and well fed.  Will definitely be adding Buddy V's to my list of Vegas faves!

3BkqhYEnfIuR1og1N9BBbw.text: So this is the second time we go to Buddy V this week. We loved the Sunday Gravy but it is a lot of food, so come hungry. We went in a Thursday night so the band was planning, those guys are great, music was good and they really make an effort to play the music you want to hear. Hersh was our waitress, she's awesome. Props to her, very nice and came by to make sure we were good many times. She deserves a raise. Lastly, the location is great and it is a nice resturant so I highly recommend you try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake shop in front of the resturant
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great band, they play a variety of music.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try this cake

fV92b5Kc4UpKOTEco73zcA.text: As good as American Italian type food as you can get. Spaghetti and meatballs were home-made tasting, in my book that means you can taste the True tomato flavor and it is not overwhelmed by the many spices normally found in spaghetti sauces. 5 medium size meatballs complement the pasta in a heavenly smelling and tasting treat. Garlic bread was buttery, crispy, garlicky, and substantial. Calamari crispy, peppery, with lots of tentacles. This is how calamari should be.  Wait staff amazing, in my book. I had technical questions about the tomato sauce, as in how their Bolognese is prepared. Suffice it to say, it tasted great...not too infused with basil and oregano. Polite and courteous, all staff were pleasant and kind.  The breadsticks were wrapped in separate packages. Just ask for more if you want more. Real grissini torinesi, as they are long and thin, with a hint of olive oil taste.  As good as it gets now...if you've read my reviews, I only give 5 stars to any place only after it has consistently shown, after many visits, that their quality and commitment never wavers.

pz4023nCR98K_RxmeCPjzw.text: Best Italian food I've had!  The sauce tasted just like my grandmas. Almost like she was in the back making it!  The atmosphere is fun. We didn't order drinks because we're recovering from the previous night but the bread to the entree was delicious! Would definitely return when in Vegas!

4I2V0CYEjooC7tTgSt-YWQ.text: Yum! Seriously YUM! Everything including the iced tea was amazing! I have no idea what the croutons on the Cesar salad are but they are DELICIOUS! The chicken piccata, Cesar salad, and lasagna were all incredible. The prices weren't bad either.

zQcCVD0ftWkZHs29ASrDcQ.text: Unexpectedly, one of the best meals I have had in Vegas.  The focaccia brought out first was delicious with oil and balsamic vinegar.  Grilled octopus as a starter was to die for.  So tender and flavorful, with a slice of grilled bread to soak up the sauce.  Followed by sea bass simply prepared with a super fresh salad alongside.  He had the veal Marsala and ate it all up.  The big downside was the live music, it was so freaking loud even though we were 2 rooms away, it really detracted from the dining experience.  The singer wasn't bad, just way too loud!

9-uycvT_wi-YLNlexUqZaw.text: Picked up 3 things during our stay in Vegas and took it back to our room. (Cant comment on service). 1. The Margarita pizza was the bomb! Very delicious. Decent size for the price.  2. The spaghetti central was so freakin good!!! Second best spaghetti Ive ever had. (First is Mama Depandis at RPM Italian in Chicago.) 3. The parm polenta is the best polenta Ive ever had hands down! Definitely will be coming back to this place on return trips to LV.

dTnp9YxgTWykklWYzllvQg.text: The food here was good, but wasn't anything to rave about.  We started with the fried calamari.  It was served with banana peppers, which I love.  The calamari itself was tender and not rubbery.  We both went for the chicken parmesan.  My husband loved it, I thought it was just average.  I wasn't in love with the flavor of the sauce, so had to doctor it up with red pepper flakes and parmesan.  The service was not that great.  Our waitress was pleasant, but never came around.  You can get a decent meal here, but for the price, you will not be blown away.

e8I4jd5ui_lisNGjxrOJEQ.text: What a great restaurant.  I went there recently for dinner and sat at a table in the bar area.  To start they will bring a basket of bread/breadsticks and olive oil.  You know how sometimes you want to get an appetizer but it might be too big for 2 people so you don't get it?  No problem!  We were lucky enough to have gone during happy hour and didn't realize that they had specials during that time.  Because of happy hour we were able to try several appetizers in smaller portions so we could enjoy and taste a few things.  We had the calamari, Grandma's meatballs.  For salads were tried the cesar and mozzarella caprese.  They have homemade croutons in their salads that are unbelievable.  All were delicious.  In addition we had Italian sangria for $4 a glass.  Try and top that in Vegas folks!  For dinner we had the shrimp scampi and cheese ravioli.  Everything was excellent.  We were saying how we wish Buddy would open one of these restaurants in our area because we would be regular customers.  We'll be back Buddy -- thanks again!!!

DGlaLXslhgrIBSRzQyiuaw.text: We came here for the brunch. The quality of food was top notch. I am not a big cheese person but I enjoyed the cheese here. The olives were something else!!! Overall great place to eat.

F0WQLy-ahSClcukN3C1wsA.text: Great place for some good food and a nice stroll through the Venetian! The servers were friendly the second we walked! Would highly recommend, go again, and listen to the live music soon! Thanks Buddy.

_PtmOIrn1A_QJjKzNcAX5A.text: This place was ok, but nothing out of this world.  We wanted to try his pastries and have a drink. The line was super long so we sat at the cake boss restaurant to save time since they sell the same pastries in both. We had two pastries and a drink and water and the bill was $41dll I don't mind the price if it's good, but this was just ok, average. if you ask me its terribly over priced :( maybe my expectations were to high and that's why I seem harsh Lol. Save your self some money and just make the huge line for his bakery and don't waste your time and money at the restaurant. Line is about 20 minutes long. Service was terrible,  the waiter took forever to take our order and after he did  he took even longer to bring the drinks out, we just paid for the bells and whistles, which soumded more like beeps and toots, Lol

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4Ram935jTE0PnSgUPGkbjA.text: Skip the restaurant and enjoy the Bake Shop across the hall instead.  I thought this place looked interesting and who doesn't love Cake Boss so I tried them for lunch. Had a tough time find them at first. I was traveling solo and dining alone not for whimps. This place seemed to cater more towards families and was not that comfortable here; don't know how to explain it but almost like it was a bother that 1 person was taking a table. Food was average (meatball sub and tomato basil soup). Service was meh. Overall I was under impressed. Hit the bake shop up on the way out and that pretty much saved the trip. 7 layer rainbow cookies, yum!!!

aKMpYHAW_949EKIa8Xu6nw.text: Our waiter was the best, funny and point. We were there around 8pm. Place was packed. Once waiter took our order it long to get our food. The food was ok. I ordered the Lasagne it was good. I had better.  Their portiions are big. I was not able to eat half of it. Also to heavy to have this late. I could not sleep. The desserts were very good. I will for sure be back for the desserts.

A5k-Il27P5U2-AUqip9Jfw.text: This was a great Sunday Brunch, my first time there. Flavorful items. They also have a regular menu, for those who prefer there meals served. Delicious Sangria! Kids will love what they offerhave a small appetite and it was enough! I recommend Buddy V's. I will return for the full menu!

nx11ByDhEevEzzaOKJSOWw.text: We ate at Buddy v twice during our most recent stay in Vegas. Our first meal was so good (and so reasonably priced) that we went back a second time. For this visit, Kristina, the restaurant manager, could not have been any nicer. She accommodated us with a great table where our stroller could fit (we were traveling with a 3 year old and 2 month old) and checked in with us multiple times throughout the meal, including engaging in playful banter with our son. At the end of the meal, she gave him a light up cup that made his night. In a tourist-laden city where the service often slacks, Kristina did an exceptional job. I couldn't recommend buddy v any more if you are looking for a reasonably priced and family friendly Italian restaurant on the strip.

3YWer3rNHdFxF51kmKI7CQ.text: Casual place. Smells are fantastic. We sat at a window and had a nice view of the strip. Eats okay. Had the veal marsala. I hate to say it, but it is True, this doesnt hold a candle to the same dish at Caraba's.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z_szImvxHUJi3Y2gU5Rirg.text: Surprisingly delicious! My son and I dropped by Buddy V's for lunch and really enjoyed it. We sort of expected a "cheesy," chain style feeling. We were wrong!  The restaurant is spacious and nicely decorated. He had the $22 Express Lunch (he chose meatballs, chicken parm and a cannoli) and I chose the Caesar salad with grilled shrimp (included these amazing polenta croutons!). Everything was tasty and the portion sizes were filling and just right for lunch. The service was extremely friendly and attentive from the servers, hostess, busboy, etc. We look forward to visiting Buddy V's again next time we're in town and would recommend it for anyone looking for a casual, low-key, fair priced and tasty meal.

5k7PlduREBQuZXWFL3G5SA.text: Mike was our busser...nuff said...that's how good the service was, we remembered his name!  Ah yes...the chicken parm was off the chain!!!

QQNxEtwiXyrrJ6Vf8gZU8Q.text: AMAZING! This place is delicious. The service is fantastic. And you have to try the CANNOLIS! I had the chicken parm for dinner and it is easily a plate for two; you will not leave there hungry. At. All. 10/10

781q03FdZnW_nEmmVPcQiw.text: Very good meal! My friend and I were satisfied with what we had while on a trip to Vegas.  After several mediocre/disappointing meals, the items we had at Buddy V's left us very pleased!   Definitely recommend the calamari fritti (something similar to that spelling) it is the option hat is breaded and comes with green peppers and lemon aoli. It was fabulous and perfectly cooked.   We also shared the veal Marsala.  The noodles and the actual marsala sauce on the veal were VERY good.  Thumbs up!   Their canolis looked amazing but we were too full to get any. Next time though! :)

gGYif_8Ti8CCFoNZ9CcHyg.text: fantastic service, there were waiters walking by us and checking on us constantly. they did well to not interrupt us but quietly fill water and bus empty plates. my mom and i shared a caesar salad and a calamari appetizer and it was almost too much for us! their bread and croutons are unexpectedly yummy.

EGwFNLP_qPtec7Ap5UbrNA.text: This a casual place.  Background music was 70's and 80's, which was fine by me; as I walked in, Tom Jones was playing followed by The Who.  And the beat went on.  Ordered Grilled Octopus; broth was spicy and tasted good.  The problem was the rest.  Actual octopus was fine; only thing was, there was only one bite and rest was filled by greens and potatoes!  Then ordered Shrimp Scampi for main course.  It was with angle hair pasta which was fine.  Taste was fine.  Here again, there were only 4 medium size shrimps with tails on to make them look bigger than actually they were!  I understand this is Vegas and understand this was inside of a casino; but, by no means one gets his/hers money's worth.  There are many other Italian places in the same casino that serve great Italian food and one gets close to reasonable amount for his/her money!

X4EUaG8do-jVe8BR7sRR_Q.text: This was not just a dinner this was an EXPERIENCE!!! Food was incredible especially veal parmigiana! Omg I don't even eat veal GLAD WE TRIED IT! Big enough for left overs that are just as good later THE SAUCE IS AMAZING. I'm more impressed each time we go eat there! The eggplant appetizer amd calamari are like nothing I have ever experienced- anywhere! Butterscotch creme brulee (even though I was stuffed) I could not stop eating! Fantastico!!!!!well done Peter Nick the manager and especially chef Bryan Forgione and entire kitchen crew! Love this place more and more

zW1Sk1NgcAqGpLm_WiHReg.text: Came here with high expectations and they fell flat fast! Service slow and the food nothing like what I expected after reading positive reviews? The caprese salad was $16.00 and literally was 2 ounces of buffalo cheese with some wilted basil and a small spoonful of cherry tomatoes no seasoning big disappointment! The chicken parm that everyone raved  about tasted like something from Olive Garden but no seasoning and the Spaghetti on the side came cold no flavor .    Did not order dessert since everything was a big let down went to Bouchon for dessert! The bakery across the way looked very busy maybe should try that next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pic looks fantastic food not so much!

2ZnYNRVdFQVm_OJGOphowg.text: FYI - this restaurant is across from Carlos' Bakery. I made a reservation for dinner beforehand. Pros... Super friendly service, great ambiance, and the food was tasteful (the cheese ravioli = yummy)! The only slight complaint: the server picked up my friend's unfinished plate too early and didn't bother to ask if she wanted to take it to-go (she's a local). Anyway, I must return for the Italian Birthday Cake!

TxzdBjfBZ8q_lgt5Us3CgA.text: Total waste of time and money.  They get a star for service - our waiter was quite personable and competent and the bartender made some tasty drinks. But that's where the praise ends. I ordered something simple: spaghetti and meatballs. It was very...ordinary. As in "I've had better at my junior high school cafeteria." Absolutely nothing to praise about the dish. I make better at home. So does the wife. So does Chef Boyardee, for that matter.  The wife ordered the veal parmesan. It was a huge hunk of meat, on the bone, pounded way too thin and then burnt under the cheese. The cook obviously put it on too high a heat and forgot it for a bit. Totally inedible.  For a place opened by a "cake boss," you'd think the desserts would be exemplary. Guess again. The rum birthday cake was so-so, and the cannelloni were stale and flavorless. Again, worthless food served in a nice room with good service.  Save your money and taste buds and go anywhere else for dinner. Maggiano's is just down the block and light years better tasting. Heck, go to Battista's. It's a dive that's over-rated and still better than Buddy V's. Or just stay home, heat a can of Chef Boyardee and eat it while tearing up $20 bills. In the end it's the same experience.

yrWBne0ssx7moIIRxEGBqA.text: They did a nice job renovating the former First Food space. It feels more homey and approachable. The interior may skew towards an over-the-top, typical Italian restaurant  with red and white checkered tablecloths and a panoply of picture frames, but there are cool touches like the light fixtures and use of rolling pins throughout. The place doesn't reinvent the cuisine, but executes traditional Italian-American dishes with a few subtle modern touches to create one of the better Italian restaurants on the Strip.  The eggplant parm app has plenty of great flavor, but could have benefitted from a crispier exterior. The dough of the aggnolotti was a touch thick, but the crispy texture from being pan fried was a nice touch. The sweetness of the sauce with the savoriness o the pork filling was great. The winner of the night was the huge brick sized portion of lasagna that arrived in a small cast iron dish. The mixture of proteins along with the boldness of the ricotta made for a wonderful combination that was only enhanced by the depth of a red sauce that any Italian grandmother would be proud of. For little ones, there's a kid's menu available. Among the items was a large order of buttered noodles that my kid loved. No meal is complete without dessert, and the nutella cake was a satisfying way to end it. It's their version of a lava cake with a rich, moist cake enveloping a gooey nutella mixture. A scoop of salted caramel ice cream accompanied it with a brittle underneath that added a good contrast in texture.  The execution was solid and the dishes different enough from your typical Italian American joint to make Buddy V's a good choice among moderately priced restaurants on the Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lisa&#39;s Warm Nutella Cake ($9) - chocolate sauce, hazelnut praline crunch, salted caramel ice cream
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6UwgZQap5I9isf0kw_I8xg.text: So I went here with my family and everyone ordered different dishes. I tried a little bit everyone's dishes because I just love sharing food, and I must admit this place is amazing. I ordered salmon and it was cooked to perfection. My nephew had macaroni and cheese and it was the best I've ever had. Service was even better. The view is just incredible of the strip and I loved the big windows with natural sunlight coming in. It perfect and I cannot wait to go back!

brFxnENLCUVzZfhkSAjIyw.text: We eat at Buddy V's every time we are in Vegas. The food is generous and always delicious. Great wine selection and the cannoli's are divine.

8FaxuFPQkfY1rjKfcP75YQ.text: The first impression I had was "housekeeping" they need to do some serious cleaning in that place! The chandeliers although very pretty were dusty as hell. There was a display of fake food on the right hand side... It was covered in black dust. I work in the customer service industry and I'm sure that the dust that had been accumulating was there for months.   When I go to a establishment of that caliber, I expect it to be spotless. No excuses.   About the food, the pasta was great but the portions were rather small. The chopped summer corn salad was a fiasco. It tasted like if the corn and green beans were poured out of a can directly to the plate. If the story was different than the one I'm telling, well taste and appearance didn't make the trick.   Needs a lot of improvement. Definitely underwhelmed.

5lXJu17pMMLDDs0QvE02uw.text: Cake Boss? Where's the cake? They barely serve cake. The ravioli with tomato sauce on kids menu -which they were not serving until 5p and we were there at 4p. My Margarita Pizza was to thick and tasted like something I could make in the oven out of a box. We ordered a $9 apple pie for desert and Sara Lee does better.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple pie -save your money and get a $3 Sara Lee
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita Pizza

4k6TDh7vdFxaFBvSRDGW0g.text: Came Here From California And Had To Stop By Carlos ' Bakery didn't even know that his restaurant was across the hall. only a 20 minute wait and they texted us when our table was ready which was very convenient.    all the staff is great, very nice and always made sure our water was full ! everything on the menu looked great and our part ordered a little bit of everything.   the pastas are really good and full of flavor.  of course we had to try desert since the line at the bakery was too long and with my lack of patience I just figured we could eat at the restaurant and order some desert . BAMM best of both worlds.  wrong not all the deserts are available at the restaurant, BUT there are some good ones on the desert menu.  the bathroom isn't in the restaurant, it's actually down the hall from the bakery across the hall, seems inconvenient but there wasn't a line any of the two times I went.   Of course we had to try a canoli and of course we were not disappointed!  overall great restaurant with even better deserts.

9bQQX8RGCb1REIyAxJVKrw.text: Amazing meal! Went for husbands 50th bday. When I booked the reservation I asked for a table with a view. Got a fantastic table with a great view. Georgio was the best server, great personality, lots of advice.   Will definitely go back!  Lisa

hw78P1ufwRiNxB0DXy7OGg.text: No stars..... Had Reservation at 9:15. We just walked out at 9:48 after not one person came for our order.  Worst service ever experienced. Restaurant was not busy by any means.

7sIvIbH-sfPyebuWst6qFw.text: Excellent food. The waiter was really good as well. He took real interest in our food preferences and suggested food/wine. During booking the reservation, I had told them it was my girlfriend's birthday, which they remembered and surprised her (and me) with a cake and candle. The ambience is really good as well.

akldxlBnFyN9hMdoN3FcUQ.text: We stumbled upon Buddy V's looking on Yelp for an Italian dinner while in Vegas.  We lucked out that it was restaurant week too, so we were able to try quite the variety of options.  The restaurant is located in the front of the Venetian, so overlooks the strip making for a nice view at night.  We started out with the cheesy garlic bread, which was huge and quite good.  We also had the meatballs, which were very flavorful and the red sauce was delicious.  For dinner, the other half had the chicken parmesan, which he loved. I had the linguini vongole, which is my go to usually, and I thought it was fresh and well flavored, and not overly oily (my sometimes complaint).  We finished with a plate of all of their desserts, and every single one was good.  I think the cannoli may have been my favorite.  I did not realize until know that this is the Cake Boss' restaurant, but now that I know that, I think he should be the Boss of an Italian dinner too.

-DykGjlRjZ145PK2FA-TXg.text: We had a reservation there a few weeks ago and were seated right away.  Service was attentive -at first. We got our drinks, went straight to the entree. After that, our server wasn't very present. The chicken Marsala was pretty good; however, the pasta carbonara was very rich. My friend ordered it and I felt overwhelmed after two bites. Dessert was wonderful -we got the lobster tail and it was decadent. Great flavor and texture. The pit of night was when our waitress, Kacey, dropped the bill and told us the gratuity was already added so all we had to do was pay the total noted at the bottom.    The problem there was that we were a party of 3. We looked at the bill and printed directly on there was something along the lines of: "No gratuity has been added to your bill. For your convenience, here are some preset gratuity amounts, just circle the one you'd like to apply. - 15% - 18% - 20% - 22%"  Kacey had circled the 20% option and wrote the new total at the bottom because I guess she thought that that was what she deserved. After she dropped the bill, we noticed she was constantly circling our table, waiting for us to provide a method of payment. We were a party of 3 and even though we are young (early 20s) we know how to tip. It was pretty insulting. I get it, you work in the heart of Vegas where many international visitors aren't aware of the customs. But that doesn't mean assume everybody is like that. After talking it over amongst ourselves, I got her attention and pointed out what the receipt stated and said that if it says that, then the gratuity amount should really be up to our discretion. She tried to cover it all up by saying something like, "Oh, that was just a suggested amount, if it's that big of a deal I can just take it off." And she ripped off the bottom of the check.    I've worked in the restaurant industry and servers face heavy disciplinary action for that type of behavior. We still left a tip but the whole ordeal really just left a bad taste in our mouths.

NTycU81RymotkZQaaG7ZpQ.text: The chicken parmesan is delicious. Beware their dinner plate is very large. They have friendly staff as well. A bit pricey.

Lb-x9Gm8_GcON6CY1lZ_vQ.text: Surprisingly delicious and not "reality tv chef" gimmicky at all- the food was really good and I'd totally go back again. Love their 3 course pre fix menu for $40. Portions are pretty generous and the service was quick & speedy. Was able to get in with 4 people no reservations at 9pm no problem.

UFB1SUh6eJw_EtKRhVGCpg.text: Buddy V's Ristorante is located within The Venetian hotel. My best friends parents treated us out to lunch here on a Saturday. It wasn't too crowded and I wasn't sure what to expect. We were seated promptly given we had a reservation for 10. After looking at the menu a few of us decided to get a few different items and eat family style.   // FOOD // Margherita Pizza: sliced tomatoes, basil, fresh mozzarella. Simple and light. It's a medium sized crust, not crispy or too doughy. I really enjoyed this one with a little grated parmesan and crushed red pepper. 4.5/5  Buddy's Favorite Pizza:  spiced sausage, caramelized onions, fennel, four cheese. I didn't care for this one too much. The sausage and the blend of cheese didn't go well together. I would definitely go with the margherita pizza instead. 2.5/5  Spaghetti Central with Meatballs: Your basic and simple spaghetti with five meatballs. It was simple, but I thoroughly enjoyed the tomato sauce. I thought it had excellent flavor. I would definitely order this again and maybe try it with the bolognese next time. 4/5  Chicken Parm: Provolone, mozzarella, spaghetti marinara. This dish was excellent for sharing. It would have been too heavy if one person just got it, but it was great for our group. They give two chicken breasts with a decent portion of spaghetti on the side. The chicken parm was deliciously cheesy! 4/5  Overall, I was extremely pleased with the service and food at Buddy V's Ristorante. I will definitely be back for more of that tomato sauce goodness. The only thing that can possibly make this place any better is if they served you some fresh break with oil and balsamic in the beginning. Just saying...   ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ttMWu7IJJ9loiDN9lp6J_A.text: Overpriced, subpar food, charged us $2 for ice in a drink on the rocks (not kidding) and they charged $10 for an iced tea :')  don't waste your time, go to Olive Garden

fw279Oq94q4tWBUIB5XlQQ.text: Authentic In every way! The chicken parmesan is the absolute greatest ive ever tried. took one bite and my eyes watered from its perfection.  chicken was seasoned to perfection and cooked perfectly as for the spaghetti it was paired with was nothing short of immaculate.  Service was fantastic not once did we feel pressured to order as the waitress was very polite. I will say this place was one of the highlights of my vacating and I will be visiting again for seconds!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best chicken parmesan on the planet! Nearly brought me to tears!

Gkn-SnNucetqiahNuC0btg.text: This is undoubtedly one of my favorite places to eat when in Vegas on the strip . We've been there a few times and the service and food were above average family night or date night it all works it's a must when in Vegas an appetizer two main courses a couple glasses of vino around 100 bucks the price was very fair. 5 stars for the cake boss

XLmYTK2XFBQalT7Pk4-dbg.text: Food was good. Atmosphere nice. We enjoyed our meal and the price for everything was par. My only complaint was our waiter. He started trying to upsell from the beginning even when I told him exactly what I wanted. Oh well. I dint allow him to push me into stuff I didn't want. I will definitely go back-we enjoyed our meal.

_DX_NNNmLw_ICaeT8jPH_A.text: Our experience at Buddy V's was nothing short of spectacular. We were there for our 25th anniversary dinner and our server, Giorgio, was not just a server but a genuine host! He essentially put on a show for us - he gave us the option of allowing him to serve us the course of dishes that he and the chef felt we would enjoy the most, and they well and truly nailed our palate right on the money. Each dish he brought out was phenomenal and he treated us like royalty the entire time we were enjoying his crafted culinary experience. The quality was superb, the ambiance was incredible, and I would recommend Buddy V's for anyone who would like a truly special dining experience!

RJZxfWC1LsqxT11ADjzhxA.text: First time visitor to this restaurant. I'm Italian, I've travelled the world eating amazing food and I will admit right away, my dining experience was average. First time ever I was not offered bread in an Italian restaurant. I ordered grilled salmon and a side of capellini with "tons of garlic".  The salmon was on a bed of cold, uncooked vegetable. Really? I had to send the $7.00 side of capellini back because they forgot to put any garlic in it.  My wine (Super Tuscan) was very good but I don't appreciate drinking a $16.00 glass of wine out of a cheap ass wine glass. Have you heard of crystal wine glasses? Given all of the options in Vegas, I would not come back. First time ever I was not offered bread in an Italian restaurant.

g7bNpLX2FjDhH6TJJcvurw.text: Food wasn't terrible but certainly wasn't up to Vegas standards. I had the meatball sandwich with fries and to be honest, I've had more delicious, moist meatballs from any local ma & pa joint than I did here. They were dry and pretty flavorless. Overall it was overpriced and not worth the time or money considering all of the other places Vegas has to offer.

lA8YwB3BDBxzCG_E6M9HUg.text: Indulgent Italian fare that hit the spot for our family celebration feast! My sister got married in Vegas and we choose this place for our reception, so to speak, and had a fantastic time. The food was amazing with huge portions. The apps we all shared included the meatballs  (EXCELLENT! And I know my meatballs lol), calamari and the focaccia. Everything came out at the same time (bravo!) and we had wine chilling next to the head of the table.  The chicken parm was just like home and was so good after trying it someone else had to have it as well and changed their order. Definitely one of the best things on the menu. There's a great deal where for a set price you get an app, soup/salad, meal and dessert: WORTH IT. I enjoyed my carbonara pasta: SO much flavor.   You could take home leftovers, but you'll just eat them at 4am without regret and it'll still taste good!

k3iJ4GGTXliaT8_QlXB20g.text: Amazing place to eat at if you want authentic tasting Italian food while you are visiting Las Vegas. The service was amazing & the food was even better. And on top of that the drinks are strong. My group had the garlic bread & calamari for an appetizer which was nothing short of extraordinary!! For the main course I had the Mama's gravy which came with pasta on one dish and pork,chicken,& beef on the other plate. It was a combination of a lot of food and great taste all wrapped in one. I highly recommend this place while in the area. Will definitely be coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday&#39;s Gravy

TCmvRCx_ZLwm155nF6WGAg.text: Awesome place! We got the spaghetti with meatballs and lasagna. We are at lunch so the portions were perfect. The lasagna was fantastic. The meatballs were out of this world. The Caesar salad was great as well. We had to entrees, salad,m for table and a bottle of wine for $110, which is not bad in my mind. Great soot

V2cM_lKlJ0h9kgsgVxaBbQ.text: Food was delicious! We had the caesar salad which was dressed perfectly and then for our entrees we had spaghetti and meatballs and the veal parm! The restaurant was laid back with a cool vibe.

krg0oJAPRljCZKinkWwUfQ.text: This place is FANTASTIC! I HIGHLY recommend!!! We had the meatballs and cheese garlic bread, chicken parm, and lasagna. This was hands down our best meal yet! WARNING the portions very large! One of the meals could have filled my husband and I but we were piggies and had to try more LOL! First my husband is Italian and VERY picky about his sauce and this fit his criteria for good sauce. The chicken was fresh and the breading was light but crisp. The the lasagna was outstanding I can't say enough about it. The filling was cheesy, there was meat but not too much, and the sauce was fantastic. We ended the meal with a cannoli that was very well done. Usually the ricotta is too gritty for my taste and this was creamy with just enough sweetness. We seriously can't say enough good things about this meal! If you get the chance to come it is a must. Our only regret is that we couldn't eat more!   My husband would like to add that his ONLY complaint is that the chairs felt cheep.

D1-JTLrLKIAffwjvuZUm7g.text: This restaurant was stumbled upon because we wanted to find a great affordable restaurant that we could go to before going out for a bachelorette. This restaurant is located right in the Venetian hotel right across from Carlos's bakery. The restaurant was dimly lit inside. It's a great restaurant that has an amazing view of the north side of the strip. You just have to request it when making a reservation. It wasn't too crowded and for Vegas it is truly affordable! The dishes run between $15-30. They give you just the right amount. It's definitely not a family style Italian restaurant so I suggest not sharing. I had the chicken rigatoni which I made spicy and omgosh it was so good that I had every last bite and wanted to lick my plate up haha. It was amazing and this is definitely a winner in my book!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy chicken rigatoni

wG4T_YHkJeEmsQ2_3nmf9A.text: Fantastic dinner starting with fantastic customer service by Georgio, live rat pack music and topped off by a delicious toscano salad and then a tasty chicken parmigiana and delicious marinara pasta. So yummy!

GP9TYtPu30L9QphF_hHAYw.text: Fabulous food and incredible service! I look forward to eating here again next time I'm in Vegas!

uI23s0twrqGh2T9CdwfMnw.text: More of a 3.5 star place... Had a team lunch here on a Friday and they do have a nice lunch special where $22 get you one of the three selected app/salad, an entree, and a small dessert (tiramisu or cannoli).  I opted for the regular menu, lasagna, and a regular sized tiramisu.  As we were having lunch, we noticed our neighboring tables all got the 'birthday cake' for dessert so we also added that to our order.  It was good, but the tiramisu was still more delicious to me.  The waiter that attended to us seem to be in the weeds...  Overall, the food is decent but was a tad bit pricey for what it is worth.

uDIKHlg8j90PL66GbptRTQ.text: I had more interest in the Pastry Shop across the way than in this restaurant, but we ended up there for dinner. The restaurant wasn't full, and we were sat in the back in sort of a sad, empty room. Our waiter was nice, and recommended the Lasagna for us, which we ended up sharing. The Lasagna was delicious: it comes baked in this amazing pan and is literally covered with cheese. It was more than enough for my friend and I to share. We also tried the Garlic bread (delicious, but kind of like Texas toast Garlic Bread at the grocery store) and the Caesar salad, which was actually gross.  It was over-salty and had these terrible, sweet croutons that tasted awful with the salad. I took two bits and was done. How do you destroy a Caesar salad? With sweet croutons, that's how. Overall, we were glad we ate there on the account of the Lasagna being so delicious (It is a bit spicy, which made it even yummier), but the back room atmosphere could have been better and less like a neighborhood Applebee's.

p7Rlg2ZWP0FMkvqKPPa3Ng.text: We stopped in while walking the Strip. The staff was phenomenal and so was the food. I had fettuccine Alfredo and my husband had Buddy's favorite pizza. Both were delicious. We finished with cannoli which was excellent. Nothing to complain about!!

FNRfS0y7r8xUMmdgw6EkjQ.text: Great experience!! Food was terrific. My wife had the Shrimp  scampi. Daughter the pizza . My son had Grandmas Meatballs and I had the Lasagne!!! Our waiter MOURAD A. was very helpful and patient with a great attitude!! Highly recommend it !!!

mS81hx7OB8yVmS_-A2SSjQ.text: This place was such a nice surprise. The cappuccino was excellent and the chicken parm was so good. The ambience was really nice on Sunday brunch with the two man band. They take requests and play great classics.

HWdn4zOp9hZkkPTRN4x6mg.text: Could only be better if it were a little quieter but I can't fault the restaurant for the acts of rude tourists that were not taught how civilized people dine out in public.   The service was excellent and attentive, the food was perfect. The veal marsala is possibly the best I've had and I order it frequently. Great italian restaurant ambiance. We enjoyed totally, will be back.

7WLlCWxJvPGlAK_N7pC_xg.text: Nothing good to say about this place. Really wanted to like it, but just didn't meet my expectations at all.  The service was terrible, waitress took forever to come to our table, we were sitting there for a good 15 minutes and didn't even have water. Food took forever to arrive, and once it did, it was awful. No flavor, not cooked well. We took a couple bites and were done, we left our entire meal on the table, paid and walked out. A serious disappointment.

L8b09nt6U4B_Q31x7oBkGA.text: When I was booking the Palazzo as the hotel for NYE 2016 I noticed they offered a $25 dining credit for Buddy V's. As I was choosing from several options the Buddy V's credit sealed the deal as I can always fall back on this restaurant to serve delicious "homemade" comfort Italian food. With this I convinced my family to dine here for dinner.  Dinner is a different beast from lunch. With lunch the No1DP and I are able to have a pretty quiet meal with plenty of natural sunlight. There's also not much activity going on in the middle of the day. Come dinner, especially on the day before NYE, the place was swamped and the tables were loud. There were also plenty of people in line to get a table or in line for the nearby Carlo bakery.  The 3-course pre-theater menu ($38/person) was a hit with everyone in my family. It made ordering a lot easier and since I was covering the dinner tab, along with the $25 credit made a Vegas dinner more reasonably-priced (but still expensive for regular casual Italian). What made it particularly appealing for me was that the menu options included my favorites: Grandma's Meatballs, My Dad's Bucatini Carbonara and Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake. These were the standout dishes I stated in previous reviews and I was very happy I could have all my favorites in one sitting. This was a lot of food - I remember eating cold bucatini carbonara the next day for breakfast (which BTW is still very good if you don't mind eating it cold).  In summary I've enjoyed both lunch and dinner at Buddy V's though the situations that I'll recommend both are different. I'll recommend doing small plates for lunch as the portion sizes are more manageable if you want to save your appetite for a big and fancy dinner. This is currently the arrangement for the No1DP and I whenever we're in Vegas. I'll recommend dinner as a non-date or casual date option if all a party wants is just some good comfort Italian food.  LUNCH: 4/5. DINNER: 4.5/5.

ma-0H4ukCC49hyiZJpN9DA.text: Just landed in Vegas and stopped right in to this world renowned restaurant.  Thank best veal Marsala my wife has had in 15-years.  Coming from NY/NJ my and I know real on The Strip!

ZFX1A-vvqlsyJxRhMhEJnA.text: Pizza and mimosa lunch perfect after a wild night .  Terminando with a delicious cannoli.  Fantastico!

In-AChXdI4-C8qqIQMSR1w.text: Food is pretty good. Good service. By hard to find. Not many signs to find restaurant. The bakery across from the restaurant does extremely well.

bbCEMqUXJ1YmLqkU9iQ6CQ.text: Great food and ambiance and the live music by Nicolas Cole made this a great way to spend our last evening in Vegas! The Sunday Gravy was phenomenal and the service was impeccable.

2_cGYo-9nEgv_MaWqFMeTw.text: Be prepared for upselling. We were greeted with a prompt table was not ready(unTrue) and to go to the bar. After 10 minutes had to ask to be seated, once seated we were asked repeatedly if we would like 6 15 dollar meatballs. When we made it clear we didn't want the meatballs, we were recommended cheese bread with 15 dollar meatballs. When we asked for recommendations on the menu we were told everything was good. The waiter didn't really want to give an opinion, instead asking the bus boy yielded the shrimp scampi was his favorite. All and all the food was good but let down by the service.

U-CONRGRmAa1xNKKzRexYQ.text: Seriously one of the best Italian restaurants I've been to in a long time. Always been a fan of the cake boss and was excited to try his restaurant. The decor was nice, the tables can feel a little close together but that's not a big deal. The staff were great at helping me to decide what to order from the menu. Ended up trying the Aunt Nina's mozzarella en carozza, Buddy's dad's bucatini carbonara, and Nonna's lasagna al forno.   Everything tasted amazing, and I was a big fan of the mozzarella en carozza and the lasagna. Definitely coming here again the next time I'm in Vegas!

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella en carozza

U4U3wwRZcEtBooj4JMaZfQ.text: This place was very nice. Great service as atmosphere  and the food was more or less fabulous. The only two disappointing dishes were the orecchiette which were overly al debts and far too dry. Needed some sauce and the Italian Birthday cake which looked amazing but was  bland, dry and undelicious.  The meatballs, linguini with clams and lobster tails were all really sublime. Highly recommend for a fun night.

4m98cgbnZCNWYh55nUHO0A.text: We were very surprised the food was very tasty. The portions are big enough to share, we ordered the 3 course menu and one appetizer extra, this was more at enough. Very nice waiters, good service.  We will come back!

Zjy2TK3D4QQpdvw845eEgQ.text: I had my heart set on Chicken Parm for lunch. I was extra excited to find the best lunch deal i've seen on the Strip here at Buddy's included chicken parmigiana. Boss' Express Lunch for $22 got us an antipasto, main entree and dessert. For a starter, Grandma's meatballs were tender and sat in a bed of tomato ragu. The much anticipated chicken parm was a little on the dry side but nothing a little more sauce could've helped with. It was just the right amount of food. My heavy lunch was offset by the refreshing lemon sorbet with biscotti. Very strong lemon flavor, it was good! I would also suggest the Panzanella - i tried a few bites and it was a really great salad if you're looking for something lighter to start your meal with.  Fun touches related to baking and family incorporated into the decor. Ceiling lightbulbs encased in mixer whisks, rolling pin structures and at home pictures on the brick walls. Big restaurant and comfortable, family vibe. Huge fan of Buddy's show Cake Boss. Was hoping to catch him but maybe next time!
