Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon sorbet
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Panzella

J5-K4sAw-R9AGz-BWq_csA.text: It was an overall very good experience, the food was very good, service was excellent, the price not so much, but I guess food in Vegas has skyrocketed.

DzsJ7gPQg_UtDkaJSP7UCA.text: The service and the food here were PHENOMENAL! Came here for my Aunt's 21st Birthday. I had the Carbonara, my aunt had the salmon and mash potatoes, and my two friends had the chicken parmigiana; EVERYTHING was tasty. The mashed potatoes were creamy and buttery, the carbonara had great flavor and was filling, and the chicken parm was sooooooooo good.   I never had to look for my waiter or ask for a refill. There was always more person to help and meet my needs. I would definitely go back here. If you are looking for affordable (on average $40 for a appetizer and entree) meal while in Vegas, please go here.

ipp_E1--7SCnxzL4RBayFg.text: Went to the Venetian to find a good place for dinner and I am extremely happy this was the lucky spot we decided on. Drinks were perfect and our meals were delicious. This place can be as casual or formal as you want it to be. Would recommend this to anyone looking for a nice italian meal that won't break your wallet, still in a trendy setting!

wf6o5o92EaiDnRl0456WJA.text: I must admit I was skeptical due to the fact that many of the celebrity restaurants in Vegas are not worth the hype, but Buddy has a winner with this one! The food was delicious, the service was exceptional, knowledgeable, and entertaining, and the atmosphere is lots of fun.  We had the Cesar salad, pepperoni pizza, spaghetti and meatballs, and bread with olive oil and butter. The bread and salads came out first and we couldn't get enough, they were so good! We ordered more bread even though we had pizza and pasta coming. The pizza was crispy and the flavors really popped, and the spaghetti and meatballs were perfection. We had a table where we could see the strip out the window, which was very pleasant and surprisingly serene. Our waiter was truly Italian and a riot. He made our dining experience even more enjoyable.   I definitely recommend Buddies and make sure to check out his bakery across the way!!!

2nBg2Sm3y2MVgtqG_MEYcQ.text: One of the best restaurant experiences in Vegas. The food, drinks, service & atmosphere was amazing! I'm recommending this place to everyone! We arrived 10mins before closing and were beyond pleased with the service & accommodations. I'm coming back every time! And won't stop raving about this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What dreams are made of: &#34;My Mother in Law &#39;s Capellini Shrimp Scampi&#34;

De146yT-hMXfjpS-U2jkQw.text: Amazing food!!!   We ordered the garlic bread and spaghetti with meatballs.   The food was delicious!  The service was fantastic as well!   I would definitely eat here again.

gMaOddeUoNPsZwrYQfO6sw.text: We had a 5:30 dinner reservation but had to wait to be seated.  Not sure why, because the place had lots of empty seats.  The service was good and the food excellent.  We ordered the shrimp scampi which was made with a tomato base sauce and caesar salad.  The croutons were very different...they were served arm with cheese filled inside of these huge croutons.  It was very delicious!!  The breadsticks in packages in a holder on the table were also delicious.  We wished we stayed for the lobster dessert, but we were too filled.   We will be back the next time we're in Vegas visiting.

V1e7fT8woumO9Y7omqCi2A.text: Great family style Italian restaurant and bakery.  Food, service, drinks, ambiance and prices are all great.  Loved the pasta, octopus, meatballs, sausages,  appetizers, kale side dish, fish and bread.  Desserts are to die for and awesome coffee and espresso drinks.  Speaking of drinks the bar menu is fantastic and the wine list is right behind it.  I don't go down to the Strip much for Italian, but, when I do, I go to Buddy V's.

_wqtN3eHzCJMzVx1WHVPqQ.text: Good southern Italian style cooking.  good meatballs which is key!  bone in veal parm was great.  reasonable prices and one of the few restaurants in large hotels with a window view of the strip

YQFFplTjZaOaXn1lZ1rhhA.text: Came here for dinner. The Bucatini is the best Ive ever had! Could eat it again and again.

8Huo_hFd9iqlar5vt5eZbw.text: Made a reservation and was given the worst table there! Stuck at a small table when there was plenty of seating. This angered my bf who preceded to order something small for the both of us. Food was good but restaurant seating sucked!!

1iIs1iLriPD9PwSKdn4tog.text: The food was good. The child's cheese pizza was big and delicious. The chicken piccata had a great white wine sauce and the capers were delicious. My wife enjoyed the chicken Parmesan and couldn't finish the lunch portion. The price was decent for Vegas (lunch, about $17 per person).   The only reason it didn't score higher was the service was VERY slow. We had to ask for water multiple times and generally had to follow up with our waitress quite a bit.   We would come back again.

0tV4jVC2ubCu2SMrN4AaeA.text: All I can say is the best!! Lasagna is bomb!!! Spaghetti is perfect no to saucy but just right!!! Lobster tail and cannoli are sooooooo goooood!! I wish there was in LA!!!!

o0-xuv4rnxLez7nZX1BBTg.text: Went here yesterday and I was so excited to find a place with bottomless mimosas, sangria, and bloody Mary's.  It is a great brunch spot with a great ambience.  The meatballs were delicious and the build your own crepe was cool. Definitely will be coming back!

4IGVdItOzJXzDe7wFinUcg.text: Gosh, I hate to do this but honestly Buddy, you need to know. First, we went for lunch...ok, so its lunch. The bread was dry and stale. We mentioned to the server and she explained to us we are here at lunch and bread is make in AM so it is older. The "FRESH BREAD" IS FOR DINNER". Yikes~ We understood we have to ask for it at lunch but honestly, dry/stale bread? ok, so even gets better. I ordered a Stella, took 15 minutes to reach me. ONLY ASKED AFTER desert arrived is I'd like another Stella? WHAT???? keep the alcohol coming. Its Vegas. 12 minutes for desert. They had to make it fresh...We were laughing that perhaps the staff was in the long bakery line outside the restaurant. Food was good/fair, SERVICE HORRIBLE. Your staff is going to kill your business and should not be tolerated. Our bill was wrong. you name it. and....the best of all--our friend ordered spaghetti/meatballs. He opted for sausage instead. So, he was $6 for CRUMBLED SAUSAGE? WHAT? We discussed with waitress and she was defensive telling him "i distinctly told you it was crumbles" Well, she did not tell him $6 for crumbles. Whole sausage are only available at DINNER? Not cool at all. His family needs to get over there and educated their staff or this place will FALL! I will NOT be back. We ate appx 3pm so not too off for dinner. Very disappointing experience :(

Dyj7CD3P5p0G7unB7Xcn4Q.text: Very hard to find such a friendly place, even the chef came out to greet us! Shoutout to Chef Forgione. Great view and tasty food. The garlic bread and meatballs are a must!

xkw7kSTjnhUiHxr1je0jBg.text: The prices were reasonable and the food was very good. The waitress was just ok, I had asked to do a  doggy bag which she forgot. She was also supposed to find out a having a cake sent to my little girl, but she never did find out. I finally just left. I would definitely go back

7LhuUGBgH607USaT93MXxA.text: I really liked the lasagna!  Very nicely done!  The chocolate molten lava cake was to die for too!!!

lClKMvcsq7KAzHQlYaQsEg.text: If I could give 3.5, I would. The food was really good! We wanted to dine at the restaurant on my birthday, but they were closed for a private party. So they asked us to make a reservation for the next night and they would take good care of us.  Not so True! We had to wait for a table and the service was bad. The guys in the red tshirts were better than the waiters. As for a bday dessert or a bday wish from the waiter- NOTHING!! Did not make me feel special at all, and to think I was soooo excited to celebrate my birthday there a day late. Very disappointing.

UPe5iZH-tATO7wmGWGyElw.text: I just returned home from a trip to Las Vegas with a girlfriend of mine. One of the highlights of our trip was to go to the Carlo's Bakery and Buddy Restaurant. Although the treats at the bakery were amazing we were extremely disappointed by how we were treated by one of the male wait staff at the restaurant. We are in our mid twenties and I feel like he didn't respect us as customers. We ordered a few cocktails as well as the cheeseboard. It was not a pleasant experience and I don't know if you will see this but I think everyone should be treated fairly dining at the restaurant (also the opening time on the website is wrong). That part of our trip was ruined. I love the show and am a huge fan.

hhV9MdvWmWm-Svo_ILpDUQ.text: Best value for lunch.  Appetizer, main corse and dessert for $22. For the Venetian or anywhere on the strip it was a great deal and very good food. I had Caesar salad, carbonara pasta and tiramisu - all great. My friend had salad, pizza and cannoli - again excellent.  Service was good also.

0-MSkUtuS6qJZCWNiJj5Pw.text: Staied at Vegas for 3 days with my wife and randomly walked in to this place after check out the pictures of their food. People who gave less than 4 stars probably had better Italian food than we do. This is the best one so far we have ever tasted.

BlYPHNBkcfRneEl2Gquqqg.text: My wife and I decided to drop in Saturday night to see if we can get a table without a reservation.  Unfortunately they were booked for the night, but the hostess asked if we'd like to sit at a high top at the bar.  Since they offered the full menu we readily agreed.  Within minutes of sitting down we had waters and our waitress greeted us.  The service was great and she happily gave recommendations.  We started with the calamari and it was excellent, the fried anahiem peppers were a great counterpoint to the calamari, which was cooked excellently.  I ordered  the chicken parm and my wife had the chicken picata.  My chicken parm was delicious!  It was two chicken breasts fried to perfection topped with mozeralla and a side of spaghetti with marinara.  I'm very picky about my marinara, I can't  stand when it's sweet, and this was done really well.  Very savory and went perfect with the chicken.  My wife's picata was cooked wonderfully as well but was lacking in the citrus.  She asked for a plate of lemons and was able to season to get desire.  We finished off the meal with a lobster tail dessert.  The pastry was beautifully done, the cream rich and smooth, and the berries tasted very fresh.    All in all it was a great meal, my only gripe was the decor / ambiance.  It was like they couldnt figure out what they wanted to be.  The decor was that of a nice italian restaurant, low lighting and dark wood.  But their menus looked so cheesy like something from Farrels and the busers all wore bright red shirts but the hostesses wore little black dresses.  They need to go either elegant or cheesy, either would be fine but straddling the line is kinda weird.

lxXQZ3i7DpNWX4A0ddt4Jw.text: Herb bread has a very strong flavor. Lots of herbs. Their cheeses on the adult Mac n cheese is out of this world. There is ham an peas in it. I am a vegetarian so I was surprised that there was ham bits in the Mac n cheese. Salad was very fresh and dressing definitely homemade. Spaghetti bolognes was a very generous portion and tastes of Italy! Excellent ambiance!

52nE5Dofn0hrh1xd4WsHgg.text: Absolutely amazing!! The spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parm were the best I have ever had! The Nutella cake was chocolate heaven!!

xk42k_JwF6-gsWdpQxKqCQ.text: My experience with BuddyV was terrible. I ordered house salad and the house special of shrimps with fettuccine. I told the waiter that I cannot have any bacon or pork products (due to religious reason); he understood but didn't care to mention that the salad has bruschetta on it. Well when the salad came I raised concerns and was told another salad is coming without meat.. but after ten minutes and rest of my party already had their salad finished; my salad never came. Later the manager came asking the same questions and promising another salad; to which I told him no since I didn't want start on salad while my party is on their main entree'. I was hoping the food would be good, but no.. The pasta was not fully cooked, hard to chew, dry and only 3 shrimps!!! For a $30 entree' I was expecting some good.  But no! This place is over rated; like many other things in Vegas.

Jv_lKjZH60Vu3c6N8GVHzg.text: Really lovely restaurant -- once you find it!  We asked four employees and most looked puzzled!  We eventually got there and settled in for happy hour -- which lasts till 6:30 pm. Great deal -- $4 wine/proseco/sangria and $5 appetizers.  We enjoyed the calamari, meatballs, and mac n cheese (it was delicious).  Headed to the front desk at 6 pm for our dinner reservation and they assigned us a table right outside the open kitchen hub.  When I requested something quieter?  She walked me back to the bar area!  First I was a little annoyed -- why did I make a reservation if I'm still in the bar?  But turns out it was for the best, a quiet window table in the bar area with a view of the strip.  Perfect.  We were able to order another round of happy hour drinks and their pre-theater menu for $38 pp!  Opting for light choices, we had the tomato soup, salmon, and cannoli.  Salmon was cooked perfectly and the cannoli was a perfect ending.  Both servers in the bar were EXCELLENT, friendly, and attentive.  Sadly, our only disappointment was the quality of the happy hour drinks.  The chardonnay was very dry, which is great for some people, but the big issue was the sulfites in the wines.  Really didn't enjoy the chardonnay or the proseco.  Otherwise, lovely restaurant with good food and great service!

YLJ3dNTFtaFqUj5ZIJM0Qg.text: 5 stars for being the best meal in our week long trip to Vegas. A couple people in our party really wanted to eat here. I could care less thinking it was just a cash in on the cake boss thing. I was wrong. This place is legit.  Food was great, service was pretty good, and prices not really bad if you compare them to other joints on the strip. I paid almost $20 for a terrible cheeseburger at the TI. I paid $24 for some of the most amazing chicken parmesan at Buddy Vs. I know which I'll be going back for next time.  We started with the salumi and cheese board. Everything on the board tasted great. You really get a lot. We had a party of six and didn't eat all of it. I loved the pickled peppers that came with it.  I had the chicken parmesan. Crispy breaded chicken with delicious marinara sauce covered in gooey cheese. So freaking good! It came with a side of spaghetti which I don't normally care for (don't shoot me), but theirs was really good. I just couldn't eat it all, and I'm a big guy.  My wife had the chicken piccata. It was a big portion and delicious. Also served with pasta.  We both loved this place and will most definitely be back! Next time we'll try to save some room for that awesome looking Nutella cake.

ZfoqlWSs8eOD6gryrcnlLQ.text: Their macaroni and cheese is the BEST that I have ever had! I wish it came in a dinner portion. Their service was nice and the atmosphere was relaxing.

G7yQJ06hhgknpQjVZAclEw.text: We came here for the brunch buffet and it was honestly the most amazing food I've ever had. Everything was so delicious and fresh. A lot of buffets have an overwhelming amount of food and you don't get to try it all. Buddy V's had the perfect amount of food. I was able to try everything that I wanted! I would highly recommend the brunch buffet. It was amazing!

WtmJhkFFvN4O0lLbAw1KiQ.text: Wow, did I say wow? WOW! As soon as you've put your order in. The order is at you're table! How do they do that??? Start off with fantastic meatballs. The rigatoni with red sauce was outstanding! The carbonara dish was out of this world. Would it be bad to say go ahead and lick the bowls at the end?

GobCpwDmGEfQJ5dXVUf86w.text: We were pleasantly surprised by Buddy V's. I had a fantastic Caesar salad with warm polenta cubes and Veal Marsala that was delicious. I'd say that the prices were in line with a standard Vegas restaurant. We sat in the bar area by the HUGE windows which gave us a great view of the strip. If you're in the area and want some Italian food, it's worth your time to check Buddy V's out.

hQdw8d5NofiKwY3_oA2KZw.text: Buddy V's is amazing! Not only was the food great but the service was good as well! The meatballs were INCREDIBLE!!!! When ordering here make sure to get them! The cheese pizza, Calamari and Octopus were also very good! Everything ordered here was great and make sure to get a strawberry lemonade!

pFsYXAiiH2zxtuDXHsH-Eg.text: The grilled octopus is probably the best I have ever had. My husband and I still talk about it. The drinks are great and the pasta is the real deal here. The service was excellent! This is another restaurant on our list of favorites in Las Vegas.

aiU-7HaA5t2wZdK4yOitcA.text: Came here for happy hour, it was great! Service was frendly! Will come back to try their dinner! We tried everything at the happy hour menu!!! They were all good!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

E_gZrpMdtYUiEDanIyJaJw.text: We had a nice and delicious dinner earlier tonight. We had the spaghetti with clams and prawns, fried scallops, spaghetti carbonara, and a cannoli for dessert, all to share among 3 of us. The only thing that I don't like was the ambience. It's a noisy restaurant. Service was good and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

k8BDn2gfdALDkMlf75PeTw.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And the food was not great either. I would be happier grabbing some burgers and fries at In-N-Out instead of this crap.

XEfF7v0s4shzu3W_wmoBsw.text: BEST. FOOD. EVER. and the red bull drink is absolutely addicting. I will return to vegas JUST for buddy v's.

RixqEnFq0oMKznTW4Weflg.text: Loved the food. The portion sizes are very large. We had to split. The staff were super friendly. I could eat here again

z5iWCsquySyIkzOcvZDVig.text: Great service by the service staff. Recommending all the food and wine to us. The starters Buratta salad is great, as well as the calamari. We loved our prawn pasta. Amazing. Will definitely come back again.

c-3KhEDgCWt2kifPJFbv9g.text: My husband and I, are locals, celebrated our anniversary there tonight and it was fantastic. It's a little piece of the Italian family we have back east, complete with Sunday Gravy---highly recommended!! Also they make their own mozzarella & ricotta (you'll want to make a meal out of those alone).

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Gravy

XqOGGELw5OMV4O9zIHBSmg.text: While we waited 30 minutes for a table (we did not have a reservation) it was well worth the wait. The two of us split everything - meatball appetizer (to die for), ice cold crisp Caesar salad, and Chicken Penne a la Vodka, and Buddy's Lobster Tail for dessert. Our waitress pointed us in the right direction from start to finish. Oh! And they served this warm cheesy bread - awesome!

BuaHoh0aPyf0-JNbH2PYdQ.text: Great dinning experiene. Ask for Peter for service....great prices and value, not to mention tasty food and the best service.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lm3-548PnN4q2L1ssSEfmA.text: Food and service were both top notch. We sat at the bar and ate because we were in a bit of a rush. I got the chicken penne alla vodka and it was delicious. The fresh bread they provide is awesome as well. Our bartender was extremely friendly and attentive. I would definitely recommend this restaurant

f9ZlOs3nt_4f_eQXPlF7JA.text: Our initial plan was to stop by Carlos' Bakery at Venetian, buy some cannoli and leave. However the line was kind of long and we decided just to have an early dinner at Buddy V's cross the hall and get the deserts at the restaurant.  The hostess was courteous and the waitress was very nice. We ordered Calamari appetizer, clam linguini and mac & cheese. Linguini was al dente and kids liked the mac & cheese. But the deserts were the reason we stopped by. We ordered cannoli and lobster tail. Sure they did not disappoint, the cannoli's filling was fresh and crust was crispy. The lobster tail's skin was crunch and filling goes very well with the fresh fruits.  The price was the average Las Vegas casino meal price and the overall it was pretty good dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DAMGw1GDHuPNNMYOjMCBEw.text: Holy crap! Coming from a "enlarged family" through a recent wedding, I am part of an Italian family and we eat a lot of italian food. We were on a Girls Trip to Vegas, each celebrating something different but together and wanted to dress up for a ladies night out. We were able to get a reservation same day, the wait was so short once we got there and we were able to get some great group shots thanks to some other guests. We got an amazing window booth that over looked the strip and could see the gondolas below - it was not too loud and had a great vibe.   Our waiter Chaz - was amazing! Quick and efficient, he recommended his favorites and we took his advice - food was perfect and portions were definitely Italian Style! Share plates so you can try a little of everything! and still have room for Buddy V's award winning desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Favorite - Chicken Parm! Portions are huge - cooked to perfection!

9G-n4o-xgH-MatwT25JFDA.text: I went to Buddy's for the first time last week and I was very impressed! My mom and I shared Buddy's Favorite Pizza I believe was the name. And I actually think I fell in love. Everything about it was amazing. We actually shared with the random group next to us. The atmosphere is great! There is a fantastic view of the Strip. You can watch the cooks make meals which is fun for the kids! The service was also very good! The Assistant General Manager Adam was as nice as can be. The only problem is there isn't a Buddy's where I live!

lJ8xa2DYjI4Wcz5Rhvix9w.text: My wife and kids love watching "Cake Boss" and I usually always stay at Venetian/Palazzo so when I heard Buddy opened up a restaurant there I knew I had to go.  They had only been open about 10 days or so when my friends and I went so I did take that into consideration when writing this review.  Upon entering the restaurant I felt that the decor was quite nice.  They have framed family photos all around the walls which gives it a "homey" feel.  Even though some of the prices may be creeping close to fine dining prices the cuisine is not fine dining (which I like btw).  The whole table had the Jersey City style fried Mozzarella, margarita pizza, chicken parm, warm nutella cake, and XL lobster tail dessert.  I really enjoyed the fried mozzarella as it was not breaded like traditional fried mozzarella but rather sandwiched between two prices of bread.  The pizza is nothing special to me and did not stand out compared to the same style of pizza at other restaurants.  The chicken parm was a good portion which came with pasta that really did taste homemade.  My friends thought the Lisa's warm nutella cake was the best dessert they have had in their lives!  The service was spoty and our waiter would be gone for long periods of time but the busboy always made sure we had what we needed.  I chalk that up just to being a new restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster tail dessert

wroz4ciDRDWHsLA8APA5Kw.text: A must try when coming to Vegas! I tried the chicken Parmesan it was perfect, as well as the chicken piccata which was the best I've had so far. Meatballs were tender & flavorful as well as the polenta which tasted like butter. Waiter paired our wine to our meals & you have to try the Bombolinis!!!!! Amazing!

eiTgUMBqDcCE7WxajeAVZQ.text: The food was great. Had the chicken a la Vodka, Panzanella, bruschetta, carbonara Mac n cheese, and a lobster tail to finish things off. Food wasn't really bland as a prior review said. The apps needed a little salt, but all else was good. Service was great and not slow as mentioned in other reviews. Prices are reasonable and portions aren't gargantuan so you have some room for desert. Very neat place and I'd go again for sure. The wife liked it as well. I'd give it 4 1/2 stars if it was an option.

r2DqrXPdoLV_soqD0jDmQg.text: Came here with clients our company brought to vegas. Wanted a place with good food and low cost. Very satisfied! Good service, good food, nice view of the strip from certain parts of the restaurant, cosy family feel. Ordered the bone-in milanesa and it was AMAZING! overall great fun and good food. :)

JgJBmVVe92ep7x3kvolNBw.text: I went with my family for lunch, and was not disappointed. We had the meatballs for an appetizer. They were delicious and the sauce was so tasty.  All the food was made very well and the restaurant is very nicely decorated. I loved the dessert, so much better here than across the ways at Carlo's Bakery.  Service was great too.

YhvbUc02jOZS0lKcTawIJw.text: This was just bad. Charged us for meals we sent back and for a slice of birthday cake that we didn't want but they insisted we should get. $300 for a meal where only one dish was actually good (the chicken vodka). Went to Tao for nearly the same price and had the best sushi of my life... Buddy V's was just a waste of money.

Zq88lxZkJnDSbCpe5-1EuQ.text: Great place.  The marinara sauce was excellent and the motzerella appetizer was amazing.   We went between dinner and lunch so it wasn't crowded so,the service was very good.

qjqIZLCOwo6BnZcgRo4rkA.text: Went there for dinner on the way back to California. First of all, we were greeted when we went in. We were sat down right away. I had the Blackberry Collins (drink) and it was delicious. My brother had the drink with Jalapeno and mango and it was so good. Alex Rivera was thee best server I have come across. His skills with explaining the menu to giving us options on what is the "thing" to eat. I ended up eating the Osso Buco. It was soooo tender and the flavor was impeccably mastered. I highly suggest going here. Ask for Alex to be your server! I was impressed, hopefully you will be too.

-nv48APMEvzI7doQ4_sTKw.text: This is a great family style restaurant!  The food is extremely tasty and is set in a relaxed atmosphere. I definitely recommend you stop here while in Vegas .

Xp5qHqvkqtfnVrofpDqMIw.text: I love Cake Boss & Buddy so we went to his restaurant on our recent trip to Vegas. We were a group of 5 vegetarians. We ordered a couple antipastos & pastas. The service was good but the food was ok. Nothing was spectacular. We went with high expectations but were not impressed at all. For dessert we ordered Lisa's Nutella cake which was good. I will add that I liked the decor of the restaurant but that won't bring us back.

seMwL8ACaI-1_iKYfLOnUA.text: A wonderful meal!  We chose to go with the family style and allowed them to bring us the selection.  Worth it.  I would go back just to have more of the marinara sauce.  Everything was amazing.  Great experience.

1AlyUo4dQAEc3b_6Nj15Rw.text: This place is amazing! The food was delicious, the creme brulee is to die for!  Service was fast and courteous.  Atmosphere was a little loud for me, but it's pretty good for a restaurant on the strip

YyzwXc5NkkRvwKvhnkdTLA.text: Lasagna is amazing, Sunday Gravy is also awesome! Will return soon to try other dishes!! Deserts amazing also!

qu6MLE1JFtAbflwX8EnxWA.text: The food was okay( something you can get at a regular Italian restaurant), the service was amazing, very friendly. Me and my husband were celebrating our one year anniversary and a day that special I would of prefer spending it some where, where they don't take your plate when your not finish. It was a Sunday and not that busy but it was like they were trying to kick you out. Not the best experience, never coming here again!

WzFjqF4P7FtSiD30ghvjow.text: Great ambiance, service and food. Meat and Cheese plate to start. Meatballs and chicken Parmesan to follow. Mac and cheese melts in your mouth. I only wish they had spoons so I could get every last drop off the plate. Family oriented for the afternoon and adult ready for the evening. Desert is steps away Carlo's Bake Shop. Our server (William aka Raspberry) was excellent. Worth the $.

pLQClFkfbU1QKDrFklpGNg.text: I was extremely afraid that Buddy V's Ristorante was going to end up being a case of "never meet your heroes." But luckily the food that they're serving was amazing and the service was even better. We had a designated person besides are waiter taking away our plates, bringing us refills on our drinks, and giving us the best service possible. The only problem was how long the kitchen took to bring our main courses to us. After waiting about 45 minutes after we ordered for our food it finally came, and with an apology from the manager. For desert we ordered the famous lobster tail which was amazing. Definitely go if you don't mind spending the money.

0uQ8CpX7D2Zy48pLiKh1Yw.text: In Vegas, never sure if you will be gouged by high prices and mediocre food and service. This place delivers high quality on all aspects. Food was delicious. Prices reasonable. But most of all ... The SERVICE. Wow!! Nailed it!  We dine out 3 times a week (let's face it, I have no business being in a kitchen) and this experience has been by far, one of our best. Georgio, out server ... Hats off to you. Thank you for providing is a welcoming and phenomenal dining experience. And Alex ... A busboy ... Another wow in our books!! Nicely done gentlemen!

RP3kcAgnCP_R6eQRO7CB1g.text: One of the best birthday dinners, ever. The server and busser were so attentive, they could not have been more wonderful. In addition, the food was incredible. Homemade ravioli, yum. Oh and obviously, you're not allowed to not have dessert there :) Thank you. Delizioso!

flddW79TUw_Nrjy84wKHlg.text: I had dinner here early on a Sunday evening. Get here early enough and you can snag one of the tables overlooking the strip.  I had the "Sunday Gravy" which is a variety of things - sausage, meatballs, lamb, etc. served with pasta and red sauce. Great dish and very filling. Dining companion enjoyed her chicken parm. Pricing is reasonable for the strip, but obviously you can get cheaper Italian food in a locals restaurant. Service was good. I'll be back.

OImFKAZoN-ZMhXtW_hoKww.text: Booked a reservation for my anniversary here, they sat us by a wall in the bar. In the bar?? Really!!?? We couldn't get a regular table or booth after booking a reservation? On top of that I mentioned that is was a special occasion as I booked and they never made any mention of it or brought out dessert for us. Service was awful, food was almost too salty to eat and way overpriced for the quality. I was extremely disappointed and embarrassed for taking my fiance here on our special day. Will never ever return!!

3H_nKmCe6scV60z59eCS6A.text: Very nice atmosphere, attentive staff and pretty yummy and authentic food. Not too expensive given it's Vegas. I recommend the carbonara. If you want drinks too I recommend pre-drinks next door at rock house!

-_PgXwupWczJg_aQp1vcMw.text: Pass...  We love Cake Boss, so this place was a no brainer, despite bad reviews on Trip Advisor and some here.  The service was wholly underwhelming, except for the thin older gentlemen who filled our water and brought us bread, he was the only good part of the evening!!!!  The server was courteous but rushed she paid us little attention and it took forever to place an order, to get a dessert menu, and get the bill.  We definitely did not feel like Famiglia:(  Sorry, Buddy, this place needs LOTS of customer service training.  Food: Meh, the lasagne was forgettable, my wife liked the Sunday Gravy OK...  Portions were HUGE, Italian Birthday cake was AMAZING!!!

1HLx_WWYW7jurHAil8h1Wg.text: My husband and myself researched this place before we came on our trip. This place looked like it would be delicious. Since I liked watching buddy v's show I expected big things. Well I was soarly mistaken. We ordered the carving board. The cold cuts at my local Kroger's are way better. All of the food we ordered was terrible.

oj16EoItl2_50plNSxkdOw.text: Best Italian food I have had in a while. Rigatoni Allan vodka was very good. Good service. The only thing I didn't like was the music. On occasion the music went to 80s death love depressing ballads that kind of slowed down the vibe.

lbgabaiFX-cx3-Vd14RxIQ.text: Spaghetti was the overwhelming choice at the table and it was worth it.  The sauce is not a strong tomato taste as most Italian restaurants, almost had a light cream added to it.  The meat was perfect.  A lot of crumbled beef on the sauasage.   Excellent.    Would have been 5 stars with better service.  It seems to be a common theme in Vegas, mediocre service at the restaurants.  I think we asked for coffee 7-8 times before being served.  Just not very attentive and no sense of urgency.    5 star food and 3 star service gets you 4 stars.

EBNpbvyP8w8I2gqEyFKp0g.text: The service was excellent, food was good on Valentine's day until the AGM Adam Marguiles( not sure of the spelling) Decided to interrupt or experience by chasing his server/bartender around yelling at her and chasing her around the bar...Then he screached at her she was cut, right next to my ear.I was shocked to see how the employees are treated there.Buddy V would not approve ,I'm sure...Someone control this situation, it was horrible.We will never go back.

Yml44b7bBajQgHhN4waC5g.text: The food was not bad here but definitely did not have that wow factor. Mostly just skip the spaghetti and meatballs, the meatballs were quite the let down :( the calamari is great and the shrimp scampi noodles were on point but the rest of our food (spaghetti and garlic bread appetizer) was just okay. Ambience is cute and servers were nice and on top of drink refills and checking on our table.

917N7xnUtz440URn_JEJ-A.text: Loved this restaurant! My friend and I came here for dinner on my birthday weekend before going to see Mystere across the street. We had the garlic cheese bread as an appetizer, which was AMAZING. Seriously we both moaned upon the first bite. For my main entree, I got the Chicken Rigatoni and it was soooo good! The portion size was perfect and the pasta was very delicious! For dessert I got the italian donuts which were also delicious! My favorite was the strawberry one, but the chocolate was a close second! Our server was awesome too, he was very attentive and we never went too long without seeing him. I would definitely come back to Buddy V's!

KYUnSKMEYUiiEhYhYiMxIw.text: This place has amazing food and excellent service! We were seated right away at our reservation time and had a great visit. I would definitely come back!

UWKVHRpkGqvDaXhKQ_ApMw.text: I attended Buddy V's brunch in mid April after out-of-town friends asked some Strip brunch suggestions. I was really pleased with their choice and so were they. The selection was smaller than a typical strip Buffet, but everything I ate was high quality and tasty, unlike a lot of dishes on a typical Buffet. The shrimp cocktail we're huge and plentiful, the meat and cheese selection was awesome and the crepes with berries were excellent. The dessert table allows you to try many versions of Buddy's pastries, my favorites were  zeppole(zonuts), the cannoli and the Italian cookies. I was so impressed with this brunch, that the following month when my mother and Aunt came to town, I brought them there as a treat. On my second visit I did the Bloody Mary bar, which was excellent and I was pleased to learn that I could choose from other alcoholic drinks as part of my $15 all you can drink price. I also tried the Bellini and the sangria and both were excellent. I will be bringing many people to this brunch when they come to town. $35 for a Strip brunch of this quality is very reasonable.

YMeUU1IXjTcdPvWv10DaCg.text: Loved the pasta (tried the ravioli,  carbonara,  and spaghetti).  The bread with olive oil and vinegar was tasty too.  There were tiny sticks on the table too.  I have had better chicken parmesan at Maggianos.  The caeser salad was probably the best I have ever had.  By the time our desert came I was already bursting at the seams.....

VUDFHM1QhaWKcx6YI0KlxA.text: Well, we've been here the last three times we visited Vegas!  This place definitely hits the spot if you're looking for an Italian fix.  It's traditional Italian food.  I love the lasagna!  The cheesy garlic bread is delicious too :)

qWDkcVQZc9qhLaY3vdLl7g.text: Best part is the view of the strip from the bar. It wasn't super busy. Slow service from the wait staff, arrogant manager on-duty, and one-drink-at-a-time bartender make this restaurant experience drop a couple of stars. The positives are a very nice greeter, fast kitchen and casual Italian ambience. Skip the basics, don't get the spaghetti or lasagna al forno because they are not much better than local joints. It's expensive for what it is, so you might as well go for the good stuff. Try the veal or chicken parm, veal Marsala, and the bar. I'll try it again and hope it gets better.

vDUqXL4pgED_bb6cSs3Q-g.text: This was a very pleasant surprise. Better than I expected. Very authentic Italian good that reminded me of home (New York). The meatballs and eggplant parmigiana were like my Mom used to make - delicious! The cannoli was to die for! My kids loved it too.

BeAvlPhY4OjlAnFiiYDksw.text: The appetizers were good but the sea bass was a disappointment as it was dry and over cooked. At the $29 price I would expect more. The manager did not seem to care about our complaint and was rude.  There are by far better places to eat in Vegas.

haNNkoc0ZhX9PuAv-chStQ.text: I loved the atmosphere, the decor, everything. Server's are extremely nice and the food is beyond phenomenal. However, they lost a star because I asked for the dessert menu for more than 4 times, that's about it from my experience. GOOD JOB BUDDY

0jV51Cx1NbHgssETu7vhwA.text: We wanted to try their happy hour, unfortunately when we went here last weekend around 515 pm the hostess said we need a reservation they are expecting 400 something reserved guests so they can't accommodate us. So I'm like it must be really good. I just find it weird when the time we tried to check in, the place isn't crowded inside there are even opened seats outside. So we decided to go the next day for their weekend bunch. It was a bit pricey $34.95 including drinks. Our server was nice and very attentive. Selection was not that many but it is a good food. The tomato basil soup was superb. Their apple sausage was tasty. I like how they have a small portions for kids meal too. I was able to get  Reese chocolate. I was a big fan of sweets so dessert is big deal for me. They have red velvet cake and bread pudding not to sweet but it was good.

Yu7MN32g50q7TYhOx_FHzA.text: The chicken parm was delicious. However service was not the greatest. We waited 10 mins at our table before someone even came to our table. After ordering The waiter never came around to ask if we needed anything, we finally had to stop another waiter to ask for a refill on our water.

TKl-zK6aAEbI_5Zb6glRcg.text: This is 2nd time we came back for Chilean Seabass (only in October).  I am not a fan of fish but this fish is the bomb!!! Simple cookingn with garlic but perfect combination with salad.  Defenitly need to try if you have a cahnce.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chilean seabass... cooking but perfect combination 2with salad.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy skin Chilean seabass.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari...very good!

KGQXgJgFRMzveAHBYCKRqg.text: It was my first time at this restaurant and I was very pleased by the set up. My girls and I came here during happy which was great! We got a cute table by the bar and we order sangria and calamari to start. Their complementary bread was so yummy too! We order the cheese pizza to share and it was soo good. Our waitress was super nice and came back multiple times to check on us. I was glad we were able to eat here and check this place out. Their calamari was definitely one of my favorites! I can't wait to come back here again especially if I say at the Palazzo.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese pizza
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1GRo6oCnmGhVM4D2c1bnHA.text: The waiter's partner asks what drinks we are having, my daughter and wife tell the guy they'll have strawberry lemonade. The guy NEVER told us that the drinks come in a YOU-KEEP-THE GLASS, so you have to pay $10 each, so $20 (!!) for two strawberry lemonades! The guy just hands over the drinks menu after around 5 minutes he took our order. I want to confront the guy but the wife says to just let go.  Food was nothing of extraordinary.  Waiter was pleasant, updated us often on our orders and made small conversations here and there- including telling us "Buddy is in the Philippines at that time to personally open his two stores there."  But I had the feeling of being rushed just so they could sit another party. It was only 4pm and there was no people waiting when we left around 4:30pm.  One last annoying thing was the SUGGESTED TIPPING- minimum is 18%! My wife and I are most of the time very generous with tipping (usually 20%) bec of the fact that waiters are not paid well and rely on tips. But out of the goodness of my heart (ha! lol), tipped him 18%.  Their DISHONESTY about the you-keep-the-glass strawberry lemonades and feeling of being rushed make me give then 2.5 stars!  I WON'T COME BACK TO BUDDY'S unless someone buys me lunch. lol

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1-5jx-qNA6JNBoxZoKLwiQ.text: A wonderful restaurant that I am always excited to return back to! I have been here three times now and have never been disappointed. All the wait staff is always friendly and accommodating. Their tomato soup is to die for especially with a side of their homemade bread! Since the portions were large a few of us shared and they were kind enough to separate each dish into two to make it easier to share. The cheese ravioli was delicious. Make sure to make a reservation because this place tends to be busy all the time!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half a portion of House Made Cheese Ravioli

xLx654mJFpXupZaqUCHxUA.text: With over a thousand reviews, it is evident that this is a must for any traveler through Vegas. The giant restaurant may seem daunting but it is a must. For large groups, they have a convenient ordering process. Once seated, they will bring a menu developed around personalized choices (even gluten free variations for the table, food allergies included) to the point where the items are plated separately from main courses.  Salads, followed appetizers, followed by man courses and then finally deserts! I love the little Coca Cola bottles they bring so you're not craning for a team member to refill your glasses! Thanks for making our team dinner so seamless and a classy experience!  The management here is extremely efficient and pleasant to communicate with!!!

XpvglFFtDsghLBbJrBk_4Q.text: The food was amazing and our server was wonderful but there are two sides of the restaurant and we were the only couple who was seated by the bar, during a super crowded and loud private event.  The noise level did not make for a nice date night, like we'd planned.  I feel that if we had been seated on the quieter side it would have been a better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

XUB_aIpBmXctzTyVxV8THw.text: I'm so sad to give this review. I've never met a cannoli I didn't like, but tonight I met a tasteless cannoli with burnt chocolate dipping sauce. Sunday sauce was good aside from the lamb. Chicken rigatoni alla vodka was tasty but rigatoni was a little extra al dente. Worst of all, the croutons in the Cesar salad were soft polenta squares, not crunchy as we hoped. Wanted to like this place so bad!

ky4pNq0h0_ffws6lh0beXQ.text: Authentic Italian food is what you'll get here! If you've ever been to Italy & eaten anywhere in the country, you're pretty much ruined when it comes to experiencing anything at that level of deliciousness here in the U.S. But, this place is a worthy match & delivers on authentic flavor & generous portions. Although it can be a bit loud which is Vegas typical, it was still an enjoyable experience & I highly recommend it.

dR813KAVIJSJ6dgbFR9Xcw.text: The meal was pretty bad Italian food. I was not expecting super authentic italion food but rather good Italian american food, which i love. I got neither at this restaurant.   First I started with a caesar salad. The lettuce was fresh and the dressing was good, however instead of traditional croutons they have these polenta croutons which are soft and squishy with the consistency of soft tofu. These bad croutons ruined the salad. They had no flavor and did not provide the contrast in texture croutons provide in a caesar salad.   For my main course I ordered chicken parm. They provides 2 nice sized chicken filets but again they tasted pretty bland. It was served with an incredibly tiny side of pasta and red sauce. The sauce was bad I have had better jared sauce before. It had so much fresh basil that it was overpowering. Also it was insanely sweet and had no acid balance. I would have expected better from someone who comes from New Jersey.   For desert I got the Italian birthday cake and that at least was great. Super rich and moist and was the only good part of the meal.   The "cake boss" should stick to desert and leave the cooking to a real chef.

L887FcMxymFNDoc3UrOEXQ.text: Without a reservation we were seated on the "patio'.  Standard Italian cuisine done very nicely.  Reasonably priced.  Good portions.  Wine list seemed a little pricey (even for Vegas).

kGYGf2tMjcfDVPXx1WOo7g.text: Food was very good. We had the meat & cheese board appetizer, the lasagne, and New York strip. You can do a pre-fixed option that gives you an appetizer and dessert, however, I recommend ordering a la carte if it's more than one person dining so the portions are bigger. Great flavors with a slight personalized differences by the chef. Overall good Italian food.   You can dine with a view of the strip.

zdCv3RQi5Ya9075Vwy3HTA.text: The disappointment was completely unexpected. The chicken Parmesan had no texture. It was brought to our table within about five minutes of ordering it so it was clearly premade. Enjoyed the wine but that was about it even the cheese garlic bread was just bland. How do you mess up cheese garlic bread? Service was OK. But the food was just nothing that would warrant such a prominent placement on the strip with these kind of prices. I'm not even exaggerating when I say that I've had better Italian food at mall food courts.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blended chicken Parmesan.

neaqetnJIBEFgCvjMTbvQg.text: The chicken rigatoni alla vodka was out of this world. We loved it so much we ate at Buddy V's twice on our vacation to Vegas. Highly recommend the cannoli or Lisa's warm Nutella cake to finish off your meal.

TeXNXCtBfJaMFIUIfATR9g.text: Buddy V's is one of the only "food network" star restaurants I have wanted to check out bc his food isn't fancy smanchy and isn't overpriced. Everything from the sangria, to the garlic bread, to the salad, to the service is amazing. They've always been super accommodating and fast. I've come a few times for brunch, and everything is hot and steaming and they constantly change the food. When I came for happy hour we ordered almost every appetizer and not one disappointed. This is definitely my go to spot when I'm in Vegas, and I will continue to keep coming.

AGYmsS4_nir56hoKXAES-Q.text: I was really looking forward to Buddy's and we got in for a late brunch. You know it's Vegas when you sleep after breakfast and wake up for brunch.  The restaurant wasn't very crowded. we were seated right away and i parked myself in a comfy booth. we got  ~ grilled garlic bread (melted mozzarella and fontina cheese) ~ eggplant parm (crispy and crunchy eggplant tomato,mozzarella, parmesan) ~ cannoli (sweet cinnamon pastry with sweet ricotta)  The garlic bread and eggplant parm were good but the star was their famous cannoli which is loaded with sweet ricotta cream, pistachios and cocoa drops served with chocolate sauce.  What i didn't expect was the sloppy service, our server seemed to be having a bad day and it just felt like he wanted us to leave. I wasn't offered bread and he was ready to bring the check when i had to interrupt him and ask if he would be so kind as to bring us a Dessert Menu.  In the end we let it slide because we were in a good mood and wanted to enjoy ourselves.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More cannoli
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant parm

WD66wiE4MRs7QRIytPepiA.text: We met some friends here who were from out of town, staying at the Venetian. We've never been here at Buddy V and I thought it was good. We were bit surprised how casual, street style noisy trattoria it was, not very intimate, but we enjoyed our time. The service was top notch and KC our Server was great. We started with the calamari and it was ok, the fresh bread was very good. I had the veal parm and it was excellent. Everyone else's meals were good. One of us had the Steak Pizzaiola with polenta, however, the polenta was a bit soggy the eggplant was enjoyed by another and the Branzino was DOA and sent back. The wines by the glass were a little pricey, but good for the brand. All in all a pleasant night

EtFYzD95tfhHqkeRbPO5Eg.text: Had dinner with a family and friends group of 12 last night and our overall experience was mediocre at best; awful at worst. The food was very bland Italian with little seasoning or flair. And for the price the combo of modest portions of mediocre food coupled with elevated pricing was totally unacceptable. Beyond that, problems included 1) the noise level which made socialization difficult, at best (it would be great if you have absolutely no interest in table conversation), and 2) the ruthless attempts at upselling our group a "family style" dinner at $55 per person, excluding beverages. When we repeatedly asked what the dinner would include we received no more than vague responses. We were told there would be an appetizer offering, salad offering, entrees, desserts, etc. But when we asked for specifics as to what the courses would be there was no satisfactory response. There were vague references to pasta, meatballs, etc. and that the meal would a "surprise" from the chef. But, no detail was provided despite repeated questioning about either the offerings or the quantities.The upselling efforts actually extended to ignoring requests for menus until I flatly demanded that our server provide them, which he finally did. And we then ordered from the menu. Our waiter, obviously miffed that we'd shut down his upselling efforts, became a phantom and any needs were met by food runners and a bussing assistant who was efficient and reasonably attentive.  Our final tab, including tip, came to around $475 which was roughly $180 less than the tab would have been had we bought into the "pot luck" chef's surprise "family style" dinner than was ruthlessly pushed. And it's worth noting that our final tab also included not only the food we wanted, but also roughly $90 of alcoholic beverages which would not have been included in the upselling effort. So, despite all the previously mentioned deficiencies we at least escaped a financial scalping.  In short: We are Las Vegas locals, we did NOT have a good experience, we will not return and we will definitely never recommend the restaurant to anyone. Las Vegas locals, and all who come to Las Vegas, deserve better....better food, and a better customer service/dining experience.

gOTKPNgFfhBqkc1INtFNBg.text: Slow, spotty service and food was fairly tasteless. Service from the second waiter was very rushed like they were pushing us out the door yes there were plenty of empty tables. Picked up plates that still had food on it and we were still eating off of. Put on reservation that it was my wife's birthday but no one acknowledged it. Hostess was also not very friendly and fairly rude. Would not recommend.

GUXcttD5MHTyhbvNrTIIiw.text: Let me start by saying I get that it's Vegas. Now that we have that out of the way I will say that the food itself was amazing! You might ask well why only 3 stars? Here's why: even though it's Vegas and even though the food was delicious the service was so so and even for Vegas was supremely overpriced. The server was pushy and overly aggressive trying to up sell and honestly came off as a little misogynistic. Normally we have no problem but wine when out at a restaurant knowing full well you are paying for 2-4 times what it cost to purchase at the store. This restaurant almost forces you to purchase a bottle since it offers essentially one option of each wine to purchase by the glass. It's an Italian freaking restaurant! It should have many options to purchase by the glass or bottle and I'm sorry but selling the Meiomi Chardonnay as the only Chardonnay option for $14 a glass when I can buy an entire bottle for less than that ($12) is just crazy.. there's markup and then there's nuts. To put it plainly you are paying to eat at the famous Buddy V's "Cake Boss" restaurant since you can pay a better price for the same quality if not better food at other Italian restaurants such as Lavo or Trevi. Mic drop

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Starter bread
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

1P-ycuTr61H93AcfGrZIvQ.text: Wow! I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting or living in Las Vegas. I am a huge Cake Boss fan and Buddy really out did himself! Everything was delicious. The restaurant had all these personal touches that fans will recognize. Also his bakery is right across and the food there is just ridiculous.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

nmQWue8V2ZOq37HKiJ7pAA.text: We waited a decent amount of time to be seated but there's a lot around if you get bored waiting, desserts right across from the restaurant definitely caught my eye. Anywho, once we were seated we had a mediocre waiter come to our table. He wasn't too keen on making suggestions about the food and told us that they didn't have straws because they were "eco friendly"... people around us has straws so it was a weird statement to make. I was really torn between lasagna and chicken Parmesan and ultimately went with chicken Parmesan. I ordered some cheesy garlic bread and it's a MUST. So much better than the bread provided. The chicken Parmesan was delicious I just wish it came with a little more pasta because you get two pieces of chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AdDZZ4vdYdCBTV0GZTFoXw.text: Food was very good.   Service was very attentive,  perhaps too much so at times.  Very nice atmosphere.   If you are at Venetian or Palazzo give yourself some time because I found it tough to find.  Overall very nice experience and very good value.  Oh yeah, very good portions

pmSRsiPxIUYeAf3rAiSDGg.text: First time here, had the orecchiette with Italian sausage which was delicious. A little bit on the pricey side, but very good food. Also nice that it's a few steps away from the grand canal so is a little bit less noisy.

-TuArZxBpp7UkMhIwlYfLg.text: we were a large group and they convinced us to order off of a fixed menu family style. surprisingly, the portions were very very small for family style. it was overpriced and the food was very average.   I would never come back

kQATiO6k9wV4A2mgfzfQsw.text: Glorified Olive Garden....the dishes resemble that of a similar American knock off. This is the place for all those pasta loving eaters; however, for the prices, the dishes are no different than something you might find elsewhere for a lower price. The service seemed to be quite busy which made getting the check at the end of dinner seem endless.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Salmon

L8h1fivm9ouyignC4fK0Ng.text: I had brunch here and it was just ok. Not great and not bad. The service was good and the food was average.

dUASm1gP3lPX1TbhAjmMiw.text: We came by earlier on a Friday night after we got off our flight. We thought this was just going to be a touristy spot with mediocre food off the Vegas strip... and we were delightfully mistaken. The food was actually great. The calamari was fantastic, and the Salmon was terrific. Our server and bus boy were all super friendly and very fast accommodating us. The prices weren't terribly expensive either, so overall it was a surprisingly great experience! Others have mentioned to make a reservation, and I'd recommend that! I think we got lucky to be able to walk in. Either way, great place to eat if you're nearby!

xqyJdme8OxcktfdlUgEFcg.text: As a Las Vegas local, I try to avoid the strip restaurants as much as possible.  They're usually over priced, and over crowded, but when I found myself at the Venetian with my wife and daughter, we swung into Buddy V's on a whim for lunch.    My wife and I are typically appalled by kids menus because everything tends to be fried, or bathed in cheese; Buddy V's was no exception.  With that said, I ordered the kids chicken parm, however I requested the dish be with a grilled chicken breast, and no cheese. Our waitress gladly made the change, and my daughter loved the food. $12.00 for a kids meal is a little pricy, but it is the strip after all, and the food was a big hit with my daughter. I don't mind paying for quality.  The lunch menu is a little small, and I was wishing I'd looked at it before getting a table, I figured I'd just grab something with little expectation.  Big mistake! I ordered the adult chicken parm, and my wife had the chicken blt.  The pasta with the chicken parm was slightly al dente, and perfectly cooked. The chicken breading was crunchy with juicy chicken inside.   My wife was a big fan of the thin piece of chicken that came on her sandwich, and the perfectly toasted bread.  The basil was fresh and tomato not mushy, another big hit.  I would have given a higher rating of not for the poor service.  Our waitress, Bethany, disappeared from our table for 20+ minutes. She took our order, and didn't come back until it we'd been finished eating for quite some time.  All in all, we'd come back for the food but the service needs some work. Out total bill was $57.62.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plenty of space.

v8i3Q3UY64IJ8xUsiXdo7Q.text: Loved loved loved the happy hour! Very affordable and great portion sizes. The restaurant was a little difficult to find but many people working the shops happily redirected all my wrong turns. Well worth the search :)

xkIojckQtuH5KptposXSTg.text: What a treat this place was. We arrived without a reservation around 6 pm and were able to get seated right away. The hostess asked if we wanted to sit in their patio and we agreed but once there we quickly changed our minds. We found ourselves sitting out in the pathways of those coming in and out of the Venetian Canal Shoppes. We asked if we could be moved over to the bar and this was no problem. There was plenty of seating in the bar area and this is were we stayed and made it just in time for happy hour. They have some food items as well as alcoholic beverages for $5 and ends around 630 pm. I ordered a Caesar salad and the Eggplant Parmesan and my friend ordered chicken Parmesan and carbonara from the menu. Our app was calamari. It was all delicious and plentiful. So filling in fact that we had enough to take home. The True delight was in the tiramisu which came in a little mason jar. That alone would make me return. The bartenders were wonderful and definitely sold us on our meals. We really enjoyed the service as well as the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Foster Pudding
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara and chicken parm

V--qPnUczfatR7PFjyZmaA.text: "I think good things happen to good people." Buddy Valastro  A good thing happened to my wife and I. We were driving down Las Vegas Boulevard and were trying to decide where we wanted to eat lunch.  Heart Attack Grill ? Been there, done that. Please see review. Carson Kitchen ? Been there, done. Please see review. Lagasse's Stadium? Been there, done that as well. Please see review.  Lola's Louisiana Kitchen? Rock N Noodles? Grimaldi's Pizzeria?   Been... there... done... that... Please... See... Review.  Long story short, we found Buddy V's Ristorante and we enjoyed it a lot! I ate a Hoboken Cheesesteak. I love cheesesteak, but have never been to Hoboken. I'm not really sure what Hoboken would taste like? But the sandwich was delicious.  My wife ate a Chicken BLT and said her's was delicious as well.  Service was spectacular. Our server, Danny was one of the best we have had along Las Vegas Boulevard. If you don't believe me please see my review for Mon Abi Gabi.   The bill was under $40.00! But then again that was without alcohol. That's right it is possible to eat on Las Vegas Boulevard and not consume alcohol!  I have two concerns about Buddy V's Ristorante. One, the bakery across the hallway is over the top and smells addicting. Two, there is a kid's menu, but I have a feeling, Buddy V's Ristorante would not be good for kids in the later hours of the day. Lunch or early dinner, sure.   Great Place. Great Service. In closing I would like to suggest reading my review for Buddy V's Ristorante... but you just did.

fVGKFNYb6DakJ5i7Y7yQpw.text: Nutella Warm Cake was Life changing! We finished that in less than a minute. All four stars are for that. The atmosphere was charming, I love open kitchens. My fiance loved the Chicken parm, she said it was the best she ever had, and she gets it everywhere we go, so that says something. Our waiter was being super thirsty and was giving all the attention to the people next to us who he was hitting on ferociously, I was kinda jealous, he didn't even ask us one question except, if we want dessert. The bus boy though he was on turbo mode, my glass was never empty, we always had bread and he was on it. So all and all that balanced it out.

9WgwHjhgtZyzgVJoPUFftw.text: We showed up for a snack just as happy hour started. The waitress really sold us on the sangria, but it ended up tasting pretty bitter.  The gnocchi was weird. Very bread-like, not your typical starchy pasta. The taste was forgettable.  The wife thought the mac&cheese carbonara just tasted like bacon, but the other two at our table thought it was great (maybe they just like bacon lol). And the sliders were pretty normal. Nothing to write home about.  I found it weird that the happy hour specials were only available in the lounge. Maybe that's normal in Las Vegas/America but it caught us off guard.

9FceGXEktJsFwu5DZenj5w.text: Day two of the restaurant being open so all the staff were on their toes.  Tried the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board (olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola).  The capicola and proscuitto were the best I've ever had and the gorgonzola was epic - bleu cheese flavor with the texture of brie.  Cheeseburger at an Italian restaurant?  You bet because the Pat Lafrieda Burger (brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, tuscan fries) was really tasty.  The tiramisu was the best I've had anywhere.  Ask for a table bordering the outside perimeter windows for great views of The Strip.  Bring your camera to take pictures of the incredible entree cakes Buddy and his team made.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large bowl of Tiramisu with extra Lady Finger cookies, best ever!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy&#39;s Salumi &amp; Cheese Board (three cheeses, three meats, olives, pickled veggies, and grilled bread)

EcyiGCkz_rNNT5hPtiHVBA.text: I have visited Vegas twice this month on business and had to eat at Buddy V's both times. I love the classic Jersey Italian dishes. I had the Chicken Piccata the first time. Skipped Appetizer and Salad since we didnt want to risk getting too full for dessert. Chicken was the perfect amount of Piccata. Dessert was the star of the night with the "Italian Birthday Cake". I consider this the perfect dessert. Beautifully presented on a signature chocolate signed plate and pedestal. The perfect balance of not too sweet and not too rich layers of rum soaked sponge cake and cream filling. Coffee was good too.   Skip Maggianos Little Italy across the street and go to Buddy V's Instead. Far better quality and flavor.

5mMHtmzar7jakNjA0GiWMA.text: I wanted to love the linguine with clams, due to another review, as it is my favorite meal to order when available. It was just okay. My husband's chicken parm was just okay as well. Prices are reasonable.

MHIjCF0RZjMFoEjAgXhnEg.text: Made a reservation here because it was close to the theater where we were seeing a show.  We showed up 30 minutes late and they accommodated us and sat us quickly anyway.  Awesome!  Further, told the busboy that we had a show to catch and could he please tell the server we had to move fast.  Within 2 minutes, server appears to take our order to ensure that we could make our show.  Excellent!  Food:   Garlic Bread:  Good Buddy's Caprese:  Very Good Chicken Rigatoni "Alla Vodka" :  Very Good Valastro Sunday Gravy:  I did not try, but my friend claims it was Excellent.  In fact, he insists I write this in here because he wants to encourage others to eat it.  (He insists that others dip the Garlic Bread into the "Gravy".)  We had a bottle of Chianti and it was very good, as well.  Great service, great food and would definitely go again.  So thankful, they were so accommodating to our tight schedule!

xH_lV6sjxSfH9ANPJsF97g.text: I can't say enough about this restaurant!  Food is moderately/higher priced, but expected in a casino.  Italian food and steaks are awesome!  Drink menu is one of the best to enjoy new things!  One of the best dining experiences of my life!  We enjoyed with friends as a group of 4.  Top place and hidden gem in Sin city!

ZqBgHofwCSRR31qwBTl-2g.text: We didn't make a reservation on the night we stumbled upon Buddy V's inside the Venetian Hotel. It was a pleasant surprise as we have watched his family on tv for years. Adjacent to the Cake Boss bakery you will find the restaurant. The decor makes you feel like you are in Buddy's family kitchen with a trendy twist. First off, we were impressed with our servers knowledge of the restaurant, the beginning including how it all started, how it's grown, and Buddy's role in all of it. He seemed to really love working there and his passion for the company was inspiring. The menu is full of Italian comfort food dishes. A surprising twist to the evening was the lemon croutons on the salads, we ordered a side of them to indulge ourselves throughout dinner. The dessert menu is adorable, it looks like an old family photo album complete with pictures and the history of each recipe used. The personal touches Buddy and his family have put into this restaurant truly make you feel as if you were invited into his personal home. We are so thankful we stumbled upon this gem, and look forward to visiting again on our next trip to Vegas.  If you are a Buddy fan, this place is a MUST!

Cjao2M0ObQt73PrxKVptAg.text: Being the owner is a cake boss and I'm from Delaware only 1 hr from the original location. I was spectacle about coming here for good Italian food but we were in Vegas and hungry so we gave it a shoot. First we didn't have a reservation but they sat us in only 15 min wait time. So while at the bar I seen they have a signature The Cake Boss Martini and let me tell you it was best martini I have had in a long time! The garlic bread was awesome, portions are huge and the desert is wonderful. We even talked to the manager Stewart and expressed what a great place this was to visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderfully awesome drink!

K5xvPiVNupH23uuqxGNK6g.text: Came here for Sunday Brunch. Expectations were low.The last brunch I had was at Yardbird, and if you read my review on that, you may understand why.   Buddy V's offers about 25 food items, and 10 dessert items for a $35 price tag. They also offer a selection of unlimited alcoholic beverages for another $15.  They also have a limited al la carte menu that offers pretty much everything that is already on the buffet, but why would you pay $23 for just chicken parm?  Here we go...  As we walked in, the aroma of GARLIC just punches you in the face!   My! How quickly expectations can change.   We were warmly greeted buy 2 pretty hostesses, and immediately sat at a table. I couldn't wait to look around. Our server greeted us, and went over the workings of the Sunday Brunch. We also got the unlimited alcoholic beverage option.  My lovely wife got sangria, I started with a domestic beer, then went a red wine. Sangria was great, and so was the vino. We stuck with that for most of the meal.   As a foodie, I have to say ALL the food offered was FANTASTIC. If you like Italian comfort food, this brunch will satisfy all your needs, and make you eat way too much.   I ate so much, I did not eat again till the following day.   The italian sausage on the carving station (see pic) was luscious. The fritatta delish, orecchiette pasta amazing, the french toast unlike anything I've had before. Chicken parm was tasty. They put fried polenta croutons in that amazing fresh, cold, caesar salad. Meatballs were nice. My wife loved the ham on the carving station.   EVERYTHING was so good, so good, so good.   I visited the dessert station and discovered a totally different Tiramisu than what  I'm used to. This one was done with love. It was light, wet, and beautiful. The bread pudding and red velvet cake changed my mind about not liking bread pudding and red velvet cake. Hey, the cake boss apparently ain't no joke. These desserts were great. I can't wait to go back to try the Italian wedding cake.  I thought I was done after dessert, but went back to get more of that sausage and meatballs. With a little garlic bread of course. Also had a bloody caesar that was very good also.   Did I mention how good everything was? Man! this place is my new Sunday after church brunch spot!  I've been to buffets on the strip that offer 3 times as much of a selection for about the same price. You know what though? No one could possibly try that much food. Even if you could, not EVERYTHING would be fantastic. The other thing I dislike about buffets is that the food is almost NEVER hot.   Buddy V's Sunday brunch offers a smaller selection of fantastic HOT, FRESH food in a buffet style setting.   The food is so good, that when you float out of there on a euphoric foodie coma trip the last thing you think about is the price. A total value experience.

XShFEhhG3WfsVu_IRC7_dQ.text: This was the best Italian meal we've ever had. We shared chicken parm and lasagna and had the Italian wedding cake and a cannoli for dessert. It was worth every penny we paid. Superb service and attention to detail by the staff. We wouldn't hesitate to eat here again.

XeVeqa2nIMSodRhuO6RpeA.text: We made this reservation on New Years Eve, not knowing what to expect from a restaurant on the strip. Our experience in one word, AWESOME! From the exceptional service, to appetizer (meat and cheese board amazing), to entree (Lasagna is a no brained yummy) and finally dessert (Italian wedding cake, never had this before...soooo good) Buddy V's hit a home run. Thank you for making the start of 2018 very delicious!

kBZYTcKAPdqrMMsvvvam4Q.text: I came here Wednesday night for dinner with my mom, dad, and brother. The decor is very nice just like an Italian restaurant. Our server was very nice. For an appetizer, we started off with fried calamari, it was very crispy and delicious. For my entree, I had the classic cheese pizza and it was good. I also like their margherita pizza but I can't remember the last time I had it because I've been going to Vegas for the past 3 years. Can't wait to return for my next vacation!

iRLDspPhjSaedAbDhdpNbw.text: Good ambience and decent prices.  The food is cooked perfectly, compliments to the chef!  And on top amazing service from our waitress and table runner (Tammy). VfDH-ATzbg-nlQQ2mD5Y8w.text: Everything was beyond delicious.  Calamari was tender with the proper hint of seafood taste.  The shrimp scampi I ordered was perfect, the added side of scallops were done right.  Angel hair pasta was el dented and not sticky. The atmosphere, the staff, the service was amazing. n_7q5tKzGpDc8c0H-NnTsw.text: I have heard of Buddy V thru his cake boss show but I didn't realized he had a full restaurant.  The kids had mac and cheese and a cheese pizza and my wife had the Shrimp Scampi and I had the 3 course meal with a salad, sea bass and cannoli and cookies for desert.  Everything was very good.  There was so much food we didn't have room for desert!  Good food, good service, can't do wrong here!

_sG_TxFLKPwhr5OPGNTcMg.text: What normally is a decent place really seems to have gone downhill with regard to the hostess group at the front.  They have no idea what they are doing.  Upon arriving at 10pm for a table of five, we were greeted with "Is everyone here?" ..Yes, we reply. 'Ok - they're setting it up".....5-10 minutes later we ask what is going on and we're told "It'll be 5-10 minutes" not remembering what they said earlier.  We get to a table by the window and it's too breezy with the vents so we ask to be moved.  She says she can clean off the table next to us and we can move there.    The waiter comes by later and says that's nonsense because that table JUST ORDERED!  So we ask again.  This time we're told we have table 38 in the corner...they just have to set it up (again).  We wait patiently.  When our group sees another group of five moving to table 38, it stuns me.  They of course get seated and I have to ask for the manager.    She promptly comes by and asks all sorts of questions - and in the end comes back with "Sorry for the confusion.  It's been really busy".  REALLY?  ROCKET SCIENCE?  I think not.  With so many choices in Vegas, we will be going elsewhere from now on...don't need to be treated with incompetence from hostess to managerial level.  Good luck Buddy.  We even passed on dessert.  A shame really.....  **** UPDATE NOTE ****   Management did contact us directly and seemed truly concerned about the experience.  Very nice to know that they do care about what went on that evening.

8jLkVHk_x175Wautks6z4Q.text: This has to be the best dining experience my husband and I have ever had.  The service was AMAZING.  Our water glasses never got below half empty.  The staff asked us several times if we needed extra cheese, salt, or pepper added to our dishes.  I ordered the panzanella salad (best salad I've ever eaten), the carbonara (amazing), and for dessert, my husband ordered the tiramisu, and I ordered the cannoli.  BEST dessert ever!  I cannot put into words how delicious the tiramisu is.  But if I had to...perfection.

8fwblKnWe6babqDMTD2vbQ.text: Chicken Parm, the bread....the grilled garlic bread....was the BEST I have EVER had. We never leave LV without a stop at Buddy's.  I have sat in an actual old Sicilian lady kitchen's after they have cooked ancient old family recipes for days and it doesn't compare. Yum Yum

We wouldn't get half way through drinks before it was filled back up with a smile. Would recommend this to anyone.
