nsnafK4GYAUVqM2BHwyrIw.text: Came here on our last night in Vegas and had a great time! The food was soooo good. You won't leave hungry I promise! I'd come back again.

uunk8bpht3RK1FuAzlIXfw.text: Awesome experience! We were beyond impressed with the food and service. William did a fantastic job checking on us and answering questions. The food was incredibly delicious and the staff is very efficient. I would highly recommend checking out Buddy V's if you are looking for somewhere new as a local or are visiting Las Vegas. Buddy V is also known as Cake Boss. Across the way you'll see his other store, which always has a long line. We made a reservation because we went at 5pm. I would recommend making a reservation to ensure you are seated quickly. Within minutes the place was packed for dinner. They also have  great happy hours specials I would recommend checking out.

ct5dp3QK-IaG95sTOSF_9A.text: Great service.  Excellent seat by window on Strip.  Super low lighting only negative.  Great value.  Mains are huge.  We shared.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice Cream and Warm Nutella caje
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari and Grilled Octopus

cgmH83vH_Vw71W8g7ITWXQ.text: Today my friend and I were craving Italian food, and im glad that we chose this place. It definitely hit the spot!   The restaurant was super clean, and not overly crowded. We were seated immediately. This was refreshing since Vegas tends to be crowded everywhere. We had a nice view of the strip and some of the surrounding hotels.   I ordered the chicken parmesan, it was very good. The chicken had good flavor, and I substituted the marinara sauce for a cream sauce with penne pasta.   The whole staff seemed to stop to offer us refills on drinks and bread. Everyone was working together to make sure we had everything we needed.   No complaints, I will definitely be back.

5ksg-PLAzCbv2aBZmfYW4g.text: Plainly speaking, this restaurant looks nice, the food is fairly good and the service is above par, but you pay a very high price for eating here.  So, if you are okay with or need to impress someone by spending about double what you would normally pay for a good, but rather run-of-the-mill and somewhat small portioned Italian meal, then you will likely be satisfied with your experience here.  Otherwise, you'll probably feel like what I felt afterwards. No longer hungry, but not particularly impressed.  We had the panzanella, turkey dinner, linguine and clams, cannolis and apple crostata. The panzanella was good, but we wished there was more than the four small slices of cheese on it. The turkey dinner was good. Was it $24 good? Not so sure. The linguine and clams was somewhat overpowering with the spices. Is linguine and clams supposed to make you sweat? Apple crostata was pretty darn tasty. Easily the highlight of our meal. The cannolis? Seeing as how the cannolis are seemingly a signature type thing, you'd think they would wow. They didn't wow us. They're good cannolis for a Hoboken bakery. But for a $$$ restaurant in the Venetian? For $$$ it needs to be BETTER than "home cooking".

NqFVXKrc3pQUTcmjgWW-Yw.text: I loved it! Disclaimer: I am a huge fan of Buddy and his shows, so I'm a lil biased.  I came in for a late lunch, the staff was friendly and attentive. It was pretty quiet, not too many people around which was nice, I didn't feel like competing or waiting for a table.  I really loved the decor, it was decorated like a nice italian kitchen; I thought the rolling pins that decorate one of the walls was a cute and creative idea. There were family pictures on the walls that gave it that homey feel, and I have to say I really appreciated that the restaurant was spacious, so it didn't seem cluttered.  My friend and I ordered Aunt Nina's Mozzerella en Carozza, which was fried mozzerella with crotini in a tomato sauce.....OMG!! So Freakin good!!!! We were tempted to order another one, but decided to wait till we had tried the rest of the food we ordered.   We also order the linguine in white clam sauce that was also pretty good, it had lots of clams yummy!  For dessert, we got a lobster tail and a cheesecake. The lobster tail was too f*ckin good!!! We were in heaven, the flaky pastry filled with fresh custard cream and fresh berries, it was perfect balance! Not too sweet, not too tart, the berries complimented the pastry perfectly.  Needless to say after that we were stuffed, so we had to take the cheesecake to go.  This place is a must for Cake Boss fans!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute lil photo album style menus
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aunt Ninas mozerella! Omg this was tasty
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. XL lobster tail! Ahhh....I still have dreams about this dessert.

N9CLr-kIylXXxTiMB1F6tA.text: After spending most of the day in the sportsbook, I was ready to chow down and my belly was craving some Italian food. Upon check in at the Palazzo, my wife and I were handed a coupon book to select restaurants, bars, etc. inside of the Venetian and Palazzo. This included a coupon for Buddy V.'s. So we decided give this place a shot when we saw that this place had opened recently and had received four stars on Yelp.   We started off on the light side of things with a Caesar salad. There was nothing particularly great about this salad except for the croutons. I'm not really a crouton fan because they tend to be too bland, salty and/or crunchy.  Normally I would pass over them completely. After my wife urged me multiple times and after I had refused multiple times, I saw my wife's fork with a crouton on the end of it right smack in front of my mouth. I succumbed to peer pressure and tasted what was probably one of the best croutons ever. The crouton had a crunchy exterior and then evolved to a smooth and creamy interior with a terrific garlic flavor inside. It was so delicious that I had to fight my wife for the rest.  Looking back, she probably regrets shoving that crouton in my mouth.   I ordered the Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno which was served in an incredibly hot iron skillet. I think the cheese was still bubbling a little bit when they brought it out to our table. This was probably one of the thickest lasagnas I have eaten in a long time. This lasagna came with generous portions of fresh Italian sausage and ground beef and layered with ricotta, mozzarella and provolone cheeses. The marinara sauce was a perfect blend of sweetness and spiciness and had settled to mostly the sides of the lasagna. The top was sprinkled with a tiny amount of Italian parsley. This was one of the best lasagnas I have had in a long time. Each bite melted in my mouth. There was no doubt I was going to finish dish.  Because of the reviews, tips, and photos of meatballs on Yelp, my wife had to go with the meatball spaghetti. Needless to say, she polished off the dish easily and said it was one of the best meatball spaghettis she had tasted. The meatballs at Buddy V.'s inspired her to go home and cook some meatballs herself. I think that in itself should speak volumes about their meatballs.  We had just enough room at the end to split their Tiramisu which was equally as delicious as our entrees. It was a nice touch to include a side of lady fingers in order to swipe any remaining coffee flavored cream at the end with them.  The service here was top notch. Our waitress was fully knowledgeable about the menu and was ready to offer suggestions. She was great from start to finish!   Even with the coupon, I agree with the other reviewers that say this restaurant is on the pricey side.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu with a side of lady fingers

qyqYMxrwFvsedGYIT8j0FA.text: AMAZING Restaurant with an AMAZING crew! Joy, Thank you for being amazing! You gave the best service i have seen ever. My friends and I came to this restaurant not too long ago and Joy gave us the best service I have got ever. I highly recommend this place to everyone. The whole team was incredible.

_fSSEi9NuJDp2j9CdoH87w.text: Very good food and service. It taste like good homemade Italian food. Huge portions 2 people could split a dinner.   I only gave 4 stars because. We were trying to have a nice dinner of just us 2.  And the hostess puts a party of 8 right next to us when there were available tables not right on top of us. Plus they were extremely loud. It really took away from our celebratory dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!

GD4E6Q3IKwnN4ek8dwYNWA.text: Discovered Lunch Express Menu  I had done some research on Buddy V's Restaurant and found about their lunch express menu. For $22, you can choose an appetizer/soup/salad, your choice of entree and dessert. We had - the Caesar Salad - yummy and creamy. Salad was well tossed. OMG the cheese croutons! I could pop these nonstop! - the meatballs - quite yummy and tasty sauce - Spaghetti Bolognese - mum liked her meal a whole lot - Margherita pizza - fluffy and light pizza. - Bucatini Carbondale - the waiter recommended this dish. It is indeed one of the best carbonaras I've ever had. - Tiramisu - OMG - you don't taste the bitterness of the coffee very much. - Cannoli - crunchy she'll with a cream filling- it was OK Gelato - chocolate and vanilla - cools you down Thinking of coming back for their Sunday Brunch next time.

symfy1lxNBHdq4eMYOtVjA.text: Fantastic food and service. The place has a nice atmosphere and a live band. When you step out of the restaurant you can smell the fresh cakes out of Carla's bakery

GqjjbrF9uPhYa-CaMPEu2A.text: The food at this place is delicious. I can't say the same for the deserts though. Had the "Lobster Tail" and some cannolis. Baked/desert goods were  nothing special. Odd and funny as this is what Buddy is supposedly known for and yet the food was better than the bakery. Chicken Parm on point. Will be back for the food (ALONE) for sure; Next time I'm in Vegas.

rMDYPHBE9eZKUEtEBdlvvg.text: Had a reservation at 7. Arrived a little late but we were seated shortly after our arrival. Our booth was right next to the window so we had a view of the strip. Service was very slow though. Waiter was very pushy on what he wanted us to drink. I wanted to drink a sangria but instead he insisted I tried some other wine. Food was okay but nothing spectacular. Had the birthday cake for dessert and the alcohol taste was VERY strong.

Bx4j3wW0HhbhIzeG6W1J6w.text: Best Italian food I've had in Vegas hands down. We were seated promptly after arriving for our reservation. Hostess was very nice and friendly. All the food came out pretty fast for as busy as they were. The server was pretty short and blunt but he never let our drinks run dry and came by to check on us pretty consistently I would recommend this to anyone coming to Vegas that's likes Italian food. Just make sure you call ahead and make a reservation a day or two in advance

5v7kSc5KW5N8v-WH_PNrZA.text: I wanted to rave about this place, but it was middle of the road Italian food for me, nothing special or memorable and not really worth a second visit due to the service and prices. I had to ask for ice cubes in my water, asked for bread twice, lemons for my water twice, ranch for my son twice. It just wasn't the wow factor I expected for pricey Italian food.

T-22G3RsAxROWMrbD2vneQ.text: We've been here for dinner and Sunday brunch...we always forget the exact location of this place is: 2nd floor, walk towards Las Vegas Blvd side. The food here is ok and service is great. If the Carlos Bakery line across from here is crazy, you might as well eat here and order bakery items for dessert.  I like how they have "healthier' options here. The portions are perfect - which means, if you're starving or have hug appetite, you'll be hungry if you eat just 1 entree.  ***DINNER***  Roasted Sea Bass: Branzino with cured lemon, arugula salad and pine nuts.This was just ok. 3/5  Italian Greens: Tuscan kale, plum tomatoes in garlic oil. Tasty but a little too oily. 2/5  Caramelized Sea Scallops: Perfectly seared scallops with crispy prosciutto, parmesan polenta in tomato vinaigrette. 3.5/5  Seared Salmon: Crisp salmon with charred broccolini, pickled vegetables in balsamic reduction. 4/5  ***BUFFET BRUNCH*** Muffins, croissants, pan au chocolat, bacon, ham, sausage, scrambled eggs, French toast, crepes, nutella, jams/preserves, mascarpone, chicken parmesan, meatballs, orochiette with sausage, mac n cheese, salad, veggie frittata, garlic bread, tiramisu, cannoli, bread pudding, zeppole, red velvet cake, cookies, etc.  It's a pretty good spread. Definitely get the French toast, meatballs, mac n cheese and veggie frittata. I drizzled Nutella on my French toast....mmmmm...however, I don't think I got my $35 worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday brunch plates
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch spread (this is just one section)
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday brunch

qZKczuX8cZfM0TJjaNVLmw.text: Great dinner. We ordered Panzanella Salad, Chicken Piccata and Tiramisu.  This is the best pasta I have had in terms of flavor. It was just perfect. The salad was a bit on the salty side for us, but it got compensated by the Tiramisu.  Do recommend and make reservations. We didn't and had to side outside, which isn't too bad, but sitting in would definitely have been much much better!  It is on the pricey side as expected from a restaurant located in Venetian.

KVni38k65BZEhMt2DlT2tQ.text: Our first trip to Vegas and we selected this as our finale meal. We had good food at a variety of places in Vegas, but this was certainly the best. As a table of four (or more) we had the family style option, a fixed price, multi course meal. It was spectacular. Our server, Georgio, was the perfect combination of attentive and conversational, while knowing when to allow us time to chat and digest between courses. Family style dishes are determined by the chef. First course was panzanella (Italian bread salad), fried calamari (accented with thin sliced fried lemon!), grandma's meatballs, and a charcuterie board. Each item was prepared perfectly. We had a very nice Chardonnay with this course. If the meal had ended there we all would have been wonderfully satisfied with our meal. After letting that settle a bit, out came the entrees: a perfectly cooked beef tenderloin on a bed of mashed potatoes, a gargantuan portion of lasagna, tender chicken medallions in Marsala sauce, and a beautifully prepared sea bass. With the entrees we had Pinot noir. There was no room in our bodies for another morsel of food, but we cheered each other on to eat a bit of each of the desserts: a miniature Italian wedding cake (in honor of our brother and sister in law that were celebrating their 25th anniversary), chocolate cake with coffe gelato, and a conical, cream filled pastry called a lobster tail.  A meal of a lifetime, with impeccable service. If your budget allows, definitely make Buddy Vs a priority stop in Vegas.

4whor7BCeJrbHTs4a3TECA.text: The food was really good. It's restaurant week so they had a special. We all got chicken parm with Caesar salad and cheesecake or cannoli for $20.18.  We thought this was a great value. The bread they bring out is delicious and melts in your mouth. The Caesar salad had the most amazing, what we initially thought were croutons, melt in your mouth cornbread-ish squares. The main entrees were plated beautiful and tasted delicious!  Our daughter got chicken parm off the kids menu and it was the same serving size but no dessert or salad for $12.  We got a sangria carafe for $24 and it was very good and it had a lot of fruit...but not so much alcohol which was ok with me. Service was super friendly, but a little slow.  All in all we were so glad that we stopped in.

R6YHvDguQXu-pClH2sCKUQ.text: Came here with a reservations and got seated right away. They weren't packed at all. Our servers and bussers were super nice and accommodating. I ordered the scallops which was 5 pieces with prosciutto. The scallops are too seasoned in the rosemary flavor, which threw me off. I'm not a fan of rosemary so it was too much for me. I had to swap dishes with my boyfriend. He had the sea bass which was not bad; crispy on skin and flavor was a bit salty but decent. We had cheesy bread to start off too and it was too filling to finish with our entrees. Our wine was good and the we had a side of broccoli that had a kick of spice to it. It was my birthday too, so they gave us a cannoli with happy birthday written in chocolate. It was complimentary which was nice. It wasn't that great for it to be $114 (without tips). Reminds me a lot of Bucca too except that it's not made for family style. I want to return to try their lobster tail dessert, since i heard good things.

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scallops

tuVG_SmlUKSE_BurdNTApQ.text: Very solid food and service. Not the best, not the worst, but also better than "okay".  When you think Italian food this could definitely come to mind. They serve fairly decent sized portions. I ordered the chicken parmigiana, which was very good. I sort have expected when I ordered garlic bread that it would be knots and not just bread covered in cheese, garlic and herbs. It was served with the main course, which was kind of pointless, I would have liked to get the garlic bread before the main course. Anyway, the place was definitely solid, decent price, I would recommend it and I would return if I want good Italian food next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiana with garlic bread

U1hpAPuRuR6eUObrqcFwhg.text: Eaten here a half dozen times now.  Straight up Italian food like I grew up on back home. All the favorite dishes like chicken parm and grandmas meatballs are killer. Great pricing and huge room. Great place for Happy hour in their massive bar area.  If you are in The Venetian or near by this is a no brainer if you are looking for a place to eat and drink at with friends.

vK32Gfbw1dt0DG2rLUs9YA.text: Came here for Sunday brunch. Absolutely love this place. Got a window seat, had a life band, service was excellent, food was delicious. I can't wait to go back!

3TvAGFqE3FxLuMdbO-uPZw.text: Just went in for happy hour and sat at the bar, service was good and the small plates where not bad. They also do a all happy hour out on the patio too.

VoCUUaEid8A0WLw5o6l6pg.text: APPS:  MAC AND CHEESE CARBONARA MEATBALL  ENTREE: VEAL CHOP PARMESAN  everything was amazing!! With all the different Italian restaurants and being this was the last dinner we had in vegas it was hard to choose but so glad we came here! Meatballs were scrumptious, carbonara was rich and decadent and the veal Parmesan was so tender and perfectly fried....veal chop was huge hubby and I shared the entree and it was perfect, and of course the pasta was perfect as well. Will def be back to eat here when we return to vegas.

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball app: was soooo good and flavorful!

WttfYio4D8XZkHtrKIS4Tg.text: I was looking for a quiet place to do a web meeting during my trip and saw this place so I stopped in.  I took a seat on the couches in the bar area and quickly ordered an ice tea and some cannoli.  Once my meeting started, the server checked in on me quietly once or twice to refill my ice tea.  I didn't realize that he didn't know I was in my meeting already.  Oops.  Anyway, this was a nice place to sit and relax away from the crowds in the shops area.  The cannoli was a treat, which I enjoyed one and took the other back to my hotel for a late night snack.  I'll have to try Buddy V's place again so I can check out the whole menu next time.

8aHvzjQCp2FREZE30A26gA.text: Went for lunch here while walking the strip.  The food and service was excellent.  Would highly recommend.

dUqDlC6Ax0yeXCKsFFfhZA.text: Food is great, prices are surprisingly cheap, and service was great. I would recommend a visit, and would come back whenever I'm in Vegas.

XtO3J0jCD8wqGw8QtYpLMg.text: Good but we felt it was priced  a little high for the entire experience.  The service was good. We did not like the seating arrangement though.

NR1QzbnjhLmBJdWAUh9Byg.text: I wanted to just check out Carlo's and didn't know Buddy's was here.  I was so tired from travel and we were staying at the venetian anyway that we just came here.  My wife got the spaghetti and meatballs and I got the Sunday Gravy, which includes Lamb, meatballs, sausage, and pork, and pasta all for $26.  We also got the Cesar Salad which they told us was too big for one person and gave it to us on separate plates to share :) .   I've never had croutons like the ones they served.  Had I known they tasted that good I would have asked for extras.  There was so much food we didn't have room for desert.  We will have to stop by Carlo's in the morning and pick up a few for our road trip to the grand canyon.

QvgEgtLC9rrysBHG5aS3eQ.text: My husband and I had dinner here earlier this year and I can say the service is truly amazing. We dined on a late Sunday evening and our waiter was very attentive throughout the time.   Food: I wasn't super impressed with the food based on all the reviews. No complaints, just didn't live up to the hype I saw in the other reviews. We had the fried mozzarella, lasagna, and garlic bread (huge portions). I felt like Maggianos has tastier sauces for everything we tried, and similar pricing. Would I come here again?? Sure, why not as service was great!

dU7P_S4Y-Ow_4q4Z9-7v9w.text: Food was ok. Service was a little slow. I've had better Italian.  My friends' food was a disaster -tasteless and too salty. Mine was ok. 2 stars for the price and meh food.

ubjVdwcJi4lyiawk7b7fsg.text: As this is the cake boss restaurant, I was hoping to see at least one impressive or unbelievable ornate over the top, beautifully decorated cake.  But there wasn't.  The food was nice, but not amazing.  The menu is based on family recipes, literally "my aunt's spaghetti" which is a nice touch.  The desert menu is like a family photo album, which is again a nice sentiment in a world of global corporate brands. The food was ok.

bXVpddrHKcGI7IybG29mqw.text: I am a fan of the Cake Boss and was excited to come here. A bit hidden in the Shops at the Canal This has place delicious authentic Italian food. We did not have to wait to be seated, with a view of The Strip. The service was great. And the food exceeded every expectation we had. We started with the tomato and basil soup and was so good that we wanted to order some more (and I'm not a tomato soup person). We ordered the chicken rigatoni "alla vodka" and it tasted amazing. It was rich and creamy. We also got the roasted sea bass with arugula salad and it was a great choice too. We went big on desserts with the Italian birthday cake, a layered sponge cake, YUM! And the lobster tail also great. If you want rich Italian food with an Italian feel don't look any further. He also has the Carlos Bakery across from here. Didn't get a chance to go but the pastries looked delish.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The dessert menu is like a family photo album
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of The Strip
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Italian birthday cake and Lobster tail

tImmJiR9os2g62qb22IJGQ.text: Was in Las Vegas for a conference and always try to stay at the Palazzo.  It is a very nice hotel with lots of restaurant choices.  One of my favorites is Buddy V's.  They have great traditional Italian food that is simply prepared with the best ingredients.  The flavors and quality of the food for the price is pretty incredible for anywhere, but especially in Las Vegas.  One of my favorite dishes is the Bucatini Carbonara.  It literally calls my name sometimes.  The best carbonara I have ever eaten is in Austin, TX at a place called La Traviata, but I digress.  Buddy V's Bucatini Carbonara is pretty amazing.  It has just the right mixture of flavors and with the richness of the sauce is just amazing.  I have to confess I was a little high maintenance and asked for a flat pasta (linguine).   My dinner Caesar salad was large, but as Caesar salad go, pretty uninspired.  Don't get me wrong, it was good, but it wasn't up to the level of the pasta dish.  The wine list was reasonable (for Las Vegas) with several good selections by the glass.  Since I was dining alone, a bottle seemed an overindulgence.  If you are anywhere near the Palazzo, Buddy V's is a must.  You need to eat this food.  The one star deduct is for the just average Caesar salad.  Everything else was great.

y2Ryh3wcs5UW6sTOWw4VbQ.text: So this is going to be a bit of a longer review covering so much.   Ambiance: This restaurant has an incredible energy! I love the display kitchen. So you will see everything being made and exiting the kitchen, if you are near the kitchen.   Food: Honestly this menu is one of the best menus. It offers everything from pasta, pizzas, burgers, and everything in between. The quality is incredible too! The chefs have an incredible sense of what flavors go together.   Service:  The initial welcome from the host was incredible! She greeted me and inquired about anything that I am celebrating. She then very politely showed us to the table. Now my waitress was a different story. She greeted us nicely at the beginning. However she made us feel very rushed! Like the restaurant was not busy, why are you rushing us? Like her first question wasn't for drinks but rather food we want. Then when we ordered drinks we never got refills on our water until our food came out. Once we finished the main entree, she was quick to try to give us the check until she remembered we are celebrating a birthday. Overall I'm disappointed in the service.   I still give this 4 stars because it was a great restaurant but had a few bad staff members. Overall I would return but I hope I receive better service next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

81jF7qhZTB9E2qDlF0-KgQ.text: Buddy V's restaurant was good but not great, which was disappointing. The service and setting was excellent and notable. I found everyone from the hostess to waitstaff to be courteous and helpful. The restaurant specializes in classic Italian-American fare like lasagna, chicken parm, and cannolis.   The lasagna, Caesar salad, house salad, and cannoli were all delicious and a highlight of our visit. The chicken parm, unfortunately, was disappointing. There was barely any marinara sauce present and the chicken was not soft and succulent like I've come to expect from excellent Italian-American joints in the New York area.   Overall there is clearly a strong vision coming from Buddy Valastro's family home cooking, but I assume there is some miss in the execution. The restaurant is good and I would recommend if in the area, but it was not a standout.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Ky9M8YoTH5aILFK-8J9YQ.text: My boyfriend and I had got a voucher to eat at this restaurant, originally I didn't realize it was Buddy's restaurant. I freaked out when I realized. I had a high expectations of this place and I can honestly say it met my expectations. The staff was extremely nice, the atmosphere of the restaurant was romantic and the food was delicious with good portions. I am sad that I was completely full that I could not eat dessert but I am definitely coming back when I am in Vegas.

ImlUG726FERyhcS8DiX1FQ.text: I don't write reviews at all; I'm on Yelp to look for great places eat. That being said, do not hesitate to come here! Best service and food I have ever received. The Prix Fixe meal is definitely worth it by getting a 3 course meal for $40. I got the Cesar Salad (amazing), Carbonara (so comforting).. my friends got the chicken parm, which was also very good, and then we got tiramisu for dessert. The tiramisu has a chocolate cake layer in the bottom... amazing. Overall, if you're in Vegas or any other Buddy V location... go!

rAwFHcdJR57VrQOMQUO6-Q.text: So, I went here for my brithday and the food was great and the waiter was great at first but... Then a situation happened. So,  they have like a 40 dollar meal combo where you can get an appetizer, entree,  and a dessert and my sister and my mom were planning on getting that but our waiter suggested doing the 60.00 meals where it's all family style and you can all share. So,  they decided to do that.  However,  when we got out bill they charged by sister for scallops separately when that was supposed to be part of the menu and they also charged me for 2 other desserts when we never ordered those desserts and they gave it to me cause it was my bday but I never ordered it.  They did refund the desserts but that was about it. Like I said the food was good and the waiter was nice for the most part just I don't suggest doing the all you can eat unless you're a big family.

_uFp8oFdJ4H6XkUDIo34ng.text: I was very excited to try famous BuddyV restaurant and we arrived at happy hour time. Excellent food but very bad service. Hostess they do not communicate properly because we over waited for seat that while happy hour bar where was empty. We had to inquiry once more happy hour seat and were seated after some time. Food was excellent we took calamari,meat balls and meatballs sliders, 2 prosecco for great price of $4 each and we skip tiramisu due to slow service.

8QhszrcrvdoYbGDHt07cwg.text: The best food. The best service. The food family style menu was to die for and Georgio's service was truly one of a kind! He made us feel so cared for and made our meal so special. Hands down one of the best restaurants I've eaten at in Las Vegas!

7tGIwEdx78USrm3lOFsxZw.text: I really enjoyed my evening spent here on Valentine's Day!  My husband and I ordered the Meatless meatballs for appetizer. For entrees we ordered Pasta carbonara, Parmesan chicken, and truffle fries.   We also paired it all with a 33oz glass of Stella each.   I highly recommend everything we ordered. Not only was it delicious, it all came in a timely manner. There is something unique to Buddy V's recipes as they are influenced by family and you can taste the difference in these classic dishes.   Our server and everyone else who worked there were upbeat and friendly while working in this fast paced busy restaurant. Everything was on point with the service, takings orders, packing leftovers, plate/utensil exchange, etc.   Thank you for the pleasant experience. Hope to dine here again sometime.

Jan8shelfqKiNP4XGqcssQ.text: I do not like meatballs, never have, but I tried Grammas meatballs and I am a believer. They were amazing! Very light and oh, the flavor. We had the panzanella salad which I thought was only ok. But the carbonara and veal Milanese were pretty spot on though the veal could have been pounded a little thinner. Our only disappointment was the waiter tried to upsell us on the wine. We are big brunello fans (have been to Tuscany several times) The waiter started to tell us Banfi was the only brunello you should have to experience a True Brunello ($40 higher in price). We happen to disagree. Can't wait to go back.

cc_HZEiATMIal0xNdjA1Tw.text: We were only here for the night.  We were staying on the strip, walking, and looking for something different to eat.  I've watched Buddy on T.V. and have been impressed with his portrayed personality anyways.  So when we saw the restaurant we decided to try it.  All of the tables with the view of the strip were taken so we decided to sit at the bar where my husband could watch the hockey game that was about to start.  Christian was our bartender.  She greeted us promptly, set us up with waters, offered suggestions, had a vast knowledge of the foods and drinks and patiently waited for us to make up our minds. They offer a decent selection of bourbons and whiskeys.  My husband loves a good old fashion.  Not only was Christian accomplished in making one she recommended the Elijah Craig and took it to another level.  She muddled the fruit and then strained it off which he always appreciates. Comes over square ice, nice presentation with orange rind and not one, not two, but 3 luxardo cherries.  We got there in time for happy hour, which ends at 6:30 or 7 p.m.   I had the sangria for $5.  You can't beat it.  Probably 1/2 cup of fresh fruit at the bottom.  It was refreshing and the wine was actually a decent one, which isn't always the case for sangrias.  There was another bartender working, Matthew.  They worked flawlessly together.  No one's drink without ice or is left with an unfilled glass.  Usually  you get the attention of 'your' server but here, they are attentive and make you feel like family.  Speaking of which, Matthew recently became the proud Pappa of a preemie which he is still visiting daily at the hospital.  Prayers for speedy growth and discharge home.  Thanks to these two our stay was wonderful and the food was completely overshadowed.  But allow me to address it.  We had the meatball sliders.  I found good.  My husband found wonderful.  The macaroni and cheese was very good.  And we had the lobster tail dessert.  Crispy croissant cooked perfectly with a french creme in the middle.  This is wonderful!  Don't forget afterwards to walk across to Carlo's and get some of their ..

EliLUuNI9bPsGLYSVnb-6w.text: We love this place and frankly may be one of the best food for the money in Vegas.  We tried the pizza this time Buddy's favorite and it was seriously delicious. The Polenta, omg so yummy.  All the food is good, the decor beautiful and the service excellent.  We will be back.

xO78cdyv8Ku6izWDMXQdHw.text: The food was just ok. We expected a lot more for the price and hype.   Only thing that really stood out was the appetizers: meatballs and tomato soup. Very fresh and well seasons. But it's $13 for 3 meatballs so I would really not expect anything short of amazing at that price point.   As for the pasta, nothing exciting about the flavors or presentation. The ravioli dish looked messy and rushed. Reminds me of Chef Boyardee canned raviolis (except bigger) that when you microwave them the sauce splatters everywhere on the plate.   As for dessert, we shared a cannoli. That was good but seemed a bit soft on the shell. Not sure if it was pre-made so it was starting to get soggy or just a softer shell recipe but not the crunchy cannoli I was expecting.   We live close to Vegas and go every few months. We will probably not got go here again. I prefer Gordon Ramsay's Fish and Chips, and so does my debit card.

LwdwwJB8IdhTaP-zRQkUlg.text: Our tradition is to go to Vegas every year and find a place to eat for Thanksgiving meal. I will be honest the price is high but the food is great. We have now gone to Buddy's twice now for the Thanksgiving meal.   We love the food. They have a version for kids or they can order from the kids menu. Note: you can order from the menu if you don't want the chefs menu.   The desserts are to die for. We had the pumpkin cheese cake.  The kids had Chocolate cake and Nutella ice cream

gRzRZlYBpfRi2FlRyI2cqg.text: I will start by saying,  I'm a native and I avoid the strip like the plague.  However,  my mom had been here before and wanted to come back for her birthday.  So my sister and I decided to take her and her best friend here to celebrate her 65th.  I'm always down for trying new places and venturing out.  Let me just say this place did NOT disappoint!!   Oh my goodness!!!   We sat in the bar area so we had a view.  Our bartender/server was Danny and he was amazing!!!  He made us a pitcher of sangria and it was ridiculously good.  We ordered lots of small plates/ appetizers so we could try different things.  The calamari was the best I've ever had outside of Maui.  My moms friend doesn't even like calamari and she loved it.  The caprese salad was hands down the best EVER!!!  The eggplant was incredible.....   I could go on and on but I honestly cannot say one  bad thing about this place.    The service,  the food,  the ambiance....  it exceeded every single expectation!!!  I cannot wait to go back!!!  Absolutely incredible!!!    It was awesome to celebrate my moms birthday with the most amazing meal possible!  Thanks Danny,  you rocked!

o2aRXPBkYiJc1vV1SS2ObQ.text: The BEST linguine and clam I have ever had!!!! I could tell the clams were extremely fresh. Plus, it had a generous amount of clams and chopped clams in the dish. Heaven in my mouth!!! It was too good to the point where the margherita pizza seemed so bland. I had to take the pizza home but it was perfect for the late midnight snack. The tomato basil soup was a little bit on the salty side but wasn't terrible. The mac n cheese was also very delicious! The bread crumbs made a great combination with the mac n cheese. Overall, the service and food was amazing. I would definitely come back more often.

cD79csR_IkU7Kly3C6n4Kg.text: I came to this restaurant because I read a review of burgers and they said this was the best burger ever. Even if it was in an Italian restaurant. It took us forever to find the restaurant. It's not well signed. When we got there a nice lady took us to our table. We waited quite awhile to be noticed. Finally a snoody server came over. He tried to upsell us bottled water. We declined. Of course I didn't order the burger. Instead I had the smashed meatball sandwich. It came on a crisp french roll. It also had ricotta cheese on it. That just ruined it for me. The meatballs were dry and very little sauce. All I could taste was the ricotta. It came with french fries that were nothing spectacular. My friend had the vodka rigatoni. He said it was very good. It should have been for $23.00!! That was the lunch price. I think this place is over priced and to snoody for me. I would have much rather gone across the street to Mangiano's. I never have a bad meal there. No, I won't be back and won't recommend it.

sXiFr0bWAJmUrLW8hNxs3g.text: Not easy to find, but no big deal.  Had the Meatball Sub (Hero) and the problem I had was that it came on a toasted roll?!  It does not say that in the description on the menu and to me, changes the whole delicious simplicity your watering mouth is expecting. Taste of the Meatballs were good and I ended up just eating them.  Now YOU know.

tIYEkCJqcqNTA2ZhdAJzqw.text: Absolutely amazing. The food here is so fresh and SO good. The restaurant itself is stunning and the service is wonderful.

0rKdCAaFFNDQz-Xs0Y7gow.text: Food was great! Our server, Chaz was spot on. The water and bread guys were always there. Oh and the decor is fabulous. Split your meal. The portions are way too big. We ate off our veal chop for 2 days once we brought it home.

dU9Ars2W5Sur3tBQDnWjRA.text: Had chicken parm with a side of rigatoni. The chicken was dry and fair tasting. Not a great example of traditional Italian chicken parm. The rigatoni was very tasty, though could have used more sauce. Overall not a bad meal, but was expecting more from them. Pricey, but typical for Vegas.

dweTMHQicQD5ISSTHfKGbA.text: thankfully it was right where we entered the hotel (from the pedestrian walkway/bridge), so we didn't have to walk far into the venetian lol... there's a lil tables w/ chairs and umbrellas section by the windows near the entrance of the pedestrian walkway/bridge (it's right by huge open windows, no screens so birds literally flew in and ate crumbs off the tables!! idk if u like birds w/ ur meals but i sure wouldn't.. idk y they don't have screens on the windows! but yeah this is their version of an outdoor patio i guess) and also  there's even more extra seating outside the restaurant if u wanna be in the venetian hotel corridor and do people watching (but this section was roped off when we were there). anyway so we find out we didn't have to wait either :))) we got a nice table by the window so we got a nice view of the strip. our waiter was very nice and informative all around. the bread provided was errr different lol but VERY soft which i appreciated, but def do NOT use the oil concoction provided, OMGOSH it has a horrible taste!!! it only lasts a couple secs but man i was tempted to spit it out lol and my husband actually did.. i dunno, maybe the waiter did the concoction wrong? anyone else get bad flavor w/ it?? i really don't see the appeal of that stuff *shrugs.. anyway, i ordered the 'valastro sunday gravy' which is rigatoni pasta w/ various meats: meatballs, sausage, pork, and lamb.. everything was really soft and tender! however, the meatballs didn't taste like i like em (oh well) and the pasta sauce looked a bit orange rather than red, i don't wanna be insulting but my husband did say 'chef boyardee' when he tried my rigatoni lol.. it was still good tho and great portions. also, the server who brought it actually took the meats out of the lil pot they come in and placed em on my plate of rigatoni for me, i thought that was a nice touch :)...    i also got 2 desserts which the waiter suggested i do cuz i asked him if it was better to get desserts in the restaurant or across in the bakery (price-wise, etc). he suggested the restaurant for the lisa's warm nutella cake (i love nutella so this was a must and tasted very good when i had it later that nite). the lil cake has a filling of peanut butter (if i remember right) in the middle, it was thick lol, i wish i had eaten it when i was in the restaurant still... also, it comes w/ salted caramel ice cream which i wasn't a fan of the taste.. i like my ice cream sweet lol, not salty so that was an adjustment for my taste buds but i ate most of it nonetheless.. the crunchy bits that came w/ it were tasty tho IMO... and of course i had to get the tiramisu (i LOVE tiramisu so i was having high expectations w/ this!) it came in this lil jar deal w/ a few lady finger cookies on the side. i was pretty satisfied w/ the tiramisu but i do wish it was more traditionally plated (a square freely on the plate.. idk what it is about vegas strip restaurants putting desserts in jars lol). a nice lil touch is, they give u an italiany postcard saying thank u on it w/ the check which i appreciated and brought home as a souvenir! :) overall, the food wasn't to die for IMO, w/ buddy's shows and cooking/baking being his forte, u'd think his restaurant would be amazing food-wise, but idk maybe the chefs were having an off day or it should've been cooked by buddy himself lol... either way, i still adore the guy and will continue to watch his TLC shows happily as i have been since day 1!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. a close up of the tiramisu  :))) i wish it had been plated more traditionally tho (a square freely on a plate)
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my arrangement of desserts lol. the cake was eaten later that nite.. the tiramisu rocked my world, the ice cream was ehhh
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my valastro sunday gravy dish.. the meats were added onto the plate by the server who brought it. (the meats were in a lil pot)

7EhgJAsxs-nlAHWyfQEeLw.text: AMAZING DINNER! I went to Buddy V's with my family and was a bit nervous at first. I love the show and have been dying to try this restaurant since Buddy announced he was opening it. It was probably one of the best Italian meals I have had in a long time, the meatballs were amazing, great portion size and lots of flavour. The caesar salad was also good, very garlicky which I like. Next was the mains, we got a few but the most memorable were the shrimp pasta and the spaghetti and meatballs. Both had tons of flavour and great portion sizes. We were celebrating my 25th birthday and all I wanted was to try something at Carlos Bakery. The manager was incredible, he went across to the bakery and got me a cupcake because he knew how much I wanted to try it and the line was crazy. For dessert, we also had the apple pie, this was the only item we ordered I was not crazy about. It came out like a hard cookie shell and it was nothing to write home about. The waiter was very annoying, he kept trying to push us to order things and he didn't take no for an answer until we said it more firmly. However, overall, it was a great meal. The manager Adam was very nice and seemed to really enjoy his job. He was all about customer service and customer satisfaction.  My only recommendation is people who dine at the restaurant should also be able to go to the bakery.

sVDpuygIuT2uOl3BgV6PbQ.text: Great food an great service.  Had the meatball sub  and ny friend had the bolognese pasta.  And Danielle was great!

RgdvAInCiVKDzzU2k5dz6Q.text: My wife and I was at Buddy V'S on 10/3/14 I had Lasagna, which was good but it could of been better with more red sauce, the portion was great the price was high 27.00, the Focaccia bread was outstanding, they put us right in front of where they cook and there was a lot of noise, our server did a great job!!

xlQgd-3QD2O4LZjubpYLrg.text: We decided to try this new LV restaurant because we are huge Cake Boss fans. We should have asked for the dessert menu first because the appetizers and entrees were just okay. I'd recommend just coming for the desserts! Sorry Buddy. The food was fair. Location is very nice- can't beat the Venetian. Nice atmosphere. A tad pricey for our family's budget, but expected for a LV strip restaurant.

kh7BQPtkmPh_ppbzYS3DMA.text: Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. My husband and I were looking for a place for lunch and stumbled upon this place. While I know of his show I can't honestly say I've ever watched it. The capresse salad was delicious! I had the penne alla vodka and it was too die for! And my husband had the meatball sub, which he also loved. We shared the Nutella cake for dessert and it was also good, but the salted carmel ice cream was the True star! I would highly recommend stopping in here for a meal!

4y9i6i5_8o514bEiilsTGg.text: We went to Buddy V's on our anniversary for wine and cheese.  We were very impressed with the portions on the cheese/salumi platter.  The wine was delicious and the service we received from Pete our waiter was outstanding.  We will definitely be back.

eT7qBprrvFM2bZUdD6YdPQ.text: Never in my life have I had such a bad experience as the one I had yesterday at this restaurant!  While waiting for friends to stand in the 2 hour line at Carlo's Bakery, I decided to wait at the bar and have a Happy Hour drink special.  I sat at one of the bar tables and was happy that there were only two other customers having drinks. I waited and waited and watched as the waitresses appeared to be setting up for happy hour. The bartender looked busy as he helped the two customers sitting at the bar. After almost 20 minutes I walked to the bar and told the guy I was waiting patiently and he apologized so asked for a sangria and he walked away.  He didn't bother to help me but instead started taking orders from the customers who were starting to pour in. WTF? Finally one of the waitresses asked me what I wanted and i ordered my drink after telling her that i was being ignored.  She failed to acknowledge me. I went back to sit on one of the sofas and finished my drInk and finally after another 20 minutes they finally came around so i could order again.  I was even more perturbed because the customers who came in way after me were already on their third drinks! A few minutes later i saw the waitress with a tray of sangrias assuming one was mine but it was for the people next to me!  She claims she accidentally forgot my drink!  I dont like people playing the race card and never in my life have i ever felt so small and insignificant but thats how they made me feel.  I was the only hispanic in the place. Big deal if my one and only drink was free. The manager Adam Margolies Who claimed to be Buddy's cousin, offered a free $4 drink!  I will never go to an establishment that treats anyone the way i was treated.  Terrible service. No one despite who they are should be singled out.

5b6YIp9_cXxI-nGzaDDVgQ.text: Please Save Your Money Wife and I had dinner there on Friday night. Overall the entire experience was very very disappointing. The value for the dollar was not good.  We had 2 drinks, 2 Apps, the caprase tomato's, laughable small  no taste at all. The potion size was the smallest I ever saw. The price was high even for the strip and it was tasteless. Wife had the tomato basil soup. Was only avg.  I had had the spaghetti bolognese and wife had the regular red sauce. I don't know how Buddy can call himself Italian but the bolognese  sauce was totally tasteless. red sauce was just avg.  Our male waiter upset us big time. Coming to Vegas 4 times a year I am or so I thought well schooled at efforts to run up the bill however.. We ordered drinks, apps etc and he says, oh do you want garlic bread at the table? Thinking it was an opening (welcome) dipping sauce and bread like most Italian restaurants, we say sure. Well us and the table next to us made the same exact mistake. It comes and it is actually $13. charge. We both looked over and said, we just got taken! Shame on Buddy V's for this type of tactic to its guests. BEWARE.. Also, FYI, tables are very close to each other, private conversation is impossible. We heard everything the table next to us said and they were not loud at all.  You need to understand that the value for the dollar you pay is NOT there..  Buddy V should just stick to what he does best, bake!! The open kitchen quickly reviled that there wasn't an Italian in the entire kitchen as it shows in the taste!  There are much better choices on the strip. This is just another celeb chef guy trying to capitalize on the name. If people stop going to these places to eat they will go out of business or start getting it right.  For the life of me I cant figure out why there are positive reviews unless these are being gamed intentualy.  By the way, a manager never came around to even ask us or the other table how everything was. Just another sign! We will never go back.

AfO-m_Nc15lj4ufs-BTMXw.text: 5 stars for the delicious food and the fantastic service I got!!! Its always nice to walk around the Venetian, but the location of this restaurant is quite strange to me, I thought it would be at the heart of Venetian.                                         But anyway I've heard of this place through a client of mine who went to the grand opening, I watch cake boss on tv all the time and I've been curious about this place so I had to check it out for myself.So the wait time for our table on a Saturday night was only 15 minutes, our waiter was great and the amazing client service we got was from our busboy Jamal. He was very attentive,efficient, and he just paid attention to everything. He should definitely get a promotion and a raise! Ok so now the review of the food. We started with a charred octopus (recommended by our waiter)as appetizer and it was seriously delicious, I love squid so this was perfect. For our drinks we got the brooklyn ipa and prosecco which went perfect with everything we ordered.For entree we ordered Eggplant Parmesan with marinara pasta, Meatball Spaghetti and Garlic Bread on the side. Everything was so delicious. The garlic bread was a meal by itself. The portions here are huge, so you better go here with a huge appetite.And lastly we got the lobster tail and this was the cherry on top it was light,airy, and yummy! I'm very excited that the cake boss opened a restaurant in sin city! Now I don't have to drool all the time while watching him make amazing pastries on tv, I can just stop by Buddy V's ristorante instead! I will definitely go back because the experience and service I got was excellent.

2gGgw56U39hb-6ctlPq_iQ.text: Stayed at The Venetian and made a reservation for 5:15pm on Saturday night.  When we were to be seated, the hostess tried to sit us right opposite the open kitchen, which is brightly lit, noisy, steamy and certainly not where we wanted to be. She then went back to see where else we sit and we got a table for 2 in the bar. The food was good. Foccacia was warm and they offered oil and vinegar as well as butter. We found the service was fast, maybe a bit too fast.  Maybe Saturday night is a busy one,and they try to move their diners along. We had the beef medallion, $38, cooked a little too rare for medium, but it was tasty. The mashed potatoes and sauteed spinach that it was placed on, could have been a bit more generous. Very skimpy on those portions. We also had the price fixed dinner for $38, which gave you choices. We had: Grandma's meatballs, chicken parm with spaghetti and they were tasty but they skimped on the sauce so although it was good, it could have been better. The chicken parm was very crispy and tender but the spaghetti was a bit dry. The meatballs had a nice portion of sauce served with them, so we should have kept that dish, just for the leftover sauce. The desserts you could choose was a cannoli or a Nutella cake with salted carmel ice cream.  Nah...didn't appeal to us, but we were told you couldn't substitute from that menu.  Really?  I can understand the entrees but the desserts? We were told that they had a 'full dessert menu' but our waitress never offered to show it to us. Carlo's Bakery is right across the hall from the restaurant, but by the time our meal was done, so were we. There was quite a long line waiting to get into the bakery, and it wasn't moving very quickly.  What we did notice, was that when you go to sit at the bar, there are 2 steps up, and there is no handrail in the middle of this wide expanse. We saw two patrons stumble, and one of the waiters actually took a flat out fall. We may go back to give Buddy V's another try and since we now know the lay of the land, so to speak, we will be specific about where we want to be seated, and will order with a request for "additional sauce on the side". I'm from Jersey City NJ originally, so come on, Buddy, take a little constructive criticism to heart, from a neighbor who loves ya'!  :-)

PM94nbIZAYlNP67OjnJCRA.text: Love this place! Their chicken parmesan is unbelievable!  It is a great environment and fun place to go.  For desert the lobster tail pastry is a must and is definetly enough for a few people.  So good!!

deFMJml_SZGlrz6eyrQGOg.text: I had the chicken parm which was good. My husband had the scallops and they were delicious!  Not to heavy, just right portions. The garlic cheese bread was very good. The service was great!

EfKf9vV5_OGcczzt4GHoWA.text: Just returned from Vegas. Had reservations for 5pm before seeing Rock Of Ages Show.  Went personally at noon to confirm reservations, as the two ladies in our party of four were celebrating birthdays, and wanted to make sure we would get window seats.  The original reservations were made at the same time room reservations were made by the pallazo hotel.  We were told we would be given window seats. Well the hostess said she could not guarantee, but made a note of the request as well as the birthday celebration. We arrived at 4:45pm fifteen minutes early, and found an almost empty restaurant.  As luck would have it, the original hostess was there.  She said she would be able to seat us "near" a window table.  I laughed and said, well it looks as though you have lots of tables.....her comment was to go sit in the lounge "bar" area until our reservation time.  Trying to sell drinks I suppose.  We sat there , not ordering drinks, and she started to seat us away from the window....again I reminded her, and miraculously she found a table.. It dawned on me later (after my wife explained) she was fishing for a tip to "find a table" Anyway, we ordered.   The Lasagna came, large portion, lots of cheese and meat, little skimpy on the sauce.  Wife had Chicken Parmesan which was overcooked and little sauce.  The other couples order consisted of a new York steak which she raved about, but her husband had steak and lobster, and said the steak he had was tough, but the lobster was good.   Table service was good, lots of flat bread, water refills. Oh....if you happen to like a nice fruity White Zinfandel (the fastest growing wine category in the US) you will not get it there.. They don't carry one,  I know some restaurants are a bit snobbish because its a "blend"    So regarding the birthdays?  Well most restaurants will make an effort to do something to acknowledge a celebration.... Desert came and went, nothing...  Anyway, I know they have not been open for very long.  Our waiter was good, food runners ok...The Floor manager spent his time looking from a distance, but made no contact with the customers.    Place looks nice, food ok, price ok....but Buddy......you need to instill a little passion in your place...Your gonna have to step it up to compete with the upscale establisments located in the same building.

JSUO7HfOYG2rr9BB7hqw0A.text: Let me start out by saying that if you come here without trying the calimari you are making a mistake.. In fact you will want to come hungry and order more than one because you may not want to share... I ordered the smashed meatball sandwich with parmigian fries.. This was a 10! Great flavor and healthy portion size. I haven't been this pleasantly surprised by a meal in a long time. 2 thumbs way up to buddy v's

HamHo147b4DFEnhlCnN28Q.text: Service was terrible. Hostesses were not accommodating and acted like they were the ones running the place. Manager is clearly not on the side of the customer and inexperienced. With all of the choices available at the Venetian, I would think they would be more customer focused.

aURmcdmWwOc9q-540Bf3Zg.text: We were in Las Vegas and stopped in for an early dinner. We were extremely impressed with the food and service. We ordered a healthy amount of food, our bill was $95. We will return for sure if we're in the area again.

The food was unbelievable and the staff outstanding,  this is the place to go if you want to have a memorable dinner with a wonderful group of people , they truly were the icing on the cake ..

7-rdMbXA0qJ-yEskqivqmw.text: The lasagna is simply delicious, chicken parm as well.  Chicken Caesar is ok. Some stuff is overpriced overall kids had good experience and enjoyed their food. Service is great they are on top of things

AKOE7M0jtgbbmf7e8htflQ.text: This place is excellent!  Great service, great food, great atmosphere!  A must try whenever you are in Vegas!

N8D8Ej5RXv-NXKD_k-7r0A.text: My girlfriend and I went to Buddy V's Ristorante on May 10, 2014. I'm a fan of Cake Boss so I knew in advance of our trip that this would be one of the first places we would eat at. She ordered Nonna's Lasanga al Forno which we both enjoyed. I ordered the Valastro Sunday Gravy which also was pretty good. To be honest I expected a little more from the restaurant before arriving there, but at the same time it is what it's described as. A casual Italian restaurant with a famous owner and I'm ok with that.

jxYsno6MygqjeSk5EKp3Xw.text: The service was so good they were so nice the food was amazing it tasted like real home made Italian food. They brought out are dishes fast too! Definitely recommend to come to this restaurant when coming to Las Vegas.

8mOsa-M2c3yu9BK1E3Yjng.text: Great Place to eat!!! Wifey had me try the garlic cheese bread.....OMG!!! was so Freaking GOOD!!! Highly recommend this place. Staff was great! Service exceptional! Ask for one of (Caleb's Tables). Food Amazing! I will keep coming back any time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pic of the outside sign and our drinks

-l-8McfFzaePkcYHPInJ6A.text: Was told it would be 30 mins and it was 50 mins while I could see seats open. Then they cram as many seats and tables together where I am less than 2 feet from someone not in my party. Could not turn my head without feeling like I was invading someone else privacy. Also some tables is right next to kitchen and with all the banging and yelling in kitchen could not hear myself think much less have a conversation. Server disappeared for 15-20 at one point. Food was average. Basically running on name alone

8dMFhyMve2N6xEtknxopgw.text: Had chicken parmesan and it was amazing, big, thin, lightly breaded and juicy. We also had grandma's meatballs which were great as well.  I'm def coming back here next time im in vegas.

xdTfTHVd5m0iXKxADUWyLg.text: My husband and I are huge cake boss fans. We've visited the bakery multiple times, met buddy, and even ordered birthday cakes from Carlo's. He's such a nice guy, and his family is so genuine.   Of course we had to try one of his newest additions. We showed up on a Friday right when they open, at 11:30a. We were seated pretty promptly. Our server was friendly, but not very authentic... Kinda 'going through the motions'. Too early to be at work I guess.  We ordered a pizza and a sausage and pasta dish. Both were very tasty and average sized, not huge but not small either.   The decor is very authentic Italian, and has a homestyle kitchen vibe. Really spacious with tons of seating, only the weren't too many people dining , that day at least.   I'll be back next time in in Vegas! I hope others will too!

pfs2iNTSLwrPEcWieVOsSA.text: My boyfriend and I were so looking forward to the food and the experience.  I will say it was very busy and we got right in to our table.  The wait staff is amazing!!! they were so attentive and they were never missing in action.  The lasagna was to die for and the portion was enough for 4 people.  If anyone is going there get the lasagna you will think you have died and gone to heaven.   For dessert we had the lobster claw with cream and berries again outstanding and enough for two people to share.  They also let you reserve on line.   I would suggest that you take full advantage of that.  Some days are harder to get into the restaurant than others.  And online reservation makes it more convenient.    I would also suggest that you don't go home with out visiting Carlos Bakery which is located just across from the restaurant   I am going there again very soon and they also have a Happy Hour menu with lots of specials especially for all the locals.

CG49bXZj5Y5xFiXHIzFnVQ.text: Wasn't bad, but doesn't come close to actual Italian food. Basically a few steps above an Olive Garden. The service was great though and our waiter was attentive. Should have went next door and tried the desserts.

y_Otx75nSq4YfjydPFPDXw.text: I had a couple of friends in town to celebrate a 21st birthday. We tried a few options; the club, people watching, etc but it wasn't living up to The Experience (although I am local) for my friends. We ended up stopping by at Buddy V's and Joy, the bartender there, completely turned our night around... From her wonderful personality to the detail she put into creating and explaining our cocktails - THAT is what Vegas is about. The experience. We didn't plan on being there last night but we spent a good 2-3 hours there having a wonderful time and joy ended up giving my friend the experience we were all looking to get.

rtG2YSN7vBxFgw9gLL5tmQ.text: Excellent well worth the price! Went for desert but ended up having salad, dinner and desert.  We split the Lobster Tail and great coffee for desert.  The portions were perfect to split. We live in Las Vegas and can't wait to return and share with friends and family.

8jeEjR4sgbNyKBBWxs5YxA.text: We vacation in Las Vegas several times a year and plan our dinners in advance.... Buddy V's is ALWAYS on our list. We love everything about this establishment! Not only is the food some of the BEST Italian we've ever had, the staff makes the experience. Thank you Emily, Nichol and Joy for another wonderful evening!

bXyYM0I5XyqWqPCfdsrz_Q.text: This restaurant was just ok for me.  We went on a Saturday for lunch.  Service was ok, but not great. The food was ok, but nothing outstanding.  Finally, the prices were high for what was served.  Now for more detail.   My husband and I both had salads.  I had the panzanella, which is mozzarella and grilled bread on a bed of greens.  The bread was wet and mushy.  The greens had way too much dressing.  The good news: the tomatoes and cucumbers in the salad were delicious.    My husband got the Sicilian charred octopus. He said the octopus was nice.  The problem is, with so many outstanding restaurants close by, "nice" just doesn't make the grade.    Sorry Buddy!

9LReR3mOG2g0xw3xty2oPA.text: Really really wanted to give more stars because I am such a fan of the Cake Boss, but our meal was mediocre at best for the amount we paid for it.  The spaghetti and meatballs were extremely salty with little flavor otherwise.    We did not have any dessert, but the cute pictures in the dessert menu we so wonderful!  The service was acceptable and friendly, but I'm not sure we will return.  Sorry Buddy  PS... Okay I decided to go back  2 nights later to give it a second chance. We heard the tiramisu was wonderful so we asked to get some to go, and they said they were unable to do so...... What a disappointment.  Two strikes and your out!

KgOI0lHYNUVdBkpTxYv_Lg.text: I honestly had a hard time finding things to eat here as a vegan. I opted for the whole wheat penne pasta with roasted vegetables - mostly mushrooms! It was delicious, aside from the mushrooms. I'd prefer if it was listed in the description what the veggies were! Otherwise, seems like an average Italian restaurant to me.

EL5daFPepSVvCcEw8hT0JQ.text: Best place ever! We tried the express menu, from the soup to the dessert, everything was awesome. Definitely worth trying if you are on the strip.

MffVmRdicCP-10fL2QvBGw.text: All the servers were excellent I believe the main servers name was Gianni but his two helpers and the hostesses were fantastic too. This is one of my new favorite restaurants. I have to drink tonic water for my leg cramps and they made sure my glass was never empty. Also the main server recommended a fantastic drink we enjoyed every moment of the evening. Great job and the service was second to none.
