Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XcutTDO2lLOzJd2SxzpZ-w.text: My husband and I came here for my birthday dinner on August 22nd and I can not express how wonderful our meal and service was. The food was so delicious as well as the dessert. Our server Peter was so kind, helpful, knowledgeable of the menu and provided excellent recommendations. The manager Emily was so sweet and made us feel so welcomed! Over all it was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. They truly made us feel so special. I can't wait to go back. Thank you Peter, Emily and the whole team at Buddy V's

FzhWJlvl9zDOEqPrRxH-Vw.text: Spur of the moment choice but well worth it. Entertainment was good & food was excellent. Nice happy hour special & the garlic bread was terrific

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best garlic bread I&#39;ve had in a while!

6CoUA1M_YP90jwZRVtW-ww.text: Excellent meatball sub - it's huge and good to share so you have room for the super fabulous cannoli! The food is amazing and the service is amazing as well! This is a must in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UqIdHQMe5E7kIzBjuFR1ng.text: The brunch was so much fun and delicious!! Come hungry! A little expensive but I didn't regret it.

wHR7V0MMRnP9GSGk0ub7Rw.text: Wow, not sure where to begin because there were so many amazing aspects to our buffet brunch! Part of the reason we decided to check out this spot was because of the amazing drink special. We were sold on the $14.95 for bottomless drinks, thinking that the food would be a run of the mill Vegas buffet. Our group of 9 ended up arriving pretty late to our reservation due to traffic and the navigation of the hotel. Our waiter, Charlie, couldn't have been more understanding and cool about it. When we ordered our drinks, we found out that with the special you could switch your drink at anytime. Because of that, our boy Charlie was generous with keeping a mixture of carafes on the table, and kept them flowing! Once we actually got started on the buffet.... Wow. Everything was DELICIOUS. I highly recommend the Mac and Cheese (it was on my plate every single time!)  Overall for the price of the buffet/drinks and the actual quality of the food, this place is a steal! I cannot wait to come back the next time I'm in Vegas. I also hope to have Charlie as a waiter again, because his helpful and sweet attitude really just enhanced the entire experience!

JNjYi8qdkbsV5AU5PHVnuA.text: Before we get to food or ambiance, first you have to find the place - which is buried in the maze of the Venetian / Palazzo Canal Shops.  I have been to the real Venice many times and I swear it is easier to find your way around there than it is around the Canal Shops.  At least the real Venice has guidebooks with maps.  It would be helpful if Buddy V's website would at least give a clue, like saying "We are on the second floor, about 30 yards down a hallway from Barney's New York, and overlooking the porte cochere facing the Strip."  Would that be so hard?  So, anyway, after a few wrong turns and roaming around for 10 minutes I'm a little grumpy but we find the restaurant.  My first impression is that someone crossed a mob restaurant from Jersey with a Chuck-E-Cheese.  Very bright.  Very loud.  Very crowded.  Lots of kids.  Hard chairs at the tables, although the booths looked comfortable.  (The booths were all full at 6:00 p.m. on a Wednesday.  Whatever criticisms I have about this place, they sure don't seem to be keeping the customers away.)  The wait staff was attentive.  Drinks came quickly (I needed one), along with a piece of foccacia bread and some olive oil and vinegar for dipping.  We were here for restaurant week, which meant ordering off of the prix fixe menu.  I started with Grandma's Meatballs; they were not the best I've had.  They had a kind of a light, mousse consistency and not much (if any?) sauce.  Well, I've never understood the iconography of "Grandma" as the pinnacle of  the culinary arts anyway.  Personally, I'm more impressed by training at the Culinary Institute of America and a few years working in a Michellin starred restaurant, but hey - maybe your Grandma was a better cook than mine.  My entree was the roasted sea bass, and that was a very nice piece of fish.  I also had a side of Mac & Cheese Carbonara, which was excellent,  My wife had a Cesar Salad and a pasta entree, and she enjoyed them both very much.  For dessert we each tried the cannoli, which was kind of mediocre.  That surprised me, since Buddy V is known, first and foremost, as  baker.  The $40 prix fixe menu was a good bargain, although the prices on the main menu were definitely creeping into the "fine dining" range.  Oh, it's not Sinatra or Giada's by a couple of hundred dollars, but it wasn't priced as a family restaurant either, even though it felt more like a family restaurant.  So, time for the trek back to the parking lot.  At least we didn't get lost this time, and the Venetian is one of the few Strip hotels that still provides free parking - hat tip to Sheldon Adelson for that.

NAAi088ak8voQDf5RmOVLQ.text: Super disappointed in our recent visit to our once beloved Buddy V's. With so many excellent choices in the Vegas culinary field, it's critical to place the upmost importance on customer service if your intention is to remain relevant, not just a mere tourist destination. As always, the food was delicious, atmosphere beautiful and location perfect. However, the customer service has significantly declined. Our waiter was inattentive, bothered by our request to split the check for a party of eight, less than fourth coming with the cost of a birthday treat for our daughter's 16th celebration, incorrectly calculated our ticket (hopefully in error) and expressed his exasperation in an evident and unappreciated fashion. Sadly, I think we will be forced to expand our Italian palate.....

YZqE7YlqR1-kvcHUGZt3Ug.text: The food was great, must try the garlic bread, calamari and can't skip out on dessert, the cannoli is absolutely delicious. Service was a little slow but they were great which made up for it. They have a $22 lunch special which offers an appetizer, main entree and dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h1Lbi5TgOAa3COeS7JmJpg.text: Just went there and WOW was it good and I mean really good. Me daughter and myself had dinner there. Simple meals but explosive flavor. She had the cheese ravioli and I had the chicken Parmesan with spaghetti. The flavor that burst inside your mouth never stopped. We were pretty much smiling throughout the entire meal. Me beer was cold. Both beers. And the garlic bread appetizer with marinara was the perfect prelude to the entire meal. The service was really nice. We felt comfortably serviced. The environment with the background music selection made you feel like you were at home eating your grandmamas cooking. And they were staffed properly. All very important things to look for. I would put the pricing star to a level three though. Won't be back for awhile but let me say that if you are in Vegas and are looking for some killer fare Buddy V's is a must have. By yourself or with somebody else. DO IT

wPCP9KX0vi_bpWoo0vYNaw.text: I have eaten here recently a couple times. One time the service was shitty and the other it was great. The food gets 5 stars easily. You get what you pay for here.   Grandma's Meatballs: beef, veal, and pork. Good flavor and easily shared but you wont want to.   Free Bread: dude came around once with bread and that was it. I wanted more bread! He poured some oil and vinegar for us (a lot of it) and gave us 1 piece of bread for it. That's ok I made up for it by eating all the bread stick thingys that are in the cups on the table.   Buddy's Salumi and Cheese Board: damn yo this was real good. I didn't care for the olives but I'm not a fan of them anyway. The meats and cheeses I could have ate all day.  Orecchiette and Italian Sausage: This dish had sausage in its name so I ordered it. It was not as heavy as a spaghetti with sauce which was nice. I ate every bite and would order it again.   Spaghetti Bolognese: I was very surprised to like this. When it came out I expected some sort of red sauce on it but that wasn't the case. My wife took a bite and really liked the taste too. Winner winner bolognese dinner!  Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake: Came with salted caramel ice cream. This was hot and good and everyone should order it.   Zeppole: I guess a spiced sugar is outside of these but I didn't taste anything but fried dough. I didn't like this.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. free bread
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. lighting replicating whisks
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Orecchiette and Italian Sausage

BPGi55JCBpvePZQNPOh-cA.text: Pleasantly surprised by this restaurant. They do simple Italian dishes really well! Their octopus appetizer is full of flavor and cooked to perfection and their egg plant parm is some of the best I've had! Only downside is that they served their wine in cheap small wine glasses which really took away from the experience and did not highlight their well thought out wine list. Just remember to ask for a better glass if you get stuck with one! No other complaints, just a jersey girl proud of a Jersey chef!

d33LKsAbUt3vml0W7BWwyg.text: Best pasta carbonara I have eaten to date. The rest of my family also seemed very pleased with their dishes. I'll be coming back in the future. My family has been there once before without me and said the service was incredible. I didn't necessarily get that experience but the food was wonderful.   Tip: the garlic bread is phenomenal

SLSCcFKGUzTeOIpUMuPpCA.text: We recently visited Buddy V's before seeing a show on a Saturday. The restaurant didn't seem too busy for a Saturday night, the view was pretty nice as the sun was setting. The noise level was a little high and we weren't thrilled by the seating. A lot of the tables were up against a very long bench seat which they all shared. This created a situation where we felt like we were having dinner with the two sets of people on each side of us.  Our waitress wasn't too attentive, but our bus boy was pretty awesome! The food was really good and the potion size was huge. After eating my lasagne it looked as if I didn't even touch it.   The most awesome part was the dessert... I love canolis! They were fabulous!! Perfect hint of cinnamon in the pastry and super yummy cream! My husband has the tiramisu which he said was also great.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat and cheese board
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Canoli
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enormous lasagne!

4VQGIDi5gGows7l5o9urwQ.text: My husband and I were so excited to come here, we were really hungry after a long day of sightseeing and it was our last night in Vegas. Ready to indulge one last night. We were seated in the couch/lounge. I thought it looked cozy, only to sit on an extremely awkward, low, deep sunken in seat. Odd. But can be overlooked.   Our server Christin was nice enough, not really helpful when we asked for an opinion of favorites. So I ordered the veal marsala and my husband ordered the ravioli. (How can you mess up ravioli?) Well... after a long wait for food to roll out, his ravioli was disappointing and very very salty. Same salt issue with the veal. My pasta on my plate tasted like pasta roni, and was cold. My veal, extremely hot. The ravioli portion was small and didn't even begin to fill him up even though he tried to stomach the saltiness.   Our birthday canolli was a nice thought, but we didn't really eat it. Maybe we ordered the wrong items? But this felt like a dressed up version of the olive garden. A bit disappointed to end our trip this way. My favorite meal was at B&B downstairs.

gyy3FHIuLUM-Zr84NjEPFA.text: What can I say about Buddy V's except that it was absolutely amazing.  My wife and I dined here with my mom and her partner durning a recent trip to Vegas.  We were greeted by a smiling Italian server who explained to us that we could enjoy the food one of two ways.  The first way being just ordering our own thing off the menu and enjoying it like that or secondly we could close our menus sit back and let the restaurant take us on a culinary experience.  We had to go with a culinary experience.  We were amazed.  The firsts course had meatball, calamari a meat and cheese board and a great salad.  Entree was sea bass, chicken and pasta, lasagna and filet and for dessert a Italian cake and their signature lobster tail.  Everything was so good good and service.  Didn't expect a pastry guy to have such good dinner food

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O1xvInN9lnzbGUuotSv9Nw.text: This is a place I have been wanting to try since we moved to Vegas. I think I blew it by going to Bootleggers before coming here. I love Cake Boss's show so I had high hopes for his restaurant. We went at about 345pm on a Thursday afternoon. We were sat right away at a great window table that over looked the strip. It is always nice to feel like we are tourists here even though we have been here almost 3 years now.  We decided to get things we could share...so of course I had to order the garlic cheese bread and Mac.n.cheese to start. Both delicious. The garlic cheese bread was served with amazing marinara sauce. The mac.n.cheese was creamy had pancetta and peas with a crumb top on it. Delicious. Made the way mac.n.cheese should be...creamy goodness. For our main dish we ordered Buddy's favorite pizza and Bolognese. The pizza was yummy, sausage, grilled onions, fennel and 4 different types of cheeses. The crust of the pizza was cooked to perfection, a little crispness, but still soft and very tasty. The sausage was perfect with all the onions and cheese.  The only item I was not impressed with was the Bolognese...lack of flavor, creaminess, and the spaghetti noodles...we're just store bought...I guess since he is a baker...I expected homemade noodles...so I was a little disappointed...and the Bolognese I had at Bootleggers blows this out of the water. It was also $23 for a bowl the wasn't even big enough to feed my man. Had we only ordered this we would have left hungry....and we probably would not ever go back. But luckily we ordered other good dishes...so if we happen to be at the Venetian again and are craving italian...we would go again. I only gave them a 3 because I was disappointed...but I think I just set my bar too high!

GezB4x5tZ7N5wT0hW_oJyg.text: We wanted to try dessert from Carlo's Bakery, but the line was extremely long.  Instead we decided to come to the restaurant which is across from the bakery. We sat in the lounge/bar area.  The desserts we had were the Buddy V's XL Lobster Tail (custard cream, flaky pastry shell, and seasonal fruit), and the Cannoli (cinnamon pastry, sweet ricotta cream, cocoa drops, pistachios).  LOVED the lobster tail!  If you're dining here, save room and share this incredible dessert!  I will come back for dinner the next time I'm in town.

tWELhtmF6wMb_rw9obhQfw.text: This review is for happy hour and not any of the meals. $5 sangrias were incredible and dangerous - barely tasted like alcohol until they hit you. We got the ricotta cheese small plate, and while the cheese was pretty bland, the grilled filoni bread was incredible!

eDd7i2ET6aLwrZhr_izQhA.text: This place had a very modern homey feel, good menu selections, make sure to ask for the bread it was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2dBk44nx6bvAsHX1Bocl7g.text: Best experience ever  We went a group of four and ordered different food For starters appetizers we got the calamari fritti and the Aunt Ninas mozzarella en carozza  The calamari fritti has been the best ever calamari I've ever taste very delicious the flavor is mouth watering so good   Ninas mozzarella en carozza is also another must try very delicious   I had the  Nona's lasagna al forno ,very very delicious very bite was amazing I've never had good authentic Italian lasagna it was with every bite so delicious   My brother in law : ordered the  spaghetti central meatball ; let me tell you that I've tried different spaghetti and this place right here at Buddy V Ristorante has been the best spaghetti and meat balls I've ever tried in my life the best of the best   My girlfriend ordered Buddy favorite (pizza) very delicious and flavorful  If your in Las Vegas and craving real authentic Italian food stop by at the Venetian   Check out Buddy V Ristorante best of the best and a must ride the Gondola it's an Italian experience worth it

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti central meatballs the flavor is phenomenal best spaghetti I&#39;ve ever tasted very authentic delicious
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy favorite : this pizza was good something new I&#39;ve always wanted to try loved it
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna al forno very delicious authentic Italian dish

kyDuCYjqfypLhlbNCZOQgA.text: Best Italian restaurant in Las Vegas. Came here for the second time tonight & they have nothing but fast, excellent service. Their alfredo sauce is on the secret menu but is to die for! Def. must check this place out. One of my favorites on the strip!

xJ41Jmx3hPZ0wB_vqkjkDw.text: We enjoyed the meatballs for appetizers, and the bread was some of the best we've had. The lasagna was so filling, I had quite a bit for leftovers. This is one of the best Italian restaurants I've tried recently, and I highly recommend it. The customer service was excellent, and we look forward to going again.

g0yVKrxNoHY0g8LjJZKR4Q.text: Nothing touches this food. Nothing. This is the one restaurant I recommend in Vegas over everything. You'd be doing yourself a disservice if you're in Vegas & looking to eat Italian & don't come here. Don't break the bank at Rao's or Carmine's or some other fine dining Italian restaurant. Eat at the place that feels like home but has the quality of food that can compete with the more expensive places. At those places you're going to pay extra for noodles with your parm. At Buddy V's it's all included for a lower base price.   I'm not going to give a review based on a specific experience because each time I've gone it's been nothing but the best. Girlfriend and I love it. We start with the meatballs that will blow your mind; I order the chicken parm & she orders something new every time. While you wait, piping hot, fresh bread is delivered to you with classic oils for dipping; however, I'm a much bigger fan of dipping it in the meat sauce that comes with the meatballs. Red wine to wash it all down & I am a very happy man.   Aesthetically, the restaurant feels like someone's home; classic oldies & doo wop are played throughout the restaurant. Seating has never been an issue for me even when I go at 6 or 7 PM on a Friday or Saturday. Restaurant may be packed, but there's plenty of bar seating.   Two entrees, an appetizer & a glass of wine runs you roughly $70. Kinda pricey, but well worth it. Servings are huge. Most restaurants in Vegas will run you close to that amount anyways. You came to the wrong city if you're looking to pinch pennies and be frugal.

-HhMOwa6Jf7ouybFPEBp7w.text: Amazing food and amazing service!!! Our food came out very quickly, and there was always a staff around to refill drinks and get other things for the table. Had the chicken parm and cannolis for dessert. Could not complain at all!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NOMGkadd-zZBiK8kQW4aMg.text: Came here for lunch yesterday and was pleasantly surprised with how good the food was. Arrived around 2:30 pm and the place was pretty dead. I didn't have high expectations for this place because it had a very chain restaurant feel. SO WRONG.   Ordered: x Panzanella Salad w/ Shrimp (buffalo mozzarella, focaccia croutons, tomatoes, arugula, balsamic red onions) - Salad with lots of flavor. Wait, what? It was perfect with the added shrimp, but I think if you order it without protein it'll feel more like a side salad. LOVED this salad. Croutons were amazeballs. x Grilled Salmon (Mediterranean chickpea & artichoke salad, roasted tomato vinaigrette, balsamic) - L-L-LOVEEEEE! I like salmon, but I don't LOVE cooked salmon. kinda tastes the same for me everywhere I order it, but this one was excellent. Highly recommend for a healthy option from the menu. All the components complimented each other very well. x Butterscotch Creme Brulee - My favorite dessert in the world. I didn't really care for the cookies or the vanilla cream it came with, but the creme brulee itself was perfection! Probably one of the best ones I've ever had. 10/10 would recommend.  Service was extremely slow, but the food made up for it. Ask to sit by the window and enjoy A+ food with a strip view :0)  Cake boss knows wssup.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp panzanella salad
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zrXqDLoSLXXTgEkXbx__Tg.text: I was at the Sands Expo for ISC West and waited way too long for lunch.  Every place I went to had a super long wait so I was happy when I got into Buddy V's with a 5 minute wait.      The service was very good with the waiter being perfectly attentive.  The restaurant has a nice interior and despite  a busy lunch service was very clean.      I ordered the Veal Marsala which was priced at $26.  It came with garlic butter spaghetti noodles.  The garlic butter noodles were the highlight of the plate.  The veal was not even lightly salted and had no flavor.  The Marsala sauce was overly sweet.  It was ok but I have had much better.  I was starved so it filled the void.      I wasn't impressed so this was my last and only visit to Buddy V's.

XX5hdbwG6AcL1GMGo-edHQ.text: Fried calamari appetizer was delicious. Chicken parmigiana was just ok, needed more seasoning, came with a side of spaghetti which was delicious, wish the portion was larger though. The lasagna was just ok to me, it has Italian sausage in it and I don't care for that. A bit pricey for what you get, but it is Vegas, so expect to pay. Outstanding service, on top of everything, very friendly, polite and polished. Would definitely return, but would definitely get the large bowl of spaghetti instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wE0siIt0LcfIpWyE2Bkwfg.text: Everything here was amazing including the service, cocktails, and entrees! Surf and turf was perfect. Big thanks to Mourad for the great service and for recommending we add scallops to our plates. Everything was simply amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yd3JDZatiTelSPh3cmOrqA.text: With all the choices in Vegas, Buddy V's stands out as a classic Italian restaurant with a beautiful, upscale, eclectic decor. The food is exceptional, it's authentic, but with some unique twists.  You will not be disappointed, and you'll want to come back for more.  The desserts were undeniable, and our server, Moudo, was exceptional.  Tucked in the corner at the Venetian, Buddy V's sits across from Carlos Bakery, for the ultimate decadence of having your dessert (at Buddy V's) and taking another home from Carlos'.  It's a sure bet, in Vegas!

47QpDvpk9S65sRKbeec8-Q.text: The Cake Boss is everywhere these days and I am glad to see a place in Vegas.   I made a reservation which you can do on line so getting a table was a snap.   The chicken Parm was amazing, perfect breading and plenty of food. They give you spaghetti also. The food is absolutely fantastic.   The lasagna is amazing also, perfect. The portions can be large however.   Tried the garlic toast also and it was a perfect match.   The staff are absolutely amazing, the waiter made a perfect recommendation for a wine to pair with the chicken Parm and knew the menu and food. There was also a couple assistants that kept everything flowing. This made everything work like a well oiled machine. The Cake Boss did an excellent job and I will be back if in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

-o3MimuE6ScFHsMG70T7Uw.text: I LOVED Buddy V's and cannot wait for my next trip to Vegas to go back. The atmosphere in the restaurant was great, but the food was what set this restaurant apart. I had the shrimp scampi and my husband had the chicken parm. Both were simply outstanding. Had I been wearing a looser dress, I would have been tempted to finish off the entire bowl of pasta.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our table!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The husband&#39;s chicken parm. So, so good.

OTDDtjfKwuF0Mk7ScFLFYA.text: I was not a fan. The food was ok. Our food came out soon after we ordered it but that was the only positive. It took a long time before our order was taken and a very long time before getting the check! Will not be returning ever!

XbUNdewnIevolZ5pW9X4nA.text: Awesome place to sit down for food or apps with good wine! Our waitress was amazing and suggested fantastic food. Great relaxed atmosphere

PK6ELctnkotwaHi4kMtrSg.text: came here on a recommendation from a friend. the restaurant is sort of hidden and yet a secret spot to go to when you're around the area.  my girlfriend and i loved the atmosphere and the attentiveness of the server and staff with refilling our water and checking up on us! i'm in the service industry myself and i'm blown away by now we'll this team took care of us.  i would recommend this place and the Chicken BLT to anyone!! it was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken BLT with small side caesar salad

hxluITskF2cgS8Aq5nSHpQ.text: We are here tonight for my best friends birthday and from the moment the waiter spoke to our table we all felt that he had a HUGE chip on his shoulder. We then proceeded to wait 35 minutes with him never coming back after taking our order, no bread, no drinks. Finally we complained and the manager, who was beyond apologetic, nice and understanding came over and made sure the rest of our evening was great and it was. It was just disappointing to watch the original waiter serve other people in front of us like we were less important than the other parties. I work hard for my money and chose to spend it at this restaurant so it's disappointing when someone treats me like this. Hay being said the four stars instead of five was because of this. The waitress we were moved to was wonderful and lovely. I don't think I would go back but it was a great experience AFTER the first impression was made.

ecTGO5G7kdu6n8gUCNbYWQ.text: This place is always good. Eveytime we come to vegas we have to stopped for dinner here or lunch. The chicken parm is delicious and the service is always good. I also get the buddy vs specialty pozza yumm and the cesar sals with the calamari is on point

rWdWlomQQxIYcd2r-09Lnw.text: Don't request a different seat they will cancel your reservation! 2 dozen tables open and I can move to the one 5ft away without having to wait another 30min... Thought Buddy was all about customer service! Guess not.

Ep7hR5v6LmqsU04wi1jwWQ.text: My husband and I had lunch here the other day. We weren't as thrilled as some of the other Yelpers, it may be because we didn't choose Italian items... But honestly, I didn't see it as an Italian restaurant when we walked in. We were also in quite a hurry, so we were looking to be in-and-out people.  That being said, our waiters were terrific - polite and kept our sodas filled. My husband ordered the meatball sandwich, which he enjoyed. His one complaint was that the bread was toasted and made it very hard. I ordered the Chicken BLT, which also had avocado on it. It was quite yummy. It came with a tiny tiny Caesar Salad... So tiny, you can't help but wonder what the point is?   All in all, tasty and a good experience!

zqkXbUJaaBnrPF83O5tpPA.text: Great service, good food.  Definitely worth a try. Fave: chicken Parm with Spaghetti  Least Fave: Margherita Pizza

bT7-EVfpMzuYu4dmlXKi4g.text: With relatively easy entrance from the Strip, competitive pricing to other Italian spots nearby and a nice dining area, it's clear to see why Buddy V's Ristorante has maintained a good level of success since they opened.  I had only previously been to happy hour here, which is one of the best values on the boulevard from 4:30pm-6:30pm daily by the way, and had my mind set on a couple of items prior to walking in.    Skipping formalities, like ya know...salad, we started with "Grandma's Meatballs".  The six spheres mixed with beef, veal and pork were very good and perfectly portioned for the group.  I usually prefer them pan-fried first before being dropped into sauce, which these were not, but eaters gonna eat and they disappeared within minutes.    And funny how things are always extra special and endearing once "Grandma" is added to the front of it. Grandma's apple pie.  Grandma's pet rat.  Grandma's criminal record.    The "Bone-In Parm Chop" was screaming out to me and totally rocked my world.  With a  hefty quantity of crispy, juicy veal meat doused in a mouth-watering marinara sauce and then finished in the oven after being topped with ooey gooey mozzarella and provolone cheese, this dish was outstanding, well presented, and worth the $42.  Being such a large entree, I'd recommend two people going in on it together while getting a few more appetizers to make it a better rounded meal.  I personally felt rounder afterwards.    A couple of other "can't go wrong" items I was able to sample were the ultra meaty "Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno" and "Veal Marsala" with its rich mushroom ragu.  No room for dessert this time, but I am confident that I can count on this spot for a solid "pasto" in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone - In Parm Chop
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grandma&#39;s meatballs

jXpaJMhJjFls6YHP2Sk5dg.text: We checked out Buddy V's for their weekend brunch buffet.  I love Italian food so this buffet was perfect IMO.  It is not overwhelming big, but has just enough to have a bit of everything.  There is also an option to add on endless wine, beer or mimosas.  The stations include an antipasto bar with cheeses, charcuterie, salads and veggies.  The carving station cooked up Italian sausages and breakfast meats.  The hot food station included Italian style scrambled eggs, pancakes and of course pasta!  My favorite part was the dessert spread with favorites like tiramisu and mini cannoli. I left feeling satisfied, not overly full, and felt I tried everything without having to waste.  The decor and ambiance is also really cool with and open kitchen.

QFwU7qwcMTsR3I71Rg1oRw.text: Great time! We went for the happy hour and man it was great! HAPPY HOUR was @4:30 and we had; $5 sangria,so refreshing  $6 calamari, the best $6 grandmas meatballs, so tender and flavorful you get 3 $6 meatball sliders, very good $26 LASAGNA.....the best ever!!! And HUGE 3 people could share Customer service was excellent our server Joanne was very attentive and efficient  They also had food helpers checking on us too!!

KQWgcQZWfXfZlcb10Q9vKg.text: Figured it be a tourist trap because they make cakes maybe just use in his name Pleasantly surprised had lunch with my wife very good good service focaccia bread was delicious

03I5MKHqc6waJNoxCbFDIw.text: Wow, this place was excellent! Every single dish we ordered was superb!!! The pastas were perfectly portioned and flavorful. The portions were huge. And most importantly the customer service was excellent.   I ordered the chicken parmesan. At first I was very hesitant because EVERYTIME I order chicken parmesan the chicken is dry and junk. However, I got the $40 special that comes with salad, an entree and a dessert... so out of the entree selections I chose the chicken parmesan and boy did i absolutely enjoy it!! The chicken breast was soooo tender and juicy. They put a nice amount of cheese on top too. I wish they gave a little more noodles, but that's okay. They give two chicken slices and each slice was huge. So good!!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who values food Italian food!

The food was off the charts, beyond delicious. Best Italian cuisine I have eaten. 5 stars and highly recommended

sqyQY3N-AAfRppEVacsD6g.text: The Toscano salad and eggplant starter were more than enough for dinner. Delicious food, fine service, great location -- and it didn't break the bank. Will go back.

toSQHaoiI3arpyc8C1x3yQ.text: Omg yum! Brunch is all you can eat and they have bottomless drinks mix and match for $15. There aren't a ton of selections but man everything is good and filling! The Mac and cheese and the Sunday eggs are so good! This is a FABULOUS AND FUN BRUNCH SPOT! Go! I'm sad it took me two years to go to this place.

QGHliT9rStV1OKUrR_M0uA.text: I had to check this place out. I was a huge fan of Cake Boss and of course wanted to try Carlo's Bakery as well, conveniently located across the restaurant at the Ventian. We got there around noon and started off with the Grandmas Meatballs. OMG!!! It was so good. Then I had the Boss' House salad and it was good. I was saving myself for dinner so I had to eat light.  We had to end it with lattes and NY Cheesecake and it was so good. I would definitely go back again. A must!

J-N28fCxEWI4ldKFPnrgTg.text: I'm always down for Italian as a safe favorite. After a long day of traveling, we weren't really sure what we wanted, and Buddy V's had availability on a Friday night.  I got the dinner deal that came with an app, entree, and dessert, while my BF got pasta with vodka sauce.  The Caesar salad was fantastic! The croutons were the best croutons I have ever had. They were piping hot with soft centers.  My chicken parm was apparently the thing to get (I listened to everyone else's suggestions). It was so much food and very tasty.  My BF's pasta with vodka sauce was good, but he said it tasted like a dish you could get anywhere. Nothing too special  The tiramisu for dessert was good, and had little shortbread cookies for dipping.   Overall, I liked the ambiance and location (within the Venetian), but it wasn't anything super standout. Should've just stuck with his cake shop across the hall!

DXMmfZm6rq3w6VqnmirYIA.text: Great Italian food, will definitely come back here again. 5/5 Shrimp on a chopped vegetable salad. Better for the healthy conscious. Shrimp was cooked perfectly, tender in a butter garlic. $23 4/5 Veal Marsala. Thinly sliced veal in a dark thick wine mushroom sauce. A bit too salty or concentrated. Really good buttery garlic pasta with light cheese topping. I wish I had double pasta. $26 4/5 Trying to decide Lobster tail desert or chocolate Nutella cake? Lobster tail won, very light, flaky crust with cannoli cream and fresh fruit. Some of the crust was non uniform in crunch but very good. $9/each. 5/5 Unsweetened ice tea. The best tea taste in Vegas so far. Surprising to me so I had to rate it. Overall with tip and tax $97 for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella cake lost to Lobster tail desert. Both great.

B5Rfxbt742c33hHwBYErmQ.text: We decided to give this place a try based on the yelp reviews they received, and boy were they spot on. It had a great atmosphere and a friendly staff.   Our server (Peter maybe?) was super helpful with great suggestions. When we couldn't decide on a dish he assisted us in building another dish to combined the best of both worlds. When we were unsure of wine, he made a suggestion based on our dish.   The food was great, the wine was delicious, and we had an overall great experience. We were very please with the customer service and recommend you give it a try.

W-yf-MYV1t5wwNi9m45nwQ.text: I haven't had Italian food in a while, but this was an amazing place to break my Italian fast. The servers were so friendly. We got there 15 min before our reservation and they were able to seat us. We ordered calamari as our appetizer and my dad's bucatini carbonara, the chicken rigatoni alla vodka and the lisa v's linguine & clams. Everything was delicious. Even the bread that they gave us was focaccia bread and paired perfect with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. All of the pastas were very flavorful and unique from one another. The carbonara was probably my favorite as it was the most creamy. Overall, amazing restaurant with good food and cute aesthetics. They even give you a free cannoli for your birthday!

nSvyr8vuv1y_krp2b_PP_g.text: Delicious Italian food!!! The whole family loved it. We highly recommend the lasagna, chicken piccata, chicken Parmesan, and the salmon! The service was quick and friendly. Our favorite dining experience in Vegas!! It's location was beautiful as well. We got some great family shots under the Buddy V sign as well as on the balcony overlooking the Venetian canal and the strip.

jUJwdbc-bVu9IRxMRpdqJw.text: Pleasantly surprised by this Italian restaurant. We had the course meal and shrimp scampi. The meatball, Chicken Parmesan, Tiramisu, Shrimp Scampi were all great. Would definitely recommend!

hCACi15pWfuelqgtoHkC4Q.text: A popular and beautiful restaurant in the Venetian Hotel.  The host staff was welcoming, the wait staff was friendly and efficient, and the food was fantastic.  I started with a Caesar salad and followed that with Chicken Picatta.    Both were excellent and chased down with a nice glass of Pinot Grigio.  Next time, I'd like to include dessert, but my time was running short to get to the performance of Le Reve at the Wynn Hotel.  I highly recommend Le Reve as well.  It's beautifully staged and the acrobatic dancers are amazing.  Try to avoid gasping if you can. LOL!

FFTkg9wf92Q6XW4ZD5XZSw.text: My family's experience at Buddy V's was one of the highlights of our vacation in and around Vegas.  The highlight of the meal was our waiter Giorgio who was extremely engaging, fun, attentive, and made what would have been a solid meal into something memorably for our family.  He doted on my 9 year old daughter and gave her a stuffed animal and chef's hat.  He dared us to guess how many Italian wedding cakes he ate over two hours to capture the "world record" and gave the winning guess a Buddy V's glass.  He accommodated two vegetarians in the family and removed all the guesswork from ordering...we just put our trust in him and he brought out a lot of good food!  In terms of the food, I'd say the fare ranged from slightly above average to very good.  The meatballs were great and the meats in the antipasto appetizer were awesome as well.  I didn't think the lasagna was all that special but the rest of the family loved it.  Anyway, the highlight to me was the service and this restaurant would be the first one I'd head back to with my family if we're in Vegas again.

CZaaHVOhg2ZdH5k3JNPOsw.text: Went to Buddy V's for Sunday brunch.  The food was delicious and authentic.  A wide variety of dishes for all likes.  Wide spread of desserts, the pecan bread pudding was the best!! The bottomless mimosas, Bellinis, and sangrias were great.  Nice atmosphere, place was cozy.  Totally worth the experience.

0FaK8aMMY6euYHfO2rKgRw.text: The good:  the service was very excellent  The bad:  literally everything else. Supposedly this was Italian food but it tasted like a bad elementary school cafeteria. The food was flavorless and unmemorable.   Do not eat here.

HXv7yiUG2A-xhJ6vtv1dGQ.text: Buddy V's, for those who don't know who he is, I'm going to tell you. he is the owner of Carlo's Bakery and has a show Cake Boss and now Buddy V's Ristorante in Vegas. So as I entered was greeted right away with a Hostess and asked to be seated by the window,with no seats available by the window, we all chose to sit in the middle of the Restaurant, not what we all wanted. Would have waited for a booth by the window. She should have stated to us,if you would like to wait for one, we all would have waited. I'm sure, I'm not the only one who has no patience when it comes to food and being hungry.I want to eat,relax and enjoy great company with family and friends,especially a bunch of Italians. So the server comes over and takes our drink order and returns with the drinks and takes our meal order. As our meals came out, I was surprised at the portion size of the spaghetti with marinara sauce,small and the presentation of the chicken parmesan with spaghetti,plain. The spaghetti sauce had a good taste to it, however the Chicken Parmesan didn't. The Server wasn't attentive to our needs,during my visit the busboy was more attentive,but the one thing that blew us all away was at the server bought our check over and didn't even ask us would you like any Dessert. The check was put on the table and walked away. Mind you not this is my Birthday dinner and the owner started is Business,as a cake baker and as you walk in that's what you see is a display of the Dessert's they offer. Unbelievable.Must retrain server's at the close of each check,offer. So the check was paid and we walked right a cross to his small little bakery Carlo's Bakery. 39/100 Yelp Challenge.(2018)

KOiWnKN7Fp_RddHWwHB9jg.text: Synopsis: A wonderful value for the price without the snobbery of a lot of Vegas flagship restaurants.   We booked a birthday dinner here on a Sunday at 5.30 pm. It was busy, but not packed. The wait for walk-ins was about 30 mins.   I hate to say this, but the host staff could use some work. The two girls that checked us in and seated us seemed unbothered to greet and talk to patrons. As a local, I observe this often with restaurants on the Strip. It's disappointing. As a host it is your job to present me with a first impression about your brand and establishment.   Moving on...  Our waiter (I did not get your name but you are Australian/South African/Amercian) was so sweet and so lovely. Once he had a chance to take care of our table he treated us like he was his only table.   We ordered:  Calamari Fritti app Sunday Gravy x 2 Salmon Lasagna  The calamari was cooked to perfection. You could actually cut it with the side of your fork! The Anaheim peppers were a nice touch and very unique. Well done! The only thing...the oil it was cooked in needed to be changed as the breading came out a little dark.   The salmon was also cooked to perfection. It beautifully fell apart when I cut into it. It was a very large portion. I shared it with my infant daughter, who loved it! And you know babies are the harshest critics! It came on a bed of salad, which had a wonderful flavor.   The guys were so impressed with the Sunday Gravy. If you don't know what this is - most Italian restaurants don't bother serving it because it takes all day to cook. Theirs they said takes 18 hours and is cooked throughout the day. We loved it. The flavors were amazing. The meat was so tender. The portion was gigantic.   Same with the lasagna. It could easily feed 2-3 people. My mom barely put a dent in it. If you don't like sausage, don't order this because it has a very strong sausage flavor. They brought a beautiful little Tiramisu cake for my mom, which really made her day. The waiter stayed to sing happy birthday with us, which was sweet.   The were very accommodating to our baby, who is 9 months old. Our waiter made suggestions on thing she could eat and was very complimentary about her behavior. One note: they do not allow strollers inside the dining area, but you can leave them at the front.   So, we ordered an app, we all ordered wine/beer, four entrees, and a desert...the bill was UNDER $200, which is simply impressive for a restaurant on the Strip with good quality. I'm really pleased with our dining experience.

D_TCg1F1S6X8pMYCUvaiPQ.text: A great place within the Venetian for dinner.  We made reservations via Open Table but you likely (at least on this day) wouldn't have needed to.  Either way I felt good about having them.  I like to plan ahead.    They seated us in the bar area, which I liked a lot it seemed like families with smaller children where more in the main area so it was nice.  There was a TV in the bar so you could keep up with the latest game that was on.  We brought in a bottle of wine and their corkage fee was $35.  In looking at the menu that was a bargain for wine.  Our wine cost us about $35 originally so, yeah, still paying about $70 a bottle.  It was still all good.  Dinner was fantastic and fairly large portions.  I took mine back to the hotel with me and it was our lunch the next day.  I had the chicken piacatta and was amazing.    I would definitely come back here again.

2hLQO7EqjVp9KUB1pt0fTA.text: I have to say, this was the perfect place for my last night in Vegas.  I'm always really on the fence about eating octopus.  It's often really rubbery and hard to eat.  At the waitress's suggestion we ordered it and it was AMAZING.  The best I've ever had hands down.  We then ordered the "Sunday gravy" which is really a massive amount of various meats swimming in some really zesty sauce served with Rigatoni.  Tasted like someone's grandma was sitting in the kitchen! All in all the service was friendly, drinks were quick, and the food was amazing.  Will definitely be coming back !

8WQk1iAxcsiG0DaWYiYt6g.text: Absolutely love this place. We started off at the bar for happy hour and our bartender Christia was amazing. She was super friendly and recommended the best drinks and food for us. We then moved to the main dining area where Freddy was our waiter. He was perfect as well. The food was amazing. Whenever I am in Vegas, I make sure to come here to celebrate my birthday. Love love love this place. Great drinks, great food, great service. Will definitely be back.

VQc5S4cA1w5qbw3WiL0UcA.text: We chose this as our location to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary.  We decided to go here because we had just rolled into town and we were staying at the Palazzo, and wanted someplace low-key where we could dine with our teen.  We made a reservation and were good to go.  We didn't know that the meal came with foccacia, so we ordered cheesy garlic bread to go with our caesar salads.  Next time, we will skip the cheesy garlic bread, as it was very cheesy but not really garlicky.  The caesars were good, but came with very hot polenta croutons.  They were kind of strange!  For our main meal we had ravioli with alfredo, lasagna and an order of meatballs.  My favorite was the lasagna!  Lots of flavor and enough sauce that we were happy with it.  They've got a great menu and we would definitely return!

1S-r7nqFfhvVzr1ho_a3JA.text: Sustenance was great however nothing excellent. You can likely improve close-by in a similar value point. Didn't have desert so perhaps that would have improved the experience.   Went for lunch. We had a pizza and a BLT.

5UGooyJUUBVIayyGEK-epw.text: Service was fantastic! Bread was very good. The mashed potatoes are the best mashed potatoes I've ever had. The pasta was very flavor full but only lacked spice. The cannoli were fantastic with a side of melted chocolate.

BAnAhKkIkPhiT03qSDvM0g.text: Stopped by Buddy V's for my birthday dinner in Vegas and had an absolute blast! Service was phenomenal and food and drinks were delicious.  Beautiful view overlooking the strip so we were able to get some great photos right from our booth.  Not an inexpensive choice but, after all, it's Vegas.    Will definitely be coming back here! Thanks for the birthday hospitality Buddy V's.

QGOZYKzj8KGljrlptzTBgQ.text: Okay Italian food and aggressive wait staff upselling entrees, appetizers, etc. The waiter was more accommodating when he learned I had a serious food intolerance so my choices are limited.  My son really enjoyed the chicken Parmesan.  Hubby was not impressed with the orecchiette. My tomato basil soup was overly salty but the Italian greens were well-seasoned.

65ju5ofWXl6C5vwBqIipcA.text: I thought the food was ok.  It was edible but compared to some of the other choices in the area I would skip this joint.  The atmosphere is nice and the staff is great.  I wished we would've went back to the burger spot(and I'm not a burger guy usually)

45vOKeGZfS6eUd8pIb49hQ.text: I went to Buddy's after trying to locate a restaurant that could serve me a nice meal before going to an event. Service was lighting fast for an a la carte restaurant, the portions where huge, delicious and the price point surprisingly low for Vegas. A must!

u4c8pCRziimyj4gImtSYRg.text: Great experience and amazing service...  Here's a legit spot to get Italian food on the strip of Vegas. Had a plentiful selection of dishes ranging from pasta to pizza to seafood/meat. Overall cost for the dishes were sorta pricey... However, we're in Vegas so the whole situation is justified   Here's we're we got:  Focaccia Bread 5/5- So bomb ! I wanted to eat the four or five more rolls but we had so much food. Dipped this in oil/balsamic and it's like heaven.  Calamari Fritti 5/5 - so delicious! The breading was perfection. Not too dense and not too salty. The perfect blend. I would highly recommend it!  Grandma's Meatballs 3/5 - they aight. Personally, didn't think it was anything special.  I feel like I make better balls myself .   Dad's Bucatini Carbonara 4/5 - This dish was very rich and creamy. I was in the mood for something like this so I knew what to expect.  I was very pleased with the taste and how it turned out. There was a nice crunch from the pancetta. But beware, this might be the creamiest dish on the menu. The sauce was so nice and think that I felt like my stomach was putting on a warm blanket to keep my belly warm.  Mother and Law's Shrimp Scampi with Linguine 4/5  - here's a nice size plate with good size shrimp. Scampi sauce was buttery and rich and worked with the pasta.  Veal Marsala 4/5 - Strong plate with a very nice protein.  Marsala sauce was very good with a strong red wine taste. Veal was super tender and tasty.  Caramelized Sea Scallop 4/5 - Very good dish. 6 small sea scallops and everything was very tasty. Crispy prosciutto and parmesan polenta was on point. Only negative was that the dish might be good for someone with a smaller appetite. You definitely get more bang for the buck on a pasta dish.  Lisa V's Linguine and Clams 4/5 - Another great dish. Sauce was tasty, clams were fresh, good size. Can't really screw up a clam linguine unless you really try.  Overall, solid place to eat and great service. Great for taking a date. Didn't get any dessert because we were so full. But I'll be getting that next time!  AC

o_OW9sx_p4oTsOhgyoUdAA.text: Goofy Italian restaurant on the Las Vegas strip.  Food is a slight step up from a microwaveable meal. An order of meatballs and an order of pasta (clearly made from dried noodles) was $50+.  Neither were good (although they were edible).  Im giving it two stars only because the servers were very nice and attentive without being annoying.  Dollar for dollar the worst Italian food ive ever had though.  I didnt try the bakery (which looked good).

kymMs7TVXdfdrekOsmEFEQ.text: Delicious food. Nice environment and friendly servers, we had great time and enjoyed the afternoon with my friends.

KVluD7eV4KBq4O5Qu6VAMg.text: My wife and I have been here multiple times and have been satisfied with every dish. This is the first time we decided to try the "Meatless Meatballs" and I was blown away. I was convinced that they made a mistake and brought us real meatballs ins, but was reassured that it was, in fact, vegetarian. Absolutely amazing flavor. We will be ordering this every time we come back.   Update: Last time we went the "Meatless Meatballs" had been removed from the menu unfortunately. Regardless, every other food item I've had here has been fantastic and I still highly recommend eating here.

HvShq47GfVMvGSFHkHfOmw.text: This place was quick, affordable and really good for the price/location. It's a quiet restaurant with a well lit atmosphere. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable.  I had the Veal Marsala and thought it leaned on the salt a bit, but otherwise it was well balanced and filling.

bqUCNO07quOBoKsdOHJnvg.text: Came in for dinner. Had the shrimp scampi, lasagna, kid's chicken perm and kids meat spaghetti. Atmosphere 5 stars, service 4.5, food 4 stars.
