Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid&#39;s meat spaghetti
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kid&#39;s chicken perm

PIKyf5bVpY-zkqgBfHBxbA.text: Buddy V's is a great Vegas strip experience.  The Brunch is fantastic , and a window seat for people watching is a fun way to chill out while you sample their unlimited drink option. We tried the sangria with brandy and fresh fruit, the pomegranate mimosa, and the Bloody Mary with a full condiment station. All were superlative, we sampled them over and over.  The brunch is done buffet style but with small trays that are refilled  frequently.  The antipasto/charcuterie table is outstanding we selected a great blue cheese variant, prosciutto, shrimp, focaccia and cheesy bread. The chef's corner entrees were fantastic, the standouts were the mac n' cheese carbonara, Sunday eggs, and crepes with in-house whipped cream and an amazing compote that was entirely comprised of fresh berries. The carving station had delicious sausages and a sumptuous slab bacon that was more like pork belly. At most brunch buffets the deserts are so-so but this is the cake boss's place so they were all incredible the exceptional items were the cannoli, zeppoli, and Italian cookies platter.   The service was friendly and accommodating regardless of how busy the restaurant became.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XvdOuVakX5DLYSl9Tr05Tg.text: I do not understand all the great reviews. I really wanted to like this place but 26 for lasagna with no salad or soup? And I only got one piece of bread, at least give me 2 pieces. It is all hype and way too expensive for Italian food. The real question is was the service good? Ehhhh it was okay, not amazing and just okay. Was the food good? Well this is where I'm in the fence, it was good but not 30 dollars good for Alfredo either. Now would I go back? No, I would not go back because the service and food were not worth the 80 I spent on two dinners  without anything other than Alfredo and lasagna. If the dinners came with a salad, soup, or even two pieces of bread I would think about going again. I didn't even order a beverage, just had water and two dinners.

O8qxy-qLkwaBxrB4Ke-A3g.text: Great service! Cool bar with nice views of strip. A little bit of a walk to find the place. But once you do find the place it's very inviting. Chicken parmesan was good. Linguine clams was delicious and had enough to fill you up with a little bit of spice  The deserts are AMAZING!!! The apple and the lobster things whatever you call them they were soooo good!!!

LRcsH6uyzreMEQSPci20tA.text: Good food, nice presentation, great service even though it was crowded. But truthfully, for what we spent, I expected it to be a little better than it was. Fun to go once, but probably would not go there again!

h2LK_f1Y6Db3NHvMfK7dxA.text: Awesome Restaurant! You must get the Caesar Salad with the polenta croutons then get the appetizer of the polenta croutons to go. The service is always good and you cannot go wrong with anything on the menu.

pN3zoCLkF8pUq4O18HdF-A.text: Loved it. Great atmosphere, and amazing food. The cannoli was to die for!  The do a brunch on Sunday's or we would have gone back a second time. It's a little hard to locate, but make sure you do!

Vv8JYE9bryOLBsF3FjB9Ug.text: My wife and I were in Vegas from Atlanta, relaxing and enjoying her birthday weekend.  Bobby V's was one of the eatery's I specifically wanted to visit while we were here. Upon being seated we were met with welcoming and friendly customer/guest service.  Caleb was our server and hit a Grand Slam in doing so. He was very attentive to our request and even provided suggestions when I seemed unsure.  I ordered the Tomato & Basil soup and my wife ordered the  Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carozza for appetizers. At first bite, the authenticity of the food was evident and the Riesling and Moscato wine that followed were right on time.  Shortly after finishing the appetizers, our entrees showed up and my wife's Capellini Shrimp Scampi and my Nonna's Lasagna Al Forno  dishes pushed the experience over the top.  All the while being treated like relatives by Adam, the Asst. General Manager. I pulled Adam to the side and mentioned that I had a confession and that was, that my wife and I eat out a lot, while home and this was the best all around experience we've had in a long time and thanked him for the wonderful experience.  The cherry on top was when they brought out a piece of Chocolate Expresso cake, on the house, for the Mrs.'s birthday and a couple of lattes. This customer service is what I strive to exemplify in my own business at Ambassador Barbershop, Atlanta, GA, because long term relationships are better than short term money, any day.  Adam and Caleb, we'll see you next time we're in Vegas. Thanks again, K. Jones

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday gesture on behave of Bobby V&#39;s.

CIPPB_-BREfIgdVAuAOcug.text: I'm giving it a lower grading this time because we did the brunch buffet and it wasn't that grand.  I had to come back here because of that AMAZING carbonara mac n cheese, but it was on the verge of awful this time.  The stuff in the brunch is not good at all compared to when they make it fresh for you!  It is to die for when it's fresh.  In the brunch, it's been sitting around etc, and isn't very good.  The salads were good.  The Caesar salad croutons are very different.  There almost like a cornmeal texture.  The arugula salad was delicious.  Chicken Parmesan was ok, but I'm sure it would be excellent if made fresh.  All around, the pastas were kind of disappointing.  It's cool to have a bottomless mimosa/Bloody Mary option.  Roughly $15, but it's bottomless.  Service from the bartender Emily was fantastic!  Not a remote complaint in that department.  We would come back, but won't do the brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just an FYI of what it costs.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chix Parm (fair), meatballs (fair), carbonara mac n cheese (awful! Only have fresh, not buffet style), &amp; sausage pasta (blah)
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp cocktail (excellent), Caesar salad, and arugula salad.  Both were good.  All on the brunch.

LaHyhK2yUixTxv6n8gHPKQ.text: Great food and decently priced. And the service was amazing. The restaurant was about to close and they served us. They were extremely friendly. The live music is pretty good and is somewhat loud but enjoyable. Some people might not like the music though. The view is also pretty good too.

Cv2G2_D4eSOLtQ_fj2DRSA.text: Above average scallop dinner, however surprised when I receive a bill for $16 beer. I was asked when seated if I wanted small, medium or large, I went with medium. When questioning the $16 charge, I was told this was because I can keep the glass.  I don't want a cheap glass to take home, I want a reasonably priced beer.

V3bK9Cg3ZtmwgOzhwk-96w.text: Service:  Wonderful.  For the first week of a new operation, the waitstaff was friendly, helpful and efficient.  The servers had issues figuring our who ordered what, but this was probably because we were four sitting at a booth that could seat six.  Extremely accommodating.  Decor: Great views of the strip from the window booth. Nicely laid out with not too many tables and not too close together.  However, the cold air was blowing on us the entire time and I didn't go to Vegas for the cold weather.  Please fix this.  Food: Turkey meatballs were wonderful.  Chicken Parm was chewy and probably overcooked.  We came for the desserts and were disappointed that there isn't a more traditional cake.  I realize you have to spice things up, but if you are going to have funky desserts, you should also have at least one boring chocolate cake.

4xwUrjKeFM0mM3FMSww8eg.text: If you want touristy low grade Italian food this is the place. Very low quality food and way overpriced. Buddy isnt going to make it in vegas just on his good name. Meat balls were good, chicken parm tasteless , cheap low grade spaghetti side thrown next to it. At the price point should have used linguini with a higher grade sauce.

i8OxKSDjSQvxZn3tbqDqkw.text: I've been in Vegas 4 days and have eaten here 3 times and will be back for lunch tomorrow. My husband doesn't like Italian food, so I don't get my fill, but this place changed that. Twice I've been here alone and the service and food has just been fantastic.  I've gotten the pizza, lasagna, tomato basil soup and caesar salad and liked the salad least of all. Both desserts - the cheesecake and creme brulee- were fantastic.  I wish we had one of these in Austin!!!!

_BnweXjsCGiItUMwQmgZRA.text: the pre fixed meal between 5-7 is a GREAT deal... appetizer meal and desert for $38... great views of strip and meatballs that melt in your mouth!!!!  excellent service and wonderful food...

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonerra with shrimp! !!!
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1E9Y77RUgsYE3KZIXt_kzQ.text: Omg...I was caught off guard here. Being Italian and a pretty good cook myself I was surprised by how delicious, flavorful and well prepared everything was. Had the meatball appetizers which were like my grandma used to make and a little better shh don't tell. ;-) next I had the shrimp scampi....it was perfection for me, jumbo shrimp with spinach, tomatoes in a divine sauce. Buddy you hit this one out of the park for me. On side note, atmosphere is great, comfortable restaurant, excellent service. Will be returning, perhaps once more before I head home.

C4-cXthprIbI-djyhuyf1w.text: Always the best experience when we go there. Great food, Great Service, Fabulous company.

raN5CBJHeMyeuhgsBAHkHg.text: Great food, poor service.  Sunday gravy was delicious and loved the piccata.  Birthday cake, cannoli, and lobster tail were on point.  The beef tenderloin was on the rare side for a medium.  Kudos to the kitchen.  For the service, I'll keep it short. Just our luck as first time diners to get the waitress in training on a Saturday night.  It would have been tolerable if she had any personality or acted if she even cared about our experience there.  Never engaged us, we had to continually ask for refills on water,  and brought me the wrong drink.  Trainer right at her side, for what? I blame the management and trainer for this.   Servers in training should be up to speed for the weekend dinner service before being put there.  When customers leave satisfied with the food but disgruntled over the service after paying nearly three bills for a mediocre dining experience, you end up losing a repeat customer.    You want great reviews and repeat business? Then don't use the trial by fire method with new servers and send them to charm school first.

yhF2_N5gpGKsV1Q8q6-Wsw.text: I went here on our last trip to Vegas. It was convenient because we were staying at the Venetian. The food was amazing!! So yum. I got the ravioli and it was amazing! I was trying to save some for later that night but ended up eating it all! I definitely want to go back and try the other meals. The only downside was the waiter wasn't as nice, a little rude.

fiZv0ab62gEGXaveyMR8AQ.text: Second time here for another visit to vegas, and I absolutely love this place!  The portions are huge (the first time there was just too much leftovers), so order an entree per person if you really want to stuff yourselves.  Be sure to save room for dessert.  The tiramisu is very unique and not too sweet -- perfect for me, maybe for you?

UoxlwgxcSlMDg4qV-uqpYg.text: We had an amazing time here for brunch... if I could give it six stars I would! We were lucky to get Charlie as our server... he was amazing! He knew what I wanted before I asked for it... ten stars for him! You should definitely come here... ask for Charlie!

KK0iHM96fWrFYY4O6EWYzQ.text: Oh my goodness we had the best salad (Buddy's Caprese) to start and were smart enough to share the salad and meatball sandwich.  The salad had the most unbelievable croutons in it.  I almost filled up on those alone.  Oh and the cheese in it... stop it.  So delicious.  We then shared the meatball sandwich and fries.  The sandwich is a bit messy just as any good Italian should be.  I thought the meatballs were very good and authentic.  I am surprised by the low reviews from various people because my experience could not have been better.  I also went to the bakery across the way and bought a cookie and brownie and both tasted homemade.  I really dislike "bakery" tasting cookies and to my surprise these were as if I had baked them in my own kitchen.  I'd highly suggest this place.  Also, I noticed a great room for big parties which I might use when in town again on business down the road.  The bar has a cool ambiance although I was there during the day on a Monday so it wasn't crowded.  I'll go back for sure!

ZLJt6knvfRokk4nHCkg5uQ.text: Amazing !! Our waitress was so awesome. We told her we had a show to make and she said she would tell the back we were in a hurry. Our food came out in 10 mins and was so good. She was attentive and vey friendly could not have asked for better service. Completely impressed.

bNc3HL5dHgYNjv1uat0bZQ.text: We came across the restaurant and I really want it to have dinner their to celebrate my birthday.  When we asked if we need it any reservations the restaurant hostess was very rude. I asked if we can make reservations for a later time and with an attitude she said "well I guess,  I'll try and squeeze you in," although I really want it to eat their didn't feel like dealing with attitude. We decided to eat at a different restaurant.

BG_TTkRTTAQ24VkNgNnGog.text: Valastro Sunday Gravy, I was NOT ready for you! When I read the ingredients listing for this dish I just didn't believe it. I honestly took it for a joke. It was no joke. Valastro Sunday Night gravy is one of those thick, rich and hearty Italian dishes that you imagine Sophia would be cooking for the Golden Girls on a cheesecake and ice cream night. So saucy and full of meat, meat,  meat!!! Veal, sausage, pork, meatballs and bones. Ohhh the lovely bones. I ditched the rigatoni for spaghetti and I was soooo satisfied. Shame on me for swooping down on the soft and super tasty basket of bread like a starved hawk. So much bread made for a crowded tummy but I couldn't help myself. Butter and olive oil for sopping weren't necessary. That's just how tasty the bread was. Dessert??? There was no room and no way. This ain't The Olive Garden. The chefs in Buddy V's ristorante were definitely paying attention to their Italian grannies in the kitchen. I'm sure of it.

yOLTZz_ukI_ojLHGVGN3VQ.text: I'm a big fan of Buddy's but not a fan of Buddy Vs... over priced for mediocre food... the highlight was the garlic bread...spaghetti was runny... pizza was a little too hard... hopefully Carlos bakery will be better... stick to what you know Buddy. ..

w4sIpiIbLfiJR7PyoRsJqg.text: My family and I ate here a few times during our stay in Las Vegas. It was a nice, quiet restaurant with good service. The food overall was pretty decent. Their salads were very good while I got an individual pizza which was decent. It was very small and wasn't very filling, but tasted pretty good. The menu during the day was pretty limited. The prices for the food was manageable. It wasn't the greatest of restaurants in Vegas, but it wasn't too expensive and we were able to get in and out very quickly.

bdBNyce3OA2LpGph5nzA0Q.text: We love Italian Food, and we felt like treating ourselves. We had heard so many good things about Buddy V's, being locals, so we decided to give it a try. We were not disappointed. The service was impeccable - friendly & attentive. The server was knowledgeable and described the dishes well. We are "Wine Snobs" so we were worried about the wine selection, but to our surprise they had a great selection of Italian and Californian Wines, and the Server seemed fairly knowledgeable and recommended a suitable Italian Wine. And the food was everything we hoped it would be - classic, fresh, simple and delicious.  The restaurant was busy and vibrant.The kitchen is situated right in the middle of the restaurant, and you can watch the action. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Sg6ivONaXYT5Pe1mvD8-hg.text: The service was totally awesome, our waiter Randy was very knowledgeable about the menu and the wine selection, and the buss boy Jamal was super attentive and very helpful. I didn't feel rushed, even though our order was complicated and had a few special requests. The food was the best Italian food I have had in a long time. We had 3 dishes with a range of steak, seafood, and pasta, and it was all amazing. I am very impressed with the whole experience, and I think Buddy V should be proud of this place. The management is obviously doing a great job here!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We had a great Saturday night at Buddy V&#39;s

W6-ho56D0ULiChjzEuRq6A.text: First off, the food is not bad here, not great but would give it B+.  The problem is the noise level; it is horrific.  We sat in banquets by the kitchen and heard every order 3 times and every pan bang.  As if this is not enough noise, they play cheesy music soooo loud.

pUB4-bTHd98hL_MUhbX53A.text: Great for lunch. Hubby had meatball sandwich and diet Pepsi, I had the Hoboken cheesesteak sandwich and a Brooklyn summer ale. Both sandwiches came with fries, which they top with a little bit of shredded cheese. Hubby didn't want cheese on the sandwich or fries.... Orders came out perfect. Sandwiches are large enough to share. Service was a good. Water refilled often, free refills on soda. Cute decor. Would definitely return when visiting Vegas again. Thanks Buddy V for the real homemade Italian food!!!

0sKtydGeJpPYj8GBm4aFTg.text: A friend and I went here after a show -- we were pretty much just starving and wanted pasta and this was the first place we saw. The wait was about 20 minutes so we just grabbed a seat at the bar easily which was great, however we were pretty much ignored for 15 minutes until the bartender finally came over. My friend asked for the wine list and the way she rolled her eyes you would think that's a dumb question (is that a dumb question?). When she finally came back another 10 minutes later to get drinks I asked for a food menu and that was also apparently really labor-intensive for her because she seemed crazy annoyed. The place wasn't that busy but I could tell she was the only one behind the bar which I can sympathize -- I'm a pretty patient person so if I have to wait it's not usually a big deal as long as you're pleasant when you do get to me. So that whole exchange was sort of a bummer.   All that said the food was pretty good. Not the best Italian food I've ever had but it was straightforward pasta and good sauce. I had the rigatoni and my friend had the orecchiette and both were good enough that we finished them.   Will I go back? Meh. But I am pretty excited the bakery is opening across the hall!

xQNj7eV82QlEPDRci9HoHA.text: I've dined at Buddy V's twice now and both times it's been consistently good for both food and service.   My husband had the meatball sub once for lunch which was the best we've ever had and the other time he had the bone in veal parm chop which was bigger than the size of your head! The octopus and tuna caponata are also delicious and the polenta croutons on the Caesar Salad are delicious! I've never seen polenta croutons in all the Italian restaurants I've dined in. Very creative!  Dessert is also a must, I mean it is the Cake Boss' restaurant. The lobster tail is light and crispy and the tiramisu is soooo good with the chocolate cake on the bottom.   A trip to Buddy V's is definitely a must and the food was so much better than what I had at Carnevino at a fraction of the cost!

xyX6m2qXxpOIgunRiNb7RA.text: I came here Friday evening for my birthday.it was kinda hard to find,but when I did it was well worth it.very nice restaurant,open,clean and great atmosphere.we had a booth by the window with an amazing view of the strip.our waiter was awesome!! Be prepared to spend some $ for two pple it was 98.00. We got a Caesar salad,lasagna,lobster tail and shrimp dish.the lasagna was to die for...so amazing and dishes are very filling.most people were dressed in just shorts and thirst I felt overdressed.

LaoIHFMME99FmF1rzH9LBA.text: We went to Buddy V's on our last night in Vegas recently and had a great meal and terrific service.  Our server was Melissa - she was right on with her recommendations and clarifying portion sizes (we were trying to avoid leftovers).  The two team members working with her (unfortunately, I didn't get their names) were also very attentive and friendly.    We had the calamari appetizer and Sunday Gravy entree and both were outstanding.  Certainly enough for two to share and leave a little room for desert.  The Tiramisu has a great chocolate cake layer in the bottom which was a great surprise and very good.  We'll definitely go back.

Wz3Ja8SPnBZb6MM0NJXPEg.text: Great service. Did get our order mixed, however let us keep the dish we didn't order free of charged. Food was very good.

qcwL-9NF-i3W33AvAHRtYw.text: This place is the best Italian food every! Everything was great. I come from a Sicilian family straight off the boat.  Just like Nona's cooking.  Would give it 10 stars if I could

5iLPHKDEyFVtMysLaOzBhQ.text: My wife loves Creme Brulee.  She has it at any restaurant that serves it.  I like Creme Brulee.  My wife likes butterscotch.  For me is butterscotch is just ok.   Who would have ever thought we would both love the Buddy V's Butterscotch Creme Brulee so much we have it every time we are in Vegas.  Multiple times!   Now Creme Brulee at other restaurants just doesn't quite measure up.  The Grandma's Meatballs are also the best I have ever had.  The Mediterranean Sea Bass was good.  Service was excellent.

3YCb3aMGqJ8u2vcC0N-Evw.text: Best Italian food I have had, we order the grilled garlic bread that we so moist and cheesy makes me want more just thinking about, the shrimp scampi that was awesome as well, the chicken parm was probably the best could not taste the fried taste which is great, and the carbonara that was great as well. We also tried there itailian beer is was smooth and had a great taste we also got to keep the cup another plus.

b1-h7V26eVHNxfYt1l0XpQ.text: Horrible experience at this restaurant , I looked it up here on yelp and thought It  would be kid friendly . Well I Was super wrong, my 18 month old started to cry maybe 5 min and I Was asked by the manager to take him outside if I could not control him kinda like a dog. I could not believe it !  OMG  of course I wanted to control him! It was 4:30 Pm on a Saturday, instead of making a scene I walked out of the restaurant with my baby and did not come back in. My husband paid our bill, for the meal that we weren't even able to eat because of this horrid situation.  I still can't believe it ! I felt so angry.  I don't recommend it to anyone and I  recommend that anyone with a child  Boycott it !!!!!!

8If3DL4jIhNzbjuKksDM4Q.text: We've always loved watching Buddy V on TLC's Cake Boss.  While standing in line for Carlo's Bake Shop, we noticed that Buddy V's Ristorante looked like it had a great environment so we made reservations for dinner.  We couldn't have been happier.  The food had a True Italian flare to it.  I had the Chicken Parmesean & my wife had the Shrimp Scampi w/ Angel Hair pasta.  We'll definitely being paying Buddy V's a visit the next time we're in Vegas.

7lsa2DtLsFM6w-dJt8TRTQ.text: While vacationing in Vegas with family we decided to check out Buddy V's at the Venetian.  It was a very pleasant experience for our party of seven.  The restaurant itself is lovely with a tastefully decorated interior and comfortable seating.  The service was excellent, very professional and courteous from our waitress to the bussers. The complimentary bread with Olive Oil and Balsamic Dipping plate was delicious, the bread warm and fluffy and the olive oil and balsamic very flavorful.  The Garlic Bread Appetizer was so tasty, warm and very cheesy...we ate every crumb.  The Salumi & Cheese Board Appetizer was outstanding...very flavorful, quality, thinly sliced Proscuitto, Cappicolla and Salami along with Grana Padano and Parmeggiano, and Gorgonzola Cheeses and delicious olives. The entrees were a home run for all seven of us.  The Veal Marsala, Chicken Parm, Chicken Picatta, Steak Pizzaiola ...all perfectly cooked, good portion size and the accompanying Broccolini and/or Buttered Spaghetti Noodles just made the dishes even more pleasing.  The Sunday Gravy signature dish was excellent, the sauce authentic Italian and the combination of meats reminded us of our mother's and grandmother's typical Sunday dinners.  The wine selection was impressive and our Pinot Grigio and Chianti choices did not disappoint.  Loved this restaurant ... the best dinner we had in Vegas during our trip.

jWjt2iWd1KVWdZnHKsHnUA.text: The most uncomfortable, worst dining experience I've ever had.   We (a group of 4) were seated in the "lounge" area near the bar because they didn't have any regular tables available. It was like sitting at a coffee table to eat dinner. Between that and the giant  LED screen outside the window blinding half of our party, it was quite uncomfortable. We were there a good 20 minutes before the waiter came to take our drink orders and it went downhill from there.   The garlic bread was disgusting, and the chicken parm tasted like a frozen TV dinner.   And that brings us to the service... Our waiter was the rudest server I have ever had. I was on a business trip and needed to have the checks split, which took him 3 tries and about 25 minutes to get right. Then, when he didn't bring me an itemized receipt (which I need for business trip expenses), I asked for one and the reaction I received was rolled eyes and gritted teeth. He did eventually bring it, but it was served with a lot of unnecessary attitude.   I would give 0 stars if I could.

4F1k1uhqMiPS0ufPAP6hnw.text: Everything is good, from their savory butter garlic bread to their Octopus salad to their non-rich but so damn good four layers tall tiramisu! The atmosphere is pretty darn special too (giving you a warm holiday feeling)!

shU3CyQZU7XfjDcRsM0HBg.text: Where do I begin? The food was to die for, the service was even better. Big shout out to Giorgio who educated us not only on the menu choices themselves, but on what wine to try with our meals and even dessert. He checked in frequently, as did the young gentleman who was refilling water glasses (I regret not asking his name). If you like Italian food at all, Buddy V's is a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vEtqPQ9aVv-A1-brZ9j29g.text: First off - the food was good.  I recommend the Mac & Cheese.  It all went sideways from there.  A group of us decided to give it a try last week.  We got right in and the service was fast.  The server knew nothing about where she worked nor any details about the cake boss himself or the famous bakery across the hall.  We informed her as to who Buddy is.  Bad start for this employee we thought.  Later that night we decided to give the bakery a try and experience the famous treats we had only seen on the TV show.  We waited in the long line and ordered our treats.  After we paid, I heard some construction noise and realized that a construction person was knocking bricks off the wall some 15 feet behind us.  In fact the debris actually hit one of our guests.  In the small bakery their is a small bar to sit at, but in this case that was even closer to the construction guy.  We asked the cashier if we could sit across the hall at the Buddy V's to enjoy our treats.  She said ok but to inform the host.  We crossed the hall and asked the host if we could sit in the dining area that was in the hall, she said no that area was closed.  The restaurant was near empty and I clearly pointed out the construction mess as it was only 30 feet across the hall.  I then asked if we could sit anywhere inside to eat our already paid for treats.  She said no, I should go eat it at the bar inside the bakery.  Needless to say we left and found some tables out in the mall.    I can not believe that the same establishment from across I the hall would treat people so negatively.  I will not return given their lack of service.  Too bad, the food was pretty good.  They really need some training as to who they work for as well as the True value of a customer.  I will never go back for that reason.

a0Ihojt9HErKWYllmmT0TQ.text: Wow. We stopped in for some lunch here and our expectations were nothing short of exceeded. We ended up having a few appetizers. The eggplant and fried motz (not on menu)  and some ceaser salad. It was fresh and flavorful. Down to the croutons on the salad everything was crafted perfectly. We were gonna go grab dessert next door and the bakery and we're glad we didnt. Our enthusiastic server named Georgio recommended us to have the dessert there. They brought us the desert menu which was adorable like a photo album with family photos in it as well. They had what we would have gotten next door and served it garnished with extra cream and chocolate and even fresh fruit. This place is a must to stop in.

g5-m2Ja8ucSmBhCntvudiw.text: All I can say is WOW!  The food was amazing! We had the whole wheat penne and the orecchiette with Italian sausage. Really good. We also split the Nutella cake with salted Carmel ice creme. One of the best deserts I have had.

3e_CD1ZuMJAnWUjpDmXG0Q.text: Boring average Italian food that lacked adequate service.  There are much better places to spend your vacation dollars.

JAxdQJAMfc_7WIaXDjfAYQ.text: Best Italian I have had.  The Sunday pasta dish was incredible and I would fly to Vegas to have it again.

OpfuRM4NCP4v6J-rVckS4A.text: My wife and I had a really great experience here for lunch.  I wanted the Sunday Gravy, which was the special, but it turns out it is a dinner item.  The waitress insisted on going back and checking with the chef and he agreed to make it for me.  I'm glad he did, it was amazing.  We also had the cheese sticks for an appetizer.  They were delicious, though a bit unorthodox, it was more like a grilled cheese sandwich in tomato sauce.  Service was great and friendly.  The restaurant, for lunch, was relatively empty, but everything was amazing.

eCJtZJwMPv17RY2R5GwlVw.text: Best meal in Las Vegas. Much better than Delmonico's (Emeril's place). 5 star service from Georgio.  We have eaten somewhere different for almost a week and this was the best.  Ask for the family style sampler. We didn't see it on the menu but they bring their signature appetizers, entrees and desserts. Worth the visit!

OWrkxLIGxQrircpfYKw4cg.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS RESTRAUNT!  Food was so delicious, and the waiters/waitresses were super nice and helpful.  Was great for lunch and dont get me started on the canoli's....  DELISH!  I will deffinately be returning!

g_nNmLzGgSvAT6fEHaw7Sg.text: Had a great meal , very traditional Italian offerings !  I ate the Sunday gravy special & it was perfect - just like grandma's !  The atmosphere, staff, decor was all very friendly & roomy.  If your looking for traditional Italian that's fairly priced - you found it !  I would return for sure.

6_pVuiVuukDalINqjLnu5A.text: This is a good plan to take the family for grub. Typical American version of Italian food, nothing special. Would have preferred bread with linguini and clams over breadsticks. Decent liguini dish but nothing to be wowed about.

WDzewB6snMPc2Y3XZR76zQ.text: This place is a must eat has to be the best Italian restaurant is Vegas if the not best overall. The service and environment are second to none. From the time we walked up to the hostess stand to the time we paid we felt we were the the most important customers there and they were quite busy. The food, was absolute amazing the best Italian food I have ever eat. Our waiter was the most patient caring and professional waiter ever (Giorgio) is a must ask for! I would give 12 out of 5 stars!

5UTOH3CUyR7PG8udOEiBXQ.text: As a NJ expat, I can say one of the few things I miss most living in Hawaii is exceptional Italian food. Luckily, my boyfriend comes from a line of Italian chefs and isn't afraid to be super critical when it comes to Italian, and I can say he would have approved and I can't wait to take him here. The eggplant Parmesan was mouth watering my delicious, and caprese salad had the freshest ingredients. The four sides we ordered (polenta, asparagus, kale, and mashed potatoes) were a bit too over seasoned or cheesy, but the main dishes were phenomenal. Highly recommend the cheese/cured meat board. Friendly atmosphere with a great view of the strip.

EhJ08iUxln5tE84BU1EVaQ.text: Great food, great service from Crystal.  The meatballs were fabulous,  ravioli was great and their tomato basil soup was excellent.

2KFYGBUW2YYVMR0XrOuDvA.text: Great family friendly restaurant on the strip, good food and service, variety in the kids menu and an all around great meal.  Chaz was a great server, and is a dead ringer for the Rock!

d8FHcXIl-QsxyYImt1W_TA.text: Dinner last night with 3 very close clients. Overall very good, excellent spin on Italian with references to Buddy V's heritage. We shared a variety of appetizers, the signature dried meats and cheese board was excellent. For entree's a couple of us opted for pasta, cooked perfectly, flavorful. We also shared a couple of desserts of which the Canoli was very creative and extraordinary. The Canoli is kind of deconstructed which makes it fun to eat. Overall highly recommended!

E6dq756BKIOrEhoaa_LO4g.text: What a wonderful experience! The veal Marsala melted in my mouth and I mopped up all of the sauce with the perfectly cooked spaghetti it came with. The lobster tail for dessert was amazing! The filling was perfect and held together by a perfect, flaky pastry. Our waiter Rocco was more than accommodating with my multitude of requests and questions - always responding with a pleasant smile and great attitude. Thank you Buddy Vs! We will be back.

FL-4DIMTSYDZEXJjpcm3rA.text: Food is absolutely amazing!! Perfect portion sizes and unique twists to traditional recipes. Try the mozzarella sticks as an appetizer. Delicious!! And not what you expect!! Service is personalized and impeccable!!

GCBy8uCPgSRVpkscKBDj1w.text: Had heard good things and wanted to stop by before seeing a show however the hostess was on a major power trip and wouldn't even FATHOM letting us sit at the completely empty bar in the completely empty restaurant (no joke this was 5pm and there were maybe 3 people in the entire thing). All we wanted were some appetizers and drinks and they wouldn't even let us in because they were "completely booked" that night and people were coming "at any second". Since when do restaurants book spots at the bar?? We were completely incredulous and the hostess could not have been ruder. She definitely gets off on shooing people away, but honey this isn't an exclusive club it's the Cake Boss's restaurant...

KRuCrEKmruVrNzccbJtSvw.text: Service was amazing and they were very attentive. I tried the chicken parmesan and spaghetti which was delicious. There lasagna was humongous. Overall a 5 out of 5.

4CQrVMF6XWBTChfZxHdRtw.text: This review is for the hostess. She turned me away with an elderly person and my 2 children. I could not get a table and order a drink. She said I had to order food and turned us away. My father in law has a few medical conditions I will not list but to be turned away is a joke. This place will never earn my business again!

iOntxeAtoduG1yMtYzFD4A.text: Against my better judgement I went to eat here because I assumed that even if the food was mediocre at least the dessert menu should be stellar. Not the case. Two thin,appetizer sized pieces veal and some third rate lasagna for almost $60 in a space that only poor people wont mind dining in. I thought the dessert menu would make up for this but boy was I wrong. About 6 underwhelming options from the "Cake Boss". WTF? I ordered two items that were as pathetic as the food. Steer clear of this place.

saanzRbYUBjvowqPrhQCxA.text: Two stars because the service was horrible. We waited for over 20 minutes when we were first seated to have a waitress come over. Food was good. Trying to pay bill was a nightmare. 20 minutes and still waiting!

ZZ-NSBDq9Tl2nO3hY6S0RQ.text: My mother and I came here for the Sunday Brunch Buffet. Everything was amazing! From the fresh made crossants, to the chicken Parmesan and all the yummy desserts! We will definately be coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From the Sunday brunch buffet

EtqRiYtLt0W_5SIrKjCtjQ.text: Had visit as soon as I saw the ad walking through the canal shoppes..this place did not disappoint!!! The salad is out of this word good and fresh. Buddy's signature pizza is great.. And the cannoli is what we came for especially. It was way better than expected..can't wait for Carlo's to open across the way...so coming back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy v&#39;s

_5FyyhmpmrE2_RYgTdFygg.text: A little hard to find if you're in the casino but a great place to eat. Service was good but not polished. The meatballs were perfect. Very flavorful. Sea scallops were delicious. Ambience is nice but it's more bustling than relaxing. Italian birthday cake is something I'd highly recommend if you're in the mood for dessert. Skip the drinks, they looked overpriced and sugary.

wDKQboB9x7B7uEug2LK7eg.text: Excellent service. We were seated quickly not know that the were closing. All staff members were accommodating and friendly. A member of our party had a gluten allergy and the staff went out of their way to make sure she found something on the menu despite all the Italian carb/wheat options. They do apparently have a gluten free penne pasta option. The food came out quickly and was delicious! I would recommend and come back. Oh... And prices very reasonable. #winning

tYnAGAzDuIV-jyIv_WK2LQ.text: Buddy V's is like eating Sunday dinner with my Nona. The food was traditional, impeccably crafted, and amazingly delicious. The service was beyond helpful, informative, and all around pleasant. The general manager Adam, went out of his way to chat with our table and surrounding tables several times. I highly recommend this restaurant for the good and the atmosphere.

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Piccata

8os26YUuHjXmZTy_tQOJHw.text: Eat here!   Food is fantastic.  Service is top notch.  A don't miss in Vegas.  The carbonara was excellent.  The cheesy garlic bread is a great appetizer.  Meatballs are fantastic. Chicken Parm is more than one person can eat.

I8Z8-7dLXisgnTfU3gd-_w.text: Had been at the Venetian for 2 days and realized that I have't eaten any Italian food. Walked past Buddy V's several times and decided to make reservations for later in the evening. When I arrived I was seated promptly. The menu was short and sweet covered all of the classics. I usually order Chicken Parm but I was in the mood for Spaghetti. The noodles were great and the meat sauce had great consistency. Buddy V's is very approachable and a solid choice for classic Italian cuisine. I will be coming back.

IvwzFxu1ef1f7mnHKK7GxQ.text: What a fun place to dine. We went for lunch. The service was amazing and fast. All employees were very nice. We ate off the lunch express menu which was more than enough. Sangria was delicious. Bloody Mary was good but a bit on spicy side. Would highly recommend this restaurant especially if looking for a place Away from casino. Loved it! Don't forget to go across the hall to Carlos bakery. Get there as soon as they open!

h3HUAz7na3t5V5mmGjT2wg.text: First time here and it was an overall great experience. Our waiter Charlie was fun, energetic and knowledgable on the menu. Tried "My dads bucatini carbonara" which was excellence. The Nutella cake was super delish! Will be going back for sure

L4dLppq4SkcsLZfiEq2l3g.text: Awesome all around. The food is amazing. Service spectacular and view is perfect. I give my highest rating and will come every time I am in Vegas.

d-Y-7_TCIxpPPLqAlrEPvw.text: My husband and I enjoyed our last dinner in Vegas at Buddy V's. The service was excellent and we were seated right away with our reservation. The live music was also enjoyable. We split a Caesar salad and the croutons were warm and stuffed! I had the orchiette pasta and my husband had the chicken parm. Both entrees were big portions. I recommend getting a table next to the window so you can enjoy the view of the strip.

ZZkC32cIo9uvkKqN_UhUyQ.text: Came here this past Sunday night to celebrate my sister's bachelorette event in Vegas. There was 10 of us ladies. I must say the ambiance was relaxing, semi formal-casual. Our server Peter was very attentive to our needs. They gave us this fresh rosemary garlic bread with balsamic vinegar and olive oil and it was amazing. We ordered the chicken picatta and added mushrooms and it was quite tasty, chicken marsala, lasagna, linguine with clams, mac and cheese, chicken rigatoni alla vodka, the caprese salad,  caesar salad, and veal marsala. Everything was pleasing to the palate. I also ordered the salted caramel ice cream to go and it was delicious. I would definitely come back here again to get my Italian fix the next time I'm in town.

s1ZXsIQNTuLrwtLCQWG3kA.text: Expected a tourist trap and average food. Instead received unblemished service, dynamite meatball appetizer, delicious chicken parm and great desserts. Never know until you try something, and Buddy V's won't disappoint.

s8LKpexCcNtPBNM4UGjYcw.text: There food was delicious! There sauce was soooo good, but the the portion sizes are extremely small, very pricey for the size but other than that this place is perfect, great atmosphere, great food, what more could you want.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FNr8Rv4dD5XC1kt6SOjxsw.text: Here for the Super Bowl, if you are thinking a great combination good food and football big mistake the food and waiters service along with the tv size is a big disappointment don't waste your time

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small tv&#39;s for such a large event

qpdyHupBHB3IAbEHeLJs7Q.text: I am a big fan of the cake boss and when I found out that he opened a restaurant I was over the moon. Good parts the food and portions are excellent, the price is pretty comparable considering it is on the Vegas strip. Unfortunately the service was horrible!!!!! The server never paid attention to her tables. It took a lot to get refills on drinks, our check, and our change. She didn't even check our table to see if our meal was tasting ok. I will go back for the food, just hope they can fix the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and Cheese

N677bOuryxPu8BLLaf31GA.text: I had a salad from here which was light but very filling. The cannoli was the best I have had! Our server was very friendly, while we ate our lunch there was live music in the background. They have a  caesar cart which my friend loved, you can make your own caesar!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannolis

zI1ikegwIVz08C1opLzKhg.text: Amazing service. Amazing food. And best of all we got to meet buddy !!! Can't wait to go back!!!

7Plfzbda-moZ-2xhyManlA.text: Cake was average. Nothing special. Looked delicious but lacked in flavour and was honestly too sweet.   I ordered the rainbow cake which was visually appealling but lacked any flavour. It tasted like sugar imbalanced with more sugar. At $8 a peice it was hardly worth the price and it took me almost 8 sittings to finish because i couldnt handle more than 3 bites at a time due to overwhelming and overpowering flavour of sugar. I love desserts but it wasnt balanced at all and honestly most church bakers or even school bake sales make better cake.   Only upside was the short line and the great single serve packaging for the cakes to go. Otherwise skip it and head ANYWHERE else. Its a fad place from tv and the desserts are extremely lacking in quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rainbow cake @buddy v&#39;s

3d44Zi9ekV-BPitGdtkCQg.text: First of all, this place is super hard to find in the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes area. Locate Tao, then use the exterior door to get the covered balcony, hang a right and it's past Rock House. I'm usually good at navigating casinos but this place was hidden! Worth seeking out though.  Came in for Restaurant Week lunch menu with Lauren C- $20, 3 courses, $4 donation to Three Square food bank, so a win all around. As expected, they are spectacularly good at carbs here, from the house focaccia you are served upon seating to the polenta croutons in the Caesar. We shared the spaghetti and meatball and chicken parm entrees, both with more than ample pasta for a lunch portion with a great robust sauce and well-seasoned protein. I'm not much of a dessert person, but the NJ style cheesecake was well made and nicely accented by strawberry compote and chocolate almonds.   Service was attentive and I really love the ambiance of the dining room. While this spot is hard to find, I'd come back to try more. As a local, RW is great for giving a discounted opportunity to try a place I otherwise wouldn't seek out (who voluntarily goes to the Strip these days?!), while giving back at the same time!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Focaccia
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Jersey style cheesecake
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm lunch

afnsHA3Jag81dQrwhWz8qQ.text: This was a very good Italian restaurant located in the Palazzo.  We made reservations so were say right down.  We got to sit right next to the band that was performing.  I thought it was going to be annoying being that close but it was awesome.  They were extremely friendly and really good music while dining.  They even helped us pick out our food.  The food was really good.  Not the best Italian food I've had but definitely good.  It's a good location, great staff and good food.  Would definitely go again.

qHyDS9hGg5-kH_PtboZIww.text: More like 3.5 stars. Stopped by for restaurant week $20.18 lunch. Service was great and you can't beat the price for a 3 course meal. Caesar salad was unremarkable but the polenta croutons it was topped with were fantastic! They had a hint of lemon that really made them stand out. The tomato basil soup was also a hit. For entrees we had chicken parm & spaghetti meatballs. The chicken was moist and flavorful as were the meatballs. The pasta was cooked perfect but the sauce was just average. Not something I would want again. We were too full for dessert & got it go. Totally enjoyed it later!!   I might return for happy hour. I heard they have the croutons as an appetizer on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato &amp; Basil Soup
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti &amp; meatballs

9DXBgH2PDraKPRKp-r8f3A.text: I've dined here two years in a row for Restaurant Week and have been happy with both food and service.   The service has been attentive and friendly. Both times I had reservations and was seated right away.   On my most recent visit I started with the Caesar Salad. The salad was basic and not overly exciting, but the polenta croutons on top were tasty. The warm bread served with oil and vinegar was pretty good.   Spaghetti and Meatballs made for a hearty, delicious lunch. The meatballs were fairly seasoned and I liked the spaghetti sauce on the dish. My friend's Chicken Parmesan was my favorite of the two dishes though. The chicken had plenty of breading and cheese.   I'm a big dessert person and both hit the spot for me. The Cannoli had a great tasting filling with yummy chocolate chips and pistachios on one end. I just tasted the Cheesecake, but loved the flavor and I don't usually care for cheesecake.  Buddy V's is probably not my first pick for Italian in town, but a solid option if in the area. A big perk is Carlo's Bakery across the hall for more post dinner sweets.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatball Starter
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm bread with oil and vinegar for dipping.

TIRAxuutUURp9a0vUqMu0Q.text: As if I am a LV resident, I come here almost every visit to Las Vegas. I usually stay in the Palazzo when I am working a conference at the Sands Expo.   Which makes it convenient, I just have to take the elevator down and walk down the hallway that can be easily be missed.   Not sure I've had a bad item here, spaghetti, linguine, lasagna and their pizzas are pretty good here. As for the apps I always get the calamari and the caprese salad.   Another plus is their mules here are pretty good!

RBg53_4r33RTp4-L_WxvjQ.text: I was torn writing this review.  I was stuck on a three or a four star, but eventually decided on the three for several reasons.  The first one was how we were greeted.  This seems to be a trend in Vegas where the hostesses don't really care if you are there or not.  Hi I am here and we have a reservation followed by the rolling of the eyes from the hostess.   We get seated and are promptly waited on and drinks arrive quickly after.  Our server was attentive but had very little personality and seemed like he did not care to be there either.   My sons and I shared the salumi platter which was very good.  My oldest ordered a plain cheese pizza which he really liked.  My youngest got the meatball sub which he also liked.  The meatballs were really good and tender and came with a huge pile of fries.  Now here is another reason why I gave the three stars, my veal Marsala and my wife's carbonara were just completely over seasoned in black pepper.  My veal's breading had so much it killed the flavor or the wine sauce.  I know there is supposed to be pepper in carbonara, but not to the point it mutes out all other flavors by numbing your tongue. If I was in the area I might stop again, but it wouldn't be my first choice and most likely we well be heading back to Rao's.  It is more expensive, but the atmosphere and service are far better and the food doesn't numb your palate.

6GfluJoafPiDa0Ctuccfeg.text: Ive loved his show and always wanted to try the food so Im so happy this did not disappoint! We came for my bfs bday and it was restaurant week and got a great full meal for 20$. Cesar salad with polenta crutons, chicken parm with spaghetti, and cannoli with chocolate chips and pistachios! EVERYTHING was delicious and the service is on point. Definitely recommend any fan to go the the Venetian and try this place!

i-v3eD41LG7aC7eh4OAmkQ.text: Best. Italian. Food. I've. Ever. Eaten.   From the very first bite it was divine! I ordered the chicken parmesan with garlic bread and it was the best chicken parm I've EVER had. The pomodoro sauce was to die for! Even the iced tea was amazing. The service was great, our server told us all of the good places to go and what shows to see. We went around 2pm and it wasn't busy at all. It must be busy for dinner.   Go here if you're dying for some good Italian food! You won't be disappointed

z8AiOuuPIO75e87YSXAGWQ.text: Where to start..... maybe with the perfectly cooked pasta, or maybe the perfectly seasoned lasagna... no wait, I think it has to be the calamari. I've got it. It's the burrata caprese salad. Yes, that's definitely it.    I loved everything about this meal. From the ambiance, to the attentive waiter with a personality that didn't disappoint. I've been to Italy and love great pasta, so my standards are high. I'm happy to say my expectations were not only met, they were well exceeded. I've now found my new favorite restaurant! I'll definitely be visiting every time I'm in Vegas

fEOimdThYdPri3kOISbgUQ.text: Really good food with friendly staff.  When we were there they had a live band playing which was nice.  The portions were still on the large side but everything was tasty. We had the lasagne, spaghetti bolognese, tomato bisque, house salad and ravioli. Everything was great. If I had one slight complaint it would be that the soup was a little too salty.

YzTZbQ3Tdu1-URBrBnQ7Sg.text: This was our first time at this restaurant we loved it. Food was delicious service was spectacular I spent my 50th birthday here love the show cake Boss. You may want to make reservations if you have a large party

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So excited it&#39;s my 50th birthday!

UXf0NPlddo4Zcil2rnuZRg.text: I don't think I'm the only person whose mouth starts to water, when watching a show like the Sopranos and the show's characters converge around good Italian food all the while remarking, "Gravy is good tonight" or that scene in 'Goodfellas' where the wiseguys are making dinner in prison. Those scenes always had me craving for good American-Italian food.   Buddy V's wasn't even on my radar when the wife and I went to Las Vegas during Christmas. Come dinnertime on Christmas Day the wife and I had no idea where to eat with all the restaurants around the area but thanks to Yelp, and all the other people reviewing, we decided to give Buddy V's a shot and both of us were not disappointed.  First Impression  The restaurant has a down home feel to it. Nothing fancy so don't feel bad if you're dressed casually. The hostess was cheerful and it took her a few minutes to prepare a table and get us seated on a fairly busy evening.  Service  Our waitress, Nichole, and the server working the area were excellent. Both were friendly and always checking at appropriate intervals in to see how things were and making sure our water glasses were always filled up and that our plates were cleared and new utensils provided.  Food  As first timers who were both very hungry and looking to indulge, we started with 'Aunt Ninas Mozzarella en Carrozza' and 'My Wife's Eggplant Parm'. Both were delicious and actually quite filling. In hindsight, we probably would have skipped the appetizers if we knew what a generous portion of food would be coming with the pasta dishes we ordered.  For the main course, my wife ordered 'Lisa V's Linguine and Clam' and I had the 'Valastro Sunday Gravy' as well as a glass of red wine to go with it.   The linguine and clam was perfect. A generous amount of large clams and linguine whose texture was perfectly al dente. At other restaurants, they would skimp on the clams and you'd not only get a small amount of clams but the clams they used were tiny. Not here. Large clams and plenty of them!  When the server brought the Valastro Sunday Gravy that's when I knew I had bitten off more than I could chew. It was a large dish filled with meatballs, Italian sausage, a large piece of lamb and a massive portion of pork, all covered in a hearty and delicious tomato sauce plus a separate bowl of rigatoni. Wow.  By the end of the dinner I was so full and could barely move. Definitely no space for dessert so unfortunately we weren't able to try the desserts that brought Buddy Valastro fame. Until the next time!

TPG6TcB9qlFyOzhHJfF7RQ.text: With so many Italian restaurants in the Canal shops, it's really hard to choose which one to dine at. I decided on this place because of all the wonderful reviews and I'm so happy that I did. I ordered my favorite linguine with fresh clams and hubby ordered the chicken rigatoni ala vodka sauce. Both dishes tasted amazing and I would definitely order the linguine clams again. We weren't really hungry so we didn't order appetizers or a salad. They also offer fresh baked foccacia bread with was phenomenal so make sure you get some because they don't always provide it. Hubby made the mistake of eating too much bread so he had to take the rest of his pasta to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d57nGkEYahnRujq8c8_x2A.text: Great customer service and extremely tasteful. Would highly recommend as there menu has many options from pastas, seafood, and steak this place has it all. Super busy during dinner time but walked in without a reservation and was seated right away. Ordered the grilled salmon, chicken piccata, and chicken Marsala and they all taste good. Super flavorful and light. Absolutely love this place and that's why I keep coming back.

I didn't know that they gave complimentary focaccia bread so we ordered the Cheesy Garlic Bread - both were fantastic. Overall a great experience, and the service was great.

iK4943rY8oUVRXxw6loYYg.text: The only reason that I went to Vegas was Buddy's Restaurant. The food was great and definitely worth it!! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a delicious meal and a delicious cannoli.

0sNcTLT0NAGWh1nbRWIiZQ.text: Nice restaurant with helpful and courteous wait staff.  We were looking for a nice restaurant to eat at in Vegas and decided to try Buddy's restaurant.   It was a great choice.   The portions were large and tasty.  I would recommend trying his restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food and accommodating staff we had the lasagna.   It was great..

2Bm5AHDXtPp7myyeEO_PtQ.text: Went to Vegas for a bachelorette celebration and we planned to have a nicer dinner on the last day of our stay. Everyone loves Italian, right?! Right!  Buddy V's is located inside the Palazzo and on one side is the restaurant and on the other side is the cake shop. We had reservations for 7pm on a Sunday night (on Memorial day weekend) and we still had to wait a pretty long time to be seated. So much for a reservation, but that's not too huge of a deal I guess. I was just getting tired standing in my heels lol.  Aesthetically, this plays feels very home-y, which I liked. There were photos of Buddy and his family members incorporated into the dessert menu (it was really cute), and there were photos all around the restaurant--makes you just feel good inside when you know that this is a longtime family tradition!   We were seated and a few minutes passed before we met our server. He introduced the idea that we could order family style or we could just order individual plates. Although ordering family style would probably be a more economical option, it was just too much fuss to do with a group of 8 girls. A lot of us (including myself) ended up getting the chicken parm, and a few others ordered a pasta dish (the one with the vodka sauce, I forgot the  name). ALL OF THE FOOD WAS SO DELICIOUS. WOW. Even the appetizers and bread that we got was finger-licking good. JUST LET THE CARBS WIN. GET THE FOCCACIA BREAD APPETIZER TOO. You'll thank me later...   Although we didn't need the server too much, he was nowhere to be found, never really checked up on us, so service gets a ding.  The price point was really reasonable given the enormous portions we got (chicken parm dish gives you 2 large breast cutlets; this is easily shareable). We had tons of leftovers that we happily ate after a long night of dancing.   The only reason this review gets 4 stars is because the service. It was just lacking. But everything else, just superb! Superb food, superb pricing, portions, value, etc. I try not to eat that many carbs, but when in Vegas, carb it up. And come here to do it. Pasta and bread all day BRO! ha.

tu0CIQ5tt-LYgNksSZQ9Lw.text: Great service and good food.  My husband and I came her w/ my sister in law and we sat at the bar. Our bartender was very attentive and polite. She always checked up on us and made sure our drinks were topped off. Overall, service was great. The food was good, but it wasn't spectacular. I got the spaghetti and calamari for an app to share, my husband got the chicken parm, and my sister in law got the shrimp scampi. The price was fair for being in Vegas but the flavor of the food was subpar.

eS96C1--kTJNiWv3eeYmVw.text: First of all, the service was amazing! Never had a waiter treated my party and I so well! We ordered the lasagna which is not an item on the menu, but they made it available for us! Also, I highly recommend the tiramisu!

3DSet4QpaKlfXY0pGl36Ag.text: The food / service here was pretty good. I really liked the chicken parmigiana. The cheese bread was pretty good also. Certainly recommend this place, and give it another go when I'm back in Las Vegas.

QypUzT75_KXCWRe_BoP5ig.text: The orzo, the chicken Parm and the cheesecake. Enough said!   I brought a large party here, and it was rave reviews all around. The atmosphere is causal, but delivers on home cooked style goodness that pleases the masses.   I would definitely go back, and I would definitely bring people here again!

sNlfgXbCuMcpx5u1GLPotQ.text: I like to visit Buddy V's everytime I am in Vegas. Their food is very heartfelt and comforting. I would recommend their tomato soup, veggie pasta and birthday cake.

xhS8KZrxATD0aNocMPTApQ.text: I really liked everything, I had here. So I started with A Acai Berry Mojito that's was so good. Then I went for the Shrimp Caesar Salad. It was so good. My Shrimp were perfect and well seasoned it came along with these awesome croutons that were huge and delicious! I must say I'll be back to try some Pasta!

GrHTGQROnrxCpWvszEEvyQ.text: Buddy V's is a great place for Italian food!  We recently took my daughter, son and grandson there and all of them enjoyed it.  Lots to look at inside and we were kind of close to a window overlooking the strip.  My wife and I get the grandma's meatballs and the garlic bread.  And we were thoroughly satisfied.  The spaghetti my daughter got was very good also.  The only thing that was bizarre  was when our server asked to move the baby seat that was sitting on a chair, bothering no one, to the floor.  My son responded, "whatever is good for you..I guess."  Whatever.   Food was good so we overcame the weird request.

6dexl1uplBLuwTK0PfZzgQ.text: My boyfriend and I went for our 5 year anniversary and the restaurant was fantastic. They had live music, a very romantic setting, everyone that we encountered was so friendly. The food was AMAZING.  I can't wait to go again.

UsYVcFmXtljwnSzUwO7XIQ.text: Great meal & great service. My friend & I shared the Caesar salad to start. Instead of regular croutons they were made out of polenta. The pomegranate martini was nice & tart, not sweet which it how I like them. I had the seared scallops w polenta & prosciutto. Melt in your mouth. My friend got the eggplant parm w appetizer with added meatballs & spaghetti. She enjoyed. We shared the Nutella molten cake w salted caramel ice cream. Great finish to the meal. I definitely would come back here!!

nsqAnpDhugrz7_Rs6ZFQjw.text: We ate here over the forth of July weekend.  The hostess was very nice on the phone and accommodated my addition of two more to our existing reservation of 4.  We were seated promptly when we arrived and were greeted with smiles and water at our table.  Our wait staff was attentive so we never needed anything.  The food was delicious and timely.  We told the staff we had a show later and they ensured we had enough time to enjoy our dinner and still make the show.  I would come back.

gOshzLl-YrbEptpNpEWYtQ.text: Let me start with my granddaughter  She loved this restaurant S he had spaghetti  See pic  Now the chicken piccata according to my daughter and her friend fell flat like a New England patriots football   The shrimp scampi was excellent   My son in law ate the chicken Parmesan  He likes it because it has 2 chicken breasts But one of our friends gave him another and he ate it I have a strong feeling he enjoyed it  I had the meatballs and they were okay  The service  was excellent   The ambiance was excellent

yRIIV_wZuXwr34ToVZxBvw.text: Tried the brunch buffet and the food was delicious - my favorite items were the smoked salmon, crepes, chicken parmigiana, croissants, egg frittata, and meatballs. The portions are small but the food is fresh and you can go get more of whatever you like if you want more. It also gives you a chance to try a variety of items. We opted for the bottomless alcohol and it was worth it. They had mimosas, bellinis, domestic beer, and sangria. All of the staff are so sweet and attentive. Definitely give it a try if you are in the casino.

MY5YGj1zlqlISc8uOw_hdw.text: We went to Buddy V's because we wanted a reasonably priced sit down dinner near where we were staying.  It was a Friday night and we didn't have a reservation (just made it in town) and checked in around 8pm.  The wait was about 45 minutes and they buzzed us right around that time.  We had the garlic bread, clam linguine, and chicken parmesan.  Everything was delicious.  The marinara on the side of spaghetti that came with the chicken parmesan was amazing.  My family has our own homemade sauce, but I will admit, this one was better.  Hopefully I can find the recipe online or in a cookbook Buddy puts out!  The dessert menu was more of what you see in a traditional Italian restaurant, so we went across the way to his bakery for dessert.  Which again was delicious and reasonably priced.  I had the raspberry linzer cookie and my husband a cupcake.  All in all food and service was great.  Will be going back the next time we are staying on the strip.

SPFkgND1Z84N4f8p30UNIg.text: Such delicious food! We ordered the chicken parm and chicken piccata along with two ceases salads. The service was fast and great but I am not giving a full five stars because the hostess were probably the fakest humans ever ever met in my life. The host is the first person you see when you go into a restaurant and they should be genuine and welcoming whereas our host was acting like she owned the restaurant.

fdL5rnF5CRuL9XF5tI7H2w.text: Solid Italian food!  I took my boyfriend to Buddy V's Italian restaurant at The Venetian, because he loves watching shows such as Cake Boss.  It didn't disappoint!    We came around 5 pm in the evening, and I was pleased to find that the wait was only a few minutes, and that we were promptly seated.  The service was quick and respectable, as well.   The food here is a bit upscale, but still not too bad.  We got two different carbonara dishes - one of them a macaroni carbonara!  I really loved the macaroni dish, although my boyfriend said he liked the pasta a lot more.  I thought they were both very creamy and rich with flavor, and tasted delicious.  They were also very filling, and we were full by the time we finished!    They provide little packs with sticks of bread in them on the table, but I didn't care for them too much.  I kind of was wishing that they would provide some complimentary bread and olive oil like a lot of Italian restaurants, but they didn't offer any.    All in all, a solid Italian restaurant at The Strip.  Very good, solid Italian pasta dishes, and efficient service.  A bit pricey, but reasonable for the type of restaurant that it is, and I feel I thoroughly enjoyed my experience.

uccV7dUxqZnbSmmE5TbDLQ.text: This is delicious! Had the meatball sub, the lunch portion, and it was outstanding. The flavor of the meatballs made you think you were sitting in Italy. Come enjoy some amazing Italian food!

iDNQ-7oVRK8OtMH76oyBLQ.text: Super disappointed.  My dining experience here was probably the second worse experience of my 7 day trip.  This establishment gives off a casual vibe but we expected better food given that Buddy Valastro is behind it. My meatball sub left much to be desired.  The meatball itself was not tasty at all.  My husband ordered the Chicken Parm and found that the chicken parm at Maggiano's was much better.  Our waitress was rushed and not pleasant at all. Big let down for sure.  I would skip this restaurant.

rBN6wBonsnNDBJnYWap2rw.text: My husband has gotten my birthday cake here for the past few years. They never fail, it is always the best! My favorite is the strawberry shortcake. Yumm!

PqZYfj9vKS_WOw1Z8cZZ4Q.text: Service was great. They really made sure my  anaphylaxis child was safe and able to eat his meal. I'm so thankful. Service and atmosphere were amazing. Having my son eat and feel safe beats the taste of the food.  As for the food, well it was eh, ok. Nothing to write home about but service was great!

glPsugZkej6sm6bj6CHAQw.text: The food really just isn't good. Bland, dry, and not cooked well. The reviews made it sound like traditional Italian cooking, but it tastes like a tourist trap. Very disappointing

CaMt7pcc30eDqTq2LaWaxw.text: I would give this place a 4.5 stars. I was pleasantly surprised how delicious the food was! I read the reviews, however, with my experience eating at bacchanal buffet, I was a bit skeptical and had no expectation eating here. Not sure if it was me being skeptical and had no expectation, but the food was amazing. The dinner bread was soft and delicious. The salad (Panzanella) was surprisingly good. I thought it would be just some ordinary balsamic vinaigrette salad, but the flavors of the mix greens, cheese, and tomatoes really worked well together. The calamari was crispy, I recommend to ask for marinara on the side to cut up the oiliness from the calamari. We ordered the lasagna and OMG the portion size is huge! we ordered one to share, but it came out like two individual entrees. Finally, for dessert and OMMMGG the banana bread pudding is to die for. Great texture and flavor all mixed together to perfection. It was not overly sweet, even though, it looked like it would be, but it is not. The crunchiness from the nuts (I think pecans) and the soft bread with the vanilla ice cream (*smacking lips) works sooooo well together. I would say this is the best bread pudding I ever had. Even though, me and my fiance was full from the other foods, we definitely had room to finish every single bite of this perfection. Overall, best experience and for the price and the portion size of the foods, I would say is fair.

KziZc6xTg6MDqDiNJ31K-A.text: The calamari fritti was a great opener for the family; daughter had the Margherita and polished it off too; father in law had the lasagne, he barely had 1/3 of it, it was huge, but he enjoyed it; hubby had a the steak pizzaiolo and he enjoyed it; had the linguine and clams and it was good, not great, too creamy for my taste but we had a great time, great view of the strip too.

WB3-oRf9_w1oBJ2MqIHgEQ.text: Food and server were amazing. I got the shrimp scampi which was full of flavor. First time here and we will be back.

_5LjS0iggTNBAberIjVeWQ.text: What a disappointment. Underseasoned capellini shrimp scampi with not even a hint of garlic. It had flavorless shrimp - boiled instead of sauteed?  Merely average lasagna. Bland, gummy focaccia that needed longer baking and the addition of rosemary. At these expensive prices, expected better food.   On the plus side, service was quick and waitstaff excellent (otherwise this place would only have gotten 2 stars). The olive oil/balsamic dipping sauce was excellent (but not enough to redeem the sorry focaccia). The lemonade was great - for $10, glad it came with free refills.

C266V1GYWflOyihFg4fWRw.text: So far this place sucks. Arrogant hostess that just keeps saying we are working on your table. This was going to be a nice company dinner for 6 people. Reservation was made 2 months ago and it is now 30 minutes past our reservation time. Rude hostess and at least 30 minute wait for our table so far. Not a good start. In the end the food was good and the server was great. The manager came out and talked to us. All in all once we got seated it was a nice, pleasant dinner with good food and very good service.

54Jn0puaui6jmdWwZiqs-Q.text: This place is so incredibly good buddy has done in amazing job making sure that this food is a real Italian food the meat balls are and spaghetti are a must. Staff is super bz but they still do a good job.

2349YVz7BzG315oeYD_lyA.text: This was my first visit to Buddy V's and it was AMAZING. The ambiance was great with really nice live music and lighting, the service was impeccable and our food was out of sight! Our server Giorgio was probably the best server I have ever had! He was so friendly and really went out of his way to take care of us and make us feel at home. We also Got to spend some time chatting with the manager who was also excellent at his job and runs a top notch place. He even had a fabulous cake sent to our table to help us celebrate our anniversary. We had an amazing evening at Buddy V's. We would highly recommend it to anyone and we will be back soon!! Thanks Giorgio!!

YQdHYGJsx-ggqdwyBMdEBA.text: i have nothing but good things to say about this place. everything we ordered are superb and kudos to our server who suggested a wine to perfectly pair with my pasta dish. definitely a MUST when in Vegas.

gxDSKPdWL2ZorIJiSFAaJQ.text: I must say, I ate one of the best Italian dishes in my life at bobby's V last night. From the moment you walk in service is great. Had a great view of the last Vegas strip. One good thing was that they didn't have any dress code which was important because i sure didn't feel like dressing up and walk a casino with heels on.    There was live music performed by 2 incredible guys. The singer song need amazing and very classy.  Now back to the food. To start of I had grilled octopus and cheesy garlic bread. I was a bit skeptical about the octopus but it was really good. After that I had the mamas linguine and shrimp pasta. I ate a lot more that I'm reviewing. All I must say is if you come to Vegas and your in the mood for some home made Italian food come to this place.

2PgjH6DuVAXijw49wJ35mg.text: This review is for Sunday brunch. It starts at 10:30 in the morning. It goes until early afternoon. The price is around $35 per person, unless you include bottomless Mimosas or sangrias or Bellinis for an added $15 or bloody Mary's for an added $17 with the souvenir cup. We chose not to do that. There are a few stations around the restaurant. To begin with, there is a children's station with candy, pizza, fruit, and raw sliced vegetables. There is a meat section with apple sausage, thick bacon, and other choices. There is a soup and salad/antipasto section. There is a warm food section which has scrambled eggs, Sunday Alex, French toast, crepes with options for feelings, a penne carbonara dish, a tagliatelle dish, traditional Italian meatballs, and several other yummy choices. Finally there is a desert section. The tagliatelle and penne dishes were disappointing and very average. Other than that, everything was delicious. The breakfast is very good. The dessert table is pretty good and the best part is the bread pudding. The tiramisu was a let down for me which is surprising but I have had way better. The service is very good. The restaurant is nice. We did have to ask for a different table as we found out our table was way too close to the next table and it was hard to get out to get to the food stations. For the price, this place is reasonable. Other places are way more expensive. It is not a five star brunch, but it's a solid four star.  This is a good place for families and it is a great place for kids.

PEAt5PnvYAP1uFBDP5VNkA.text: His name speaks for its self the food is delicious the pasta is just to die for I've probably had almost every pasta and i can't say one is even bad. And the deserts are just as phenomenal. The price is great too i recommend all my clients to come here if they want amazing Italian affordable dinner.

Ah9TmVVYc5HP193o0_gyGQ.text: I would give more stars if I could... my family and I were in town for my cousins 21st b-day and we decided to eat here for dinner on night one. We had just arrived and hadn't eaten all day, so we were starving. They have skinny bread sticks in a cup on the middle of the table and we were so starving that we all shared them, I thought to myself I hope this isn't one of those restaurants that gives you tiny portions and these skinny bread sticks and charges an arm and a leg lol and than the bread came out. OMG!!! I was wrong and in complete heaven. I had the Lasagna (best I have ever tried) trust me I am a Lasagna expert! My fiance had the Chicken Parm (Best he and I have ever had) this place will NOT disappoint you. The service was excellent as well!!

2eoPMqPwEWIDcQcoZOZzig.text: Visited the Ristorante for my daughter's birthday. The food was excellent. I had the eggplant parmigiana. The ambiance was great. I really enjoyed the feel of the place. It was a bit loud, yet i enjoyed the hustle and bustle around me. It added to the character of the place. The only issue that I had was that our waiter was not very attentive. On arrival, we had him store a birthday cake that we bought at Carlo's Bakery so that we can sing happy birthday and have the cake for dessert. It took the a very long time to take out order and being our drinks. The food took even longer. He did not stop by our table to check on our refills or if we needed anything. We had to flag him down each time we needed something. It seemed like we were in the restaurant forever because the service was so slow. We could no longer wait on him so we asked for our cake and decided to bring it back to the hotel.  Other than that, I loved everything about the place and plan on visiting again.

bp7fNjW0ZRzYBZduznM6TQ.text: This was one of the best meals of my entire life. Molto bene! I wish I had room after dinner for dessert. Lol. The staff are very friendly, helpful and professional. Make sure you make a reservation in advance. The only issue we had was the air conditioning was blasting so it was very uncomfortable. Bring a coat just in case!

iKMM4DlzQiqvP0QENjx9DA.text: This my first time here and this is absolutely amazing. The meal the service everything was absolutely amazing. I will definitely be back... this food made me feel like I am home. Will definitely be coming back
