v70U_XzereiXwLflhMXGDQ.text: Arrived about 5 pm Wednesday to take advantage of happy hour pricing which runs 4:30-6:30. Small plate specials were $5.00 each, side salad for $7.00. About 8 choices total. Items we ordered were very good. Originally met by an unfriendly Hostess (I assume she's tired of answering "where do I sit for HH?") but our server was very nice, attentive and busy. Would like to revisit if in the area and order off menu but it is pricey.

cni_Dkmu7q0BWPE-BYfcTA.text: I love it when a place holds up to expectations. Not that I had anything to compare it to, other than fancy, but family style strip Italian places. I can't wait to return. I will take the long annoying walk from valet for it, it's that good.  My sister and I took my dad here for his 60'th birthday. We didn't want to be too fancy, but still wanted authentic Italian food. I am so glad we went out on a limb and tried Buddy V's!  They have a selection of appetizers, most named after a family member. Then for entrees they offer pasta, meatballs, veal, chicken, tons of Italian classics! As a family of 6 Italians at the table, I can tell you we were very satisfied. My dad wanted a veal picatta. They have chicken picatta, and veal angelo, so they didn't hesitate to make him the dish he wanted.  I went with a Sunday gravy dish, and it exceeded expectations. The appetizer platter of select meats and cheeses was phenomenal! Literally the best prosciutto and blue cheese I ever tasted.  We skipped on dessert because of course we went across the hall to Carlo's! I am sure it was the same cannolis, but it's the point!  This will be an Italian place I continue to come to over the years. It hit the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal picatta
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesey garlic bread
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the best I&#39;ve had

VFJc3nUGbpAdjd06AGrohw.text: After reading some positive reviews I wanted to try Buddy V's for some decent Italian food. It's a nice place with a nice view of the strip, with the neon lights flickering in the background. Here is what we had: - Grandmas Meatballs. These were pretty tast but our order was cold. I know they are not made to order  but you expect them to be warm. -Calamari Fritti. You basic calamari with 2 slivers of a banana pepper and grilled lemon. Another dish that came out cold. -Lisa V's Linguini and white clam sauce. This dish has the most balanced flavors and a decent amount of clams. This was the 3rd dish in a row that was cold. I would have mentioned it to our server but he wasn't around much. -My mother in laws shrimp scampi. The one dish that came out warm . It had pretty good flavors but not the best scampi I ever had. My mother in laws is much better!.  Where most authentic Italian restaurants might offer you freshly grated parm you had to ask for it and it took a few minutes to let the food get even colder. We also asked for some bread, mainly for the scampi since it had a nice broth build up in the bottom of the bowl. The waiter looked as if I was asking for ketchup at a steak house. Another dissapointing Italian meal in Las Vegas, my search continues!

dqGBIzFldFx4ac8_Zf1HRA.text: Came here for late drinks with a huge party so this is really about the bar service and menu.  They didn't have a huge cocktail menu but whatever they served was pretty darn good.  It's good to see that even the Cake Boss knows you gotta spice up your drinks to make people get sloshed (like we did for a big reunion party).  I had a berry mohjito that was absolutely kick ass.  The bartender was also very friendly and did a good job of making sure the drinks kept flowing.  The ambiance of this place is really nice and there's a good amount of space that can accommodate a large number of guests, making it a great meeting spot if you're part of a big party or celebration.

7dhOREvNhsD8AuP3EdDgHw.text: I chose Buddy V's for our 10 year anniversary reception dinner. We were a group of 12 people including two young kids and a preteen. When we arrived for our 6:30pm reservation, we were asked to go to the bar and wait for the table however once we all started to walk into the bar, the receptionist saw we had our two small kids with us and said that the kids could not be in the bar area. She told us to wait a few minutes and she would have the table rushed to get ready. A few minutes later it was ready, and we sat down at a nice large rectangular table near the open kitchen. At the time, I didn't think twice about the 'go to the bar' hand off but now that I am writing the review, I realize that this was mostly likely a way for them to get us to spend some additional money.  Anyway, we sat and we chose to do the family style dining. Everything tasted amazing, the food just kept coming out. I waitress told me the chefs knew how much to serve, but it was clearly too much. A shame really, as a lot of it was boxed up but we were all staying in hotels with no available space in the frig (all weight sensitive booze filled frigs). I would recommend order your own dishes, according to your group appetite, and then share it all. Every dish we had was excellent. Meatballs, lasagna, pasta, sea bass all excellent.

3KH6Ww7wpDECse3ShL2HoA.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. I think about this place and my mouth still waters. Yes, I agree it is a bit pricey, but what my fiance and I ended up doing is splitting the food. We went for dinner. We got the "My Wife's Eggplant Parm" for the appetizer and it was AMAZING. It is pretty filling. For the entree, we got Chicken Rigatoni "Alla Vodka" and it's just WOW. The food was filling and tasty. I will definitely go back to it. The food is rich and creamy. You don't get food like this anymore.

HYikTPYdjjyZvfGY74sAXg.text: The RJ did a review on this restaurant and I had no desire to visit until I read it.  We came for a late dinner on a Monday night. I didn't think we would need reservations. Walking down the hall, we were met with a huge line and I hoped it wasn't a dinner rush. I suddenly second guessed my decision to gamble on a walk in. We got closer and realized the crowd was for the bake shop located directly across the hall from the restaurant. Still, there was a good amount of people in front of the host stand. Turns out, Buddy and some of the guys were there! He was near the bar that was sectioned off for a private party, but it was still pretty cool to see them there none the less!  We were seated right away and really liked the decor and vibe of the place. Caleb was our server and he pretty much made our night. He offered bottled, sparkling, or tap water to start while we looked over the menu.  We started with Aunt Nina's Mozzarella en Carrozza as suggested by the RJ review and also by Caleb. Be sure to order this when you come! Think fried mozzarella, but done the way it should be. The outside provided a perfect crunch and the inside had all the ooey-gooey-ness you hope to find when you get fried mozzarella. It comes dressed with a tomato sauce and pesto sauce drizzle. After our first bite, we immediately contemplated ordering another. We held off as we planned on saving room for dessert.  My fiancee ordered one of the specialty cocktails as well. I don't remember which one..it had good flavor, but the alcohol was a little strong for her liking. Caleb was attentive enough to notice she wasn't drinking it and asked a couple times if she would like him to get her something else. Being in the service industry herself and not wanting to create more hassle, she declined and figured she would drink it with her entree. Caleb came over once more and took the glass and said he wanted to get her a glass of his favorite drink on the menu. He brought back a cocktail the was tequila based and had a sprig of rosemary. My fiancee doesn't care for tequila but I enjoyed the drink very much. We were very appreciative of Caleb's initiative to make our experience the best it could be.  My fiancee was torn between the chicken parm and the chicken rigatoni "alla vodka". Based on the descriptions and recommendations of our server, she went with the latter. I ordered the Agnolotti. The rigatoni was perfectly al dente and the sauce was very well prepared. The Agnolotti was so hearty from the flavorful meat filling and the brown butter sauce was a perfect compliment.   We somehow managed to save some room for dessert. My fiancee has a weakness for cannolis so her decision was made fairly quickly. I came in with the intention of ordering the XL lobster tail pastry. After the meal I just had, the "XL" part turned me off of that idea. I was torn between the birthday cake and the Nutella cake. I turned once more to Caleb for advice trusting he would once again deliver and not turn us astray. I ended up with the Nutella cake.  The cannoli was very flavorful and had a nice touch of cinnamon. It was served with a side of chocolate sauce. The Nutella cake was actually a lava cake. It was very moist which is often lost on such a dessert. It was served with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream which perfectly balanced the sweetness of the cake.  All in all it was a great experience. The dinner menu is a little bit smaller compared to other Italian restaurants, but if every item is executed well, who cares?? Be sure to ask for Caleb and be sure to order Aunt Nina's mozzarella. I am convinced that everything on the menu is delicious and we will definitely be returning to test that theory.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buddy! (The one facing the other way in the black shirt) best photo I could get :/

_aClM8MdqFWGId0Jr8ZSeA.text: We went for hh and the food and drinks were good. We had sangria that tasted great. We ordered mac and cheese, polenta squares, meatballs, and calamari all very tasty.. better than expected.

Uyqu5wWqT2YhnYtYODM5Lg.text: This food is like Ragu.  Really, I am losing trust in Vegas yelpers.  :P I got the special sauce with meat, the one with lamb, meatballs, sausage in sauce which came with some type of tube pasta.  The sauce was so bland.  Maybe add some oregano, basil, less tomato paste, I don't really know what it is.  The lamb was okay, the balls were okay, the sausage wasn't bad.  The pasta was nothing special.  Though if you go, hubby enjoyed the chicken parmesan, so give that a go.  We didn't stay for dessert, I wasn't feelin' it.  But the waitress was fantastic!  She was really polite and I noticed she had a rude customer and she kept smiling.  The drinks were okay, the bread was eh and the Cesar salad was heavily dressed, but wasn't bad.  I enjoyed the croutons in the salad.

hnKNL14M9GNJ_x5-4hmKkw.text: Amazing food and service!This restaurant has the best service by far and our server, Peter was simply outstanding! The GM Christina also was exceptional! My husband and I will definitely be back again!

5bKU4W31ZJzHvuLNj4Zqkg.text: I went here last month with my parents because my mom is a fan of their TV show. I love Italian but I wasn't sure how well I'd like this place. It turned out to be be the best meal my whole trip. The spaghetti with bolognese sauce was fantastic. Even better I did not have to ask for extra sauce on the side. I can't remember the last time I didn't do that.  The wait staff was extremely polite and helpful. Our food was out to us in almost no time at all. The waiter even told my mom about a location opening in the city my parents live in. Thedecor was nice without being stuffy. There were old family photos on the wall as well as the dessert menu. It was a great value. I would definitely come back.

a83gMm7y7ttXEtR8Ey-wUQ.text: I ate here for Restaurant Week Spring 2014 and again the following night from their regular menu. The portions here are nice and the different types of dishes on the menu make it hard to decide what to order. Our server, Perry is fantastic! He checked on us often and made sure everything was to our liking. Managers, Adam and Christopher also stopped by our table at different times to introduce themselves and make sure we were enjoying everything. I could tell that not just the managers care about the experience of every customer, but the servers and rest of the employees do too.  The cost for the RW week dinner was $30.14 per person which I found to be a very fair price considering what I got. I had the following:  Buddy's Caprese  Chicken Parm & Spaghetti  Zeppole  The next day I at the following:  The meal started out with warm bread and oil and balsamic. Nice start!  Buddy's Caprese ($16) - This salad is sooooo good! It had charred green beans, burrata, tomatoes and balsamic. The variety of tomatoes and different colors of them were nice. The tomatoes tasted so fresh. The burrata was fantastic! So soft and tasted great.   Buddy's Salumi and Cheese Board ($21) - Prosciutto, spicy capicola, genoa salami, gorgonzola, pecorino, grana padano, pickled veggies, olives and grilled bread arranged beautifully on a cheese board. The meats had such great flavor and the olives (they contain pits) had a nice garlic flavor to them. All the cheeses were good, but the gorgonzola was my favorite. It was creamy and easy to spread on the garlic toast. Delish!  Chicken Parm & Spaghetti ($23) - This is oven baked with provolone and mozzarella. I thought mine from the night before was soggy, so I asked that it be cooked longer this time and it was just perfect. Nice and crispy were is should be and the cheeses tasted good. The spaghetti on the side had marinara on it and parmesan and even though I barely had room, I couldn't let it go to waste! I did take half of my chicken parm home and it reheated nicely.   Lisa's Warm Nutella Cake ($9) - The cake was warm and baked perfectly. It also came with a scoop of salted caramel ice cream that was excellent.   Zeppole ($9) - These are served hot and coated in a spiced sugar. 2 dipping sauces accompany them, lemon raspberry jam and chocolate. The raspberry jam I wasn't crazy about, but the chocolate dipping sauce tasted great.   They also have a kid's menu as well a lunch menu that offers burgers and sandwiches. I am eager to come back and check some of the sandwiches out. I was very pleased with the service, food and atmosphere. The first night, we sat at a table near the bar area next to a large window that overlooks the strip. The next night we sat at a booth that was closer to the kitchen. Both are different experiences so try them both! They also can host events here.

ftWn8V-Tp6e4qO6pFGl3lQ.text: Very good food, pasta, lasagna, and appetizers. Nice views, cool atmosphere. Waitress a little impatient with dishes and order, and it was a little expensive for the money. But overall it's a safe option to eat great Italian food.

nx6zxYHNkwFcSVA29d0GsQ.text: Ate here for lunch with the Wife. We shared the smashed meatball sandwich. I started with a caesar salad and I do not know what they do to those croutons, but damn they are good. Head up on the salad, they are heavy with the anchovies. I did not mind it and almost licked my salad plate clean.   Then the meatball sub came out. The meatballs were awesome, the bread nice and crunchy, and the right amount of cheese(more mozzarella than ricotta).   We both enjoyed the meal and left full.   The waiter seemed like he was in pain, the way he was moving around, almost like he through he back out of something. So maybe that was why we did not seem to be in that great of a mood.   All and all a great meal and will try it again on another trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k1E7Us9I-HVwdLK843OdHA.text: This was our second time visiting Buddy V's.  The first time I came was about a year ago with several other couples on an adult trip.  We celebrated a friend's birthday and we had the most amazing experience and an extremely attentive waiter.  Our waiter completely took care of us with a flat rate per person and an unending amount of food, all of which was incredible.  We enjoyed it so much that we've been planning for the past year to come back and bring our children so they could experience it for themselves.  On Friday evening, April 7, 2017, we had the opportunity to bring our children, however the experience fell short of what we'd been long anticipating.  In town for a volleyball tournament, our first Vegas dinner was at Buddy V's.  We had a party of 8 and were celebrating birthdays for two of the girls in the group.  Upon initially sitting down at the table, I placed my purse on the back of the chair, as I do in every restaurant.  I pulled the chair out to sit down and as I sat, I fell completely on the floor as the chair had tipped over.  My purse is not THAT heavy, but rather the chairs are incredibly lightweight and not durable.  The waiter attempted to help me up but made no offer to get me ice or to notify management.  He did ask if I was okay, but due to the embarrassment and humiliation of falling down in front of other patrons, I quickly said yes, even though my elbow was hurting.  Leaving the restaurant that night my right elbow hurt.  Saturday morning I noticed my right elbow was bruised in addition to another bruise on the back of my left arm.  With regard to the meal, my daughters ordered off the Dinner Prix Fixe menu where you get a salad, an entree, and a dessert for $40.  The girls split their meal.  When the bill came, our girls had been charged for each item they ordered according to the a la carte menu pricing, instead of the Dinner Prix Fixe menu and it was added to the other party's ticket instead of our own.  The waiter also expressed displeasure with having to split the bill for the table into two separate tickets, which should not have been shared with us.  We asked the waiter toward the end of the meal if they could sing to the girls for their birthdays and he notified us that they don't sing.  He offered instead to bring each of the girls a birthday cannoli.  What he failed to mention, however is that there would be an additional charge.  I would not have minded had he mentioned that before bringing the desserts out but rather I discovered the additional charge when I got my bill.  Feeling dissatisfied with our overall experience, I decided on Saturday evening to write this Yelp review but wanted in all fairness to first call the restaurant and speak with the General Manager to let her know of our experience.  I called at approximately 6:30--not the most ideal time to call, which I acknowledged but I felt it needed to be addressed before anymore time had passed.  She told me that anytime a customer falls in the restaurant, she is to be notified.  She mentioned she was there on Friday evening when I fell and no one made mention of my fall to her.  She asked for my email address and told me that the next time we were in Vegas just to email her and she would take care of everything.  It is now Sunday at 11:15 a.m. and I've not received an email or phone call from her.  Incredibly disappointing, especially with all the hype I've given to Buddy V's in anticipation of this trip.  We will be looking for a new location for Italian cuisine on future visits to Vegas.

ppja7B1tqVcpo5y2VjXN7Q.text: The food is full of flavor. We decided to eat here after reading a few Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed. My husband had the Veal Marsala and I had the Chicken Parm. Both were delicious! We wish we would have split a dish though, because by the end of dinner we didn't have much room left for dessert, which look so dang good. Sad face. Next time we will definitely split a dish so that we can indulge in some yummy Italian dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

x14jM2cHWLf2ZVmYHyY0nQ.text: Wow! We wanted a place for Sunday Brunch that also offered bottomless drinks besides the standard champagne or mimosa. For an extra $15 each we had our choice of sangria, mimosas or pomegranate bellinis. Our waitress was wonderful and we certainly got our money's worth as our glasses were never empty.  The Buffet food ($35) was delicious too! There were several stations located throughout the main dining area. They included salads/appetizers, a carving station, kid's station and the dessert table. Entrees were lined up right next to the open kitchen and included Chicken Parm, meatballs, French Toast, scrambled eggs and a carbonara mac & cheese. Be sure not to miss the traditional mac & cheese at the kid's table which was the best we've ever tasted!! Also, get your protein fix with the delicious carved ham and chicken sausage.   The dessert table is, of course, not to be missed! We saw a line a mile long across the way at Carlos' Bakery on our way in and were looking forward to being able to sample some of those offerings. The cannolis and the bread pudding with fresh whipped cream and caramel sauce were the highlights at the Buffet. They also had big jars of bite-sized wrapped candy which made for a nice little treat later in our room at The Palazzo. Parking was a pain since Venetian/Palazzo are two of the last on the Strip who do not charge but Buddy's Sunday Brunch will definitely be on our repeat list for our next trip!

tTsRKSErEdqCkAun86dTfQ.text: Was extremely looking forward trying the Buddy V's, however, the food was extremely salty. I tried the fried calamari and was very awful and salty, the garlic bread was the best among all of my orders.  Waiters were friendly and professional but still we came for the food and it was not good.

A6DN5EFGsscji1A9hNrnzw.text: Fantastic food! I do Vegas once or twice a year, this place was great! Reasonable prices, good portions, good service (even though they were slammed), and the food was great! I went twice!

3PS5hZtf7I5TPKJRaAQAZQ.text: First time here at the Cake Boss' restaurant. Quiet Monday so the place was not crowded. We were seated tight away in a nice circular booth with a great view of the Wynn.  Our waitress was very helpful and went over the menu with us and brought us some hot bread while we made up our minds on what to order.  We ordered the Shrimp Scampi and the V. Family Sunday Gravy. Delicious! The best Italian food and good value for the money.  In addition to the restaurant, there is a bar and a bakery for take out desserts.  Overall a five star experience...

9GzKVvWMEiZ2-c_3QEy_Uw.text: Our party of 7 wanted to eat here after the NCAA tournament basketball games and we were seated sooner than promised on a busy Saturday and st patty's day evening   .  Service was outstanding and food is delicious!  We had pizza, chicken Parmesan( very tender and large serving)  , eggplant Parmesan ( crispy and perfect!)  and Sunday sauce with rigatoni  which my husband loved !   Focaccia bread with olive oil was a great starter.  Definitely recommend and will return next year!

l1AhMjUK_gfq-7mquV69PA.text: Horrible service. Bland food that was  ridiculously over priced for the portion size. The staff was extremely unaccommodating and unfriendly with a large group. They refused to split the check which was ridiculous. Overall it was a very disappointing experience for an establishment with Buddy's name on it. I wouldn't recommend it to friends and I will definitely not go back.

TNmUzrXGdyXU5jxxDE6Y_g.text: This isnt SPECTACULAR Italian food but it is pretty close. We went with two 70 year olds plus a 9 & 11 yr old and everyone liked their meal. This is one of the few restaurants on the strip that actually has real windows to the outside world (no fake ceiling here) which was refreshing. A little loud in the dining room - but then is Vegas known for being quiet?  We had: Salumi plate- salumi was terrific, cheeses better than average, olives OK Eggplant parm- on app menu & can be shared even though waitress said it was too small for sharing. Easily enough for 6 to share Scallopps- not very Italian, was it bacon? too over cooked but polenta & scallopps were perfect The lasagne was HUGE & very good. Kids chix parm was a large sized portion and excellent.  Chix marsala came with 3 pieces of chicken! Ceasar Salad was tastey but way over dressed. Very soggy. Ask for less dressing. With a bottle of wine & tip our meal for 6 was $300. Not an inexpensive night out so don't be misled by the lower $ on yelp.   Perfect if you have a mixed crowd & need something for everyone. Can't beat the Ventitian atmosphere either.

2CE20HL-yBiopFujk12otA.text: Not the greatest... Back to the basics! I was told the there was a steak/arugula salad as an option for dinner. I am not a fan of arugula, so I asked to have it on romaine (as they had a Caesar salad on the menu).  He asked the chef and the chef said no. I then said, can you just give me the Caesar salad and place a filet on it. He said sure. The entree came as follows... One plate with a filet (6oz) and one small bowl of Caesar salad. I asked what is this??? The server proceeded to tell me that the chef did not think a filet would go nicely on a Caesar. I told the server that I ordered the meal and not him. This really frustrates me. Cater to the customer, especially when this is a middle of the road restaurant. I also had (2) vodka and soda with a lime. The third one came with lemon. I asked why and where was my lemon. The server said that he did not want the drinks messed up? What?!? This place needs some flavor added to the meals, re-training of the staff and the chef to have a new attitude. I miss the First!!! The First was the restaurant prior.

isrc1fJX6QlT0DomuCyt3g.text: I had got the chicken rigatoni alla vodka and a kale salad. Of course it was a meal that is a little pricey because it is at a hotel/casino. Its hard to share these dishes because they are more individual portions. The kale sald was very flavorful and good. I enjoyed the texture of the kale and it was way to eat. I didnt really like the rigatoni. I think it was undercooked because the rigatoni was hard and very difficult to chew. The sauce was good though. Our waiter was cool to talk to and welcoming. Nice to try because i do like buddy from cake boss, but I'm not planning to come back.

iJGdvJZPXM-a3EabJdY8DA.text: I was in Vegas for a business trip and I remember a friend posting on FB what a wonderful dinner she had at Buddy V's a few months back so I checked it out on Yelp.  After viewing the pictures, I had my heart set on the lasagna but the chicken parm also looked good so I asked the waiter what he would recommend.  He said both were good but since I was by myself, I should have the chicken parm because the lasagna was large enough to serve two.  Since I was there in time for their pre-show prix-fix menu, and chicken parm was on that, I went with that selection.  The Caesar salad had a nice dressing, not overly powerful.  The chicken parm was good but not so delicious that it made me not wish that I tried to lasagna instead.  I went with the chocolate hazelnut cake (can't remember the exact name) and that was delicious.  I really wanted to try the lobster tail, but it was not one of the options on the prix fix, but unlike the entree, I was not disappointed that I didn't have what I walked in intending to order.  Although the chicken parm was a bit disappointing, it wasn't bad, just nothing special.  I would go back to try the lasagna.

TRMsoh13DfSMR_O8qgnMPQ.text: My husband & I dined here 11/17 to celebrate my bday. First off the place is difficult to find. They are so new the restaurant wasn't listed on the directory. We had a hard time finding it & even after asking an employee at palazzo they had no idea where it was! We called buddy v's and they directed us where to go. I was disappointed where they seated us, we had a seat facing the kitchen while the gorgeous view was behind us. I thought since we had a reservation& a bday to celebrate we should have been able to enjoy the view. The food definitely made up for the bad seat. My husband ordered the chicken Parmesan and I ordered chicken Marsala. Both were excellent, but the chicken Marsala was the best I've ever had. Service was awesome, no complaints there. Can't wait to go back!  Hopefully we'll have a better seat next time.

IaTHc0zy5T_npc3N-b6lnw.text: what an amazing dinner and unexpected surprise!!!  I took my wife here for her birthday thinking what else than the "Cake  Boss" can suffice for her birthday celebration.  We were seated and after a few minutes our server Georgio approached our table.  unbelievably upbeat and personable.  We were blown away by his descriptions of the menu items and took his recommendations wholeheartedly, and it was amazing.  His table service was incredible while making us laugh the WHOLE time!!  At the end he sang to my wife in Italian as she sat there ready to burst with tears of joy.  By far more memorable than her last birthday where we spent 3 times the amount and half the quality of food and service.  Thank you for the super memorable night Georgio and the Buddy V staff.....The Klausberg Family

j1j7iD9V0WNsDBPYAyrF5w.text: First thing I am going to say is" I am so sorry Buddy! I love you, I love your show! I love your charisma, but unfortunately the food at your Las Vegas restaurant is very disappointing. ;( We came here on Dec. 24 to celebrate my daughters first birthday, this i will give you though, your staff is excellent! Great customer service and great ambiance! They were very accommodating and on top of things, Kudos on that! We ordered various things from desserts to appetizers, the most disappointing item was the veal, it tasted funky and it had a weird smell to it, so i returned it and they graciously took it off my bill. the tastiest item we ordered was the linguini with clams, but it wasn't amazing, the other items like calamari, osso buco, grilled cheese, was ok, but not great as well. The lobster tail dessert was just horrible, it was as hard as a rock! I am sorry to say that my expectations were a bit higher, especially since the menu was a bit pricey, but even if the menu was more reasonably priced, the taste was just not exciting my palate. I mean overall it was a fun time, I don't regret celebrating my baby's first birthday there, hey at least the baby loved the free bread sticks, but would I come back? Maybe if somebody else paid, i would be willing to give it another shot, also keep in mind that they just opened this location, and every restaurant will always have its growing pains, that's why these reviews are necessary.

RLfywlB6jOPPSOOz6vJNtA.text: It was good but not blow-your-mind good. We had the calamari appetizer (great), caesar salad (ok, thought the croutons were weird), chicken parmesan (good, didn't care for the spaghetti that came with it, big portion), and shrimp scampi (wasn't a creamy type scampi, I liked the noodles but thought the shrimp were really salty), and the cannoli (good). Overall pretty tasty but not amaaaaazing.

y0R_T6_Yq_bZw0-67rQpFA.text: We were just there last night, and we found it to be great.  Our server was Caleb and he was wonderful, he helped explain everything about our dishes so we could make the best choices for us.  Food was great, service was great, I would go back in a heart beat.  The manager that night was Adam and he was very attentive and funny from the time we walked in to the time we left.  The two of them really made our visit go over the top.Food AAa  Service AAA

u3T2XFCwKrMh18PoWtxeUw.text: Hands down, best Italian restaurant I've experienced. Italian food is my absolute favorite food and I have been to A LOT of Italian restaurants, but Buddy V's is by far the best. Everything about it was authentic...even our server! He was awesome! I had the Sunday Gravy. It's a pasta with sauce full of different meats. Everything about it was amazing. The Lamb was the best and most tender I've ever tried and the Italian sausage was amazing. The food was so delicious that we passed all of our plates around the table so everyone in our group could try each dish. The Mac and Cheese and lasagna are to die for as well! This is definitely a restaurant worth trying during your trip to Vegas!

dgg2VrJaXWev9rKfo6k7wQ.text: Went there for a friends birthday last night. Atmosphere is really comfortable and welcoming. Good crowd and energy. The food 100% delivered. My challenge was with the service. They're new so I'm sure they're working out kinks. But the waiter was so spotty - wouldn't see him for 15-20 minutes at a time. Forgot requests, didnt bring any pens for the checks. Overall great experience and ill be back.

z8eOJS-qeaZ3WmG4lmpNHw.text: Kind of a disappointment, we had the chicken parm and the chicken was very dry! Everything else was very mediocre not worth the price, kinda expected more from buddy

8NQsOgi8z2DCwPoQqHmr1A.text: I brought my daughter here for her birthday lunch. She has a passion for cooking and baking and Buddy is her idol. She was so excited. We made a reservation for the 6 of us. When we showed up I was automatically taken back by the lack of personality and sheer lack of respect from the hostess. I must have high standards seems how I work in a restaurant but I certainly would expect more from a restaurant of its caliber and popularity. We had no greeting, no hello, no nothing. When we were seated we were handed menus and we knew it was a bit pricy before we went so that wasn't a shocker. It's the Las vegas strip and you're paying for the name. But honestly for the price and because of the name I really pictured a warm, friendly atmosphere. Not a cold environment where we were treated like we intruded and were not welcome. I felt so sad for my daughter. She was excited to go there for the amazing experience she thought she'd have and to have my 12 year old on her birthday feel so let down and disappointed about the service is very disheartening. She felt like she was personally let down by Buddy himself. The food was good but when you feel so unwelcome, it ruins the entire experience. Such a bummer that the Bake Shop service wasn't any better either. Can't say I'll be going back and I Definately don't think this is how Buddy would want people to feel walking into his restaurant because he is such a family guy who's welcoming and makes it feel like home.

r8GLw51OrnZSjy7nA3JYrA.text: Got to try Buddy V's today with some co-workers... The atmosphere is open and has a modern with a hint of old world vibe going on. I had the Chicken Parm, which was a huge portion and was a great dish I will enjoy for dinner too! The smashed meatball sub and the Salmon were ordered by the others in the party and all said they really enjoyed their dishes! We also got an order of the garlic bread which was the right amount of garlic and cheese! The service was good and nicely paced! Overall great experience, great food and I would recommend this place to others! Sadly we were too full to order dessert.

Q5Rzv19ZwgDXz7lVAiw70g.text: Delicious. The food was delicious. I had the Sunday sauce and it was amazing. Probably enough for two, so I had food waste guilt. The caesar was good, weird croutons, not really croutons but slightly crisped focaccia pieces... not so good. But the salad and dressing were great. But that sunday sauce......  yum.

SFYzPMpR-4gCSP-9ZL4Wbg.text: This restaurant was really great! I went with my family at 11:30 for brunch and was very satisfied with my experience. The restaurant is huge and the little details make it special. You can tell that it is inspired by Buddy's family which gives it a homey and comfortable feel. The coffee and food was fantastic as well as the service. We ordered the eggplant Parmesan, buddy's pizza, pasta carbonara, calamari, caprese, spaghetti and meatballs, and the tomato soup. Everything was so delicious and satisfying. The dessert menu was a nice touch as well because it is like a family photo album which I thought was a nice detail. Service was excellent and our wait staff was very attentive. We ordered in advance from Carlo's bakery and ate in in the restaurant along with our coffee. Overall this place was excellent and I will probably be back in the future.

1NL4ujs9zCJwGzwEcm8qqg.text: We had lunch there 11/10/14 while at the Venetian for a few things before we left town. The food was 4.5 stars, but the service was 3. Our actual server was a unfriendly dud. She was not pleasant and acted as if we and the table next to us was an annoyance. The servers' assistant however, was perfect! He was very polite and friendly, he took our drink order and kept them filled as well as boxed up my leftovers. The server took our food order (Hoboken Cheesesteaks - Delish!) but a runner brought our meals from the kitchen, she stood around leaning on the servers' station while we waited for our food and ate, then she turned around as if she were offended when I declined the dessert menu, then she literally dropped our check folio on the table. Yes, I realize they are famous for desserts with Carlo's Bakery across the hall but I had 2/3 of my meal boxed up because of the generous portions, we were stuffed! I hope they split the tips with the assistants because she was awful and the young man took very good care of us the entire meal, even my hubby commented several times about her demeanor and expressed that he wished the assistant was our actual server.

k-jzVBiFDJVQmnwWd47xPw.text: A dream come True after watching Carlo's Bakery on TV for years.  Service was good and food was amazing from the bread to the entree to dessert.  Had Madeline's Whole Wheat Penne and then Cannoli for dessert.  Just as good as I had hoped it would be.  Clever interior with rolling pins hanging and whisks on the light fixtures.  Family photo album in the dessert menu.  Great option for getting dessert since the bakery across the hall is always so busy.

u3GUyT-9QE7t8MT2BADHcA.text: The sea bass was very tasty. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was that all I had on the plate was the bass and an itty bitty salad....more of a decoration. A small vegetable garnish would have made the plate. I think the plate was $29. It was overpriced for what was received

ayPTWs91Wd-mCHckNnZ5ZQ.text: My husband & I just got back from our Vegas trip & before arriving, we had decided to go on a mission of finding the absolute best happy hour on the strip. We were staying at the Palazzo & let me tell you to not look any further!!!  The hostess enthusiastically escorted us to the sexy lounge area adjacent to the dining area. This is not your typical "sit at the bar" experience, it's more like a "VIP club experience" with stellar views of the strip. Our super friendly waitress made our experience memorable. The food is totally authentic grandma cooking & the prosecco is a delicious brut, not sweet. The drinks were $4 & the appetizers were $5.  Just as we couldn't drink or eat another bite, my husband was closing the tab & we quickly realized WTF are we doing turning down desert?? We are in the cake boss restaurant. As we were deciding between cannoli's or tiramisu, our adorable waitress suggested the Nutella cake with espresso ice cream. What a slice of heaven!!!!!!  As soon as the bubbly started to hit, an amazing jazz band ( The fabulous baker boys) arrived & blew us away with their great jazz/Italian hits. They were more than happy to accommodate requests. Dino, Frank, Bobby Darin, they know it!  The vibe reminded me of an old school Italian "Goodfellas" experience & because of that,  This is my new go to spot when I am in Vegas.  : ))

EulPe9Byfv4NxyJcDSK5WA.text: I went here for a small meal with my parents before departing for the airport.  Among us 3 we split a Buddy's pizza and a pasta carbonara.  Pizza was quite tasty and good, very flavorful, but I thought it was too salty for my full and complete enjoyment.  The pasta arrived in a small-lookin portion, for the price we were paying . . (~$23?).  It's not like I was expecting Cheesecake factory portions, but given the price, the pasta could have either used a bit more pizzaz or a larger serving size.  It was a very .. bland okayish dish overall, something I feel that I could have made at home.  Definitely a skippable dish.

VKthcu_HRRl-xwYH_y1Obg.text: Terrible customer service and food was bland.  They couldn't even make a chicken btl correctly, they "forgot" the slice of bread .  No apology fr the manger or chef.  I don't recommend this place

g9GNtrPfhuYAMWcB-AZUhA.text: Great food and atmosphere. My hubby and I had a delicious meal. if you go after 6 , it was crowded. We arrived at 500 so we avoided the crowd.  Service was ggreat!!!

RAIyCAaRnuW3VpXGldojrg.text: I'm a local and when friends came into town to attend a wedding (officiated by Elvis, no less) I suggested Buddy V's for a late lunch, even though I'd never been there before.   3pm is a perfect time to visit! It's slow in the restaurant, but the service is top-notch. They even had a specific menu for 3-5pm which was a-little-lunch-a-little-dinner. Here's what we chose and the consensus on each.  1. Meatball Sub and Fries: Good! large meatballs, delicious marinara and cheese, crusty bread, tasty fries that seemed almost batter dipped. I ate half so I'd have room for dessert.  2. Chicken Avocado Club Thingy: Good! The Caesar salad that came with it had what looked like croutons on top, but really they were a fried cube of something - we thought polenta - with a mildly lemony taste. Really added to the salad and surprised in a good way.  3. Margherita Pizza: Good! The person who ordered this enjoyed it a lot. I had a bite and thought it was good. One other person at our table thought it was horrible. Whatever. I'd still give it a solid B+.  4. The Meat and Cheese Board: Excellent! Our difficult-to-please patron got this and enjoyed it immensely. It had 4 kinds of Italian cold cuts, very fresh and very good, sliced thin. A few hunks of cheese (the Parmesan was to die for!) and some olives and other pickled veggies rounded it out. There was also some toasted bread.  Nobody finished any of their meal, and it was boxed and given back to us in a pretty bag with utensils and napkins for later.  We'd saved room for dessert and got the XL Lobster tail with fresh fruit, lemon sorbet, and the caramel creme brulee.  All of them were very, very good, but I've got to say that hands-down, that was the BEST creme brulee I've ever had. EVER. And I love creme brulee. And it wasn't even my dessert!  I'm not ashamed to say, I used my finger to get the last of the creme brulee out of the bowl. Well, maybe I'm a little ashamed.   The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that, while everything was good and fresh tasting; it lacked something. Very good, but not indistinguishable from other good Italian meals that I've had. I'd love to say "there's nothing out there like Buddy V's" but I can't. Yet.  I think I'll have to try again, just to make sure.

jo4T6yo7FwZSaKx3hbinWw.text: Pretty decent little restaurant and we will be back. That being said I think this place is entirely overhyped due to its celebrity association. We came here at a weird time and only had a choice of like 5 real food items. A bit oddd. I am sure my review will be better if I eat during a different time.

p6YykzBjkmwf0yTCsbwn2w.text: Where to start...  Location is awkward (end of a mostly deserted hallway) and was certainly of no help to former occupant FIRST Food and Bar.  Ambiance inside the restaurant itself is quite nice, although tables thrown in the hallway seem strange.  Outdoor seating is laughable and ill-conceived.  It's essentially at the top of an escalator leading up from Walgreens/down to the Strip so plenty of foot traffic will get to check-out your food.  The outdoor view is obstructed by a wall.  This area was never intended for restaurant seating and has emerged as a hot spot for Grand Canal Shoppes' employees to congregate and smoke.  Enjoy!  Service is slow and uninterested, perhaps even worse than FIRST.  Maybe the same staff?  A friend of mine said he and his date waited 15 minutes at an empty bar to be acknowledged, let alone served.  He was so aggravated they left without eating.  He's a bartender in the Venetian and understands the importance of timely service.  My experience wasn't much better.  My food was bland, we're talking CPK bland.  A penne dish was swimming in flavorless oil and assorted vegetables that looked to be left-over from some other dish and the chicken parm was just as bland.  Skipped dessert which was probably my mistake given that's the namesake's claim to fame.  Speaking of, who thought naming an Italian restaurant after a well-known PASTRY chef was a good idea?  I've already spent too much energy on this place.  Maybe it will improve and it seems others have had better experiences, but I won't give it a second go.

kaluWCIAKUbwRiu1K0yOEQ.text: My little sister watches a lot of Cake Boss, so we decided to come here and try Buddy's restaurant as a treat to her. The place is very family-friendly with a relaxed and cozy ambiance. Food is good, but I wouldn't say it was memorable. My family ordered different dishes (chicken parm, caesar salad, buddy's favorite pizza), and I got to try each of them. They were all good and the portion sizes are great, but they weren't rave-worthy.  The service, however, was fantastic. Our waiter was so friendly and helpful, and we really felt like the restaurant was a cozy, family-oriented establishment. The service really made the whole experience more enjoyable - probably enough to come back a second time when I'm in Vegas again with friends or family.

j0PJHXT_e2gNIky3C-gjow.text: Went for lunch - I would give it 3 1/2 stars.  The sauce was good, meatballs OK and service very good.  If I had to go back, I would, but I would not seek it out.

SVnKYTLBJg5m1CNFw0afPA.text: Terrible service from the time I called the restaurant to be put on hold for 10 minutes to  make reservations to the host who answered the phone and snottingly responded, "what's this regarding?"  really? Its regarding me eating at your restaurant and paying your paycheck.  Really snotty servers and hostesses. Due to possible poor management?  Buddy V would be ashamed.  Really disappointing because the food was great....

myu8aD0CkczUvzszy_Sghg.text: Had the lunch special. Chicken Parm was delicious. Also came with tomato basil soup. Prob one of the best versions I've ever had. Very tasty. Appetizer main course and dessert for under $22. Very good deal and worth the price.

DT4cGRnl_-bvN0-q301mGw.text: Bone in parm chop baby - that's where Vegas life starts to get really good.  Had dinner with a group of friends last Vegas trip - I was impressed! Solid classic Italian. Very good food - prices aren't bad for the Strip.  Dessert - I have been avoiding them lately but the Lobster Tail Thingy (really, I think that's what it's called) was awesome.  No lobster in it (not a bad thing) just simple, buttery shreds of puff pastry filled with a slightly sweetened pastry cream.  Simple, but very good.  Totally rocked in fact!

qjXN-zgPzKEil2YszHlMKg.text: Omg YUM. This place is so good. Perfectly cooked pasta. Fresh Cesar salads with homemade croutons. The decor is adorable and the service is wonderful. Not overly expensive either. Then you can go across the walkway and get homemade desserts from Carlos Bakery. I wish we had Buddy V's in So. Cal!

iQ3FFBZ5A81aHbREHwXzzg.text: My family and i went for brunch. The services and drinks were great, but the brunch menu was limited. There wasn't much of a variety.

gz5RWf4FvMBCUw7AtTmx6g.text: I've always been a huge fan of Buddy so my friend and I decided to try it out. Service was exceptional, and we were suprised at how fast we got our food. The chicken marsala was good, but nothing more special than the others I have tried. The real reason we came was for the lobster tail and cannoli. It was amazing and even better then we imagined.  A definite must try when visiting this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster tail dessert. A must try and the perfect size to split between two.
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custard filled cannolli with pistachios and chocolate chips :)

1kZMlxrLlHzGSjeb_DzGMg.text: Ordered the Cheese Ravioli and a side Caesar Salad. WOW! Definitely one of the best Caesar Salads I've ever had and the Cheese Ravioli was ridiculously amazing! My friend got a Salumi & Cheese board that was also amazing. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Vegas who wants a nice sit down meal at an upscale restaurant for average prices!

pRZopCu9z4BY-nWzu8CpiA.text: It's ok. Had lasagne and it was better than any franchise. But pieros is still the best Italian food and this didn't come close. My blend-wine was the best I've had since being on this trip out to Vegas. Service was decent. Piano player/singer was everything!!! Loved it :))

1H_zUdjAkgOABnnY0w68nA.text: Grand Openings are not always grand.  I get it.  Staff is nervous.  Owners are stressed, etc.  Today was the opening of Buddy V's in the Venetian.  My fellow event planners and I wanted to escape the 3200 person conference we were working on and go somewhere without strobe lights and bass, so we came here.  I will start with the good:   The decor here is great.  It takes up a corner spot on the Canal Shoppes level and you have a view of TI, the Trump and the strip.  It's rustic and familiar.  Red checkered napkins and rustic wood tables with interesting lighting fixtures.  My favorite was the children's artwork on the walls and the family photos everywhere (especially the dessert menu).  The food was GREAT.  I had the Orechiette with Italian Sausage.  It was flavorful and satisfying.  It had a perfect balance of al dente pasta, savory sausage and broccoli and tomatoes.  I wasn't starving, but I ate ALL of it. My team had the spaghetti and meatballs, the Burratta Salad and the meatballs.  They ALL raved without exception.  If it only depended on food and decor, i would have been more generous with my rating.   However, for me, service trumps it ALL.   The not so good: Service was odd.  We arrived for our noon reservation and the restaurant was probably 1/4 full.  There were PLENTY of open booths that would have accommodated us perfectly, but the hostess decided on putting us at a table in the back.  Once seated we waited a bit to be greeted by our server, but he eventually showed and took our order.  Once orders arrived, we all seemed to receive what belonged to someone else.  Then we had an unfortunate situation that involved our waiter spilling ice cold lemonade all over someone in our party.  It was a mistake and I felt terrible for him.  But the problem was he didn't seem prepared for the situation.  He remedied it as best he could by getting help, some towels and eventually a staff tshirt for our young group member (which lucky for him was not someone in an expensive business suit).  At the end of our lunch he announced his apologies and included that his manager was so sorry about the situation that he would be sending over a dessert for the table.  Now I don't know about you, but once I was at BJ's restaurant and there was a spill at our table that hit a few of our shoes and the manager raced over, paid for our dinner AND offered to pay for our shoes and dry cleaning!  and that was at a chain pizza place!  I'm going to take a wild guess and say that if someone spilled ice cold anything all over one of Buddy V's kids, he wouldn't be so keen on getting a hard puff pastry filled with custard as an apology.  While the spill was the waiter's mistake, management could have comped her lunch or at least her drink -- which he still charged us for!     Unfortuantely, this is what I will remember most about my time at Buddy V's.

jutT4ksomysEv0fHy5vg0Q.text: I have been here every time I visit Vegas because we like it that much. The food is your typical italian food, but so much better tasting. I always get the three course meal they offer for $40 a person. It gives you some pretty good options for the appetizer, main dish, and dessert. The chicken parm is by far my favorite. The portion sizes are relatively large too which is great! Also, the service was fantastic as usual and we are never forgotten for too long. While it can be a pricey meal it is worth the food and restaurant setting. I would recommend trying this place on your visit to Vegas.

4QriHSlbdZ9oe_LWXMfobg.text: Took my chic here last night for her birthday because she heard Buddy on 98.5 and asked if we could go, so off we went. I have been to the best places in Vegas and some are over hyped and some under hyped. I went into Buddy V's not really thinking anything was gonna be all that amazing but I was wrong on a few things.  One, The mussels they have are the best mussels I have ever eaten in my life. The mussels were so good I ordered another order after dessert.  Two, The surf and turf I ordered was cooked to perfection.  Three, The XL Lobster dessert is probably one of the most amazing things on this planet.  I love to watch new restaurants as they open just to see who really has their shit together and I think Buddy V's did a pretty good job on their opening. Staff was nervous and If I worked there I would be too. Not only is it opening day but the owner, owners business partners and the owners parents are all there.   We were greeted by Adam Margolies who is the asst G.M. and it was really great to talk to a guy who is really into the property enough to where he had an answer for every question. I know to people reading this that may not seem like much but being from Vegas it is really hard to find knowledgeable people that know things even at the places were they work. We asked him how the XL lobster is made, where the cuts of beef were farmed from, if the scallops are flown in or driven, if the broccoli is organic, if the chocolate chips in the Gelato was made from scratch or store bought.  We asked all these questions and he answered all of them with no hesitation.   The decor is 10/10 for the type of restaurant it is and I think it will do well here in Las Vegas. I love eating at places that don't feel stuffy as I don't believe you should ever feel uncomfortable anywhere in Las Vegas.  Welcome to Vegas Buddy V!! Your gonna do great here and we are glad you chose Vegas to serve. Gonna get more mussels now !

cZTuiK1XJOkpy1AapB7fzg.text: Decent place, loved the Alfredo Pasta. Not sure why I assumed this was Patio Dining. Staff is nice and responsive. They even adjusted my billing so that it can be billed to the room at The Palazzo which can earn my points towards my status. We really wanted to like the Tiramisu but it can be better.  Fine option if you are looking to spend a lazy day not doing much.

dBb-qD_cXxqX7s2oDkmp7g.text: We just finished doing some engagement photos at Venetian, and decided we wanted to try some Italian nearby. Buddy V's had good reviews, so why not?  On one hand, we were incredibly impressed with the quality of the food. We're accustomed to plain-jane low-budget Italian restaurants (that many people scoff at even calling Italian) like Olive Garden. Buddy V's was accommodating and everything we tried was exquisite. They even made a custom Alfredo sauce for me that they don't have on their current menu.  I had the eggplant parmesan with added Alfredo, as well as the cheesy garlic bread and a caesar salad. The eggplant was perfectly crispy on the outside and juicy and full on the inside. And the Alfredo was to die for, especially since I had been craving it so bad. And their caesar salad had croutons made of polenta! Definitely never had that before! It reminded us of tofu at first, but we knew it couldn't be. So good! The fiance also was in love with his lasagna but had devoured way too much bread for sure beforehand, and whined that he couldn't finish the size. Haha.   The downsides of this place is that it was busy, so we ended up having to ask for our own complimentary bread and balsamic/olive oil dip that only about half the restaurant was getting. Also we got sat next to this horrendous couple that were so weird and probably bored with their lives that they sat there discussing and making fun of us like we wouldn't be able to see and hear them. Not really Buddy V's fault, but it dampened my experience.  If I'm remembering right,  they have 7-days-a-week happy hour. That's always a plus for any restaurant!

Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m1HACZ22Zd2NPVu92pSpzw.text: Came for my sister birthday and it didn't disappoint!! We are not huge good people while in Vegas, it slows us down haha! We knew we wanted some Italian. I got the chicken parm dish and it was hands down the best I've had. For my drink I got the cake boss, very delicious. Friends and fast staff as well

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kYUva8-DFwFSA5JRYtMGQA.text: This is our favorite place to eat when we come to Las Vegas,  the food is always incredible and we are never disappointed. Our service today was exceptional, Matt and Chris took great care of us...highly recommend this restaurant!

dW6eKXdsDwpJgcLIAg_8WQ.text: Came in for lunch today with my fiance and all I have to say is WOW! The Best Italian food we have ever experienced! Every dish we ordered was fresh and completely blew us away. Our waiter was just as awesome, great service! Thank you David! Def would give them more than 5 stars if I could! This is a must if your planning to eat at the strip! Great atmosphere, great service, amazing food.. what more could you want!

uWceRYGdt0eE1m6LAXBB3A.text: Customer service was great and we went at about 2:30 PM on a Tuesday so we were seated very quickly. The fresh bread with the vinegar and oil was amazing and they freshly make their own croutons on their salad and my goodness, Ive never tasted anything like it. It was soft and I still can't pinpoint what they had Steph to wet but it was great. We both ordered the Parmesan chicken and it was by far one of the best Italian dishes that I've tasted. Highly recommended and definitely will eat there again when I go back to Vegas!

gJSF0U5gHzjw2CxqCbQ_fA.text: There is no 3.5 so I give this place a 4. I know this is going to be an unpopular opinion but hey its my review. Food was good but not great. Nothing special or different from any other Italian place you will ever go to. You are paying for the name. I have had a chicken parm equally as good in college in New York no joke. No Italian dish is worth $25 plus when your mom can kill that dish any given Sunday.

T9_lwPR2HUAKbapgE4iJww.text: Ordered the clam and linguine, cheesy garlic bread, carbonara pasta, and salad. Good service, nice ambience, and even better food. Had only one night to spend in Vegas for a quick celebratory dinner and this place did not disappoint. Very happy with my experience. Also free parking at the Venetian hotel. Thanks Buddy!

zFusQLkSAZQSQqbUtIntxA.text: Came to Vegas to visit. Never really heard about this place, it just showed up on my Yelp search place. The food is as amazing as the photos on here! I am extremely happy I chose this place for early lunch. We had the lasagna, rigatoni, chicken blt (i think), a clam pasta, mac n cheese, and cheese bread. This place did NOT disappoint at all! The hostess and waitresses were so mind and attentive! Our cups were constantly being refilled as well, we never had to ask for more of anything! I would definately recommend this place. The bakery across is just as amazing. The birthday vanilla cake and cannoli were amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All of it was amazing

ITPmaeoFrZHhiW1SLvvfmg.text: The best restaurant that we tried in Vegas! Definitely a must go. Food was wonderful, service was great and prices were good. We were blown away by the flavors! We did lunch to make it more affordable. But compared to other restaurants in the areas...the price point was good and taste superior!

CDxz19sV0rK8TJsefow0gw.text: Agree with the reviews, we really enjoyed dinner here. The caprese salad is out of this world delicious! I ordered the bucatini carbonara and my husband got the spaghetti bolognese. Both were tasty. We ended the meal with a tiramisu. I loved the casual atmosphere of this place. Would recommend for a nice casual meal.

t_dDiUte6JzHMq6A_OnRLw.text: As if the Venetian needed another reason for people to stop by. The Italian rooms in Las Vegas are usually top notch. But Buddy V's does classic Italian with the pride of an Italian artisan. Had the Veal Marsala and made this Italian cuisine lover happy. Cooked impeccable with the flavor True Italian lovers love. The shrimp scampi capalini was cooked spot on with large fresh shrimp, chunks of garlic, and beautiful creamy sauce... top notch spot.

y5DEnC6DANYmXmwznAWN6A.text: This place is a MUST TRY!!!! Between the beautiful ambiance, the attentive staff, live entertainment, and of course the melt in your mouth food! If I could give more stars I would but if you are in the area I highly recommend stop

o6x4Ubk9hopPJgLSxVC6TA.text: The shrimps are huge and the pasta is refreshing. The food leaves you full but not heavy.

076nk5bzn64rRf5vEVhSHg.text: I wish I could give this place five stars! First off, the service is 100%. Our waitress was very attentive and came by multiple times to ask how things were and if she could bring us anything at the moment. The food, however, was subpar. I ordered the class spaghetti with meatballs (on Yelp, the meatballs seem to be a highly rated item). The texture of the meatballs was strange. They were not soft and didn't fall apart easily as you bit into it, how I usually imagine good meatballs to be. My friend ordered the chicken Parmesan. The portion of chicken was HUGE, but again nothing special. My friend thought it was ok. The food reminded us of what you would get at Bucca di Beppo or Olive Garden, that exact quality. All in all, I definitely appreciated the great service but giving this 3 stars solely because of the food :(

RJ6z_RaAxHPyShgpmNdZSA.text: This was one of the best meals we have had in a long time.  We had the cheese bread appetizer and pizza and spaghetti for the main course.  Food was excellent and the atmosphere was great.  Our Waiter, Mourad, was on his game.  He made sure everything was ok and continued to check on us throughout our meal, including dessert. Very pleasant experience and will definitely recommend and return to this restaurant!

hzzp5ry-vGq72JI2pToynQ.text: Meh. The food (once we actually got it) wasn't bad. It just took a long time. We had to ask for extra bread in order to keep the kid satisfied because it took a while to get our food. When they first served us we each only got one small square of foccasia. We sat for a while just looking out the window at the lights and traffic.   I guess we just expected more for what we spent.   Check the box. We probably won't need to go back.

pCXiyDzr2pniDtre0wEdgg.text: Truly a gem.   Great service, great food.  Not expensive.  We ate there twice in our stay (once for lunch, once for dinner).  I ordered the scallops, the waiter asked "do I want shrimp too?"   They added 5 big shrimp -- I didn't ask the price before and didn't see it on the menu -- and wondered how much they'd add -- it was only $8 on a $32 entree.  When we ate supper there, they were very busy.  Lunch was empty.  Everything we had was really good -- when we go to Vegas again, we'll stop in.

boshn3ZhBRcSIvQ1FvpPGw.text: That lasagna is amazing and enough for 3 people.  I ate a third of it and could not eat anymore.  The flavors were great and the portion size was even better.  I also had the shrimp pasta dish that was a party in my mouth.  The service was excellent and the location in a great hotel.  I would come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nonna &#39;s Lasagna Al Forno
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Mother in Law &#39;s Capellini Shrimp Scampi

6gZoSvU24uT8mUkgBGE1lQ.text: The $20.18 lunch for Restaurant Week drew us in on a Sunday morning. We got seated right away and was pleasantly surprised to hear live music (Sinatra songs) and a wide variety of appetizing brunch stuff . I ordered off of the restaurant week menu : Caesar salad, tasty and good size chicken parmigiana with spaghetti and cannoli. My husband made a mad dash to the wonderful brunch spread ($34.95). Picture of brunch selections is attached to this review. It was a perfect Sunday morning for us: live, relaxing music, wonderful brunch and service by Freddy and busser Christian was excellent! Mac and cheese carbonara, sausages and bread selection was top notch and lastly the tiramisu is amazing. We highly recommend and give 5 Stars all the way !

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Highly recommended: Sunday brunch
Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $34.95 brunch buffet

oo_QsHDXWaTwQ6kfvOFItQ.text: For Strip dining this is VERY good and very good price point too!     They offer a lunch special menu with Gr8 selections 3 courses $22.00 soup/salad, main & dessert, not including drinks      Started with the Caesar salad, which is killer~ the croutons are deep fried corn meal & the creamy dressing is not over whelmed by anchovies . My gf had a spinach salad beautifully presented w/ red cherry tomatoes, red onions, grated parmesan.      Main courses ~ mine was the spaghetti Bolognese, flipping fantastic!!!!! The sauce or gravy depending where your from is "Outta Site!" My gf had the salmon generous portion (cooked to perfection) over sauteed veggies, again both were beautiful to look at and tasted equally DEEEELISH!!!!!!    Dessert ~ I had tiramisu, excellent with a cappuccino & my gf has the raspberry sorbet with coffee .    All in all just a great stop and quite good for the kiddos too!!!

zidWBvOCNoz5uyFWh6ChaA.text: The sparkling water is $10. They don't even tell you that when pouring it. I wish they would just tell you that. Food was good a little flavorless.

ZlPp7K56QJa7oo2zxunxUw.text: All started out well. After our salads the kitchen then fell apart. We waited and waited and waited. All the other tables were served. Then we asked when we would get out dinner. Oops. Sorry. Few more minutes. About 10 min later we get the food. All ok not great. Cold pasta probably waited while chicken was cooked. By now all we want to do is leave. No offer to comp. No we're sorry we sucked how about a dessert. Nothing. Waiter hovered while we filled out a comment card. Manager disappeared. Found a hostess who was giving a free dessert to another table for their inconvenience. All in all. Don't go there not worth it. Price high. Value low. Food mediocre. Service terrible. Will not return and will tell all to avoid. For a much better meal go to Viva Las Arepas!

yMCd6gdqniN3qWdCE9yjPg.text: BEST Italian restaurant in Vegas. Quality yummy food, excellent and friendly customer service.

bgp_24vvlZTV0D9iWnGQtg.text: Maybe I expected a lot more because of the name behind it. I Have to admit I was pretty excited to try this place out and not that I was disappointed but more so I wasn't wowed or left with a "can't wait to come back" feeling. A couple friends were in town and like any vegas visitor wanted to try something new. We came for Sunday brunch and instead of ordering off the regular menu they offer a Sunday brunch buffet. Though the selection was more than enough to fill me up, don't expect a lot of food (the idea most might get when thinking of a vegas buffet).  The food was ok. Nothing spectacular but very well presented. First time ever seeing dragonfruit and lychees (served in original shell and "hair") in a restaurant so that was new for me. Disappointment #1 for the price you are kind of better off checking out one of the other casino buffets.  The restaurant itself was cute, family like and had a really open feeling. Love the concept of the open kitchen!   As for service, this would be disappointment #2. Our server sold us the idea of unlimited drinks for an upgrade (of course) but the fact we only saw him 2 times our entire visit, limited the drinks we could order. We had to ask our busser on 3 different occasions for more water. Plus side though the bloody mary bar was pretty neat, lots of hot sauce options, vegetables and additions to choose from...good touch! We could tell they were a bit short handed since we only saw 3 servers (from what we could tell) covering the entire floor and they were fairly busy.  So we cut him some slack because he was very nice.   Hostess staff was a little rude and not very personable but our interaction with them was short enough to make it tolerable.   We wanted to visit the bakery but the line was so long we decided against it. I'm a local so not sure I would visit again unless visitors from out of town really want to go, but even then I might suggest another spot.

TxTt77tpayT_awwRC1Pc0g.text: We went to Buddy's on a Thursday for dinner there was a group of about 10 of us the wait was about an hour and a half(which I understand with a large group) to be seated and another hour just to get our food out. I understand it's Vegas and all but the experience was not great especially when all we ordered was pasta it shouldn't have taken that long to get our food out. We overall spent 3 hours to be seated, get our food, and eat.  The restaurant wasn't very busy to have waited that long either. The food was fine but I didn't think it was worth it for the price.

E5s3nBife-xi_GVAn2HLlw.text: Nice place, but the crowd is a bit too casual and the food a bit lacking for a restaurant that costs two people $150 total, including two drinks each.  $22 ravioli - nothing to write home about.  Empty plates and glasses collected on our table before anyone finally decided to pick them up toward the very end of our meal.  Kids leaving their table and running around the place -- not the fault of the establishment, but not the way I prefer to dine.  I'm sure there are a lot better places to spend $150 for a meal in Vegas. If it were less expensive I would have given it three stars.

l7J8OKt9tNMyBd73Xxoisw.text: Great food! Love it. From apps to main dishes. Very tasty food. Got their grilled cheesy bread, pizza and spaghetti. All great.

d2YjDrLmcyR9pWyg6l7oyw.text: We just held our holiday office party here. Prior to the party, they called and upgraded our dining area free of charge. The food and service was amazing! We had a party of 30 and everything flowed so smoothly as far as getting food and drinks in a timely manner. Food is served family style and the staff even gave those with food allergies or dietary restrictions their own plates at no additional cost.

ir9q2Uh3mGswKUQanJN_MQ.text: Everything was amazing I was kind of surprised! Expensive but everything in Vegas is... best calamari ever so perfect! Tiramisu and eggplant were delicious as well!

XuKEze7NDyY3hT-cdmheJQ.text: I recommend stopping here if you want some Italian, in Las Vegas. It's located by the Shops in the Venetian.  We both got the Prix Fixe and it was so good! It seemed a little pricey at $40/person, but for what you get, it's better deal than you would think at first glance.   The complimentary bread they bring for you to dip in oil & vinegar is as a type of a focaccia, so delicious. I don't care for Balsamic vinegar, so the waitress kindly brought some marinara for me, and that sauce was perfect. I chose the panzanella side salad, which was so huge and packed with goodness. They didn't just throw some salad mix on a plate! Very fresh, croutons made in-house and packed with flavor. The cheese, the tossed-in dressing, all in perfect proportion to the greens. Also noted that they halved the grape tomatoes, which is a sign to me that they pay attention to detail. (I love the taste, but hate biting into a whole grape tomato and having it burst.)   As entree, I had the Bucatini Carbonara, which is a dish I am super picky about, and it was the best I've ever had! Pasta was perfect and I could have easily saved half, if I was a little less hungry, or it was less delicious. As it was, there was such a generous portion, I didn't finish it.   My guy had Orecchiette and Italian Sausage. It looked lovely, and had some red peppers, broccolini, roasted tomatoes, and the spicy Italian sausage. Really, all the flavors he loves. I tried a bite, and it was fantastic.   The wine  Paolo Scovino Dolcetta d'Alba 2013- was great pairing with pasta, just enough sweet and mild acidity and richness to be a wonderful accompaniment to the meal. It's a variety I hadn't tried before, so I have a new love.   Tiramisu was beautiful and flavorful, not too much of any of the ingredients, and a couple of lady fingers on the side. My guy finished his cannoli in about 3 minutes, as well, so I'm assuming he liked it.   All in all, Excellent! We were stuffed and happy, and the service was attentive and friendly.

oCabFSrg171O8DPpkiLW1Q.text: Buddy V's....horrible service, good food. If you want to wait 1 1/2 hours and watch everyone who comes in after you get their drinks, food , and check before you get bread, then this is your place. The hostess made us wait to be seated after we had a reservation, the restaurant is understaffed and literally everyone kept pointing the finger of accountability towards someone else as to why we waited so long to be served. This place is a joke. Who cares if the food is good if you have to wait so long. Plenty of other places to dine.

v5EDikAOzAKsWAdY7Gqzdg.text: Amazing Italian restaurant with a great view! Huge serving sizes, definitely think about sharing. Reasonably priced for what you get. I ordered the spaghetti with pomodoro sauce and started with a caprese salad, both really great. Highly recommend the lasagna and the chicken Parmesan. Really you can't go wrong with anything on the menu! I think it's even better food than Lavo Italian.   Our server was beyond awesome! Good service in Vegas is really hard to come by.

XoN1UzfOLi1kb9_r8qsmYw.text: Today I ordered the Sunday gravy. Truthfully if my mother had made this type of food for my father it would've been Monday divorce. I started with a Caesar salad. Croutons on the Caesar salad were warm polenta croutons. Yuk! The rigatoni was overcooked bag rigatoni. The meat was over done. The sauce had zero flavor. Notably the pasta and the meat had two different sauces. That seems kind of strange since typically you would use the meat sauce on top of the pasta. I didn't stay for dessert got my check and went home.

D_g1m8IDFdgMF0TQbc0p2g.text: We had a very nice family dinner with my parents at Buddy V's restaurant. We shared the appetizers family style - Cesar salad with yummy polenta croutons, calamari fritti and scrumptioius Grandma's meatballs.    We had the following entrees: 1) Linguine with clams 2) Mediterranean sea bass 3) Grilled salmon 4) Chicken Parm 5) Classic cheese pizza  For dessert, we had the butterscotch creme brulee with vanilla mascarpone cream, pecan nib shortbread and the apple pie with caramel cinnamon apples, oatmeal & raisin crubmle and vanilla ice cream. The dessert menu was in a mini photo album with shared memories of Buddy growing up and his family. Overall it was delicious authentic Italian food, fresh pasta and flavorful meatballs, chicken and seafood. The service was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Buddy V's Ristorante - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious authentic Italian food at Buddy V&#39;s.

OwUcHmD_tYmOEvkDd-xxIw.text: I do not like being cheated out of my money, and sadly, guys, that's exactly what they did to me here. This is the first time I have stopped by in years after claiming they have the best tiramisu. It was so HUGE. And now.....it comes in a mini mason jar.   I understand businesses have to make money, but some dishes and desserts have become painfully small and remained at expensive prices, which is just plain sad.   Furthermore, they try to trick you into paying for water now. Instead of offering tap water like they used to, they get rid of the option in their speech.  --SO if you DON'T want to pay for nestle water, and they say "Still or Sparkling?"...SAY TAP. Don't pay for water unless you really want to. Because that is just a damn waste of $10 folks.   They never used to trick me before, so I was totally not expecting this. I can't even rate them like I normally do, because I was so mad.   The big points are:  1) Their food is just average, so just skip it.  2) The dessert is the better part of the meal, so if you want some, just go to Carlo's Bakery.  3) They do have really good service, but they tricked me, so that was a little messed up since they didn't used to do that. It's totally what you expect restaurants that serve $80 per head to do. If you're going to do that, can't you at least do it during the more expensive dinner time?  I'm pretty mad, so it'll be a while when I come back, if ever.

-K_z27dojL7W8t5LmApfhg.text: My wife and I were looking for a reasonable Italian restaurant on the strip. After seeing great reviews for Buddy V's, we decided to gamble on the cake boss and see how his restaurant was. Wow, we both were blown away at how great this place is. The service was on point, they refilled our water as soon as the glass was half empty. The food was so good and satisfying. Big portions and quality ingredients for a great price. We both got the prefix menu. The Caesar salad was great, the warm croutons were a hit with us. The chicken parm and pasta carbonara were fantastic. We ended our meal with the cannoli and tiramisu. Blew our minds! Such an unexpected surprise in Vegas. Will definitely be coming back next time we are in town!

26Q3oTHq-VI8m-oqKT5ZBA.text: We were quickly seated for lunch. Prices were average for Vegas, but the food was so delicious I would have paid more. Eggplant parm amazing! Salad and carbonara what dreams are made of. The waitstaff was very attentive, great meal

j_RzuTh_cNPf-AccHiiXbQ.text: Had an early dinner here last weekend. The service was outstanding and the good was good too. The Focaccia bread they serve for their bread service was moist and flavorful. I took our server's suggestion and ordered the Chicken Parm dinner. The pasta was good but not great. The chicken however was cooked perfectly. I would certainly recommend this spot to anyone looking for a new place for Italian in Vegas.

KZ8VwyTeI-4GZqyctBXslQ.text: We went to eat at Buddy V's Ristorante, not knowing what to expect, neither my husband or I really follow his show. However, we were starving and figured since it was newer to Vegas it was worth a try...  Absolutely delicious!!!! Everything we ordered was really good. The brick oven pizza was the best I ever had! We could tell that only the freshest and best ingredients were used.   I liked the interior as well, it was modern looking but felt also had an old world Italian feel to it!
