0ACPrymaMRjRD_XG8jebGA.text: Came here for lunch since we didnt want to spend too much on a buffet. Food was not impressive. Portions are just ok and definitely pricey.  Make sure you ask for tap water so they dont charge you more than $10 on bottled water. Would not go back.

Zs_j0hFsr5_Bw83qf5UAbw.text: Really good Italian food. My kids loved it especially the view of the city we got. We waited for almost an hour for our table but that's our fault for not making reservations. Waiter was very kind but didn't come as much as I'd like. I kept running out of beer and would have gotten more than two if he had came by more. Their grilled octopus was great and the Sunday gravy was pretty good.

RG2fBtfrdgi-gEAUUraYzw.text: The smashed meatball sub was amazing and the rosemary seasoning on the fries was delicious. Loved the vibe in there too!   I noticed that our server gave the table beside us different attention. He asked them if they had been there before and when they replied no, he gave them an intro speech of sorts, describing who Buddy is and how the restaurant came about. I was a little disappointed that he didn't bother sharing that with us. I'd suggest that it was because  we looked like tourists, but you know...they ARE located on the strip!  I will definitely go back for dessert. They looked phenomenal.

3SdmsVILtPdpXFUql1TDOg.text: Excellent service, and food. Had a taste for spaghetti and meatballs - best I've ever had. Water glass never went below half, and I drink a lot...lol. Had a melon blossom drink, not a big drinker but that was very good as well. Highly recommend.

srVxZR-gR5S-6vFN7jyLdw.text: I am still in love with Buddy V's.  I have been to this restaurant several times, and EVERY single time the service is perfect, and the food is paramount.  I always get the Caesar Salad, I just can't get enough of the polenta croutons. I tried the Steak Pizzaiolo, and IT WAS PHENOMENAL!! The steak was cooked perfectly, the sauce had a delicious Cacciatore flavor, and the cheesy polenta it came with was supreme. For dessert I tried the Butterscotch Creme Brulee (it was the only one I hadn't tried yet) it's my new favorite dessert.  When you come to Vegas and your craving Italian try Buddy V's, you won't be disappointed.

1w5acnf9oBNx6dhHBCcDAw.text: I ordered from the lunch specials and chose the tomato bisque, chicken parmesan and tiramisu. All dishes were phenomenal and the service was fast. The chicken parm dish was really filling so I took some to go and ate it as a later lunch.

ovXUQzNNIvFNU65AmuCsZw.text: It was a wonderful experience overall, the service was great, the view was beautiful. The only thing I didn't like was that the menu was very limited and the food was kind of too salty, but overall it was not disgusting or anything just okay.

ouzJOBQrXZCzVeiZo2g52Q.text: Great place.  Our server was very nice and the busgirl was nice as well.  They were very attentive, no attitude and the food was good and came out quick (they were very busy too) I had the calamari which tasted very fresh, meatballs and parmesan chicken .  Most servers here in vegas are consistently nice compared to our area(md) .

0gsBo3hLsp_07MqQgC9u9A.text: This was the best food we had in Las Vegas the whole 8 days we were there!  My husband got the lasagna and I got the spaghetti with marinara sauce.  It was all awesome and we ate it all.  Sweet tea was great!  Serving staff left a carafe of it at the table for us.  We will definitely be back next time we're in town.

yggEI0UI25qJdqv1T1bFrQ.text: I had one of the best restaurant experiences at Buddy's! I was there for my mom's 60th birthday, and we had our whole family. They were able to accommodate us in a beautiful, comfortable table, the service was amazing, and they were so welcoming. Aside from that, the food was fabulous! As an Italian family, we're generally realty picky when it comes to Italian food. I was pleasantly surprised that the food was so beautiful and delicious. Everyone enjoyed their meal, and it's a place I would definitely visit again!

UgVxw9clvYrMejPuOoYOyw.text: I give this place a two star because of the following   1- this message is to the manager: there are ridiculously less amount of staff working in the restaurant,  i was waiting forever to get the check and i had to literally ask for everything. My water was not getting refilled and easily 30 min of our time got wasted for lack of management.  If you want customers to come back hire more staff and be professional, you also impact the poor staff by getting less tip and more work load.  When someone comes to your restaurant expects great experience  2- the food was good but there was so much fat in the chicken...   The reason i give it a two star is because of friendly staff. I wont go back to this restaurant again.

DGI6WRCKHZCHIhJz-0LKpA.text: This place is excellent!!! Last night I was craving Italian food and noticed this restaurant across the street from my hotel. I'm so glad we found it. The food was great and the service was awesome.

pfjIIEZb1Gvizm3woiToWA.text: Wow!!  I am so happy we decided to try Buddy's.  I had a feeling it would be good but it was way better then expected!  My hubby and I both got the early special for $38.  You choose a starter, entree, and dessert.  Hubby got the meatballs and I got the Caesar salad.  The meatballs we so freaking moist! And the sauce was perfect!  The salad...probably some of the best dressing I have ever had and the polenta croutons! OMG!  Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, so yummy!  Then for our entree hubby got the carbonara and I got the chicken parm.  Both were amazing!  Pasta was cooked perfectly, the carbonara was creamy and rich, the chicken was moist and crispy, just...yes!  And then there was dessert.  I couldn't even finish my meal so we got the warm Nutella cake there and the cannoli to go.   The Nutella cake with ice cream was like heaven on a plate!  And we are still so full so we haven't tried it yet but I'm dreaming about it haha!  This is a must try!

-v7D3zWMD996TQVIXQIcwg.text: FOOD POISONING on January 6, 2018, Saturday, dinner around 6:00-6:30pm. I had the salmon (cooked) entree and shortly after the meal became lethargic and nauseous. Had a horrible night as symptoms progressed with fever and weakness until finally the poisoning passed around 2:00pm the next day. Stay away from this place, they are not handling their seafood properly and unfortunately most everyone going there is a tourist so they don't have to survive on repeat customers. But from my experience of getting very sick from eating the food here I would not recommend this place to anyone. In my opinion you're placing your health at risk.

m_pNSQsvmt7y62yZRzmk4A.text: We were a party of seven with reservations and were seated promptly. We started with their yummy bread with olive oil. Calamari, cheese bread and the mozzarella with pesto. All were delicious. Everyone loved their entrees. They were delicious and large portions. I couldn't finish half of my lasagna which made our son happy as he ate the rest. Highly recommend this restaurant if you love Italian food. Great decor and service.

6JRQeaH7_G53EyzJxEtd5w.text: Mamma Mia!!! Wow!!! Way to go Buddy Valastro! This feels like a classic Italian home the second you walk in. Family photos of the Valastro family, hodgepodge furniture, comfy sofas and chairs...only thing missing is the vinyl and plastic covers, but honestly who misses them?   Teaming up with Kim Canteenwalla & Elizabeth Blau, who have created beautiful restaurants here in Vegas (Society Cafe + Honey Salt), the trio came together to make the Cake Bosses culinary debut a real knockout, start to finish.   I went with my Italian buddy to try it out and we were really impressed (to say the least)! Straight forward and diverse food menu, doesn't overwhelm; drink menu follows the pattern of the food menu with good wine choices by the glass.  I chose the agnolotti which was seasoned perfectly and was in season with the sage brown butter sauce. My buddy went to spaghetti central with a rigatoni and meatball bowl and he couldn't hold back the tears knowing the impending rejection his mother would give him after finding a better meatball.   The meatballs came really really really close to beating my Italian grandmother's secret recipe, but that leads to a lifetime of questions and heartache on my nonna. So, its easier to say that grams are better and avoid the remaining years of rejection by telling her a little white lie.  Dessert was the highlight (as expected) as my Tiramisu was not only flavorful but semi deconstructed as the lady fingers were on the side that you could dip into the cake and creme combo. My friend's salted caramel ice cream came loaded with bits of dark chocolate and an awesome biscotti.  If the restaurant wasn't in the Venetian/Palazzo's Grand Canal Shoppes: A) It would be way busier and the menu prices wouldn't be so high; and B) it wouldn't have awesome floor to ceiling windows facing the strip that make the space even more visually enjoyable.  Mangia!
